recipes_details: {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This layer cake was a standard in our house. This recipe is a very old one that people could keep in their heads because of the utter simplicity of the formula that gave the cake its name\u20141 cup of butter, 2 cups of sugar, 3 cups of flour, and 4 eggs. The juice mixture will give the cake a lovely, fresh, fruity flavor and it is not rich like an icing.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'75%', 'ingredient list': [u'Softened butter and flour, for the pans', u'3 cups sifted cake flour (not self-rising)', u'4 teaspoons baking powder', u'1/2 teaspoon plain salt', u'1/2 pound (2 sticks) unsalted butter, at room temperature', u'2 cups sugar', u'4 large eggs, separated, at room temperature', u'1 cup whole milk, at room temperature', u'1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'3/4 cup freshly squeezed orange juice', u'2 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice', u'3/4 cup sugar', u'1 tablespoon finely grated orange zest'], 'preperation steps': [u'Butter and flour the bottom and sides of three 8 by 1 1/2-inch cake pans with the softened butter, tipping out the excess flour.', u'Sift the flour, baking powder, and salt together. Beat the butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer on high speed until it is light, creamy, and fluffy, about 1 minute. Gradually add the sugar into the butter, and beat until the mixture is very light and fluffy, about 2 minutes more. As the sugar blends in it will change the color of the butter to a much lighter color, almost white.', u'Whisk the egg yolks in a small bowl until they are well blended. Gradually beat into the butter mixture, mixing well after each addition. With the mixer on low speed, starting with the flour mixture, add the flour mixture in thirds, alternating with two equal additions of the milk, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed. Beat in the vanilla. In a clean bowl using clean beaters beat the egg whites until they form firm, glossy peaks. Do not overbeat until they are stiff and dry. Fold the whites into the batter.', u'Pour and scrape the batter into the prepared pans, dividing it equally among them. Give the filled pans a little knock on the countertop to level the batter. Bake in the center of a preheated 350\xb0F oven for 25 minutes, or until each cake springs back when touched in the center. Remove the pans from the oven and put them on wire cake racks to cool for a few minutes, then loosen the layers by running the flat side of a knife blade around the sides of the pans, put a rack on top of each pan, and invert so the cake comes out onto the rack, top side down. Then reverse the layers so they are top side up.', u'Mix the orange juice, lemon juice, sugar, and orange rind together and drizzle the mixture over the still warm cake layers, being careful not to let it all soak into one spot; then pile the layers on top of each other. Let the cake cool.'], 'chef': u'James Beard', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/1-2-3-4-cake-51128010', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes one 3-layer cake; 12 servings', 'recipe title': u'1-2-3-4 cake', 'image_source': None}

Double or triple the recipe and use it all summer.'], 'chef': u'Alison Roman', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/4-3-2-1-spice-rub-51175040', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': None, 'recipe title': u'4-3-2-1 Spice Rub', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 40 min Start to finish: 1 1/2 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Each serving about 280 calories and 4 grams fat\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Gourmet', 'recommendation': u'84%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 lb fresh apricots, pitted and cut into 1/2-inch wedges', u'7 tablespoons sugar', u'1 tablespoon all-purpose flour', u'1 1/2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice', u'3/4 to 1/4 teaspoon almond extract', u'3/4 cup all-purpose flour', u'3/4 teaspoon baking powder', u'1/4 teaspoon baking soda', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'3 teaspoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons cold unsalted butter, cut into bits', u'1/2 cup well-shaken buttermilk'], 'preperation steps': [u'Toss all filling ingredients together in a 9-inch glass or ceramic pie plate and let stand until juicy, about 30 minutes.', u'Preheat oven to 400\xb0F.', u'Sift together flour, baking powder and soda, salt, and 1 teaspoon sugar in a bowl. Blend in butter with your fingertips or a pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse meal. Stir in buttermilk with a fork just until combined (do not overmix).', u'Drop rounded tablespoons of dough over filling, leaving spaces in between to allow topping to expand. Sprinkle with remaining 2 teaspoons sugar.', u'Bake cobbler in middle of oven until fruit is tender and topping is golden, about 30 minutes. Cool slightly, about 15 minutes, and serve warm.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/apricot-cobbler-105131', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 servings', 'recipe title': u'Apricot Cobbler', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Carciofi alla Romana', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'67%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 large artichokes (10 to 12 oz each)', u'1 lemon, halved', u'1 cup water', u'1/3 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped garlic', u'2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh mint', u'Garnish: chopped fresh mint', u'Special equipment: a melon-ball cutter'], 'preperation steps': [u'Keep stem attached and, at opposite end, cut off top inch of 1 artichoke with a serrated knife. Bend back outer leaves until they snap off close to base, then discard several more layers of leaves in same manner until you reach pale yellow leaves with pale green tips.', u'Cut remaining leaves flush with top of artichoke bottom using a sharp knife, then pull out purple leaves and scoop out fuzzy choke with melon-ball cutter. Trim dark green fibrous parts from base and sides of artichoke with a sharp paring knife, then rub cut surfaces with a lemon half.', u'Cut 1/4 inch from end of stem to expose inner core. Trim sides of stem (still attached) down to pale inner core. Rub cut surfaces with same lemon half.', u'Trim remaining artichokes in same manner.', u'Put water and oil in a 4-quart heavy pot.', u'Mince and mash garlic with 1 teaspoon kosher salt, then mix in mint. Rub one sixth of garlic paste into cavity of each artichoke, then stand artichokes upside down in liquid in pot. Sprinkle remaining teaspoon salt over artichokes, then simmer, covered, over low heat, until tender, 20 to 30 minutes.', u'Transfer artichokes to a serving dish and boil cooking liquid, whisking, until emulsified and reduced to about 1/3 cup. Pour sauce over artichokes and serve warm or at room temperature.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/artichoke-bottoms-braised-in-olive-oil-with-garlic-and-mint-106242', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 first-course or antipasto servings', 'recipe title': u'Artichoke Bottoms Braised in Olive Oil with Garlic and Mint', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 1/2 hr Start to finish: 5 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'90%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/3 cup sweet orange marmalade', u'1 qt superpremium vanilla ice cream, softened slightly', u'1 pint orange sorbet, softened slightly', u'1/2 cup cake flour (not self-rising)', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'3 large eggs at room temperature for 30 minutes', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'2 teaspoons finely grated fresh orange zest', u'2 teaspoons Grand Marnier', u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted and cooled', u'7 large egg whites', u'1/4 teaspoon cream of tartar', u'1 1/4 cups sugar', u'1 teaspoon vanilla', u'1 eggshell half, cleaned', u'2 tablespoons Grand Marnier', u'Special equipment: 2 (8- by 2-inch) round cake pans; a 9- by 2-inch round cake pan; a round cake pan or plate at least 10 inches in diameter'], 'preperation steps': [u'Beat marmalade into vanilla ice cream in a bowl with a wooden spoon until combined, then spread in an 8-inch cake pan. Spread sorbet in other 8-inch cake pan. Cover pans with plastic wrap and freeze until firm, at least 3 hours.', u'Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 350\xb0F. Butter 9-inch cake pan and line bottom with a round of parchment or wax paper, then butter paper.', u'Sift flour and salt into a bowl.', u'Heat eggs and sugar in a large metal bowl set over a pot of simmering water, gently whisking constantly, until lukewarm and sugar is dissolved.', u'Remove bowl from pot and add zest and liqueur, then beat with an electric mixer at high speed until very thick, pale, and tripled in volume (about 7 minutes in a stand mixer or 10 minutes with a handheld). If using a tall narrow bowl, transfer to a large wide bowl (to facilitate folding). Resift flour and salt over eggs in 2 batches, folding gently but thoroughly after each batch. Fold butter into about 1 cup batter in a small bowl until just combined, then fold butter mixture into remaining batter gently but thoroughly until just combined. Spread in buttered pan, smoothing top.', u'Bake cake until a wooden pick or skewer inserted in center comes out clean, about 15 minutes. Cool in pan on a rack 5 minutes, then run a thin knife between cake and side of pan and invert rack over cake. Flip cake onto rack and cool completely. Peel off paper.', u'Cut cake horizontally in half with a long serrated knife to form 2 layers, then tightly wrap each layer in plastic wrap and freeze 30 minutes.', u'Put 1 cake layer on plate or inverted cake pan (at least 10 inches, but small enough to fit in your freezer). Dip pan containing vanilla ice cream mixture in a large bowl of hot water briefly to loosen, 5 to 7 seconds (have a kitchen towel ready to wipe off water), and unmold ice cream onto cake. Top vanilla ice cream layer with second cake layer, cut side up. Unmold sorbet layer onto cake in same manner and freeze ice cream cake until firm, about 1 hour.', u'Beat egg whites and a pinch of salt in a large bowl with cleaned beaters at moderately high speed until foamy, then add cream of tartar and continue to beat until whites hold soft peaks. Add sugar a little at a time, beating, and continue beating until whites just hold stiff, glossy peaks. Beat in vanilla.', u'Put oven rack in lower third of oven and preheat oven to 450\xb0F.', u'Transfer frozen cake (still on plate or inverted cake pan) to a baking sheet lined with parchment or wax paper and spread meringue over cake, making it at least 1 inch thick and mounding it on top. Make an indentation with a tablespoon in center of meringue deep enough to fit eggshell. Bake cake until edges are lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Carefully transfer cake to a serving plate using 2 metal spatulas and place eggshell in indentation. Pour liqueur into eggshell and carefully ignite with a kitchen match. Spoon flaming liqueur evenly over meringue (flaming liqueur will brown meringue a little more). Remove eggshell and serve baked Alaska immediately.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/baked-alaska-saint-pierre-109544', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 10 servings', 'recipe title': u'Baked Alaska Saint Pierre', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 15 min Start to finish: 1 1/2 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'95%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 (6-oz) red apples such as Gala or Rome Beauty', u'1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice', u'1/4 cup finely chopped dried apricots', u'2 tablespoons dried currants', u'2 tablespoons chopped pecans, toasted', u'2 tablespoons packed dark brown sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon cinnamon', u'1/8 teaspoon ground nutmeg', u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter (1/2 tablespoon softened and 1/2 tablespoon cut into 4 pieces)', u'1/2 cup unfiltered apple cider', u'1/4 teaspoon vanilla', u'1/2 cup low-fat vanilla or maple yogurt', u'Special equipment: an apple corer'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F. Core apples with corer. Stand apples up and make 4 evenly spaced vertical cuts starting from top of each apple and stopping halfway from bottom to keep apple intact. Brush inside of apples with lemon juice and stand apples in a 9-inch ceramic or glass pie plate.', u'Toss together apricots, currants, pecans, brown sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a bowl. Rub softened butter into dried-fruit mixture with your fingers until combined well, then pack center of each apple with mixture. Put a piece of remaining butter on top of each apple. Pour cider and vanilla around apples and cover pie plate tightly with foil.', u'Bake in middle of oven, basting once, until apples are just tender when pierced with a fork, about 40 minutes. Remove foil and continue to bake until apples are very tender but not falling apart, 20 to 30 minutes more.', u'Transfer to serving dishes and spoon sauce over and around apples. Serve with dollops of yogurt.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/baked-apples-stuffed-with-dried-fruit-and-pecans-107429', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': None, 'recipe title': u'Baked Apples Stuffed with Dried Fruit and Pecans', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Trim the tops and tails of the beets to 1 inch.', 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving (without cr\xe8me fra\xeeche): 120 calories, 4.5g fat, 10mg cholesterol, 20g carbohydrates, 2g protein\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Other', 'recommendation': u'50%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 beets, trimmed and scrubbed', u'8 cups vegetable or chicken broth', u'2 cups apple juice', u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'3 Granny Smith apples, peeled, cored, and sliced', u'3 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, or to taste (from 1 large lemon)', u'Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste', u'Cr\xe8me fra\xeeche, for garnish, optional'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Place the beets in a large, heavy pot and cover with the broth and juice. Bring to a boil, reduce the heat, and simmer, partially covered, until tender, about 45 minutes. Transfer the beets to a bowl with a slotted spoon. When cool enough to handle, slip off the skins and cut the beets into pieces.', u'2. Strain broth through a fine sieve lined with two paper towels and return it to the pot.', u'3. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium- low heat. Add the apples and saut\xe9 until just caramelized, about 10 to 15 minutes.', u'4. Pur\xe9e the cooked beets and saut\xe9ed apples together in batches in a food processor, adding some broth through the feed tube. Return the pur\xe9e to the pot and combine with the broth. Stir in the lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Pass the soup through a strainer, if desired.', u'5. Serve the soup hot or cold, dolloped with cr\xe8me fra\xeeche if desired.'], 'chef': u'Sheila Lukins', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/beet-apple-soup-350641', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Beet Apple Soup', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 hr Start to finish: 2 1/4 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'71%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 frozen puff pastry sheet (from a 17 1/4-oz package), thawed', u'1 1/2 teaspoons cornstarch', u'2 tablespoons water', u'1/2 teaspoon fresh lemon juice', u'1/2 cup raspberries', u'1/2 cup blackberries', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'2/3 cup Essencia or other orange Muscat dessert wine', u'6 tablespoons chilled heavy cream', u'1 tablespoon confectioners sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon finely grated fresh orange zest', u'1 cup raspberries', u'1 cup blackberries', u'Confectioners sugar for dusting'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 425\xb0F.', u'Unfold pastry sheet, then turn over (to prevent creases from splitting during baking). Cut 6 (4 1/2-inch) triangles from sheet with a long sharp knife and a ruler.', u'Arrange triangles on a greased baking sheet and lightly prick centers a few times with a fork. Bake in middle of oven until puffed and golden brown, 15 to 18 minutes. Transfer to a rack and cool.', u'Stir together cornstarch, water, and lemon juice in a small saucepan. Add berries and sugar and simmer over moderately high heat, stirring and breaking up berries, until thickened, 3 to 4 minutes. Force pur\xe9e through a fine sieve into a bowl, pressing hard on solids, then cool pur\xe9e at room temperature.', u'Boil wine in another small saucepan until reduced to about 1 tablespoon, 10 to 12 minutes, then cool.', u'Beat cream with confectioners sugar and zest in a bowl until it just holds stiff peaks. Fold wine into cream until just incorporated, then chill.', u'Split each pastry triangle in half horizontally and make a sandwich with about 1 1/2 tablespoons cream. Spread 1 teaspoon pur\xe9e on top of each pastry, leaving a 1/4-inch border (there will be pur\xe9e left over). Decoratively arrange some raspberries and blackberries on top and sift some confectioners sugar over berries.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/berry-puffs-with-orange-muscat-cream-105430', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Berry Puffs with Orange Muscat Cream', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 15 minutes Start to finish: 1 1/4 hour', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'84%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 cups all-purpose flour', u'1 cup plus 2 tablespoons sugar', u'2 teaspoons baking powder', u'3/4 teaspoon baking soda', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'3/4 teaspoon cinnamon', u'Rounded 1/4 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg', u'1 1/2 sticks (3/4 cup) plus 2 tablespoons cold unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u'2 large eggs, lightly beaten', u'1 cup sour cream', u'1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla', u'3 cups fresh blueberries (15 ounces)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 375\xb0F.', u'Whisk together flour, 1 cup sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a bowl. Blend 1 1/2 sticks butter into flour with your fingertips or a pastry blender just until mixture resembles coarse meal with some small (roughly pea-size) butter lumps.', u'Transfer 1 1/2 cups flour mixture to another bowl for crumb topping. Add remaining 2 tablespoons butter and remaining 2 tablespoons sugar to crumb topping, then blend with your fingertips until large lumps form.', u'Whisk together eggs, sour cream, and vanilla, then add to remaining flour mixture, stirring until just combined. Fold in blueberries and spread batter, distributing berries evenly, in a buttered 13- by 9- by 2-inch baking pan. Sprinkle batter evenly with crumb topping.', u'Bake in middle of oven until cake is golden and a wooden pick or skewer inserted in center comes out clean, 40 to 45 minutes. Cool cake in pan on a rack 20 minutes before cutting.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/blueberry-crumb-cake-108416', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Make 8 to 12 servings', 'recipe title': u'Blueberry Crumb Cake', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 40 min Start to finish: 1 1/4 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'83%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 bacon slices (4 oz), cut crosswise into 1/4-inch-wide strips', u'1 (3 1/2-lb) chicken, cut into 8 serving pieces', u'1 lb shallots, thinly sliced', u'1 head garlic, cloves separated and peeled', u'1/4 cup balsamic vinegar'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cook bacon in a deep 12-inch heavy skillet over moderately low heat, stirring, until crisp, about 8 minutes. Transfer with a slotted spoon to paper towels to drain and reserve bacon fat in skillet.', u'While bacon is cooking, pat chicken dry and season with salt and pepper. Brown, beginning with skin sides down, in 2 batches in bacon fat over moderately high heat, turning, about 8 minutes. Transfer chicken as browned with tongs to a plate and pour off all but 2 tablespoons fat from skillet.', u'Add shallots to skillet and cook over moderately low heat, covered, stirring occasionally, until soft and pale golden, about 10 minutes.', u'Remove lid and cook shallots, stirring, until deep golden, about 10 minutes more. Add garlic and 1 cup water to skillet and boil, stirring, 1 minute.', u'Return chicken to skillet, turning pieces to coat, then arrange them skin sides up and gently simmer, covered, until chicken is cooked through and garlic is tender, about 30 minutes.', u'Transfer chicken with tongs to a serving dish. Add vinegar to sauce and boil, uncovered, mashing garlic with back of a spoon, until slightly thickened. Season sauce with salt and pepper and pour over chicken, then sprinkle with bacon.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/braised-chicken-with-shallots-garlic-and-balsamic-vinegar-105589', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 servings', 'recipe title': u'Braised Chicken with Shallots, Garlic, and Balsamic Vinegar', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 1/2 hr Start to finish: 5 1/2 hr', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'94%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 (1 1/2-lb) eggplants (at least 10 inches long and 4 inches in diameter), trimmed', u'1/3 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon black pepper', u'6 lb lamb shanks, trimmed of excess fat', u'1 1/2 teaspoons salt', u'1 teaspoon black pepper', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1/2 large green bell pepper, cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'2 garlic cloves, chopped', u'1 (1 1/2-inch) piece cinnamon stick', u'16 whole allspice', u'15 whole black peppercorns', u'2 Turkish bay leaves or 1 California', u'1 cup dry white wine', u'1 (28- to 32-oz) can whole tomatoes in pur\xe9e, coarsely chopped (including pur\xe9e) in a food processor'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F.', u'Remove 2-inch-wide strips of skin from opposite sides of each eggplant with a vegetable peeler and discard. Holding knife parallel to a peeled side, cut each eggplant lengthwise into 8 (1/3-inch-thick) slices.', u'Brush eggplant slices on both sides with oil and arrange in 1 layer in 2 shallow baking pans. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and bake in upper and lower thirds of oven, switching position of pans halfway through baking, until eggplant is tender and lightly browned, 30 to 40 minutes total. Cool eggplant in pans. Leave oven on.', u'Pat shanks dry and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then brown shanks in 2 batches, turning occasionally, about 5 minutes per batch. Transfer as browned to a roasting pan just large enough to hold shanks in 1 layer. Reserve skillet.', u'Cook bell pepper, garlic, spices, and bay leaves in fat remaining in skillet over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until garlic is golden, about 3 minutes. Add wine and bring to a boil, stirring and scraping up any brown bits. Add chopped tomatoes and bring to a boil. Season sauce with salt and pepper and pour over shanks (liquid should come about halfway up sides of meat).', u'Cover roasting pan tightly with foil and braise in middle of oven until very tender, 2 1/2 to 3 hours. Cool shanks, uncovered. Leave oven on.', u'Remove shanks from sauce. Discard bones and gristle, then cut meat into 1 1/2-inch pieces. Skim fat from sauce and season sauce with salt and pepper. Spoon one third of sauce into a 13- by 9-inch glass or ceramic baking dish.', u'Arrange 2 eggplant slices end to end lengthwise on a work surface so that ends overlap by about 2 inches. Put one eighth of lamb on eggplant where it overlaps, then wrap ends of eggplant over lamb to form a bundle. Transfer bundle to baking dish with a wide metal spatula. Make 7 more bundles in same manner, arranging them in 1 layer in dish. Spoon remaining sauce over and around bundles and cover dish tightly with foil.', u'Braise bundles in middle of oven 30 minutes.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/braised-lamb-shanks-wrapped-in-eggplant-107589', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Braised Lamb Shanks Wrapped in Eggplant', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/4 cups white rice flour (6.5 ounces) or brown rice flour (5.5 ounces)', u'1 1/4 cups sweet white sorghum flour (5.25 ounces)', u'1/2 cup amaranth flour (2 ounces)', u'3/4 cup cornstarch (3.5 ounces) or tapioca starch (3.2 ounces)', u'3 teaspoons xanthum gum', u'1 teaspoon salt'], 'preperation steps': [u'Weigh out each dry ingredient using a kitchen scale. Weights are provided for a single recipe here.', u'The amount of gum, salt, baking powder, and baking soda per single recipe are too small to weigh out. Instead, measure these in teaspoons and tablespoons and add to your blend.', u'For larger batches: on a worksheet, multiply each ingredient by the number of recipes you would like to create. (I find that 5 or 10 work well.) Measure out the same multiple for the smaller ingredients like the gum, salt, baking powder, and baking soda, in teaspoons and tablespoons. Weigh this quantity in grams and write down the amount for future use.', u"Now you are ready to make a large batch of a blend anytime you wish. Simply weigh ingredients in the multiple you've chosen and place the ingredients in a large bowl or plastic container. Mix very well."], 'chef': u'h Hillson', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/bread-flour-1-388371', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': None, 'recipe title': u'Bread Flour #1', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 3/4 hr Start to finish: 2 1/2 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'89%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 (1 1/2-lb) butternut squash, halved lengthwise and seeded', u'3/4 lb Yukon Gold potatoes', u'1 large egg, lightly beaten', u'1/2 cup finely grated Pecorino Romano (1 1/2 oz)', u'1/2 teaspoon finely chopped fresh thyme', u'1/2 teaspoon finely chopped fresh sage', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/8 teaspoon white pepper', u'Pinch of nutmeg', u'3/4 cup all-purpose flour plus additional for dusting', u'5 (6-oz) confit duck legs', u'5 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'3 lb Swiss chard, stems and tough center ribs discarded and leaves cut into 2- by 1-inch pieces, then washed (but not dried)', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'Accompaniment: grated Pecorino Romano', u'Special equipment: a potato ricer or a food mill fitted with fine disk'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 500\xb0F.', u'Arrange squash halves, cut sides down, in an oiled shallow baking pan and put potatoes alongside. Roast vegetables in middle of oven until squash is tender, about 25 minutes. Transfer squash to a cutting board and potatoes to oven rack, then continue to roast potatoes until tender, about 12 minutes more.', u'When cool enough to handle, scrape flesh from squash, discarding skin, then force flesh through ricer into a bowl. Measure out 3/4 cup pur\xe9e and put in another bowl (reserve remainder for another use). Remove skin from potatoes while still hot and force flesh through ricer into bowl with squash. Spread squash-potato pur\xe9e in another shallow baking pan and cool completely.', u'Return pur\xe9e to bowl and stir in egg, cheese, thyme, sage, salt, white pepper, and nutmeg. Add flour, then gently knead dough by hand 1 minute (it will be soft and slightly sticky).', u'Turn dough out onto a floured cutting board and cut into 3 portions. Gently roll each portion into a long log about 3/4 inch thick. Cut each log into 3/4-inch pieces with a floured knife.', u'Press a piece of dough against tines of a floured fork and push with a floured thumb in a forward motion toward end of tines, letting gnocchi fall from fork onto a floured kitchen towel. Repeat with remaining pieces of dough.', u'Cook duck legs, skin sides down, in batches in a large heavy skillet over moderate heat, turning once, until browned and some of fat is rendered, about 5 minutes. Transfer duck to cleaned cutting board, then discard all but 1 tablespoon fat from skillet, reserving skillet.', u'When duck is cool enough to handle, discard skin and bones, then pull meat into 1/4-inch-thick pieces.', u'Melt 3 tablespoons butter in a 12-inch heavy skillet and remove from heat. Cook gnocchi in 3 batches in a 6-quart pot of boiling salted water, stirring occasionally, until centers are cooked through, about 3 minutes. (Gnocchi will float to top after about 1 1/2 minutes.) Transfer as cooked with a slotted spoon to butter in skillet.', u'Melt remaining 2 tablespoons butter in a 3- to 4-quart heavy saucepan over moderate heat, then stir in chard and salt. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 1/4 hr Start to finish: 12 hr (includes soaking beans)', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'78%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 lb dried white beans (preferably Great Northern)', u'8 1/4 cups cold water', u'2 cups beef broth', u'1 tablespoon tomato paste', u'2 cups chopped onion (3/4 lb)', u'3 tablespoons finely chopped garlic (6 large cloves)', u'1 (3-inch) piece celery, cut into thirds', u'3 fresh thyme sprigs', u'1 Turkish or 1/2 California bay leaf', u'3 whole cloves', u'3 fresh flat-leaf parsley sprigs plus 1/2 cup chopped leaves', u'1/4 teaspoon whole black peppercorns', u'1 (14-oz) can stewed tomatoes, pur\xe9ed or finely chopped with juice', u'4 confit duck legs* (1 3/4 lb total)', u'1 to 2 tablespoons olive oil (if necessary)', u'1 lb cooked garlic pork sausage* or smoked pork kielbasa, cut crosswise into 1/3-inch-thick slices', u'2 cups coarse fresh bread crumbs (preferably from a baguette)', u'1 1/2 teaspoons salt', u'1/2 teaspoon black pepper', u'Special equipment: an 8-inch square of cheesecloth; kitchen string; a 4 1/2- to 5-quart casserole dish (3 to 4 inches deep)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cover beans with cold water by 2 inches in a large bowl and soak 8 to 12 hours. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'(Three Generations of Squash)', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'93%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 cups small cherry tomatoes (1 lb; preferably Sungold), halved lengthwise', u'2 teaspoons olive oil', u'3 oz mild fresh goat cheese (6 tablespoons) at room temperature', u'1 tablespoon heavy cream', u'2 tablespoons chopped green (hulled) pumpkin seeds, toasted until they puff', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh basil (preferably Thai)', u'1/4 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/8 teaspoon black pepper', u'12 male squash blossoms with stems (not with baby zucchini), stems trimmed to 1 inch', u'1 tablespoon rice vinegar (not seasoned)', u'1 tablespoon minced shallot', u'2 tablespoons mild extra-virgin olive oil', u'1/8 teaspoon black pepper', u'3/4 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1 lb assorted baby summer squash, stems discarded', u'6 cups vegetable oil (preferably canola or grapeseed)', u'1 cup all-purpose flour', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1 cup chilled sparkling water', u'2 tablespoons green (hulled) pumpkin seeds, toasted until they puff', u'1/3 cup small basil leaves (preferably Thai) or sliced larger leaves', u'Special equipment: a mandoline or similar manual slicer such as a Japanese (Benriner); a deep-fat thermometer'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 250\xb0F.', u'Toss tomatoes with oil and arrange, cut sides up, in 1 layer in a shallow (1-inch-deep) baking pan. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 hr Start to finish: 2 1/2 hr', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'92%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 1/2 lb medium eggplants (about 3), cut crosswise into 1/3-inch-thick rounds', u'3 1/4 teaspoons salt', u'5 lb plum tomatoes', u'1 1/2 cups plus 3 tablespoons olive oil', u'2 large garlic cloves, finely chopped', u'20 fresh basil leaves, torn in half', u'3/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'1/4 teaspoon dried hot red pepper flakes', u'1 cup all-purpose flour', u'5 large eggs', u'3 1/2 cups panko * (Japanese bread crumbs)', u'2 ozfinely grated Parmigiano-Reggiano (2/3 cup)', u'1 lb chilled fresh mozzarella (not unsalted), thinly sliced'], 'preperation steps': [u'Toss eggplant with 2 teaspoons salt in a colander set over a bowl, then let drain 30 minutes.', u'While eggplant drains, cut an X in bottom of each tomato with a sharp paring knife and blanch tomatoes together in a 5-quart pot of boiling water 1 minute. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 3/4 hr Start to finish: 4 1/4 hr (includes making stock and rouille)', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'90%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 large leek, green part coarsely chopped and white part cut into 1/4-inch pieces', u'5 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 medium onion, coarsely chopped', u'2 celery ribs, coarsely chopped', u'2 carrots, coarsely chopped', u'3 garlic cloves, smashed', u'1/4 teaspoon crumbled saffron threads', u'2 bay leaves (not California)', u'1 teaspoon dried hot red pepper flakes', u'1 1/4 lb plum tomatoes, coarsely chopped', u'3 tablespoons canned tomato pur\xe9e', u'2 cups dry white wine', u'1 1/2 qt white fish stock', u'1 (8- to 9-inch) unsliced round or oval pain au levain or sourdough loaf (1 lb), crust discarded', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1 lb skinned white fish fillets such as halibut, snapper, and/or bass, cut into 1-inch cubes', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'2 cups rouille', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh oregano', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley'], 'preperation steps': [u'Wash green and white parts of leek separately in a bowl of cold water, then lift out with a slotted spoon and pat dry. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Rajas is the Spanish word for "strips," and in the Mexican kitchen it generally refers to strips of chile.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'60%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 lb fresh poblano chiles', u'1 1/2 lb white onions, halved lengthwise, then sliced lengthwise 1/4 inch thick', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'3 tablespoons safflower oil', u'1 lb banana leaves*, thawed if frozen', u'8 (6-oz) pieces skinless snapper or halibut fillet', u'1 cup crema (thick Mexican cream) or cr\xe8me fra\xeeche plus additional for drizzling if desired', u'Garnish: fresh cilantro leaves'], 'preperation steps': [u'Roast chiles on racks of gas burners over high heat, turning with tongs, until skins are blackened, 10 to 12 minutes. (Or broil chiles on a broiler pan about 5 inches from heat, turning occasionally, about 15 minutes.) Transfer to a large bowl and cover tightly with plastic wrap, then let stand 20 minutes.', u'When cool enough to handle, peel chiles, discarding stems and seeds (do not rinse under running water as this washes away flavor), and cut lengthwise into 1/4-inch-thick strips.', u'Cook onions with salt in oil in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderate heat, stirring, until onions are tender but still have texture, about 10 minutes. Stir in chiles and cook, stirring, 1 minute, then season with salt.', u'Preheat oven to 450\xb0F.', u'Unfold banana leaves. Cut off (and reserve) tough center rib that runs along bottom edge of each leaf with kitchen shears. Cut ribs into 12- to 14-inch strips for tying packets. Gently cut leaves into 8 (12-inch) squares, being careful not to split them.', u'Slowly run a banana-leaf square across flame of a gas burner, just enough to "melt" outer coating on leaf (it will become quite shiny; if you have an electric stove, hold leaf slightly above burner on moderately high). Place a piece of fish in center of square and season with salt, then top with 1/2 cup rajas and 2 tablespoons crema. Fold 2 sides of banana leaf over fish to enclose it, then fold in opposite sides to form a packet. Tie packet with a strip of banana-leaf rib and transfer to a large baking sheet. Assemble 7 more packets in same manner.', u'Bake fish packets in middle of oven 20 minutes, then transfer each to a large plate or shallow soup bowl. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 1/2 hr Start to finish: 2 1/2 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'89%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 large boiling potatoes (2 1/4 lb)', u'3 qt vegetable oil (96 fl oz)', u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u'1 (12-oz) bottle cold beer (preferably ale)', u'1 1/2 lb haddock or cod fillets, skinned, pin bones removed, and fish cut diagonally into 1-inch-wide strips (5 to 6 inches long)', u'Special equipment: a deep-fat thermometer', u'Accompaniment: malt vinegar'], 'preperation steps': [u'Peel potatoes and halve lengthwise, then cut lengthwise into 1/2-inch-thick wedges, transferring as cut to a large bowl of ice and cold water. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 hr Start to finish: 1 1/2 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'83%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 oz dried morel mushrooms', u'1 1/2 cups warm water', u'1/2 lb asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces', u'1/4 lb green beans (preferably haricots verts), trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces', u'3/4 cup frozen baby peas, thawed', u'2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'Rounded 1/2 teaspoon dried hot red pepper flakes', u'4 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 1/2 pints grape tomatoes', u'1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar', u'3 tablespoons water', u'1 lb spaghettini (thin spaghetti)', u'1/2 stick (1/4 cup) unsalted butter', u'2/3 cup heavy cream', u'1 teaspoon finely grated fresh lemon zest', u'2 oz finely grated Parmigiano-Reggiano (1 cup)', u'1/4 cup finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley', u'1/4 cup finely chopped fresh basil', u'1/3 cup pine nuts (1 1/2 oz), lightly toasted', u'Garnish: Parmigiano-Reggiano shavings'], 'preperation steps': [u'Soak morels in warm water in a small bowl 30 minutes. Add halved tomatoes, vinegar, and water and simmer, stirring occasionally, until sauce is thickened and halved tomatoes are softened, 3 to 4 minutes. Keep tomatoes warm.', u'While tomatoes are cooking, return water in pot to a boil and cook spaghettini until al dente.', u'Drain in a colander. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'C\xf4telettes de Saumon Frais Dorigny', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'94%', 'ingredient list': [u'2/3 lb medium shrimp (about 28) in shells', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'3/4 stick (6 tablespoons) unsalted butter', u'2 tablespoons Cognac', u'2 tablespoon water', u'8 (3/4-inch-wide) slices center-cut salmon fillet (1 1/2 to 2 lb total), skinned', u'1 oz fresh or preserved black winter truffles (28 g)', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'2 cup dry white wine', u'1 1/2 cups French Chablis or other dry white wine', u'1/3 cup finely chopped shallot', u'1 1/2 cups heavy cream', u'1 teaspoon arrowroot', u'2 teaspoons Cognac', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/8 teaspoon black or white pepper', u'Special equipment: 8 (18-inch) pieces kitchen string'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cut each shrimp shell lengthwise along back with scissors, leaving last segment of shell intact, then devein shrimp, keeping shell in place. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Spinach and Feta Phyllo Triangles', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'92%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 stick (1/2 cup) plus 1 tablespoon unsalted butter', u'1 lb baby spinach', u'1/2 lb feta, crumbled (scant 2 cups)', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg', u'10 (17- by 12-inch) phyllo sheets, thawed if frozen'], 'preperation steps': [u'Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderate heat, then cook spinach, stirring, until wilted and tender, about 4 minutes. Transfer to a bowl and stir in feta, nutmeg, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper.', u'Preheat oven to 375\xb0F.', u'Melt remaining 1 stick butter in a small saucepan, then cool.', u'Cover phyllo stack with 2 overlapping sheets of plastic wrap and then a dampened kitchen towel.', u'Take 1 phyllo sheet from stack and arrange on a work surface with a long side nearest you (keeping remaining sheets covered) and brush with some butter. Top with another phyllo sheet and brush with more butter. Cut buttered phyllo stack crosswise into 6 (roughly 12- by 2 3/4-inch) strips.', u'Put a heaping teaspoon of filling near 1 corner of a strip on end nearest you, then fold corner of phyllo over to enclose filling and form a triangle. Continue folding strip (like a flag), maintaining triangle shape. Put triangle, seam side down, on a large baking sheet and brush top with butter. Make more triangles in same manner, using all of phyllo.', u'Bake triangles in middle of oven until golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes, then transfer to a rack to cool slightly.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/spanakopita-107344', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 30 pastries', 'recipe title': u'Spanakopita', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"You can use 4 small regular bell peppers (1 1/2 lb total) instead of the 24 baby bell peppers, but you'll need to make 1 1/2 times the filling.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'75%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 medium onion, chopped', u'2 anchovy fillets, rinsed, patted dry, and finely chopped', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'3/4 cup toasted bread crumbs', u'1 cup whole-milk ricotta', u'1/3 cup finely grated Parmigiano-Reggiano (1 oz)', u'2 tablespoons drained capers, rinsed, patted dry, and chopped', u'2 large eggs, lightly beaten', u'3 tablespoons finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley', u'1 1/2 lb baby red and yellow bell peppers* (2 inches in diameter; 24)', u'1/2 cup water', u'1 tablespoon olive oil'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cook onion and anchovies in oil in a heavy skillet over moderate heat, stirring frequently, until onion is golden, about 8 minutes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 45 min Start to finish: 1 1/2 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'92%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 medium red bell peppers', u'1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'3/4 teaspoon baking powder', u'9 large eggs', u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted', u'1 1/2 cups coarsely grated extra-sharp Cheddar (6 oz)', u'1 cup whole-milk ricotta (8 oz)', u'1 cup grated Parmigiano-Reggiano (2 oz)', u'3 scallions, finely chopped (1/2 cup)', u'Garnish: thin slivers of scallion greens'], 'preperation steps': [u'Roast peppers on racks of gas burners over high heat, turning with tongs, until skins are blackened, 10 to 12 minutes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 1/4 hr Start to finish: 2 1/4 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 (2 1/2- to 3-lb) turkey breast half (with bones and skin)', u'1 qt chicken broth', u'2 to 2 1/2 qt water', u'1 (6-oz) can tuna packed in olive oil, drained', u'3 large anchovy fillets', u'3/4 cup mayonnaise', u'1/3 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'3 to 4 tablespoons fresh lemon juice (to taste)', u'1 tablespoon water', u'1 lb haricots verts (thin French green beans), trimmed', u'2 lb small (1 1/2- to 2-inch) red potatoes, peeled and quartered', u'2 tablespoons bottled capers, rinsed and drained', u'1/2 cup Kalamata or other brine-cured black olives, pitted and quartered lengthwise', u'Garnish: small fresh basil leaves'], 'preperation steps': [u'Put turkey breast in a 6- to 8-quart pasta pot and add broth and enough water to cover turkey by 1 inch. Remove turkey and bring liquid to a boil. Cool turkey in broth 30 minutes (internal temperature will rise to 170\xb0F).', u'Pur\xe9e tuna, anchovies, mayonnaise, oil, lemon juice, and water in a blender until very smooth.', u'Transfer turkey to a cutting board, then bring remaining poaching liquid to a boil.', u'Add half of beans and cook, uncovered, until crisp-tender, 3 to 5 minutes. Transfer with a slotted spoon to a colander and refresh under cold water. Cook remaining beans and refresh in same way. Add potatoes to broth in pot and simmer until just tender, about 10 minutes. Drain potatoes, reserving broth for another use.', u'Thinly slice turkey breast on the diagonal. Arrange beans on a platter and top with potatoes, then drizzle vegetables with some tonnato sauce. Top with turkey slices and more tonnato sauce. Sprinkle dish with capers, olives, and basil. Serve remaining sauce on the side.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/turkey-tonnato-with-potatoes-and-green-beans-105125', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Turkey Tonnato with Potatoes and Green Beans', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 hr Start to finish: 1 hr 20 min', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'3/4 cup bulgur', u'1 cup boiling-hot water', u'1/3 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 1/2 lb small yellow squash, sliced 1/2 inch thick', u'1 small red onion, chopped', u'1 lb Asian eggplant or small Italian eggplant, halved lengthwise and cut crosswise into 1/2-inch-thick slices', u'1/2 cup cherry tomatoes, halved', u'1 English cucumber, quartered lengthwise and cut crosswise into 1/2-inch-thick slices', u'2 cups baby spinach', u'1/2 cup fresh basil', u'2 tablespoons tomato, caper, and olive vinaigrette'], 'preperation steps': [u'Combine bulgur and boiling-hot water in a bowl and let stand, covered, 20 minutes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 hr Start to finish: 3 1/4 hr (includes chilling)', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'57%', 'ingredient list': [u'3/4 cup sugar', u'1/4 cup water', u'1 teaspoon finely grated fresh lemon zest', u'5 cups coarsely chopped seeded watermelon (from a 4-lb piece, rind discarded)', u'2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, or to taste', u'1/4 cup packed fresh basil leaves', u'1 1/2 cups dry white wine', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1 teaspoon finely grated fresh lemon zest', u'1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons water', u'2 teaspoons unflavored gelatin (from 1 envelope)', u'2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, or to taste', u'Special equipment: an ice cream maker'], 'preperation steps': [u'Bring sugar, water, and zest to a boil in a 2-quart heavy saucepan, stirring until sugar is dissolved, then reduce heat and simmer, without stirring, washing down any sugar crystals on side of pan with a pastry brush dipped in cold water, 2 minutes.', u'Put watermelon in a blender, then add syrup and lemon juice and blend until smooth. Pour through a fine-mesh sieve into a large bowl, pressing on pulp and discarding any remaining solids.', u'Freeze in ice cream maker, then transfer to an airtight container and freeze until firm.', u'Blanch basil in a 3-quart pot of boiling salted water 5 seconds, then drain and transfer to a bowl of ice and cold water to stop cooking. Drain basil and squeeze dry.', u'Bring wine, sugar, zest, and 1/2 cup water to a boil in cleaned 2-quart heavy saucepan, stirring until sugar is dissolved, then simmer 2 minutes.', u'While wine syrup simmers, sprinkle gelatin over remaining 2 tablespoons water in a large metal bowl and let soften 1 minute.', u'Pour about 1/2 cup wine syrup through a medium-mesh sieve lined with a dampened paper towel into gelatin mixture (reserve lined sieve), then stir until gelatin is dissolved.', u'Blend remaining syrup with basil and lemon juice in cleaned blender until smooth (use caution when blending hot liquids), then pour through lined sieve into gelatin mixture. Set bowl in a larger bowl of ice and cold water and let stand, stirring occasionally, until cold, about 15 minutes, then chill in refrigerator, uncovered, until set, at least 2 hours.', u'Gently whisk gel\xe9e to break into small pieces and serve as a bed for scoops of sorbet.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/watermelon-sorbet-with-wine-basil-gelee-109666', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 to 8 dessert servings', 'recipe title': u'Watermelon Sorbet with Wine Basil Gel\xe9e', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This layer cake was a standard in our house. This recipe is a very old one that people could keep in their heads because of the utter simplicity of the formula that gave the cake its name\u20141 cup of butter, 2 cups of sugar, 3 cups of flour, and 4 eggs. The juice mixture will give the cake a lovely, fresh, fruity flavor and it is not rich like an icing.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'75%', 'ingredient list': [u'Softened butter and flour, for the pans', u'3 cups sifted cake flour (not self-rising)', u'4 teaspoons baking powder', u'1/2 teaspoon plain salt', u'1/2 pound (2 sticks) unsalted butter, at room temperature', u'2 cups sugar', u'4 large eggs, separated, at room temperature', u'1 cup whole milk, at room temperature', u'1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'3/4 cup freshly squeezed orange juice', u'2 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice', u'3/4 cup sugar', u'1 tablespoon finely grated orange zest'], 'preperation steps': [u'Butter and flour the bottom and sides of three 8 by 1 1/2-inch cake pans with the softened butter, tipping out the excess flour.', u'Sift the flour, baking powder, and salt together. Beat the butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer on high speed until it is light, creamy, and fluffy, about 1 minute. Gradually add the sugar into the butter, and beat until the mixture is very light and fluffy, about 2 minutes more. As the sugar blends in it will change the color of the butter to a much lighter color, almost white.', u'Whisk the egg yolks in a small bowl until they are well blended. Gradually beat into the butter mixture, mixing well after each addition. With the mixer on low speed, starting with the flour mixture, add the flour mixture in thirds, alternating with two equal additions of the milk, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed. Beat in the vanilla. In a clean bowl using clean beaters beat the egg whites until they form firm, glossy peaks. Do not overbeat until they are stiff and dry. Fold the whites into the batter.', u'Pour and scrape the batter into the prepared pans, dividing it equally among them. Give the filled pans a little knock on the countertop to level the batter. Bake in the center of a preheated 350\xb0F oven for 25 minutes, or until each cake springs back when touched in the center. Remove the pans from the oven and put them on wire cake racks to cool for a few minutes, then loosen the layers by running the flat side of a knife blade around the sides of the pans, put a rack on top of each pan, and invert so the cake comes out onto the rack, top side down. Then reverse the layers so they are top side up.', u'Mix the orange juice, lemon juice, sugar, and orange rind together and drizzle the mixture over the still warm cake layers, being careful not to let it all soak into one spot; then pile the layers on top of each other. Let the cake cool.'], 'chef': u'James Beard', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/1-2-3-4-cake-51128010', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes one 3-layer cake; 12 servings', 'recipe title': u'1-2-3-4 cake', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"This recipe makes more meringue than you'll need for 8 servings. You can pipe the extra into sticks and bake them to eat as a snack.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'50%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 large egg whites', u'3/4 cup superfine granulated sugar', u'1/3 cup sliced almonds, lightly toasted , cooled, and coarsely crushed', u'Special equipment: parchment paper; a pastry bag fitted with a 3/8-inch plain tip'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 225\xb0F.', u'Beat whites with a pinch of salt in a bowl with an electric mixer at high speed until they hold soft peaks. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Carciofi alla Romana', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'67%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 large artichokes (10 to 12 oz each)', u'1 lemon, halved', u'1 cup water', u'1/3 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped garlic', u'2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh mint', u'Garnish: chopped fresh mint', u'Special equipment: a melon-ball cutter'], 'preperation steps': [u'Keep stem attached and, at opposite end, cut off top inch of 1 artichoke with a serrated knife. Trim sides of stem (still attached) down to pale inner core. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Skip the bacon if you like and substitute 2 tablespoons melted butter instead.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'86%', 'ingredient list': [u'12 large eggs', u'3 slices of bacon', u'Melted butter', u'1/3 cup mayonnaise', u'2 teaspoons Dijon mustard', u'1 heaping tablespoon chopped scallions', u'Kosher salt', u'Freshly ground black pepper', u'Thinly sliced scallions'], 'preperation steps': [u'Place 12 large eggs in a large saucepan; add water to cover by 1". Bring to a boil, cover, and remove from heat. Let sit for 10 minutes. Drain. Transfer eggs to a bowl of ice water and let cool completely, about 10 minutes; peel. Halve lengthwise and remove yolks. Coarsely chop 3 slices of bacon. Cook in a medium skillet over medium heat until browned and crisp. Transfer bacon to paper towels. Strain drippings through a fine-mesh sieve into a small bowl. Add melted butter if needed to measure 2 tablespoons.', u'Finely mash reserved yolks, bacon fat (and/or butter), 1/3 cup mayonnaise, 2 teaspoons Dijon mustard, and 1 heaping tablespoon chopped scallions in a medium bowl; season with kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper.', u'Transfer to a large resealable freezer bag, then cut 1/2" off 1 corner. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 1/2 hr Start to finish: 5 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'90%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/3 cup sweet orange marmalade', u'1 qt superpremium vanilla ice cream, softened slightly', u'1 pint orange sorbet, softened slightly', u'1/2 cup cake flour (not self-rising)', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'3 large eggs at room temperature for 30 minutes', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'2 teaspoons finely grated fresh orange zest', u'2 teaspoons Grand Marnier', u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted and cooled', u'7 large egg whites', u'1/4 teaspoon cream of tartar', u'1 1/4 cups sugar', u'1 teaspoon vanilla', u'1 eggshell half, cleaned', u'2 tablespoons Grand Marnier', u'Special equipment: 2 (8- by 2-inch) round cake pans; a 9- by 2-inch round cake pan; a round cake pan or plate at least 10 inches in diameter'], 'preperation steps': [u'Beat marmalade into vanilla ice cream in a bowl with a wooden spoon until combined, then spread in an 8-inch cake pan. Butter 9-inch cake pan and line bottom with a round of parchment or wax paper, then butter paper.', u'Sift flour and salt into a bowl.', u'Heat eggs and sugar in a large metal bowl set over a pot of simmering water, gently whisking constantly, until lukewarm and sugar is dissolved.', u'Remove bowl from pot and add zest and liqueur, then beat with an electric mixer at high speed until very thick, pale, and tripled in volume (about 7 minutes in a stand mixer or 10 minutes with a handheld). Fold butter into about 1 cup batter in a small bowl until just combined, then fold butter mixture into remaining batter gently but thoroughly until just combined. Dip pan containing vanilla ice cream mixture in a large bowl of hot water briefly to loosen, 5 to 7 seconds (have a kitchen towel ready to wipe off water), and unmold ice cream onto cake. Top vanilla ice cream layer with second cake layer, cut side up. Unmold sorbet layer onto cake in same manner and freeze ice cream cake until firm, about 1 hour.', u'Beat egg whites and a pinch of salt in a large bowl with cleaned beaters at moderately high speed until foamy, then add cream of tartar and continue to beat until whites hold soft peaks. Beat in vanilla.', u'Put oven rack in lower third of oven and preheat oven to 450\xb0F.', u'Transfer frozen cake (still on plate or inverted cake pan) to a baking sheet lined with parchment or wax paper and spread meringue over cake, making it at least 1 inch thick and mounding it on top. Carefully transfer cake to a serving plate using 2 metal spatulas and place eggshell in indentation. Pour liqueur into eggshell and carefully ignite with a kitchen match. Spoon flaming liqueur evenly over meringue (flaming liqueur will brown meringue a little more). Remove eggshell and serve baked Alaska immediately.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/baked-alaska-saint-pierre-109544', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 10 servings', 'recipe title': u'Baked Alaska Saint Pierre', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 15 min Start to finish: 1 1/2 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'95%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 (6-oz) red apples such as Gala or Rome Beauty', u'1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice', u'1/4 cup finely chopped dried apricots', u'2 tablespoons dried currants', u'2 tablespoons chopped pecans, toasted', u'2 tablespoons packed dark brown sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon cinnamon', u'1/8 teaspoon ground nutmeg', u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter (1/2 tablespoon softened and 1/2 tablespoon cut into 4 pieces)', u'1/2 cup unfiltered apple cider', u'1/4 teaspoon vanilla', u'1/2 cup low-fat vanilla or maple yogurt', u'Special equipment: an apple corer'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 40 min Start to finish: 2 1/2 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'87%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 large or 12 medium beets (3 lb with greens), trimmed, leaving 1 inch of stems attached', u'3 medium onions (1 lb), halved lengthwise and thinly sliced crosswise', u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon sugar', u'2 teaspoons balsamic vinegar', u'1/3 cup dry white wine', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 (1/2-lb) piece Parmigiano-Reggiano', u'Special equipment: a Japanese Benriner* or other adjustable-blade slicer; a small offset spatula'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 400\xb0F.', u'Tightly wrap beets in double layers of foil to make 3 packages (2 large beets or 4 medium per package) and roast on a baking sheet in middle of oven until tender, 1 1/4 to 1 1/2 hours. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 30 min Start to finish: 2 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'84%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 (1 1/2-inch) piece cinnamon stick', u'1/2 teaspoon anise seeds', u'3 lb boneless pork shoulder, cut into 1 1/2-inch cubes', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'3/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 large onion, chopped', u'4 garlic cloves, smashed', u'4 (1/2-inch-thick) slices peeled fresh ginger, smashed', u'2 (4- by 1-inch) strips fresh orange zest', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1/2 cup soy sauce', u'1/2 cup Chinese rice wine or medium-dry Sherry', u'2 1/2 cups low-sodium chicken broth (20 fl oz)', u'3 fennel bulbs (sometimes called anise), stalks cut off and discarded, then bulbs sliced lengthwise 1/4 inch thick', u'1/2 cup coarsely chopped fresh cilantro', u'Special equipment: cheesecloth; kitchen string'], 'preperation steps': [u'Put oven rack in lower third of oven and preheat oven to 350\xb0F.', u'Wrap cinnamon stick and anise seeds in a small square of cheesecloth and tie bundle closed with string.', u'Pat pork dry and sprinkle with salt and pepper. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'A 3 1/2-pound chicken works well, too, in this dish from Syracuse.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 2 1/2-pound rabbit, cut into 8 pieces', u'6 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 large red onion, thinly sliced', u'1 pound white-skinned potatoes, peeled, cut into 1-inch cubes', u'3 bell peppers, sliced', u'2 large tomatoes, chopped', u'1 1/4 cups sliced pitted brine-cured Sicilian green olives', u'2 celery stalks, thinly sliced', u'1/3 cup drained capers', u'3 large garlic cloves, chopped', u'3 fresh thyme sprigs', u'1/4 cup apple cider vinegar', u'1/4 cup (or more) water', u'Fresh Italian parsley sprigs'], 'preperation steps': [u'Rinse rabbit and pat dry; sprinkle with salt and pepper. Mix in vinegar and 1/4 cup water. Add rabbit. Cover, reduce heat to medium-low and simmer 10 minutes. Spoon some of vegetable mixture over rabbit. Top with rabbit. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 3/4 hr Start to finish: 2 1/2 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'89%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 (1 1/2-lb) butternut squash, halved lengthwise and seeded', u'3/4 lb Yukon Gold potatoes', u'1 large egg, lightly beaten', u'1/2 cup finely grated Pecorino Romano (1 1/2 oz)', u'1/2 teaspoon finely chopped fresh thyme', u'1/2 teaspoon finely chopped fresh sage', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/8 teaspoon white pepper', u'Pinch of nutmeg', u'3/4 cup all-purpose flour plus additional for dusting', u'5 (6-oz) confit duck legs', u'5 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'3 lb Swiss chard, stems and tough center ribs discarded and leaves cut into 2- by 1-inch pieces, then washed (but not dried)', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'Accompaniment: grated Pecorino Romano', u'Special equipment: a potato ricer or a food mill fitted with fine disk'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 500\xb0F.', u'Arrange squash halves, cut sides down, in an oiled shallow baking pan and put potatoes alongside. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'(Three Generations of Squash)', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'93%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 cups small cherry tomatoes (1 lb; preferably Sungold), halved lengthwise', u'2 teaspoons olive oil', u'3 oz mild fresh goat cheese (6 tablespoons) at room temperature', u'1 tablespoon heavy cream', u'2 tablespoons chopped green (hulled) pumpkin seeds, toasted until they puff', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh basil (preferably Thai)', u'1/4 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/8 teaspoon black pepper', u'12 male squash blossoms with stems (not with baby zucchini), stems trimmed to 1 inch', u'1 tablespoon rice vinegar (not seasoned)', u'1 tablespoon minced shallot', u'2 tablespoons mild extra-virgin olive oil', u'1/8 teaspoon black pepper', u'3/4 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1 lb assorted baby summer squash, stems discarded', u'6 cups vegetable oil (preferably canola or grapeseed)', u'1 cup all-purpose flour', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1 cup chilled sparkling water', u'2 tablespoons green (hulled) pumpkin seeds, toasted until they puff', u'1/3 cup small basil leaves (preferably Thai) or sliced larger leaves', u'Special equipment: a mandoline or similar manual slicer such as a Japanese (Benriner); a deep-fat thermometer'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 250\xb0F.', u'Toss tomatoes with oil and arrange, cut sides up, in 1 layer in a shallow (1-inch-deep) baking pan. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'For this one, you will need six 4 1/2-inch tartlet pans with removable bottoms.', 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'56%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 tablespoons whipping cream', u'1/4 teaspoon crushed saffron threads', u'1 1/2 pints vanilla ice cream, slightly softened', u'1 1/3 cups whole milk', u'5 ounces bittersweet or semisweet chocolate, chopped', u'6 tablespoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons plus 2 teaspoons cornstarch', u'3 large egg yolks', u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter', u'3/4 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour', u'1/2 cup blanched slivered almonds', u'2 1/2 tablespoons sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon (generous) baking powder', u'1/2 cup (1 stick) chilled unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u'2 tablespoons whipping cream', u'1 large egg yolk', u'Fresh mint sprigs'], 'preperation steps': [u'Combine cream and saffron in custard cup. Place in microwave oven and heat on high until cream is hot, about 30 seconds. Remove cup from microwave and let mixture steep at room temperature 1 hour. Place ice cream in medium bowl; add saffron mixture and stir with rubber spatula until well blended. Spoon ice cream into container; cover and freeze until firm, at least 6 hours and up to 3 days.', u'Bring milk to simmer in heavy medium saucepan. Remove from heat; add chocolate and stir until melted and smooth. Cool 5 minutes.', u'Whisk sugar and cornstarch in medium bowl to blend. Add yolks; whisk until blended (mixture will be thick). Gradually whisk warm chocolate mixture into yolk mixture until smooth. Return mixture to saucepan. Whisk constantly over medium heat until mixture thickens and starts to bubble, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat (mixture may look grainy; whisk vigorously until smooth). Whisk in butter and vanilla. Transfer pastry cream to bowl. Let cool at room temperature until lukewarm, stirring occasionally, about 20 minutes. Cover with plastic wrap and chill overnight. (Can be prepared 2 days ahead. Keep chilled.)', u'Combine flour, almonds, sugar, and baking powder in processor; blend until almonds are very finely ground. Add butter; cut in using on/off turns until small crumbs form. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Kosher Status: Meat Prep: 10 Minutes Cook: 2 Hours, 20 Minutes Total: 2 1/2 Hours', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'80%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 pound ground beef', u'1 pound beef stew meat, cut into 1/2 inch chunks', u'1 large onion, coarsely chopped', u'1 medium green bell pepper, ribs and seeds removed, coarsely chopped', u'One 28-ounce can whole plum tomatoes, drained', u'One 8-ounce can tomato sauce', u'One 15 1/2 ounce can red kidney beans, rinsed and drained', u'One 15 1/2 ounce can black beans, rinsed and drained', u'3 tablespoons packed light brown sugar', u'2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce', u'2 tablespoons red wine vinegar', u'1 tablespoon chili powder', u'2 teaspoons dried basil', u'2 teaspoons ground cumin', u'2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'2 bay leaves', u'Tortilla chips, for serving (optional)'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add ground beef and cook, breaking up the beef, until nicely browned, about 8 minutes. Remove the ground beef with a slotted spoon and set aside in a large bowl or place. Pour another tablespoon of oil into the pot; when hot, add the stew meat and cook until nicely browned on all side, about 8 minutes. Remove the stew meat with a slotted spoon and add it to the ground beef. Pour off the fat and any accumulated juices from the pot.', u'2. Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon oil. Add the onion and pepper, and cook until slightly softened, about 4 minutes. Return the meats to the pot and add the tomatoes, tomato sauce, kidney beans, black beans, sugar, Worcestershire, vinegar, chili powder, basil, cumin, salt, and bay leaves. Stir well to mix, breaking up the whole tomatoes with the back of a wooden spoon. Bring to a boil, reduce the heat to a simmer, and cook, covered, until the stew meat is soft, about 2 hours. Remove and discard the bay leaves. Divide the chili among 8 bowls and serve warm, with chips on the side, if you like.'], 'chef': u'Jamie Geller', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/chunky-red-chili-51206840', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'8 Servings', 'recipe title': u'Chunky Red Chili', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Made from yuca (pronounced "YOO-ca"), pearl tapioca can be found at Asian markets and specialty foods shops.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'8 1/4 cups water', u'2/3 cup large (3/4- to 1/4-inch) pearl tapioca (not quick-cooking)', u'1/2 cup grated or crumbled dark palm sugar (4 oz)*', u'2 (13- to 14-oz) cans unsweetened coconut milk (do not shake)', u'2 firm-ripe mangoes (1 1/2 lb total), peeled, pitted, and cut into 1/4-inch pieces', u'1 lb firm-ripe papaya (preferably red), peeled, seeded, and cut into 1/4-inch pieces', u'1/2 pineapple, peeled, cored, and cut into 1/4-inch pieces', u'2 cups shaved ice', u'Garnish: fresh coconut shavings, toasted', u'Special equipment: an ice shaver, preferably manual'], 'preperation steps': [u'Bring 8 cups water to a boil in a 2-quart saucepan and add tapioca, stirring constantly. Gently boil, stirring occasionally, until tapioca is almost completely translucent, 40 minutes to 1 1/2 hours, depending on size of tapioca.', u'Remove from heat and let tapioca stand, covered, until completely translucent, 45 minutes to 1 1/2 hours, depending on size.', u'While tapioca is standing, bring sugar, a pinch of salt, and remaining 1/4 cup water to a simmer in a small heavy saucepan, stirring until sugar is dissolved. Chill syrup until cold, about 1 hour.', u'Add 3 cups cold water to translucent tapioca, then drain in a sieve. Transfer tapioca to a large bowl filled halfway with cold water, swirl, and then drain in sieve. (This removes excess starch.)', u'Spoon 3 tablespoons syrup into each of 4 glasses (there will be some left over), then divide fruit and tapioca among them. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 45 min Start to finish: 2 3/4 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 large egg yolks', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1/3 cup fine-quality grappa', u'2 large egg whites at room temperature', u'1 cup heavy cream', u'1 cup sugar', u'1/2 cup boiling water', u'4 teaspoons instant espresso powder', u'1/4 teaspoon fresh lemon juice', u'6 teaspoons fine-quality grappa, chilled', u'Special equipment: 6 tall (2 1/2-inch high; 1/2-cup capacity) metal baba au rhum molds or 6 (1/2-cup) ramekins', u'Garnish: mocha coffee beans'], 'preperation steps': [u'Have ready a large bowl of ice and cold water.', u'Beat together yolks, sugar, and 1/3 cup grappa with an electric mixer in a metal bowl set over a saucepan of simmering water 10 minutes, or until thick and pale and mixture registers 170\xb0F on an instant-read thermometer. Top with second 12-inch layer, gently pressing layers together. Spread 2 cups lemon curd atop second layer, then cover with third 12-inch layer, gently pressing layers together. Spread 2 cups lemon curd atop third layer. Arrange 2 cups raspberries, side by side, stem ends down, atop curd in concentric circles to cover entire layer. Top with fourth 12-inch layer, gently pressing layers together.', u'Repeat process to make 9-inch tier, using 1 1/3 cups lemon curd between each layer and 1 1/2 cups raspberries between first and second layers and between third and fourth layers.', u'Repeat process to make 6-inch tier, using 2/3 cup lemon curd between each layer and 1 cup raspberries between first and second layers and between third and fourth layers.', u'Refrigerate tiers until curd is firm, about 1 hour.', u'Make 2 batches meringue buttercream . (Remaining batch will be made on day of decorating.)', u'Using offset spatula and about 2 1/2 cups buttercream, spread thin, even coat of frosting on top and sides of 12-inch tier. Repeat with 9-inch and 6-inch tiers, using 1 1/2 cups and 1 cup buttercream, respectively. Refrigerate tiers until frosting is firm, about 30 minutes.', u'Using offset spatula and about 5 cups buttercream, evenly spread second, slightly thicker (about 1/8-inch-thick) layer of frosting on top and sides of 12-inch tier. Frost 9-inch and 6-inch tiers in same manner, using about 3 cups and 2 cups buttercream, respectively. Refrigerate tiers at least 2 hours or overnight.', u"Assemble 3 tiers and decorate cake, following Epicurious's illustrated step-by-step instructions. To see Melissa Murphy assemble and decorate the cake, click here."], 'chef': u'issa Murphy', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/lemon-raspberry-wedding-cake-238192', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 125 servings', 'recipe title': u'Lemon-Raspberry Wedding Cake', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 45 min Start to finish: 4 1/2 hr', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'90%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 medium onions, chopped', u'3 carrots, cut into 1/4-inch dice', u'2 celery ribs, cut into 1/4-inch dice', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'3 (6- by 6-inch) matzos, broken into 1/2-inch pieces', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves', u'1 large egg, lightly beaten', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'1 (3 1/2- to 4-lb) boneless veal breast (1 1/2 inches thick)', u'1 small onion, quartered', u'2 garlic cloves, smashed', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'2 teaspoons paprika (preferably sweet Hungarian)', u'1 1/2 teaspoons salt', u'1 teaspoon black pepper', u'2 fresh thyme sprigs', u'1 1/2 cups water', u'Special equipment: a carpet, darning, or upholstery needle; kitchen string'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cook onions, carrots, and celery in oil in a wide 3 1/2- to 5-quart heavy pot over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until vegetables begin to brown, 8 to 10 minutes.', u'While vegetables are cooking, put matzos in a colander and run under hot water until softened.', u'Remove pot from heat and transfer half of vegetables to a bowl. Cut a large pocket in veal breast: Beginning at center of thickest side, insert a large knife horizontally and cut into center of veal as evenly as possible, leaving a 1-inch border on 3 sides.', u'Pur\xe9e onion, garlic, oil, paprika, salt, and pepper in a food processor or blender. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 30 min Start to finish: 3 1/2 hr', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 large egg whites', u'1/8 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 cup superfine granulated sugar', u'2 teaspoons regular granulated sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon anise seeds', u'1/2 cup chilled heavy cream', u'1/4 cup pomegranate seeds', u'Special equipment: a pastry bag fitted with 1/3-inch plain tip; parchment paper; an electric coffee/spice grinder'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 175\xb0F.', u'Beat egg whites with salt using an electric mixer at high speed until they just hold stiff peaks. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 hr Start to finish: 1 1/2 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'83%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 oz dried morel mushrooms', u'1 1/2 cups warm water', u'1/2 lb asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces', u'1/4 lb green beans (preferably haricots verts), trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces', u'3/4 cup frozen baby peas, thawed', u'2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'Rounded 1/2 teaspoon dried hot red pepper flakes', u'4 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 1/2 pints grape tomatoes', u'1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar', u'3 tablespoons water', u'1 lb spaghettini (thin spaghetti)', u'1/2 stick (1/4 cup) unsalted butter', u'2/3 cup heavy cream', u'1 teaspoon finely grated fresh lemon zest', u'2 oz finely grated Parmigiano-Reggiano (1 cup)', u'1/4 cup finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley', u'1/4 cup finely chopped fresh basil', u'1/3 cup pine nuts (1 1/2 oz), lightly toasted', u'Garnish: Parmigiano-Reggiano shavings'], 'preperation steps': [u'Soak morels in warm water in a small bowl 30 minutes. Halve small morels lengthwise and quarter larger ones.', u'Cook asparagus and beans in a 6- to 8-quart pot of boiling salted water , uncovered, 3 minutes. Immediately transfer vegetables with a large slotted spoon to a bowl of ice and cold water to stop cooking, reserving hot water in pot for cooking pasta. Drain cooled vegetables in a colander.', u'Cook 1 teaspoon garlic and a rounded 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes in 2 tablespoons oil in a 10- to 12-inch heavy skillet over moderately low heat, stirring, just until garlic is fragrant, about 1 minute. Reserve skillet.', u'Cut half of tomatoes into quarters and halve remainder lengthwise, keeping quarters and halves separate. Cook remaining teaspoon garlic and remaining rounded 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes in remaining 2 tablespoons oil in skillet over moderately low heat, stirring, just until garlic is fragrant, about 1 minute. Add quartered tomatoes with salt and pepper to taste and simmer, stirring occasionally, until tomatoes are softened, about 3 minutes. Add halved tomatoes, vinegar, and water and simmer, stirring occasionally, until sauce is thickened and halved tomatoes are softened, 3 to 4 minutes. Keep tomatoes warm.', u'While tomatoes are cooking, return water in pot to a boil and cook spaghettini until al dente.', u'Drain in a colander. Immediately add butter, cream, zest, and morels to empty pasta pot and simmer gently, uncovered, 2 minutes. Stir in cheese and add pasta, tossing to coat and adding as much of reserved morel soaking liquid as necessary (1/2 to 2/3 cup) to keep pasta well coated. Add green vegetables, parsley, basil, pine nuts, and salt and pepper to taste and toss gently to combine.', u'Serve pasta topped with tomatoes and Parmigiano-Reggiano shavings.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/pasta-primavera-107981', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Pasta Primavera', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 1/4 hr Start to finish: 2 3/4 hr (includes cooling)', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'82%', 'ingredient list': [u'Ingredients for basic butter cookies', u'1 1/2 cups confectioners sugar for dredging and dusting', u'3/4 cup fresh lemon juice', u'1 tablespoon finely grated fresh lemon zest', u'3/4 cup granulated sugar', u'1 stick (1/2 cup) unsalted butter, cut into bits', u'2 tablespoons cornstarch', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'4 large egg yolks', u'Special equipment: a 1 1/4-inch round cookie cutter; a pastry bag fitted with small plain tip or a heavy-duty sealable plastic bag (not pleated)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Follow recipe for basic butter cookies, forming dough into 2 balls (instead of a log) and flattening each into a 6-inch disk. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Finnan Haddie Gratin', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 medium onions, halved lengthwise, thenthinly sliced lengthwise', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1/2 lb smoked haddock fillet (finnan haddie), thawed if frozen, shredded with your fingers into 1/2-inch pieces, discarding any tough parts', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley', u'1 1/2 lb celery root (sometimes called celeriac), peeled with a knife', u'2 lb large potatoes (preferably russet or Yukon Gold), peeled', u'2 cups heavy cream', u'1/2 cup whole milk', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'Special equipment: a Japanese Benriner* or other adjustable-blade slicer; a 13- by 9- by 2-inch or other shallow (2 1/2- to 3-quart) glass or ceramic baking dish'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 375\xb0F.', u'Cook onions in butter in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until softened and just beginning to brown, 7 to 8 minutes.
