{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Use good butter, fresh crabmeat, and Meyer lemons and this simple spread will really sing. Can't find Meyer lemons? Substitute 2 tablespoons juice and 1-2 teaspoon zest from a regular lemon instead.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'67%', 'ingredient list': [u'1-2 Meyer lemons (2 teaspoons finely grated zest, 3 tablespoons juice, plus thin slices for garnish)', u'2 tablespoons Sherry', u'1/2 cup (8 tablespoons) unsalted butter (preferably Kerrygold Pure Irish), room temperature', u'1 teaspoon harissa paste or 1/8 teaspoon cayenne pepper', u'Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'8 ounces lump crabmeat, picked over for shells', u'Buttered toast points'], 'preperation steps': [u'Bring juice and Sherry to a boil in a small saucepan over medium-high heat; cook until reduced to 1 tablespoon, about 3 minutes. Gently fold crabmeat into butter (keep crab pieces intact). Pack crab butter into a crock, smoothing top with a butter knife. Cover and chill for at least 3 hours and up to 2 days.', u'Garnish with lemon slices, if desired. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Terrine de Lapin aux Olives Vertes et Pistaches', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'77%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 (3-lb) rabbit, cut into 8 pieces', u'4 shallots, thinly sliced', u'2 carrots, thinly sliced', u'3 fresh parsley sprigs', u'2 fresh thyme sprigs', u'1 leek (green part only), rinsed', u'1 head garlic, left unpeeled and halved horizontally', u'1/2 teaspoon black peppercorns, cracked', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'6 1/4 cups cold water', u'2 large egg whites plus shells, crushed', u'4 teaspoons unflavored gelatin (from two 1/4-oz envelopes)', u'1 tablespoons Madeira', u'1/2 teaspoon fennel seeds, toasted*', u'1/2 cup picholine or other brine-cured green olives (3 oz), pitted and coarsely chopped', u'1/3 cup salted shelled pistachios, coarsely chopped', u'3 tablespoons thinly sliced fresh chives', u'1 teaspoon chopped fresh thyme', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'3/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'Accompaniment: 18 very thin slices firm white sandwich bread, each slice buttered and cut into 2 pieces the shape of terrine slices, then toasted.**', u'Special equipment: 2 (12- by 2-inch) tapered narrow rectangular terrines; kitchen string; 2 (11 1/2- by 1 1/2-inch) strips of corrugated cardboard wrapped well with foil; 2 (10- to 11-inch) rolling pins or high-shouldered wine bottles'], 'preperation steps': [u'Remove fat, kidneys, and liver from rabbit if necessary. Put rabbit, shallots, carrots, parsley, thyme, leek, garlic, peppercorns, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 6 cups water in a 4-quart heavy pot and bring to a boil, skimming froth. Reduce heat and gently simmer rabbit, partially covered, until tender, 1 hour.', u'Cool rabbit in broth, uncovered, 30 minutes, then remove, reserving rabbit pieces and broth separately. Pour broth through a fine sieve into a bowl, discarding solids. Whisk egg whites in another bowl until foamy and add egg shells. Whisk in warm broth in a stream and return mixture to cleaned pot.', u'Heat over moderate heat, stirring and scraping bottom constantly with a wooden spoon to prevent egg white from sticking, until stock comes to a simmer (this will take about 10 minutes). Reduce heat and gently simmer broth, without stirring, until all impurities rise to surface and form a crust, and broth underneath is clear, about 10 minutes.', u'While broth is simmering, coarsely shred rabbit meat, being careful to remove all small bones.', u"Pour broth through a sieve lined with a double thickness of dampened paper towels into a bowl and let all broth drain through. Discard solids. (If liquid doesn't drain completely, tap edge of sieve repeatedly with a metal spoon to help drain.) Broth should be completely clear; if not, repeat procedure with clean dampened paper towels.", u'If clarified broth measures more than 2 1/2 cups, boil to reduce. If it measures less, add water. Bring broth just to a simmer. Sprinkle gelatin over remaining 1/4 cup cold water and soften 1 minute, then whisk into hot broth until dissolved. Stir in Madeira and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt, or to taste.', u'Lightly oil terrines and line with a sheet of plastic wrap large enough to drape over edges. Place terrines on a tray. Place a foil-wrapped cardboard strip on top of each terrine, then rest a rolling pin or bottle on top of cardboard and tie to terrine, creating just enough pressure to press cardboard about 1/2 inch into terrine (some broth will spill over onto tray).', u'Chill terrines on tray 3 hours, then remove string, weights, and cardboard. Heat any reserved jelled broth (including spillover on tray) just until it becomes liquid and add to terrines. Cover with overhanging plastic wrap and chill at least 6 hours more.', u'To unmold terrines, unwrap plastic wrap and invert molds onto a long narrow platter, pulling slightly on plastic to release terrines from molds, then removing it. Gently cut terrines with a serrated knife into 1/3-inch-thick slices and serve on toasts.', u'Toast spices in a dry heavy skillet over moderate heat, stirring, until fragrant and a shade or two darker.', u'** To toast, arrange bread slices on a baking sheet and spread with 2 tablespoons butter. Toast in middle of oven until golden, about 10 minutes.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/rabbit-terrine-with-green-olives-and-pistachios-105493', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u"Makes about 40 hors d'oeuvres", 'recipe title': u'Rabbit Terrine with Green Olives and Pistachios', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 3/4 hr Start to finish: 2 3/4 hr', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'12 garlic cloves, peeled', u'1 tablespoon fine sea salt', u'1 (10-inch) round or oval sourdough loaf (1 1/2 lb), crust discarded', u'9 fresh porcini (c\xe8pes; 3/4 lb), trimmed', u'3 (1-lb) squabs', u'3 large sprigs fresh thyme', u'3 tablespoons garlic confit pur\xe9e garlic confit pur\xe9e', u'6 tablespoons strained duck fat (from garlic confit pur\xe9e)', u'1/3 cup loosely packed fresh flat-leaf parsley', u'1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice, or to taste', u'Special equipment: kitchen string'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 450\xb0F.', u'Bring 2 cups water, garlic, and 1 teaspoon sea salt to a boil, then drain in a colander. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 hr Start to finish: 2 3/4 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'83%', 'ingredient list': [u'10 oz pearl onions', u'4 medium leeks (white and pale green parts only), cut into 1/2-inch-thick slices', u'2 lb boneless lamb shoulder, cut into 1-inch cubes', u'2 teaspoons salt', u'1/2 teaspoon black pepper', u'5 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'3 1/2 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened', u'2 tablespoons chopped garlic', u'1/2 cup dry white wine', u'1 1/2 tablespoons tomato paste', u'1 cup beef broth', u'1 cup water', u'2 teaspoons chopped fresh thyme', u'5 carrots, cut diagonally into 1/3-inch-thick slices', u'2 medium turnips, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'2 lb russet (baking) potatoes', u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u'1/2 cup milk', u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'Special equipment: a wide 3-quart heavy flameproof casserole (about 2 inches deep; not glass); a potato ricer or a food mill fitted with medium disk'], 'preperation steps': [u'Blanch onions in a 2- to 3-quart pot of boiling salted water 1 minute, then transfer with a slotted spoon to a bowl of cold water to stop cooking. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Spinach and Feta Phyllo Triangles', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'92%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 stick (1/2 cup) plus 1 tablespoon unsalted butter', u'1 lb baby spinach', u'1/2 lb feta, crumbled (scant 2 cups)', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg', u'10 (17- by 12-inch) phyllo sheets, thawed if frozen'], 'preperation steps': [u'Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderate heat, then cook spinach, stirring, until wilted and tender, about 4 minutes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"You'll need to start marinating the meat at least a day ahead. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 2 hr Start to finish: 4 hr (includes making fresh pasta)', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'81%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1 1/2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'2 cups whole milk', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'Pinch of freshly grated nutmeg', u'3/4 oz finely grated Pecorino Romano or Parmigiano-Reggiano (about 1/3 cup)', u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 small onion, chopped', u'2 garlic cloves, finely chopped', u'10 oz baby spinach', u'1 3/4 cups ricotta (12 oz fresh or 15 oz supermarket-style)', u'1 large egg, lightly beaten', u'1/2 cup chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley', u'3 oz thinly sliced prosciutto (optional), chopped', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'1 oz finely grated Pecorino Romano or Parmigiano-Reggiano ( 1/2 cup)', u'8 (6- by 4-inch) fresh pasta rectangles lasagne noodles', u'Special equipment: a 13- by 9- by 2-inch ceramic baking dish or other shallow 3-qt flameproof baking dish (not glass)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Melt butter in a 1 1/2- to 2-quart heavy saucepan over moderately low heat. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Hor Neung Pla Duk', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'78%', 'ingredient list': [u"1 lb banana leaves, thawed if frozen (see cooks' note, below)", u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 tablespoons Thai red curry paste', u'3 tablespoons Thai chicken stock or canned chicken broth', u'2 tablespoons nam pla (Asian fish sauce; preferably Thai)', u'1 1/2 lb catfish fillets, cut into 1-inch cubes', u'1 1/2 tablespoons toasted rice powder', u'3 (4-inch-long) fresh or frozen Kaffir lime leaves (sometimes called bai makroot), very thinly sliced', u'Special equipment: a large (6-qt) wok with lid; a heatproof plate (just small enough to fit inside steamer rack); a large steamer rack'], 'preperation steps': [u"Unfold banana leaves. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Strawberries marinated in a vanilla-orange syrup add a new twist to these sponge-cake shortcakes.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'75%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 large egg yolks and 2 large egg whites', u'3/4 cup sugar', u'2 tablespoons whole milk', u'1/2 teaspoon vanilla', u'1/2 cup all-purpose flour', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 vanilla bean, halved lengthwise', u'1/3 cup sugar', u'1/3 cup water', u'1 to 1 1/2 tablespoons finely grated fresh orange zest (from 2 oranges)', u'1/4 cup fresh orange juice', u'1 pint strawberries (3/4 lb)', u'1/4 cup chilled heavy cream', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons sour cream', u'Special equipment: a 3- to 3 1/4-inch round cookie cutter'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F and butter an 8- by 2-inch square metal baking pan. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 1/4 hr Start to finish: 2 1/4 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 (2 1/2- to 3-lb) turkey breast half (with bones and skin)', u'1 qt chicken broth', u'2 to 2 1/2 qt water', u'1 (6-oz) can tuna packed in olive oil, drained', u'3 large anchovy fillets', u'3/4 cup mayonnaise', u'1/3 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'3 to 4 tablespoons fresh lemon juice (to taste)', u'1 tablespoon water', u'1 lb haricots verts (thin French green beans), trimmed', u'2 lb small (1 1/2- to 2-inch) red potatoes, peeled and quartered', u'2 tablespoons bottled capers, rinsed and drained', u'1/2 cup Kalamata or other brine-cured black olives, pitted and quartered lengthwise', u'Garnish: small fresh basil leaves'], 'preperation steps': [u'Put turkey breast in a 6- to 8-quart pasta pot and add broth and enough water to cover turkey by 1 inch. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This layer cake was a standard in our house. This recipe is a very old one that people could keep in their heads because of the utter simplicity of the formula that gave the cake its name\u20141 cup of butter, 2 cups of sugar, 3 cups of flour, and 4 eggs. The juice mixture will give the cake a lovely, fresh, fruity flavor and it is not rich like an icing.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'75%', 'ingredient list': [u'Softened butter and flour, for the pans', u'3 cups sifted cake flour (not self-rising)', u'4 teaspoons baking powder', u'1/2 teaspoon plain salt', u'1/2 pound (2 sticks) unsalted butter, at room temperature', u'2 cups sugar', u'4 large eggs, separated, at room temperature', u'1 cup whole milk, at room temperature', u'1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'3/4 cup freshly squeezed orange juice', u'2 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice', u'3/4 cup sugar', u'1 tablespoon finely grated orange zest'], 'preperation steps': [u'Butter and flour the bottom and sides of three 8 by 1 1/2-inch cake pans with the softened butter, tipping out the excess flour.', u'Sift the flour, baking powder, and salt together. Beat the butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer on high speed until it is light, creamy, and fluffy, about 1 minute. Gradually add the sugar into the butter, and beat until the mixture is very light and fluffy, about 2 minutes more. As the sugar blends in it will change the color of the butter to a much lighter color, almost white.', u'Whisk the egg yolks in a small bowl until they are well blended. Gradually beat into the butter mixture, mixing well after each addition. With the mixer on low speed, starting with the flour mixture, add the flour mixture in thirds, alternating with two equal additions of the milk, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed. Beat in the vanilla. In a clean bowl using clean beaters beat the egg whites until they form firm, glossy peaks. Do not overbeat until they are stiff and dry. Fold the whites into the batter.', u'Pour and scrape the batter into the prepared pans, dividing it equally among them. Give the filled pans a little knock on the countertop to level the batter. Bake in the center of a preheated 350\xb0F oven for 25 minutes, or until each cake springs back when touched in the center. Remove the pans from the oven and put them on wire cake racks to cool for a few minutes, then loosen the layers by running the flat side of a knife blade around the sides of the pans, put a rack on top of each pan, and invert so the cake comes out onto the rack, top side down. Then reverse the layers so they are top side up.', u'Mix the orange juice, lemon juice, sugar, and orange rind together and drizzle the mixture over the still warm cake layers, being careful not to let it all soak into one spot; then pile the layers on top of each other. Let the cake cool.'], 'chef': u'James Beard', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/1-2-3-4-cake-51128010', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes one 3-layer cake; 12 servings', 'recipe title': u'1-2-3-4 cake', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'A classic dish perfected. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Filet de Boeuf \xe0 la Bordelaise', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'83%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 lb (3- to 4-inch-long) beef marrowbones (about 6 bones), both ends of marrow exposed', u'2 cups dry red wine (preferably Bordeaux)', u'1/3 cup finely chopped shallot', u'1/2 cup chopped mushrooms', u'1 small carrot, finely chopped', u'2 large sprigs fresh thyme', u'1 bay leaf (not California)', u'10 black peppercorns, cracked', u'2 cupsVeal stock', u'4 teaspoons arrowroot', u'1 tablespoon Madeira', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 (2 3/4- to 3-lb) trimmed and tied beef tenderloin', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter', u'1 cup beef broth', u'1 cup water', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'Garnish: watercress sprigs'], 'preperation steps': [u'Rinse marrowbones and soak in warm water to cover 10 minutes. Drain marrow and transfer with a slotted spoon to saucepan. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 3/4 hr Start to finish: 2 1/2 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'89%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 (1 1/2-lb) butternut squash, halved lengthwise and seeded', u'3/4 lb Yukon Gold potatoes', u'1 large egg, lightly beaten', u'1/2 cup finely grated Pecorino Romano (1 1/2 oz)', u'1/2 teaspoon finely chopped fresh thyme', u'1/2 teaspoon finely chopped fresh sage', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/8 teaspoon white pepper', u'Pinch of nutmeg', u'3/4 cup all-purpose flour plus additional for dusting', u'5 (6-oz) confit duck legs', u'5 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'3 lb Swiss chard, stems and tough center ribs discarded and leaves cut into 2- by 1-inch pieces, then washed (but not dried)', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'Accompaniment: grated Pecorino Romano', u'Special equipment: a potato ricer or a food mill fitted with fine disk'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 500\xb0F.', u'Arrange squash halves, cut sides down, in an oiled shallow baking pan and put potatoes alongside. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 30 min Start to finish: 1 3/4 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'57%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 cup all-purpose flour', u'2/3 cup packed dark brown sugar', u'2 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'7 oz fine-quality bittersweet chocolate (not unsweetened), finely chopped', u'1/2 stick (1/4 cup) unsalted butter, cut into pieces', u'2 large eggs', u'2 teaspoons finely grated fresh orange zest', u'1/2 cup chilled heavy cream', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'4 navel orange segments, membranes discarded from each and fruit cut into 1/4-inch pieces', u'Special equipment: 2 (12-inch-long) sheets of parchment paper; a 1 1/2-inch round fluted cookie cutter'], 'preperation steps': [u'Whisk together flour, brown sugar, cocoa powder, and salt in a bowl.', u'Melt chocolate and butter in a metal bowl set over a saucepan of barely simmering water, stirring occasionally, until smooth. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 1/4 hr Start to finish: 6 3/4 hr (includes chilling pastry and cooling pie)', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'72%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 1/2 sticks (3/4 cup) plus 3 tablespoons cold unsalted butter', u'4 to 6 tablespoons ice water', u'5 large eggs', u'3/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons sugar', u'2 cups whole milk', u'1/2 cup half-and-half', u'1 teaspoon vanilla', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 cup sweetened flaked coconut', u'1/2 cup fresh coconut shavings (cut with a vegetable peeler from a shelled coconut) or sweetened flaked coconut', u'1 cup chilled heavy cream', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon vanilla', u'Special equipment: pie weights or raw rice'], 'preperation steps': [u'Whisk together flour and salt in a large bowl. Cut 6 tablespoons butter into 1/2-inch cubes, then blend into flour with your fingertips or a pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse meal. Cut another 6 tablespoons butter into 1/2-inch cubes, then blend into flour in same manner until mixture has small (roughly pea-size) butter lumps.', u"Drizzle evenly with 4 tablespoons ice water and gently stir with a fork until incorporated. Squeeze a small handful: If it doesn't hold together, add more ice water, 1/2 tablespoon at a time, stirring until just incorporated, then test again. (Do not overwork mixture, or pastry will be tough.) Gather dough into a ball in bowl, then flatten into a 5-inch square on a sheet of wax paper. Wrap dough in wax paper and chill 30 minutes.", u'Cut remaining 3 tablespoons butter into very thin slices. Roll out dough on a floured surface with a floured rolling pin into a 13- by 11-inch rectangle (1/3 inch thick). Arrange dough with a short side nearest you and place butter slices evenly over dough, then fold dough into thirds like a letter: bottom third up and top third down over dough.', u'Turn dough so a short side is nearest you and roll dough into a 13- by 11-inch rectangle (1/3 inch thick) again, then fold dough into thirds like a letter once more. Brush off any excess flour, then wrap dough in wax paper and chill at least 3 hours.', u'Preheat oven to 375\xb0F.', u'Roll out dough on floured surface with floured rolling pin to a rough 16-inch square, then fit into a 10-inch (6-cup) glass pie plate. Trim excess dough, leaving a 1-inch overhang, then fold overhang under to form a rim (baked crust will not hold a crimp). Line pie shell with foil and fill with pie weights. Bake in middle of oven until edge of pastry is set and pale golden, 17 to 20 minutes.', u'Carefully remove foil and weights, then prick bottom and side of pie shell all over with a fork. Bake, pricking again if any large air pockets form, until pie shell is golden all over, about 15 minutes more. (Leave oven on.)', u'Beat eggs in a large bowl with an electric mixer at medium speed until combined well. Beat in sugar, milk, half-and-half, vanilla, and salt, then stir in flaked coconut.', u'Pour custard into hot pie shell and cover edge of pie with a pie shield or foil (to prevent overbrowning). Bake in middle of oven until custard is set 2 inches from edge but still jiggles slightly in center, 30 to 40 minutes. (Leave oven on.) Cool pie completely on a rack, about 1 1/2 hours.', u'Reduce oven temperature to 350\xb0F.', u'Spread coconut shavings in a shallow baking pan and bake in middle of oven, stirring once, until pale golden, about 5 minutes (watch carefully, since coconut burns easily). Cool in pan on rack.', u'Just before serving, beat cream with sugar and vanilla in a bowl with cleaned beaters at medium speed until it just holds soft peaks. Spread cream over pie and sprinkle with toasted coconut.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/coconut-custard-pie-107769', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 to 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Coconut Custard Pie', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Skinless, boneless chicken breasts are the poultry cut grill jockeys both love and hate. We love the convenience (not to mention the fact that they\'re virtually pure protien with practically no fat). On the down side, they\'re rather bland in flavor and tend to dry out on the grill. Brining is a great way to compensate for both of these shortcomings \u2014 especially if you use this "redeye" variation on traditional brine. A shot of espresso adds an unexpected flavor (don\'t worry, it\'s subtle), along with an inviting mahogany hue. To complete the coffee motif, I propose serving the chicken with an espresso-flavored mustard barbecue sauce.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'86%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/2 cup hot brewed espresso', u'1/4 cup coarse salt (kosher or sea)', u'1/4 cup firmly packed dark brown sugar', u'4 lemon slices (each 1/4 inch thick)', u'1 tablespoon black peppercorns', u'1 tablespoon mustard seeds', u'1 tablespoon coriander seed', u'2 whole skinless, boneless chicken breasts (each 12 to 19 ounces), or 4 half breasts (each 6 to 8 ounces)', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted', u'1 slice of bacon, thinly slivered', u'1 shallot, finely chopped', u'3 tablespoons hot brewed espresso or strong coffee', u'3 tablespoons cider vinegar', u'1/4 cup Dijon mustard', u'1/4 cup firmly packed dark brown sugar', u'2 tablespoons heavy (whipping) cream', u'1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce', u'Coarse salt (kosher or sea) and freshly ground black pepper'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Place the espresso, salt, and brown sugar in a large nonreactive mixing bowl and whisk until the salt and sugar dissolve. Add 3 cups of cool water and the lemon slices, peppercorns, mustard seeds, and coriander seed and stir to mix. Let the brine cool to room temperature.', u'2. If using whole chicken breasts, cut each breast in half. Trim any excess fat or sinews off the chicken breasts and discard. Rinse the breasts under cold running water, then drain and blot dry with paper towels. Remove the tenders from the chicken breasts and set aside for kebabs or sat\xe9s. Add the chicken breasts to the brine and place a weight, such as a pot lid of plate, on top to keep them submerged. Or plate the breasts in a large resealable plastic bag and add the brine, let the chicken breasts brine in the refrigerator for 2 to 3 hours, turning them twice so they brine evenly.', u'3. When ready to cook, drain the chicken breasts, discarding the brine. Blot the chicken breasts dry with paper towels. Lightly brush each breast on both sides with the butter.', u'4. Arrange the chicken breasts on the grill on a diagonal to the ridges and cook the chicken, until cooked through, following the instructions for any of the grills below, until cooked through. Use the poke test to check for doneness: the chicken should feel firm when pressed. Or insert an instant-read meat thermometer into the thick part if a breast through one end: The internal temperature should be about 160\xb0F.', u'5. Transfer chicken to a platter or plates and serve at once with the Redeye Sauce #3 on the side.', u'1. Place the bacon in a heavy saucepan over medium heat and cook until the fat begins to melt, about 2 minutes, stirring with a wooden spoon. Add the shallot and continue cooking until it and the bacon are golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes.', u'2. Add the espresso and cider vinegar and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Stir in the mustard, brown sugar, cream, and Worcestershire sauce, reduce the heat to medium, and let simmer gently until the sauce is thick and flavorful, 5 to 8 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.', u'CONTACT GRILL: Preheat the grill; if your contact grill has a temperature control, preheat the grill to high. Place the drip pan under the front of the grill. When ready to cook, lightly oil the grill surface. Place the chicken breasts on the hot grill, then close the lid. The chicken will be done after 3 to 4 minutes.', u'GRILL PAN: Place the grill pan on the stove and oreheat it to medium-high over medium heat. When the grill pan is hot a drop of water will skitter in the pan. When ready to cook, lightly oil the ridges of the grill pan. Place the chicken breasts in the hot grill pan. They will be done after cooking 4 to 6 minutes per side.', u'BUILT-IN GRILL: Preheat the grill to high, then, if it does not have a nonstick surface, brush and oil the grill grate. Place the chicken breasts on the hot grate. They will be done after cooking 4 to 6 minutes per side.', u"FREESTANDING GRILL: Preheat the grill to high; there's no need to oil the grate. Place the chicken breasts on the hot grill. They will be done after cooking 5 to 7 minutes per side.", u'FIREPLACE GRILL: Rake red hot embers under the gridiron and preheat it for 3 to 5 minutes; you want a hot, 2 to 3 Mississippi fire. When ready to cook, brush and oil the gridiron. Place the chicken breasts on the hot grate. They will be done after cooking 4 to 6 minutes per side.'], 'chef': u'Steve Raichlen', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/coffee-brined-chicken-with-redeye-sauce-3-232201', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 4. (Makes about 1 cup sauce.)', 'recipe title': u'Coffee-Brined Chicken with Redeye Sauce #3', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Make ahead: Store in a sealed, airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 months.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 cups coarse, whole-grain, yellow cornmeal', u'2 cups whole wheat flour', u'1 3/4 cups spelt flour', u'1 cup old-fashioned rolled oats (do not use quick-cooking or steel-cut oats)', u'3/4 cup sugar', u'1/4 cup baking powder', u'4 teaspoons salt', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon'], 'preperation steps': [u'Whisk all the ingredients in a large bowl, taking care that the baking powder is evenly distributed throughout. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Hot pepper jelly is an unexpected taste that picks up the sweetness of the corn and cornmeal.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'86%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour', u'3/4 cup yellow cornmeal', u'3/4 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'2 cups whole milk', u'3 large eggs', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted, plus additional for brushing skillet', u'3 1/3 cups whole-milk or part-skim ricotta (30 oz)', u'1 (6-oz) piece Black Forest or Virginia ham, cut into 1/4-inch dice', u'1 large egg, lightly beaten', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon coarsely ground black pepper', u'1/4 cup hot pepper jelly', u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'6 scallions, thinly sliced and white and pale green parts reserved separately from greens', u'2 cups corn (from 4 ears)', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper'], 'preperation steps': [u'Blend flour, cornmeal, cumin, salt, milk, eggs, and 2 tablespoons butter in a blender until smooth. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"This piquant Indian marinade adds depth of flavor to the sturgeon's meaty white flesh.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'50%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 teaspoon fennel seeds, toasted', u'2 cups plain yogurt (16 oz)', u'1 garlic clove, minced', u'1 teaspoon minced peeled fresh ginger', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1/2 teaspoon ground coriander', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'1/4 teaspoon turmeric', u'1/8 teaspoon cayenne, or to taste', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'6 (1-inch-thick) pieces skinless sturgeon fillet or halibut fillet with skin (6 oz each)', u'3 tablespoons finely chopped fresh mint', u'1/2 teaspoon finely grated fresh lemon zest', u'Special equipment: an electric coffee/spice grinder'], 'preperation steps': [u'Finely grind fennel seeds in grinder. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"If you don't want to cook a live lobster for this recipe, buy 2/3 pound cooked lobster meat from your seafood shop.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'96%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 (1 1/4- to 1 1/2-lb) live lobster', u'2 teaspoons finely chopped shallot', u'1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice', u'1/4 teaspoon table salt', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 pink or ruby-red grapefruit', u'1 firm-ripe California avocado', u'1 oz baby arugula (2 cups)', u'Coarse sea salt to taste (optional)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Plunge lobster headfirst into an 8-quart pot of boiling salted water . {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'For more information about forming tortellini, see Wrapped Around Your Little Finger.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'83%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 cups boiling-hot water', u'1 1/2 oz dried porcini mushrooms (1 1/2 cups)', u'1 large leek', u'1 piece Parmigiano-Reggiano with rind (at least 6 oz)', u'1/2 lb fresh cremini mushrooms, caps and stems chopped separately', u'1/4 lb fresh shiitake mushrooms, caps and stems chopped separately', u'2 teaspoons minced garlic', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley plus 2 fresh flat-leaf parsley sprigs', u'2 fresh thyme sprigs', u'1 (3- to 4-inch) piece celery rib', u'4 cups cold water', u'4 cups beef broth', u'8 black peppercorns, cracked', u'Fresh pasta dough at room temperature', u'All-purpose flour for dusting', u'Garnish: small fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves', u'Special equipment: kitchen string; cheesecloth; a pasta maker; a 2-inch round cookie cutter'], 'preperation steps': [u'Pour boiling-hot water over porcini in a bowl and let stand until softened, about 20 minutes. Lift out porcini, squeezing excess liquid back into bowl, and rinse to remove any grit. Finely chop porcini. Pour soaking liquid through a sieve lined with a dampened paper towel into another bowl and reserve.', u'Trim leek, reserving about 5 inches of green leaves, and rinse greens well. Halve rest of leek lengthwise, then rinse well under cold water and pat dry. Coarsely chop greens and finely chop white and pale green parts, reserving greens separately.', u'Finely grate enough cheese to measure 1/4 cup, then cut off and reserve rind. Reserve remaining piece of cheese.', u'Pulse cremini caps, shiitake caps, 1/3 cup chopped porcini, white and pale green parts of leek, garlic, and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a food processor until finely minced.', u'Heat butter in a 12-inch nonstick skillet over moderate heat until foam subsides, then cook mushroom mixture, stirring constantly, until liquid mushrooms give off is evaporated and mushrooms are golden, about 10 minutes. Transfer to a bowl and cool completely. Bring cold water, beef broth, bouquet garni, cracked peppercorns, cremini stems, shiitake stems, leek greens, remaining chopped porcini, porcini soaking liquid, cheese rind, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt to a simmer in a 3-quart heavy saucepan, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat and cook at a bare simmer, partially covered, 45 minutes.', u'Pour broth through a large sieve lined with a double thickness of rinsed and squeezed cheesecloth (or dampened paper towels) into a large bowl, pressing on and discarding solids. Return broth to saucepan.', u'Set smooth rollers of pasta maker at widest setting. Cut pasta dough into 4 pieces and keep 3 pieces covered. Flatten unwrapped piece of dough into a rectangle and feed through rollers. Fold rectangle in half and feed through rollers 8 more times, folding in half each time and dusting with flour as necessary to prevent sticking.', u'Turn dial to next (narrower) setting and feed dough through without folding. Continue to feed dough through without folding, making space between rollers narrower each time, until narrowest setting is used. (Cut sheet of dough in half if it gets too long.)', u'Cut out as many rounds as possible from sheet with cookie cutter (reserve trimmings for another use, such as chicken noodle soup). Transfer rounds in 1 layer to a lightly floured wax-paper-lined baking sheet and cover with plastic wrap.', u'Working with 5 pasta rounds at a time, put 1/4 teaspoon filling in center of each round, keeping remaining rounds covered tightly with plastic wrap. Moisten edges of filling-topped rounds with a fingertip dipped in water and fold in half, letting bottom edge protrude slightly beyond top edge, then press top edge to bottom half to seal. Holding straight edge of half-moon against nail of your little finger, wrap half-moon around fingertip (which will cause curved edge to flip up), overlapping corners and pinching to seal. Transfer tortellini to a dry kitchen towel (not terry cloth).', u'Roll out and cut remaining dough and make more tortellini in same manner, working with 1 piece at a time.', u'Bring broth to a boil and season with salt and pepper. Gather dough and form it, rotating on work surface, into a disk. Chill dough, wrapped in plastic wrap, until firm, at least 1 hour.', u'Roll out dough between sheets of wax paper, 2 overlapping sheets each for top and bottom, into a 12-inch round and chill until firm, about 15 minutes.', u'Pulse almonds with 2 tablespoons sugar and remaining 2 tablespoons flour in a food processor until finely ground (be careful not to grind to a paste).', u'Cut rhubarb crosswise, holding knife at a 45-degree angle, into 1/4-inch-thick slices.', u'Preheat oven to 375\xb0F.', u'Remove top sheets of wax paper and invert dough onto a large baking sheet, then remove remaining wax paper (now on top). Top with rhubarb, overlapping slices and arranging them decoratively . Score edge of crust decoratively, then chill tart 15 minutes.', u'Sprinkle remaining 1/4 cup sugar evenly over rhubarb and bake in lower third of oven until crust is golden brown on edges and rhubarb is tender, 35 to 45 minutes.', u'Cool tart on baking sheet on a rack, then brush rhubarb with enough preserves to coat evenly.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/open-faced-rhubarb-tart-105041', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Open-Faced Rhubarb Tart', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'C\xf4telettes de Saumon Frais Dorigny', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'94%', 'ingredient list': [u'2/3 lb medium shrimp (about 28) in shells', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'3/4 stick (6 tablespoons) unsalted butter', u'2 tablespoons Cognac', u'2 tablespoon water', u'8 (3/4-inch-wide) slices center-cut salmon fillet (1 1/2 to 2 lb total), skinned', u'1 oz fresh or preserved black winter truffles (28 g)', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'2 cup dry white wine', u'1 1/2 cups French Chablis or other dry white wine', u'1/3 cup finely chopped shallot', u'1 1/2 cups heavy cream', u'1 teaspoon arrowroot', u'2 teaspoons Cognac', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/8 teaspoon black or white pepper', u'Special equipment: 8 (18-inch) pieces kitchen string'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cut each shrimp shell lengthwise along back with scissors, leaving last segment of shell intact, then devein shrimp, keeping shell in place. Transfer shrimp and butter to a sieve set over a bowl and, when just cool enough to handle, shell shrimp (leave shell on tail segment), reserving shells and butter. Chill shrimp, covered, until ready to use.', u'Return shells and butter to skillet and reheat briefly to liquefy butter, then transfer to a food processor along with Cognac and water. Pur\xe9e until as smooth as possible, about 2 minutes. Simmer, whisking occasionally, until slightly thickened, about 2 minutes, then stir in salt and pepper.', u'Butter bottom of a deep 12-inch heavy skillet and arrange salmon in it. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 45 min Start to finish: 3 1/4 hr', 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 cups water', u'2 1/2 cups plus 2 tablespoons sugar', u'3 fragrant small pineapple quinces* (1 lb total), halved lengthwise', u'7 pitted prunes, halved', u'2/3 cup Armagnac', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1/4 cup plus 1 tablespoon Grand Marnier or other orange liqueur', u'1 vanilla bean, halved lengthwise', u'1 vanilla bean, halved lengthwise', u'2/3 cup heavy cream', u'3 large eggs', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1 tablespoon Grand Marnier', u'6 (3/4-inch-thick) slices from a large brioche or challah loaf', u'Accompaniment: cr\xe8me fra\xeeche'], 'preperation steps': [u'Bring water and 2 1/2 cups sugar to a boil in a 4-quart heavy saucepan, stirring until sugar is dissolved. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'For more information about cooking wild rice, see Born to Be Wild.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'83%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 cups water', u'1 cup wild rice (5 oz)', u'1 1/2 teaspoons salt', u'1 3/4 cups whole milk', u'4 large eggs', u'1 stick (1/2 cup) unsalted butter, melted and cooled slightly', u'1 cup all-purpose flour', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'3/4 cup thinly sliced scallions', u'3 red bell peppers (18 oz)', u'1/2 cup water', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 1/2 teaspoons balsamic vinegar', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 1/2 oz dried porcini mushrooms', u'3/4 cup boiling-hot water', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1 1/2 lb fresh cremini mushrooms, trimmed and thinly sliced', u'3 large garlic cloves, minced', u'3/4 teaspoon minced fresh rosemary', u'3/4 teaspoon minced fresh thyme', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'Garnish: thinly sliced scallions', u'Special equipment: 16 (5-inch) squares of wax paper; a well-seasoned 6- to 7-inch cr\xeape pan or nonstick skillet'], 'preperation steps': [u'Bring 4 cups water to a boil in a 2-quart heavy saucepan, then add rice and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Transfer to a large bowl and cover tightly with plastic wrap, then let stand 20 minutes.', u'When cool enough to handle, peel peppers, discarding stems and seeds, and coarsely chop.', u'Pur\xe9e peppers with water, oil, vinegar, and salt in cleaned blender until smooth. Spread 1/4 cup filling over half of 1 cr\xeape, then fold other half over filling to form a half-moon. Fold half-moon in thirds, overlapping outer sections (see photo, opposite), and transfer to baking pan. Repeat procedure with 11 more cr\xeapes, arranging in 1 layer in baking pan.', u'Brush cr\xeapes generously with remaining melted butter and bake in upper third of oven until outsides are crisp and filling is heated through, about 15 minutes.', u'While cr\xeapes are baking, heat sauce over low heat until hot, about 5 minutes.', u'Put 2 cr\xeapes on each of 6 plates and serve with sauce.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/scallion-wild-rice-crepes-with-mushroom-filling-and-red-pepper-sauce-107348', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 main-course servings', 'recipe title': u'Scallion Wild Rice Crepes with Mushroom Filling and Red Pepper Sauce', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'We have given no-boil lasagne noodles as an alternative to fresh because regular dried lasagne noodles often have curly edges and are too thick.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'89%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/3 cup finely chopped shallot', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped carrot', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped celery', u'1 lb medium shrimp in shells (31 to 35 per lb), peeled, reserving shells, and deveined', u'1 lb sea scallops, tough muscle removed from side of each and reserved', u'5 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened', u'1 teaspoon tomato paste', u'1 cup dry white wine', u'3 cups water', u'1 tablespoon seafood glaze* (optional)', u'2 fresh flat-leaf parsley sprigs', u'3 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'1 cup heavy cream', u'1/2 teaspoon fresh lemon juice, or to taste', u'1 1/2 teaspoons salt', u'1/2 teaspoon black pepper', u'2 tablespoons Cognac', u'1/2 cup finely chopped fresh chives', u'14 (6- by 3-inch) flat fresh or no-boil lasagne noodles (without curly edges)', u'Special equipment: a 3-quart flameproof rectangular casserole dish (about 13 by 9 inches; not glass)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cook shallot, carrot, celery, reserved shrimp shells, and reserved scallop muscles in 3 tablespoons butter in a 2- to 3-quart heavy saucepan over moderately low heat, uncovered, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are softened and pale golden, about 5 minutes. Add tomato paste and cook, stirring, 1 minute. Add wine and boil over high heat, stirring occasionally, until reduced to about 1/4 cup, 6 to 8 minutes. Add water, seafood glaze (if using), and parsley sprigs and simmer, covered, 30 minutes.', u'Discard parsley and pur\xe9e stock, including shrimp shells, in 2 batches in a blender (use caution when blending hot liquids). Pour through a fine-mesh sieve into a bowl, pressing on and discarding solids.', u'Melt remaining 2 tablespoons butter in cleaned saucepan over moderately low heat, then add flour and cook roux over low heat, stirring, 3 minutes. Add warm seafood stock all at once, whisking, and bring to a boil, whisking. Add 1/2 cup cream and gently simmer sauce, whisking occasionally, 10 minutes. Stir in lemon juice, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.', u'Transfer 1/2 cup sauce to a bowl set in a larger bowl of ice and cold water to cool for filling.', u'Cut one third of shrimp and one third of scallops into 1/4-inch pieces and toss with 1/4 teaspoon salt. Pur\xe9e remaining shrimp and scallops in a food processor with Cognac, cooled 1/2 cup sauce, remaining 3/4 teaspoon salt, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Add remaining 1/2 cup cream and pulse just until combined. Transfer mousse to a large bowl and stir in shrimp and scallop pieces and chives.', u'Preheat oven to 375\xb0F.', u'Boil lasagne noodles a few at a time in a large pot of boiling salted water , stirring to separate, until al dente, about 2 minutes for fresh noodles or about 6 minutes for no-boil. Gently transfer noodles with tongs and a slotted spatula to a large bowl of cold water to stop cooking, then lift out, shaking off water, and lay flat on dry kitchen towels (not terry cloth). Spread 1/3 cup mousse over each noodle, leaving a 1/2-inch border on both short ends. Starting with a short end, loosely roll up each noodle.', u'Spread about 1/2 cup sauce on bottom of casserole dish and arrange cannelloni, seam sides down, snugly in 1 layer over sauce. Pour remaining sauce over cannelloni and bake, covered with foil, in middle of oven until sauce is bubbling and filling is just cooked through, 25 to 30 minutes. (To test filling for doneness, insert a metal skewer into a cannelloni and hold it there 5 seconds. Remove skewer and press it against your bottom lip: If metal is warm, casserole is hot all the way through and filling is cooked.)', u'Preheat broiler.', u'Remove foil and broil cannelloni about 3 inches from heat until brown spots appear, 3 to 5 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.', u'Available at some supermarkets, specialty foods shops, and More Than Gourmet (800-860-9395).'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/seafood-cannelloni-107417', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Seafood Cannelloni', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"If you're making the striped bass in agrodolce sauce as well as this salad, save 1/3 cup chopped fennel fronds for garnishing the fish.", 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'50%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/3 cup olive oil', u'2 tablespoons fennel seeds, lightly crushed', u'4 medium fennel bulbs (sometimes called anise; about 3 1/2 lb total), stalks cut off and discarded', u'1 lb radishes (about 1 1/2 lb total with greens), trimmed', u'4 pink or red grapefruits', u'1 medium garlic clove', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'Special equipment: a Japanese Benriner or other adjustable-blade slicer'], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat oil with fennel seeds in a small heavy saucepan over moderate heat until seeds are fragrant and pale golden, 1 to 2 minutes. Cut fennel lengthwise into paper-thin slices with slicer. Transfer to a large bowl.', u'Cut radishes crosswise into very thin slices (slightly thicker than fennel slices) with slicer and add to fennel in bowl.', u'Cut peel, including all white pith, from grapefruits with a small sharp knife. Working over a bowl, cut segments free from membranes and squeeze juice from membranes into bowl. Transfer segments to a cutting board, reserving juice in bowl, and coarsely chop, then add to fennel and radishes.', u'Pour fennel oil through a fine-mesh sieve into a small bowl. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 hr Start to finish: 2 3/4 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'83%', 'ingredient list': [u'10 oz pearl onions', u'4 medium leeks (white and pale green parts only), cut into 1/2-inch-thick slices', u'2 lb boneless lamb shoulder, cut into 1-inch cubes', u'2 teaspoons salt', u'1/2 teaspoon black pepper', u'5 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'3 1/2 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened', u'2 tablespoons chopped garlic', u'1/2 cup dry white wine', u'1 1/2 tablespoons tomato paste', u'1 cup beef broth', u'1 cup water', u'2 teaspoons chopped fresh thyme', u'5 carrots, cut diagonally into 1/3-inch-thick slices', u'2 medium turnips, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'2 lb russet (baking) potatoes', u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u'1/2 cup milk', u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'Special equipment: a wide 3-quart heavy flameproof casserole (about 2 inches deep; not glass); a potato ricer or a food mill fitted with medium disk'], 'preperation steps': [u'Blanch onions in a 2- to 3-quart pot of boiling salted water 1 minute, then transfer with a slotted spoon to a bowl of cold water to stop cooking. Put lamb and 3 tablespoons flour in a sealable plastic bag, then seal bag and shake to coat lamb.', u'Melt 2 tablespoons butter in casserole dish over moderately high heat until foam subsides, then brown half of lamb, turning, about 6 minutes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Ask for the smallest lamb your butcher has (like those from New Zealand), or buy a 3 1/2-4-pound piece of a leg.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 garlic cloves, crushed', u'2 tablespoons fresh thyme leaves', u'2 tablespoons kosher salt plus more', u'4 fresh bay leaves, divided', u'3 pounds Yukon Gold potatoes (6-8), peeled, cut into 1/4" slices, divided', u'7 tablespoons olive oil, divided', u'Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 3 1/2- to 4-pound bone-in leg of lamb', u'2 pounds tomatoes, cut into 1/4" slices', u'2 medium onions, cut into 1/2" slices', u'2 cups dry white wine'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F. Spread out potatoes in a single layer.', u'Place lamb on top of potatoes and rub with garlic mixture. Layer tomatoes, onions, remaining 3 crushed bay leaves, and remaining potatoes around and up sides of lamb, seasoning with salt and pepper and drizzling with remaining 6 tablespoons oil as you go (lamb will be nearly covered). {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Delicately flavored sole is a dieter's BFF, with only 73 calories per 3-ounce fillet.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: 396 calories, 16 g fat, 4 g saturated, 24 g carbohydrates, 1 g fiber, 36 g protein\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Self', 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'Parchment paper', u'4 sole fillets (6 ounces each)', u'1 tablespoon plus 4 teaspoons olive oil, divided', u'3 cloves garlic, 2 thinly sliced, 1 halved', u'1/8 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u'1 cup grape tomatoes, halved', u'2 tablespoons capers, drained', u'8 large, pitted kalamata olives, quartered', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'8 teaspoons dry white wine', u'4 teaspoons unsalted butter', u'8 fresh thyme sprigs', u'4 slices (1/2-inch thick) ciabatta bread'], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat oven to 450\xb0F. Fold four 15-inch-square pieces of parchment in half. Starting at fold of each piece, draw half a large heart shape. Cut along lines; open. Place 1 fish fillet next to crease on each piece of parchment. In a small skillet, warm 1 tbsp oil over medium heat. Saut\xe9 sliced garlic and pepper flakes until garlic turns golden, 1 minute. Remove skillet from heat; stir in tomatoes, capers and olives. Sprinkle fish with salt and pepper. Divide tomato mixture among fish. Top each fillet with 2 teaspoon wine, 1 teaspoon butter and 2 thyme sprigs. Fold other half of parchment over fish. Starting at top of each parchment half-heart, make small, tight, overlapping folds along outside edge to seal packet; twist tail ends tightly to seal completely. Place packets on a large rimmed baking sheet; roast 8 minutes. Broil or toast ciabatta until golden; rub with garlic clove halves and brush with remaining 4 teaspoon oil. Transfer packets to plates. Slit tops with a knife; gently open. Serve 1 slice ciabatta with each packet.'], 'chef': u'Larraine Perri', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/sole-em-en-papillote-em-with-tomatoes-and-olives-51101600', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 servings', 'recipe title': u'Sole en Papillote with Tomatoes and Olives', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This vegetarian version of the Spanish classic is perfect for spring. You will need a 12-inch-diameter skillet with 3-inch-high sides.', 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'58%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 large fresh fennel bulbs (about 1 1/2 pounds total), trimmed, each cut into 8 wedges; 2 tablespoons chopped fronds reserved', u'12 ounces baby carrots (from about 4 bunches), trimmed, peeled', u'8 ounces turnips, peeled, cut into 3/4-inch pieces (about 1 1/2 cups)', u'8 ounces 1 1/2-inch red-skinned new potatoes, halved', u'1/4 cup plus 3 tablespoons olive oil', u'1/4 cup plus 1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley', u'4 garlic cloves, chopped', u'1 tablespoon paprika', u'1 teaspoon saffron threads, crushed', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 onion, chopped', u'4 plum tomatoes, chopped, seeds and juices reserved', u'2 1/4 cups arborio rice or medium-grain rice', u'1 14-ounce can vegetable broth', u'2 cups water', u'3/4 cup dry white wine', u'1 pound asparagus, trimmed, cut into 1-inch pieces', u'1 cup drained canned garbanzo beans (chickpeas)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 450\xb0F. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'We usually turn to fish for omega-3 fatty acids and their brain-enhancing powers, but walnuts are a great vegetarian source of the nutrient.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: 314 calories, 12 g fat, 1 g saturated fat, 40 g carbohydrate, 13 g fiber, 10 g protein\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Self', 'recommendation': u'67%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 large yellow onion, chopped', u'4 celery stalks, chopped', u'2 medium carrots, chopped', u'3 cloves garlic, quartered', u'1/2 cup dry white wine or water', u'1 quart low-sodium vegetable stock', u'2 cups canned cannellini beans, rinsed and drained', u'1 can (14 ounces) diced tomatoes', u'2 bay leaves', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, divided', u'2 packed cups fresh basil', u'1/4 cup walnuts', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper'], 'preperation steps': [u'In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Bring soup to a boil; reduce heat, cover, and simmer, stirring occasionally, until carrots are very soft, 15 to 20 minutes. In a blender, puree basil, walnuts, black pepper, remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 cup water. Transfer pesto to a bowl; wash blender. Remove bay leaves from soup; discard. In blender, carefully puree half of soup; transfer to a bowl; repeat with remaining half of soup. Divide soup among 4 bowls, dollop each with 1/4 pesto, and swirl in; serve.'], 'chef': u'Kerri Conan', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/tomato-white-bean-soup-with-pesto-395097', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 servings', 'recipe title': u'Tomato-White Bean Soup with Pesto', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Begin at least a day before you plan to serve the vacherins. (Don't make them on a humid day; moisture prevents meringues from drying properly and staying crisp.) Use a 3 1/2-inch round cookie cutter or a 3 1/2-inch round can to trace the bases.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 cups sugar', u'2 tablespoons cornstarch', u'6 large egg whites, room temperature', u'1/4 teaspoon cream of tartar', u'3/4 cup seedless raspberry jam', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1/3 cup water', u'1 16-ounce package frozen unsweetened mixed berries (do not thaw)', u'1 teaspoon ground cardamom', u'3 pints raspberry sorbet', u'Fresh raspberries', u'Fresh mint sprigs'], 'preperation steps': [u'Position 1 rack in bottom third and 1 rack in top third of oven; preheat to 200\xb0F. Turn parchment over so that marked side faces down (circles will show through).', u'Whisk sugar and cornstarch in medium bowl to blend. Using heavy-duty or handheld electric mixer on medium-high speed, beat whites in large bowl until foamy, about 1 minute. Add cream of tartar; beat until soft peaks form, about 1 minute. Add sugar mixture, 1 tablespoon at a time, beating until whites are very stiff and glossy, at least 4 minutes with heavy-duty mixer and 6 to 8 minutes with handheld. Scoop enough meringue into pastry bag fitted with medium star tip to fill 1/3 full. Pipe small dot of meringue under parchment in each corner of baking sheets. Press parchment onto dots.', u'Starting in center of 1 marked circle, pipe meringue in continuous spiral to fill circle completely. Pipe 1 meringue circle atop edge of base circle, forming standing rim. Repeat, piping 2 more circles atop first, forming meringue cup. Pipe 3 more cups on sheet, filling bag with meringue as needed. Pipe 4 cups on second sheet.', u'Bake meringues 3 hours without opening oven door (sides of meringues may settle slightly). Store airtight in single layer.)', u'Whisk jam, sugar and 1/3 cup water in heavy medium saucepan over medium-high heat until sugar dissolves and jam melts. Boil until sauce thickens and is reduced to generous 3/4 cup, whisking often, about 7 minutes. Add berries and cardamom; stir gently. Remove from heat; let stand 1 hour to thaw fruit. Cover; chill at least 2 hours and up to 1 day.', u'Scoop sorbet into vacherins. (Can be made 2 days ahead. Wrap tightly; freeze. If you freeze the vacherins, the meringues will be tender and chewy rather than crisp.) Spoon sauce over. Garnish with berries and mint. Serve with remaining sauce.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/vacherins-with-raspberry-sorbet-and-mixed-berry-cardamom-sauce-102908', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Vacherins with Raspberry Sorbet and Mixed Berry-Cardamom Sauce', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 3/4 hr Start to finish: 5 hr', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'88%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 cups yellow cornmeal (not coarse)', u'7 1/2 cups water', u'2 3/4 teaspoons salt', u'2 1/2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1/4 teaspoon cinnamon', u'1/4 teaspoon paprika', u'1/4 teaspoon cayenne', u'1/2 cup raw green (hulled) pumpkin seeds (pepitas)', u"1 tablespoon fresh pomegranate juice (see cooks' note, below) or cranberry juice cocktail", u'2 teaspoons Sherry vinegar', u'1 tablespoon minced shallot', u'6 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 small cheese pumpkin or butternut squash (2 lb), peeled, quartered lengthwise, and seeded', u'1 (6-oz) piece Parmigiano-Reggiano', u'8 oz arugula, trimmed'], 'preperation steps': [u'Bring cornmeal, water, and 2 1/4 teaspoons salt to a boil in a 4-quart heavy saucepan, stirring constantly. Reduce heat and simmer, stirring frequently, until polenta is creamy and tender, about 50 minutes. Remove from heat, then stir in 11/2 tablespoons butter and cool slightly.', u'Spoon polenta onto center of a lightly buttered large baking sheet, then spread evenly into a 10- by 7-inch rectangle (about 1/2 inch thick). Cover with plastic wrap, then poke several holes in wrap with a small sharp knife and chill 2 hours.', u'Melt remaining tablespoon butter in a heavy saucepan over moderate heat. Stir in sugar, cumin, cinnamon, paprika, cayenne, and 1/4 teaspoon salt, then cook, without stirring, until caramelized. Add pumpkin seeds and cook, stirring occasionally, until seeds are puffed and golden. Transfer to a plate to cool. When seeds have hardened, break up any clumps with your fingers.', u'Whisk together pomegranate juice, vinegar, and shallot and let stand 5 minutes. Whisk in 3 tablespoons oil, remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt, and pepper to taste.', u'Preheat oven to 450\xb0F.', u'Cut pumpkin quarters crosswise into 1/2-inch-thick slices. Toss with 1 tablespoon oil and salt and pepper to taste in a shallow baking pan and arrange slices in 1 layer. Roast in middle of oven until just tender, about 20 minutes. Remove from oven, then cover with foil to keep warm.', u'Trim polenta into a 9- by 6-inch rectangle. Cut polenta into 6 (3-inch) squares, then halve each square diagonally. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large nonstick skillet until hot but not smoking, then cook polenta in 2 batches, turning once, until golden brown, about 8 minutes (if necessary, use remaining tablespoon oil for second batch). Transfer as cooked to a plate and keep warm, covered.', u'Shave 12 strips from cheese with a vegetable peeler.', u'Whisk vinaigrette, then toss arugula in a large bowl with enough vinaigrette to lightly coat. Place several pieces of pumpkin and 1 piece of polenta on each of 6 plates. Top with arugula, more pumpkin, and remaining polenta. Sprinkle with candied pumpkin seeds and top with parmesan shavings, then drizzle with remaining vinaigrette.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/warm-pumpkin-salad-with-polenta-and-candied-pumpkin-seeds-105581', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Warm Pumpkin Salad with Polenta and Candied Pumpkin Seeds', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 hr Start to finish: 3 1/4 hr (includes chilling)', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'57%', 'ingredient list': [u'3/4 cup sugar', u'1/4 cup water', u'1 teaspoon finely grated fresh lemon zest', u'5 cups coarsely chopped seeded watermelon (from a 4-lb piece, rind discarded)', u'2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, or to taste', u'1/4 cup packed fresh basil leaves', u'1 1/2 cups dry white wine', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1 teaspoon finely grated fresh lemon zest', u'1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons water', u'2 teaspoons unflavored gelatin (from 1 envelope)', u'2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, or to taste', u'Special equipment: an ice cream maker'], 'preperation steps': [u'Bring sugar, water, and zest to a boil in a 2-quart heavy saucepan, stirring until sugar is dissolved, then reduce heat and simmer, without stirring, washing down any sugar crystals on side of pan with a pastry brush dipped in cold water, 2 minutes.', u'Put watermelon in a blender, then add syrup and lemon juice and blend until smooth. Pour through a fine-mesh sieve into a large bowl, pressing on pulp and discarding any remaining solids.', u'Freeze in ice cream maker, then transfer to an airtight container and freeze until firm.', u'Blanch basil in a 3-quart pot of boiling salted water 5 seconds, then drain and transfer to a bowl of ice and cold water to stop cooking. Drain basil and squeeze dry.', u'Bring wine, sugar, zest, and 1/2 cup water to a boil in cleaned 2-quart heavy saucepan, stirring until sugar is dissolved, then simmer 2 minutes.', u'While wine syrup simmers, sprinkle gelatin over remaining 2 tablespoons water in a large metal bowl and let soften 1 minute.', u'Pour about 1/2 cup wine syrup through a medium-mesh sieve lined with a dampened paper towel into gelatin mixture (reserve lined sieve), then stir until gelatin is dissolved.', u'Blend remaining syrup with basil and lemon juice in cleaned blender until smooth (use caution when blending hot liquids), then pour through lined sieve into gelatin mixture. Set bowl in a larger bowl of ice and cold water and let stand, stirring occasionally, until cold, about 15 minutes, then chill in refrigerator, uncovered, until set, at least 2 hours.', u'Gently whisk gel\xe9e to break into small pieces and serve as a bed for scoops of sorbet.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/watermelon-sorbet-with-wine-basil-gelee-109666', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 to 8 dessert servings', 'recipe title': u'Watermelon Sorbet with Wine Basil Gel\xe9e', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'An elegant terrine with pretty layers of walnut praline and homemade white chocolate ice cream. Do-aheads: praline, 3 days; sauce, 1 day; entire terrine, 3 days.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'93%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 cup sugar', u'1/2 cup water', u'1/8 teaspoon cream of tartar', u'1 1/3 cups coarsely chopped walnuts', u'4 large egg yolks', u'1 1/2 cups heavy whipping cream', u'1 1/2 cups whole milk', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'8 ounces high-quality white chocolate (such as Lindt or Perugina), chopped', u'1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'Blackberry-Raspberry Sauce'], 'preperation steps': [u'Line rimmed baking sheet with foil. Stir sugar, 1/2 cup water, and cream of tartar in heavy medium saucepan over medium heat until sugar dissolves. Increase heat and boil without stirring until syrup is pale amber color, occasionally brushing down sides of pan with wet pastry brush and swirling pan, about 5 minutes. Add nuts; stir with wooden spoon until coated with syrup. Continue to cook until syrup is deep amber color, gently pushing nuts into syrup, about 3 minutes longer. Immediately scrape mixture out onto prepared baking sheet, spreading as thinly as possible with metal spatula. Let praline stand until cool and firm, about 1 hour. Break praline into irregular pieces. Set aside a few pieces for garnish. Coarsely chop remaining praline. (Can be made 3 days ahead. Store airtight at room temperature.)', u'Whisk yolks in bowl to blend. Bring cream, milk, and sugar to simmer in heavy medium saucepan, stirring until sugar dissolves. Gradually whisk cream mixture into yolks; return to saucepan and stir constantly until mixture thickens slightly and instant-read thermometer inserted into mixture registers 170\xb0F, about 3 minutes (do not boil). Transfer custard to 4-cup measuring cup; cool slightly.', u'Place white chocolate in medium metal bowl. Set bowl over saucepan of barely simmering water; stir just until chocolate is melted and smooth. Remove bowl from over water. Gradually whisk warm custard into melted chocolate. Mix in vanilla. Cover and chill custard at least 4 hours and up to 1 day.', u'Process custard in ice cream maker. Transfer ice cream to container; cover and freeze at least 6 hours or overnight.', u'Line 9x5x3-inch loaf pan with double layer of plastic wrap, leaving 4-inch overhang. Spread 1/3 of ice cream over bottom of prepared loaf pan; sprinkle with half of chopped praline. Spread half of remaining ice cream over; sprinkle with remaining chopped praline. Spread remaining ice cream over. Fold plastic wrap over to cover. Freeze overnight. (Can be made 3 days ahead. Keep frozen.)', u'Invert terrine onto platter; remove plastic wrap. Serve terrine with sauce and garnish with reserved praline pieces.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/white-chocolate-praline-ice-cream-terrine-with-blackberry-raspberry-sauce-231325', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': None, 'recipe title': u'White Chocolate Praline Ice Cream Terrine with Blackberry-Raspberry Sauce', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This layer cake was a standard in our house. This recipe is a very old one that people could keep in their heads because of the utter simplicity of the formula that gave the cake its name\u20141 cup of butter, 2 cups of sugar, 3 cups of flour, and 4 eggs. The juice mixture will give the cake a lovely, fresh, fruity flavor and it is not rich like an icing.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'75%', 'ingredient list': [u'Softened butter and flour, for the pans', u'3 cups sifted cake flour (not self-rising)', u'4 teaspoons baking powder', u'1/2 teaspoon plain salt', u'1/2 pound (2 sticks) unsalted butter, at room temperature', u'2 cups sugar', u'4 large eggs, separated, at room temperature', u'1 cup whole milk, at room temperature', u'1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'3/4 cup freshly squeezed orange juice', u'2 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice', u'3/4 cup sugar', u'1 tablespoon finely grated orange zest'], 'preperation steps': [u'Butter and flour the bottom and sides of three 8 by 1 1/2-inch cake pans with the softened butter, tipping out the excess flour.', u'Sift the flour, baking powder, and salt together. Beat the butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer on high speed until it is light, creamy, and fluffy, about 1 minute. Gradually add the sugar into the butter, and beat until the mixture is very light and fluffy, about 2 minutes more. As the sugar blends in it will change the color of the butter to a much lighter color, almost white.', u'Whisk the egg yolks in a small bowl until they are well blended. Gradually beat into the butter mixture, mixing well after each addition. With the mixer on low speed, starting with the flour mixture, add the flour mixture in thirds, alternating with two equal additions of the milk, scraping down the sides of the bowl as needed. Beat in the vanilla. In a clean bowl using clean beaters beat the egg whites until they form firm, glossy peaks. Do not overbeat until they are stiff and dry. Fold the whites into the batter.', u'Pour and scrape the batter into the prepared pans, dividing it equally among them. Give the filled pans a little knock on the countertop to level the batter. Bake in the center of a preheated 350\xb0F oven for 25 minutes, or until each cake springs back when touched in the center. Remove the pans from the oven and put them on wire cake racks to cool for a few minutes, then loosen the layers by running the flat side of a knife blade around the sides of the pans, put a rack on top of each pan, and invert so the cake comes out onto the rack, top side down. Then reverse the layers so they are top side up.', u'Mix the orange juice, lemon juice, sugar, and orange rind together and drizzle the mixture over the still warm cake layers, being careful not to let it all soak into one spot; then pile the layers on top of each other. Let the cake cool.'], 'chef': u'James Beard', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/1-2-3-4-cake-51128010', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes one 3-layer cake; 12 servings', 'recipe title': u'1-2-3-4 cake', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"This is a whole-wheat version of basic white sandwich bread. It's a little less soft but a lot more wheat-y and substantial. The use of bread flour gives this bread a lighter texture, while the milk powder and oil help soften it.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'67%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 cups (12 ounces/336 grams) water, room temperature (70\xb0F to 90\xb0F)', u'2 tablespoons honey', u'1 3/4 cups (8.7 ounces/244 grams) whole-wheat flour', u'1 1/4 teaspoons instant yeast (also known as rapid-rise or bread machine yeast)', u'1 2/3 cups (8.7 ounces/244 grams) Gold Medal "Better for Bread" flour*', u'3 tablespoons non-fat dry milk powder', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 1/2 teaspoons fine sea salt', u'*If unavailable substitute 1/2 cup plus 1/3 cup (4.4 ounces/122 grams) bread flour and 1/2 cup plus 1/3 cup (4.4 ounces/122 grams) unbleached all-purpose flour.'], 'preperation steps': [u'In bowl of stand mixer fitted with whisk attachment, whisk together water, honey, whole-wheat flour, and 1/2 teaspoon yeast until very smooth, about 3 minutes.', u'In medium bowl, whisk together "Better for Bread" flour, milk powder, and remaining 3/4 teaspoon yeast. Sprinkle mixture over whole-wheat flour mixture (sponge) in bowl of mixer to form blanket on top of sponge. Cover bowl tightly with plastic wrap and let stand at least 1 hour, preferably up to 4 hours. (Starter can be made ahead and refrigerated, tightly covered with plastic wrap, overnight. There is no need to bring starter to room temperature before proceeding.)', u'Attach dough hook to stand mixer and mix starter on low (#2 on Kitchen Aid) until rough dough forms, about 1 minute. Scrape down sides of bowl, then cover tightly with plastic wrap and let dough rest 20 minutes. Add vegetable oil and mix on low until incorporated, about 30 seconds. Add salt and mix on low until dough is smooth, sticky enough to cling to fingers, and pulls away completely from bowl, about 7 minutes. If dough is not sticky, using spray bottle, spray with small amount of water and briefly knead by hand just until sticky.', u"Using vegetable oil or nonstick vegetable-oil spray, lightly oil 3-quart or larger bowl (or dough-rising container). Transfer dough to bowl and lightly oil or spray top of dough. Using tape, mark outside of bowl to approximately double current height of dough. Cover container tightly with plastic wrap and let dough rise in warm place (75\xb0F to 80\xb0F, see Chef's Notes) until doubled in size, 1 to 1 1/2 hours.", u'Using oiled dough scraper or spatula, transfer dough to lightly oiled work surface.', u'Gently stretch bottom of dough and fold up to center, then repeat with left side, right side, and top. Round dough package then transfer to bowl, smooth side up, and lightly oil or spray top of dough. Using tape, mark outside of bowl to approximately double current height of dough. Cover bowl tightly with plastic wrap and let dough rise in warm place until doubled in size and depression holds when pressed gently with fingertip, about 1 hour.', u'Transfer dough, smooth side down, to lightly floured work surface and press gently to flatten to about 1/2-inch thickness. (Dough will still be slightly sticky but use only as much flour on work surface as absolutely necessary to prevent sticking.) Lightly coat sheet of plastic wrap with vegetable oil or nonstick vegetable-oil spray. Cover dough with oiled plastic wrap and let rest 20 minutes.', u'Lightly coat loaf pan with vegetable oil or nonstick vegetable-oil spray. Using fingertips, dimple dough all over to eliminate air bubbles, then shape into rectangle about twice size of loaf pan. Fold right-hand-side of rectangle over to just past center, then fold left-hand-side over to meet right-hand-side. Roll down top edge of dough, using thumbs to push dough down and away from you. Continue rolling until you reach bottom then use thumbs to press and seal bottom edge. Transfer dough to prepared pan (dough should fill pan to 1/2 inch from top). Lightly coat sheet of plastic wrap with vegetable oil or nonstick vegetable-oil spray and gently cover pan with oiled wrap.', u'Let dough rise in warm place until highest point is about 1 1/2 inches above sides of pan and depression very slowly fills in when pressed gently with fingertip, about 1 hour. Using razor or thin sharp knife, make 1/2 inch deep lengthwise slash along top of bread.', u'While dough is rising, position rack near bottom of oven and top with baking stone or heavy baking sheet. Set aluminum-foil-lined cast-iron pan or heavy rimmed baking pan on floor of oven and preheat oven to 450\xb0F for 1 hour.', u"Using spray bottle, spray top of dough with water. Quickly transfer bread to hot baking stone (see Chef's Notes) and add 1/2 cup ice cubes to pan beneath.", u'Bake bread, rotating pan 180 degrees halfway through, until top is golden brown and skewer inserted in middle comes out clean (instant read thermometer inserted into center will register about 205\xb0F), 40 to 50 minutes. Transfer bread from pan to rack to cool completely. Serve warm or at room temperature.', u"\u2022Dough rises best around 75\xbaF to 80\xbaF. If your house is on the cold side, you can set a container of very hot tap water near the rising dough and cover the dough and the hot water with a large plastic container or bowl-you will need to reheat the water every 30 to 40 minutes. Alternatively you can place the dough (and the small container of very hot water) in a microwave oven (not turned on!) or a standard oven without a pilot light, but with the oven light turned on to provide gentle heat. \u2022If you want to make this bread over a 2-day period, you can refrigerate it overnight after the first rise. Once it has doubled in size (first rise), gently press the dough down in the bowl, then cover with plastic wrap that has been lightly coated with vegetable oil or nonstick vegetable-oil spray and refrigerate. The next day, bring the dough to room temperature at least 1 hour before shaping and baking the loaf. Keep in mind that the time in the refrigerator replaces the second rise so there is no need for a second rise. \u2022For proper texture, it's important for the bread to get a blast of heat as soon as it goes into the oven. For this reason, the oven needs to be preheated for a full hour, and it's important not to let too much heat escape when you put the bread in. When transferring the dough to the oven to bake, be sure to shut the door quickly.", u'flour: 100% water: 70.6% yeast: 0.8% salt: 1.8% oil: 5.5%'], 'chef': u'Rose Levy Beranbaum', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/50-whole-wheat-sandwich-bread-351231', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes one (8-by 4 1/2- by 4 3/4-inch) loaf ', 'recipe title': u'50% Whole Wheat Sandwich Bread', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This recipe is adapted from The Thrill of the Grill by Chris Schlesinger and John Willoughby (William Morrow and Company, 1990).', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'94%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 1/2 tablespoons sugar', u'3 tablespoons paprika', u'2 tablespoons ground cumin', u'1 1/2 tablespoons black pepper', u'1 tablespoon chili powder', u'1 tablespoon salt', u'2 full racks pork spareribs (each 3 lb), brisket flap and chine bone removed', u'1 3/4 cups distilled white vinegar', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1 tablespoon Tabasco', u'1 tablespoon salt', u'1 1/2 teaspoons black pepper'], 'preperation steps': [u'Stir together sugar, spices, and salt and rub all over ribs to coat well, knocking off excess.', u'Put chips in foil and crimp tightly closed to form a packet. Poke holes all over packet.', u'Stir together all sauce ingredients until sugar is dissolved.', u'Open vents two-thirds in lid and bottom of grill. Light half a chimney of charcoal, then put on one side of bottom rack, mounding and banking against side. Charcoal will be ready for cooking when it turns grayish white (10 to 15 minutes). Temperature should be about 350\xb0F inside covered grill. Add additional charcoal if necessary. (Temperature will gradually drop during cooking; the goal is to maintain a low, continuous heat, about 250\xb0F.)
