{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Kosher Status: Pareve Prep: 35 Minutes Rise: 2 Hours, 15 Minutes Bake: 45 to 55 Minutes Cool: 15 Minutes Total: About 4 Hours', 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'11%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 ounces (1/4 cup) active dry yeast', u'2 cups plus 3 tablespoons granulated sugar', u'6 cups warm water (90\xb0 to 100\xb0F)', u'1/4 cup kosher salt', u'6 pounds high-gluten (bread) or all-purpose flour', u'4 large eggs, separated', u'1 1/4 cups canola oil', u'Cooking spray', u'1/2 cup sesame seeds', u'1/2 cup poppy seeds'], 'preperation steps': [u"1. Bloom the yeast: Dissolve the yeast and 3 tablespoons sugar in 2 cups of the warm water in a medium bowl; set aside to bloom. If the yeast doesn't bloom after 5 minutes discard the mixture and start over.", u'2. Place the salt, flour, and the remaining 2 cups sugar together in a very large bowl and stir together. Add the 4 egg yolks. Make a well in the middle and add the yeast mixture and the remaining 4 cups water. Start kneading together; add 1/2 cup canola oil. Knead for 10 minutes, adding 1/2 cup canola oil, a small amount at a time, to create a workable dough. The dough will become a cohesive mass yet be a bit sticky. Rub a little of the remaining 1/4 cup canola oil over the top and sides of the dough. Loosely cover the dough with a kitchen towel and place the bowl in a warm spot for 15 minutes.', u'3. After 15 minutes, the dough will have relaxed a bit and should be easier to work with. Lightly oil your hands and knead the dough again until smooth and satiny, 2 to 3 minutes. Rub a little oil over the top and sides of the dough. Cover with a kitchen towel and place the bowl in a medium garbage bag. Place the open end loosely underneath the bowl to trap air. Let the dough rise in a warm dark corner of your kitchen until doubled in size, about 1 hour.', u'4. Uncover the dough. With lightly oiled hands, punch the dough down to release air. Cover again with the bag, loosely tucked under, and let rise for 1 hour.', u'5. Divide the dough into five equal parts, about 2 pounds each. Preheat oven to 375\xb0F. Spray five 9-inch round baking pans with cooking spray.', u"6. Place one piece of dough on a smooth work surface. Squeeze out any air bubbles from the dough and roll in into a 12-inch rope. If the dough is sticking, lightly spray your work surface with cooking spray. Cut the rope into eight equal pieces. Roll each piece into a ball. Place one ball in the center of the prepared pan and surround it with the remaining balls. Repeat with the remaining pieces of dough so you have five pans of challah. Loosely cover each pan with a kitchen towel or plastic wrap and let rise 15 minutes. (If you can't fit all the pans in your oven at once and you want your challahs to be as beautiful as possible, shape the remaining dough while the first round of challahs are in the oven so they don't see rise for too much longer than 15 minutes before baking.)", u'7. Beat the egg whites with 1 teaspoon water in a small bowl and brush the challahs. Sprinkle each with sesame or poppy seeds or a combination of the two.', u'8. Bake for 10 minutes. Reduce the temperature to 350\xb0F and bake until tops are dark golden brown, 35 to 45 minutes more. Let cool 15 minutes before serving warm, or cool completely on a wire rack.'], 'chef': u'Jamie Geller', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/basic-pull-apart-challah-51206820', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'10 Pounds 6 Ounces Dough, 5 Challahs', 'recipe title': u'Basic Pull-Apart Challah', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'A classic dish perfected. Ask your butcher to cut the meat from the shank into 3/4-inch cubes.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: 474.2 kcal calories, 42.4 % calories from fat, 22.6 g fat, 4.1 g saturated fat, 81.1 mg cholesterol, 18.4 g carbohydrates, 4.1 g dietary fiber, 8.1 g total sugars, 14.3 g net carbohydrates, 48.6 g protein \xa0\xa0\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Bon App\xe9tit', 'recommendation': u'67%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/2 cup canola oil', u'1 1/2 pounds white onions, halved through core, thinly sliced crosswise (about 8 cups)', u'2 garlic cloves, sliced', u'1 tablespoon dried marjoram', u'1 1/2 tablespoons tomato paste', u'3 tablespoons Hungarian sweet paprika', u'1 1/2 teaspoons Hungarian hot paprika', u'1 cup white wine vinegar', u'6 cups low-salt chicken broth', u'2 bay leaves', u'2 teaspoons finely grated lemon peel', u'3 1/2 pounds beef shank meat (from about 4 1/2 pounds beef shanks) or boneless beef short ribs, cut into 3/4-inch cubes'], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat oil in heavy large pot over medium high heat. Add onions and cook until golden brown and soft, stirring often, about 25 minutes. Add garlic and marjoram; cook until garlic softens, about 3 minutes. Add tomato paste and cook until mixture begins to turn dark red, stirring often, about 3 minutes. Add both paprikas and stir to blend; remove from heat and let stand 1 minute for flavors to blend. Add vinegar; stir over medium heat until almost all liquid is absorbed, about 2 minutes. Add broth, bay leaves, and lemon peel; increase heat and bring to boil.', u'Sprinkle beef with salt and pepper; add to pot. Simmer over medium-low heat until beef is tender, stirring occasionally, about 2 1/2 hours.', u'Transfer beef to bowl, leaving onions in pot. Boil sauce in pot until reduced to 5 cups, about 15 minutes. Cool slightly. Working in batches, puree sauce in blender until smooth; return to pot. Season with salt and pepper. Return beef to pot. Simmer until heated through, about 5 minutes. DO AHEAD: Can be made 2 days ahead. Cool slightly. Chill uncovered until cool, then cover and chill. Rewarm before serving.', u'In keeping with the spirit of this menu, pour an Austrian red with the gulasch. The fruity, elegant Feiler-Artinger 2007 Zweigelt ($19) is a good choice.'], 'chef': u'Chefs Andrew Chase and Erwin Schrottner', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/beef-gulasch-356793', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Beef Gulasch', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Kosher Status: Meat Prep: 10 Minutes Cook: 4 Hours Rest: 15 Minutes Total: 4 Hours, 25 Minutes', 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 tablespoon sweet or hot smoked paprika', u'1 tablespoon dark brown sugar', u'1 tablespoon ground cumin', u'1 tablespoon instant coffee granules', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 teaspoon onion powder', u'1/2 teaspoon garlic powder', u'One 5-pound top of the rib', u'3 tablespoons olive oil', u'Three 12-ounce cans or bottles dark lager beer', u'1 garlic head, halved horizontally', u'1 pound small parsnips, peeled and halved length wise', u'1 pound peeled baby carrots with greens'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 hr Start to finish: 2 1/4 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'71%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 frozen puff pastry sheet (from a 17 1/4-oz package), thawed', u'1 1/2 teaspoons cornstarch', u'2 tablespoons water', u'1/2 teaspoon fresh lemon juice', u'1/2 cup raspberries', u'1/2 cup blackberries', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'2/3 cup Essencia or other orange Muscat dessert wine', u'6 tablespoons chilled heavy cream', u'1 tablespoon confectioners sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon finely grated fresh orange zest', u'1 cup raspberries', u'1 cup blackberries', u'Confectioners sugar for dusting'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 425\xb0F.', u'Unfold pastry sheet, then turn over (to prevent creases from splitting during baking). {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Don't worry \u2014 you won't need a giant oven for this king-size tart. It's made in 4 quadrants, baked one at a time. And because the recipe uses packaged puff pastry, it's fairly simple to prepare.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'85%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 large egg yolks', u'4 tablespoons water', u'4 (17 1/4-oz) packages frozen puff pastry sheets, thawed but kept chilled', u'2 (8-oz) packages cream cheese', u'1/2 cup granulated sugar', u'1/2 cup chopped crystallized ginger (4 oz)', u'2 pt strawberries (1 lb), hulled, then halved or quartered if large', u'3/4 cup red currant jelly', u'4 pt blueberries (2 1/2 lb)', u'Garnish: confectioners sugar', u'Special Equipment: parchment paper and a large flat board (at least 20 inches square) for serving'], 'preperation steps': [u'Stir together yolks and 2 tablespoons water for egg wash. Place right angle on 1 corner on top of 2 adjacent edges of pricked pastry to form first quadrant of tart. Transfer pastry on parchment to baking sheet in freezer and chill until firm, about 10 minutes.', u'Transfer pastry on parchment from freezer to cutting board and trim a 1/4-inch-wide strip from all 4 edges using tip of small knife and a ruler and cutting all the way through pastry. Make 1/4-inch-long vertical cuts through double layers of edge about 1/2 inch apart (to help sides rise evenly).', u'Return pastry on parchment to baking sheet in freezer and chill until firm but not solid, about 10 minutes more.', u'Preheat oven to 450\xb0F and heat another baking sheet on lowest rack in oven until hot, about 2 minutes.', u'Remove baking sheet from oven and transfer pastry on parchment from freezer to hot sheet. Transfer pastry on parchment to a rack to cool.', u'Repeat procedure with remaining 3 packages puff pastry to make remaining 3 quadrants of tart.', u'Blend cream cheese and granulated sugar in a food processor until sugar is dissolved and mixture is smooth. Add ginger and pulse until finely chopped and mixture is combined well.', u'If very puffed, gently flatten inner parts of pastry (single layer) slightly with your palm. Fit quadrants together on flat board to form a giant square tart shell, trimming inside edges of each quadrant slightly with a serrated knife to help quadrants fit together smoothly. "Glue" inner edges together with a little ginger cream, then spread remaining ginger cream evenly over tart, leaving double edges as a border.', u'Arrange strawberries in a decorative pattern over cream. Bring jelly to a boil with remaining 2 tablespoons water, whisking until smooth, then simmer glaze 1 minute. Toss three fourths of glaze with blueberries in a large bowl and spoon blueberries onto tart to cover cream between strawberries, mounding slightly. Brush strawberries with remaining glaze.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/berry-tart-with-ginger-cream-106760', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 16 to 24 servings', 'recipe title': u'Berry Tart with Ginger Cream', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 40 min Start to finish: 1 1/4 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'83%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 bacon slices (4 oz), cut crosswise into 1/4-inch-wide strips', u'1 (3 1/2-lb) chicken, cut into 8 serving pieces', u'1 lb shallots, thinly sliced', u'1 head garlic, cloves separated and peeled', u'1/4 cup balsamic vinegar'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cook bacon in a deep 12-inch heavy skillet over moderately low heat, stirring, until crisp, about 8 minutes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This recipe serves 4 as a main course after you set aside half of the veal shanks and sauce to make Eggplant and Veal Pastitsio . {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Buffalo meat can be very red, even when cooked to medium-rare. Don't be alarmed \u2014 this is a naturally occurring phenomenon that has to do with the animal's diet and how little fat is marbled through the muscle. While testing this recipe, we learned that buffalo meat varies in quality; the purveyors whose meat we like best are Wild Idea Buffalo Company (866-658-6137; wildideabuffalo.com), Jackson Hole Buffalo Meat Company (800-543-6328; jhbuffalomeat.com), Arrowhead Buffalo Meats (877-283-2969; arrowheadsteaks.com), and D'Artagnan (800-327-8246; dartagnan.com).", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 (7- to 8-lb) bone-in buffalo prime rib roast or bone-in beef prime rib roast (sometimes called standing rib roast; 3 or 4 ribs), brought to room temperature (allow 1 hour)', u'4 1/2 to 5 cups water', u'Orange balsamic glaze', u'2/3 cup dry red wine', u'1/4 cup Madeira (preferably Sercial)', u'1 1/2 cups beef broth', u'Special equipment: a V-rack for roasting; a meat or instant-read thermometer'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 450\xb0F.', u'If using beef, trim all but a thin layer of fat from roast. Generously season buffalo or beef with salt and pepper. Brush meat with some of glaze and add 1/2 cup water to pan, then continue to roast, brushing with glaze and adding 1/2 cup water to pan every 15 minutes, until thermometer inserted into center of roast (do not touch bone) registers 125\xb0F, 2 to 2 1/4 hours more (115\xb0F for beef, 1 3/4 to 2 hours more). Transfer meat to a large platter and let stand, uncovered, 25 minutes. (Meat will continue to cook as it stands, reaching about 135\xb0F for medium-rare buffalo or 130\xb0F for medium-rare beef.)', u'If using buffalo, straddle roasting pan across 2 burners, then add red wine and Madeira and deglaze pan by boiling over moderately high heat, stirring and scraping up brown bits, 2 minutes. Add broth and boil until reduced to about 1 1/2 cups, about 3 minutes. (If using beef, pour pan juices into a 1-quart fat-separator pitcher or glass measure and skim off fat, then pour juices back into pan. Straddle roasting pan across 2 burners and deglaze pan by boiling juices over moderately high heat, stirring and scraping up brown bits, until reduced to about 2/3 cup, about 8 minutes. Add red wine and Madeira and boil until reduced to about 2/3 cup, 3 to 4 minutes. Add broth and boil until reduced to about 2 cups, about 6 minutes.)', u'Stir in any buffalo or beef juices accumulated on platter and season jus with salt, if necessary. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 3/4 hr Start to finish: 2 1/2 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'89%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 (1 1/2-lb) butternut squash, halved lengthwise and seeded', u'3/4 lb Yukon Gold potatoes', u'1 large egg, lightly beaten', u'1/2 cup finely grated Pecorino Romano (1 1/2 oz)', u'1/2 teaspoon finely chopped fresh thyme', u'1/2 teaspoon finely chopped fresh sage', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/8 teaspoon white pepper', u'Pinch of nutmeg', u'3/4 cup all-purpose flour plus additional for dusting', u'5 (6-oz) confit duck legs', u'5 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'3 lb Swiss chard, stems and tough center ribs discarded and leaves cut into 2- by 1-inch pieces, then washed (but not dried)', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'Accompaniment: grated Pecorino Romano', u'Special equipment: a potato ricer or a food mill fitted with fine disk'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 500\xb0F.', u'Arrange squash halves, cut sides down, in an oiled shallow baking pan and put potatoes alongside. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"When I was growing up in Louisiana, nothing made my mouth water like the smell of onion, bell pepper, and celery cooking in my mom's dark Cajun roux. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Opting for top round beef keeps our sliders on the leaner side, with only 4 g sat fat apiece.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: 249 calories, 11 g fat, 4 g saturated fat, 18 g carbohydrate, 2 g fiber, 20 g protein\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Self', 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 tablespoon canola oil', u'1 1/2 cups thinly sliced onion', u'2 garlic cloves, chopped', u'1 green bell pepper, thinly sliced', u'12 ounces top round beef, cut into thin strips', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce', u'4 ounces reduced-fat provolone, cut into thin strips', u'1 whole-wheat baguette, 9 to 10 inches (about 6 ounces), split and sliced into 6 portions'], 'preperation steps': [u'In a large nonstick pan, heat oil over medium-high heat. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This recipe is extremely simple to make and has a nice peppery flavor from the red pepper flakes, white pepper, and ginger. There is a variety of fresh noodles in the refrigerator section of most Chinese food markets. The best noodles for lo mein are about 1/4 inch thick and are sold in 1-pound packages. If fresh shiitake mushrooms are not available, use button mushrooms. I will sometimes substitute bean sprouts for the Napa cabbage.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'12 ounces fresh Chinese thick, round egg noodles', u'2 teaspoons sesame oil', u'12 ounces skinless, boneless chicken thigh, cut into 1/4-inch-thick bite-sized slices', u'1 tablespoon finely shredded ginger', u'1 teaspoon plus 1 tablespoon Shao Hsing rice wine or dry sherry', u'1 teaspoon cornstarch', u'1 teaspoon plus 1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon ground white pepper', u'2 tablespoons peanut or vegetable oil', u'1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u'3 cups thinly sliced Napa cabbage (about 5 ounces)', u'4 ounces fresh shiitake mushrooms, stems removed and caps thinly sliced (about 2 cups)', u'1/2 cup finely shredded scallions'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. In a 3-quart saucepan bring 2 quarts water to a boil over high heat. When the water comes to a rolling boil, add the noodles. Return to a rolling boil and boil according to package directions until al dente. Carefully pour the noodles into a colander and rinse several times with cold water. Drain the noodles, shaking well to remove excess water. Return the noodles to the unwashed pot, add the sesame oil, and toss until well combined. Set aside.', u'2. Put the chicken in a shallow bowl and add the ginger, 1 teaspoon of the rice wine, cornstarch, 1 tea- spoon of the soy sauce, 1/4 teaspoon of the salt, and pepper. In a small bowl combine the remaining 1 tablespoon rice wine and 1 tablespoon soy sauce.', u'3. Heat a 14-inch flat-bottomed wok over high heat until a bead of water vaporizes within 1 to 2 seconds of contact. Swirl in 1 tablespoon of the peanut oil, add the red pepper flakes, then, using a metal spatula, stir-fry 10 seconds or until the pepper flakes are fragrant. Push the pepper flakes to the sides of the wok, carefully add the chicken mixture and spread it evenly in one layer in the wok. Cook undisturbed 1 minute, letting the chicken begin to sear. Stir-fry 30 seconds or until the chicken begins to brown. Add the cabbage and mushrooms and stir-fry 1 minute or until the cabbage is just wilted but the chicken is not cooked through. Transfer the chicken and vegetables to a plate.', u'4. Swirl the remaining 1 tablespoon peanut oil into the wok. Add the noodles and stir-fry 15 seconds. Restir the soy sauce mixture, swirl it into the wok, add the scallions and chicken mixture, and sprinkle on the remaining 3/4 teaspoon salt. Stir-fry 1 to 2 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and noodles are heated through.'], 'chef': u'Grace Young', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/chicken-lo-mein-with-ginger-mushrooms-388609', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 3 as a main dish or 4 as part of a multicourse meal.', 'recipe title': u'Chicken Lo Mein with Ginger Mushrooms', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Sephardim (Jews of Middle Eastern and Mediterranean extraction) eat peas during Passover; those from eastern European Jewish backgrounds do not. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"You'll only need 1/4 cup of the vinaigrette for the pilaf; use the rest all week.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': u'550 calories, 29 g fat, 28 g carbohydrate\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Bon App\xe9tit', 'recommendation': u'89%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 tablespoons cumin seeds', u'1/2 cup Sherry vinegar', u'2 small garlic cloves, minced', u'1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped Hunza raisins', u'2 teaspoons whole grain mustard', u'2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice', u'Kosher salt', u'4 tablespoons (or more) olive oil, divided', u'1 1/2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into 1/2"-thick cutlets', u'Kosher salt', u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter', u'1 garlic clove, smashed', u'1 pound kale, large center ribs and stems removed, torn into pieces', u'1 cup cooked freekeh', u'1 cup cooked lentils'], 'preperation steps': [u'Stir cumin in a small dry skillet over medium heat until toasted, about 2 minutes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'These satisfying tarts may incite "vegetarian envy" in your meat-eating guests. The recipe makes 4 sizable main-course portions, but the tarts could be halved (or even quartered) to serve as a side dish. Either way, they are delicious with the roasted mushroom and barley gravy.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'91%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 (1-lb) eggplant', u'1 3/4 teaspoons salt', u'1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 medium onion, halved lengthwise, then cut crosswise into 1/2-inch-thick slices', u'1 Turkish or 1/2 California bay leaf', u'3 garlic cloves, minced', u'1 (14 1/2- to 16-oz) can stewed tomatoes, drained, reserving juice, and coarsely chopped', u'1/2 teaspoon paprika (not hot)', u'1/8 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1 (15- to 19-oz) can chickpeas, rinsed and drained', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1 1/2 teaspoons black pepper', u'1/4 cup coarsely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley', u'6 (17- by 12-inch) phyllo sheets (from a 1-lb package), thawed if frozen', u'Garnish: fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves, torn into pieces'], 'preperation steps': [u'Peel eggplant and cut into 1/2-inch cubes. Toss with 1 teaspoon salt in a large bowl and let stand 15 minutes, then rinse in a colander under cold water and squeeze out excess water.', u'Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then cook onion with bay leaf, stirring occasionally, until golden, about 5 minutes. Add 1 tablespoon oil, eggplant, and garlic and cook, stirring, until eggplant is tender, 8 to 10 minutes. Add tomatoes (without juice), paprika, and cumin and cook, stirring, 3 minutes. Add reserved tomato juice, chickpeas, sugar, 1/2 teaspoon pepper, and remaining 3/4 teaspoon salt and simmer, stirring occasionally, until filling is thickened and most of liquid is evaporated, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in parsley, then discard bay leaf.', u'Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 425\xb0F. Line a large baking sheet with foil.', u'Unroll phyllo and cover stack with plastic wrap and a dampened kitchen towel. Keeping remaining phyllo covered, lightly brush 1 phyllo sheet with some of remaining oil and top with 2 more sheets, brushing each with oil. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon pepper, then cut stack in half crosswise with a sharp knife. Spoon 1 cup filling into center of each half. Crumple edges of phyllo and shape into a crescent, leaving filling exposed, then transfer to baking sheet using a spatula. Make 2 more tarts in same manner, arranging about 1/2 inch apart on baking sheet.', u'Bake, rotating baking sheet 180 degrees after 10 minutes, until edges of tarts are golden, 15 to 20 minutes total. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'We liked this particular recipe with Lindt or Ghirardelli bittersweet chocolate, which is around 50 percent cocoa solids. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'For this one, you will need six 4 1/2-inch tartlet pans with removable bottoms.', 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'56%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 tablespoons whipping cream', u'1/4 teaspoon crushed saffron threads', u'1 1/2 pints vanilla ice cream, slightly softened', u'1 1/3 cups whole milk', u'5 ounces bittersweet or semisweet chocolate, chopped', u'6 tablespoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons plus 2 teaspoons cornstarch', u'3 large egg yolks', u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter', u'3/4 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour', u'1/2 cup blanched slivered almonds', u'2 1/2 tablespoons sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon (generous) baking powder', u'1/2 cup (1 stick) chilled unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u'2 tablespoons whipping cream', u'1 large egg yolk', u'Fresh mint sprigs'], 'preperation steps': [u'Combine cream and saffron in custard cup. Spoon ice cream into container; cover and freeze until firm, at least 6 hours and up to 3 days.', u'Bring milk to simmer in heavy medium saucepan. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 30 min Start to finish: 6 1/4 hr (includes cooling and chilling)', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'71%', 'ingredient list': [u'7 1/2 oz shortbread cookies such as Lorna Doone, finely ground (2 cups)', u'1 1/4 cups sweetened flaked coconut (3 oz)', u'1/2 stick (1/4 cup) unsalted butter, melted', u'1 cup whole milk', u'5 tablespoons cornstarch', u'1 cup heavy cream', u'1 cup well-stirred canned cream of coconut (not coconut milk) such as Coco L\xf3pez', u'2 large eggs, lightly beaten', u'1/2 teaspoon coconut extract', u'1 cup chilled heavy cream', u'1/4 cup sour cream', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'Special equipment: a 9-inch round fluted tart pan (1 inch deep) with removable bottom'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F.', u'Pulse cookie crumbs, coconut, and butter in a food processor until coconut is finely ground, then press evenly onto bottom and up side of tart pan. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 1/4 hr Start to finish: 6 3/4 hr (includes chilling pastry and cooling pie)', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'72%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 1/2 sticks (3/4 cup) plus 3 tablespoons cold unsalted butter', u'4 to 6 tablespoons ice water', u'5 large eggs', u'3/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons sugar', u'2 cups whole milk', u'1/2 cup half-and-half', u'1 teaspoon vanilla', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 cup sweetened flaked coconut', u'1/2 cup fresh coconut shavings (cut with a vegetable peeler from a shelled coconut) or sweetened flaked coconut', u'1 cup chilled heavy cream', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon vanilla', u'Special equipment: pie weights or raw rice'], 'preperation steps': [u'Whisk together flour and salt in a large bowl. Cut 6 tablespoons butter into 1/2-inch cubes, then blend into flour with your fingertips or a pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse meal. Cut another 6 tablespoons butter into 1/2-inch cubes, then blend into flour in same manner until mixture has small (roughly pea-size) butter lumps.', u"Drizzle evenly with 4 tablespoons ice water and gently stir with a fork until incorporated. Squeeze a small handful: If it doesn't hold together, add more ice water, 1/2 tablespoon at a time, stirring until just incorporated, then test again. (Do not overwork mixture, or pastry will be tough.) Gather dough into a ball in bowl, then flatten into a 5-inch square on a sheet of wax paper. Wrap dough in wax paper and chill 30 minutes.", u'Cut remaining 3 tablespoons butter into very thin slices. Roll out dough on a floured surface with a floured rolling pin into a 13- by 11-inch rectangle (1/3 inch thick). Arrange dough with a short side nearest you and place butter slices evenly over dough, then fold dough into thirds like a letter: bottom third up and top third down over dough.', u'Turn dough so a short side is nearest you and roll dough into a 13- by 11-inch rectangle (1/3 inch thick) again, then fold dough into thirds like a letter once more. Brush off any excess flour, then wrap dough in wax paper and chill at least 3 hours.', u'Preheat oven to 375\xb0F.', u'Roll out dough on floured surface with floured rolling pin to a rough 16-inch square, then fit into a 10-inch (6-cup) glass pie plate. Trim excess dough, leaving a 1-inch overhang, then fold overhang under to form a rim (baked crust will not hold a crimp). Line pie shell with foil and fill with pie weights. Bake in middle of oven until edge of pastry is set and pale golden, 17 to 20 minutes.', u'Carefully remove foil and weights, then prick bottom and side of pie shell all over with a fork. Bake, pricking again if any large air pockets form, until pie shell is golden all over, about 15 minutes more. (Leave oven on.)', u'Beat eggs in a large bowl with an electric mixer at medium speed until combined well. Beat in sugar, milk, half-and-half, vanilla, and salt, then stir in flaked coconut.', u'Pour custard into hot pie shell and cover edge of pie with a pie shield or foil (to prevent overbrowning). Bake in middle of oven until custard is set 2 inches from edge but still jiggles slightly in center, 30 to 40 minutes. (Leave oven on.) Cool pie completely on a rack, about 1 1/2 hours.', u'Reduce oven temperature to 350\xb0F.', u'Spread coconut shavings in a shallow baking pan and bake in middle of oven, stirring once, until pale golden, about 5 minutes (watch carefully, since coconut burns easily). Cool in pan on rack.', u'Just before serving, beat cream with sugar and vanilla in a bowl with cleaned beaters at medium speed until it just holds soft peaks. Spread cream over pie and sprinkle with toasted coconut.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/coconut-custard-pie-107769', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 to 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Coconut Custard Pie', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Don\'t let the good looks of this eight-layer beauty fool you; it\'s easy to make. Bake 4 cakes (we used 9" round metal cake pans, but disposable ones work fine), then slice each in half. Finish with toasted coconut, a knockout garnish that\'s also forgiving\u2014 it\'ll mask a less-than-perfect frosting job.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'73%', 'ingredient list': [u'Nonstick vegetable oil spray', u'2 3/4 cups cake flour plus more for pans', u'2 1/2 cups unsweetened shredded coconut (not reduced-fat)', u'1 tablespoon baking powder', u'2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'2 3/4 cups sugar', u'1 cup (2 sticks) unsalted butter, room temperature', u'5 large eggs', u'1/2 cup coconut oil, warmed to melt', u'1 cup buttermilk', u'4 cups unsweetened coconut chips', u'2 8-ounce packages cream cheese, room temperature', u'1 1/2 cups (3 sticks) unsalted butter, room temperature', u'1 1/2 tablespoons plus 1/4 cup Southern Comfort', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'5 cups powdered sugar', u'Ingredient info: Unsweetened shredded coconut, coconut oil, and unsweetened coconut chips can be found at some supermarkets and at natural foods stores.'], 'preperation steps': [u'Arrange racks in top and bottom thirds of oven; preheat to 350\xb0F. Coat cake pans with nonstick spray; dust with flour. Whisk 2 3/4 cups flour and next 3 ingredients in a medium bowl. Using an electric mixer, beat sugar and butter at medium speed, occasionally scraping down sides of bowl, until smooth, 3-4 minutes. Add eggs one at a time, beating to blend between additions. Beat until light and fluffy, 2-3 minutes. Gradually beat in oil. Beat in dry ingredients at low speed in 3 additions, alternating with buttermilk in 2 additions, beginning and ending with dry ingredients. Divide among four 9" cake pans (about 2 generous cups batter per pan); smooth tops with a spatula.', u'Bake until a tester inserted into center of cakes comes out clean, 22-27 minutes. Transfer pans to wire racks; let cool in pans for 5 minutes. Invert cakes onto racks, remove pans, and let cakes cool completely.', u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F. Place coconut chips in a single layer on a rimmed baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Toast until some of the chips are golden brown (some will remain white), 5-7 minutes; let cool completely. DO AHEAD: Can be made 3 days ahead. Store airtight at room temperature.', u'Using an electric mixer, beat cream cheese and butter on high speed, occasionally scraping down sides of bowl, until smooth and creamy, 2-3 minutes. Add 1 1/2 tablespoons Southern Comfort and salt; beat to blend, about 1 minute longer. Add sugar; beat on low speed to blend. Increase speed to high; beat until fluffy, 5-6 minutes.', u'Using a long serrated knife, cut each cake in half horizontally. Place 1 layer, cut side up, on a cake stand or plate. Lightly brush with about 1/2 tablespoon of Southern Comfort. Spread 1/2 cup frosting over. Repeat with remaining 7 layers, Southern Comfort, and frosting. Chill cake for 30 minutes. Leave remaining frosting at room temperature.', u'Cover sides of chilled cake with frosting. Cover cake loosely with foil and chill overnight. DO AHEAD: Can be made 2 days ahead. Keep chilled. Let cake stand at room temperature for at least 30 minutes.', u'Gently pat handfuls of toasted coconut chips over sides and top of cake and serve.'], 'chef': u'Martha Hall Foose', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/coconut-southern-comfort-layer-cake-388659', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 16 to 20 servings ', 'recipe title': u'Coconut Southern Comfort Layer Cake', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 40 min Start to finish: 1 3/4 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'94%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 lb ripe tomatoes, peeled and quartered', u'2 to 4 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped scallion greens', u'2 teaspoons finely grated fresh lemon zest', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'Pinch of dried thyme, crumbled', u'Pinch of dried marjoram, crumbled', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'1 cup sour cream', u'Garnish: fresh parsley leaves'], 'preperation steps': [u'Pur\xe9e tomatoes in batches in a blender until smooth, then force pur\xe9e through a sieve into a large bowl, discarding seeds. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Hot pepper jelly is an unexpected taste that picks up the sweetness of the corn and cornmeal.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'86%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour', u'3/4 cup yellow cornmeal', u'3/4 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'2 cups whole milk', u'3 large eggs', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted, plus additional for brushing skillet', u'3 1/3 cups whole-milk or part-skim ricotta (30 oz)', u'1 (6-oz) piece Black Forest or Virginia ham, cut into 1/4-inch dice', u'1 large egg, lightly beaten', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon coarsely ground black pepper', u'1/4 cup hot pepper jelly', u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'6 scallions, thinly sliced and white and pale green parts reserved separately from greens', u'2 cups corn (from 4 ears)', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper'], 'preperation steps': [u'Blend flour, cornmeal, cumin, salt, milk, eggs, and 2 tablespoons butter in a blender until smooth. Stir batter, then, holding skillet off heat, pour in 1/3 cup batter, immediately tilting and rotating skillet to coat bottom. (If batter sets before skillet is coated, reduce heat slightly for next cr\xeape.) Return skillet to heat and cook until just set and pale golden around edges, 10 to 15 seconds. Loosen edge of cr\xeape with a heatproof silicone spatula, then flip cr\xeape over carefully with your fingertips. Cook until underside is set, about 20 seconds more, and transfer cr\xeape to a plate. Make 11 more cr\xeapes in same manner, brushing skillet lightly with butter for each and stacking cr\xeapes on plate as cooked.', u'Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 375\xb0F. Lightly butter a 13- by 9-inch (or 15- by 10-inch) shallow baking dish.', u'Stir together ricotta, ham, egg, salt, and pepper. Put 1 cr\xeape, paler side up, on a work surface and spread 1 teaspoon pepper jelly in a horizontal line just below center of cr\xeape (toward end nearest you), leaving a 1-inch border on each side. Spoon 1/3 cup ricotta filling over jelly and fold in sides of cr\xeape over filling, then, beginning at bottom, roll up to enclose filling. Arrange cr\xeape, seam side down, in baking dish. Assemble 11 more cr\xeapes in same manner, arranging them in 1 layer in baking dish.', u'Bake, covered with foil, until filling is hot, about 30 minutes.', u'Melt butter in 10-inch skillet over moderate heat until foam subsides, then cook white and pale green scallions, stirring, until softened, about 2 minutes. Spoon topping over cr\xeapes.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/cornmeal-crepes-with-ricotta-and-ham-109667', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Cornmeal Crepes with Ricotta and Ham', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Add broth 1/4 cup at a time, stirring, to avoid sogginess.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: 330 calories, 33g carbohyrdates, 12g protein, 18g fat, 40mg cholesterol\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Other', 'recommendation': u'50%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 cups each 1-inch cubed French bread and prepared cornbread', u'4 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 tablespoon dried thyme', u'1 pound well-spiced turkey or sweet Italian pork sausage, bulk or links (casings removed), broken into clumps', u'1 cup chopped red onions', u'1 cup chopped celery', u'1 tablespoon finely minced garlic', u'2 teaspoons dried sage leaves, crumbled', u'3/4 cup dried cranberries', u'3/4 cup chopped pecans', u'1/2 cup pitted prunes, quartered', u'1 cup defatted chicken broth'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'You can use either Chinese or Japanese eggplants for this recipe; both varieties have purple skin, a long, slender shape, and small seeds.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'79%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 lb Asian eggplants (about 6), cut crosswise into 1/3-inch-thick rounds', u'1 3/4 teaspoons salt', u'1 large garlic clove, chopped', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped peeled fresh ginger', u'2 teaspoons chopped fresh jalape\xf1o chile including seeds', u'1 teaspoon yellow or brown mustard seeds', u'1 teaspoon cumin seeds', u'1/2 teaspoon turmeric', u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 large onion, halved lengthwise and thinly sliced lengthwise', u'1 (3-inch) cinnamon stick', u'3/4 cup water', u'1 tablespoon packed brown sugar', u'3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', u'1/4 cup roasted cashews (1 1/4 oz), chopped', u'Accompaniment: steamed basmati or jasmine rice'], 'preperation steps': [u'Toss eggplant with 1 teaspoon salt in a colander set over a bowl, then let drain 30 minutes. Rinse eggplant, then drain, pressing gently on eggplant to extract any excess liquid.', u'While eggplant drains, mash garlic, ginger, and jalape\xf1o to a paste with 1/2 teaspoon salt using a mortar and pestle (or mince and mash with a large heavy knife and transfer to a cup), then stir in mustard and cumin seeds and turmeric.', u'Heat oil in a 5-quart heavy pot over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then saut\xe9 onion, stirring occasionally, until softened and golden, 8 to 10 minutes. Add spice paste and cinnamon stick, then reduce heat to moderate and cook, stirring, 1 minute.', u'Add eggplant and cook, stirring, until it begins to soften, about 3 minutes. Stir in water, brown sugar, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and simmer, covered, stirring occasionally, until eggplant is tender but not falling apart, 20 to 25 minutes. Season eggplant with additional salt.', u'Discard cinnamon stick and serve eggplant sprinkled with cilantro and cashews.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/curried-eggplant-109738', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 side-dish or 4 main-course servings', 'recipe title': u'Curried Eggplant', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Roasting the pancetta in one large piece renders out most of the fat, making it easy to dice into perfect 1/4" pieces.', 'rating': u'1/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 medium delicata squash (about 1 1/2 pounds total)', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'Kosher salt, freshly ground pepper', u'6 ounces pancetta (unsliced; about a 1"-thick piece)', u'12 ounces bucatini or spaghetti', u'5 large egg yolks', u'2 teaspoons finely grated lemon zest', u'Pecorino (for serving)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0. Halve squash lengthwise, scrape out seeds, and slice crosswise into 1/4"-thick half-moons. Toss with oil in a large bowl; season with salt and pepper.', u"Arrange squash slices on a wire rack set inside a large rimmed baking sheet; place pancetta on rack next to squash. Roast until squash is tender, hasn't taken any color, and still holds its shape, and pancetta is browned all over (when pressed, it should feel like a well-done steak), 30-35 minutes. Transfer squash to a platter; set aside.", u'Let pancetta cool slightly, then cut into 1/4" pieces. Pour any rendered fat in baking sheet into a large skillet. Add pancetta and cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until crisp, about 4 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer pancetta to a small bowl. Reserve skillet with drippings.', u'Meanwhile, cook pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water, stirring occasionally, until al dente. Drain, reserving 1 cup pasta cooking liquid.', u'Add pasta to reserved skillet along with 1/2 cup pasta cooking liquid and toss to coat, scraping up any browned bits stuck to the bottom of the skillet with a wooden spoon.', u'Lightly beat egg yolks and lemon zest in a large bowl just to combine. Working quickly, add hot pasta to egg mixture and toss vigorously with tongs until a thick, glossy sauce forms, about 4 minutes. (If sauce still looks watery, keep tossing.)', u'Add pancetta and reserved squash to pasta, season with salt and pepper, and toss everything together.', u'Shave Pecorino over pasta and top with more pepper just before serving.'], 'chef': u'es Thompson, SHED Restaurant, Healdsburg', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/delicata-squash-carbonara-51263760', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'6 Servings', 'recipe title': u'Delicata Squash Carbonara', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This Derby-ready julep doubles down on the mint flavor with a bright Mint Simple Syrup and fresh mint leaves. The julep cup is essential to the presentation. This recipe yields about 1 1/4 cups mint simple syrup, enough for 30 cocktails. You can also use it to make a refreshing non-alcoholic drink\u2014add a few tablespoons to club soda and serve over ice.', 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'15 mint sprigs (1 bunch)', u'1 cup raw sugar', u'3 large fresh mint leaves, plus 3 mint sprigs for garnish', u'2 cups crushed ice, divided', u'1 1/2 ounces 100-proof bourbon (such as Four Roses), divided', u'12-ounce julep cup'], 'preperation steps': [u'Combine mint, sugar, and 1 cup water in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, 5 minutes. Let cool to room temperature. Using a fine-mesh sieve or a colander lined with cheesecloth, strain mixture into a heatproof container and chill at least 25 minutes.', u'Using your hands, lightly slap mint leaves, being careful not to bruise them, and place in a julep cup. Add 1/3 cup ice, then 2 tsp. Mint Simple Syrup. Pack another 1/3 cup ice on top. Add 1 oz. bourbon and stir. Add another 1/3 cup ice and remaining 1/2 oz. bourbon. Top with remaining 1 cup ice, tightly packing into a dome. Insert a straw into ice and garnish with mint sprigs.', u'The Mint Simple Syrup can be made up to 5 days in advance and stored in the refrigerator.'], 'chef': u'my Werner', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/derby-mint-julep-56389507', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'1 cocktail', 'recipe title': u'Derby Mint Julep', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"We wanted to give this savory starter a modern look for the photograph, so we cut away the curved edges of the celery to make flat pieces. If you're short on time, it looks just as nice with the edges left on. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"'80S THE COSBY SHOW", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'89%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 oz dried ancho chiles (4 large), stemmed and seeded', u'6 large garlic cloves, 3 of them finely chopped', u'1 tablespoon salt, or to taste', u'1 1/2 tablespoons ground cumin', u'1 1/2 tablespoons chili powder (not pure chile)', u'4 lb well-marbled beef brisket or boneless chuck, trimmed and cut into 1 1/2- to 2-inch pieces', u'3 to 4 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 (28- to 32-oz) can whole tomatoes in juice', u'1/4 cup canned chipotle chiles in adobo', u'1/2 cup coarsely chopped fresh cilantro', u'1 1/2 lb white onions, chopped (4 cups)', u'1 tablespoon dried oregano (preferably Mexican), crumbled', u'1 to 4 fresh serrano or other small green chiles, finely chopped, including seeds (1 is fine for most tastes; 4 is the eight-alarm version)', u'1 (12-oz) bottle beer (not dark)', u'2 cups water', u'2 1/2 cups cooked pinto beans (optional; 30 oz), rinsed if canned', u'Accompaniments: cubed avocado; chopped white onion; shredded Cheddar; chopped fresh cilantro; sour cream'], 'preperation steps': [u'Soak ancho chiles in hot water to cover until softened, about 30 minutes. Pat beef dry and toss with spice mixture in a large bowl until coated.', u'Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a wide 6- to 7-quart heavy pot over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then brown beef in 3 or 4 batches, without crowding, turning occasionally, about 5 minutes per batch (lower heat as needed; spice mixture burns easily). Transfer beef as browned to another bowl. (Do not clean pot.)', u'Pur\xe9e anchos in a blender along with tomatoes (including juice), chipotles in adobo, cilantro, remaining 2 whole garlic cloves, and remaining 1/2 tablespoon salt until smooth.', u'Add enough oil to fat in pot to total 3 tablespoons, then cook onions and chopped garlic over moderate heat, stirring and scraping up brown bits from beef, until softened, 8 to 10 minutes. Add oregano, remaining tablespoon cumin, and remaining tablespoon chili powder and cook, stirring, 2 minutes. Add chile pur\xe9e and 1 chopped serrano and simmer, stirring, 5 minutes. Stir in beer, water, and beef along with any juices accumulated in bowl and gently simmer, partially covered, stirring occasionally and checking often to make sure chili is not scorching, 2 hours.', u'Taste sauce, then add more serrano if desired and continue to simmer, partially covered, until beef is very tender and sauce is slightly thickened, 1 to 2 hours more. (If chili becomes very thick before meat is tender, thin with water as needed.)', u'Coarsely shred meat (still in pot) with 2 forks and cool chili completely, uncovered, then chill, covered, 1 to 2 days to allow flavors to develop.', u'Reheat over low heat, partially covered, stirring occasionally, until hot, about 30 minutes. Add beans (if using) and simmer, stirring, 5 minutes.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/ding-dong-eight-alarm-chili-108488', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Ding Dong Eight-Alarm Chili', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 15 min Start to finish: 2 3/4 hr (includes cooling)', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Each serving with 2 tablespoons low-fat sour cream contains about 429 calories and 4 grams fat (without sour cream: 384 calories and 1 gram fat).\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Bon App\xe9tit', 'recommendation': u'67%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 navel or juice orange', u'1 1/2 cups dry white wine', u'2/3 cup sugar', u'2 cups water', u'1 vanilla bean, halved lengthwise', u'1/2 lb dried figs (preferably Calimyrna; about 1 cup)', u'1/2 lb dried apricots (about 1 1/3 cups)', u'1/2 lb pitted prunes (about 1 1/4 cups)', u'Accompaniment: lightly sweetened low-fat sour cream (optional)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Peel zest in long strips from half of orange with a vegetable peeler and trim any white pith from zest. Scrape seeds from vanilla bean with a sharp knife into wine mixture, reserving pod for another use. Bring mixture to a boil, stirring until sugar is dissolved, then continue to boil, uncovered, until reducedto about 3 cups, about 10 minutes.', u'While syrup is boiling, cut off and discard fig stems and halve figs lengthwise. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Wheatmeal crackers (sometimes called digestive biscuits) have a flavor similar to graham crackers. For this particular recipe, we prefer Carr\'s brand wheatmeal crackers, which are available at supermarkets and labeled as "whole wheat crackers." Chill, covered, at least 6 hours.', u'Heat all glaze ingredients in a double boiler or a small metal bowl set over a saucepan of barely simmering water, stirring until smooth, then pour over cheesecake, tilting baking pan to coat top evenly. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'EFFORT: NOT MUCH PREP TIME: 15 MINUTES COOK TIME: 6 HOURS KEEPS ON WARM: 1 HOUR', 'rating': u'1/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 tablespoons Italian-seasoned tomato paste', u'3 tablespoons full-bodied red wine, such as a California Zinfandel', u'2 teaspoons Red wine vinegar', u'1 1/4 pounds lean ground beef, preferably 93% lean', u'3 ounces (about 3/4 cup) provolone cheese, finely shredded', u'1/3 cup uncooked long-grain white rice', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u'3/4 teaspoon dried thyme', u'1/2 teaspoon crushed fennel seeds'], 'preperation steps': [u'1 Whisk the tomato paste, wine, and vinegar in a shallow bowl.', u'2 Mix the ground beef, cheese, rice, oregano, thyme, and fennel seeds in a large bowl until the cheese and seasonings are evenly distributed throughout the ground beef.', u'3 Form the mixture into balls, using about 1/3 cup for each fairly large meatball. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"This starter, from Colby Garrelts, chef and co-owner of Bluestem in Kansas City, Missouri, is ideal for any summer get-together. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Vignarola', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'63%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 cups shelled fresh fava beans (2 1/2 lb in pods) or shelled edamame (fresh soybeans)', u'2 lemons, halved', u'4 large artichokes (3/4 lb each)', u'2 oz guanciale (smoked pork jowl)* or pancetta, cut into 1/8-inch-thick matchsticks (1/2 cup)', u'2 cups thinly sliced onion', u'5 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 cups fresh or frozen peas (not thawed)', u'2 teaspoons finely chopped fresh oregano', u'2 cups water', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon black pepper', u'1/2 teaspoon fresh lemon juice, or to taste'], 'preperation steps': [u"Blanch beans in a 2-quart pot of boiling water 1 minute, then drain in a sieve and immediately transfer to a bowl of ice and cold water to stop cooking. Gently peel off skins (it's not necessary to peel edamame, if using).", u'Fill a large bowl with 4 cups cold water and squeeze juice from 2 lemon halves into bowl.', u'Cut off stem of 1 artichoke and reserve. Cut off top inch of artichoke with a serrated knife. Bend back outer leaves until they snap off close to base, then discard several more layers of leaves in same manner until you reach pale yellow leaves with pale green tips.', u'Cut remaining leaves flush with top of artichoke bottom using a paring knife, then quarter bottom. Cut out fuzzy choke and purple leaves with paring knife. Trim dark green fibrous parts from base and side of artichoke, then rub cut surfaces with a remaining lemon half and put artichoke bottom in bowl of acidulated water.', u"Trim 1/4 inch from end of reserved stem to expose inner core, then trim sides of stem down to pale inner core (don't worry if remaining stem is very thin). Rub cut surfaces with lemon half and put in bowl of acidulated water. Trim remaining artichokes, including stems, in same manner.", u'Drain artichokes and cut crosswise into 1/4-inch-thick slices, including stems. Cook guanciale and onion in oil in a 5-quart heavy pot over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until onion is softened, about 6 minutes. Add sliced artichokes, fava beans, and remaining ingredients and simmer, covered, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are tender, about 45 minutes.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/fava-bean-pea-and-artichoke-stew-107806', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 main-course servings', 'recipe title': u'Fava Bean, Pea, and Artichoke Stew', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 30 min Start to finish: 1 1/4 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'77%', 'ingredient list': [u'5 oz feta, patted dry if wet, then crumbled', u'1/4 cup walnuts, toasted and finely chopped', u'3/4 teaspoon dried Aleppo chile flakes', u'9 (17- by 12-inch) phyllo sheets (preferably spelt phyllo)', u'1 1/2 sticks (3/4 cup) unsalted butter, melted'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F.', u'Blend feta, walnuts, Aleppo flakes, and a pinch of salt in a food processor until a ball begins to form. Place a feta log in center of phyllo sheet parallel to short end. Fold phyllo in half, enclosing log, and brush with butter. Starting at end with log, roll up pastry to resemble a cigar.', u'Transfer, seam side down, to a lightly buttered baking sheet, then make 26 more rolls in same manner.', u'Brush rolls with some butter and bake in middle of oven until golden, about 25 minutes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 30 min Start to finish: 1 1/4 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 frozen puff pastry sheet (from a 17 1/4-oz package), thawed', u'26 firm-ripe fresh figs (1 1/2 lb)', u'1 cup mascarpone cheese (8 1/2 oz)', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped crystallized ginger, or to taste', u'2 1/2 tablespoons sugar', u'3/4 teaspoon vanilla', u'Confectioners sugar for dusting'], 'preperation steps': [u'Roll out pastry with a floured rolling pin on a lightly floured surface into a 15- by 12-inch rectangle (3/4 inch thick) and trim edges. Arrange rectangles in 1 layer on 2 large baking sheets and chill 20 minutes.', u'Preheat oven to 400\xb0F.', u'While pastry is chilling, trim and chop 4 figs and stir together with mascarpone, ginger, sugar, and vanilla. Chill filling, covered.', u"Cover pastry rectangles on 1 baking sheet with an inverted large metal cooling rack to lightly weight them, then bake in upper third of oven until golden and cooked through, 15 to 18 minutes. Remove rack carefully and transfer baked pastry to another rack to cool completely. Bake remaining rectangles, weighted with rack (make sure it's cooled), in same manner.", u'While pastry is baking, cut remaining figs lengthwise into 1/4-inch-thick slices.', u'Spread filling over 7 pastry rectangles and top with half of sliced figs, overlapping them. Dust with confectioners sugar.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/fig-and-gingered-mascarpone-napoleons-105433', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 7 napoleons', 'recipe title': u'Fig and Gingered Mascarpone Napoleons', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 3/4 hr Start to finish: 4 1/4 hr (includes making stock and rouille)', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'90%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 large leek, green part coarsely chopped and white part cut into 1/4-inch pieces', u'5 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 medium onion, coarsely chopped', u'2 celery ribs, coarsely chopped', u'2 carrots, coarsely chopped', u'3 garlic cloves, smashed', u'1/4 teaspoon crumbled saffron threads', u'2 bay leaves (not California)', u'1 teaspoon dried hot red pepper flakes', u'1 1/4 lb plum tomatoes, coarsely chopped', u'3 tablespoons canned tomato pur\xe9e', u'2 cups dry white wine', u'1 1/2 qt white fish stock', u'1 (8- to 9-inch) unsliced round or oval pain au levain or sourdough loaf (1 lb), crust discarded', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1 lb skinned white fish fillets such as halibut, snapper, and/or bass, cut into 1-inch cubes', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'2 cups rouille', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh oregano', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley'], 'preperation steps': [u'Wash green and white parts of leek separately in a bowl of cold water, then lift out with a slotted spoon and pat dry. Heat 3 tablespoons oil in a 6-quart heavy pot over moderate heat until hot but not smoking, then cook leek greens, onion, celery, and carrots, stirring, until beginning to soften, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook, stirring, 3 minutes. Add saffron, bay leaves, and red pepper flakes and cook, stirring, 2 minutes. Add fresh tomatoes and tomato pur\xe9e and cook, stirring, 4 minutes. Add wine and simmer, uncovered, until liquid is reduced by about half, about 30 minutes.', u'Stir in stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, 30 minutes. Carefully pour through a fine sieve into a bowl, then discard solids.', u'Preheat oven to 300\xb0F.', u'Heat a well-seasoned ridged grill pan over moderately high heat until hot. Brush bread with remaining 2 tablespoons oil, then grill on all sides until grill marks appear. Tear bread into rough 3-inch pieces and bake on a baking sheet in middle of oven until crisp outside but soft inside, about 10 minutes. Cool cro\xfbtes.', u'Heat butter in a 4-quart heavy saucepan over moderate heat until foam subsides, then cook white part of leek, stirring, until beginning to soften, about 2 minutes. Add fish, hot broth, and salt and bring to a simmer (fish will be cooked through). Remove from heat and stir in 1/2 cup rouille.', u'Put cro\xfbtes in soup plates and ladle soup over. Sprinkle with oregano and parsley and serve remaining rouille on the side.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/fish-soup-with-bread-and-rouille-105642', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Fish Soup with Bread and Rouille', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Rajas is the Spanish word for "strips," and in the Mexican kitchen it generally refers to strips of chile.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'60%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 lb fresh poblano chiles', u'1 1/2 lb white onions, halved lengthwise, then sliced lengthwise 1/4 inch thick', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'3 tablespoons safflower oil', u'1 lb banana leaves*, thawed if frozen', u'8 (6-oz) pieces skinless snapper or halibut fillet', u'1 cup crema (thick Mexican cream) or cr\xe8me fra\xeeche plus additional for drizzling if desired', u'Garnish: fresh cilantro leaves'], 'preperation steps': [u'Roast chiles on racks of gas burners over high heat, turning with tongs, until skins are blackened, 10 to 12 minutes. (Or broil chiles on a broiler pan about 5 inches from heat, turning occasionally, about 15 minutes.) Transfer to a large bowl and cover tightly with plastic wrap, then let stand 20 minutes.', u'When cool enough to handle, peel chiles, discarding stems and seeds (do not rinse under running water as this washes away flavor), and cut lengthwise into 1/4-inch-thick strips.', u'Cook onions with salt in oil in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderate heat, stirring, until onions are tender but still have texture, about 10 minutes. Stir in chiles and cook, stirring, 1 minute, then season with salt.', u'Preheat oven to 450\xb0F.', u'Unfold banana leaves. Cut off (and reserve) tough center rib that runs along bottom edge of each leaf with kitchen shears. Cut ribs into 12- to 14-inch strips for tying packets. Gently cut leaves into 8 (12-inch) squares, being careful not to split them.', u'Slowly run a banana-leaf square across flame of a gas burner, just enough to "melt" outer coating on leaf (it will become quite shiny; if you have an electric stove, hold leaf slightly above burner on moderately high). Place a piece of fish in center of square and season with salt, then top with 1/2 cup rajas and 2 tablespoons crema. Fold 2 sides of banana leaf over fish to enclose it, then fold in opposite sides to form a packet. Tie packet with a strip of banana-leaf rib and transfer to a large baking sheet. Assemble 7 more packets in same manner.', u'Bake fish packets in middle of oven 20 minutes, then transfer each to a large plate or shallow soup bowl. Cut ties of packets and open them (leaves are not edible). Drizzle fish with additional crema.', u'Available at Latino and Asian markets.'], 'chef': u'f Claire Archibald', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/fish-wrapped-in-banana-leaves-with-chile-rajas-and-crema-107200', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Fish Wrapped in Banana Leaves with Chile Rajas and Crema', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Though these 1/4-cup dessert portions may seem small, you wouldn't want them any larger \u2014 they're extremely rich.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 envelope unflavored gelatin (about 1 tablespoon)', u'1/2 cup sweet Sherry or brandy', u'2 cups plus 2 tablespoons heavy cream', u'1/3 cup sugar', u'1 teaspoon finely grated fresh lemon zest', u'Garnish: fresh raspberries'], 'preperation steps': [u'Sprinkle gelatin over Sherry in a small bowl to soften. Heat cream, sugar, and zest, stirring until sugar is dissolved, and remove from heat. Stir in gelatin mixture until dissolved. Pour through a fine sieve into a large glass measure and pour into 8 (1/4-cup) molds. Cool flummeries completely and chill, covered, 6 hours. To unmold flummeries, dip molds, 1 at a time, into a bowl of hot water 2 seconds and gently pull edges away from molds with your fingertips. Invert desserts onto plates.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/flummeries-103205', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Flummeries', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Served warm or at room temperature, a frittata makes for an easy yet impressive dinner. If you are following our $68 Dinner Story, buy 1 bunch asparagus and use 3/4 bunch for the Fettuccine with Asparagus, Beet Green Pesto, and Poached Egg and the remaining 1/4 bunch here. This is the perfect opportunity to use up any leftover beet green pesto from the pasta dish as well.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 teaspoons fennel seeds', u'1/2 pound ground pork', u'3 tablespoons plus 1 teaspoon olive oil, divided', u'1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt, divided, plus more', u'3/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, divided, plus more', u'1/2 medium onion, thinly sliced', u'2 garlic cloves, finely chopped', u'4 ounces asparagus (about 4 medium spears), trimmed and cut diagonally into 1-inch pieces', u'8 large eggs', u'1/4 cup grated Parmesan', u'3 tablespoons heavy cream', u'1/4 cup beet green pesto (see headnote) or 1 tablespoon finely chopped herbs plus 2 tablespoons olive oil'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F. Heat a 10" ovenproof skillet over medium-high. Add fennel seeds and toast, stirring constantly, until fragrant, 1 minute. Add pork, 1 tsp. oil, 1/2 tsp. salt, and 1/4 tsp. pepper and cook, breaking up pieces with a wooden spoon or spatula, until browned and cooked through, about 5 minutes more. Scrape pork mixture into a medium bowl.', u'Heat 1 Tbsp. oil in same skillet over medium. Add onion, 1/4 tsp. salt, and 1/4 tsp. pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, 1 minute. Add asparagus and cook, stirring occasionally, until crisp-tender and bright green, 3\u20135 minutes more. Add vegetable mixture to pork mixture, stir to combine, and let cool slightly. Wipe out skillet and reserve.', u'Meanwhile, whisk eggs, Parmesan, cream, 3/4 tsp. salt, and 1/4 tsp. pepper in a large bowl. Add pork and vegetable mixture and stir until well combined.', u'Heat 2 Tbsp. oil in reserved skillet over medium. Add egg mixture and cook, without stirring, until edges have started to set and pull away from pan, about 7 minutes. Transfer frittata to oven and bake until set, 10\u201312 minutes.', u'Season with salt and pepper, cut into wedges, and drizzle with leftover beet green pesto, if using, or herbed oil. Serve warm or at room temperature.'], 'chef': u' Epicurious Test Kitchen', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/frittata-with-fennel-spiced-pork-and-asparagus-56389495', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 4\u20136 ', 'recipe title': u'Frittata with Fennel-Spiced Pork and Asparagus', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 15 min Start to finish: 1 1/4 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'82%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 lb small (2 1/2-inch) Gala, Empire, or Golden Delicious apples', u'1 1/2 lb firm-ripe Seckel (9), Forelle (6), or Bartlett (3) pears', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1/2 cup Calvados or Cognac', u'5 tablespoons packed light brown sugar', u'24 dried apricots (preferably California; 5 oz)', u'18 pitted prunes (dried plums; 7 oz)', u'6 (2- by 1/4-inch) strips fresh lemon zest', u'1 cup mascarpone cheese* (8 oz)', u'2 tablespoons confectioners sugar', u'Special equipment: a melon-ball cutter'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 400\xb0F.', u'Halve apples lengthwise (quarter if large), leaving stem intact, and core halves with melon-ball cutter. Halve Seckel and Forelle pears or quarter Bartletts lengthwise, then core with melon-ball cutter and trim root ends.', u'Melt butter in a 14- by 9-inch oval gratin dish or other 2 1/2- to 3-quart shallow baking dish in middle of oven, about 2 minutes. Stir in Calvados and 3 tablespoons brown sugar, then add fresh and dried fruit and zest and turn gently to coat. Cover dish tightly with foil and bake in middle of oven, gently turning fruit and basting occasionally with juices, until apples and pears are tender but not falling apart, about 1 hour. Remove dish from oven.', u'Preheat broiler.', u'Spoon 1/3 cup baking juices from baking dish into a bowl and stir in mascarpone and remaining 2 tablespoons brown sugar. Rearrange fruit, cut sides up, in baking dish to form an even layer, if necessary, and spoon mascarpone mixture over fruit. Put confectioners sugar in a fine-mesh sieve and sift over fruit. Broil gratin 3 inches from heat until confectioners sugar is caramelized, 1 to 2 minutes.', u'Available in Italian markets and many supermarkets.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/fruit-gratin-with-calvados-and-mascarpone-107382', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Fruit Gratin with Calvados and Mascarpone', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'EFFORT: A LOT PREP TIME: 25 MINUTES COOK TIME: 1 HOUR 20 MINUTES TO 2 HOURS KEEPS ON WARM: NO', 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'8 tablespoons (1 stick) unsalted butter, cut into small bits, plus more for greasing the canister', u'9 ounces dark chocolate, chopped', u'2 ounces unsweetened chocolate, chopped', u'1 cup sugar', u'2 large eggs, at room temperature', u'2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'2/3 cup all-purpose flour, plus more for coating the canister', u'1/2 teaspoon salt'], 'preperation steps': [u'1 Generously grease the inside of the slow cooker canister by holding a small slice of butter with a paper towel and rubbing the butter all over the surfaces. Add some flour, then turn the crock this way and that to coat both the bottom and the walls with a fine, even dusting. Tap out any excess flour.', u'2 Set up a double boiler with about 1 inch of water in the bottom pan, simmering over medium heat\u2014or place a large, heat-safe metal bowl over a medium saucepan with a similar amount of simmering water. Add the butter and both chocolates. Stir with a rubber spatula until about two-thirds of the chocolate has melted. Remove the top half of the double boiler or the bowl from the saucepan below, then continue stirring off the heat until all the chocolate has melted. Cool for 10 minutes.', u'3 Meanwhile, beat the sugar, eggs, and vanilla in a large bowl with an electric mixer at medium speed until quite thick and pale yellow, up to 10 minutes.', u'4 Beat in the cooled chocolate mixture until smooth, then scrape down and remove the beaters. Fold in the flour and salt with a rubber spatula, using wide, gentle arcs to make sure every speck of flour has been moistened. Pour and spread this mixture into the slow cooker.', u'5 Lay long strips of paper towels across the top of the slow cooker, overlapping each other and hanging down the sides for stability. Set the lid in place, then cook on high for about 1 hour 20 minutes in a small (2- to 3 1/2-quart) slow cooker, about 1 hour 40 minutes in a medium (4- to 5 1/2-quart) one, or about 2 hours in a large (6- to 8-quart) model, or until the cake is firm to the touch and the edges are dry while the middle is dark and moist. Unplug, uncover, and cool in the canister for 30 minutes before cutting out slices with a nonstick-safe knife or setting a cutting board over the cooker, inverting it, and turning the cake out.'], 'chef': u'Bruce Weinstein and Mark Scarbrough', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/fudgy-brownie-cake-51220650', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves: 6 to 12', 'recipe title': u'Fudgy Brownie Cake', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'-Gazpacho can be made ahead and frozen. Defrost in the fridge overnight. -Mayonnaise is an unusual ingredient, but we like the creaminess it adds to the soup. -For 2 you will need 4 tomatoes, 1 small cucumber, and 1 small red bell pepper. For 6, you will need 12 tomatoes, 1 cucumber and 1 red pepper.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'67%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 garlic cloves', u'2 onions', u'2 1/4 oz cucumber', u'2 7/8 oz bell peppers', u'2 1/4 lb ripe tomatoes', u'1 1/4 oz white country-style bread (without crust)', u'1/2 cup water', u'1/3 cup olive oil, plus extra to serve', u'2 tbsp sherry vinegar', u'1 tbsp mayonnaise', u'4 oz croutons'], 'preperation steps': [u'Peel and cut each garlic clove in half. Remove the green shoot inside, if there is one. Fill a small saucepan with cold water and add the garlic. Bring the water to a boil. When the water begins to boil lift the garlic out of the water and into a bowl of ice water to quickly cool it. Repeat this twice, always starting with cold water in the saucepan. Peel the onion and cut in half, then cut into large chunks. Peel the cucumber. Cut in half, then into large pieces. Halve the bell peppers, then remove the seeds and white membranes. Chop the bell peppers, then aside along with the cucumber and onion. Cut the tomatoes into large wedges and put in a bowl with the onions, cucumbers, and bell peppers. Add the bread, torn into pieces, then pour over the water. Process everything together using a hand-held blender, or using a food processor. Strain the gazpacho through a fine-mesh strainer. Add the oil, vinegar, and mayonnaise, then whisk or blend the soup until smooth and creamy. Season with salt and pepper. Chill in the fridge before serving (at least 2 hours). Serve the gazpacho in soup bowls with croutons, plus an extra drizzle of olive oil.'], 'chef': u'Ferran Adri\xe0', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/gazpacho-367950', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 6', 'recipe title': u'Gazpacho', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'You\x92ll need a 7 3/4-inch-diameter trifle dish that is at least 4 3/4 inches deep. The recipe makes an extra gingerbread cake; have it for breakfast the next morning. If you prefer to make 12 individual trifles, use all three gingerbread cakes and cut each in half horizontally. Using a pretty glass as a guide, cut out 4 cake rounds from each cut cake layer. Alternate 2 cake rounds with 2 to 3 layers of the mascarpone cream, a few candied kumquats, and some poached cranberries in each glass.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'83%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 1/2 cups sugar', u'1 1/2 cups water', u'3 cups sliced seeded kumquats', u'2 cups fruity red wine (such as Syrah)', u'2 cups sugar', u'12 ounces fresh or frozen cranberries', u'1 cup extra stout (such as Guinness)', u'1 cup mild-flavored (light) molasses', u'1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda', u'2 cups all purpose flour', u'2 tablespoons ground ginger', u'1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder', u'3/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cloves', u'1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg', u'1/8 teaspoon ground cardamom', u'3 large eggs', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1/2 cup (packed) dark brown sugar', u'3/4 cup vegetable oil', u'1 tablespoon minced peeled fresh ginger', u'3 8-ounce containers mascarpone cheese* (3 cups)', u'3 cups chilled heavy whipping cream', u'1 1/2 cups powdered sugar', u'3 tablespoons Grand Marnier or other orange liqueur', u'4 teaspoons finely grated orange peel'], 'preperation steps': [u'Stir sugar and 1 1/2 cups water in large saucepan over medium heat until sugar dissolves. Increase heat and bring to boil. Add kumquats; reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until soft mixture to medium bowl. Cool. Cover and chill until cold. DO AHEAD: Can be made 5 days ahead. Keep chilled.', u'Before using, pour kumquat mixture through strainer; set kumquats aside for trifle. (Reserve syrup for another use.)', u'Stir wine and sugar in large saucepan over medium heat until sugar dissolves. Increase heat and boil wine mixture 5 minutes. Add cranberries and simmer until soft but still intact, about 5 minutes. Transfer mixture to medium bowl. Cool. Cover and chill until cold. DO AHEAD: Can be made 5 days ahead. Keep chilled.', u'Before using, pour cranberry mixture through strainer; set cranberries aside for trifle. (Reserve syrup for another use.)', u'Combine stout and molasses in large saucepan. Bring to boil over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat; stir in baking soda (mixture will foam up). Let stand until completely cool, about 1 hour.', u'Position 1 rack in top third and 1 rack in bottom third of oven and preheat to 350\xb0F. Generously butter three 8-inch-diameter cake pans with 1 1/2-inch-high sides. Dust pans with flour; tap out excess. Whisk 2 cups flour and next 6 ingredients in large bowl to blend. Whisk eggs and both sugars in medium bowl to blend. Whisk oil, then stout mixture into egg mixture. Gradually whisk stout-egg mixture into flour mixture. Stir in fresh ginger. Divide batter among prepared pans (about 12/3 cups for each).', u'Place 2 cake pans on top rack and 1 cake pan on bottom rack of oven. Bake until tester inserted into center of cakes comes out clean, reversing position of pans halfway through baking, about 28 minutes total. Cool cakes in pans on rack 15 minutes. Invert cakes onto racks; cool completely. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Wrap in plastic; store at room temperature.', u'Using electric mixer, beat mascarpone in large bowl until smooth. Add all remaining ingredients and beat until peaks form and mixture is smooth (do not overbeat or mixture may curdle). Cover and chill up to 2 hours.', u'Using serrated knife, cut each of 2 cakes in half horizontally for a total of 4 cake layers. (Reserve remaining cake for another use.) Trim 1 cake layer to 7-inch round. Place trimmed cake round in bottom of 7 3/4-inch-diameter, 43/4-inch-deep trifle dish. Scatter scant 1/2 cup drained kumquats in single layer over cake. Top with 11/3 cups mascarpone cream, spreading evenly to sides of dish. Sprinkle 1/2 cup drained cranberries over. Repeat 2 more times with cake layer, kumquats, mascarpone cream, and cranberries. Top with fourth cake layer. Spread 1 1/3 cups mascarpone cream over. Spoon remaining cream into pastry bag fitted with large star tip. Pipe rosettes of mascarpone cream around top edge of dish. Tent loosely with foil; chill at least 4 hours. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Keep chilled. Cover and chill remaining kumquats and cranberries separately.', u'Scatter remaining kumquats and cranberries over center of trifle and serve.', u'An Italian cream cheese; sold at many supermarkets and at Italian markets.'], 'chef': u'Claudia Fleming', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/gingerbread-trifle-with-candied-kumquats-and-wine-poached-cranberries-350790', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 12-16 servings', 'recipe title': u'Gingerbread Trifle with Candied Kumquats and Wine-Poached Cranberries', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'You can make the souffl\xe9s 4 hours ahead (keep at room temperature). Put in a 375\xb0F oven for 8 minutes to reheat.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'96%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 (17- by 12-inch) phyllo sheets, thawed if frozen', u'1/2 stick (1/4 cup) unsalted butter, melted', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'3/4 cup whole milk', u'2 teaspoons Dijon mustard', u'2 large eggs, separated', u'finely grated Parmigiano-Reggiano (1/2 cup)', u'5 oz soft mild goat cheese, crumbled (2/3 cup)', u'1 1/2 tablespoons cider vinegar', u'1 1/2 teaspoons Dijon mustard', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'5 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'8 oz fris\xe9e, torn into bite-size pieces (8 cups)', u'6 radishes, cut into very thin wedges', u'3 tablespoons chopped fresh chives', u'Special equipment: a muffin pan with 12 (1/2- or 1/3-cup) muffin cups'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 375\xb0F.', u'Cover stack of phyllo with 2 overlapping sheets of plastic wrap and a dampened kitchen towel.
