{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"To maximize the flavor of this salad, toss the beets with the dressing while they're still warm, so they'll absorb more of it. Sunflower seeds turn rancid fairly quickly, so it's important to purchase them from a place with high turnover, such as a natural foods store.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 1/2 lb medium golden beets (with greens)', u'1/2 cup raw (not roasted) sunflower seeds (2 1/4 oz)', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped shallot', u'2 1/2 tablespoons cider vinegar', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'1/4 teaspoon sugar', u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'6 oz sunflower sprouts or baby mesclun (6 cups)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Put oven racks in lower third and middle of oven and preheat oven to 425\xb0F.', u'Trim beet greens, leaving 1 inch of stems attached. Tightly wrap beets together in double layers of foil to make packages (2 or 3 per package) and roast in middle of oven until tender, 40 to 45 minutes. Unwrap beets and cool slightly.', u'While beets roast, toast sunflower seeds in a pie plate or a small baking pan in lower third of oven, shaking occasionally, until seeds are golden, about 10 minutes.', u'Whisk together shallot, vinegar, salt, pepper, and sugar in a small bowl, then add oil in a stream, whisking.', u'When beets are cool enough to handle, slip off and discard skins. Cut beets lengthwise into 1/4-inch-thick slices and gently toss with 3 tablespoons vinaigrette in a bowl.', u'Toss sunflower sprouts and half of sunflower seeds with remaining vinaigrette in another bowl. Arrange beets on 6 salad plates and top with dressed sprouts. Sprinkle salads with remaining sunflower seeds.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/golden-beet-and-sunflower-salad-109626', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Golden Beet and Sunflower Salad', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'These beautiful, gossamer soft rolls make the perfect complement to any dinner. Mashed sweet potato is responsible for the moist texture and gorgeous color.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'43%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/2 small (about 4 ounces/112 grams) orange-fleshed sweet potato (also called yam)', u'1 1/2 cups plus 1 tablespoon (8 ounces/224 grams) unbleached all-purpose flour', u'1/3 cup plus 4 teaspoons (3.5 ounces/98 grams) water, room temperature (70\xb0F to 90\xb0F)', u'1 1/2 teaspoons honey', u'3/4 teaspoon instant yeast (also known as rapid-rise or bread machine yeast)', u'1 1/2 tablespoons non-fat dry milk powder', u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter, softened, plus 6 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted and cooled', u'3/4 teaspoon fine sea salt', u'Special equipment: stand mixer fitted with whisk attachment and dough hook, 3-quart or larger bowl or dough-rising container, masking tape, dough scraper or spatula, heavy baking sheet, baking stone or second heavy baking sheet, aluminum-foil-lined cast-iron pan or heavy rimmed baking pan'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 375\xb0F. Using fork, pierce potato in several places. Wrap in aluminum foil and bake until easily pierced with fork, about 50 minutes. When cool enough to handle, peel and mash. Reserve 1/2 cup (4.5 ounces) mashed potato and discard remainder or save for another use.', u'In bowl of stand mixer fitted with whisk attachment, whisk together 1/2 cup plus 1 tablespoon (3 ounces/84 grams) flour, 1/3 cup plus 4 teaspoons (3.5 ounces/98 grams) water, honey, and 1/4 teaspoon yeast until very smooth, about 2 minutes. Sponge should be consistency of thick batter). Scrape down sides of bowl.', u'In medium bowl, whisk together remaining 1 cup (5 ounces/140 grams) flour, remaining 1/2 teaspoon yeast, and milk powder. Sprinkle mixture over flour mixture (sponge) in bowl of mixer to form blanket on top of sponge. Cover bowl tightly with plastic wrap and let stand at least 1 hour, preferably up to 4 hours. (Starter can be made ahead and refrigerated, tightly covered with plastic wrap, overnight. There is no reason to bring starter to room temperature before proceeding.)', u'Attach dough hook to stand mixer. Add mashed sweet potato and 1 tablespoon softened butter to starter and mix on low (#2 on Kitchen Aid) until rough dough forms, about 1 minute. Scrape down sides of bowl, then cover tightly with plastic wrap and let dough rest 20 minutes.', u'Sprinkle salt over dough and knead on low (#2 on Kitchen Aid) until smooth, shiny, and slightly sticky to touch, 7 to 10 minutes. Scrape down sides of bowl. (If dough is too sticky, transfer to lightly floured work surface and knead in small amount of flour. If too stiff, add small amount of cold water and knead briefly.)', u"Using vegetable oil or nonstick vegetable-oil spray, lightly oil 3-quart or larger bowl (or dough-rising container). Transfer dough to bowl and lightly oil or spray top of dough. Using tape, mark outside of bowl to approximately double current height of dough. Cover bowl tightly with plastic wrap and let dough rise in warm place (75\xb0F to 80\xb0F, see Chef's Notes, below) until doubled in size, about 1 hour.", u'Using oiled dough scraper or spatula, transfer dough to lightly oiled work surface.', u'Gently stretch bottom of dough and fold up to center, then repeat with left side, right side, and top. Round dough package then transfer to bowl, smooth side up, and lightly oil or spray top of dough. Using tape, mark outside of bowl to approximately double current height of dough. Cover bowl tightly with plastic wrap and let dough rise in warm place until doubled in size and depression holds when pressed gently with finger, about 1 hour.', u'Line large baking sheet with parchment paper.', u'Transfer dough to lightly floured work surface and, using lightly oiled bench scraper, divide into 4 equal pieces, each weighing about 4 ounces (112 grams). Divide each piece into 3 pieces, each weighing about 1.3 ounces (36 grams). Keep remaining dough covered while working with each batch.', u'Using lightly floured hands, roll 1 dough piece between palms to form smooth, 1 3/4-inch-wide ball. Pinch indentation on bottom of ball tightly to seal. Repeat to form remaining balls.', u'Transfer melted butter to small bowl. Dip each dough ball into melted butter, coating all sides, and transfer, sealed-side-down, to prepared baking sheet, spacing about 2 inches apart. Lightly coat sheet of plastic wrap with vegetable oil or nonstick vegetable-oil spray and gently cover pan with oiled wrap. Let rolls rise in warm place until doubled in size and depression very slowly fills in when pressed with fingertip, about 45 minutes.', u'While dough is rising, position rack near bottom of oven and top with baking stone or heavy baking sheet. Set aluminum foil-lined cast-iron pan or heavy rimmed baking pan on floor of oven and preheat oven to 400\xbaF for 1 hour.', u"Quickly transfer baking sheet with rolls to hot baking stone (see Chef's Notes) and add 1/2 cup ice cubes to pan beneath.", u'Bake rolls, rotating pan 180 degrees halfway through, until golden brown and skewer inserted in middles comes out clean (instant read thermometer inserted into center will register about 190\xbaF), about 12 minutes. Transfer rolls from baking sheet to rack to cool completely. Serve warm or at room temperature.', u"\u2022Dough rises best around 75\xb0F to 80\xb0F. If your house is on the cold side, you can set a container of very hot tap water near the rising dough and cover the dough and the hot water with a large plastic container or bowl\u2014you will need to reheat the water every 30 to 40 minutes. Alternatively you can place the dough (and the small container of very hot water) in a microwave oven (not turned on) or a standard oven without a pilot light, but with the oven light turned on to provide gentle heat. \u2022If you want to make this bread over a 2-day period, you can refrigerate it overnight after the first rise. Once it has doubled in size (first rise), gently press the dough down in the bowl, then cover with plastic wrap that has been lightly coated with vegetable oil or nonstick vegetable-oil spray and refrigerate. After one hour and again after two, gently press the dough down. Then refrigerate overnight. The next day, bring the dough to room temperature at least 1 hour before shaping and baking the loaf. Keep in mind that the time in the refrigerator replaces the second rise so there is no need for a second rise. \u2022For proper texture, it's important for the bread to get a blast of heat as soon as it goes into the oven. For this reason, the oven needs to be preheated for a full hour, and it's important not to let too much heat escape when you put the bread in. When transferring the dough to the oven to bake, be sure to shut the door quickly.", u'Flour: 100% (includes starch contained in the potato) Water: 64.9% (includes water contained in the butter and yam) Yeast: 0.93% Salt: 1.7% Butterfat: 4.4%'], 'chef': u'Rose Levy Beranbaum', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/golden-dinner-rolls-351232', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes one dozen dinner rolls', 'recipe title': u'Golden Dinner Rolls', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'To get the look we wanted for this tart, we used grapes in assorted colors and shapes and halved the larger ones. Taste grapes before making the pastry cream. Their flavor will determine how much sugar you use\u2014 if the grapes are tart, use 1/3 cup sugar; if sweet, use 1/4 cup.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 large egg yolks', u'1/4 to 1/3 cup sugar, depending on sweetness of grapes', u'2 1/2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'1 cup whole milk', u'1 teaspoon vanilla', u'1 1/2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1 sheet frozen puff pastry (1/2 pound), thawed', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'4 cups red and green grapes', u'2 tablespoons red-currant jelly'], 'preperation steps': [u'Whisk together yolks and 1/2 of sugar, then whisk in flour and a pinch salt. Stir together milk and remaining sugar in a heavy saucepan and bring just to a boil over moderate heat. Whisk 1/2 of hot milk into yolks to temper and whisk yolks into milk remaining in pan. Bring custard to a boil over moderate heat and boil, whisking constantly, until very thick. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and butter until incorporated. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"This hefty frittata is cooked entirely on the grill\u2014from the vegetables to the eggs themselves. While it's ok to cook the frittata over direct heat, you want to make sure the grill isn't so hot that the bottom burns before the center is set. Ideally, you should grill the frittata over moderate heat--when you can hold your hand 4 to 5 inches from the grill for 4 to 5 seconds.", 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 large zucchini (about 12 ounces), sliced lengthwise 1/3 inch thick', u'2 medium leeks, roots trimmed, top 2 inches discarded, leeks halved lengthwise and rinsed well', u'Extra-virgin olive oil, for brushing', u'1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt, divided', u'Freshly ground black pepper', u'12 large eggs', u'1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons cr\xe8me fra\xeeche', u'2 teaspoons harissa, plus more for serving', u'2 tablespoons torn basil leaves'], 'preperation steps': [u"Light a grill or preheat a grill pan; if you're using a charcoal grill, leave one spot cooler for indirect cooking. Grill the zucchini over high heat, turning once, until nicely browned and tender, about 2 minutes per side. Transfer to a work surface, let cool slightly and slice crosswise 1/2 inch thick.", u'Grill the leeks over high heat until grill marks form, about 2 minutes per side, then move the leeks to a cooler part of the grill and grill over moderately low heat, turning occasionally, until just tender, about 15 minutes. Transfer the leeks to a work surface and let cool slightly. Remove the outer leaf and thinly slice the leeks crosswise, discarding any tough dark green pieces.', u"Turn the grill burners to moderate heat or, if you're using a charcoal grill, let the hot coals cool slightly. Brush a seasoned 12-inch cast-iron skillet generously with olive oil and set it on the grill.", u"In a large bowl, whisk the eggs with 1/4 cup of the cr\xe8me fra\xeeche and remaining 1 teaspoon salt. Stir in the cooled vegetables. When the skillet is hot, carefully pour in the eggs and vegetables. Using a spoon, carefully dollop the remaining 2 tablespoons of the cr\xe8me fra\xeeche and the 2 teaspoons of harissa around the top of the eggs. Close the grill and cook the frittata for about 15 minutes, moving the skillet a few times to make sure it's evenly heated, until the eggs are puffed and set.", u'Let the frittata cool slightly, then garnish with the basil leaves. Slice the frittata into wedges and serve, passing more harissa at the table.'], 'chef': u'stin Donnelly', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/grilled-frittata-with-zucchini-leeks-creme-fraiche-and-harissa-51241440', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Grilled Frittata with Zucchini, Leeks, Cr\xe8me Fra\xeeche and Harissa', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'If you are using cherry tomatoes on the vine and get 1 large cluster, simply cut the vines into 4 clusters before grilling and serving with the lamb.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Each serving (including barley) contains about 429 calories and 14 grams fat.\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Gourmet', 'recommendation': u'99%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 tablespoons honey', u'2 tablespoons red-wine vinegar', u'2 garlic cloves, finely chopped', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'8 rib lamb chops (1 1/2 lb total), bones frenched and all fat trimmed', u'1 1/2 lb cherry tomatoes (preferably on the vine)', u'1 1/2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar', u'Accompaniment: barley with toasted cumin and mint', u'Special equipment: a 12- by 8- by 2-inch disposable aluminum roasting pan'], 'preperation steps': [u'Stir together honey, vinegar, garlic, salt, and pepper and transfer to a sealable plastic bag. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 1/4 hr Start to finish: 1 1/2 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/4 cup Creole mustard* or other coarse-grain mustard', u'1/4 cup white-wine vinegar', u'2/3 cup plus 1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'3 tablespoons minced fresh flat-leaf parsley', u'2 1/2 tablespoons drained bottled horseradish', u'2 1/2 tablespoons minced dill pickle', u'2 tablespoons minced scallion greens', u'2 teaspoons paprika (not hot)', u'1 1/2 teaspoons cayenne', u'2 1/4 teaspoons salt', u'1 teaspoon black pepper', u'3 lb large shrimp in shell (21 to 25 per lb)', u'Special equipment: 14 (12-inch) wooden skewers'], 'preperation steps': [u'To make r\xe9moulade, whisk together mustard and vinegar in a large bowl until combined well, then whisk in 2/3 cup oil with parsley, horseradish, pickle, scallion, paprika, cayenne, 1 1/4 teaspoons salt, and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper.', u'Snip through shells of shrimp down middle of back using scissors, exposing vein and leaving tail and first segment of shell intact. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'The yield for these cutouts varies depending on the size and shape of the cookie cutters you use. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Pletzel', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 cup warm water (105\u2013115\xb0F)', u'1 (1/4-oz) package active dry yeast (2 1/2 teaspoons)', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'3 1/2 cups all-purpose flour', u'2 1/2 teaspoons salt', u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 medium onions, finely chopped (2 cups)', u'1 large egg, lightly beaten with 1 tablespoon water', u'1 teaspoon nigella seeds* or poppy seeds'], 'preperation steps': [u"Stir together water, yeast, and sugar in a small bowl until sugar is dissolved, then let stand until foamy, about 5 minutes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Gaeng Pah Muu', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'78%', 'ingredient list': [u"1 lb Thai apple eggplants (see cooks' note, below)", u'2 tablespoons to 1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'1/4 to 1/2 cup Thai red curry paste', u'1 1/2 lb pork tenderloin, halved lengthwise, then sliced crosswise 1/4 inch thick', u'1/3 cup julienne strips peeled fresh or frozen grachai (lesser galangal or wild ginger; thawed if frozen) or drained bottled grachai, rinsed, or ginger', u'3 oz Chinese long beans or green beans, cut into 1-inch pieces', u'8 canned baby corn, rinsed, drained, and halved lengthwise', u'1 1/2 cups Thai chicken stock', u'3 tablespoons nam pla (Asian fish sauce; preferably Thai)', u'5 (4-inch-long) fresh or frozen Kaffir lime leaves (sometimes called bai makroot)', u'1 fresh chee fah chile or 2 red jalape\xf1o chiles, thinly sliced crosswise and seeds discarded', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 cup loosely packed bai grapao (holy basil leaves)', u'Special equipment: a large (6-qt) wok', u'Accompaniment: Thai pickled garlic (gratiam dong)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Trim eggplants and cut into 1-inch wedges (do this just before heating oil to avoid discoloration).', u'Heat oil (see above) in wok over moderate heat until warm, about 30 seconds. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'The potatoes are poached in olive oil as they often are in Spain \u2014 only some oil is absorbed; the rest is drained off.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'94%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 lb boiling potatoes', u'1 cup olive oil', u'1 large onion, chopped', u'1 1/2 teaspoons salt', u'1 lb kale, center ribs discarded', u'7 large eggs'], 'preperation steps': [u'Peel potatoes and cut into 1/3-inch dice (2 1/4 cups). {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Though it originated in Austria, this sweet raisin-filled yeast bread has become a specialty of the Alsace region of France, where it is often served for breakfast or brunch. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Light, delicate, and crisp, rice-stick noodles come packaged in different sizes. However, 1 package, no matter how small, will be plenty for this recipe. If you'd like to make larger crisps for dramatic presentation, simply pull each noodle mound into a wider tangle, then fry crisps 1 at a time.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'About 1 oz dried rice vermicelli (rice-stick noodles)', u'6 cups vegetable oil (48 fl oz)', u'Confectioners sugar for dusting', u'Special equipment: a deep-fat thermometer'], 'preperation steps': [u'Soak noodles in cold water in a large bowl until very pliable, 15 to 20 minutes, then drain and pat dry. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"You'll need a pastry bag fitted with a 1/4-inch star tip to create the decorative rosettes. Begin making this cake two days before you plan to serve it.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'83%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 cup sugar', u'3/4 cup fresh lemon juice', u'3 large eggs', u'3 large egg yolks', u'1/4 cup (1/2 stick) chilled unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u'6 large eggs, separated', u'14 tablespoons sugar', u'1 3/4 cups sifted cake flour (sifted, then measured)', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1/2 cup boiling water', u'1/4 cup fresh lemon juice', u'2 cups chilled heavy whipping cream', u'3/4 cup sugar', u'3 8-ounce containers chilled mascarpone cheese*'], 'preperation steps': [u'Whisk first 4 ingredients in medium metal bowl. Set bowl over saucepan of simmering water (do not allow bottom of bowl to touch water). Whisk constantly until thickened and instant-read thermometer inserted into mixture registers 160\xb0F, about 10 minutes. Remove bowl from over water. Add butter; whisk until melted. Transfer 1 cup curd to small bowl for spreading on cake layers. Reserve remaining curd for filling. Press plastic wrap directly onto surface of both curds. Chill overnight. (Can be made 3 days ahead. Keep chilled.)', u'Position rack in center of oven and preheat to 375\xb0F. Line bottom of two 9-inch-diameter cake pans with 1 1/2-inch-high sides with parchment paper (do not grease pans or parchment). Using electric mixer, beat egg yolks and 7 tablespoons sugar in large bowl until mixture is very thick and slowly dissolving ribbons form when beaters are lifted, about 4 minutes. Using clean dry beaters, beat whites in another large bowl until soft peaks form. Add remaining 7 tablespoons sugar, 1 tablespoon at a time, beating until stiff and glossy. Fold half of whites into yolk mixture, then sift half of flour and 1/4 teaspoon salt over and gently fold in until incorporated. Fold in remaining whites, then sift remaining flour over and fold in just until combined, being careful not to deflate batter.', u'Divide batter between pans; smooth tops. Bake until tester inserted into center of cakes comes out clean, about 15 minutes. Cool in pans on racks.', u'Run knife around edge of pans to loosen cakes. Invert cakes onto 9-inch-diameter cardboard rounds, tapping on work surface if necessary to release cakes. Cut each cake horizontally in half (layers will be thin). Peel off parchment.', u'Place sugar in small metal bowl. Add 1/2 cup boiling water; stir to dissolve sugar. Stir in lemon juice.', u'Beat whipping cream and sugar in large bowl until peaks form. Add mascarpone to lemon curd in medium bowl; whisk until blended. Fold whipped cream into lemon-mascarpone mixture.', u'Place 1 cake layer, flat side up, on platter. Brush with 1/4 of syrup. Spread 1/4 cup lemon curd over, then 1 cup lemon-mascarpone filling. Top with second cake layer; brush with 1/4 of syrup and spread with 1/4 cup lemon curd and 1 cup lemon-mascarpone filling. Repeat with third cake layer, syrup, lemon curd, and filling. Top with fourth cake layer. Brush with remaining syrup, then spread remaining lemon curd over. Spoon 2 cups lemon-mascarpone filling into pastry bag fitted with 1/4-inch star tip (to be used for rosettes). Spread remaining lemon-mascarpone filling as a frosting over sides of cake. Pipe small rosettes of frosting over top of cake, covering completely. Cover cake with cake dome; refrigerate at least 6 hours and up to 1 day.', u'*Italian cream cheese available at Italian markets and many supermarkets.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/lemon-layer-cake-with-lemon-curd-and-mascarpone-107898', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 10 to 12 servings', 'recipe title': u'Lemon Layer Cake with Lemon Curd and Mascarpone', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"If you don't want to cook a live lobster for this recipe, buy 2/3 pound cooked lobster meat from your seafood shop.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'96%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 (1 1/4- to 1 1/2-lb) live lobster', u'2 teaspoons finely chopped shallot', u'1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice', u'1/4 teaspoon table salt', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 pink or ruby-red grapefruit', u'1 firm-ripe California avocado', u'1 oz baby arugula (2 cups)', u'Coarse sea salt to taste (optional)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Plunge lobster headfirst into an 8-quart pot of boiling salted water . Transfer with tongs to sink to drain.', u'When lobster is cool enough to handle, remove meat from tail and claws, keeping meat intact. Discard tomalley, any roe, and shells. Chill lobster, covered, until cold, at least 1 hour.', u'While lobster chills, stir together shallot, lemon juice, and table salt in a small bowl and let stand at room temperature 30 minutes. Add oil in a stream, whisking.', u'Cut peel, including all white pith, from grapefruit with a sharp knife. Cut segments free from membranes and transfer segments to paper towels to drain.', u'Halve avocado lengthwise, discarding pit. (Save 1 half, wrapped tightly in plastic wrap, for another use.) Halve remaining avocado half lengthwise and peel, then cut crosswise into 1/3-inch-thick slices.', u'Cut lobster tail meat crosswise into 1/2-inch-thick slices. Divide avocado and all of lobster meat between 2 salad plates and arrange grapefruit around them. Top with arugula and drizzle with dressing. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"It just wouldn't be a holiday without my mom preparing a pasta course, whether it precedes the turkey at Thanksgiving or follows antipasti at Easter. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Cakes resembling Yule logs are very popular at Christmastime in Canada and the United States. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Serve these eggplant slices on crusty Italian bread spread with a mild, earthy cheese such as a fresh goat cheese.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'86%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 lb small purple Italian or white eggplants (about 3), trimmed and cut lengthwise into 1/8-inch-thick slices', u'1 1/4 teaspoons salt', u'5 tablespoons red-wine vinegar', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1 garlic clove, thinly sliced', u'1/2 cup finely chopped fresh mint', u'2/3 cup extra-virgin olive oil'], 'preperation steps': [u'Toss eggplant with 1 teaspoon salt in a colander set over a bowl, then let drain 30 minutes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Boxes of matzo farfel, very small pieces of matzo (about 1/4 inch wide), turn up in markets around Passover. Farfel is usually used in soups or for stuffing. This brittle can be eaten as candy or sprinkled over ice cream.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'83%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 cups matzo farfel', u'Vegetable oil for brushing pan (unless using nonstick liner)', u'2 cups sugar', u'1/4 cup water', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'3 tablespoons salted butter or margarine, softened', u'1 1/2 cups sliced almonds (5 ounces), toasted'], 'preperation steps': [u'Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 350\xb0F.', u'Spread matzo farfel in a large shallow baking pan (1/2 to 1 inch deep) and toast, stirring and shaking pan occasionally, until golden, 15 to 20 minutes. Boil gently, without stirring but washing down any sugar crystals on side of pan with a pastry brush dipped in cold water, until syrup begins to turn golden. Continue to boil, swirling pan occasionally, until syrup is a deep golden caramel. Immediately remove pan from heat and carefully stir in butter with a wooden spoon (mixture will rise up and bubble vigorously). When bubbling begins to subside, immediately stir in toasted matzo farfel and almonds and quickly pour into baking pan, spreading and smoothing with back of spoon before mixture hardens.', u'Transfer baking pan to a rack. If using a foil-lined pan, cool brittle to warm in pan, then peel off foil and transfer brittle to rack to cool completely. If using nonstick liner, cool brittle completely in pan. Break brittle with your hands into bite-size pieces, or make into a topping: Break into large pieces with your hands, then put brittle in a heavy-duty sealable plastic bag, seal bag, force out excess air, and lightly pound with a rolling pin into smaller pieces.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/matzo-almond-brittle-109341', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes about 1 1/2 lb candy', 'recipe title': u'Matzo Almond Brittle', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 45 min Start to finish: 4 1/2 hr', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'90%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 medium onions, chopped', u'3 carrots, cut into 1/4-inch dice', u'2 celery ribs, cut into 1/4-inch dice', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'3 (6- by 6-inch) matzos, broken into 1/2-inch pieces', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves', u'1 large egg, lightly beaten', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'1 (3 1/2- to 4-lb) boneless veal breast (1 1/2 inches thick)', u'1 small onion, quartered', u'2 garlic cloves, smashed', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'2 teaspoons paprika (preferably sweet Hungarian)', u'1 1/2 teaspoons salt', u'1 teaspoon black pepper', u'2 fresh thyme sprigs', u'1 1/2 cups water', u'Special equipment: a carpet, darning, or upholstery needle; kitchen string'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cook onions, carrots, and celery in oil in a wide 3 1/2- to 5-quart heavy pot over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until vegetables begin to brown, 8 to 10 minutes.', u'While vegetables are cooking, put matzos in a colander and run under hot water until softened.', u'Remove pot from heat and transfer half of vegetables to a bowl. Cut a large pocket in veal breast: Beginning at center of thickest side, insert a large knife horizontally and cut into center of veal as evenly as possible, leaving a 1-inch border on 3 sides.', u'Pur\xe9e onion, garlic, oil, paprika, salt, and pepper in a food processor or blender. Discard string, then cut veal across the grain into 1-inch-thick slices and serve with sauce.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/matzo-stuffed-breast-of-veal-107600', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Matzo-Stuffed Breast of Veal', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Schwarzw\xe4lder Torte', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'79%', 'ingredient list': [u'Vegetable oil for greasing', u'3 tablespoons all-purpose flour plus additional for dusting', u'1/2 cup granulated sugar', u'5 large egg whites, at room temperature for 30 minutes', u"3 oz almonds or hazelnuts, toasted (see cooks' note, below), chopped, and finely ground in a food processor (3/4 cup)", u'5 1/2 oz fine-quality bittersweet chocolate (not unsweetened), chopped', u'1/4 cup water', u'1 teaspoon instant-coffee granules', u'1 1/2 cups chilled heavy cream', u'3 tablespoons confectioners sugar', u'1 tablespoon kirsch or Cognac', u'Garnish: grated bittersweet chocolate or chocolate curls'], 'preperation steps': [u'Put oven racks in upper and lower thirds of oven and preheat oven to 425\xb0F.', u'Oil 2 large baking sheets and dust with flour, knocking off excess. Beat egg whites with a pinch of salt in a bowl using an electric mixer at medium-high speed until they just hold stiff peaks. Fold in sugar mixture gently but thoroughly, then fold in nuts. Arrange 1 meringue round, chocolate side up, on a cake stand or plate, then spread 1/3 cup whipped cream over it. Top with a second round and spread with 1/3 cup whipped cream. Repeat, then top with remaining meringue round. Frost top and side of torte with remaining whipped cream.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/meringue-chocolate-and-kirsch-cream-layer-cake-108902', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 to 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Meringue, Chocolate, and Kirsch Cream Layer Cake', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Dried fruit is the secret to moist low-fat baked goods. These cupcakes have such a rich, chocolaty flavor, you would never know there were dates in the batter if you hadn't baked them yourself.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Each serving (3 cupcakes) contains about 177 calories and 4 grams fat.\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Gourmet', 'recommendation': u'95%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/3 cup water', u'1/3 cup pitted dates, coarsely chopped', u'1/4 cup unsweetened Dutch-process cocoa powder', u'1 ounce fine-quality bittersweet chocolate (not unsweetened), coarsely chopped', u'3 tablespoons packed light brown sugar', u'1 large egg', u'1/4 teaspoon vanilla', u'1/4 teaspoon baking soda', u'2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'Vegetable oil cooking spray', u'1 teaspoon confectioners sugar for dusting', u'Special equipment: a mini-muffin pan with 12 (1/8-cup) muffin cups, preferably nonstick'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 325\xb0F.', u'Bring water and dates just to a boil in a 1-quart heavy saucepan, then transfer mixture to a food processor and add cocoa powder and chocolate, pulsing once to combine. Add flour and pulse just until incorporated.', u'Spray muffin cups with cooking spray. (If pan is not nonstick, line sprayed bottoms with rounds of wax paper, then spray paper.) Spoon batter into cups, dividing it evenly, and bake in middle of oven until a wooden pick or skewer comes out clean, 18 to 22 minutes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"These hot dog buns look very much like \xe9clairs, which is no coincidence \u2014 they're made from p\xe2te \xe0 choux instead of yeast dough. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'In North Africa (and Marseille!) mint tea is generally drunk enormously sweet\u2014the kind of sweetness that makes you a bit thirsty\u2014which is exactly how I like it. Start with 1/4 cup of sugar and add more if you want it sweeter. To avoid any bitterness, do not let the tea boil once the mint has been added. For an earthy, Tunisian touch, dry roast a handful of pine nuts and drop them in the glass just before serving.', 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 tablespoon loose-leaf gunpowder green tea', u'3 cups plus 3 tablespoons cool water', u'1/4 to 1/2 cup sugar', u'1 large handful of fresh mint, rinsed and picked over', u'4 tablespoons pine nuts, dry roasted (optional)'], 'preperation steps': [u'In a stove-top teapot, add the tea leaves and cover with the 3 tablespoons of water. Bring to a quick boil and immediately pour off the water, being carefully that no tea leaves escape. (This gets rid of the some of the bitterness, and allows the tea to seep longer with mint.)', u'Add the sugar to the wet grounds and cover with the remaining 3 cups of water. Over medium heat, with the lid open or off, bring to a boil.', u'Pour half of the liquid into a bowl or Pyrex measuring cup; reserve. Stuff the mint into the teapot, pressing it against the bottom of the pot with a spoon to gently and slightly crush the leaves. Return the reserved liquid to the teapot.', u'Simmer over low heat for a few minutes to let the mint infuse. Pour a glassful into a clear drinking glass and then back into the pot, from as high as possible without spilling to aerate the tea and blend the flavors. Repeat this two or three more times, as the color of tea changes from clear to a cloudy caramel.', u'Begin tasting for sweetness and flavor. Add more sugar if desired, or let it simmer another few minutes to make it stronger. Continue to pour glassfuls in and out of the pot until satisfied with both the sweetness and strength of the tea.', u'Serve in small clear tea glasses. Do not pour tea into them from the teapot, but from the glass used for mixing and testing (this will help trap any sediment).', u'If adding pine nuts, sprinkle into the glasses of tea before serving.'], 'chef': u'Jeff Koehler', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/mint-tea-51173820', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 4', 'recipe title': u'Mint Tea', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 15 min Start to finish: 1 1/4 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'67%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds', u'1/2 teaspoon fennel seeds', u'2 teaspoons tamarind concentrate * or balsamic vinegar', u'2 tablespoons hot water', u'1 to 2 teaspoons mild honey', u'1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'3 cups mixed cherry tomatoes (1 lb), halved'], 'preperation steps': [u'Toast cumin and fennel seeds then coarsely crush using a mortar and pestle or an electric coffee/spice grinder.', u'Whisk tamarind concentrate into hot water until dissolved, then whisk in honey (to taste), oil, salt, and pepper until blended.', u'Add tomatoes and spices and toss to coat. Let stand at room temperature 1 hour, then season with salt.', u"*Available at ethnic markets and Kalustyan's (212-685-3451)."], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/mixed-cherry-tomatoes-with-tamarind-dressing-105419', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Mixed Cherry Tomatoes with Tamarind Dressing', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 3 hr Start to finish: 4 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 cup finely chopped onion', u'2 large garlic cloves, minced', u'1 fresh jalape\xf1o chile, seeded and minced', u'1 teaspoon dried epazote or oregano, crumbled', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro', u'1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'2 lb mushrooms, cut into 1/4-inch-thick slices', u'2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'12 (6-inch) corn tortillas', u'3/4 cup coarsely grated Monterey Jack cheese (3 oz)', u'3/4 cup crumbled soft, mild goat cheese (3 oz)', u'21/4 cups Chile colorado , cooled', u'1 1/2 cups sour cream', u'Garnish: fresh cilantro leaves, sliced white onion, thinly sliced radish'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cook onion, garlic, chile, epazote, and cilantro in 2 tablespoons oil in a 5- to 6-quart heavy pot over moderate heat, stirring, 2 minutes. Lightly toast tortillas 30 seconds on each side. Wrap tortillas, stacking them, in a kitchen towel as toasted. Cut tortillas in half and return them to towel.', u'Preheat oven to 375\xb0Fand lightly oil a 10- by 8- by 2-inch ceramic or glass baking dish.', u'Toss cheeses together in a bowl.', u'Spread 1/3 cup chile colorado evenly in bottom of baking dish.', u'Begin layering by arranging 5 tortillas halves over sauce in dish in 1 layer (slightly overlapping if necessary). Sprinkle top with remaining 1/2 cup cheese and bake, uncovered, in middle of oven, until heated through, about 20 minutes.', u'Whisk together remaining sour cream with a little water to loosen it, then serve on the side for drizzling over bud\u202d\xecn.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/mushroom-budin-104398', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 (main course) servings', 'recipe title': u'Mushroom Budin', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This recipe serves 4 as a main course after you set aside 3 cups to make the mushroom and mozzarella arancini or the mushroom risotto cakes. Otherwise, it serves 6.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'73%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 oz (28 g) dried porcini (1 cup)', u'3 3/4 cups hot water', u'5 1/4 cups reduced-sodium chicken broth (42 fl oz)', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'3/4 stick (6 tablespoons) unsalted butter', u'1 small onion, finely chopped (1 cup)', u'2 garlic cloves, finely chopped', u'3/4 lb fresh cremini mushrooms, trimmed and thinly sliced', u'1 lb Arborio rice (2 1/3 cups)', u'2/3 cup dry white wine', u'1 oz finely grated Parmigiano-Reggiano (1/2 cup)', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon black pepper', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley', u'Special equipment: parchment paper (if reserving some risotto for another recipe)', u'Garnish: Parmigiano-Reggiano shavings'], 'preperation steps': [u'Soak porcini in 1 1/2 cups hot water in a bowl until softened, about 20 minutes. Stir in porcini and cook, stirring, 1 minute, then add rice and cook, stirring, 1 minute. Add wine and cook, stirring, until absorbed, about 1 minute.', u'Stir 1 cup simmering broth into rice and cook, stirring constantly and keeping at a strong simmer, until absorbed. Continue cooking and adding broth, about 1 cup at a time, stirring frequently and letting each addition be absorbed before adding next, until rice is tender and creamy looking but still al dente, 18 to 20 minutes. Stir in cheese, salt, pepper, and remaining 5 tablespoons butter until butter is melted.', u'If reserving some risotto to make one of the following recipes, set aside 3 cups and cool to room temperature, then chill, covered with plastic wrap.', u'Stir parsley into remaining risotto and serve immediately.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/mushroom-risotto-231798', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 to 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Mushroom Risotto', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Serve this no-frills feast with cold beer and bowls of melted butter and steaming broth for dipping. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 hr Start to finish: 3 3/4 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'83%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 cup plus 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'1/4 cup plus 3 tablespoons sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 1/2 sticks (3/4 cup) cold unsalted butter, cut into bits', u'1 1/2 to 2 tablespoons cold water', u'1/4 cup whole blanched almonds', u'1 1/4 lb rhubarb stalks (preferably about 1 1/3 inches wide)', u'1/4 cup apricot preserves, melted and strained', u'Accompaniment: lightly sweetened whipped cream'], 'preperation steps': [u'Whisk together 1 cup flour, 1 tablespoon sugar, and salt. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 30 min Start to finish: 4 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'56%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 large navel oranges', u'1 3/4 cups sugar', u'3 cups whole milk', u'3 whole large eggs and 3 large egg yolks', u'Special equipment: 6 (6-oz) ramekins'], 'preperation steps': [u'Finely grate zest from oranges, then squeeze enough juice to measure 1 cup.', u'Pour juice through a fine sieve into a 2-quart heavy saucepan, discarding pulp, and stir in 1 cup sugar. Bake in middle of oven until custard is just set (but still trembles slightly in center), 50 minutes to 1 hour. Run a thin knife around side of each ramekin to loosen, then transfer ramekins to a rack and cool. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Making spaetzle is easy, with no fancy equipment needed: a coarse grater, colander, or wide perforated spoon or ladle with 1/4-inch holes will work well.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'71%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 1/2 cups frozen peas (do not use petite peas)', u'4 large eggs', u'1 cup low-salt chicken broth, divided', u'6 tablespoons chopped fresh chives, divided', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh mint plus 1/3 cup sliced mint leaves', u'2 1/2 teaspoons coarse kosher salt', u'2 cups all purpose flour', u'6 tablespoons pareve margarine, divided', u'1/4 teaspoon (generous) ground nutmeg', u'1 cup teardrop or grape tomatoes, halved'], 'preperation steps': [u'Combine 2 cups peas, eggs, 1/2 cup broth, 2 tablespoons chives, 2 tablespoons chopped mint, and salt in blender. Using strainer,transfer spaetzle to large colander; drain and place in large bowl. Toss spaetzle with 2 tablespoons margarine. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover spaetzle and remaining 1 1/2 cups peas separately and chill.', u'Melt 4 tablespoons margarine inlarge skillet over medium-high heat. Add spaetzle and 1/2 cup broth. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 1/4 hr Start to finish: 2 3/4 hr (includes cooling)', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'82%', 'ingredient list': [u'Ingredients for basic butter cookies', u'1 1/2 cups confectioners sugar for dredging and dusting', u'3/4 cup fresh lemon juice', u'1 tablespoon finely grated fresh lemon zest', u'3/4 cup granulated sugar', u'1 stick (1/2 cup) unsalted butter, cut into bits', u'2 tablespoons cornstarch', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'4 large egg yolks', u'Special equipment: a 1 1/4-inch round cookie cutter; a pastry bag fitted with small plain tip or a heavy-duty sealable plastic bag (not pleated)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Follow recipe for basic butter cookies, forming dough into 2 balls (instead of a log) and flattening each into a 6-inch disk. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Blancmange is a jellied molded pudding (similar to panna cotta) that is made with almonds and milk and served cold, often with a fruit sauce. Though it dates back to medieval times, blancmange became part of Jefferson's dessert repertoire after he encountered it during his years in Paris. Following his lead as an innovator, we made this version with pistachios instead of almonds, which gives the pudding a beautiful pale green hue and terrific flavor.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'50%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 cups shelled unsalted pistachios (not dyed red; 7 oz)', u'1 3/4 cups whole milk', u'1/8 teaspoon almond extract', u'1 3/4 teaspoons unflavored gelatin (from a 1/4-oz envelope)', u'2 tablespoons cold water', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1 cup chilled heavy cream', u'Special equipment: 8 (4-oz) oval or round metal molds or ceramic ramekins; a thin fine-weave kitchen towel (not terry cloth)', u'Accompaniment: brandied poached peaches', u'Garnish: chopped unsalted pistachios'], 'preperation steps': [u'Put oven rack in middle position and preheat to 350\xb0F. Oil molds and line bottom of each with an oval of wax paper.', u'Spread pistachios on a baking sheet and toast until nuts are fragrant but not colored, 4 to 5 minutes. Transfer to a bowl and cool completely. Rub off and discard any skins.', u'Blend nuts with milk in a blender or food processor 2 minutes. Rinse kitchen towel under cold water and wring out as much water as possible. Line a large sieve with towel, then set sieve over a bowl or large glass measure and pour pistachio mixture into towel. Wrap towel up and around mixture and, working over sieve, squeeze pistachio milk (about 1 cup) from towel into bowl, discarding ground pistachios. Stir in almond extract and a pinch of salt.', u'Sprinkle gelatin over cold water in a very small bowl or a cup and let stand 1 minute.', u'Heat pistachio milk and sugar in a small saucepan over moderately low heat, stirring, until sugar is dissolved. Add gelatin mixture and cook, stirring, until gelatin is dissolved. Transfer to a metal bowl set in a larger bowl of ice and cold water and cool, stirring constantly, just until mixture is the consistency of raw egg white. Remove bowl from ice water.', u'Beat cream in another bowl with an electric mixer until it just holds stiff peaks, then whisk one fourth of cream into pistachio mixture to lighten. Fold in remaining cream gently but thoroughly and spoon mixture into molds. Chill blancmanges, covered with plastic wrap, until set, at least 6 hours.', u'Working with 1 blancmange at a time, run tip of a thin knife between each custard and metal mold. Tilt mold sideways and tap side of mold against a work surface, turning it, to evenly break seal and loosen custard. Keeping mold tilted, invert a dessert plate over mold, then invert blancmange onto plate.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/pistachio-blancmanges-108527', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Pistachio Blancmanges', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 3/4 hr Start to finish: 2 3/4 hr', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'12 garlic cloves, peeled', u'1 tablespoon fine sea salt', u'1 (10-inch) round or oval sourdough loaf (1 1/2 lb), crust discarded', u'9 fresh porcini (c\xe8pes; 3/4 lb), trimmed', u'3 (1-lb) squabs', u'3 large sprigs fresh thyme', u'3 tablespoons garlic confit pur\xe9e garlic confit pur\xe9e', u'6 tablespoons strained duck fat (from garlic confit pur\xe9e)', u'1/3 cup loosely packed fresh flat-leaf parsley', u'1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice, or to taste', u'Special equipment: kitchen string'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 450\xb0F.', u'Bring 2 cups water, garlic, and 1 teaspoon sea salt to a boil, then drain in a colander. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This recipe calls for giant 4 1/2- to 5-ounce prawns, which can be ordered from some specialty fish markets. If unavailable, substitute 24 large prawns.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'71%', 'ingredient list': [u'8 ounces fresh morel mushrooms or 2 ounces dried morel mushrooms*', u'8 tablespoons (1 stick) unsalted butter, room temperature, divided', u'3/4 cup chopped shallots, divided', u'1 garlic clove, minced', u'1 1/2 teaspoons chopped fresh thyme', u'6 4 1/2- to 5-ounce uncooked giant prawns or 24 large prawns'], 'preperation steps': [u'Finely chop enough fresh morels or reconstituted morels to measure 1/2 cup (packed); reserve remaining morels. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"My mother's inspiration for these traditional Jewish cookies came from her great-grandmother, who owned a small Catskills hotel. Even after Bubbe Sarah retired, she'd turn out enough rugelach to feed a hotel full of people.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'96%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'2 sticks (1 cup) unsalted butter, softened', u'8 oz cream cheese, softened', u'1/2 cup plus 4 teaspoons sugar', u'1 teaspoon cinnamon', u'1 cup apricot preserves or raspberry jam', u'1 cup loosely packed golden raisins, chopped', u'1 1/4 cups walnuts (1/4 lb), finely chopped', u'Milk for brushing cookies', u'Special equipment: parchment paper; a small offset spatula'], 'preperation steps': [u'Whisk together flour and salt in a bowl. Beat together butter and cream cheese in a large bowl with an electric mixer until combined well. Add flour mixture and stir with a wooden spoon until a soft dough forms. Gather dough into a ball and wrap in plastic wrap, then flatten (in wrap) into a roughly 7- by 5-inch rectangle. Chill until firm, 8 to 24 hours.', u'Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 350\xb0F. Line bottom of a 1- to 1 1/2-inch-deep large shallow baking pan with parchment paper.', u'Cut dough into 4 pieces. Chill 3 pieces, wrapped in plastic wrap, and roll out remaining piece into a 12- by 8-inch rectangle on a well-floured surface with a floured rolling pin. Transfer dough to a sheet of parchment, then transfer to a tray and chill while rolling out remaining dough in same manner, transferring each to another sheet of parchment and stacking on tray.', u'Whisk 1/2 cup sugar with cinnamon.', u'Arrange 1 dough rectangle on work surface with a long side nearest you. Spread 1/4 cup preserves evenly over dough with offset spatula. Sprinkle 1/4 cup raisins and a rounded 1/4 cup walnuts over jam, then sprinkle with 2 tablespoons cinnamon sugar.', u'Using parchment as an aid, roll up dough tightly into a log. Place, seam side down, in lined baking pan, then pinch ends closed and tuck underneath. Make 3 more logs in same manner and arrange 1 inch apart in pan. Brush logs with milk and sprinkle each with 1 teaspoon of remaining granulated sugar. With a sharp large knife, make 3/4-inch-deep cuts crosswise in dough (not all the way through) at 1-inch intervals. (If dough is too soft to cut, chill until firmer, 20 to 30 minutes.)', u'Bake until golden, 45 to 50 minutes. Cool to warm in pan on a rack, about 30 minutes, then transfer logs to a cutting board and slice cookies all the way through.'], 'chef': u'd editor: Melissa Roberts-Matar Mother: Phyllis Roberts, Monsey, NY', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/rugelach-109475', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes about 44 cookies', 'recipe title': u'Rugelach', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Start this dish at least 4 hours ahead. The chicken can also marinate overnight. What to drink: A delicate white wine with floral aromas, like Pinot Gris from Austria or Alsace.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/4 teaspoon saffron threads', u'3 tablespoons butter, room temperature', u'4 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided', u'6 large boneless chicken breast halves with skin', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh Italian parsley', u'1 tablespoon (scant) finely grated lemon peel', u'3 teaspoons fresh thyme leaves, divided', u'2 1/2 cups sliced green onions, white and green parts separated', u'6 cups loosely packed fresh pea shoots or pea sprouts (about 4 ounces)', u'1 tablespoon water', u'1/4 cup torn fresh mint leaves', u'2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice', u'English Pea Puree'], 'preperation steps': [u'Stir saffron threads in dry skillet over medium-low heat just until brittle and slightly darkened, being careful not to burn saffron, about 20 seconds. Add 2 tablespoons oil to remaining saffron in mortar, scraping sides and bottom of mortar with rubber spatula to blend well.', u'Place chicken breasts in large bowl. Add saffron oil, parsley, lemon peel, and 2 teaspoons thyme leaves; toss to coat chicken. Cover and refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight.', u'Heat 1 tablespoon oil in each of 2 large nonstick skillets over medium-high heat. Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper. Transfer chicken to platter; cover and keep warm.', u'Add white parts of green onions and remaining 1 teaspoon thyme to one skillet; saut\xe9 over medium heat until onions are translucent, about 3 minutes. Add saffron butter, pea shoots, green parts of green onions, and 1 tablespoon water; stir until pea shoots are barely wilted, about 10 seconds. Remove from heat; stir in mint and lemon juice. Season to taste with salt and pepper.', u'Divide English Pea Puree among 6 plates. Top with chicken. Spoon pea shoots mixture and juices over and serve.'], 'chef': u'anne Goin', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/saffron-chicken-breasts-with-english-pea-puree-pea-shoots-and-mint-234429', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Saffron Chicken Breasts with English Pea Pur\xe9e, Pea Shoots, and Mint', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'For more information about cooking wild rice, see Born to Be Wild.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'83%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 cups water', u'1 cup wild rice (5 oz)', u'1 1/2 teaspoons salt', u'1 3/4 cups whole milk', u'4 large eggs', u'1 stick (1/2 cup) unsalted butter, melted and cooled slightly', u'1 cup all-purpose flour', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'3/4 cup thinly sliced scallions', u'3 red bell peppers (18 oz)', u'1/2 cup water', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 1/2 teaspoons balsamic vinegar', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 1/2 oz dried porcini mushrooms', u'3/4 cup boiling-hot water', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1 1/2 lb fresh cremini mushrooms, trimmed and thinly sliced', u'3 large garlic cloves, minced', u'3/4 teaspoon minced fresh rosemary', u'3/4 teaspoon minced fresh thyme', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'Garnish: thinly sliced scallions', u'Special equipment: 16 (5-inch) squares of wax paper; a well-seasoned 6- to 7-inch cr\xeape pan or nonstick skillet'], 'preperation steps': [u'Bring 4 cups water to a boil in a 2-quart heavy saucepan, then add rice and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Reduce heat and cook, covered, over low heat until rice is tender and grains are split open, 1 to 1 1/4 hours (not all liquid will be absorbed). Drain well in a colander and cool to warm.', u'Blend together milk, eggs, 3 tablespoons butter, flour, pepper, remaining teaspoon salt, and 1 cup cooked wild rice in a blender until smooth, about 1 minute. Transfer to a large bowl and stir in scallions and 1 1/2 cups cooked wild rice (reserve remainder for another use). Let batter stand, covered, at room temperature 1 hour.', u'Roast bell peppers on racks of gas burners over high heat, turning with tongs, until skins are blackened, 10 to 12 minutes. (Or broil peppers on a broiler pan about 5 inches from heat, turning occasionally, about 15 minutes.) Transfer to a large bowl and cover tightly with plastic wrap, then let stand 20 minutes.', u'When cool enough to handle, peel peppers, discarding stems and seeds, and coarsely chop.', u'Pur\xe9e peppers with water, oil, vinegar, and salt in cleaned blender until smooth. Season with pepper and pour into a small heavy saucepan.', u'Soak porcini in boiling-hot water in a small bowl until softened, about 20 minutes. Lift porcini out, squeezing liquid back into bowl, then rinse porcini (to remove any grit) and finely chop. Pour soaking liquid through a sieve lined with a dampened paper towel into another small bowl.', u'Heat oil and 1 tablespoon butter in a 12- to 13-inch nonstick skillet over moderately high heat until foam subsides, then saut\xe9 porcini and cremini mushrooms, tossing with 2 wooden spatulas or spoons, until wilted and any liquid mushrooms give off is evaporated, 3 to 5 minutes. Add garlic, rosemary, thyme, salt, and remaining tablespoon butter and saut\xe9, stirring, 1 minute. Add porcini soaking liquid and boil until most of liquid is evaporated and mushrooms are tender, 3 to 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.', u'Line a plate with 1 square of wax paper. Heat cr\xeape pan over moderate heat until hot, then brush lightly with some melted butter. Spoon about 3 tablespoons batter into pan, tilting and rotating to coat bottom. (If batter sets before skillet is coated, reduce heat slightly for next cr\xeape.) Cook until underside is lightly browned, about 1 minute, then loosen cr\xeape with a heatproof plastic spatula and flip over with your fingers. Cook cr\xeape until other side is lightly browned, about 1 minute, and transfer to wax-paper-lined plate. Top cr\xeape with another square of wax paper. Make more cr\xeapes with remaining batter, brushing pan lightly with butter as needed. (You will have extra cr\xeapes.)', u'Preheat oven to 400\xb0F.', u'Brush some melted butter on bottom of a large shallow baking pan (1 inch deep). Spread 1/4 cup filling over half of 1 cr\xeape, then fold other half over filling to form a half-moon. Fold half-moon in thirds, overlapping outer sections (see photo, opposite), and transfer to baking pan. Repeat procedure with 11 more cr\xeapes, arranging in 1 layer in baking pan.', u'Brush cr\xeapes generously with remaining melted butter and bake in upper third of oven until outsides are crisp and filling is heated through, about 15 minutes.', u'While cr\xeapes are baking, heat sauce over low heat until hot, about 5 minutes.', u'Put 2 cr\xeapes on each of 6 plates and serve with sauce.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/scallion-wild-rice-crepes-with-mushroom-filling-and-red-pepper-sauce-107348', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 main-course servings', 'recipe title': u'Scallion Wild Rice Crepes with Mushroom Filling and Red Pepper Sauce', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 30 min Start to finish: 1 1/4 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'96%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 large fennel bulbs, preferably with fronds (sometimes called anise; about 2 lb total), fronds reserved and stalks discarded', u'1 large onion, halved lengthwise, one half cut lengthwise into 1/4-inch-thick slices and the other half chopped', u'1/2 teaspoon anchovy paste', u'2 1/2 teaspoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 cup fat-free chicken broth', u'1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon dried hot red pepper flakes', u'1 (14-oz) can whole tomatoes in juice', u'4 (5-oz) skinless sea bass fillets (3/4 inch thick), bones removed'], 'preperation steps': [u'Chop enough fennel fronds, if using, to measure 2 tablespoons. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Anson Mills, the company behind the South's heirloom-grain revival, helped usher this beautiful little pea back into the limelight. Chef Ashley Christensen orders hers from ansonmills.com, though you can substitute dried black-eyed peas and cook them for about 1 1/4 hours.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 cups dried Sea Island red peas or black-eyed peas', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt plus more', u'2 garlic cloves', u'6 sprigs thyme', u'1 fresh bay leaf', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil plus more for drizzling', u'1/2 cup finely chopped celery plus', u'1/2 cup celery leaves from inner stalks', u'1/2 cup finely chopped onion', u'1/2 cup finely chopped red bell pepper', u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter', u'1 teaspoon coriander seeds', u'1/2 cup flat-leaf parsley leaves', u'2 tablespoons thinly sliced chives', u'2 teaspoons finely grated lemon zest', u'Freshly cracked black peppercorns'], 'preperation steps': [u'Place peas in a medium pot; cover with 6 cups water; let soak for 3 hours or overnight.', u'Bring water with peas to a boil (do not drain); boil for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to medium; gently simmer, adding water by 1/2-cupfuls as needed to keep peas covered, until peas are tender but still hold their shape, 20-25 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in 1 teaspoon salt. Season to taste with more salt, if desired. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and chill. Rewarm before continuing, adding more water by 1/4-cupfuls if too thick.', u'Place garlic on a cutting board. Sprinkle with salt and chop, occasionally smearing with the back of a knife, until a coarse paste forms. Tie thyme and bay leaf with kitchen twine to form a bundle for bouquet garni.', u'Heat 1/4 cup oil in a medium pot over medium heat; add garlic paste, bouquet garni, celery, onion, and bell pepper; cook until vegetables are tender, about 15 minutes. Set aside.', u'Toast coriander seeds in a small dry skillet over medium heat, shaking pan often, until fragrant and slightly darker in color, 2-3 minutes. Let cool. Coarsely grind in a spice mill, or place in a resealable plastic bag and crush with a rolling pin or the bottom of a heavy skillet. Combine celery leaves, parsley, chives, lemon zest, and crushed coriander seeds in a small bowl; drizzle with oil and toss to coat. Season to taste with salt and cracked pepper. Divide peas among plates or transfer to a serving bowl; garnish with salad.'], 'chef': u'Ashley Christensen', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/sea-island-red-peas-with-celery-leaf-salad-388667', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 to 10 servings', 'recipe title': u'Sea Island Red Peas with Celery Leaf Salad', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'We have given no-boil lasagne noodles as an alternative to fresh because regular dried lasagne noodles often have curly edges and are too thick.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'89%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/3 cup finely chopped shallot', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped carrot', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped celery', u'1 lb medium shrimp in shells (31 to 35 per lb), peeled, reserving shells, and deveined', u'1 lb sea scallops, tough muscle removed from side of each and reserved', u'5 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened', u'1 teaspoon tomato paste', u'1 cup dry white wine', u'3 cups water', u'1 tablespoon seafood glaze* (optional)', u'2 fresh flat-leaf parsley sprigs', u'3 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'1 cup heavy cream', u'1/2 teaspoon fresh lemon juice, or to taste', u'1 1/2 teaspoons salt', u'1/2 teaspoon black pepper', u'2 tablespoons Cognac', u'1/2 cup finely chopped fresh chives', u'14 (6- by 3-inch) flat fresh or no-boil lasagne noodles (without curly edges)', u'Special equipment: a 3-quart flameproof rectangular casserole dish (about 13 by 9 inches; not glass)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cook shallot, carrot, celery, reserved shrimp shells, and reserved scallop muscles in 3 tablespoons butter in a 2- to 3-quart heavy saucepan over moderately low heat, uncovered, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are softened and pale golden, about 5 minutes. Add tomato paste and cook, stirring, 1 minute. Add wine and boil over high heat, stirring occasionally, until reduced to about 1/4 cup, 6 to 8 minutes. Add water, seafood glaze (if using), and parsley sprigs and simmer, covered, 30 minutes.', u'Discard parsley and pur\xe9e stock, including shrimp shells, in 2 batches in a blender (use caution when blending hot liquids). Pour through a fine-mesh sieve into a bowl, pressing on and discarding solids.', u'Melt remaining 2 tablespoons butter in cleaned saucepan over moderately low heat, then add flour and cook roux over low heat, stirring, 3 minutes. Add warm seafood stock all at once, whisking, and bring to a boil, whisking. Add 1/2 cup cream and gently simmer sauce, whisking occasionally, 10 minutes. Stir in lemon juice, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.', u'Transfer 1/2 cup sauce to a bowl set in a larger bowl of ice and cold water to cool for filling.', u'Cut one third of shrimp and one third of scallops into 1/4-inch pieces and toss with 1/4 teaspoon salt. Pur\xe9e remaining shrimp and scallops in a food processor with Cognac, cooled 1/2 cup sauce, remaining 3/4 teaspoon salt, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Add remaining 1/2 cup cream and pulse just until combined. Transfer mousse to a large bowl and stir in shrimp and scallop pieces and chives.', u'Preheat oven to 375\xb0F.', u'Boil lasagne noodles a few at a time in a large pot of boiling salted water , stirring to separate, until al dente, about 2 minutes for fresh noodles or about 6 minutes for no-boil. Gently transfer noodles with tongs and a slotted spatula to a large bowl of cold water to stop cooking, then lift out, shaking off water, and lay flat on dry kitchen towels (not terry cloth). Spread 1/3 cup mousse over each noodle, leaving a 1/2-inch border on both short ends. Starting with a short end, loosely roll up each noodle.', u'Spread about 1/2 cup sauce on bottom of casserole dish and arrange cannelloni, seam sides down, snugly in 1 layer over sauce. Pour remaining sauce over cannelloni and bake, covered with foil, in middle of oven until sauce is bubbling and filling is just cooked through, 25 to 30 minutes. (To test filling for doneness, insert a metal skewer into a cannelloni and hold it there 5 seconds. Remove skewer and press it against your bottom lip: If metal is warm, casserole is hot all the way through and filling is cooked.)', u'Preheat broiler.', u'Remove foil and broil cannelloni about 3 inches from heat until brown spots appear, 3 to 5 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.', u'Available at some supermarkets, specialty foods shops, and More Than Gourmet (800-860-9395).'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/seafood-cannelloni-107417', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Seafood Cannelloni', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 30 min Start to finish: 1 1/4 hr', 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'67%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/2 cup semolina flour', u'1/2 cup all-purpose flour', u'1 1/3 cups walnuts (4 oz), chopped', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1 stick (1/2 cup) unsalted butter, softened', u'2/3 cup sugar', u'2 teaspoons finely grated fresh orange zest', u'4 large eggs', u'2/3 cup water', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'2 tablespoons fresh orange juice', u'1 tablespoon honey', u'2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice', u'Accompaniment:sour cherry compote'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F.', u'Pulse flours, 1 cup walnuts, and salt in a food processor until nuts are finely chopped.', u'Beat together butter, sugar, and zest in a large bowl with an electric mixer until pale and fluffy. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 hr Start to finish: 2 3/4 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'83%', 'ingredient list': [u'10 oz pearl onions', u'4 medium leeks (white and pale green parts only), cut into 1/2-inch-thick slices', u'2 lb boneless lamb shoulder, cut into 1-inch cubes', u'2 teaspoons salt', u'1/2 teaspoon black pepper', u'5 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'3 1/2 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened', u'2 tablespoons chopped garlic', u'1/2 cup dry white wine', u'1 1/2 tablespoons tomato paste', u'1 cup beef broth', u'1 cup water', u'2 teaspoons chopped fresh thyme', u'5 carrots, cut diagonally into 1/3-inch-thick slices', u'2 medium turnips, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'2 lb russet (baking) potatoes', u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u'1/2 cup milk', u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'Special equipment: a wide 3-quart heavy flameproof casserole (about 2 inches deep; not glass); a potato ricer or a food mill fitted with medium disk'], 'preperation steps': [u'Blanch onions in a 2- to 3-quart pot of boiling salted water 1 minute, then transfer with a slotted spoon to a bowl of cold water to stop cooking. Put lamb and 3 tablespoons flour in a sealable plastic bag, then seal bag and shake to coat lamb.', u'Melt 2 tablespoons butter in casserole dish over moderately high heat until foam subsides, then brown half of lamb, turning, about 6 minutes. Add 1 tablespoon garlic and cook, stirring, 2 minutes. Transfer browned lamb and garlic to a plate with a slotted spoon and repeat with remaining lamb and tablespoon garlic (do not add more butter).', u'Add wine to casserole dish and deglaze by boiling over high heat, stirring and scraping up brown bits, 1 minute, then stir in tomato paste and boil, stirring, until liquid is reduced by half, about 5 minutes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'How do you impart the most flavor in a boil without overcooking the shrimp? Ice! {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Shrimp have glutamic acid, the main taste component of umami. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"The rice needs to stir-fry in a generous amount of oil. (It's fried rice, after all.) {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"This is the ultimate turkey lover's turkey\u2014no bells and whistles, just a succulent bird with crispy skin and plenty of delicious gravy. It's also great for first-timers, since there's no fussing with brines or glazes and no stuffing the cavity. Plus, it's done in under 4 hours.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'92%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 (16-lb) turkey at room temperature 1 hour, any feathers and quills removed with tweezers or needlenose pliers, and neck and giblets removed and reserved for another use if desired', u'1 tablespoon salt', u'1 3/4 teaspoons black pepper', u'2 cups water', u'7 to 8 cups turkey stock', u'1 stick (1/2 cup) unsalted butter', u'3/4 cup all-purpose flour', u'1 1/2 to 2 tablespoons cider vinegar', u'Special equipment: 2 small metal skewers; kitchen string; a 17- by 14-inch flameproof roasting pan with a flat rack; an instant-read thermometer; a 2-qt glass measuring cup'], 'preperation steps': [u'Put oven rack in lowest position and preheat oven to 450\xb0F. Fold neck skin under body and secure with metal skewers, then tie drumsticks together with kitchen string and tuck wings under body.', u'Put turkey on rack in roasting pan. Add 1 cup water to pan and roast without basting, rotating pan halfway through roasting, until thermometer inserted into fleshy part of thighs (test both thighs; do not touch bones) registers 170\xb0F, 2 1/4 to 2 3/4 hours.', u'Carefully tilt turkey so any juices from inside large cavity run into roasting pan, then transfer turkey to a platter, reserving juices in roasting pan. Pour through sieve into measuring cup containing pan juices. Season gravy with salt and pepper, then stir in cider vinegar (to taste).'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/simple-roast-turkey-with-rich-turkey-gravy-236409', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 12 (with leftovers)', 'recipe title': u'Simple Roast Turkey with Rich Turkey Gravy', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Ask for the smallest lamb your butcher has (like those from New Zealand), or buy a 3 1/2-4-pound piece of a leg.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 garlic cloves, crushed', u'2 tablespoons fresh thyme leaves', u'2 tablespoons kosher salt plus more', u'4 fresh bay leaves, divided', u'3 pounds Yukon Gold potatoes (6-8), peeled, cut into 1/4" slices, divided', u'7 tablespoons olive oil, divided', u'Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 3 1/2- to 4-pound bone-in leg of lamb', u'2 pounds tomatoes, cut into 1/4" slices', u'2 medium onions, cut into 1/2" slices', u'2 cups dry white wine'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F.
