{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"For the best texture, don't overwork the meat mixture and use Parmesan that's ground to a fine powder ( use the processor or the rasp side of a box grater). For more heat, add 1/2 to 3/4 teaspoon dried crushed red pepper to the sauce.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'87%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 28-ounce cans whole peeled tomatoes in juice, drained, juice reserved, tomatoes finely chopped', u'1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter', u'2 medium onions, peeled, halved through root end', u'1/2 teaspoon (or more) salt', u'1 cup fresh breadcrumbs made from crustless French or country-style bread', u'1/3 cup whole milk', u'8 ounces ground beef (15% fat)', u'8 ounces ground pork', u'1 cup finely ground (not grated) Parmesan cheese', u'1/3 cup finely chopped Italian parsley', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'2 large eggs', u'2 large garlic cloves, pressed', u'1 pound spaghetti', u'Freshly grated Parmesan cheese (for serving)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Combine tomatoes with juice, butter, onions, and salt in large wide pot. Bring to simmer over medium heat. Reduce heat; simmer uncovered 45 minutes, stirring occasionally. Discard onions. Using immersion blender, process sauce briefly to break up any large pieces of tomato (texture should be even but not completely smooth). Season sauce with more salt and freshly ground black pepper. Remove from heat.', u'Combine breadcrumbs and milk in small bowl; stir until breadcrumbs are evenly moistened. Let stand 10 minutes.', u'Place beef and pork in large bowl and break up into small chunks. Add 1 cup ground Parmesan, parsley, salt, and pepper.', u'Whisk eggs to blend in small bowl; whisk in garlic. Add to meat mixture.', u'Using hands, squeeze milk from breadcrumbs, reserving milk. Add breadcrumbs to meat mixture. Using hands, quickly and gently mix meat mixture just until all ingredients are evenly combined (do not overmix). Chill mixture at least 15 minutes and up to 1 hour.', u'Moisten hands with some of reserved milk from breadcrumbs, then roll meat mixture between palms into golf-ball-size balls, occasionally moistening hands with milk as needed and arranging meatballs in single layer in sauce in pot. Bring to simmer.', u'Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until meatballs are cooked through, 15 to 20 minutes. DO AHEAD: Can be made 2 days ahead. Cool slightly. Chill uncovered until cold, then cover and keep chilled. Rewarm before continuing.', u'Cook spaghetti in large pot of boiling salted water until just tender but still firm to bite, stirring occasionally. Drain.', u'Using slotted spoon, transfer meatballs to platter. Add pasta to sauce in pot and toss to coat. Divide pasta among 6 plates. Top each serving with meatballs. Sprinkle meatballs with freshly grated Parmesan cheese and serve.'], 'chef': u'Molly Wizenberg', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/spaghetti-and-meatballs-361349', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 main-course servings', 'recipe title': u'Spaghetti and Meatballs', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 2 hr Start to finish: 4 hr (includes making fresh pasta)', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'81%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1 1/2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'2 cups whole milk', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'Pinch of freshly grated nutmeg', u'3/4 oz finely grated Pecorino Romano or Parmigiano-Reggiano (about 1/3 cup)', u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 small onion, chopped', u'2 garlic cloves, finely chopped', u'10 oz baby spinach', u'1 3/4 cups ricotta (12 oz fresh or 15 oz supermarket-style)', u'1 large egg, lightly beaten', u'1/2 cup chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley', u'3 oz thinly sliced prosciutto (optional), chopped', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'1 oz finely grated Pecorino Romano or Parmigiano-Reggiano ( 1/2 cup)', u'8 (6- by 4-inch) fresh pasta rectangles lasagne noodles', u'Special equipment: a 13- by 9- by 2-inch ceramic baking dish or other shallow 3-qt flameproof baking dish (not glass)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Melt butter in a 1 1/2- to 2-quart heavy saucepan over moderately low heat. Whisk in flour and cook roux, whisking, 2 minutes. Add milk in a stream, whisking, and bring to a boil over high heat, whisking constantly (sauce will thicken). Reduce heat and simmer, whisking occasionally, 2 minutes, then whisk in salt, pepper, and nutmeg. Remove from heat and whisk in cheese, then cover pan.', u'Heat oil in a 5- to 6-quart heavy pot over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then saut\xe9 onion and garlic, stirring occasionally, until lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Add spinach and saut\xe9, stirring, until just wilted, about 3 minutes. Remove from heat and cool completely.', u'Stir together ricotta, egg, parsley, prosciutto (if using), salt, pepper, and 1/3 cup cheese in a bowl, then stir in spinach mixture.', u'Boil pasta 2 pieces at a time in a 6- to 8-quart pot of boiling salted water , stirring to separate, until just tender, about2 minutes for fresh pasta or about 6 minutes for oven-ready noodles. Gently transfer with a slotted spoon to a large bowl of cold water to stop cooking, then remove from bowl, shaking off water, and lay flat on kitchen towels (not terry cloth). Pat dry with paper towels. Trim oven-ready noodles (if using) as closely as possible to 6 1/4- by 5 1/2-inch rectangles.', u'Preheat oven to 425\xb0F.', u'Spread 2/3 cup sauce in buttered baking dish. Spread about 1/3 cup ricotta filling in a line along 1 short side of 1 pasta rectangle, then roll up to enclose filling. Transfer, seam side down, to baking dish. Make 7 more cannelloni in same manner, arranging snugly in 1 layer. Spread 1/2 cup more sauce over cannelloni and sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake, covered with foil, in middle of oven until sauce is bubbling, about 20 minutes.', u'Turn on broiler.', u'Remove foil and broil cannelloni about 5 inches from heat until lightly browned, 2 to 4 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Reheat remaining sauce and serve on the side.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/spinach-and-cheese-cannelloni-107789', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 first-course or 4 main-course servings', 'recipe title': u'Spinach and Cheese Cannelloni', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Hor Neung Pla Duk', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'78%', 'ingredient list': [u"1 lb banana leaves, thawed if frozen (see cooks' note, below)", u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 tablespoons Thai red curry paste', u'3 tablespoons Thai chicken stock or canned chicken broth', u'2 tablespoons nam pla (Asian fish sauce; preferably Thai)', u'1 1/2 lb catfish fillets, cut into 1-inch cubes', u'1 1/2 tablespoons toasted rice powder', u'3 (4-inch-long) fresh or frozen Kaffir lime leaves (sometimes called bai makroot), very thinly sliced', u'Special equipment: a large (6-qt) wok with lid; a heatproof plate (just small enough to fit inside steamer rack); a large steamer rack'], 'preperation steps': [u"Unfold banana leaves. Cut off and reserve tough center rib that runs along bottom edge of each leaf with kitchen shears. Cut ribs into 12-inch strips (you'll need 8) for tying packets. Gently cut leaves into 8 (10-inch) squares with shears, being careful not to split them (you may want to cut a few extra in case some split while folding). Gently wash banana leaf squares in a large pan of water, then pat dry.", u'Heat oil in wok over moderate heat until warm, about 30 seconds, then cook curry paste, stirring constantly, until very fragrant and a shade darker, 1 to 2 minutes. Add stock and fish sauce and bring to a boil over high heat, stirring. Add fish and rice powder and stir-fry until outside of fish just turns white, 1 to 2 minutes, then transfer mixture to a bowl.', u'Put a banana leaf square on a work surface, then put 1/3 cup fish curry in center of square and sprinkle with some of sliced Kaffir lime leaves. Fold 2 sides of banana leaf over fish to enclose it (be careful not to split leaf), then fold in opposite sides to form a packet. Tie packet with a strip of banana leaf rib and transfer to heatproof plate. Assemble 7 more packets in same manner, arranging in 1 layer on plate.', u'Bring 1 inch water to a boil in wok fitted with steamer rack. Transfer plate with packets to steamer rack carefully and steam, covered with lid, 5 minutes. Serve packets warm or at room temperature.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/steamed-catfish-in-banana-leaves-109435', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings (as part of larger meal)', 'recipe title': u'Steamed Catfish in Banana Leaves', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Pea shoots are the young, tender tips and vines of the snow pea or the sugar snap pea plant. Once your plants are established and producing an abundance of pods, clip off leaf and tendril sections about 4 inches (10 cm) long. If you don't have your own plants, look for these tender shoots at farmers' markets or Asian grocery stores. Sambal oelek (or ulek) is an Indonesian chile paste, and tart, citrusy kaffir lime leaves are used in Southeast Asian cooking. Look for both products in Asian markets.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'kosher salt', u'sugar snap peas, 6 oz (185 g), trimmed', u'English peas, 1 cup (5 oz/155 g) shelled', u'pearl barley, 1/2 cup (3 1/2 oz/105 g)', u'rice vinegar, 2 tbsp', u'soy sauce, 2 tbsp', u'golden brown sugar, 1 tbsp firmly packed', u'sambal oelek or other pure chile paste, 1 tsp', u'Asian sesame oil, 1 tbsp', u'green garlic, 1/4 cup (3/4 oz/20 g) thinly sliced, or 4 cloves garlic, minced', u'green onions, 1/4 cup (1/4 oz/20 g) sliced', u'fresh kaffir lime leaves, 2', u'pea shoots, about 1/4 lb (125 g)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Bring a large saucepan half full of salted water to a boil over high heat. Add the snap peas and peas and cook until tender-crisp, about 1 minute. Using a slotted spoon, transfer the vegetables to a colander and rinse under cold water. Set aside. Return the saucepan to a boil, add the barley and cook until tender, about 45 minutes. Drain and set aside.', u'In a small bowl, whisk together the rice vinegar, soy sauce, 2 tbsp water, brown sugar, and sambal oelek until blended. In a large, heavy frying pan over high heat, warm the sesame oil. Add the green garlic, green onions, and lime leaves and stir-fry until the green onions are tender, about 30 seconds. Add the reserved snap peas, peas, and barley along with the pea shoots, and stir to coat. Pour in the soy sauce mixture and stir and toss until the peas and pea shoots are tender and the liquid is absorbed, about 4 minutes. Transfer to a warmed serving dish and serve.'], 'chef': u'Jeanne Kelley', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/three-peas-with-barley-chile-green-garlic-51166410', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 servings ', 'recipe title': u'Three Peas with Barley, Chile & Green Garlic', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'A 4-ounce fillet of mild-tasting tilapia has only 108 calories.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: 436 calories, 15 g fat, 8 g saturated, 28 g carbohydrates, 4 g fiber, 39 g protein\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Self', 'recommendation': u'57%', 'ingredient list': [u'Vegetable oil cooking spray', u'4 U.S.-farmed tilapia fillets (5 ounces each)', u'1 teaspoon salt, divided', u'1/2 cup fresh lemon juice', u'4 teaspoons capers', u'12 ounces snap peas', u'1 pound red potatoes, cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'4 tablespoons unsalted butter, cut into 4 pieces', u'1 cup white wine, divided', u'1 lemon, cut into 4 wedges'], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat grill. Fold four 18-inch-long pieces of foil in half; unfold and coat inside with cooking spray. Season tilapia with 1/2 teaspoon salt; place 1 fillet in center of 1 half of each piece of foil. Sprinkle each fillet with 2 tablespoons lemon juice and 1 teaspoon capers. Toss snap peas with potatoes and remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt; divide evenly among packets. Dot each fillet with 1 tablespoon butter. Fold foil to close and crimp 2 sides of each packet, leaving 1 side open; pour 1/4 cup wine into each packet. Crimp third side of packets to seal; place on grill; close lid; cook until packets are fully puffed, 12 minutes. Carefully cut foil to open. Serve with lemon wedges.'], 'chef': u'Marge Perry', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/tilapia-piccata-with-snap-peas-365832', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 servings', 'recipe title': u'Tilapia Piccata with Snap Peas', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"When I was a kid and my mom made tomato soup, she would cut buttered toast into squares and float them on top of each bowl. My twist on Mom's toast is to make brown butter croutons, though when I'm really feeling feisty I go all the way and make grilled cheese croutons to float on the soup.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'91%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter', u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'1 medium onion, thinly sliced', u'3 garlic cloves, smashed with the side of a knife and peeled', u'5 cups canned whole tomatoes in juice', u'1 cup water', u'2/3 cup heavy cream', u'2 teaspoons kosher salt, plus more as needed', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, plus more as needed', u'1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes', u'1/4 teaspoon celery seed', u'1/4 teaspoon dried oregano or 1/2 teaspoon finely chopped fresh oregano', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'4 slices european-style rustic bread, crusts removed, cut into 3/4- to 1-inch cubes (30 to 36 cubes)', u'Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Heat the butter and olive oil in a large saucepan and saut\xe9 the onion and garlic until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the tomatoes, water, cream, salt, red pepper flakes, celery seed, oregano, and sugar. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to a simmer and simmer for 15 minutes.', u'2. Remove from the heat and puree in batches in the container of a blender. Return the soup to the pot and reheat to a simmer, seasoning to taste with more salt and pepper.', u'3. Meanwhile, to make the brown butter croutons, preheat the oven to 350\xb0F. Heat the butter in a small pan over medium heat and cook, stirring often, until the butter is golden brown and aromatic, about 3 minutes after the butter melts. Remove from the heat. Put the bread cubes in a bowl and pour the brown butter over them, tossing to coat. Season to taste with salt and pepper and toss again. Spread the bread cubes on a baking sheet and place it in the oven. Bake until the croutons are toasted and golden, about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove the pan from the oven.', u'4. Serve the soup hot, garnished with the croutons.'], 'chef': u'Tom Douglas and Shelley Lance', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/toms-tasty-tomato-soup-with-brown-butter-croutons-51129200', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u"Tom's Tasty Tomato Soup with Brown Butter Croutons", 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Consomm\xe9 avec Petites Profiteroles', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'75%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 large egg whites plus shells, crushed', u'1 lb plum tomatoes, quartered', u'1 lb celery (5 to 6 large ribs), cut into 1-inch pieces', u'1/2 lb lean ground sirloin', u'1 tablespoon kosher salt', u'20 black peppercorns, cracked', u'6 cups veal stock', u'Accompaniment: tiny choux puffs', u'Garnish: celery leaves and diced seeded peeled tomatoes'], 'preperation steps': [u'Whisk egg whites in a large bowl until foamy and add eggshells. Heat over moderately high heat, stirring and scraping bottom constantly with a wooden spoon to prevent egg white from sticking, until stock comes to a simmer (this will take about 20 minutes). Reduce heat and gently simmer broth, without stirring, until all impurities rise to surface and form a crust, and broth underneath is clear, about 30 minutes.', u"Ladle broth with crust into a large sieve lined with a double thickness of dampened paper towels set over a large bowl and let all liquid drain through. (If liquid doesn't drain completely, tap edge of sieve repeatedly with a metal spoon to help drain.) Broth should be completely clear; if it's not, repeat procedure with clean dampened paper towels. Discard solids.", u'Before serving, bring consomm\xe9 to a boil and season with salt. Ladle into bowls and top with profiteroles and garnishes.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/tomato-and-celery-infused-beef-consomme-with-tiny-choux-puffs-105485', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings (about 6 cups)', 'recipe title': u'Tomato and Celery-Infused Beef Consomm\xe9 with Tiny Choux Puffs', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Most turkey breasts are sold with the bone and skin still attached. Another option is to ask your butcher to bone it for you \u2014 the weight of the turkey breast without the bone should be 4 to 5 pounds.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'90%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 medium onion, finely chopped', u'1 pound fennel (sometimes called anise), stalks and fronds cut off and discarded, then bulbs cut into 1/4-inch dice', u'2 celery ribs, cut into 1/4-inch dice', u'2 teaspoons salt', u'1/2 cup golden raisins', u'2 egg matzos (about 6 inches square), broken into 1/2-inch pieces', u'1 large egg, lightly beaten', u'1/3 cup finely chopped fresh parsley', u'1 1/2 teaspoons black pepper', u'1 1/2 teaspoons fennel seedstoasted and ground in an electric coffee/spice grinder', u'1 (6- to 7-pound) whole turkey breast (bone and skin attached)', u'1 3/4 cups low-sodium chicken broth (14 fluid ounces)', u'1 teaspoon potato starch', u'Special equipment: kitchen string; an instant-read thermometer'], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat 3 tablespoons oil in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then saut\xe9 onion, stirring occasionally, until golden, about 5 minutes. Transfer vegetables to a bowl to cool.', u'Soak raisins in boiling-hot water to cover 5 minutes, then drain well and chop. Add to vegetables.', u'Rinse matzo in a colander under hot running water until softened, 15 to 30 seconds. Drain, pressing gently on matzo to extract excess water. Add to vegetables along with egg, parsley, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper and stir until combined.', u'Stir together 1 tablespoon oil, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon pepper, and ground fennel seed in a small bowl.', u'See No Bones About It.', u'Arrange 1 breast half, skinned side down, lengthwise on work surface, with thinner, pointed end nearest you. Starting at top (thicker part), cut breast half lengthwise down middle, but not all the way through to work surface, with a boning knife or a sharp, small knife, stopping about 1 inch from end closest to you. Then, turning knife horizontally, cut turkey breast open on either side like a book jacket, beginning at lengthwise cut, to form 2 flaps. Open flaps, then put butterflied breast between 2 sheets of plastic wrap.', u'Pound turkey with flat side of a meat pounder or with a rolling pin until 1/2 inch thick. Butterfly and flatten remaining breast half.', u'Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 375\xb0F.', u"Remove top sheet of plastic wrap from 1 breast half and pat turkey dry. Arrange with a short side nearest you and season with 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Mound half of stuffing in center, leaving a 1-inch border on each long side. Fold short end nearest you over stuffing to enclose, gently pressing on filling, then roll to form a cylinder (don't roll too tight, or filling will slip out of ends). Tie rolled turkey breast crosswise at 1-inch intervals with kitchen string. Season remaining turkey breast half with remaining 1/4 teaspoon each of salt and pepper, then stuff, roll, and tie in same manner.", u'Rub fennel oil all over roasts to coat. Heat remaining 2 tablespoons oil in a large heavy flameproof roasting pan straddled across 2 burners on moderately high heat. Add roasts (position 1 roast over each burner) and sear, turning with tongs, until golden brown on all sides, about 6 minutes total. Cover pan tightly with foil and roast turkey in oven until a thermometer inserted diagonally 2 inches into center of each roast (to touch stuffing) registers 165\xb0F, 35 to 40 minutes. Transfer roasts to a cutting board and let stand, loosely covered with foil, 10 minutes before slicing.', u'While roasts stand, straddle roasting pan across 2 burners on moderately high heat, then add 1 1/2 cups broth and deglaze by boiling, stirring, and scraping up brown bits, until liquid is reduced to about 1 cup, 2 to 3 minutes. Whisk together remaining 1/4 cup broth and potato starch and whisk into sauce, then boil, whisking, until slightly thickened, 1 to 2 minutes. Pour sauce through a fine-mesh sieve into a sauceboat and skim off any fat. Serve turkey with sauce.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/turkey-breast-stuffed-with-matzo-and-fennel-109320', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 10 to 12 servings', 'recipe title': u'Turkey Breast Stuffed with Matzo and Fennel', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 1/4 hr Start to finish: 2 1/4 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 (2 1/2- to 3-lb) turkey breast half (with bones and skin)', u'1 qt chicken broth', u'2 to 2 1/2 qt water', u'1 (6-oz) can tuna packed in olive oil, drained', u'3 large anchovy fillets', u'3/4 cup mayonnaise', u'1/3 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'3 to 4 tablespoons fresh lemon juice (to taste)', u'1 tablespoon water', u'1 lb haricots verts (thin French green beans), trimmed', u'2 lb small (1 1/2- to 2-inch) red potatoes, peeled and quartered', u'2 tablespoons bottled capers, rinsed and drained', u'1/2 cup Kalamata or other brine-cured black olives, pitted and quartered lengthwise', u'Garnish: small fresh basil leaves'], 'preperation steps': [u'Put turkey breast in a 6- to 8-quart pasta pot and add broth and enough water to cover turkey by 1 inch. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Though 4 pounds of brisket may seem like a lot, remember that this cut of meat loses some weight in cooking; one advantage of leaner first-cut brisket is that there's less shrinkage, but remember you'll pay more for the privilege.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'50%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 onions, peeled and quartered', u'2 large potatoes, scrubbed and cut into 1-inch-thick wedges', u'1 large carrot, peeled and cut into 2-inch pieces', u'1 fennel bulb, cut into 1 1/2-inch-thick wedges', u'1 garlic head, unpeeled, sliced in half crosswise', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon kosher salt, divided', u'1 1/2 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper, divided', u'1 tablespoon finely ground Turkish coffee or espresso', u'1 tablespoon smoked cinnamon (available from www.laboiteny.com) or regular cinnamon', u'1 teaspoon ground cardamom', u'One 3 1/2- to 4-pound brisket, (first or second cut; Solomonov prefers well-marbled second cut)', u'Heavy, large roasting pan'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 400\xb0F. Place onions, potatoes, carrot, fennel, and garlic in a heavy roasting pan. Toss with olive oil, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. In a small bowl, combine coffee, cinnamon, cardamom, remaining 1 tablespoon salt, and 1 teaspoon pepper. Rub all over brisket and nestle brisket into vegetables to rest on bottom of pan. Roast until vegetables are lightly browned, 45 minutes.', u'Cover tightly with foil, lower oven to 300\xb0F, and roast until fork-tender (you should be able to insert a roasting fork in the center and twist slightly with little resistance), 4 1/2 to 5 hours for first cut and 5 1/2 to 6 hours for second cut. As the brisket cooks, check on it every 45 minutes, adding 1/4 cup water to the pan if it starts to look dry. When the brisket is cooked, remove roasting pan from oven, cool to room temperature, and refrigerate with the vegetables until fat is solid, 8 to 24 hours. Transfer brisket to a cutting board and slice across the grain. Skim and discard fat in the roasting pan. Return brisket slices to the roasting pan with the vegetables and cooking juices.', u'To serve, preheat oven to 300\xb0F. Transfer roasting pan to oven and heat brisket until liquid is melted and brisket and vegetables are just warmed through, 15 to 20 minutes. Transfer the brisket and vegetables to a serving dish, cover with foil, and reserve. Set the roasting pan over two burners on the stovetop and simmer the liquid over medium heat until thickened, 10 to 15 minutes. Pour the thickened pan juices over the brisket and serve.'], 'chef': u'hael Solomonov', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/turkish-coffee-rubbed-brisket-51250890', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 to 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Turkish Coffee-Rubbed Brisket', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'For a lemony twist, reduce the vanilla extract to 3/4 teaspoon and add 1 1/4 teaspoons finely grated lemon peel.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'43%', 'ingredient list': [u'10 tablespoons (1 1/4 sticks) unsalted butter, room temperature', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 large egg', u'1 1/4 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'2 cups all purpose flour', u'Sprinkles or other sugar decorations (optional)', u'Royal Icing (optional)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Using electric mixer, beat butter in large bowl at medium speed until smooth and creamy, about 2 minutes. Add sugar and salt and beat until pale and fluffy, about 2 minutes. Add egg; beat until well blended, about 1 minute. Reduce speed to low and beat in vanilla. Add flour and beat on low speed just to blend. Gather dough into ball; divide in half. Form each half into ball and flatten into disk. Wrap disks separately in plastic and chill until firm, at least 4 hours. DO AHEAD: Can be made 2 days ahead. Keep chilled.', u'Position rack in center of oven; preheat to 350\xb0F. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. Working with 1 disk at a time, roll out dough between 2 sheets of waxed paper to 1/8-inch thickness for smaller (2-inch) cookies and 1/4-inch thickness for larger (3- to 4-inch) cookies. Using decorative cookie cutters, cut out cookies and transfer to prepared sheets, spacing 1 inch apart. If cookies become too soft to transfer to baking sheets, place in freezer on waxed paper for 5 minutes before continuing. Gather scraps, roll out dough, and cut more cookies, repeating until all dough is used. If not icing cookies, decorate with sprinkles or other sugar toppings, if desired.', u'Bake 1 sheet at a time until cookies are firm on top and golden around edges, about 10 minutes for smaller cookies and up to 14 minutes for larger cookies. Cool completely on rack. Decorate with Royal Icing, then sprinkles or other sugar toppings, if desired. Let stand until icing sets. DO AHEAD: Can be made 4 days ahead. Store between sheets of waxed paper in airtight containers.'], 'chef': u'ie Greenspan', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/vanilla-roll-out-cookies-240670', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes about 40 small or 15 large cookies', 'recipe title': u'Vanilla Roll-Out Cookies', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Brown rice is not traditionally used for sushi in Japan, but since it's such a healthy whole grain, we've decided to bend the rules. You'll have leftover vegetables, which are great for salads.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'88%', 'ingredient list': [u'Scant 2/3 cup short-grain brown rice*', u'1 cup plus 1 teaspoon water', u'2 teaspoons soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons seasoned rice vinegar**', u'1 teaspoon wasabi powder**', u'2 (8 1/4- by 7 1/4-inch) sheets roasted nori** (dried laver)', u'1/2 Kirby cucumber, peeled, seeded, and cut into 1/16-inch-thick matchsticks', u'1/2 carrot, cut into 1/16-inch-thick matchsticks', u'1/2 firm-ripe small California avocado', u'3/4 oz radish sprouts*, roots trimmed', u'Special equipment: a bamboo sushi mat**', u'Accompaniments: soy sauce for dipping; sliced gari ** (pickled ginger)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Rinse rice well and bring to a boil with 1 cup water and 1 teaspoon soy sauce in a 1- to 1 1/2-quart heavy saucepan, then reduce heat to very low and simmer, tightly covered, until water is absorbed, about 40 minutes. Remove from heat and let rice stand, covered, 10 minutes.', u'While rice is standing, stir together vinegar and remaining teaspoon soy sauce.', u'Transfer rice to a wide nonmetal bowl (preferably wood, ceramic, or glass) and sprinkle with vinegar mixture, tossing gently with a large spoon to combine. Cool rice, tossing occasionally, about 15 minutes.', u'Stir together wasabi and remaining teaspoon water to form a stiff paste. Let stand at least 15 minutes (to allow flavors to develop).', u'Place sushi mat on a work surface with slats running crosswise. Arrange 1 sheet nori, shiny side down, on mat, lining up a long edge of sheet with edge of mat nearest you. Using damp fingers, gently press half of rice (about 3/4 cup) onto nori in 1 layer, leaving a 1 3/4-inch border on side farthest from you.', u'Arrange half of cucumber in an even strip horizontally across rice, starting 1 inch from side nearest you. (You may need to cut pieces to fit from side to side.) Arrange half of carrot just above cucumber in same manner. Peel avocado half and cut lengthwise into thin slices, then arrange half of slices just above carrot in same manner. Repeat with radish sprouts, letting some sprout tops extend beyond edge.', u'Beginning with edge nearest you, lift mat up with your thumbs, holding filling in place with your fingers, and fold mat over filling so that upper and lower edges of rice meet, then squeeze gently but firmly along length of roll, tugging edge of mat farthest from you to tighten. (Nori border will still be flat on mat.) Open mat and roll log forward to seal with nori border. (Moisture from rice will seal roll.) Transfer roll, seam side down, to a cutting board. Make second log in same manner, then cut each log crosswise into 6 pieces with a wet thin-bladed knife. Serve with wasabi paste, soy sauce, and ginger.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/vegetarian-brown-rice-sushi-rolls-109641', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 1 serving', 'recipe title': u'Vegetarian Brown Rice Sushi Rolls', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 1/4 hr Start to finish: 2 1/2 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'67%', 'ingredient list': [u'2/3 cup yellow cornmeal', u'1/3 cup all-purpose flour', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon baking powder', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'5 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted and cooled', u'2 tablespoons milk', u'1 large egg', u'About 2 tablespoons Dijon mustard', u'1/4 lb sliced cooked Virginia country ham*, cut into 1 1/2- by 1/3-inch strips', u'1/2 cup melon apple chutney', u'Special equipment: a 1 1/2-inch round cookie cutter'], 'preperation steps': [u'Put oven rack in middle position and preheat to 350\xb0F.', u'Whisk together cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 45 min Start to finish: 1 3/4 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'84%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 pints firm small red and yellow cherry tomatoes', u'1/2 cup vodka', u'3 tablespoons white-wine vinegar', u'1 tablespoon superfine granulated sugar', u'1 teaspoon finely grated fresh lemon zest', u'3 tablespoons kosher salt', u'1 1/2 tablespoons coarsely ground black pepper'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cut a small X in skin of blossom end of each tomato. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 3/4 hr Start to finish: 5 hr', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'88%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 cups yellow cornmeal (not coarse)', u'7 1/2 cups water', u'2 3/4 teaspoons salt', u'2 1/2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1/4 teaspoon cinnamon', u'1/4 teaspoon paprika', u'1/4 teaspoon cayenne', u'1/2 cup raw green (hulled) pumpkin seeds (pepitas)', u"1 tablespoon fresh pomegranate juice (see cooks' note, below) or cranberry juice cocktail", u'2 teaspoons Sherry vinegar', u'1 tablespoon minced shallot', u'6 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 small cheese pumpkin or butternut squash (2 lb), peeled, quartered lengthwise, and seeded', u'1 (6-oz) piece Parmigiano-Reggiano', u'8 oz arugula, trimmed'], 'preperation steps': [u'Bring cornmeal, water, and 2 1/4 teaspoons salt to a boil in a 4-quart heavy saucepan, stirring constantly. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This is a variation on the Sicilian classic gelo di melone, which is steeped with jasmine flowers. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 hr Start to finish: 3 1/4 hr (includes chilling)', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'57%', 'ingredient list': [u'3/4 cup sugar', u'1/4 cup water', u'1 teaspoon finely grated fresh lemon zest', u'5 cups coarsely chopped seeded watermelon (from a 4-lb piece, rind discarded)', u'2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, or to taste', u'1/4 cup packed fresh basil leaves', u'1 1/2 cups dry white wine', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1 teaspoon finely grated fresh lemon zest', u'1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons water', u'2 teaspoons unflavored gelatin (from 1 envelope)', u'2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, or to taste', u'Special equipment: an ice cream maker'], 'preperation steps': [u'Bring sugar, water, and zest to a boil in a 2-quart heavy saucepan, stirring until sugar is dissolved, then reduce heat and simmer, without stirring, washing down any sugar crystals on side of pan with a pastry brush dipped in cold water, 2 minutes.', u'Put watermelon in a blender, then add syrup and lemon juice and blend until smooth. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"As anyone who knows me will testify, my body is a temple. A Buddhist temple. Friends have cruelly suggested I had been in training for the following events in the London 2012 Olympic Games\u2014the diabetics and the paralytics. In response, I thought I could kill two birds with one stone by undergoing an eight-day hunger strike outside the home of the prime minister in protest about the lack of equal parenting rights in the UK. By Day 6, an armed response team were protecting David Cameron's refrigerator and I would have killed for a quiche. I knew licorice had to be in the book after I began hallucinating about a character made from assorted licorice candies. The Prime Minister subsequently sent me a letter as slippery as his preelection commitments.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 1/2 ounces black licorice sticks, gently crushed', u'1 cup whole milk', u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u'2 egg yolks', u'1/3 cup plus 1 tablespoon superfine or granulated sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'few drops of natural black food coloring'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Put the licorice in a saucepan with 1/2 cup of water and place over low heat for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the licorice has melted.', u'2. Meanwhile, pour the milk and cream into a large saucepan and heat gently, stirring occasionally, until the mixture begins to steam but not boil.', u'3. Whisk the egg yolks in a heatproof bowl until smooth. Add the sugar and vanilla and whisk until pale and slightly fluffy. Gradually and slowly, pour the hot milk into the egg mixture while whisking continuously to prevent the eggs from scrambling. Return the mixture to the saucepan, place over low heat, stir in the melted licorice, and heat until the custard thinly coats the back of a wooden spoon. Do not let boil. Add the black food coloring to desired effect.', u'4. Pour back into the bowl and set aside for about 30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until cooled to room temperature. For more rapid chilling, fill a sink halfway with cold water and ice and place the bowl of mixture in it for 20 minutes. Never put the hot mixture into the refrigerator.', u"5. Once cooled, cover the mixture and refrigerate, ideally overnight, but at least for 6 hours, until thoroughly chilled (at least 40\xb0F). Pour the chilled mixture into an ice cream machine and churn according to the manufacturer's instructions.", u'6. When the churning is complete, use a spoon or spatula to scrape the ice cream into a freezer-proof container with a lid. Freeze until it reaches the correct scooping texture (at least 2 hours).'], 'chef': u"Matt O'Connor", 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/black-ice-licorice-ice-cream-51187410', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'About 2 cups', 'recipe title': u'Black Ice Licorice Ice Cream', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This variation on the traditional method has never failed me. I learned it at the Memphis in May World Championship Barbecue event more than two decades ago from an Arkansas cook. It\'s simple. Place a partially smoked pork butt in a paper grocery bag and finish cooking by slow smoking it. The paper absorbs some of the grease and keeps the meat from drying out. People ask me, "Won\'t the bag catch on fire?" The bag will be saturated with pork fat, but a bag fire hasn\'t happened to me yet. For true Southern pork butt, go with hickory wood. However, I like to use fruitwood\u2014maybe even peach or cherry\u2014mixed with pecan. Because pork butt slow smokes for 6 hours, this is not a recipe to try on a gas grill.', 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 tablespoons freshly ground black pepper', u'1 teaspoon fine sea salt', u'One 5-pound (or more) bone-in pork shoulder', u'2 cups wood chips, soaked in water and drained', u'Barbecue sauce of your choice (optional)'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Mix the pepper and salt together and rub it on all surfaces of the pork. Set aside while you build the fire.', u'2. Fill your charcoal chimney with briquets, set the chimney on the bottom grill grate, and light or prepare a fire in your smoker. Oil the grill grate.', u'3. When the coals are ready, dump them into the bottom of your grill, and spread them evenly across half. Scatter the wood chips on the hot coals. Place the butt on the indirect side of the grill across from the coals. Increase the temperature to 350\xb0F by opening the bottom vents on your grill. When the smoke starts to rise, close the lid. Place a candy thermometer in the lid vent. Smoke for 30 to 45 minutes to get the bark started.', u"4. Reduce the temperature by closing the vents until you're at 225\xb0F to 250\xb0F. Smoke the pork for 4 hours. Place the butt in a brown paper grocery bag large enough to hold it, fold the ends over to close it, and return it to the same place in the smoker, opposite the fire. Add more briquets if necessary, and close the lid. Continue smoking for 2 to 4 more hours or until tender. Check for tenderness by pulling a piece of meat off and tasting it. The mark of a shoulder done to perfection is when you can remove the blade bone by pulling it out with your hand.", u"5. When the shoulder is done, set it aside in a pan to rest for 30 minutes, then move it to a cutting board. Serve it Southern-style pulled (stringy portions torn off by hand), Kansas City-style thick sliced, or the-hell-with-it chopped. Some barbecuers like to mix in a little tangy barbecue sauce as they're chopping and combining the meat on a platter, especially if the pork is still a little fatty."], 'chef': u'Ardie A. Davis', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/butt-in-a-bag-354391', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 10', 'recipe title': u'Butt in a Bag', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"It's important to use large lettuce leaves (about 6 inches) for this salad, so you may need to buy 2 heads of lettuce in order to get 6 good leaves.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 ounces dried rice-stick noodles (rice vermicelli)', u'1 1/2 tablespoons rice vinegar (not seasoned)', u'1 1/2 teaspoons sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 cup plus 1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'2 (6- to 7-ounce) confit duck legs, meat (with skin attached) removed from bone in large pieces', u'1 large shallot, thinly sliced crosswise and separated into rings (1/3 cup)', u'1 (6-inch) piece seedless cucumber (usually plastic-wrapped), peeled', u'1 firm-ripe medium peach or nectarine, halved lengthwise and pitted', u'6 large Boston lettuce leaves', u'24 fresh mint leaves', u'24 fresh cilantro leaves', u'18 Thai basil leaves or small Italian basil leaves', u'Special equipment: a Japanese Benriner or other adjustable-blade slicer', u'Accompaniment: sweet chile dipping sauce and/or nuoc cham'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cook noodles in a 4-quart pot of boiling salted water until just tender, 2 to 3 minutes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'"Don\'t dump a bunch of sauce on your crispy skin\u2014 you\'ll ruin it. Put your sauce on the plate and place the fillet on top."\u2014Donald Link', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'50%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 6 ounces fillets branzino or black bass', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'Kosher salt'], 'preperation steps': [u"Starting with parched skin is the key to a pro result\u2014 try to cook wet fish and it's going to steam, stick, rip, and generally be a huge, frustrating bummer. One hour before cooking, put your fillets on a plate, skin side up (no seasoning, please!), and leave them uncovered in the fridge to dry out.", u'Get a large stainlesssteel skillet ripping hot over high heat (2 minutes should do it), then pour in 1 tablespoon oil and add a big pinch of salt. Once the oil is smoking, take the skillet off the heat and use a handful of paper towels to wipe oil and salt around and out of the pan (be extra careful\u2014you might want to use tongs to hold the towels).', u'Put your now-seasoned skillet back over high heat and take those beautiful air-dried fillets out of the fridge. Add another 1 tablespoon oil to the pan and hit both sides of each fillet with a decent amount of salt. Once the oil is shimmering, carefully lay a fillet skin side down in the pan (be sure to lay them going away from you to guard against spatters).', u'Use a fish spatula (call it a "fish spat" if you want to sound like a pro) to apply firm, even pressure to the fillet until it relaxes and lies flat. Repeat with remaining fillet, then keep at it! Periodically press down each fillet and cook until flesh is nearly opaque and cooked through, with just a small raw area on top.', u"Slide your fish spatula under each fillet and\u2014using your other hand as a guide\u2014turn it away from you (watch that oil). Remove the pan from heat. At this point you're just letting the raw side kiss the skillet to finish cooking, about 1 minute."], 'chef': u'ald Link, Chef P\xeache, New Orleans', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/crispy-skinned-fish-56389401', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'2 Servings', 'recipe title': u'Crispy-Skinned Fish', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"'80S THE COSBY SHOW", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'89%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 oz dried ancho chiles (4 large), stemmed and seeded', u'6 large garlic cloves, 3 of them finely chopped', u'1 tablespoon salt, or to taste', u'1 1/2 tablespoons ground cumin', u'1 1/2 tablespoons chili powder (not pure chile)', u'4 lb well-marbled beef brisket or boneless chuck, trimmed and cut into 1 1/2- to 2-inch pieces', u'3 to 4 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 (28- to 32-oz) can whole tomatoes in juice', u'1/4 cup canned chipotle chiles in adobo', u'1/2 cup coarsely chopped fresh cilantro', u'1 1/2 lb white onions, chopped (4 cups)', u'1 tablespoon dried oregano (preferably Mexican), crumbled', u'1 to 4 fresh serrano or other small green chiles, finely chopped, including seeds (1 is fine for most tastes; 4 is the eight-alarm version)', u'1 (12-oz) bottle beer (not dark)', u'2 cups water', u'2 1/2 cups cooked pinto beans (optional; 30 oz), rinsed if canned', u'Accompaniments: cubed avocado; chopped white onion; shredded Cheddar; chopped fresh cilantro; sour cream'], 'preperation steps': [u'Soak ancho chiles in hot water to cover until softened, about 30 minutes. Pat beef dry and toss with spice mixture in a large bowl until coated.', u'Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a wide 6- to 7-quart heavy pot over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then brown beef in 3 or 4 batches, without crowding, turning occasionally, about 5 minutes per batch (lower heat as needed; spice mixture burns easily). Transfer beef as browned to another bowl. (Do not clean pot.)', u'Pur\xe9e anchos in a blender along with tomatoes (including juice), chipotles in adobo, cilantro, remaining 2 whole garlic cloves, and remaining 1/2 tablespoon salt until smooth.', u'Add enough oil to fat in pot to total 3 tablespoons, then cook onions and chopped garlic over moderate heat, stirring and scraping up brown bits from beef, until softened, 8 to 10 minutes. Add oregano, remaining tablespoon cumin, and remaining tablespoon chili powder and cook, stirring, 2 minutes. Add chile pur\xe9e and 1 chopped serrano and simmer, stirring, 5 minutes. Stir in beer, water, and beef along with any juices accumulated in bowl and gently simmer, partially covered, stirring occasionally and checking often to make sure chili is not scorching, 2 hours.', u'Taste sauce, then add more serrano if desired and continue to simmer, partially covered, until beef is very tender and sauce is slightly thickened, 1 to 2 hours more. (If chili becomes very thick before meat is tender, thin with water as needed.)', u'Coarsely shred meat (still in pot) with 2 forks and cool chili completely, uncovered, then chill, covered, 1 to 2 days to allow flavors to develop.', u'Reheat over low heat, partially covered, stirring occasionally, until hot, about 30 minutes. Add beans (if using) and simmer, stirring, 5 minutes.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/ding-dong-eight-alarm-chili-108488', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Ding Dong Eight-Alarm Chili', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"When we added Earl Grey ice cream to our trucks' offerings in 2009, New Yorkers went mad for it. Not surprisingly\u2014black tea, combined with bergamot oil, cuts through the summer heat about as well as anything. We use a high-quality loose tea from our favorite tea brand, Rishi, which uses pure Italian bergamot citrus oil (and not bergamot flavoring), to make the most intensely fragrant Earl Grey tea ice cream.", 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 cups heavy cream', u'1 cup whole milk', u'3/4 cup (150 grams) sugar', u'6 tablespoons (30 grams) loose Earl Grey tea', u'1/2 teaspoon (2 grams) kosher salt', u'6 large egg yolks'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Pour the cream and milk into a double boiler or a heatproof bowl set over a saucepan of gently simmering water (the bottom of the bowl should not touch the water). Whisk in 1/2 cup (100 grams) of the sugar, the tea, and the salt and stir until the sugar and salt have dissolved. Warm the mixture until you see steam rising from the top. Remove from the heat and strain the mixture into a bowl, pressing on the tea leaves to extract as much infused liquid as possible. Discard the tea leaves and return the infused dairy mixture to the double boiler.', u'2. Meanwhile, prepare an ice bath in a large bowl and set another bowl over it. Set aside.', u"3. In a medium bowl, with a kitchen towel underneath it to prevent slipping, whisk together the egg yolks with the remaining 1/4 cup (50 grams) sugar until uniform. While whisking, add a splash of the hot dairy mixture to the yolks. Continue to add the dairy mixture, whisking it in bit by bit, until you've added about half. Add the yolk mixture to the remaining dairy mixture in the double boiler. Set the heat under the double boiler to medium and cook the custard, stirring continuously with a wooden spoon and reducing the heat to medium-low as necessary, until steam begins to rise from the surface and the custard thickens enough to coat the back of the spoon. Hold the spoon horizontally and run your finger through the custard. If the trail left by your finger stays separated, the custard is ready to be cooled.", u'4. Strain the custard into the bowl sitting over the prepared ice bath and stir for 3 to 5 minutes, or until the custard has cooled. Transfer the custard to a quart-size container, cover, and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or, preferably, overnight.', u'5. Pour the chilled custard into an ice cream maker and freeze according to the manufacturer\'s instructions. Place the container in which you refrigerated the custard in the freezer so you can use it to store the finished ice cream. Churn the ice cream until the texture resembles "soft serve." Transfer the ice cream to the chilled storage container and freeze until hardened to your desired consistency. Alternatively, you can serve it immediately\u2014it will be the consistency of gelato. The ice cream will keep, frozen, for up to 7 days.'], 'chef': u"ra O'Neill, Benjamin Van Leeuwen, Peter Van Leeuwen", 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/earl-grey-tea-ice-cream-56389790', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes about 1 quart', 'recipe title': u'Earl Grey Tea Ice Cream', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This whimsical bread is traditionally served at Italian and Greek Easter celebrations, though many Eastern European countries also claim it as their own. Dye the eggs for a more festive look.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'6-7 large eggs', u'Food coloring (optional)', u'Master Sweet Dough', u'All-purpose flour (for dusting)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Place 5 or 6 eggs in a medium pot. Pour in cold water to cover by 1" and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Remove from heat, cover pot, and let stand for 10 minutes. Transfer eggs to a medium bowl of ice water; let cool completely.', u'If desired, color eggs according to food-coloring package directions. Transfer eggs to paper towels to dry. DO AHEAD: Eggs can be dyed up to 1 week ahead. Cover and chill.', u'Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper. Punch down dough. Divide into 3 equal pieces. With lightly floured hands, roll each piece on a lightly floured surface into a 16"- long rope with tapered ends. (If dough begins to bounce back, cover with a kitchen towel and let rest for 10 minutes to allow dough to relax.)', u'Arrange ropes side by side lengthwise on prepared sheet. Pinch top ends together. Braid dough. Pinch bottom ends together to secure (braided loaf will be about 12" long). Tuck dyed eggs between braids, spacing evenly. Loosely cover with plastic wrap or a kitchen towel. Let rise in a warm, draft-free area until puffed but not doubled in size, 45-50 minutes. Arrange a rack in middle of oven; preheat to 375\xb0F. Whisk remaining egg with 2 teaspoons warm water in a small bowl. Avoiding dyed eggs, brush dough all over with egg wash. Bake until bread is golden and an instantread thermometer inserted into center of loaf registers 190\xb0F, 20-25 minutes. Let cool on a wire rack. Serve warm or at room temperature. DO AHEAD: Can be made 8 hours ahead. Let cool completely and store airtight at room temperature.'], 'chef': u'Melissa Roberts', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/easter-bread-395055', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes one 14" loaf ', 'recipe title': u'Easter Bread', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'EFFORT: NOT MUCH PREP TIME: 15 MINUTES COOK TIME: 6 HOURS KEEPS ON WARM: 1 HOUR', 'rating': u'1/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 tablespoons Italian-seasoned tomato paste', u'3 tablespoons full-bodied red wine, such as a California Zinfandel', u'2 teaspoons Red wine vinegar', u'1 1/4 pounds lean ground beef, preferably 93% lean', u'3 ounces (about 3/4 cup) provolone cheese, finely shredded', u'1/3 cup uncooked long-grain white rice', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u'3/4 teaspoon dried thyme', u'1/2 teaspoon crushed fennel seeds'], 'preperation steps': [u'1 Whisk the tomato paste, wine, and vinegar in a shallow bowl.', u'2 Mix the ground beef, cheese, rice, oregano, thyme, and fennel seeds in a large bowl until the cheese and seasonings are evenly distributed throughout the ground beef.', u'3 Form the mixture into balls, using about 1/3 cup for each fairly large meatball. As the meatballs are made, roll them in the tomato paste mixture, coating them lightly and evenly, then set them in the slow cooker in a single layer.', u'4 Once all the meatballs are made, cover the cooker and cook on low for 6 hours, or until the meatballs are firm and cooked through.'], 'chef': u'Bruce Weinstein and Mark Scarbrough', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/easy-cheesy-meatballs-51220250', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves: 3 to 8 ', 'recipe title': u'Easy Cheesy Meatballs', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"It's actually a clam boil, and it\u2019s prepared on the stove top. The secret is to layer the ingredients, like clams, lobsters, potatoes, and sausages, in one pot so that the flavors mingle during cooking.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 cup (2 sticks) butter, room temperature', u'3 large garlic cloves, finely chopped', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u'1 teaspoon dried basil', u'6 dozen littleneck clams, scrubbed', u'1/4 cup yellow cornmeal', u'2 celery stalks, cut crosswise in half', u'6 large fresh parsley sprigs', u'6 fresh thyme sprigs', u'2 small dried bay leaves', u'1/4 teaspoon whole black peppercorns', u'3 1 1/2-pound live lobsters', u'12 small (about 2-inch-diameter) red-skinned potatoes, scrubbed', u'6 small onions, peeled', u'1 1/2 pounds fully cooked smoked sausages (such as kielbasa or andouille sausage), cut into 6 portions', u'6 ears of corn, husked', u'Chopped fresh parsley', u'Lemon wedges'], 'preperation steps': [u'Blend all ingredients in bowl. Season butter with salt and pepper. (Can be prepared 2 days ahead. Cover and refrigerate.)', u'Place clams and cornmeal (to help purge clams of sand) in very large bowl or pot; fill with enough cold salted water to cover clams. Set aside at least 30 minutes and up to 1 hour.', u'Place 12-inch square of cheesecloth on work surface. Place celery, parsley, thyme, bay leaves, and peppercorns in center. Roll up and tie with string. Place bouquet garni in large (at least 18-quart) pot. Half-fill pot with cold water and bring to boil over high heat. Add 1 lobster headfirst; cover pot. Boil until lobster is almost cooked through and shell turns bright red, about 8 minutes. Using tongs, transfer lobster to bowl. Repeat with remaining lobsters.', u'Add potatoes and onions to pot. Ladle off cooking liquid into large bowl, leaving enough to cover vegetables; reserve liquid in bowl. Bring liquid in pot to boil. Cover; cook potatoes and onions 10 minutes. Layer sausages and corn atop vegetables. Cover; cook until potatoes are just tender, about 10 minutes.', u'Rinse clams thoroughly. Arrange clams atop corn and sausages. Place lobsters atop clams. Cover pot tightly with lid or, if necessary, cover tightly with overlapping large sheets of foil. Boil until clams open, about 12 minutes. Remove from heat.', u'Transfer lobsters to work surface, shell side down. Place tip of large knife in center of 1 lobster. Cut lobster lengthwise in half from center to end of head (knife might not cut through shell), then cut lobster in half from center to end of tail. If necessary, use kitchen shears to cut through shell. Repeat with remaining lobsters. Mound clams (discarding any that did not open), lobsters and sausages on large platter; reserve cooking broth in pot. Surround seafood with corn, potatoes and, if desired, onions. Sprinkle vegetables with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with parsley; garnish with lemon wedges. Cover with foil to keep warm.', u'Melt seasoned butter in saucepan; divide among 6 ramekins. Discard bouquet garni from pot. Taste broth; season with pepper. Add some of reserved lobster cooking liquid if broth is too salty. Bring broth to boil; divide among 6 soup cups. Serve seasoned butter and broth alongside vegetables, sausages, and seafood.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/easy-summer-clambake-105351', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Easy Summer Clambake', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Andrea Reusing, chef at Lantern in Chapel Hill, NC, cooks whole ears of corn in the dying embers of a charcoal fire after the burgers or pork chops have finished cooking. "I love the efficiency of it," she says. The waning heat produces some sweeter bites and others that are more charred. Keep the husks on to protect the corn, and soak the ears before they hit the embers so the kernels don\'t dry out.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 ears of corn, in husk', u'Softened unsalted butter', u'Kosher salt'], 'preperation steps': [u'Gently pull husks away from corn (do not detach from cob); remove silk. Pull husks up over corn to cover kernels. Secure husks tightly with string or a strip of foil. Soak in a large pot of room-temperature water for at least 15 minutes and up to 1 hour.', u'Meanwhile, remove grill grate and build a hot fire in a charcoal grill, allowing fire to burn down until coals are completely covered with ash (or use the ash-covered coals remaining after grilling a main course).', u'Push coals to one side of grill. Arrange 3 ears of corn in a single layer on cleared side of grill; cover corn with coals. Repeat on the other side with remaining coals and corn, spreading coals evenly over corn. Roast corn until most of the kernels are deep golden brown, about 10 minutes (some kernels will be flecked with dark brown spots). Remove husks; use a pastry brush to flick off any ashes. Serve with butter and salt.'], 'chef': u'Andrea Reusing', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/ember-roasted-corn-on-the-cob-51108330', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Ember-Roasted Corn on the Cob', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Alison Hotchkiss of San Francisco\u2013based Alison Events shared this easy centerpiece idea with Epicurious. She recommends lining the vases up along the length of your table to create a unique centerpiece. Best of all, after the party, each guest can take home a vase as a memento. The vases shown here are covered in vintage-inspired fabric and were originally part of 1960s-themed bridal shower, but they can be adapted for any type of party.', 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 yards vintage or vintage-inspired fabric*', u'12 (6- by 6-inch) clear glass vases**', u'12 (1 3/4- by 1 3/4- by 8-inch) clear glass vases**', u'Colorful flowers such as gerbera daisies', u'Fabric scissors, glue gun, and glue sticks', u'*Yards of fabric vary by width. These measurements are based on a 45-inch-wide bolt of fabric. Vintage or vintage-inspired fabrics can be found at flea markets, garage sales, or on Web sites such as eBay, Etsy, Purlsoho, and Reprodepot. Hotchkiss also suggests scouting your local Goodwill or Salvation Army for used dresses that can be cut up for fabric.', u'**Hotchkiss recommends vases from Save-on-crafts, which offers both these sizes, but you can find similar styles at Crate & Barrel, Ikea, and Target.'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cut fabric into 1-yard and \xbd-yard sections. Cut 1-yard section into 12 (24- by 3-inch) strips.', u'Place one 6-inch vase on your work surface so opening faces away from you.', u"Arrange one fabric strip on side of vase that's face up, leaving 1\xbd inches of space from both top and bottom of vase.", u'Using glue gun, dot two rows of glue sparingly onto side of vase that is face up; the rows should line up just below where top and bottom of fabric strip will be positioned. Use only as much glue as necessary, or it may show through fabric.', u'Repeat with remaining three sides, wrapping fabric around and gluing each side completely before moving on to next side. Repeat with remaining 6-inch vases.', u'Cut remaining 1/2-yard fabric into 12 (7- by 5-inch) strips.', u'Place one 8-inch vase down on your work surface so opening faces away from you.', u"Arrange one fabric strip on side of vase that's face up, leaving 1\xbd inches of space from both top and bottom of vase.", u'Using glue gun, dot two rows of glue sparingly onto side of vase that is face up; the rows should line up just below where top and bottom of fabric strip will be positioned. Use only as much glue as necessary, or it may show through fabric.', u'Repeat with remaining three sides, wrapping fabric around and gluing each side completely before moving on to next side. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Each serving is baked en papillote, or wrapped individually in parchment paper to lock in steam for a more succulent result.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'81%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 pounds slender asparagus spears, trimmed to 7-inch lengths', u'2 garlic cloves, minced', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'2 tablespoons (1/4 stick) butter', u'1 tablespoon plus 6 teaspoons olive oil', u'1/3 cup fresh lemon juice', u'1 1/2 teaspoons grated lemon peel', u'1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper', u'6 6-ounce cod fillets, pinbones removed', u'6 ounces paper-thin prosciutto slices, halved lengthwise'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cook asparagus in large pot of boiling salted water until crisp-tender, about 3 minutes. Add garlic paste; stir until pale golden, about 1 minute. Stir in lemon juice, peel, and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper. Remove from heat.', u'Preheat oven to 500\xb0F. Cut out six 12-inch squares of parchment paper. Place 1 parchment square on work surface. Drizzle 1 teaspoon oil over parchment. Place 1 cod fillet in center of parchment. Spoon 1/6 of garlic-lemon mixture over fish. Cover with 1/6 of asparagus spears. Arrange 1/6 of prosciutto slices over. Fold 2 opposite sides of parchment in over fish and vegetables, then fold in remaining 2 sides, enclosing completely. Fasten parchment edges together with paper clips to seal packet. Place on large rimmed baking sheet. Repeat procedure with remaining parchment, oil, fish, garlic-lemon mixture, asparagus, and prosciutto. (Can be prepared 6 hours ahead. Refrigerate.)', u'Bake fish until just opaque in center (parchment will turn golden brown), about 12 minutes. Transfer 1 parchment packet to each of 6 plates. {'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 to 8 drained bottled whole green peperoncini', u'1/2 cup mayonnaise', u'1 pound cleaned squid, preferably small', u'6 to 7 cups vegetable oil', u'3/4 cup rice flour*', u'Special equipment: a deep-fat thermometer'], 'preperation steps': [u'Halve peperoncini and discard stems and seeds. Rinse and pat dry, then mince enough to measure 1/4 cup. Stir into mayonnaise in a small bowl.', u'Rinse squid under cold running water and lightly pat dry between paper towels, leaving some moisture so rice flour will stick. Leave tentacles whole and cut bodies (including flaps, if attached) crosswise into 1/3-inch-wide rings, then reserve separately on paper towels.', u'Heat 2 inches oil in a 4- to 5-quart heavy pot (4 inches deep; preferably cast-iron) over high heat until it registers 390\xb0F on thermometer.', u'Preheat oven to 200\xb0F.', u'While oil is heating, whisk together flour, 3/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper in a shallow bowl. Have ready a medium-mesh sieve in another shallow bowl.', u'Dredge a small handful of squid rings in flour mixture, tossing to coat well. Transfer to sieve and shake over other bowl to remove excess flour. Return excess flour to first bowl.', u'Fry floured rings in oil, stirring to separate, until golden, about 1 minute, then transfer with a slotted spoon to dry paper towels to drain, arranging in 1 layer.', u'Coat and fry remaining rings in about 3 more batches in same manner, returning oil to 390\xb0F between batches. Transfer fried and drained rings to a shallow baking pan in 1 layer and keep warm, uncovered, in middle of oven.', u'Coat and fry tentacles in 2 or 3 batches until golden, about 1 1/2 minutes per batch, returning oil to 390\xb0F between batches and transferring as fried to paper towels, then to baking pan.', u'Serve with peperoncini mayonnaise for dipping.', u"*Available in the Latino section of many supermarkets, natural foods stores, Kalustyan's (800-352-3451), and The Baker's Catalogue (800-827-6836)."], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/fried-calamari-with-peperoncini-mayonnaise-108155', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u"Makes 4 hors d'oeuvre servings", 'recipe title': u'Fried Calamari with Peperoncini Mayonnaise', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'EFFORT: A LOT PREP TIME: 25 MINUTES COOK TIME: 1 HOUR 20 MINUTES TO 2 HOURS KEEPS ON WARM: NO', 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'8 tablespoons (1 stick) unsalted butter, cut into small bits, plus more for greasing the canister', u'9 ounces dark chocolate, chopped', u'2 ounces unsweetened chocolate, chopped', u'1 cup sugar', u'2 large eggs, at room temperature', u'2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'2/3 cup all-purpose flour, plus more for coating the canister', u'1/2 teaspoon salt'], 'preperation steps': [u'1 Generously grease the inside of the slow cooker canister by holding a small slice of butter with a paper towel and rubbing the butter all over the surfaces. Add some flour, then turn the crock this way and that to coat both the bottom and the walls with a fine, even dusting. Tap out any excess flour.', u'2 Set up a double boiler with about 1 inch of water in the bottom pan, simmering over medium heat\u2014or place a large, heat-safe metal bowl over a medium saucepan with a similar amount of simmering water. Add the butter and both chocolates. Stir with a rubber spatula until about two-thirds of the chocolate has melted. Remove the top half of the double boiler or the bowl from the saucepan below, then continue stirring off the heat until all the chocolate has melted. Cool for 10 minutes.', u'3 Meanwhile, beat the sugar, eggs, and vanilla in a large bowl with an electric mixer at medium speed until quite thick and pale yellow, up to 10 minutes.', u'4 Beat in the cooled chocolate mixture until smooth, then scrape down and remove the beaters. Fold in the flour and salt with a rubber spatula, using wide, gentle arcs to make sure every speck of flour has been moistened. Pour and spread this mixture into the slow cooker.', u'5 Lay long strips of paper towels across the top of the slow cooker, overlapping each other and hanging down the sides for stability. Set the lid in place, then cook on high for about 1 hour 20 minutes in a small (2- to 3 1/2-quart) slow cooker, about 1 hour 40 minutes in a medium (4- to 5 1/2-quart) one, or about 2 hours in a large (6- to 8-quart) model, or until the cake is firm to the touch and the edges are dry while the middle is dark and moist. Unplug, uncover, and cool in the canister for 30 minutes before cutting out slices with a nonstick-safe knife or setting a cutting board over the cooker, inverting it, and turning the cake out.'], 'chef': u'Bruce Weinstein and Mark Scarbrough', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/fudgy-brownie-cake-51220650', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves: 6 to 12', 'recipe title': u'Fudgy Brownie Cake', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Pita rounds spring to life after just a couple of minutes on a hot grill: The dimpled surfaces of the flatbread crisp up in a nice contrast with their soft interiors (be sure to buy the pocketless kind of pita, which is fluffier than pita that is meant to be split and stuffed). A shake of crunchy kosher salt and a brush of garlicky olive oil flecked with oregano knocks them out of the park.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 garlic cloves, smashed', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped oregano', u'6 (6-to 8-inch) pocketless pita bread rounds', u'Kosher salt to taste'], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat oil in a small heavy skillet over medium heat until it shimmers. Cook garlic, turning once, until pale golden, about 1 minute. Discard garlic and remove skillet from heat, then stir in oregano.', u'Prepare grill for direct-heat cooking over medium-hot charcoal (medium-high heat for gas); see Grilling Procedure .', u'Oil grill rack. Grill pitas, 3 at a time, covered only if using a gas grill, turning once, until grill marks appear, about 2 minutes total per batch. Transfer to a cutting board and brush both sides with garlic-oregano oil. Cut pitas into wedges. Sprinkle with kosher salt. Serve warm.'], 'chef': u'Gina Marie Miraglia Eriquez', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/garlic-oregano-grilled-pita-bread-354512', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Garlic-Oregano Grilled Pita Bread', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'-Gazpacho can be made ahead and frozen. Defrost in the fridge overnight. -Mayonnaise is an unusual ingredient, but we like the creaminess it adds to the soup. -For 2 you will need 4 tomatoes, 1 small cucumber, and 1 small red bell pepper. For 6, you will need 12 tomatoes, 1 cucumber and 1 red pepper.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'67%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 garlic cloves', u'2 onions', u'2 1/4 oz cucumber', u'2 7/8 oz bell peppers', u'2 1/4 lb ripe tomatoes', u'1 1/4 oz white country-style bread (without crust)', u'1/2 cup water', u'1/3 cup olive oil, plus extra to serve', u'2 tbsp sherry vinegar', u'1 tbsp mayonnaise', u'4 oz croutons'], 'preperation steps': [u'Peel and cut each garlic clove in half. Remove the green shoot inside, if there is one. Fill a small saucepan with cold water and add the garlic. Bring the water to a boil. When the water begins to boil lift the garlic out of the water and into a bowl of ice water to quickly cool it. Repeat this twice, always starting with cold water in the saucepan. Peel the onion and cut in half, then cut into large chunks. Peel the cucumber. Cut in half, then into large pieces. Halve the bell peppers, then remove the seeds and white membranes. Chop the bell peppers, then aside along with the cucumber and onion. Cut the tomatoes into large wedges and put in a bowl with the onions, cucumbers, and bell peppers. Add the bread, torn into pieces, then pour over the water. Process everything together using a hand-held blender, or using a food processor. Strain the gazpacho through a fine-mesh strainer. Add the oil, vinegar, and mayonnaise, then whisk or blend the soup until smooth and creamy. Season with salt and pepper. Chill in the fridge before serving (at least 2 hours). Serve the gazpacho in soup bowls with croutons, plus an extra drizzle of olive oil.'], 'chef': u'Ferran Adri\xe0', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/gazpacho-367950', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 6', 'recipe title': u'Gazpacho', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Usually considered a summer drink, this refreshing lime concoction is a tart surprise when the chill of winter weather settles in.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 ounces (6 tablespoons) gin', u'2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'6 to 8 oz chilled club soda or seltzer', u'Garnish: lime wedges'], 'preperation steps': [u'Fill a cocktail shaker halfway with cracked ice, then add gin and lime juice. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'The syrup is also used to coat the apple wedges and grapes that garnish each plate.', 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'67%', 'ingredient list': [u'6-ounce log soft fresh goat cheese', u'Sugar', u'1/4 cup water', u'6 small grape clusters', u'Apple, cored and cut in six 1/3-inch wedges'], 'preperation steps': [u'Place one 1/2-inch-thick round of goat cheese (cut from log) on each of 6 plates. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This dip is also delicious with thin baguette slices, toast, crackers, or tortilla chips.', 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'8 whole artichokes', u'1 cup (packed) fresh mint leaves', u'6 ounces cream cheese', u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil'], 'preperation steps': [u'Prepare barbecue (medium heat). Grill until leaves pull away easily from heart, turning occasionally, about 40 minutes. Unwrap artichokes. Discard any outer leaves that may be charred and any tough inner leaves. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Transfer dip to bowl and place on platter.'], 'chef': u'David Downie', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/grilled-artichokes-with-artichoke-mint-dip-234402', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Grilled Artichokes with Artichoke-Mint Dip', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This recipe serves 4 as a main course if you set aside 2 chicken breasts for another meal. Otherwise, it serves 6.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/2 cup fresh lime juice', u'1 tablespoon mild honey', u'1/2 teaspoon dried hot red pepper flakes', u'2 1/4 teaspoons salt', u'1 cup olive oil', u'6 chicken breast halves with skin and bones (3 lb total)', u'2 large tomatoes, cut into 1/2-inch pieces (2 cups)', u'2 medium shallots, halved lengthwise and thinly sliced crosswise (1/2 cup)', u'8 oz mesclun, thinly sliced (6 cups)', u'1 cup loosely packed fresh basil leaves, thinly sliced'], 'preperation steps': [u'Whisk together lime juice, honey, red pepper flakes, and 3/4 teaspoon salt in a large bowl and add oil in a slow stream, whisking.', u'Transfer chicken to a 1-gallon sealable plastic bag and add 1/3 cup lime vinaigrette, then seal bag. Put remaining lime vinaigrette in a small airtight container and reserve for lettuce wraps (recipe follows).', u'Remove chicken from bag, discarding marinade, and sprinkle all over with remaining 1 1/2 teaspoons salt.', u'Open vents on bottom of grill and on lid. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'If you prefer to present these halibut steaks with additional grill marks (as in the photo), you can grill the skin sides for about 1 minute each before grilling flesh.', 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'43%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 small shallots, finely chopped (2 tablespoons)', u'1 large garlic clove, finely chopped', u'3 tablespoons olive oil', u'2 1/2 lbs plum tomatoes, chopped', u'6 stalks fresh lemongrass, tough outer layers removed and lower 6 inches coarsely chopped', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon black pepper', u'6 (1-inch-thick) pieces halibut steak with skin (6 oz each)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cook shallots and garlic in 1 tablespoon oil in a 3- to 4-quart heavy saucepan over moderately low heat, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 3 minutes. Serve fish with sauce.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/grilled-halibut-with-lemongrass-tomato-sauce-109521', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Grilled Halibut with Lemongrass Tomato Sauce', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

It also adds a roasty complexity to a super refreshing cocktail.', 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 lemons, halved plus 1 lemon, sliced into 6 rounds', u'1/2 cup simple syrup (see Note)', u'1 3/4 cups ice water', u'Six 12-ounce pilsners'], 'preperation steps': [u'Light a grill and set it up for direct heat or preheat a grill pan. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'These skewers are traditionally made with Brazilian queijo de coalho, a dense, salty white cheese very similar in taste and texture to the Haloumi we use here.
