{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'The pork is prepared for roasting like a prime rib of beef; you can follow the method here or have your butcher do it for you. For best results, start brining the pork five days before you plan to roast it.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 quarts cold water, divided', u'1 1/2 cups sugar', u'3/4 cup fine sea salt', u'8 large fresh thyme sprigs', u'6 Turkish bay leaves, crumbled', u'4 juniper berries*', u'2 teaspoons whole black peppercorns', u'1 6- to 6 1/2-pound center-cut pork rib roast (8-bone; about 12 to 14 inches long), well-trimmed', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh thyme', u'2 teaspoons whole black peppercorns, crushed in mortar with pestle or in resealable plastic bag with mallet'], 'preperation steps': [u'Combine 1 quart water and all remaining ingredients in medium saucepan. Bring to boil, stirring until sugar and salt dissolve. Pour brine into wide pot or container large enough to hold pork (3- to 4-gallon capacity). Add remaining 5 quarts cold water; stir to blend. Let stand until brine is cool to touch, about 1 hour.', u'Place pork on work surface. Trim off all but 1/4-inch layer of fat from roast. Turn roast over so that rib bones point up. Using boning knife and starting where meat meets rib bones, gradually cut loin away from rack of bones, leaving 2 inches of meat attached to bones (do not cut meat off bones completely). Tie meat back onto bones with kitchen string at 2-inch intervals. Place roast in brine, submerging pork completely and weighing down with heavy pot if necessary. Cover and refrigerate 5 days.', u'Remove pork from brine; discard brine. Rinse pork under cold running water for 5 minutes to reduce saltiness; pat dry with paper towels. Place pork on rack set over sheet of foil; let stand at room temperature 2 hours.', u'Position rack in center of oven and preheat to 400\xb0F. Place pork on rack in large roasting pan. Mix thyme and crushed peppercorns in small bowl; sprinkle mixture over pork. Roast until instant-read thermometer inserted into center of pork registers 140\xb0F, about 1 hour. Remove from oven. Let roast rest 30 minutes (internal temperature of roast will increase 5 to 10 degrees).', u'Remove kitchen string from roast. Cut meat into slices and serve.', u'*Available in the spice section of most supermarkets.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/herb-brined-pork-prime-rib-roast-231595', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Herb-Brined Pork Prime Rib Roast', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Because the heat on individual grills varies, cooking times will range from about 30 minutes to one hour. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Use two 6-mold nonstick mini-Bundt-cake pans or giant-muffin tins for these.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'2/3 cup dried apricots, thinly sliced', u'3 tablespoons chopped crystallized ginger', u'1 cup sugar', u'3 tablespoons water', u'1 tablespoon light corn syrup', u'1 tablespoon salted butter', u'2/3 cup whipping cream', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'Nonstick vegetable oil spray', u'2 1/2 cups all purpose flour', u'4 teaspoons ground ginger', u'2 teaspoons baking soda', u'1 1/2 teaspoons ground allspice', u'1 cup hot water', u'1 tablespoon instant espresso powder', u'1 cup (packed) golden brown sugar', u'3/4 cup (1 1/2 sticks) salted butter, room temperature', u'1 cup mild-flavored (light) molasses', u'2 large eggs', u'2 tablespoons finely grated peeled fresh ginger', u'2 teaspoons sugar'], 'preperation steps': [u'Combine apricots and ginger in small bowl. Pour enough boiling water over just to cover; let soften 10 minutes. Drain; pat dry with paper towels.', u'Combine sugar, 3 tablespoons water, and corn syrup in heavy medium skillet. Stir over low heat until sugar dissolves. Increase heat; boil until syrup is deep amber color, brushing down sides with wet pastry brush and swirling pan occasionally, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Mix in butter, apricots, and ginger. Add cream and vanilla. Stir over low heat until caramel bits dissolve and sauce is smooth. (Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover; chill. Rewarm over low heat before serving.)', u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F. Spray 9 mini-Bundt molds with nonstick spray; generously butter same molds. Sift flour, ground ginger, baking soda, and allspice into medium bowl. Combine 1 cup hot water and espresso powder in small bowl and stir to dissolve. Using electric mixer, beat brown sugar and butter in large bowl until blended. Beat in molasses, then eggs and fresh ginger. Beat in flour mixture in 3 additions alternately with espresso mixture in 2 additions. Divide among 9 prepared molds. Sprinkle with 2 teaspoons sugar. Bake cakes until tester inserted near center comes out clean, about 20 minutes. Cool cakes in pans 10 minutes; turn out onto baking sheet. (Can be made 6 hours ahead; let stand at room temperature. Rewarm in 350\xb0F oven 8 minutes.) Serve ginger cakes warm with warm apricot sauce.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/individual-ginger-cakes-with-apricot-sticky-sauce-106233', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 9', 'recipe title': u'Individual Ginger Cakes with Apricot Sticky Sauce', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'"If gumbo is the national stew of Cajun country, burgoo is the stew of Kentucky," Ronni Lundy asserts in her book Shuck Beans, Stack Cakes, and Honest Fried Chicken. Because the stew is made in many different ways with a variety of ingredients, the "Burgoo Song" by Robert Myles claims, "You can toss in almost anything that ever walked or flew." Many early recipes for burgoo include squirrel in addition to chicken, beef, and pork. In Kentucky, Anderson County, which hosts its Burgoo Festival every September, is known as the burgoo capital of the world. Arenzville, Illinois, makes a similar claim. But the French lay claim to the basic concept of burgoo, and it\'s conceivable that the word burgoo arose somehow from the French ragout (pronounced ra-goo), also a term describing a stew.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 pounds pork shank', u'2 pounds veal shank', u'2 pounds beef shank', u'2 pounds breast of lamb', u'1 (4-pound) chicken', u'8 quarts cold water', u'1 1/2 pounds potatoes', u'1 1/2 pounds onions', u'1 bunch carrots, peeled and sliced thickly', u'2 green peppers, seeded and chopped', u'2 cups chopped cabbage', u'1 quart tomato puree', u'2 cups whole corn, fresh or canned', u'2 pods red pepper', u'2 cups diced okra', u'1/2 cup chopped parsley', u'2 cups dry lima beans', u'1 cup diced celery', u'3/4 cup Kentucky bourbon', u'Salt and pepper', u'Tabasco', u'Steak Sauce', u'Worcestershire sauce'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Put the pork, veal, beef, lamb, and chicken into a large pot. Add the water and bring it to a boil slowly. Simmer until meat is tender enough to fall off the bones, about 4\u20146 hours.', u'2. Lift the meat out of the stock. Cool the meat, remove it from the bones, and chop it. Return the chopped meat to the stock.', u'3. Pare the potatoes and onions and dice them. Add them, plus the carrots, green peppers, cabbage, tomato puree, corn, red pepper, okra, parsley, lima beans, celery, and bourbon, to the meat and stock. Allow the stew to simmer until very thick about 6 hours.', u'4. Season to taste with the salt, pepper, Tabasco, steak sauce, and Worcestershire sauce.'], 'chef': u'Albert W. A. Schmid', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/kentucky-bourbon-burgoo-395171', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'12 to 14 servings', 'recipe title': u'Kentucky Bourbon Burgoo', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'94%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 (1-pound) firm-ripe mangoes', u'6 tablespoons turbinado sugar such as Sugar in the Raw', u'1/3 cup dark rum'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat broiler.', u'Wash and dry mangoes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"It just wouldn't be a holiday without my mom preparing a pasta course, whether it precedes the turkey at Thanksgiving or follows antipasti at Easter. My mom's manicotti recipe (which comes from her Italian mother), feeds our immediate family of 40, but I've scaled it down to feed a smaller group of 6. Stir in basil and remove from heat.', u"Break up eggs with a wooden spoon in a medium bowl and stir in water until combined (don't beat). Sift in flour and salt, then stir batter until just combined. Force through a medium-mesh sieve into another bowl.", u'Lightly brush an 8-inch nonstick skillet with melted butter and heat over moderate heat until hot. Ladle about 1/4 cup batter into skillet, tilting and rotating skillet to coat bottom, then pour excess batter back into bowl. (If batter sets before skillet is coated, reduce heat slightly for next cr\xeape.) Cook until underside is just set and lightly browned, about 30 seconds, then invert cr\xeape onto a clean kitchen towel to cool completely. Make at least 11 more cr\xeapes in same manner, brushing skillet with butter as needed and stacking cr\xeapes in 3 piles.', u'Stir together ricotta, eggs, Parmigiano-Reggiano, parsley, salt, and pepper.', u'Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 425\xb0F.', u'Cut mozzarella lengthwise into 1/4-inch-thick sticks.', u'Spread 2 cups sauce in larger baking dish and 1 cup in smaller one. Arrange 1 cr\xeape, browned side up, on a work surface, then spread about 1/4 cup filling in a line across center and top with a mozzarella strip. Fold in sides to enclose filling, leaving ends open, and transfer, seam side down, to either baking dish. Fill 11 more cr\xeapes in same manner, arranging snugly in 1 layer in both dishes (8 in larger dish and 4 in smaller). Spread 1 cup sauce over manicotti in larger dish and 1/2 cup in smaller dish. Tightly cover dishes with foil and bake until sauce is bubbling and filling is hot, 15 to 20 minutes. Serve remaining sauce on the side.'], 'chef': u'd editor: Gina Marie Miraglia Eriquez Mother: Marie Miraglia, Howard Beach, NY', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/manicotti-109442', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 main-course servings', 'recipe title': u'Manicotti', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Hollowed-out orange halves are filled with mashed yams and topped with marshmallow creme and pecans.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'96%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 pounds large yams (red-skinned sweet potatoes)', u'3/4 cup marshmallow creme', u'9 tablespoons butter, room temperature', u'6 tablespoons maple syrup', u'3 large eggs', u'9 large oranges', u'Additional marshmallow creme', u'36 pecan halves'], 'preperation steps': [u'Pierce each yam all over with fork. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Sealed jars may be stored in a cool, dry, dark place for up to one year. Unsealed jars must be refrigerated and jam must be used within a few weeks. For an even quicker jam, skip the canning instructions, ladle hot jam into clean jars, and store the jam in the refrigerator for up to two weeks.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 5-to 6-ounce containers raspberries and blackberries (3 containers each)', u'2 cups sugar', u'2 tablespoons lemon juice'], 'preperation steps': [u'Combine fruit, sugar, and lemon juice in large bowl. Let stand at room temperature 2 hours, stirring occasionally.', u'Put 2 saucers in freezer.', u'In bottom of heavy large stockpot at least 3 inches deeper than height of jars, place metal rack or extra screw bands from canning jars to protect jars from direct heat. Fill pot with water, cover, and bring water to boil. Reduce heat to low. Wash jars, lids, and screw bands in hot soapy water; rinse well. Set screw bands on clean towel to dry. Place lids in small saucepan; cover with cold water and bring to simmer; turn off heat. Fill jars with very hot water.', u'Transfer fruit mixture to large saucepan and bring to boil over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally. Mash to thick puree with potato masher. Reduce heat to medium and boil gently until mixture begins to thicken, stirring often, about 18 minutes.', u'Remove saucepan from heat to test jam for gelling point. Drop 1 teaspoonful jam on chilled saucer and return to freezer 1 minute. Remove saucer and push edge of jam with fingertip. If jam has properly gelled, surface will gently wrinkle. If not, return saucepan to heat and cook jam a few minutes longer; repeat test.', u'Drain hot water from jars and shake out excess water. Place jars on cutting board. Ladle hot jam into each jar, leaving 3/4-inch space at top. Slide flat plastic spatula between jam and jar to eliminate air bubbles. Clean rim of each jar with damp cloth. Using tongs, lift hot lids from saucepan, 1 at a time, shake dry, and place atop jars. Seal each with screw band, twisting to close but not too tightly. Return filled jars to pot of hot water.', u'Add water to pot, if necessary, to cover jars by at least 1 inch. Cover pot and bring to boil; reduce heat and boil gently 10 minutes. Turn off heat. Wait 5 minutes; use tongs to remove jars without tilting. Place upright on towel; cool completely at room temperature. Jam will thicken as it cools.', u'Check lids for seal by pressing each lightly. Lids of sealed jars will be concave and show no movement when pressed.'], 'chef': u'Molly Wizenberg', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/mixed-berry-jam-242544', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes three to four 1/2-pint jars', 'recipe title': u'Mixed-Berry Jam', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'We serve our remake of the Mojito\u2014a Cuban cocktail\u2014in lime bowls, but Martini glasses would also look sleek.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Each serving about 142 calories and less than 1 gram fat\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Gourmet', 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 teaspoons unflavored gelatin (less than 2 full envelopes)', u'3/4 cups water', u'3/4 cup amber rum', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1/2 cup fresh mint', u'6 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'6 limes (optional)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Line the bottom and sides of an oiled 8-inch square glass baking dish with a piece of plastic wrap, smoothing out wrinkles.', u'Sprinkle gelatin over 3/4 cup water in a 2-quart saucepan and let stand 1 minute to soften.', u'Heat mixture over low heat, stirring occasionally, until gelatin is dissolved.', u'Stir in rum, sugar, and mint, then simmer, stirring occasionally, 5 minutes. Spoon into lime bowls.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/mojito-jelly-103692', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': None, 'recipe title': u'Mojito Jelly', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'"This incredible cheesecake was made by the mother of my first boss," says Jim Carrier of Greenwich, Connecticut. "When I called Mrs. Marshall to ask if she would consider showing me how she made it, she warmly replied, \'I would be delighted to share the recipe with you, kid.\' On the evening of my \'seminar,\' it was a wonderful sight as I walked into her kitchen and found the stage set with all the ingredients and utensils for the important lesson. Mrs. Marshall sat on a wooden stool and directed me through the entire process. \'Pick up that wooden spoon\u2014and save some energy for later,\' she said. \'You will be beating the egg whites by hand. We don\u2019t use any electrical appliances in this production except the oven!\' I dutifully followed each step. This is a cheesecake recipe to treasure."', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'83%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 cups crushed zwieback toasts', u'1 cup sugar', u'1 teaspoon cinnamon', u'8 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted', u'2 (8-oz) packages cream cheese, softened', u'4 large eggs, separated', u'1 cup sugar', u'1 cup heavy cream', u'1 tablespoon all-purpose flour', u'1 teaspoon vanilla'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F and butter a 10-inch springform pan.', u'Stir together crust ingredients. Reserve 1/4 cup for topping and press remainder onto bottom and 1 1/2 inches up side of springform pan.', u'Beat cream cheese with a wooden spoon in a large bowl until smooth and creamy and add yolks 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in sugar, cream, flour, and vanilla. Beat whites with an eggbeater in another large bowl until they just hold stiff peaks and fold into cream-cheese mixture gently but thoroughly. Spoon filling into crust, smoothing top, and sprinkle evenly with reserved crumb mixture. Put springform pan in a shallow baking pan and bake cake on lowest rack of oven 1 hour. Turn oven off and open oven door 5 to 6 inches. Cool in oven 1 hour. Chill, covered, at least 3 hours. Remove side of pan and let cheesecake stand at room temperature 30 minutes before serving.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/mrs-marshalls-cheesecake-102394', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u"Mrs. Marshall's Cheesecake", 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'75%', 'ingredient list': [u'7 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'6 slices multigrain bread', u'9 large eggs', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'6 oz sliced Canadian bacon, chopped', u'6 tablespoons sour cream', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh chives'], 'preperation steps': [u'Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 450\xb0F.', u'Melt 6 tablespoons butter, then brush onto both sides of bread. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This recipe serves 4 as a main course after you set aside 3 cups to make the mushroom and mozzarella arancini or the mushroom risotto cakes. Otherwise, it serves 6.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'73%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 oz (28 g) dried porcini (1 cup)', u'3 3/4 cups hot water', u'5 1/4 cups reduced-sodium chicken broth (42 fl oz)', u'1 tablespoon soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'3/4 stick (6 tablespoons) unsalted butter', u'1 small onion, finely chopped (1 cup)', u'2 garlic cloves, finely chopped', u'3/4 lb fresh cremini mushrooms, trimmed and thinly sliced', u'1 lb Arborio rice (2 1/3 cups)', u'2/3 cup dry white wine', u'1 oz finely grated Parmigiano-Reggiano (1/2 cup)', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon black pepper', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley', u'Special equipment: parchment paper (if reserving some risotto for another recipe)', u'Garnish: Parmigiano-Reggiano shavings'], 'preperation steps': [u'Soak porcini in 1 1/2 cups hot water in a bowl until softened, about 20 minutes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Tossing the potatoes in a vinegar-mustard mixture before roasting gives them a flavorful crust.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'62%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/4 cup Champagne vinegar', u'2 tablespoons mustard seeds', u'6 tablespoons Dijon mustard', u'1 tablespoon coriander seeds, crushed', u'Coarse kosher salt', u'3 pounds russet potatoes, peeled, cut into 1 1/2- to 2-inch cubes', u'6 tablespoons vegetable oil'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 425\xb0F. Serve at room temperature.'], 'chef': u'Judith Choate', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/my-never-ever-fail-chocolate-fudge-231329', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Quantity: Approximately 8 dozen pieces', 'recipe title': u'My Never-Ever-Fail Chocolate Fudge', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: 227.5 calories, 64.5 calories from fat, 7.2g total fat, 1.9g saturated fat, 105.2mg cholesterol, 110.5mg sodium, 3.6g total carbs, 1.4g dietary fiber, 0.2g sugars, 35.4g protein\n\nNutritional analysis provided by TasteBook, using the USDA Nutrition Database', 'recommendation': u'75%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 pounds ground sirloin', u'1/4 cup Zinfandel', u'1/4 cup lightly packed minced fresh basil', u'1/4 cup minced red onion', u'1/4 cup fresh Italian bread crumbs', u'8 sun-dried tomatoes packed in olive oil, finely chopped', u'2 teaspoons garlic salt', u'Vegetable oil, for brushing on the grill rack', u'8 large basil sprigs, moistened with water, for grilling', u'6 large seeded sandwich rolls, split', u'6 slices Monterey Jack cheese', u'6 red leaf lettuce leaves', u'6 (1/4-inch-thick) large tomato slices', u'6 paper-thin red onion slices, separated into rings', u'6 basil sprigs, for serving', u'2/3 cup mayonnaise', u'2 tablespoons prepared basil pesto'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"If fresh clams are unavailable (or you're running short on time), substitute two 10-ounce cans of baby clams and 6 cups of bottled clam juice.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'8 pounds cherrystone clams, scrubbed', u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter', u'8 ounces bacon, cut into 1/2" pieces', u'2 celery stalks, minced', u'1 large onion, minced', u'1 garlic clove, minced', u'2 1/2 pound Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled, cut into 1/2" pieces', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh thyme', u'1 bay leaf', u'2 tablespoons cornstarch', u'2 cups heavy cream', u'Kosher salt, freshly ground pepper', u'1 freshly ground pepper', u'Chopped fresh chives', u'Oyster crackers or Vermont Common Crackers'], 'preperation steps': [u'Bring clams and 4 cups water to a boil in a large pot over high heat. Cook until clams just open, 8-10 minutes (discard any that do not open). Using a large slotted spoon, transfer clams to a large rimmed baking sheet; set broth aside. Let clams cool slightly, then pull meat from shells; discard shells.', u'Chop clams into bite-size pieces. Strain broth through a fine-mesh sieve set over a large bowl. Add water if needed to measure 6 cups. DO AHEAD: Clams and broth can be made 1 day ahead. Cover separately and chill.', u'Melt butter in a large heavy pot over medium heat. Add bacon and cook, stirring occasionally, until fat is rendered and bacon begins to brown, about 8 minutes. Add celery, onion, and garlic and cook, stirring often, until onion is translucent, about 10 minutes. Add reserved broth (or 6 cups bottled clam juice), potatoes, thyme, and bay leaf. Bring chowder base to a simmer; cook until potatoes are tender, 20-25 minutes. Stir cornstarch and 2 Tbsp. water in a small bowl to form a slurry. Stir slurry into chowder base; return to a boil to thicken. DO AHEAD: Base can be made 1 day ahead. Let cool; cover and chill. Keep clams chilled. Bring base to a simmer before continuing.', u"Remove base from heat. Discard bay leaf. Stir in reserved clams (or two 10-ounce cans baby clams) and cream. Season with salt, if needed (clams' brininess varies), and pepper.", u'Divide chowder among bowls. Garnish with chives and oyster crackers.'], 'chef': u'Mary-Frances Heck', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/new-england-clam-chowder-51122640', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 to 10 servings', 'recipe title': u'New England Clam Chowder', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 30 min Start to finish: 4 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'56%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 large navel oranges', u'1 3/4 cups sugar', u'3 cups whole milk', u'3 whole large eggs and 3 large egg yolks', u'Special equipment: 6 (6-oz) ramekins'], 'preperation steps': [u'Finely grate zest from oranges, then squeeze enough juice to measure 1 cup.', u'Pour juice through a fine sieve into a 2-quart heavy saucepan, discarding pulp, and stir in 1 cup sugar. Bring to a boil over moderately high heat, stirring until sugar is dissolved. Boil, without stirring but washing down any sugar crystals with a brush dipped in cold water and skimming froth as necessary, until syrup begins to turn golden, about 5 minutes. Continue to boil, swirling pan occasionally, until syrup is a deep golden caramel. Immediately divide caramel among ramekins, tilting if necessary to coat bottoms.', u'Preheat oven to 325\xb0F and line bottom of a small roasting pan with a folded kitchen towel.', u'Bring milk and zest just to a simmer over moderate heat, then remove from heat and let stand, covered, 10 minutes.', u'Whisk together whole eggs, yolks, and remaining 3/4 cup sugar in a large bowl, then whisk in warm milk. Pour custard through fine sieve into a bowl, pressing on and discarding solids. Divide custard among ramekins and arrange ramekins in roasting pan.', u'Carefully add enough hot water to pan to reach halfway up sides of ramekins. Bake in middle of oven until custard is just set (but still trembles slightly in center), 50 minutes to 1 hour. Run a thin knife around side of each ramekin to loosen, then transfer ramekins to a rack and cool. Chill, loosely covered, at least 2 hours.', u'To unmold, invert plates over ramekins and invert custards onto plates.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/orange-creme-caramels-106086', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Orange Cr\xe8me Caramels', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'What to drink: Stick with beer \u2014 choose a dark, medium-bodied lager with a hint of sweetness, like Shiner Bock from Shiner, Texas ($6 per six-pack).', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'85%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'3 large garlic cloves, minced', u'2 teaspoons Dijon mustard', u'2 teaspoons chopped fresh rosemary', u'2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce', u'2 teaspoons coarsely ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup dark lager beer (such as bock, m\xe4rzen, or Samuel Adams Black Lager)', u'2 1/2 pounds trimmed hanger steaks (about 3 pieces)', u'Nonstick vegetable oil spray'], 'preperation steps': [u'Whisk first 7 ingredients in medium bowl, then whisk in beer. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"The pan-fried pizza move comes in handy during the summer when you don't want to turn the oven to 500\xb0F.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'Olive oil, for frying and brushing', u'4 ounces ham or prosciutto, chopped', u'1 16-ounce ball homemade pizza dough or your favorite store-bought variety, split into 2 8-ounce balls', u'1 cup pizza sauce or your favorite store-bought variety', u'1 8-ounce ball fresh mozzarella, thinly sliced', u'1 1/2 cups pineapple cubes', u'4 or 5 fresh basil leaves, shredded'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat the broiler.', u"Add a little oil to a medium cast-iron pan and fry the ham over medium-low heat until it's a little brown and crispy, about 3 minutes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"This is a family favorite, created by Gianni's aunt Angela. It's a great cake to make when summer fruit is abundant. It is delicious when made with the plums called for in this recipe, but you may also want to consider using figs\x97one of my favorite fruits\x97or pitted sweet cherries. You can substitute about 6 quartered figs or 1/2 cup of cherries in place of the plums.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'88%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons finely ground cornmeal or semolina flour', u'1 cup all-purpose flour', u'1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder', u'Pinch of kosher salt', u'13 tablespoons butter, softened', u'3/4 cup granulated sugar', u'4 large egg yolks', u'2 large eggs', u'1 teaspoon grated lemon zest', u'1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract', u'4 plums, cut in half and pitted', u'2 tablespoons packed light brown sugar'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Preheat the oven to 350 \xb0F. Grease and lightly flour an 8 x 2-inch round cake pan or an 8-inch springform pan, tapping out any excess flour. Set aside.', u'2. In a small bowl, toss the cornmeal, all-purpose flour, baking powder, and salt. Set aside.', u'3. In a large bowl, beat the butter and granulated sugar together with an electric mixer, until pale yellow and creamy, about 5 minutes. Scrape down the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula and add the egg yolks, one at a time, beating after each addition. Scrape down the sides of the bowl and add the whole eggs, one at a time, beating after each addition. Mix in the lemon zest and vanilla. Add the dry ingredients and blend until just combined.', u'4. Spread the batter in the prepared pan. Place the plum halves, skin side down, at even intervals on top of the batter. Sprinkle the brown sugar on top of the fruit and batter. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Galette des Rois', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'95%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/4 cup pure almond paste (2 ounces)', u'1/4 cup granulated sugar', u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened', u'2 large eggs', u'1/4 teaspoon vanilla', u'1/4 teaspoon almond extract', u'2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'1 (17 1/4-oz) package frozen puff pastry sheets, thawed', u'1 dried bean such as a lima bean (optional)', u'1/2 tablespoon confectioners sugar'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 450\xb0F.', u'Pur\xe9e almond paste, granulated sugar, butter, and a pinch of salt in a food processor until smooth. Add flour and pulse until incorporated.', u'Roll out 1 puff pastry sheet into an 11 1/2-inch square on a lightly floured surface with a floured rolling pin, then brush off excess flour from both sides. Cut out an 11-inch round by tracing around an inverted plate with tip of a paring knife. Transfer round to a buttered large baking sheet (not dark metal, or pastry may brown too much), discarding trimmings, and chill. Repeat procedure with second pastry sheet, leaving round on floured surface.', u'Beat remaining egg with a fork and brush some over top of second round. Score round decoratively all over using tip of knife, then make several small slits all the way through pastry, at about 2-inch intervals, to create steam vents.', u'Brush some of egg in a 1-inch-wide border around edge of chilled pastry round (on baking sheet). Mound almond cream in center of chilled round, spreading slightly, and bury bean in cream. Immediately cover with decorated round and press edges together lightly. Holding a small spoon with side at an angle, press around edge to seal galette decoratively.', u'Bake galette in lower third of oven until puffed and pale golden, 13 to 15 minutes. Dust galette with confectioners sugar and bake in upper third of oven until edge is deep golden brown and shiny, 12 to 15 minutes more. Transfer to a rack to cool slightly, 5 to 10 minutes. Serve warm.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/puff-pastry-tart-filled-with-almond-cream-107614', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Puff Pastry Tart Filled with Almond Cream', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'In Greek mythology, the quince, with its intoxicating perfume, was the golden apple that Paris gave to Aphrodite, "the fairest of them all." Edward Lear\'s Owl and Pussy-Cat dined "on mince, and slices of quince, which they ate with a runcible spoon." Coming up with a recipe to match the stuff of legend is not the easiest thing in the world, but this ultra-simple creation is delicate and alluringly aromatic. Worthy, in fact, of the goddess of beauty and, served as a compote with a little whipped cream or Greek-style yogurt, suitable for eating with a spoon, runcible or otherwise.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 quinces (about 2 pounds total)', u'6 cups water', u'2 cups sugar', u'4 (1/4-inch-thick) lemon slices', u'4 (1/4-inch-thick) orange slices', u'6 green cardamom pods, gently crushed'], 'preperation steps': [u'Peel quinces, then quarter and core. Cover with water in a bowl (to prevent discoloration).', u'Bring water, sugar, citrus slices, and cardamom pods to a simmer in a small pot, stirring until sugar has dissolved.', u'Cut quince quarters into 1/4-inch-thick wedges and add to syrup. Return to a simmer and cover quince with a round of parchment paper. Simmer until quince is just tender, about 45 minutes. Discard citrus slices. Cool quince in syrup to room temperature, about 1 hour (color will deepen). Discard cardamom pods.'], 'chef': u'Andrea Albin', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/quince-poached-in-cardamom-syrup-354965', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 to 10 (dessert) servings', 'recipe title': u'Quince Poached in Cardamom Syrup', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Having broth as a tapa is an old custom that's becoming popular again in both Spain and the U.S. Food editor Ruth Cousineau set out to make just the broth, but the resulting short rib meat was so delicious (even after cooking in broth all that time) that she didn't want to waste it, so she came up with a use for it in a short rib terrine. This recipe is traditionally made with oxtails, but we substituted short ribs and beef shanks because they're easier to get in most supermarkets. If you'd like to try it with oxtails instead of ribs and shanks, use 6 pounds of oxtails (preferably from grass-fed beef, such as Niman Ranch).", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 pounds short ribs or flanken', u'2 pounds meaty beef shanks', u'2 onions, left unpeeled, quartered', u'2 celery ribs, quartered', u'2 carrots, 1 quartered and 1 cut into 1/4-inch dice', u'4 fresh parsley stems (without leaves)', u'1 fresh thyme sprig', u'1 Turkish or 1/2 California bay leaf', u'4 whole black peppercorns', u'14 cups water', u'1 1/2 teaspoons salt', u'Special equipment: cheesecloth; kitchen string; 12 demitasse or espresso cups'], 'preperation steps': [u'Put oven rack in lower third of oven and preheat oven to 450\xb0F.', u'Spread short ribs, shanks, onions, celery, and quartered carrot in a large flameproof roasting pan and roast, turning occasionally, until well browned, about 1 hour.', u'Wrap parsley, thyme, bay leaf, and peppercorns in cheesecloth and tie into a bundle with string to make a bouquet garni.', u'Transfer meat (with bones) and roasted vegetables to a 6- to 8-quart pot and add 12 cups water, salt, and bouquet garni. Straddle roasting pan across 2 burners, then add remaining 2 cups water and deglaze pan by boiling, stirring and scraping up brown bits, 1 minute. Add deglazing liquid to pot, then bring to a boil, skimming froth. Reduce heat to low and gently simmer, uncovered, until liquid is reduced to about 5 cups, 7 to 8 hours.', u'Transfer mixture to a bowl and cool completely, uncovered, about 1 hour, then chill, covered, at least 8 hours.', u'Remove fat. Reheat mixture in cleaned pot over moderate heat until warm. Discard beef shanks (meat and bone), then transfer short ribs to a platter and, when cool enough to handle, discard bones and fat. Finely chop short ribs and reserve for terrine . If not using meat within 1 hour, chill, covered. Pour broth though a cheesecloth-lined sieve into a 1 1/2-quart saucepan and skim off any remaining fat. Bring broth to a simmer and season with salt.', u'Cook diced carrot in a small saucepan of boiling salted water until just tender, about 4 minutes. Drain in sieve and divide among demitasse cups, then add broth.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/rich-beef-broth-with-carrot-231373', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes about 4 cups, or 12 servings (as part of tapas buffet)', 'recipe title': u'Rich Beef Broth with Carrot', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'79%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 large red bell peppers, halved, seeded', u'6 large yellow bell peppers, halved, seeded', u'6 large orange bell peppers, halved, seeded', u'8 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'3 tablespoons (or more) balsamic vinegar', u'1/2 cup pine nuts, toasted'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 400\xb0F. Transfer to large bowl; add accumulated juices from baking sheets. Add 3 tablespoons vinegar and remaining 2 tablespoons oil; toss gently. Refrigerate at least 1 hour. (Can be prepared 1 day ahead.) Drain peppers; discard juices. Transfer peppers to platter. Season with salt, pepper and more vinegar, if desired. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 hr Start to finish: 2 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 large fennel bulbs (sometimes called anise; 21/2 lb total), stalks trimmed flush with bulbs and bulbs halved lengthwise', u'1/2 teaspoon olive oil', u'3/4 stick (6 tablespoons) unsalted butter', u'1 1/2 roasted, shelled, and skinned chestnuts (1 lb in shell or 11 oz bottled whole)', u'6 unsprayed fresh fig leaves (optional)', u'6 (1-inch-thick) monkfish steaks (6 oz each)', u'1 cup white bordelaise sauce'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 425\xb0F.', u'Cut 1 fennel bulb half lengthwise into paper-thin slices with a mandoline or other manual slicer and toss with oil and salt and pepper to taste. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"You'd think grown-ups wouldn't have to share this beautiful side dish, but the onions' crispy sweetness makes them pretty irresistible to kids.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'50%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 medium red onions or sweet onions (such as Walla Walla), skin on, roots intact', u'6 tablespoons olive oil, divided', u'Salt (smoked is delicious here)', u'Herbs-either a few bay leaves or a few sprigs of rosemary and thyme', u'Freshly ground black pepper'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0.', u'Make a total of 4 vertical cuts in each onion to create 8 wedges still attached at the root end.', u'Drizzle a little of the olive oil into a baking dish, then arrange onions root end down.', u'Spoon remaining olive oil into and around onions. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'You will need three pots for this recipe.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'89%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 dozen littleneck clams (about 9 pounds), scrubbed', u'2 pounds sweet Italian turkey sausages', u'6 medium-size white potatoes (about 2 pounds), unpeeled', u'2 cups water', u'1 tablespoon dried oregano', u'1 teaspoon dried crushed red pepper', u'Shallot Butter', u'6 1-pound live lobsters or three 2-pound live lobsters', u'6 ears corn, husked'], 'preperation steps': [u'Divide clams between 2 large pots, pushing clams to one side of each pot. Divide sausages and potatoes between pots, placing both ingredients on the other side of pots. Add 1 cup water, 1/2 tablespoon oregano, 1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper, then 1/4 cup Shallot Butter to each pot. Cover tightly and cook over high heat until clams open, about 8 minutes (discard any clams that do not open). Remove from heat. Using slotted spoon, transfer clams to large bowl, leaving sausages and potatoes in pots. Ladle some of cooking broth into small serving bowl. Serve clams as appetizer, offering broth alongside.', u'Cook 3 lobsters at a time in large stockpot of boiling water, about 12 minutes for 1-pound lobsters and 20 minutes for 2-pound lobsters. Transfer lobsters to bowl.', u'Meanwhile, set pots with sausages and potatoes over medium heat. Cover and continue to cook until potatoes begin to soften, about 12 minutes. Add corn to pots; cook until vegetables are tender and sausages are cooked through, about 10 minutes longer.', u'Using heavy large knife, cut 2-pound lobsters in half lengthwise; keep 1-pound lobsters whole. Place lobsters, sausages, potatoes and corn on large platter. Pour remaining Shallot Butter into small bowl. Pour any broth from pots into another small bowl; serve alongside lobsters.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/steamed-clams-and-lobster-with-shallot-butter-corn-sausages-and-potatoes-101948', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 6', 'recipe title': u'Steamed Clams and Lobster with Shallot Butter, Corn, Sausages and Potatoes', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Most recipes for steamed mussels call for crusty bread on the side. Here, slices of bread are baked right on top of the mussels. To be sure everyone can enjoy the delicious juices in the bottom of the pans, serve this entr\xe9e straight from the cast-iron skillets (use trivets to protect the table).', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'75%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 pounds sweet or hot Italian link sausages, divided', u'2 large onions, sliced (about 6 cups), divided', u'2 large fresh fennel bulbs, sliced (about 6 cups), divided', u'6 garlic cloves, crushed, divided', u'1 teaspoon dried crushed red pepper, divided', u'3 cups dry white wine (about one 750-ml bottle), divided', u'6 pounds mussels, scrubbed, debearded', u'1 16-ounce crusty French or sourdough baguette, cut into 1/2-inch-thick slices, divided', u'Extra-virgin olive oil (for drizzling)', u'Chopped fresh Italian parsley'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 450\xb0F. Using fork, pierce sausages all over. Heat each of 2 large cast-iron skillets or other large ovenproof skillets over medium-high heat. Add half of sausages to each skillet and cook meat until browned, turning occasionally, about 5 minutes. Add half of onions, half of fennel, half of garlic, and half of dried crushed red pepper to each skillet. Add 1 cup white wine to each skillet and bring to boil. Cover and simmer until sausages and vegetables are cooked through, about 12 minutes. Add 1/2 cup wine, then 1/2 of mussels to each skillet; transfer skillets to oven and roast uncovered 5 minutes. Carefully remove skillets from oven; top each skillet with enough baguette slices to cover completely. Return skillets to oven; bake uncovered until mussels open and bread slices begin to brown, about 5 minutes longer (discard any mussels that do not open).', u'Drizzle bread in each skillet with extra-virgin olive oil, then sprinkle with chopped parsley. Serve mussels and sausages directly from skillets.'], 'chef': u'Josie Le Balch', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/steamed-mussels-with-sausages-and-fennel-351276', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Steamed Mussels with Sausages and Fennel', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"This dramatic, gorgeous terrine isn't just visually arresting; it's also absolutely delicious \u2014 and such a sophisticated change of pace from a salad to start the meal. We used beets, haricots verts, and wax beans here, but feel free to improvise if other vegetables look tempting at your local farmers market; you'll need a total of 6 cups of cooked vegetables. Since the vegetables are cooked until very tender \u2014 a knife should be able to cut through them without resistance \u2014 the terrine slices beautifully.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'45%', 'ingredient list': [u"2 1/2 lb mixed baby (1-inch) or medium (2-inch) Chioggia and golden beets with greens (about 16 baby or 6 medium; see cooks' note, below)", u'2 large leeks, trimmed of any discolored leaves or ends, leaving green parts attached', u'2 medium carrots, thinly sliced crosswise', u'2 celery ribs, sliced, reserving leaves', u'2 shallots, thinly sliced crosswise', u'2 cups dry white wine', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'10 black peppercorns', u'3 1/4 cups cold water', u'1/2 cup chopped mixed tender fresh herbs, stems reserved for stock', u'1 (1/2-oz) bunch fresh chives, coarser bottom third cut off and reserved and remainder chopped', u'4 1/2 teaspoons gelatin (from two 1/4-oz envelopes)', u'1/3 lb haricots verts, trimmed', u'1/3 lb wax beans, trimmed', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil, plus additional for oiling terrine', u'Fleur de sel for sprinkling', u'Coarsely ground black pepper for sprinkling', u"Special equipment: heavy-duty foil; a nonreactive (6-cup capacity) rectangular terrine or loaf pan (see cooks' note, below)", u'Garnish: fresh herb sprigs'], 'preperation steps': [u'Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 450\xb0F.', u'Trim beets, leaving 1/2 inch of stems intact. Divide between 2 sheets of heavy-duty foil and wrap foil to enclose beets. Roast in a shallow baking pan until very tender, 1 to 1 1/2 hours. Let steam in foil 15 minutes, then peel beets and cut into 1-inch-wide wedges if large. Season with salt and pepper.', u'Halve leeks lengthwise, then coarsely chop. Wash leeks in a bowl of water, agitating them, then lift out with a slotted spoon and transfer to a 3-quart saucepan. Add carrots to leeks along with sliced celery, shallots, wine, salt, peppercorns, and 3 cups cold water and bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, 30 minutes.', u'Add celery leaves, herb stems, and coarse parts of chives and simmer 10 minutes. Pour stock through a fine-mesh sieve into a 1-quart glass measure or heatproof bowl, discarding solids. If stock measures more than 2 1/2 cups, return to saucepan and boil until reduced to 2 1/2 cups, about 10 to 15 minutes. If there is less, add water. Season with salt and pepper.', u'Stir gelatin into remaining 1/4 cup cold water and let stand 1 minute to soften, then add to hot stock, stirring until dissolved. Set aside.', u'Boil haricots verts and wax beans in separate batches in a 5- to 6-quart pot of boiling salted water, uncovered, until very tender, 6 to 7 minutes per batch, transferring with a slotted spoon to a bowl of ice and cold water to stop cooking. Drain in a colander and pat dry. Transfer to a large bowl and season with salt and pepper.', u'Very lightly oil terrine, then line long sides and bottom with a sheet of plastic wrap, smoothing out any wrinkles and allowing at least 2 inches of overhang on each side. Pour about 1/2 cup gelatin mixture into terrine and quick-chill in freezer until just set, about 10 minutes.', u'Lay one third of beans lengthwise over set gelatin layer. Sprinkle with one third of chopped herbs (including chives), then loosely top with half of beets, leaving some space between them (for gelatin to fill and hold vegetables together). Repeat layering with half of remaining beans and herbs and all of beets, then end with a third layer of beans and herbs. Stir remaining gelatin mixture again, then slowly pour in all but 1/2 cup (reserve remainder at room temperature), pushing down vegetables if necessary to just cover with gelatin mixture. Chill, uncovered, until top is set, 1 1/2 to 2 hours.', u'If reserved 1/2 cup gelatin mixture has begun to set, heat until just liquefied but not hot, then pour over set terrine. Chill until firm, about 2 hours.', u'Run a thin knife along short sides (ends) of terrine, then invert terrine onto a cutting board, gently pulling on plastic overhang to help unmold (discard plastic wrap). Carefully cut terrine with a very sharp knife into 8 slices, transferring each slice to a plate as cut, using a metal spatula to hold outside of each slice steady. Drizzle oil (1/4 cup) around plates and sprinkle fleur de sel and pepper over oil and terrine.'], 'chef': u'lley Wiseman', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/summer-vegetable-terrine-1222173', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 first-course servings', 'recipe title': u'Summer Vegetable Terrine', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Vegan', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'57%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/3 cup quinoa', u'1 medium orange sweet potato (3/4 pound)', u'1 1/2 cups cooked chickpeas or one 15-ounce can, rinsed and thoroughly drained', u'1 heaping tablespoon finely minced fresh ginger', u'1 teaspoon minced or crushed garlic', u'3 scallions (whites plus light greens), cut into 1-inch pieces', u'3/4 teaspoon salt, or more to taste', u'2 teaspoons cumin seeds, lightly toasted', u'2-3 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, or to taste', u'6 tablespoons quinoa flour', u'1 cup green peas (steamed fresh or defrosted frozen)', u'1 cup unsalted peanuts, lightly toasted (optional)', u'Crushed red pepper', u'About 2 tablespoons grapeseed or high-oleic safflower oil for frying', u'Nonstick cooking spray'], 'preperation steps': [u"1. Combine the quinoa and 1/2 cup water in a very small saucepan with a lid. Bring to a boil, cover the pot, and lower the heat to the slowest possible simmer, with a heat diffuser, if you have one, underneath. You'll have cooked quinoa in about 20 minutes. Uncover, fluff with a fork, and set aside.", u'2. Meanwhile, cut the sweet potato into rounds about 1 1/2 inches thick and steam over or cook in boiling water until fork-soft, about 15 minutes. Cool until comfortable to handle. Strip off and discard the peels and transfer to a food processor.', u"3. Add the chickpeas, ginger, garlic, scallions, 3/4 teaspoon salt, cumin, and 2 tablespoons of the lemon juice to the sweet potato and process until reasonably blended. It doesn't need to be completely smooth.", u'4. Transfer the mixture to a bowl, then sprinkle in the cooked quinoa and the quinoa flour. Stir until all the quinoa disappears into the mixture. Gently fold in the green peas and peanuts, if using. Taste to see if it needs more salt or lemon juice and add a few big pinches of crushed red pepper flakes to taste.', u'5. Place a medium skillet over medium heat for about a minute, then add a scant 1/2 tablespoon oil and swirl to coat the pan. Heat for a little longer, until the oil is hot enough to instantly sizzle a dot of the sweet potato mixture. Turn the heat to low.', u'6. Use a nonstick-sprayed 1/3-cup measure to scoop-shape the batter as uniformly as possible. Carefully transfer as many burgers as will fit in a single layer to the hot, oiled pan, knocking the cup handle assertively against the side of the pan or using the back of a spoon to release the batter. Smooth the top surface with a dinner knife, so the burgers will crisp evenly, and push in the sides to help them keep their shape as they cook.', u'7. Cook over low heat for 8 to 10 minutes, or until golden brown on the bottom. (Longer cooking is OK\u2014just not hotter. The sugar content of sweet potatoes causes them to burn easily at higher temperatures.) Use a small spatula with a thin blade to carefully loosen each burger and flip it over, adding more oil as needed and pushing the burgers back into shape if they slump or break.', u'8. Cook on the second side for 8 to 10 minutes, or until the bottoms are nicely browned. Continue to cook in batches until all the batter has been used. Serve hot or warm.', u'Toasted peanuts on top  Steamed peas on top  Yogurt or Raita  Salsa Verde  A drizzle of pomegranate molasses'], 'chef': u'Mollie Katzen', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/sweet-potato-chickpea-quinoa-burgers-51196430', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 10 or 11 burgers', 'recipe title': u'Sweet Potato\u2013Chickpea-Quinoa Burgers', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This traditional sweet is believed to have originated in Sichuan, where walnut trees from Persia were first planted in China. As with many Chinese foods, the walnut is imbued with symbolic meaning: it is believed to benefit the mind because the shelled nut looks like a brain lobe. Brain food or not, the walnut was a deliciously significant sweet long ago in Sichuan and western China. Reminiscent of halvah, mashed walnuts encased in a thin, flaky dough and covered with sugar syrup is a famed tea-time dish and just one of many Sichuan creations based on walnuts.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'10 cups water; plus 6 tablespoons for glaze', u'12 ounces (about 4 cups) walnut halves', u'6 tablespoons sugar', u'5 cups peanut oil'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Place 5 cups of the water in a pot and bring to a boil over high heat. Add the walnuts and stir. Allow the water to return to a boil and boil for 3 minutes. Turn off the heat and run cold water into the pot. Drain the nuts thoroughly in a strainer. Return the nuts to the pot, add 5 cups of the water, and bring to a boil over high heat. Allow the nuts to boil for 5 minutes, then drain again and set the walnuts aside to dry.', u'2. This next step requires a wok that is completely free of oil. Place the 6 tablespoons water in the wok and bring to a boil over high heat. Add the sugar and stir to dissolve with a spatula. Bring to boil and stir constantly for 2 minutes. Add the walnuts and continue to stir for about 8 minutes, or until the nuts are coated completely with the sugar syrup and the liquid in the wok has evaporated. As the walnuts become glazed with the syrup, take care to regulate the heat so neither the nuts nor the glaze burns.', u'3. Turn off the heat. Using a Chinese strainer, remove the walnuts and set aside on a plate. Wash the wok and the spatula with extremely hot water to remove the sugar residue and dry thoroughly.', u'4. Place the peanut oil in the wok, and heat it to 375\xbaF on a deep-frying thermometer. Place the walnuts on the strainer and lower them into the hot oil. Fry the walnuts, stirring with the spatula, for about 5 minutes, or until they turn a golden amber brown. Turn off the heat. Scoop the nuts from the oil with the strainer and allow to drain briefly.', u'5. Spread the nuts on a baking sheet and let cool completely. After 2 minutes, loosen the walnuts so they do not stick to one another. Serve the cooled nuts or transfer them to an airtight container and store as directed in the introduction.'], 'chef': u'Eileen Yin-Fei Lo', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/sweet-walnuts-357569', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes about 4 cups', 'recipe title': u'Sweet Walnuts', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Is there anything better than a beautifully cooked steak? {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 40 minutes Start to finish: 6 hours(includes making dough and cooling pie)', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 cup granulated sugar', u'3 tablespoons cornstarch', u'2 tablespoons quick-cooking tapioca', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'3 cups fresh blackberries (3/4 to 1 pound)', u'2 cups fresh raspberries (1/2 to 3/4 pound)', u'2 cups fresh blueberries (1/2 to 3/4 pound)', u'Pastry dough', u'1 large egg, lightly beaten', u'1 tablespoon sanding or granulated sugar', u'Special equipment: a 9-inch metal or glass pie plate (4-cup capacity)', u'Accompaniment: vanilla cream'], 'preperation steps': [u'Put a large baking sheet in middle of oven and preheat oven to 450\xb0F.', u'Whisk together granulated sugar, cornstarch, tapioca, and salt, then toss with berries.', u'Roll out 1 piece of dough (keep remaining piece chilled) on a lightly floured surface with a lightly floured rolling pin into a 13-inch round and fit into pie plate. Trim edge, leaving a 1/2-inch overhang. Chill shell while rolling out dough for top crust.', u'Roll out remaining piece of dough on lightly floured surface with floured rolling pin into an 11-inch round.', u'Spoon filling into shell, then cover pie with pastry round and trim with kitchen shears, leaving a 1/2-inch overhang. Press edges together, then crimp edge decoratively. Brush top of pie with egg and sprinkle all over with sanding sugar. Cut 3 steam vents in top crust with a small sharp knife.', u'Bake pie on hot baking sheet in middle of oven 15 minutes, then reduce oven temperature to 375\xb0F and continue to bake until crust is golden brown and filling is bubbling, about 45 minutes more.', u'Cool pie on a rack at least 3 hours before serving to allow juices to thicken slightly (filling will still be juicy).'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/three-berry-pie-with-vanilla-cream-108420', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Three-Berry Pie with Vanilla Cream', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Fresh thyme adds a savory note to sweet roasted apples and caramelized onions.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'81%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 cups apple cider', u'5 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1 teaspoon coarse kosher salt plus additional for sprinkling', u'6 7-to 8-ounce onions, halved through root end, each half cut into 6 wedges', u'6 teaspoons coarsely chopped fresh thyme, divided', u'6 Braeburn apples (about 2 3/4 pounds total), peeled, halved, cored, each half cut into 4 wedges'], 'preperation steps': [u'Boil cider in large saucepan until reduced to 2/3 cup, about 28 minutes. Whisk in butter. Season glaze with 1 teaspoon coarse salt. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 week ahead. Cover; chill. Toss onions in large bowl with 2 teaspoons thyme and 3 tablespoons glaze. Arrange in single layer on 1 sheet. Toss apples in same bowl with 2 teaspoons thyme and 3 tablespoons glaze. Arrange in single layer on second sheet. Sprinkle onions and apples with coarse salt and pepper.', u'Roast onions on upper oven rack 10 minutes. Place apples on bottom rack. Roast onions and apples 20 minutes. Remove both sheets from oven. Drizzle remaining glaze evenly over onions and apples. Reverse position of sheets. Roast 20 minutes longer.', u'Increase oven temperature to 475\xb0F. Roast onions and apples until tender and slightly caramelized, watching closely to prevent burning, about 10 minutes longer. Transfer onions and apples to large bowl. Season with coarse salt and pepper. Sprinkle with remaining 2 teaspoons thyme.'], 'chef': u'Amelia Saltsman', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/thyme-roasted-apples-and-onions-355760', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 to 10 servings', 'recipe title': u'Thyme-Roasted Apples and Onions', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"When I was a kid and my mom made tomato soup, she would cut buttered toast into squares and float them on top of each bowl. My twist on Mom's toast is to make brown butter croutons, though when I'm really feeling feisty I go all the way and make grilled cheese croutons to float on the soup.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'91%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter', u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'1 medium onion, thinly sliced', u'3 garlic cloves, smashed with the side of a knife and peeled', u'5 cups canned whole tomatoes in juice', u'1 cup water', u'2/3 cup heavy cream', u'2 teaspoons kosher salt, plus more as needed', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, plus more as needed', u'1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes', u'1/4 teaspoon celery seed', u'1/4 teaspoon dried oregano or 1/2 teaspoon finely chopped fresh oregano', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'4 slices european-style rustic bread, crusts removed, cut into 3/4- to 1-inch cubes (30 to 36 cubes)', u'Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Remove from the heat and puree in batches in the container of a blender. Return the soup to the pot and reheat to a simmer, seasoning to taste with more salt and pepper.', u'3. Serve the soup hot, garnished with the croutons.'], 'chef': u'Tom Douglas and Shelley Lance', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/toms-tasty-tomato-soup-with-brown-butter-croutons-51129200', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u"Tom's Tasty Tomato Soup with Brown Butter Croutons", 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"You'll need metal turkey-lacing pins (sold at supermarkets) to secure the roulade. Because they grow up to be portobellos, crimini are sometimes labled baby bellas. Using slotted spoon, transfer pancetta to paper towel to drain. Add 2 tablespoons oil to drippings in skillet. Add crimini mushrooms and onion. Saut\xe9 until mushrooms begin to brown and no liquid remains, about 8 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in pancetta and chopped porcini, then parsley, rosemary, and fennel seeds. Mix in breadcrumbs; season stuffing to taste with salt and pepper. Mix in enough reserved mushroom-soaking liquid by tablespoonfuls to moisten (about 3). Cool stuffing completely.', u'Cover opened turkey breast with waxed paper. Using rolling pin, pound to 1/2-inch-thick rectangle (about 14x10 inches). Remove waxed paper. Starting at 1 long side, roll up turkey jelly-roll style. Secure with metal turkey-lacing pins. Tie roll crosswise with kitchen string every 1 1/2 to 2 inches to hold shape. Tie roll once lengthwise to secure ends. Remove metal pins. (Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and chill.)', u'Preheat oven to 375\xb0F. Heat remaining 2 tablespoons oil in heavy large ovenproof skillet or heavy roasting pan over medium-high heat. Brown turkey roll on all sides, turning often, about 12 minutes. Pour 1/3 cup broth over. Brush with 1 teaspoon butter. Cover skillet with foil. Roast turkey 30 minutes, basting 2 more times with 1/3 cup broth and brushing with 1 teaspoon butter. Remove foil. Roast until turkey is brown and thermometer inserted into center registers 170\xb0F, basting with broth and brushing with more butter occasionally, about 15 minutes longer. Transfer turkey to platter; tent loosely with foil. Reserve skillet or pan.', u'Strain pan juices into 2-cup glass measuring cup. Add more broth, if necessary, to measure 1 1/4 cups liquid. Blend 2 tablespoons butter and flour in small bowl. Place roasting skillet or pan over medium-high heat. Add 11/4 cups pan-juice mixture, wine, and remaining mushroom-soaking liquid, leaving any sediment in bowl. Simmer 5 minutes, scraping up any browned bits. Gradually whisk in flour paste. Simmer until gravy thickens, whisking constantly, about 3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.', u'Remove strings from turkey. Cut roast crosswise into 1/2-inch-thick slices and serve with gravy.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/turkey-breast-roulade-with-crimini-porcini-and-pancetta-231089', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': None, 'recipe title': u'Turkey Breast Roulade with Crimini, Porcini, and Pancetta', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'The recipe that started it all. After five thousand or so failed attempts to produce a vegan, gluten-free cupcake in my slanted, 6\u2011foot-by-5\u2011inch kitchen in Brooklyn\u2014with an oven that flared to broil at whim and had long since lost its temperature dial\u2014I had to tape a picture of a cupcake on the fridge to remember what a cupcake should look like. When I finally hit the right formula, though, I knew it immediately. The cake was delicate and golden, tasting subtly of vanilla with a faint hint of lemon. Now, when I see rows of these beauties on the speed rack at the bakery awaiting frosting, it\x92s hard not to slip into nostalgic reverie.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'57%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 cups garbanzo-fava bean flour', u'1 cup potato starch', u'\xbd cup arrowroot', u'1 tablespoon plus 1 \xbd teaspoons baking powder', u'\xbd teaspoon baking soda', u'1 teaspoon xanthan gum', u'2 teaspoons salt', u'2/3 cup coconut oil', u'1 1/3 cups agave nectar', u'\xbe cup homemade applesauce or store\u2011bought unsweetened applesauce', u'3 tablespoons pure vanilla extract', u'grated zest of 1 lemon', u'1 cup hot water', u'vanilla frosting'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat the oven to 325\xb0F. Add the oil, agave nectar, applesauce, vanilla, and lemon zest to the dry ingredients and combine. Stir in the hot water and mix until the batter is smooth.', u'Pour 1/3 cup batter into each prepared cup, almost filling it. Bake the cupcakes on the center rack for 22 minutes, rotating the tins 180 degrees after 15 minutes. The finished cupcakes will be golden brown and will bounce back when pressure is applied gently to the center.', u'Let the cupcakes stand in the tins for 20 minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack and cool completely. Using a frosting knife, gently spread 1 tablespoon vanilla frosting over each cupcake. Store the cupcakes in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.'], 'chef': u'Erin McKenna', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/vanilla-cupcakes-353909', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 24 cupcakes', 'recipe title': u'Vanilla Cupcakes', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'If you choose to omit the sweetbreads, simply begin the recipe by saut\xe9ing the pancetta. (In that case, you may also want to purchase a larger veal or pork loin \u2014 going up to a 5-pound veal loin or a 6-pound pork loin.)', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'67%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 lb veal sweetbreads', u'1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 cup shelled pistachios (not dyed red; 2 oz)', u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'5 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'2 oz thinly sliced lean pancetta, chopped', u'1 medium onion, finely chopped', u'1 medium carrot, cut into 1/4-inch dice', u'1/2 celery rib, cut into 1/4-inch dice', u'1 large garlic clove, chopped', u'1 Turkish or 1/2 California bay leaf', u'1 (3-inch) fresh thyme sprig', u'1 cup medium-dry Sherry', u'1 cup veal demi-glace', u'1 cup water', u'3/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'6 oz spinach, coarse stems discarded (4 cups)', u'3/8 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg', u'4 lb boneless veal strip loin roast or pork strip loin (not tied), completely trimmed of all fat, sinew, and silver membrane', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'Special equipment: 3 to 4 lb of weights such as large cans of soup or vegetables; parchment paper; kitchen string; an instant-read thermometer'], 'preperation steps': [u'Soak sweetbreads in a large bowl of ice and cold water in the refrigerator, changing water occasionally (2 or 3 times), at least 8 hours. Drain sweetbreads and transfer to a 4-quart heavy saucepan. Cover with cold water by 1 inch and add 1 tablespoon salt. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, until sweetbreads plump and feel slightly firmer to the touch, about 3 minutes. Drain in a colander and transfer to a bowl of cold water to stop cooking. Cut away any fat and pull away as much membrane and connective tissue as possible with a small paring knife without breaking up sweetbreads.', u'Arrange sweetbreads in 1 layer in a baking dish, then cover with plastic wrap and top with another baking dish or plate holding weights. Chill sweetbreads, weighted, at least 8 hours.', u'While sweetbreads chill, blanch pistachios in a small saucepan of boiling water 1 minute, then drain and peel.', u'Pat sweetbreads dry and season with salt and pepper. Heat oil and 2 tablespoons butter in a deep 12-inch skillet over moderately high heat until foam subsides, then saut\xe9 half of sweetbreads, turning over once, until golden brown, about 4 minutes total, and transfer to a plate. Add 1 tablespoon butter to skillet and saut\xe9 remaining sweetbreads in same manner, transferring to plate.', u'Add remaining 2 tablespoons butter to skillet, then reduce heat to moderate and cook pancetta, stirring occasionally, until beginning to brown, 2 to 3 minutes. Add onion, carrot, celery, garlic, bay leaf, and thyme, then reduce heat to moderately low and cook, stirring, until vegetables are softened, 3 to 5 minutes. Add Sherry and bring to a boil, then add demi-glace, water, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, pistachios, and sweetbreads and return to a boil. Reduce heat to low, then cover surface of mixture with a buttered round of parchment paper (buttered side down) and simmer sweetbreads, skillet partially covered with lid, until firm but still springy to the touch, 15 to 20 minutes.', u'Transfer sweetbreads with a slotted spoon to a bowl and, when cool enough to handle, pull apart into 1- to 1 1/2-inch pieces. Ladle cooking liquid through a sieve into a bowl, discarding bay leaf and thyme, and reserve. Reserve vegetables in another bowl for sauce and stuffing.', u'Cook spinach in a large pot of boiling salted water , uncovered, until wilted, about 20 seconds, then drain in colander. Transfer spinach to a bowl of cold water to stop cooking and drain again, squeezing handfuls of spinach to remove excess liquid. Chop spinach and stir into reserved vegetables along with 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and 1/8 teaspoon nutmeg.', u'Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 400\xb0F.', u'Make a hole for stuffing that runs lengthwise through veal: Beginning in middle of 1 end of roast, insert a sharp long thin knife lengthwise toward center, then repeat at opposite end of loin to complete an incision running through middle. Open up incision with your fingers, working from both ends, to create a 1 1/2-inch-wide opening. Pack loin with all but 2 tablespoons vegetable stuffing, pushing from both ends toward center.', u'Tie veal roast with kitchen string at 1-inch intervals along entire length of roast. Pat veal dry and season generously with salt and pepper.', u'Heat oil in an ovenproof 12-inch heavy skillet over high heat until just smoking, then brown veal, turning with tongs, about 5 minutes.', u'Transfer skillet to oven and roast veal until thermometer inserted diagonally 2 inches into meat (do not touch stuffing) registers 150\xb0F, 45 to 50 minutes for veal; about 40 minutes for pork. Transfer roast with tongs to a platter and let stand 20 minutes.', u'Skim fat from sweetbread cooking liquid and bring liquid to a boil in a 2 1/2-quart heavy saucepan. Stir in remaining 2 tablespoons vegetables, remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt, remaining 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg. Add sweetbreads along with any veal juices accumulated on platter and simmer until just heated through. Remove from heat and keep warm, covered.', u'Discard string, then cut veal into 1-inch-thick slices and serve with sweetbreads and some sauce. Serve remaining sauce on the side.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/vegetable-stuffed-loin-of-veal-with-sweetbreads-109214', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 10 servings', 'recipe title': u'Vegetable-Stuffed Loin of Veal with Sweetbreads', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"I'm a huge fan of small fish such as anchovies, baiting, and, of course, sardines. Unfortunately, when many Americans think of sardines, they picture tiny fish drowned in oil, or some other saucy mixture, packed side by side in a small, flat can. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This rich buttercream is lightened and brightened with the addition of lemon curd. The recipe yields enough buttercream to ice a 3-layer 9-inch round cake. For cupcakes, halve the recipe.', 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 large eggs, room temperature', u'1 1/2 cups sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'3 cups (6 sticks) unsalted butter, room temperature and very soft', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'6 tablespoons lemon curd'], 'preperation steps': [u'Bring 1 cup water to just below a simmer in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat. Using a handheld whisk, combine eggs, sugar, and salt in the bowl of a stand mixer. Place bowl on top of saucepan (it should not touch water) and cook egg mixture, whisking constantly, until lightened in color, thickened slightly, and an instant-read thermometer registers 160\xb0F. Remove from heat and beat with stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment on medium speed until completely cooled and tripled in volume, about 10 minutes. Add butter, 1\u20132 Tbsp. at a time, beating well after each addition until fully incorporated. Add vanilla and lemon curd and beat on medium-low speed until just combined.', u'Buttercream can be made and refrigerated up to 5 days in advance or frozen up to 1 month. To use refrigerated buttercream, let sit at room temperature until soft, at least 2 hours. Beat with stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment on medium speed until smooth. If texture is not smooth, beat in a little water, 1 tsp. at a time. To defrost, transfer buttercream from freezer to refrigerator to thaw overnight. Then follow the instructions for using refrigerated buttercream.'], 'chef': u' Worley', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/whole-egg-lemon-buttercream-56389523', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 cups', 'recipe title': u'Whole-Egg Lemon Buttercream', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Before I opened Flour, I was lucky to get some local press about my new bakery and caf\xe9. Just prior to opening day, the Boston Globe interviewed me for a cookie story and featured a bigger-than-life-size photo of my hand holding one of these lacy sesame cookies. They are gorgeous, but the ironic thing was that I didn't intend them as a selling point for Flour. A baking sheet of them just happened to be near me when the photographer asked for a prop. I'd been using the cookies for years in my restaurant work to garnish ice cream and sorbet desserts, and I wasn't planning to make them at Flour, because they seemed too brittle and delicate for the rough-and-tumble world of chocolate chip cookies and oatmeal scones. But when our doors opened, practically every other customer who walked in asked about the scrumptious-looking cookie in the newspaper and wanted to order one. We tried making them for a while, but, as I had suspected, they didn't hold up well stacked with the other cookies on our counter. Ever so slowly, we phased them out and customers eventually forgot about them.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'40%', 'ingredient list': [u'7 tablespoons (7/8 stick/100 grams) unsalted butter, at room temperature', u'1/2 cup (100 grams) granulated sugar', u'7 tablespoons (100 grams) packed light brown sugar', u'1/2 cup (70 grams) unbleached all-purpose flour', u'1/3 cup (80 grams) fresh orange juice (about 1 1/2 oranges)', u'3 tablespoons black sesame seeds'], 'preperation steps': [u'Using a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment (or a handheld mixer or a wooden spoon), cream the butter until creamy and light, about 2 minutes. Add the granulated sugar and brown sugar and continue to beat on medium speed for about 1 minute, or until combined. Turn the speed down to low and add the flour and mix until well combined. Slowly drizzle in the orange juice and mix for about 30 seconds; the mixture will look a little broken, which is okay. Mix in the sesame seeds.', u'Transfer the batter to an airtight container and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or for up to 1 week.', u'When ready to bake cookies, position a rack in the center of the oven, and heat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line a very flat baking sheet with parchment paper. (This batter spreads like crazy, so you have to use an extremely flat baking sheet in order for the cookies to bake in circles and not amoeba-like shapes.)', u'Pinch off rounded tablespoon-size balls of dough and place on the prepared baking sheet, spacing them at least 3 inches apart to allow for spreading.', u'Bake for 16 to 18 minutes, or until the cookies are completely golden brown throughout. Let cool completely (they must be firm to the touch) on the baking sheet on a wire rack. Gently remove the cookies from the parchment.', u'The cookies can be stored, in layers separated with sheets of parchment paper or waxed paper, in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days.'], 'chef': u'Joanne Chang', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/black-sesame-lace-cookies-364350', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 24 cookies', 'recipe title': u'Black Sesame Lace Cookies', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Season: Anytime. I like to make several batches of these sweets in November or early December. A dozen or so, wrapped in cellophane, are a charming gift. Needless to say, you don\u2019t need to stop at oranges: lemon and grapefruit peel work equally well, and you can use milk chocolate, dark chocolate, or white chocolate for dipping. The corn syrup is optional, but does prevent the sticks from becoming too hard. It is best to keep the candied sticks in an airtight container and only dip them in chocolate shortly before you want them.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: 530.0 calories, 110.0 calories from fat, 13.0g total fat, 7.0g saturated fat, 0.0mg cholesterol, 10.0mg sodium, 104.0g total carbs, 3.0g dietary fiber, 97.0g sugars, 2.0g protein\n\nNutritional analysis provided by TasteBook, using the USDA Nutrition Database', 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 or 5 large oranges', u'2\xa01/2 cups granulated sugar', u'1 tablespoon corn syrup (optional)', u'7 ounces good dark chocolate'], 'preperation steps': [u'Scrub the oranges, then remove the peel in quarters. To do this, cut through the peel with a sharp knife, going right around the orange, starting and finishing at the stem end, then repeat at a right angle to the first cut. Remove the peel, with the attached pith, from the fruit. Weigh out 9 ounces of peel and cut it into slices measuring about 1/4 by 2 inches.', u'Put the orange peel slices into a large pan and cover with 8 cups of cold water. Bring to a boil and simmer for 5 minutes. Drain and return to the pan with 4 cups of cold water. Bring to a boil and simmer, covered, for 45 minutes. Add the sugar and stir until dissolved (it won\u2019t take long). Simmer, covered, for 30 minutes. Remove from the heat and let stand for 24 hours.', u'Bring the pan to a boil again. Add the corn syrup, if using, and boil gently, uncovered, for 30 minutes, or until all the liquid has evaporated and the orange sticks are coated with bubbling orange syrup. Remove from the heat and allow to cool. Using a pair of tongs (or your fingers), carefully remove the orange sticks and place on a wire rack with a tray underneath to catch the drips. Leave in a warm place for 24 hours, or place in a very low oven at approximately 140\xb0F for 2 to 3 hours to dry.', u'Break the chocolate into pieces, put into a heatproof bowl over a pan of simmering water, and leave until melted. Remove from the heat. Dip one half of each orange stick in the melted chocolate and place on a sheet of parchment or waxed paper to dry.', u'Before dipping, the sticks will keep well for 3 to 4 months. Once they have their chocolate coating, they are best eaten within 3 weeks.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/candied-orange-sticks-363473', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'makes about 100 sticks', 'recipe title': u'Candied Orange Sticks', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}
