{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"For a fancifully tall cake, we used 3 (7-inch) round pans. It can also be baked in 3 (8-inch) pans, though the cake will be slightly lower. We tested this recipe with several different brands of chocolate, and found Lindt and Ghirardelli had the best flavor for this particular cake. Ours is garnished with unsprayed, organically grown rose petals, but be as creative as you'd like with yours.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'88%', 'ingredient list': [u'3/4 cup boiling water', u'1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder (not Dutch-process)', u'1 teaspoon instant-espresso powder', u'1/2 cup whole milk', u'1 teaspoon vanilla', u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u'1 1/4 teaspoons baking soda', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'2 sticks (1 cup) unsalted butter, softened', u'2 cups packed dark brown sugar', u'4 large eggs', u'2 1/2 cups heavy cream', u'20 ounces fine-quality bittersweet chocolate (not unsweetened), finely chopped in a food processor'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F. (If ganache becomes too thick, let stand at room temperature until slightly softened.)', u'Arrange 1 layer on a cake stand or plate and spread 2/3 cup ganache evenly over it. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This dish only looks indulgent: A serving has a mere 7 grams of saturated fat, and the pasta and peas help deliver 40 percent of your daily intake of folate, a nutrient that aids the body in forming red blood cells.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: 559 calories, 22 g fat, 7 g saturated, 50 g carbohydrates, 5 g fiber, 37 g protein\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Self', 'recommendation': u'78%', 'ingredient list': [u'Vegetable oil cooking spray', u'1 pound salmon fillet, skin removed', u'3/4 teaspoon salt, divided', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper, divided', u'6 ounces farfalle pasta', u'1 1/2 cups frozen peas', u'1 1/2 cups 1 percent milk,divided', u'3 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'3 ounces Neufcha\xe5tel', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh dill, divided', u'1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice', u'1 teaspoon grated lemon zest'], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat broiler to low. Coat a baking sheet with cooking spray. Season salmon with 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Broil until cooked through, 5 minutes per side. Let cool; cut salmon into bite-size pieces. Cook pasta as directed on package; add peas 3 minutes before end of cooking time; drain. Whisk 1/4 cup milk and flour in a small saucepan until smooth; whisk in remaining 1 1/4 cups milk, remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and remaining 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Cook over medium heat, whisking, until as thick as heavy cream, 10 minutes. Remove from heat; add Neufcha\xe5tel and 1 tbsp dill; whisk until cheese melts. Toss pasta and peas with sauce and salmon; drizzle with juice. Garnish with zest and remaining 1 tablespoon dill.'], 'chef': u'Marge Perry', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/creamy-farfalle-with-salmon-and-peas-364550', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 servings', 'recipe title': u'Creamy Farfalle with Salmon and Peas', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This whimsical bread is traditionally served at Italian and Greek Easter celebrations, though many Eastern European countries also claim it as their own. Dye the eggs for a more festive look.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'6-7 large eggs', u'Food coloring (optional)', u'Master Sweet Dough', u'All-purpose flour (for dusting)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Place 5 or 6 eggs in a medium pot. DO AHEAD: Eggs can be dyed up to 1 week ahead. Cover and chill.', u'Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper. Punch down dough. Divide into 3 equal pieces. Let rise in a warm, draft-free area until puffed but not doubled in size, 45-50 minutes. Arrange a rack in middle of oven; preheat to 375\xb0F. DO AHEAD: Can be made 8 hours ahead. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'You\x92ll need a 7 3/4-inch-diameter trifle dish that is at least 4 3/4 inches deep. Using a pretty glass as a guide, cut out 4 cake rounds from each cut cake layer. Keep chilled.', u'Before using, pour kumquat mixture through strainer; set kumquats aside for trifle. (Reserve syrup for another use.)', u'Stir wine and sugar in large saucepan over medium heat until sugar dissolves. Increase heat and boil wine mixture 5 minutes. Add cranberries and simmer until soft but still intact, about 5 minutes. Transfer mixture to medium bowl. Cool. Cover and chill until cold. DO AHEAD: Can be made 5 days ahead. Keep chilled.', u'Before using, pour cranberry mixture through strainer; set cranberries aside for trifle. (Reserve syrup for another use.)', u'Combine stout and molasses in large saucepan. Bring to boil over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat; stir in baking soda (mixture will foam up). Let stand until completely cool, about 1 hour.', u'Position 1 rack in top third and 1 rack in bottom third of oven and preheat to 350\xb0F. Generously butter three 8-inch-diameter cake pans with 1 1/2-inch-high sides. Dust pans with flour; tap out excess. Whisk 2 cups flour and next 6 ingredients in large bowl to blend. Divide batter among prepared pans (about 12/3 cups for each).', u'Place 2 cake pans on top rack and 1 cake pan on bottom rack of oven. Top with 11/3 cups mascarpone cream, spreading evenly to sides of dish. Sprinkle 1/2 cup drained cranberries over. Repeat 2 more times with cake layer, kumquats, mascarpone cream, and cranberries. Top with fourth cake layer. Spread 1 1/3 cups mascarpone cream over. Spoon remaining cream into pastry bag fitted with large star tip. Pipe rosettes of mascarpone cream around top edge of dish. Tent loosely with foil; chill at least 4 hours. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Keep chilled. Cover and chill remaining kumquats and cranberries separately.', u'Scatter remaining kumquats and cranberries over center of trifle and serve.', u'An Italian cream cheese; sold at many supermarkets and at Italian markets.'], 'chef': u'Claudia Fleming', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/gingerbread-trifle-with-candied-kumquats-and-wine-poached-cranberries-350790', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 12-16 servings', 'recipe title': u'Gingerbread Trifle with Candied Kumquats and Wine-Poached Cranberries', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Gaeng Pah Muu', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'78%', 'ingredient list': [u"1 lb Thai apple eggplants (see cooks' note, below)", u'2 tablespoons to 1/4 cup vegetable oil', u'1/4 to 1/2 cup Thai red curry paste', u'1 1/2 lb pork tenderloin, halved lengthwise, then sliced crosswise 1/4 inch thick', u'1/3 cup julienne strips peeled fresh or frozen grachai (lesser galangal or wild ginger; thawed if frozen) or drained bottled grachai, rinsed, or ginger', u'3 oz Chinese long beans or green beans, cut into 1-inch pieces', u'8 canned baby corn, rinsed, drained, and halved lengthwise', u'1 1/2 cups Thai chicken stock', u'3 tablespoons nam pla (Asian fish sauce; preferably Thai)', u'5 (4-inch-long) fresh or frozen Kaffir lime leaves (sometimes called bai makroot)', u'1 fresh chee fah chile or 2 red jalape\xf1o chiles, thinly sliced crosswise and seeds discarded', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 cup loosely packed bai grapao (holy basil leaves)', u'Special equipment: a large (6-qt) wok', u'Accompaniment: Thai pickled garlic (gratiam dong)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Trim eggplants and cut into 1-inch wedges (do this just before heating oil to avoid discoloration).', u'Heat oil (see above) in wok over moderate heat until warm, about 30 seconds. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"We call for English-style bitter orange marmalade (made with Seville oranges and often called Dundee) because other types made the ice cream too sweet and too soft. It's available at specialty foods shops and some supermarkets. This recipe makes about a dozen more florentines than you'll need for the sandwiches, but it's a good idea to have extra in case one or two break \u2014 and the cookies are delicious even without the ice cream.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'33%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 navel oranges', u'5 tablespoons sugar', u'1/2 cup English-style bitter orange marmalade', u'2 cups half-and-half', u'1 cup heavy cream', u'5 large egg yolks', u'1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1/8 teaspoon almond extract', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'Vegetable oil for pan', u'1 cup slivered blanched almonds (4 1/2 oz)', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'3 1/2 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened', u'2 tablespoons light corn syrup', u'2 tablespoons heavy cream', u'1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1/8 teaspoon salt', u'2 teaspoons all-purpose flour', u'5 oz fine-quality bittersweet chocolate (not unsweetened), finely chopped', u'Special equipment: an instant-read thermometer; an ice cream maker; parchment paper; a 2 1/2-inch fluted round cookie cutter; a pastry brush: an offset metal spatula'], 'preperation steps': [u'Finely grate zest from 2 oranges and cover zest with plastic wrap. Squeeze enough juice from all 3 oranges to measure 1 1/2 cups. Bring juice and 3 tablespoons sugar to a boil in a 1-quart saucepan and simmer until reduced to about 3/4 cup, about 10 minutes. Add marmalade and simmer, stirring, until melted, about 1 minute. Remove from heat and cool.', u'Bring half-and-half, cream, remaining 2 tablespoons sugar, and grated zest to a boil in a 2-quart heavy saucepan, stirring until sugar is dissolved. Whisk yolks in a bowl until blended, then add 1/2 cup hot cream mixture in a slow stream, whisking. Stir custard into cream mixture in saucepan and cook over moderately low heat, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon, until thick enough to coat back of spoon and registers 175 to 180\xb0F on thermometer (do not let boil).', u'Pour custard through a fine-mesh sieve into a (clean) metal bowl and stir in marmalade mixture, vanilla, almond extract, and salt. Cool to room temperature, stirring occasionally, then chill, covered, until cold, at least 2 hours.', u'Freeze custard in ice cream maker. While ice cream is freezing, oil bottom and sides of a 13- by 9-inch baking pan, then line bottom lengthwise with a sheet of plastic wrap, leaving a 2-inch overhang on each short end. Spread ice cream in pan, smoothing top, then wrap pan in plastic wrap and freeze until ice cream is hardened, about 4 hours.', u'Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 350\xb0F. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment.', u'Pulse almonds with sugar in a food processor until finely ground. Fifty people paid $20 each to attend this fete and to gorge themselves on Orthopteran Orzo, Locust Kabobs, a mealworm-filled Tenebrio Terrine, and a sumptuous Pear Salad dotted with Chiangbai Ants. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Blancmange is a jellied molded pudding (similar to panna cotta) that is made with almonds and milk and served cold, often with a fruit sauce. Though it dates back to medieval times, blancmange became part of Jefferson's dessert repertoire after he encountered it during his years in Paris. Following his lead as an innovator, we made this version with pistachios instead of almonds, which gives the pudding a beautiful pale green hue and terrific flavor.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'50%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 cups shelled unsalted pistachios (not dyed red; 7 oz)', u'1 3/4 cups whole milk', u'1/8 teaspoon almond extract', u'1 3/4 teaspoons unflavored gelatin (from a 1/4-oz envelope)', u'2 tablespoons cold water', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1 cup chilled heavy cream', u'Special equipment: 8 (4-oz) oval or round metal molds or ceramic ramekins; a thin fine-weave kitchen towel (not terry cloth)', u'Accompaniment: brandied poached peaches', u'Garnish: chopped unsalted pistachios'], 'preperation steps': [u'Put oven rack in middle position and preheat to 350\xb0F. Oil molds and line bottom of each with an oval of wax paper.', u'Spread pistachios on a baking sheet and toast until nuts are fragrant but not colored, 4 to 5 minutes. Transfer to a bowl and cool completely. Rub off and discard any skins.', u'Blend nuts with milk in a blender or food processor 2 minutes. Rinse kitchen towel under cold water and wring out as much water as possible. Line a large sieve with towel, then set sieve over a bowl or large glass measure and pour pistachio mixture into towel. Wrap towel up and around mixture and, working over sieve, squeeze pistachio milk (about 1 cup) from towel into bowl, discarding ground pistachios. Stir in almond extract and a pinch of salt.', u'Sprinkle gelatin over cold water in a very small bowl or a cup and let stand 1 minute.', u'Heat pistachio milk and sugar in a small saucepan over moderately low heat, stirring, until sugar is dissolved. Add gelatin mixture and cook, stirring, until gelatin is dissolved. Transfer to a metal bowl set in a larger bowl of ice and cold water and cool, stirring constantly, just until mixture is the consistency of raw egg white. Remove bowl from ice water.', u'Beat cream in another bowl with an electric mixer until it just holds stiff peaks, then whisk one fourth of cream into pistachio mixture to lighten. Fold in remaining cream gently but thoroughly and spoon mixture into molds. Chill blancmanges, covered with plastic wrap, until set, at least 6 hours.', u'Working with 1 blancmange at a time, run tip of a thin knife between each custard and metal mold. Tilt mold sideways and tap side of mold against a work surface, turning it, to evenly break seal and loosen custard. Keeping mold tilted, invert a dessert plate over mold, then invert blancmange onto plate.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/pistachio-blancmanges-108527', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Pistachio Blancmanges', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"It seems na\xefve to talk about building a business on a single muffin, but in case of this pumpkin muffin, it's the truth. Instead of the heavy, dark-brown pumpkin muffins people expected, we offered them a light-textured, attractive, pastel orange mini-cake, sprinkled with sunflower seeds. Word about my baking spread, thanks to the success of those muffins. Thank you, Peggy Cullen, for sharing these beauties.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'67%', 'ingredient list': [u'Softened unsalted butter, for the pan', u'3 2/3 cups pastry flour, sifted', u'1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon baking powder', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/4 teaspoon ground ginger', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg', u'1/4 teaspoon fine sea salt', u'8 tablespoons (1 stick) unsalted butter, chilled and cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u'1 1/3 cups superfine sugar', u'4 large eggs, at room temperature, beaten', u'One 15-ounce can solid-pack pumpkin', u'1 cup seedless golden or dark raisins', u'1/4 cup hulled unsalted sunflower seeds'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Position a rack in the center of the oven and preheat to 400\u02daF. Brush the insides of 12 to 14 muffin cups with softened butter, then brush the top of the pan.', u'2. Sift the flour, baking powder, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, and salt together into a medium bowl. Beat the butter in the bowl of a heavy-duty stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment on high speed until creamy, about I minute. Gradually beat in the sugar and continue beating, scraping the sides of the bowl often with a silicone spatula, until the mixture is very light in color and texture, about 5 minutes. Gradually beat in the eggs. Reduce the mixture speed to low. Beat in the pumpkin; the mixture may look curdled. In thirds, beat in the flour mixture, scraping down the sides of the bowl often, and mix until smooth. Add the raisins. Increase the speed to high and beat until the batter has a slight sheen, about 15 seconds, no longer.', u'3. Using a 2 1/2 inch-diameter ice-cream scoop, portion the batter, rounded side up, into the prepared cups. Sprinkle the tops with the sunflower seeds.', u'4. Bake for 10 minutes. Reduce the oven temperature to 375\xb0F and continue baking until the tops of the muffins are golden brown and a wire cake tester inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean, about 15 minutes more.', u'5. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Remove the muffins from the pan and cool completely.'], 'chef': u'Sarabeth Levine', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/pumpkin-muffins-362109', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 12 to 14 muffins', 'recipe title': u'Pumpkin Muffins', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"I'll barbecue the hell out of a goat: get the whole animal on the grill or do up just the head or maybe the legs\u2014whatever strikes my fancy. But the shoulder is probably my favorite cut to treat to hours and hours of gentle smoky caressing. This is party cooking, because (a) everyone will want some of this tender, spicy action and (b) though it takes a while to cook, you're only not sitting on your ass and drinking for, like, 10 minutes. The goat shoulder smokes for approximately seven hours. The smoking should be done in an indirect smoker (Texas-style chamber smoker). A temperature of 225\xb0F to 250\xb0F (a big variation, as smokers can be hard to control) should be maintained for 7 to 8 hours. The time variation is big, too, as there are so many smokers, and often backyard versions don't hold heat all that well. At a constant 250\xb0F, it should not take longer than 7 hours, but an understanding of the variable types of equipment should be acknowledged.", 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 fresh long red chilies, such as Anaheim or Hungarian Wax, chopped', u'2 fresh Thai bird chilies, chopped', u'3 inches fresh ginger, peeled and chopped', u'8 garlic cloves, crushed and peeled', u'1 bunch of flat-leaf parsley, leaves only', u'2 tablespoons sea salt', u'1/4 cup olive oil (the best you can afford)', u'1 bone-in goat shoulder (about 5 pounds)'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Use a mortar and pestle to pound the chilies, ginger, garlic, and parsley with the salt to a coarse paste, pounding each ingredient thoroughly before adding the next. Add the olive oil, pounding again to form a pretty smooth paste.', u'2. Rub the goat shoulder with the chili paste and refrigerate, covered, for 24 hours.', u'1. Preheat a smoker (see Headnote above).', u"2. Place the goat shoulder in the smoker (reserving any leftover marinade) and let it ride for about 3 hours. Keep an eye on the temperature, stoke your fire, and drink a Scotch. Occasionally baste the goat with the leftover marinade. After 3 hours, periodically jiggle the leg. When it gives you the sense that if you pulled just a bit harder you could tear it from the joint, it's ready, but it'll probably take another 3 to 4 hours. Serve it straight away on a platter and tear into with your hands."], 'chef': u'Zakary Pelaccio with JJ Goode', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/smoked-chili-rubbed-goat-shoulder-395590', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 4', 'recipe title': u'Smoked-Chili-Rubbed Goat Shoulder', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"It's very important not to use all white meat in this recipe \u2014 dark meat, which is higher in fat, has far more flavor, so look for ground turkey with at least 7 percent fat.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'84%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 large onion, chopped', u'2 celery ribs, chopped', u'1 red bell pepper, chopped', u'4 garlic cloves, finely chopped', u'2 1/2 lb ground turkey (not labeled "all breast meat")', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon black pepper', u'1 (28- to 32-oz) can whole tomatoes in juice', u'1/2 cup ketchup', u'2 tablespoons molasses (not blackstrap)', u'2 tablespoons cider vinegar', u'1 1/2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce', u'1 1/4 teaspoons Tabasco, or to taste', u'Cheddar buttermilk biscuits'], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat oil in a wide 8-quart heavy pot over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then saut\xe9 onion, celery, bell pepper, and garlic, stirring occasionally, until golden, 10 to 12 minutes. Add turkey and saut\xe9, stirring occasionally and breaking up large lumps with a wooden spoon, until meat is no longer pink, about 5 minutes. Stir in salt and pepper.', u'Pur\xe9e tomatoes with juice, ketchup, molasses, vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, and Tabasco in a blender until smooth. Add to turkey and simmer, uncovered, stirring occasionally, until sauce is thickened, 25 to 30 minutes.', u'Serve turkey sloppy joes on split Cheddar buttermilk biscuits.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/turkey-sloppy-joes-on-cheddar-buttermilk-biscuits-230464', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Turkey Sloppy Joes on Cheddar Buttermilk Biscuits', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'When\xad we \xaddecided\xad to start serving brunch, we were determined to stick with the original concept of the restaurant, "tea turned on its ear," so we racked our brains to come up with a way to do french toast that was unique, fun, and, most important, tasty! We all tossed a bunch of ideas out there, and one of them was french toast bread pudding. All heads tilted curiously at this idea, so of course we tried it. The idea was for it to be like a true bread pudding\u2014tea-infused, of course\u2014but when the first batch came out, our chef said, "I don\'t think this one is right\u2014the top is crisp and chewy, but the bottom may be mushy." We tried it, and lo and behold, there it was, the brunch item that would make eyes widen and taste buds explode: a layer of crisp and chewy french toast on top and a wonderfully gooey, creamy bread pudding infused with apricot brandy tea underneath. Note that you will need eight 2-inch-deep oven-safe glass bowls (8-ounce ramekins or cr\xe8me br\xfbl\xe9e dishes work well).', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 eggs', u'1 cup heavy cream', u'1 cup sugar', u'1 1/2 tablespoons pure vanilla extract', u'1 tablespoon freshly squeezed orange juice', u'1 tablespoon freshly squeezed lemon juice', u'1 1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon', u'1 loaf brioche (or challah, as a second choice), cut into eight 3/4-inch- thick slices', u'Butter, for the pan', u'1/4 cup heavy cream', u'1 tablespoon Apricot Brandy tea leaves (see Resources)', u'4 1/2 large egg yolks', u'Half of 1 large beaten egg', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1 1/2 tablespoons pure vanilla extract', u'Pure maple syrup', u'Cr\xe8me anglaise', u'Fruit coulis', u"Confectioners' sugar", u'Fresh fruit'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Preheat the oven to 350\xb0F.', u'2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the eggs, heavy cream, sugar, vanilla extract, orange and lemon juices, and cinnamon. Whisk the mixture until it is smooth and combined, but do not overbeat it. Place each slice of bread into the mixture and let it absorb the liquid thoroughly. Set the soaked bread aside on a plate.', u'3. Place a griddle or a large frying pan over medium heat and coat it with butter. When the griddle is hot, cook each slice of bread until it is nicely golden on both sides, keeping the heat at a level that allows the bread to cook through evenly without burning the egg mixture. As they are cooked, set the slices aside on a plate.', u'4. While the bread is cooking, make the pudding base: Bring the heavy cream to a simmer in a small saucepan, and then remove it from the heat. Place the tea leaves in a tea strainer and steep them in the cream for 3 minutes (or simply put the loose tea in the cream, steep for 3 minutes, and then strain carefully). Discard the tea leaves and reserve the apricot Brandy cream.', u"5. In a medium bowl, combine the egg yolks, beaten egg, and sugar, and whisk to combine. Add a little of the egg mixture to the apricot Brandy cream and continuing to whisk, gradually add the remaining egg mixture until it's fully combined. Stir in the vanilla extract. Set the pudding base aside.", u'6. When all the bread has been cooked on the griddle, cut the slices into 1 \xd7 1-inch squares.', u'7. Pour the pudding base evenly into the eight ramekins (they will be about one-fourth full), and then lay in the bread squares (the bread may extend above the edge of the ramekins). Place the ramekins on a large baking sheet, and bake for 20 minutes, or until the bread is golden and crispy and the liquid is bubbling.', u"8. To serve, drizzle maple syrup, cr\xe8me anglaise, fruit coulis, and/or confectioners' sugar on top\u2014whatever your heart desires! Slices of fresh fruit work wonderfully as a garnish or a side. Be generous, whatever you do!"], 'chef': u'Haley Fox and Lauren Fox', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/alices-curious-french-toast-bread-pudding-362651', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u"Alice's Curious French Toast Bread Pudding", 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"This recipe makes more meringue than you'll need for 8 servings. You can pipe the extra into sticks and bake them to eat as a snack.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'50%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 large egg whites', u'3/4 cup superfine granulated sugar', u'1/3 cup sliced almonds, lightly toasted , cooled, and coarsely crushed', u'Special equipment: parchment paper; a pastry bag fitted with a 3/8-inch plain tip'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 225\xb0F.', u'Beat whites with a pinch of salt in a bowl with an electric mixer at high speed until they hold soft peaks. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This juicy, fresh-fruit version evokes those described in 19th-century southern cookbooks. Flakes of fresh coconut provide a nice chew, and a little Sherry gives it sophistication and complexity. Ambrosia is often served as part of the transition to dessert, but at a generous meal like this one it fits in well earlier on, providing a bright, refreshing contrast to the main course.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'25%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 medium coconut', u'8 large navel oranges', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'Pinch of kosher or sea salt', u'3 tablespoons cream Sherry'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 400\xb0F with rack in middle.', u'Pierce softest eye of coconut with a small screwdriver, then drain liquid and discard. Coarsely grate coconut on large holes of a box grater using light pressure in long strokes to produce long, feathery flakes.', u'Cut peel and pith from oranges with a sharp paring knife. Chill, covered, at least 1 hour.'], 'chef': u'tt Peacock', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/ambrosia-241176', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Ambrosia', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"If there's a way to bake a vegetable, trust a Southerner to find it. Who else, pray tell, would steam a head of cauliflower, sauce it, bread it, and bake it? Note: To save time, I nuke the cauliflower, adding no additional liquid. The drops of water clinging to the head after it's washed are quite enough. I simply put the cauliflower in a 2 1/2-quart microwave-safe casserole deep enough to accommodate it, one with a tight-fitting domed lid. I then center the covered casserole in my microwave oven, set the cook-time at 14 minutes, and hit HIGH (full power). My microwave oven is a 650-watter; newer models of higher wattage will do the job faster\u2014perhaps twice as fast. But you will know your particular model's prowess better than I. If you choose to steam the cauliflower instead, allow 8 to 10 minutes in a covered saucepan over moderate heat or until crisp-tender\u2014there should be about 3/4 inch of water in the pan. No steamer rack needed. While the cauliflower cooks, ready the sauce and bread crumb topping. That way no time wasted. Tip: For mellower flavor and smoother sauce, substitute freshly grated Parmigiano Reggiano cheese for the Cheddar our mothers and grandmothers would have used.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 large cauliflower (about 3 pounds), trimmed of leaves and coarse bottom stem, then cooked until crisp-tender (see Note above)', u'2 1/2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'6 large scallions, trimmed and finely chopped (white part only)', u'3 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg', u'2 cups half-and-half, at room temperature', u'1/2 cup freshly grated Parmigiano Reggiano (see Tip above)', u'1/3 cup moderately coarse dry bread crumbs mixed with 2 tablespoons freshly grated Parmigiano Reggiano and 1 tablespoon melted unsalted butter (Topping)'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Preheat oven to 375\xb0F. Drain all liquid from cooked cauliflower, ease whole head into 9-inch pie pan generously coated with nonstick baking spray, and set aside.', u'2. Melt butter in small heavy saucepan over moderately low heat. Add scallions and cook, stirring occasionally, 2 to 3 minutes until limp. Blend in flour, salt, pepper, and nutmeg and cook and stir 3 minutes.', u'3. Whisking constantly, add half-and-half in slow, steady stream and continue whisking 5 to 8 minutes until thickened and no raw floury taste lingers. Add cheese and stir until melted. Carefully pour sauce over cauliflower and sprinkle with Topping.', u'4. Slide onto middle oven shelf and bake uncovered about 20 minutes until lightly browned.', u'5. Ease breaded cauliflower onto heated round platter and serve as an accompaniment to roast beef, lamb, or pork. Good, too, with roast chicken or turkey or baked ham.'], 'chef': u'Jean Anderson', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/baked-breaded-cauliflower-51139400', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 Servings', 'recipe title': u'Baked Breaded Cauliflower', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Beef "tea?" Is that like beef broth? Well, kind of. It\'s a dish that goes back in time to the days when the British were trying to find the essence of what gave beef its nutritional value. Since this was before vitamins and protein were known, they weren\'t sure what they were looking for. Along the way, somebody noticed that this very mild liquid was soothing and comforting. Give it a try when you\'re feeling under the weather, but don\'t go looking for a scientific reason for its effectiveness.', 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'56%', 'ingredient list': [u'8 ounces beef chuck steak, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'3 cups water'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Combine the beef, salt, and water in a saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat. Let the mixture boil for 1 minute. Reduce the heat to low and let the water barely simmer for 20 minutes more, skimming off any scum that forms on the surface. Remove the pan from the heat and let cool.', u'2. Pour the liquid and the pieces of beef into the jar or container, cover it tightly, and let the liquid steep (like tea, of course) in the refrigerator for at least 24 hours.', u"3. Strain the liquid either through cheesecloth or a fine-mesh strainer and discard the beef. You'll be left with the tea. Serve hot."], 'chef': u'Brian Yarvin', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/beef-tea-395253', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 2 servings', 'recipe title': u'Beef Tea', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Home turf: California Local flavor: In health-conscious California, chili is as likely to be made without meat as it is with it. No self-respecting Texan would sign off on chili with beans, squash, and bulgur\u2014but this lean, mean dish is as delicious as it is healthful. Make it a meal: continue the Cali fantasy with whole grain bread, an arugula salad with mushrooms and garlicky vinaigrette, and Sierra Nevada Pale Ale (California, $8 per six-pack).', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'83%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 tablespoons olive oil', u'2 onions, chopped', u'8 garlic cloves, chopped', u'2 1/2 chili powder', u'1 tablespoon ground coriander', u'2 14.5-ounce cans fire-roasted tomatoes', u'1 pound dried black beans, rinsed', u'2 chipotle chiles from canned chipotle chiles in adobo, minced', u'2 teaspoons dried oregano (preferably Mexican)', u'Coarse kosher salt', u'1 2 1/4-pound butternut squash, peeled, seeded, cut into 1/2-inch cubes (about 3 cups)', u'1/2 cup quick-cooking bulgur', u'Sour cream', u'Coarsely grated hot pepper', u'Monterey jack cheese', u'Diced red onion chopped', u'Fresh cilantro', u'Pickled jalape\xf1o rings', u'Ingredient info: Chipotle chiles in adobo can be found at some super markets and at Latin markets. Look for bulgur at super markets and natural foods stores.'], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat oil in heavy large pot over medium-high heat. Add onions and cook until soft and beginning to brown, stirring often, about 8 minutes. Add garlic; stir 1 minute. Sprinkle chili powder and coriander over; stir 1 minute. Bring to boil, reduce heat to low, cover with lid slightly ajar, and simmer until beans are tender, stirring occasionally, about 2 hours (time will vary depending on freshness of beans). Season to taste with coarse salt and freshly ground black pepper. DO AHEAD: Chili can be made up to 2 days ahead. Cool slightly. Refrigerate uncovered until cold, then cover and keep chilled. Rewarm chili before continuing.', u'Stir squash and bulgur into chili. Simmer uncovered over medium-low heat until squash and bulgur are tender, about 30 minutes. Turn shanks over, cover, and continue to braise until meat is very tender, about 1 1/2 hours more.', u'Remove from oven and skim fat from surface of sauce, then transfer shanks and sauce to a large platter. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Pearl-like sushi rice cooks up slightly moist and sticky, so it forms a cake easily. Chilling the cakes before browning helps them hold their shape.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'86%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 cup sushi rice', u'1 scallion', u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'8 slices Canadian bacon (6 to 8 oz total)', u'4 large eggs'], 'preperation steps': [u'Rinse rice in a large fine-mesh sieve under cold running water, then drain well, tapping sieve. Combine rice, 1 1/4 cups water, and 1/4 teaspoon salt in a 2-quart heavy saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and cook, covered, 15 minutes. Remove from heat and let stand, covered, 10 minutes.', u'While rice is standing, trim scallion and cut diagonally into very thin slices.', u'Stir rice from bottom to top. Lightly butter a metal 1-cup measure. Firmly pack enough rice in measure with a rubber spatula to fill measure halfway. (If spatula becomes sticky, dip in water.) Invert measure onto a buttered plate, then tap measure to unmold rice. Repeat with remaining rice, rebuttering measure each time, to make 4 disks total. Chill disks, uncovered, at least 15 minutes.', u'Heat 1 tablespoon butter in a 12-inch nonstick skillet over moderately low heat until foam subsides. Add rice disks and cook, rotating each once for even browning, until undersides are pale golden, about 8 to 10 minutes, then turn cakes over and add 1/2 tablespoon butter to skillet, swirling to melt butter. Cook, rotating each cake once, until golden, about 5 minutes more, and transfer to plates.', u'Increase heat to high and add 1/2 tablespoon butter to skillet, then brown bacon, turning over once, about 2 minutes total. Place 2 slices bacon on each rice cake.', u'Wipe out skillet with a paper towel and heat remaining tablespoon butter over moderately high heat until foam subsides. Crack eggs one by one into skillet. Sprinkle with 1/8 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper total and fry until whites are cooked and yolks begin to set, 2 to 4 minutes.', u'Place 1 egg on each rice cake stack and sprinkle with scallion.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/breakfast-stack-231018', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 servings', 'recipe title': u'Breakfast Stack', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Brining the nuts with herbs and some spice infuses them from the inside out, and the long roasting time gives them extra toasty flavor.', 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'33%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/3 cup kosher salt', u'8 sprigs rosemary, divided', u'8 dried chiles de \xe1rbol, divided', u'1 1/2 pounds almonds', u'2 tablespoons plus 1/2 cup olive oil', u'Flaky sea salt (such as Maldon)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Bring kosher salt, 2 rosemary sprigs, 4 chiles, and 4 cups water to a boil in a medium saucepan, stirring to dissolve salt. Spread out almonds on a rimmed baking sheet; add remaining 4 chiles and drizzle with 2 tablespoons oil. Toss to coat. Roast almonds, tossing occasionally, until dried out and completely toasted through and fragrant, 45-55 minutes. Let cool.', u'Meanwhile, pick leaves from remaining 6 rosemary sprigs. Heat remaining 1/2 cup oil in a small saucepan over medium. Working in batches, fry rosemary leaves until bright green and crisp, about 30 seconds. Using a slotted spoon, transfer to paper towels to drain. Add fried rosemary to almonds, season with sea salt, and toss to combine.', u'Do ahead: Almonds can be roasted 3 days ahead. Store airtight at room temperature.'], 'chef': u'Alison Roman', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/brined-and-roasted-rosemary-chile-almonds-51252840', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'12 servings', 'recipe title': u'Brined and Roasted Rosemary-Chile Almonds', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Healers have touted saffron's medicinal properties since the days of Hippocrates, and Cleopatra claimed that it was an aphrodisiac. Its scarcity (it takes some four thousand crocus blossoms to create an ounce of saffron) and the belief that it could be used to treat everything from wounds to the plague even caused the Austrians to go to war over the spice during the Dark Ages. This is at least one feudal folk myth that modern science has corroborated. Studies have shown that saffron has outstanding antibacterial and antiviral properties and also aids digestion. People sometimes balk at saffron's cost, but it isn't unreasonable when you consider its potency; this recipe calls for only 1/8 teaspoon, and as you'll see, a little goes a long way. This pilaf is a delightful and gorgeous dish. The rice is saut\xe9ed before cooking to avoid that sticky, gummy consistency, and ginger, parsley, and lemon zest add zing.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': u'PER SERVING: Calories: 135; Total Fat: 3.5 g (0.5 g saturated, 2 g mono-\u2028unsaturated); Carbohydrates: 25 g; Protein: 3 g; Fiber: 2 g; Sodium: 184 mg\n\nNutritional analysis provided by The Longevity Kitchen', 'recommendation': u'88%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 teaspoon warm water', u'1/8 teaspoon saffron', u'1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 tablespoon diced shallot', u'1 cup brown basmati rice, soaked, rinsed, and drained well', u'1 3/4 cups water or vegetable broth, homemade or store-bought', u'1/2 teaspoon sea salt', u'1 (1-inch) piece unpeeled fresh ginger', u'1 tablespoon freshly squeezed lemon juice', u'1 teaspoon lemon zest', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh parsley'], 'preperation steps': [u"Combine the warm water and saffron in a small bowl. Heat the olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the shallot and saut\xe9 until translucent, about 3 minutes. Add the rice and saffron and cook, stirring constantly, until the rice is evenly coated with the oil. Stir in the water, salt, and ginger. Increase the heat, cover, and bring to a boil. Decrease the heat to low and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes, until the water is absorbed. Check after 20 minutes; if there are steam holes on the top, it's ready. Remove ginger. Add the lemon juice, lemon zest, and parsley and fluff with a fork to combine."], 'chef': u'Rebecca Katz with Mat Edelson', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/brown-rice-pilaf-with-saffron-and-ginger-51151200', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Brown Rice Pilaf with Saffron and Ginger', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This version of blini\u2014a tribute to the Russian communities throughout the New York metropolitan area\u2014is fast because it does not require yeast. If buckwheat flour is unavailable, whole-wheat flour makes a good substitute.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'67%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/2 cup all-purpose flour', u'1/4 cup buckwheat flour*', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon baking soda', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'2 large eggs, separated', u'1/2 cup milk', u'1/2 stick (1/4 cup) unsalted butter, melted', u'1/2 cup sour cream', u'1/8 teaspoon salt', u'1/8 teaspoon black pepper', u'1 teaspoon chopped fresh dill or chives', u'8 oz thinly sliced smoked salmon, cut into small pieces', u'Garnish: chopped fresh dill or chives'], 'preperation steps': [u'Whisk together dry ingredients in a large bowl. Whisk together yolks and milk in a small bowl, then whisk into dry ingredients. Beat egg whites in another large bowl with an electric mixer until they hold soft peaks, then fold into flour mixture. Working in batches of 4, spoon about 1 1/2 tablespoons batter per pancake into skillet and cook until surface of pancakes bubbles, 1 to 2 minutes, then flip and cook 1 minute more. Transfer to a plate and keep warm, covered. Brush skillet with butter between batches.', u'Stir together all topping ingredients except salmon until combined, then dollop on pancakes and top with salmon.', u'*Available at natural foods stores.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/buckwheat-pancakes-with-smoked-salmon-109200', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u"Makes 18 to 20 hors d'oeuvres", 'recipe title': u'Buckwheat Pancakes with Smoked Salmon', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Although delicious when eaten right away, this salad tastes even better if you have the time to chill it, covered, for 8 hours to allow the flavors to develop, and then bring it to room temperature (about 1 hour).', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'90%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 lb cleaned squid', u'2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', u'1 tablespoon red-wine vinegar', u'1/3 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 large garlic clove, minced', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'1 small red onion, halved lengthwise, then thinly sliced crosswise (1 cup)', u'1/3 cup pitted Kalamata olives, halved lengthwise', u'2 cups cherry or grape tomatoes (3/4 lb), halved or quartered if large', u'2 celery ribs, cut into 1/4-inch-thick slices', u'1 cup loosely packed fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves'], 'preperation steps': [u'Rinse squid under cold running water, then lightly pat dry between paper towels. When squid is cool, drain and pat dry.', u'Whisk together lemon juice, vinegar, oil, garlic, salt, and pepper in a small bowl, then stir in onion and let stand 5 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, combine squid, olives, tomatoes, celery, and parsley in a large bowl. {'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 cups raw cashews (9 ounces)', u'1/2 teaspoon salt, or to taste', u'1/8 teaspoon cayenne, or to taste', u'1/8 cup confectioners sugar', u'About 3 cups vegetable oil for deep-frying', u'Special equipment: a deep-fat thermometer'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cover cashews with water in a 1 1/2- to 2-quart saucepan and simmer until slightly softened, about 4 minutes. Heat 1 1/2 inches oil in dried saucepan over moderate heat until it registers 375\xb0F on thermometer. Fry cashews in 3 batches, stirring frequently, until deep golden brown and crisp, 2 to 3 minutes per batch. Transfer with a slotted spoon to a baking sheet as fried and sprinkle with some cayenne mixture. (Return oil to 375\xb0F between batches.)'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/candied-cashews-238404', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes about 2 cups', 'recipe title': u'Candied Cashews', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Small whole fish like trout, char, walleye, bass, and even lake perch are excellent for planking, especially smoke-planking. They get the flavor of the wood plank on one side and a burnished golden color and smoky flavor on the other. An indirect fire is used to slowly cook the whole fish through. Char, in flavor and texture a cross between trout and salmon, is best planked whole. It's easier to fillet after it is cooked and stays moister that way. This method can be used with fish fillets and steaks, too. Whenever you grill fish, grill lemon halves alongside. The little bit of browning adds flavor, and the heat makes the lemons burst with juice.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 whole Arctic char (about 1 pound each), cleaned', u'8 sprigs fresh tarragon', u'8 sprigs fresh dill', u'8 sprigs fresh flat-leaf parsley', u'8 stems fresh chives', u'Salt and freshly ground white pepper', u'Olive oil for brushing', u'4 lemons, halved', u'4 medium-size red onions, peeled and halved'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Prepare an indirect fire in your grill with a hot fire on one side and no fire on the other. For a charcoal grill, soak 1 cup wood chips or corncobs in water for at least 30 minutes and place directly on the hot coals when ready to plank. For a gas grill, place 1/2 cup dry wood chips or corncobs in a smoker box (or wrap chips in aluminum foil and poke holes in the foil) and place over direct heat in the back of the grill.', u'2. In the cavity of each fish, place 2 sprigs each of tarragon, dill, and parsley, and 2 stems of chives. Season with salt and pepper. Place 2 fish on each plank.', u'3. Brush the cut sides of the lemons and onions with olive oil.', u'4. When you see the first wisp of smoke, place the planks on the indirect side of the grill. Set the onion and lemon halves, cut side down, directly on the grate over the fire and close the lid.', u'5. Check the lemons after 2 or 3 minutes. If they have nice grill marks, remove them from the grill. The onions will take an additional 10 to 15 minutes and may be turned after the first 10 to 12 minutes. When they are nicely charred, remove them from the grill, too. Close the lid and continue to cook the fish until it is opaque and begins to flake when tested with a fork, 45 to 60 minutes total.', u'6. Fillet the char and serve on a platter with the lemon and onion halves.', u'Oven Smoke-Planking: Preheat the oven to 400\xb0F. Place 1/2 cup dry wood chips or corncobs in a small metal pan on the bottom rack of the oven and let smolder for about 15 minutes before planking. Place the herb-stuffed planked fish in the middle of the oven. Oven smoke-plank for 45 to 60 minutes, or until the fish is opaque and begins to flake when tested with a fork. Garnish with lemon wedges. (Omit the onions.)'], 'chef': u'Karen Adler and Judith Fertig', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/cedar-planked-char-with-wood-grilled-onions-359609', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 4', 'recipe title': u'Cedar-Planked Char with Wood-Grilled Onions', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Move over, pumpkin. The warm sweet spices of chai tea are magic in doughnuts.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 cup sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/8 teaspoon ground cardamom', u'1/8 teaspoon ground ginger', u'1/8 teaspoon ground nutmeg', u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u'1 teaspoon baking powder', u'1/2 teaspoon baking soda', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/8 teaspoon ground cardamom', u'1/8 teaspoon ground ginger', u'1/8 teaspoon ground nutmeg', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter, room temperature', u'1 large egg, room temperature', u'1/3 cup buttermilk', u'2 tablespoons freshly brewed chai tea', u'2 quarts canola oil (for frying)', u'A 3" round cutter, 1" round cutter, deep-fry thermometer'], 'preperation steps': [u'Whisk sugar, cinnamon, salt, cardamom, ginger, and nutmeg in a large bowl until well combined.', u'Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, cardamom, ginger, and nutmeg in a large bowl.', u'Beat sugar and butter in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment on medium speed until smooth, about 3 minutes.', u'Add egg and continue to beat, scraping down sides of bowl as needed, until incorporated. Reduce speed to low and gradually add buttermilk and tea, beating just until combined. Gradually add dry ingredients and beat just until dough comes together.', u'Turn out dough onto a large piece of parchment paper and cover with a second sheet of parchment. Using a rolling pin, roll dough between parchment sheets to about 1/3" thick. Transfer dough in parchment to a rimmed baking sheet and freeze until firm, about 20 minutes.', u'Peel off top sheet of parchment. Working on bottom sheet, punch out as many rounds as you can with 3" cutter, then use 1" cutter to punch out center of each round. Gather doughnut holes and scraps and re-roll; repeat process 3\u20134 times until all dough has been used (you should have 12 doughnuts). Place doughnuts on a second parchment-lined baking sheet and freeze until slightly chilled, about 5 minutes.', u'Pour oil into a heavy-duty pot to a depth of 2" and fit pot with deep-fry thermometer. Heat oil to 375\xbaF. Working in batches, fry doughnuts until deep golden brown, about 1 minute per side. Transfer to a wire rack lined with paper towels and let cool 2\u20133 minutes. Toss doughnuts in Spiced Sugar.'], 'chef': u'herine Sacks', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/chai-doughnuts-with-spiced-sugar-56390163', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'12 doughnuts', 'recipe title': u'Chai Doughnuts with Spiced Sugar', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Editor's note: The recipe and introductory text below are from Irish Traditional Cooking by Darina Allen.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 to 8 unpeeled baking potatoes, e.g., Russet or Yukon Gold', u'1 bunch scallions (use the bulb and green stem)', u'1 1/2 cups milk', u'4 to 8 tablespoons butter', u'salt and freshly ground pepper'], 'preperation steps': [u'Scrub the potatoes and boil them in their jackets. Finely chop the scallions. Cover the scallions with cold milk and bring slowly to a boil. Simmer for about 3 to 4 minutes, then turn off the heat and leave to infuse. Peel and mash the freshly boiled potatoes and, while hot, mix with the boiling milk and scallions. Beat in some of the butter. Season to taste with salt and freshly ground pepper. Serve in one large or four individual bowls with a knob of butter melting in the center.', u"Champ may be put aside and reheated later in a moderate oven at 350\xb0F. Cover with foil while it reheats so that it doesn't get a skin.", u'Add 2 to 3 tablespoons of freshly chopped parsley to the milk, bring to a boil for 2 or 3 minutes only, to preserve the fresh taste and color. Beat into the mashed potatoes and serve hot.', u'Substitute freshly chopped chives for parsley.', u'Soak a couple of fists of seaweed in cold water for an hour or more. Drain and stew in milk until tender, about 3 hours. Add a good knob of butter and some pepper and beat into the mashed potato. Taste and correct the seasoning. Serve hot.', u'This special champ could only be made for a few weeks when the fresh green peas were in season. Cook the peas in the boiling salted milk with a pinch of sugar until tender. Add to the mashed potatoes and pound together in the usual way.'], 'chef': u'Darina Allen', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/champ-241776', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 servings', 'recipe title': u'Champ', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Flan de Queso', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'95%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 cup sugar', u'1/4 cup water', u'2 1/2 cups whole milk', u'1 (3-inch) cinnamon stick', u'1 (14-ounces) can sweetened condensed milk', u'8 ounces cream cheese, softened', u'5 large eggs', u'1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract', u'1/8 teaspoon salt', u'Equipment: 8 (7- to 8-ounce) ramekins'], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat sugar and water in a small heavy saucepan over medium-high heat, stirring until sugar is dissolved. Cook, without stirring, brushing down sugar crystals from side of pan using a pastry brush dipped in cold water and swirling pan occasionally so caramel browns evenly, until dark amber. Immediately pour into ramekins and swirl so caramel coats bottom of each and partway up side, then put in a roasting pan.', u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F with rack in middle.', u'Bring milk with cinnamon stick just to a simmer in a small heavy saucepan, then remove from heat and let steep, covered, 5 minutes. Remove cinnamon.', u'Meanwhile, blend condensed milk and cream cheese in a food processor until smooth. Add eggs, vanilla, and salt and blend until smooth. Transfer to a large bowl, then whisk in hot milk.', u'Divide among ramekins, then add enough boiling water to pan to reach halfway up sides of ramekins. Cover pan loosely with a sheet of foil and bake until custards are just set (they will still wobble slightly in center when tapped), 45 to 55 minutes.', u'Remove ramekins from water bath and let stand at least 15 minutes (flan will continue to set). Just before serving (warm or at room temperature), run a thin knife around flans to loosen, then invert onto plates.'], 'chef': u'lley Wiseman', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/cheese-flan-240004', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Cheese Flan', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'CHAMPAGNE', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'50%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/2 cup all purpose flour', u'1 3 3/4-pound chicken, cut into 8 pieces', u'1 1/2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1/2 cup minced shallots', u'2 cups Champagne or sparkling white wine', u'1 bay leaf', u'8 ounces green beans, cut in half crosswise, then lengthwise', u'2 cups matchstick-size pieces celery root (about 8 ounces)', u'1 1/4 cups matchstick-size pieces carrots (from 1 large)', u'3 large egg yolks', u'1 small black truffle, cut into matchstick-size pieces (optional)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Whisk flour, salt, and pepper in shallow bowl. Coat chicken pieces in seasoned flour; transfer to rack. Let stand 15 minutes. Coat with flour again; return to rack.', u'Melt butter with oil in heavy large skillet over medium heat. Working in batches, add chicken and saut\xe9 until brown, about 5 minutes per side. Transfer chicken to plate. Add shallots to skillet and saut\xe9 until golden, about 2 minutes. Add Champagne and bay leaf and bring to boil, scraping up browned bits. Return chicken and any accumulated juices to skillet. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Pan de Pascua', 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'33%', 'ingredient list': [u'Pinch of sugar', u'1 (1/4-ounce) packet active dry yeast (2 1/4 teaspoons)', u'3/4 cup unbleached all-purpose flour', u'1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, room temperature', u'1/3 cup sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'Finely grated zest of 1 orange or lemon', u'4 large eggs, room temperature', u'3 cups unbleached all-purpose flour', u'1 1/2 teaspoons brandy', u'1 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract', u'1/2 cup dried or glac\xe9ed cherries', u'1/3 dark raisins', u'1/3 cup golden raisins', u'1/3 cup candied ginger or lemon or orange peel', u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter, melted'], 'preperation steps': [u'In 2-cup glass measuring cup, stir together 1/2 cup warm water (105\xb0F to 115\xb0F) and sugar. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Home turf: Texas Local flavor: Chili is practically a religion in Texas. The thick, meaty "bowl of red" dates back to San Antonio in the 1820s. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'We think bowls made of ice are the perfect vessel for this soup, but if space is tight in your freezer, regular soup bowls will work just fine.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 medium onions, chopped', u'3 tablespoons olive oil', u'2 lb sugar snap peas, cut crosswise into 1/2-inch pieces', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'6 cups plus 2 1/2 tablespoons water', u'2 teaspoons salt, or to taste', u'3 tablespoons sour cream', u'1 teaspoon finely grated fresh lemon zest', u'Garnish: pea sprouts'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cook onions in oil in a wide 6-quart heavy pot over moderately low heat, stirring occasionally, until softened, 5 to 7 minutes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Parfait is the French word for "perfect," and these elegant little treats live up to the billing. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"For a fancifully tall cake, we used 3 (7-inch) round pans. It can also be baked in 3 (8-inch) pans, though the cake will be slightly lower. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Look for the heart-shaped cake ring at cake and candy supply stores, or call Jane's Cakes and Chocolates at 800-262-7630. DO AHEAD: Burgers and bacon can be prepared 8 hours ahead. Cover separately and chill.', u'Prepare barbecue (medium-high heat). Sprinkle 1 teaspoon coffee rub on top side of each burger. Place burgers, rub side down, on grill rack. Grill until slightly charred, about 4 minutes; turn.', u'Place 2 bacon slice halves atop each burger. Cook 3 minutes.', u'Top each with 1 cheese slice. Cover and cook until cheese melts, about 1 minute longer. Place burgers atop bottom halves of buns. Top with onion slices and tomato slices. Spoon dollop of Texas Barbecue Sauce over. Cover with bun tops and serve, passing additional sauce alongside.', u'Beer is a natural pairing for a burger. Keep the southern theme going by pouring a Texas brew. We like the caramel sweetness and mild hoppy flavor of Shiner Bock ($8 per six-pack).'], 'chef': u'Fred Thompson', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/coffee-rubbed-cheeseburgers-with-texas-barbecue-sauce-353870', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 ', 'recipe title': u'Coffee-Rubbed Cheeseburgers with Texas Barbecue Sauce', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'When executive editor John Willoughby caught sight of these freshly fried corn dogs, he exclaimed, "Just like the Iowa State Fair!" When he bit into one, he acknowledged that it was even better. Grilling the hot dogs first lends them a deeper, smokier flavor, and the buttermilk\u2013cornmeal coating fries up to a thick, fluffy shell\u2014delicious with mustard or ketchup and a frosty root beer on the side.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'78%', 'ingredient list': [u'8 hot dogs', u'1/2 cup plus 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour, divided', u'About 8 cups vegetable oil, divided', u'1 1/2 cups cornmeal', u'1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon baking soda', u'1/8 teaspoon cayenne', u'2 large eggs', u'1 1/4 cups well-shaken buttermilk', u'Equipment: a grill pan; 8 wooden ice-pop sticks; a deep-fat thermometer', u'Accompaniments: ketchup and mustard'], 'preperation steps': [u'Oil grill pan, then grill hot dogs over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until lightly charred on all sides, about 5 minutes total. Whisk in buttermilk.', u'Transfer some of batter to a tall glass, filling it almost to the top.', u'Working in batches of 2 or 3, dip hot dogs, 1 at a time, into glass of batter to coat (add more batter to glass if necessary), then fry, turning occasionally, until batter is cooked through and golden-brown all over, about 3 minutes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Brunch or supper, this croque-monsieur with an egg on top has the charm of a small French bistro in each bite.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'85%', 'ingredient list': [u'5 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'3 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'2 cups whole milk', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/8 teaspoon black pepper', u'1/8 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg', u'3 1/2 ounces coarsely grated Gruy\xe8re cheese (1 1/3 cups)', u'8 slices firm white sandwich bread', u'4 teaspoons Dijon mustard', u'1/2 pound thinly sliced cooked ham (preferably Black Forest)', u'4 large eggs'], 'preperation steps': [u'Melt 3 tablespoons butter in a 1- to 1 1/2-quart heavy saucepan over moderately low heat, then whisk in flour and cook roux, whisking, 3 minutes. Whisk in milk and bring to a boil, whisking constantly. Reduce heat and simmer, whisking occasionally, 5 minutes. Whisk in salt, pepper, nutmeg, and 1/3 cup cheese until cheese is melted. Remove from heat and cover surface directly with a sheet of wax paper.', u'Spread 1 1/2 tablespoons sauce evenly over each of 4 slices of bread, then sprinkle evenly with remaining cheese (1/4 cup per slice). Spread mustard evenly on remaining 4 bread slices and top with ham, dividing it evenly, then invert onto cheese-topped bread to form sandwiches.', u'Lightly oil a 15- by 10-inch shallow baking pan.', u'Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a 12-inch nonstick skillet over moderately low heat, then cook sandwiches, turning over once, until golden, 3 to 4 minutes total. Remove from heat and transfer sandwiches to baking pan, then wipe out skillet with paper towels.', u'Preheat broiler.', u'Top each sandwich with 1/3 cup sauce, spreading evenly. Broil sandwiches 4 to 5 inches from heat until sauce is bubbling and golden in spots, 2 to 3 minutes. Turn off broiler and transfer pan to lower third of oven to keep sandwiches warm.', u'Heat remaining tablespoon butter in nonstick skillet over moderate heat until foam subsides, then crack eggs into skillet and season with salt and pepper. Fry eggs, covered, until whites are just set and yolks are still runny, about 3 minutes. Top each sandwich with a fried egg and serve immediately.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/croque-madame-237589', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 servings', 'recipe title': u'Croque-Madame', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Almonds were brought to Spain by the Moors, and they've featured in Andalusian cuisine ever since. Typically they are used as a thickener for sauces and, most famously, as the base of ajo blanco. Whole Marcona almonds are roasted with sweet or hot smoked paprika\u2013I prefer to use sweet paprika, introduce a little heat via cayenne, and round it out with cumin and salt. In the event of a crippling Marcona almond shortage, regular blanched almonds will do the trick.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 egg white', u'1 1/2 teaspoons salt', u'1 teaspoon plus 1/8 teaspoon cumin, for dusting', u'1 teaspoon plus 1/8 teaspoon sweet or smoked Spanish paprika, for dusting', u'1/4 teaspoon cayenne', u'3 cups blanched Marcona almonds'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat the oven to 350\xb0F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.', u'In a bowl, whisk together the egg white, salt, 1 teaspoon of cumin, 1 teaspoon of paprika, and the cayenne. Add the almonds and toss to coat.', u'Spread the almonds out evenly on the prepared baking sheet and roast until golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes, shaking the pan halfway through. Transfer to a plate to cool for about 30 minutes.', u'In a small bowl, combine the remaining 1/8 teaspoon of cumin and the remaining 1/8 teaspoon of paprika. Sprinkle this mixture over the cooled nuts. Store in a sealed container for up to 2 weeks.'], 'chef': u'ia Baiocchi', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/cumin-and-paprika-spiced-marcona-almonds-51256020', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 3 cups', 'recipe title': u'Cumin-and-Paprika-Spiced Marcona Almonds', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'EFFORT: NOT MUCH PREP TIME: 15 MINUTES COOK TIME: 6 HOURS KEEPS ON WARM: 1 HOUR', 'rating': u'1/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 tablespoons Italian-seasoned tomato paste', u'3 tablespoons full-bodied red wine, such as a California Zinfandel', u'2 teaspoons Red wine vinegar', u'1 1/4 pounds lean ground beef, preferably 93% lean', u'3 ounces (about 3/4 cup) provolone cheese, finely shredded', u'1/3 cup uncooked long-grain white rice', u'1 teaspoon dried oregano', u'3/4 teaspoon dried thyme', u'1/2 teaspoon crushed fennel seeds'], 'preperation steps': [u'1 Whisk the tomato paste, wine, and vinegar in a shallow bowl.', u'2 Mix the ground beef, cheese, rice, oregano, thyme, and fennel seeds in a large bowl until the cheese and seasonings are evenly distributed throughout the ground beef.', u'3 Form the mixture into balls, using about 1/3 cup for each fairly large meatball. As the meatballs are made, roll them in the tomato paste mixture, coating them lightly and evenly, then set them in the slow cooker in a single layer.', u'4 Once all the meatballs are made, cover the cooker and cook on low for 6 hours, or until the meatballs are firm and cooked through.'], 'chef': u'Bruce Weinstein and Mark Scarbrough', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/easy-cheesy-meatballs-51220250', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves: 3 to 8 ', 'recipe title': u'Easy Cheesy Meatballs', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Removing all but a strip of the eggplant's skin lets the flesh meld with the sauce without falling apart.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'86%', 'ingredient list': [u'3/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons olive oil, divided', u'1 medium onion, finely chopped', u'10 garlic cloves, 2 finely chopped, 8 whole', u'2 tablespoons tomato paste', u'1 28-ounce can whole peeled tomatoes', u'Kosher salt, freshly ground pepper', u'4 medium or 8 small eggplants (about 4 pounds), halved lengthwise', u'8 sprigs oregano', u'1 1/4 cups coarse fresh breadcrumbs', u'12 ounces fresh mozzarella, torn into bite-size pieces', u'3 ounces Parmesan, finely grated (about 3/4 cup)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat 1/4 cup oil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until beginning to brown, 6\u20138 minutes. Add chopped garlic and cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add tomato paste and cook, stirring, until beginning to darken, about 2 minutes. Add tomatoes, crushing them with your hands as you add them; season with salt and pepper. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer, partially covered, mashing tomatoes occasionally, until slightly thickened, 15\u201320 minutes. Set tomato sauce aside.', u'Preheat oven to 400\xb0F. Using a vegetable peeler, remove skin from rounded side of each eggplant half, leaving a 1" strip of skin around the cut edges. Divide eggplants, oregano sprigs, whole garlic cloves, and 1/2 cup oil between 2 large rimmed baking sheets. Turn eggplants to coat with oil; season with salt and pepper and place cut side down. Cover baking sheets tightly with foil and bake until eggplants are very soft, 40\u201345 minutes.', u'Toss breadcrumbs and remaining 2 tablespoons oil in a medium bowl. Transfer eggplants, oregano, and garlic to 2 large shallow baking dishes, placing eggplants cut side up. Top eggplants with tomato sauce and mozzarella, then sprinkle with breadcrumbs and Parmesan. Bake until mozzarella is bubbling and breadcrumbs are golden, 25\u201330 minutes.', u'DO AHEAD: Tomato sauce can be made 3 days ahead. Let cool; cover and chill. Eggplants can be cooked 1 day ahead. Keep covered; chill. Entire dish can be assembled 4 hours ahead. Cover and chill.'], 'chef': u'Dawn Perry', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/eggplant-parmesan-with-fresh-mozzarella-51193670', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Eggplant Parmesan with Fresh Mozzarella', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Unlike most Western rice puddings, these desserts are chewy rather than creamy, with a delightful surprise inside. Some Chinese versions can be heavy and overly sweet, but our variation is a nicely balanced finish to the meal.', 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 1/4 cups Chinese or Japanese short-grain sticky ("sweet") rice', u'1 teaspoon peanut or vegetable oil plus additional for greasing', u'3 1/2 cups cold water', u'1/2 cup Chinese rock sugar pieces', u'1/3 cup dried pitted Chinese jujubes, cut lengthwise into 1/4-inch-thick strips', u'8 pitted prunes, quartered (1/3 cup)', u'8 large dried apricots, cut into 1/4-inch-thick strips (1/3 cup)', u'3 tablespoons dried sour cherries', u'3 tablespoons diced (1/4 inch) candied orange peel', u'8 walnut halves', u'8 teaspoons canned sweet red beans or sweet red-bean paste (from a 14- to 16-oz can)', u'Special equipment: a 9-inch round cake pan (2 inches deep); 8 (6- to 8-oz) custard cups or heatproof bowls; a 17- by 12- by 2 1/2-inch roasting pan; heavy-duty foil'], 'preperation steps': [u'Rinse rice in a large sieve under cold running water until water runs clear, then drain. Combine rice, oil, and 2 cups cold water in cake pan.', u'Put 1/2 inch of water in a 12-inch-wide pot or deep skillet. Set a metal rack (or a few metal cookie cutters) in bottom of pot, then set cake pan (with rice) on rack and bring water to a boil. Cover pot and steam over high heat, checking water level occasionally and adding more water if necessary, until rice is cooked, about 40 minutes. Carefully remove pan and cool to room temperature.', u'Meanwhile, bring remaining 1 1/2 cups cold water to a boil in a 2-quart heavy saucepan with rock sugar, jujubes, prunes, apricots, cherries, and orange peel, then reduce heat and simmer, covered, until fruit is very soft and liquid is reduced to 3/4 cup, about 45 minutes. Stir in walnuts and simmer 1 minute. Immediately drain in a medium-mesh sieve set over a bowl, reserving syrup and fruit separately. Remove walnuts from fruit and set aside.', u'Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 350\xb0F. 3Lightly oil custard cups and a 1/3-cup measure. Put 1 walnut half in bottom of each cup, then spoon 2 tablespoons mixed fruit (per cup) on top, spreading evenly around bottom of each cup. Drizzle 1 teaspoon reserved fruit syrup over fruit in each cup, then press 1/3 cup rice (per cup) on top of fruit with dampened fingertips. Using your fingertips or back of a small spoon, make a small indentation in rice and fill with 1 teaspoon red beans (per cup), leaving at least a 1/2-inch border of rice. Drizzle 1 teaspoon fruit syrup over each rice pudding, then cover with 2 tablespoons rice (dip measuring spoon in water before measuring rice to prevent sticking). Using a small piece of plastic wrap, press rice in cups to flatten surface. Discard wrap.', u'Arrange cups in roasting pan. Oil a sheet of heavy-duty foil, then cover pan with foil (oiled side down) and seal tightly. Bake in a water bath 1 hour, then let stand, covered, 5 minutes. Run a knife around edge of each cup to loosen rice, then invert each pudding onto a dish. Drizzle with remaining fruit syrup.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/eight-treasure-puddings-233815', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 dessert servings', 'recipe title': u'Eight-Treasure Puddings', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Chicken, Red Grapes, Walnuts, Dill, Scallions, Radishes and Arugula', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per Sandwich: Calories 260, protein 23 g, total fat 6 g, carbohydrates 28 g, sodium 460 mg, fiber 5 g\n\nNutritional analysis provided by The Truly Healthy Family Cookbook', 'recommendation': u'36%', 'ingredient list': [u'8 oz/224 g chicken breast', u'1/2 cup/75 g red grapes, quartered', u'2 tbsp/14 g toasted walnuts, roughly chopped', u'2 tbsp/8 g dill, roughly chopped', u'1/4 cup/25 g finely chopped scallion', u'1/2 cup/120 g low-fat Greek yogurt', u'1/4 tsp salt', u'Several grates of freshly ground black pepper', u'8 slices multigrain bread', u'2 cups/40 g arugula', u'1 cup/116 g thinly sliced radishes'], 'preperation steps': [u'To cook the chicken, bring a saucepan of water to a boil over high heat. Place in a bowl with the grapes, walnuts, dill, scallions, yogurt, salt and black pepper. Stir to combine.', u'To assemble the sandwiches, place 4 slices of bread on a work surface. For each sandwich, top with 1/2 cup/10 grams arugula, 1/2 cup/70 grams chicken salad, 1/4 cup/29 grams sliced radishes and another piece of bread.', u'You can also try substituting shrimp for the chicken and hazelnuts for the walnuts!'], 'chef': u'a Ruggiero, M.S., R.D.', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/extreme-makeover-chicken-salad-sammy-51188210', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'4 sandwiches', 'recipe title': u'Extreme Makeover Chicken Salad Sammy', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Alison Hotchkiss of San Francisco\u2013based Alison Events shared this easy centerpiece idea with Epicurious. She recommends lining the vases up along the length of your table to create a unique centerpiece. Best of all, after the party, each guest can take home a vase as a memento. The vases shown here are covered in vintage-inspired fabric and were originally part of 1960s-themed bridal shower, but they can be adapted for any type of party.', 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 yards vintage or vintage-inspired fabric*', u'12 (6- by 6-inch) clear glass vases**', u'12 (1 3/4- by 1 3/4- by 8-inch) clear glass vases**', u'Colorful flowers such as gerbera daisies', u'Fabric scissors, glue gun, and glue sticks', u'*Yards of fabric vary by width. These measurements are based on a 45-inch-wide bolt of fabric. Vintage or vintage-inspired fabrics can be found at flea markets, garage sales, or on Web sites such as eBay, Etsy, Purlsoho, and Reprodepot. Hotchkiss also suggests scouting your local Goodwill or Salvation Army for used dresses that can be cut up for fabric.', u'**Hotchkiss recommends vases from Save-on-crafts, which offers both these sizes, but you can find similar styles at Crate & Barrel, Ikea, and Target.'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cut fabric into 1-yard and \xbd-yard sections. Cut 1-yard section into 12 (24- by 3-inch) strips.', u'Place one 6-inch vase on your work surface so opening faces away from you.', u"Arrange one fabric strip on side of vase that's face up, leaving 1\xbd inches of space from both top and bottom of vase.", u'Using glue gun, dot two rows of glue sparingly onto side of vase that is face up; the rows should line up just below where top and bottom of fabric strip will be positioned. Use only as much glue as necessary, or it may show through fabric.', u'Repeat with remaining three sides, wrapping fabric around and gluing each side completely before moving on to next side. Repeat with remaining 6-inch vases.', u'Cut remaining 1/2-yard fabric into 12 (7- by 5-inch) strips.', u'Place one 8-inch vase down on your work surface so opening faces away from you.', u"Arrange one fabric strip on side of vase that's face up, leaving 1\xbd inches of space from both top and bottom of vase.", u'Using glue gun, dot two rows of glue sparingly onto side of vase that is face up; the rows should line up just below where top and bottom of fabric strip will be positioned. Use only as much glue as necessary, or it may show through fabric.', u'Repeat with remaining three sides, wrapping fabric around and gluing each side completely before moving on to next side. Repeat with remaining 8-inch vases.', u'Allow vases to dry for at least 24 hours.', u'Fill vases with water and flowers, then arrange, in alternating sizes, along length of table.'], 'chef': u'Alison Hotchkiss', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/fabric-covered-vase-centerpiece-352929', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': None, 'recipe title': u'Fabric-Covered Vase Centerpiece', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'These falafels can be prepared as crusts for use in the Middle Eastern Plate, or they can be made into more traditional falafel balls. To make these balls, just follow the instructions below but roll the mixture into 1-inch balls, then dehydrate them for only 8 to 10 hours.', 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 cups sprouted garbanzo beans', u'1 cup loosely packed fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves', u'1 cup raw tahini', u'1 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice', u'1 onion, minced', u'2 tablespoons ground cumin', u'6 tablespoons Bragg Liquid Aminos, or 2 tablespoons sun-dried sea salt', u'1 cup sesame seeds'], 'preperation steps': [u'Using a homogenizing juicer with the blank plate in place, homogenize the garbanzo beans and parsley and place in a large bowl.
