Mix into the garbanzo paste. Press into 1/4-inch-thick crusts, each 4 or 8 inches in diameter. Dehydrate for 12 to 14 hours, flipping at least once during the drying time.'], 'chef': u'Jeremy A. Safron', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/falafel-367649', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes four 8-inch crusts or eight 4-inch crusts', 'recipe title': u'Falafel', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Ever since R.C Van Dyne from Wilmington, NC tasted farinata in Alessandria, Italy, he has been wanting to make it. We obtained this recipe from Rose Pistola restaurant in San Francisco, where they serve their own farinata.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 cup chick-pea flour', u'2 cups cold water', u'1 1/4 teaspoons salt', u'4 1/2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1/2 large white onion, thinly sliced', u'30 Ni\xe7oise olives, pitted', u'45 small or 30 large fresh sage leaves'], 'preperation steps': [u'At least 1 hour before making farinata, set a pizza stone on rack in upper third of oven and preheat oven to 550\xb0F.', u'Whisk together chick-pea flour and water until smooth, then whisk in salt and 2 tablespoons of oil. Let stand at least 30 minutes at room temperature.', u'Cook onion with salt to taste in 1 tablespoon oil in a large heavy skillet over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until golden, about 10 minutes, then cool.', u'Put a seasoned 10-inch cast-iron round griddle on pizza stone and heat 10 minutes. Remove pan from oven and add 1/2 tablespoon oil, tilting to coat evenly. Working quickly, stir batter and ladle about 7/8 cup (1 cup minus 2 tablespoons) evenly into pan (batter will sizzle and start to set almost immediately). Quickly scatter a third of the onion, olives, and sage leaves over the batter and carefully return pan to pizza stone. If using an oven with a built-in broiler, bake 12 minutes, then turn oven setting to broil for 1 to 5 minutes. If using an oven with broiler underneath, bake 15 minutes, then transfer pan to broiler for 1 to 2 minutes. Edges should be golden brown and crisp and top flecked with golden spots.', u'Slide farinata onto a cutting board. Make 2 more in same manner, reheating pan 5 minutes for each successive farinata. Halve farinata and cut into strips.'], 'chef': u'Peggy Knickerbocker, Reed Hearon', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/farinata-with-sage-olives-and-onion-102392', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u"Serves 6 as an hors d'oeuvre (3 farinata)", 'recipe title': u'Farinata with Sage, Olives, and Onion', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Less expensive than crab but just as good.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: 474.6 Calories (kcal), 61.4 % calories from fat, 32.4 g fat, 4.5 g saturated fat, 104.4 mg cholesterol, 28.4 g carbohydrates, 3.2 g dietary fiber, 7.6 g total sugars, 25.2 g net carbohydrates, 15.9 g protein\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Bon App\xe9tit', 'recommendation': u'83%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 large lemons', u'1/2 cup mayonnaise', u'1/2 cup chopped green onions, divided', u'2 tablespoons sweet pickle relish', u'2 tablespoons prepared horseradish', u'3 tablespoons chopped fresh dill, divided', u'4 slices white sandwich bread, torn into pieces', u'8 ounces mahi-mahi, cut into 8 strips', u'1 large egg, lightly beaten', u'1 8-ounce bag coleslaw mix', u'2 tablespoons olive oil'], 'preperation steps': [u'Grate enough lemon peel to measure 2 1/2 teaspoons. Halve lemons; squeeze enough juice to measure 1/4 cup. Mix peel, 2 tablespoons juice, mayonnaise, 1/4 cup green onion, relish, horseradish, and 2 tablespoons dill in bowl; set sauce aside.', u'Grind bread to fine crumbs in processor. Place 1 cup breadcrumbs in medium bowl. Place remaining breadcrumbs in 13x9-inch baking dish. Using on/off turns, very coarsely chop fish in processor (do not form paste). Add fish to breadcrumbs in bowl; gently mix in egg, 1 tablespoon sauce, and 1/4 cup green onion. Shape fish mixture into four 31/2-inch-round cakes; thickly coat with breadcrumbs in baking dish.', u'Toss coleslaw mix, 3 tablespoons sauce, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, and 1 tablespoon dill in bowl. Season with salt and pepper.', u'Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add fish cakes; saut\xe9 until cooked through, about 2 minutes per side. Serve fish cakes with slaw and sauce.'], 'chef': u'The Bon App\xe9tit Test Kitchen', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/fish-cakes-with-coleslaw-and-horseradish-dill-sauce-350960', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 servings', 'recipe title': u'Fish Cakes with Coleslaw and Horseradish-Dill Sauce', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Tender baby artichokes add richness to the potato hash. Aleppo pepper, from northern Syria, gives a sweet, earthy flavor to the steak and its accompanying aioli. Look for it at specialty foods stores and online at wholespice.com. If you can't find it, substitute 1/2 teaspoon sweet paprika and 1/8 teaspoon ground chipotle chile powder.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'95%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 garlic cloves, pressed', u'1 teaspoon Aleppo pepper', u'1/4 teaspoon coarse kosher salt', u'1/2 cup mayonnaise', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 teaspoon Sherry wine vinegar', u'1 1/2 tablespoons fresh thyme leaves', u'2 teaspoons Aleppo pepper', u'1 teaspoon coarse kosher salt', u'1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper', u'1 1 1/2-to 2-pound flank steak', u'1/2 lemon', u'8 baby artichokes, stems trimmed', u'1 1/4 pounds unpeeled small yellow potatoes (such as baby Dutch or Russian Banana)', u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided', u'1/2 cup water', u'2 fresh thyme sprigs', u'1 garlic clove, minced', u'2 tablespoons heavy whipping cream', u'1 tablespoon peanut oil or vegetable oil', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh chives'], 'preperation steps': [u'Mash garlic, Aleppo pepper, and 1/4 teaspoon coarse salt to paste in mortar with pestle or in small bowl with back of spoon. Whisk in remaining ingredients. DO AHEAD: Can be made 2 days ahead. Cover and chill.', u'Mix thyme, Aleppo pepper, 1 teaspoon coarse salt, and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper in small bowl. Rub seasoning mixture into steak; set aside. DO AHEAD: Can be made 4 hours ahead. Cover; chill. Bring to room temperature before continuing.', u'Squeeze juice from lemon half into medium bowl of water. Cut 1/2 inch from tops of artichokes. Working with 1 artichoke at a time, break off dark outer leaves until only pale yellow leaves remain. Cut artichokes lengthwise in half; cut each half into 1/2-inch wedges. Place in lemon water to prevent browning.', u'Place potatoes in heavy large saucepan. Add enough cold water to cover; sprinkle with salt. Bring to boil; reduce heat to medium-high and boil until potatoes are just tender, 8 to 10 minutes. Drain. Transfer to baking sheet until cool enough to handle. Halve or quarter potatoes.', u'Drain artichokes; pat to dry well, then sprinkle with salt and pepper. Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in heavy large skillet over medium-high heat. Add artichokes and saut\xe9 until browned, about 4 minutes. Add 1/2 cup water, thyme sprigs, and garlic. Cover skillet and simmer over medium heat until artichokes are tender, about 5 minutes. Uncover and boil until no liquid remains, stirring often, 2 to 3 minutes. Add remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil and potatoes; stir to coat. Add cream and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook until potatoes are heated through and browned in spots, stirring often, about 6 minutes. Season hash to taste with salt and pepper. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 hour ahead. Let stand at room temperature.', u'Preheat oven to 400\xb0F. Heat peanut oil in heavy large ovenproof skillet over high heat. Add steak and cook until bottom is brown, about 2 minutes. Let rest 10 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, rewarm artichokepotato hash gently over medium heat. Stir in chopped chives. Thinly slice steak crosswise. Divide steak and hash among plates. Drizzle some aioli over steak. Serve, passing remaining aioli alongside.'], 'chef': u'Molly Stevens', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/flank-steak-with-artichoke-potato-hash-and-aleppo-pepper-aioli-352092', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 to 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Flank Steak with Artichoke-Potato Hash and Aleppo-Pepper Aioli', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'The fillets are cooked in foil packets with a mix of herbs, citrus, beer, and wine, then served with maque choux, a Cajun succotash.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 1/4-inch-thick shallot slices (rounds), divided', u'4 tablespoons (1/2 stick) unsalted butter, divided', u'4 small garlic cloves, sliced, divided', u'8 thin slices unpeeled lime, divided', u'4 thin slices unpeeled orange, divided', u'4 6- to 7-ounce flounder or John Dory fillets (preferably with skin)', u'Cayenne pepper', u'8 fresh thyme sprigs, divided', u'8 tablespoons dark beer, divided', u'4 tablespoons dry white wine, divided', u'Corn and Tasso Maque Choux'], 'preperation steps': [u'Line pie dish with large sheet of foil, leaving long overhang on 1 side. Separate rings of 1 shallot slice; scatter over foil. Top with 1 tablespoon butter, sliced garlic clove, 2 lime slices, and 1 orange slice. Sprinkle 1 fillet on both sides with salt and cayenne. Arrange fillet, skin side down, atop seasonings in dish. Top fillet with 2 thyme sprigs. Spoon 2 tablespoons beer and 1 tablespoon wine around fillet. Fold long foil overhang over fillet to opposite edge of foil, pressing foil onto fillet. Fold foil edge over to seal on 3 sides, then fold again to double seal. Transfer packet to baking sheet. Repeat with remaining seasonings and fillets.', u'Prepare barbecue (high heat). Arrange packets, sealed side up, on grill rack. Cook until fish feels slightly firm when pressed, about 10 minutes. Serve with Corn and Tasso Maque Choux.'], 'chef': u'Francine Maroukian and Bryan Caswell', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/flounder-with-corn-and-tasso-maque-choux-359772', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 servings', 'recipe title': u'Flounder with Corn and Tasso Maque Choux', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Francis Butler grew up on the family ranch and continues to preside over the dry, windy land. The lonesomeness of ranch life, she says, was offset by "group cooks" such as the annual Thanksgiving tamale making: "Wild turkey hunting has been a West Texas sport for as long as anybody remembers, and tamale-stuffed turkey may have been an early tip of the hat to the Mexican ranch hands who\'ve been around for at least as long as the turkey. This recipe dates back to the early 1900s. I got it from a family whose grandmother was German but had been raised in Mexico. I make it most often in the cold months, but I\'ve been known to put a tamale-stuffed turkey in the roasting pit in my time, as well. You can use commercial tamales, of course, but I like the two-day ritual of making tamales and then making the turkey. I always double or triple the tamales and freeze the extra. These days people use more barnyard turkey than they do wild. Before you go thinking that\'s a sorry thing, let me tell you this. You feed your chickens or turkey some chile peppers before you decide. That spicy sweet flavor gets into the meat and you know what they mean when they say it doesn\'t get any better."', 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'50%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 shallots, peeled', u'2 garlic cloves, peeled', u'2 jalape\xf1o chiles, stemmed and seeded', u'Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'8 tablespoons (1 stick) unsalted butter, cut into 8 pieces and chilled', u'30 medium pork, chicken, or chile tamales , husks removed and discarded', u'1 cup frozen corn, thawed', u'One 8- to 10-pound whole turkey, giblets removed'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Place an oven rack in the lower-center position and preheat the oven to 350\xb0F. Set a large V-shaped roasting rack inside a shallow roasting pan.', u'2. Pulse the shallots, garlic, chiles, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper in a food processor until finely chopped. With the food processor running, add the butter, one piece at time, and process until a paste forms.', u'3. In a large bowl, crumble the tamales and using a fork, stir in the corn. Season with salt and pepper to taste.', u"4. Pat the turkey dry. Using metal skewers or toothpicks, secure the neck skin to the back of the turkey, then tuck the turkey's wings behind its back.", u"5. Stuff the tamale mixture into the turkey's cavity and tie the legs together with butcher's twine. Place the turkey in the prepared rack, breast up, and rub with the butter mixture. Cover the turkey loosely with foil and roast for 1 hour, basting with pan drippings every 20 minutes.", u'6. Uncover and roast for 30 to 45 minutes, until the skin is well browned and an instant-read thermometer registers 175\xb0F in the thighs and drumsticks and 165\xb0F in the breast and stuffing.', u'7. Transfer the turkey to a serving platter or carving board and let rest for 30 minutes to 1 hour before serving.', u'8. Carve the turkey and serve with the tamale stuffing.'], 'chef': u"Molly O'Neill", 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/francis-butlers-texas-tamale-stuffed-turkey-367529', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 10 to 12', 'recipe title': u"Francis Butler's Texas Tamale-Stuffed Turkey", 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Surprisingly, it takes half a gallon of milk to get 1 1/2 cups of fresh ricotta. You\'ll need a double batch to have enough for the <epi:recipelink id="351042">gnocchi</epi:recipelink>. For the moistest, lightest consistency, let the curds drain only aslong as specified.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'92%', 'ingredient list': [u'8 cups whole milk', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'3 tablespoons fresh lemon juice'], 'preperation steps': [u'Line colander with 4 layers of cheesecloth; set in sink. Bring milk and salt to simmer in heavy large saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir in lemon juice. Let simmer until curds form, 1 to 2 minutes.', u'Using finely slotted spoon or skimmer, scoop curds from pan and transfer to cheesecloth-lined colander. Let drain 1 minute (curds will still be a little wet). Transfer curds to medium bowl. Cover and chill until cold, about 3 hours. DO AHEAD: Can be made 2 days ahead. Keep chilled.'], 'chef': u'Andrew Carmellini', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/fresh-ricotta-cheese-351041', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 1 1/2 cups', 'recipe title': u'Fresh Ricotta Cheese', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Fried chicken in the South has many variations. Here, a buttermilk marinade helps keep the meat tender and juicy underneath crisp, golden skin; pepper-speckled gravy and bacon add savor and smoke.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'73%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 whole chicken (about 3 1/2 pounds), cut into 8 pieces', u'3 cups well-shaken buttermilk', u'1 large onion, thinly sliced', u'2 teaspoons hot sauce such as Tabasco', u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u'2 teaspoons paprika', u'1/8 teaspoon cayenne', u'8 bacon slices (1/2 pound)', u'About 3 cups vegetable oil', u'4 teaspoons all-purpose flour', u'2 cups whole milk', u'Equipment: a deep-fat thermometer'], 'preperation steps': [u'Toss chicken with buttermilk, onion, Tabasco, and 2 teaspoons salt. Marinate chicken, covered and chilled, at least 12 hours.', u'Put flour, paprika, cayenne, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, and 1 teaspoon black pepper in a paper or plastic bag and shake to combine well.', u'Drain chicken well in a colander, discarding marinade and onions, then shake chicken in bag, 1 piece at a time, to coat well. Knock off excess flour and transfer to a sheet of wax paper. Let chicken air-dry 30 minutes.', u'Preheat oven to 250\xb0F with rack in middle. Set a cooling rack in a large shallow baking pan.', u'Meanwhile, cook bacon in 2 batches in a 12-inch heavy skillet over medium heat until browned and crisp. Transfer to rack in baking pan and keep warm in oven.', u'Scrape up brown bits from bottom of skillet with a spatula and strain bacon fat through a fine-mesh sieve into a bowl, reserving bits in sieve. Wipe skillet clean and add strained bacon fat. Add enough oil to measure 1/2 inch fat in skillet and heat to 350\xb0F over medium-high heat.', u'Fry chicken 4 pieces at a time (keep each batch all white meat or all dark meat), skin sides down first, turning occasionally with tongs, until golden-brown and cooked through, 8 to 12 minutes for breasts and wings; 10 to 12 minutes for drumsticks and thighs. Transfer chicken to rack with bacon and keep warm in oven. Return fat to 350\xb0F between batches and reserve after frying.', u'Strain frying fat through sieve into a bowl, then return 1 tablespoon fat and all brown bits in sieve to skillet. (Discard remaining frying fat once cool.) Whisk in flour and cook roux over medium heat, whisking, 1 minute. Whisk in milk, 1 teaspoon salt, and 3/4 teaspoon pepper and bring to a boil, whisking, then simmer, whisking, until thick, 3 to 5 minutes.', u'Serve chicken with gravy and bacon.', u"Haggipavlu Nemea '04"], 'chef': u'Lillian Chou', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/fried-chicken-with-bacon-and-pepper-cream-gravy-241168', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 servings', 'recipe title': u'Fried Chicken with Bacon and Pepper Cream Gravy', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Make this recipe your own by using different sausages and cheeses. For a Middle Eastern spin, sub in lamb sausage and feta. Serve pizzas with hot sauce.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'95%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 loaf ciabatta bread (about 1 pound)', u'1 cup chopped green onions', u'8 tablespoons olive oil, divided', u'8 ounces sliced hot pepper Monterey Jack cheese', u'1 pound spicy or sweet Italian sausages, casings removed', u'8 large eggs'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 450\xb0F. Cut each pizza between eggs into 4 pieces.'], 'chef': u'The Bon App\xe9tit Test Kitchen', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/fried-egg-and-sausage-ciabatta-breakfast-pizzas-241096', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Fried Egg and Sausage Ciabatta Breakfast Pizzas', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'As in many Mexican recipe names, there is a playful personification at work here: The eggs are "separated" by their salsas\u2014one is topped with fiery red, the other with jealous green.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'91%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/2 lb plum tomatoes', u'1/2 lb fresh tomatillos, husks discarded and tomatillos rinsed', u'2 fresh jalape\xf1o chiles', u'1 (1-inch) wedge of large white onion', u'2 garlic cloves', u'2 teaspoons salt', u'3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', u'1/4 to 1/2 cup water', u'4 to 8 tablespoons corn or vegetable oil', u'8 large eggs', u'8 (6- to 7-inch) corn tortillas'], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat a comal (griddle) or a dry well-seasoned cast-iron skillet over moderate heat until a bead of water evaporates quickly, then roast tomatoes, tomatillos, jalape\xf1os, and onion, turning with tongs, until charred on all sides, 10 to 15 minutes. Core roasted tomatoes. Discard stems from jalape\xf1os and discard half of seeds from each chile.', u'For red salsa: Coarsely pur\xe9e tomatoes, 1 jalape\xf1o, 1 garlic clove, and 1 teaspoon salt in a blender or food processor, then transfer to a bowl.', u'For green salsa: Coarsely pur\xe9e tomatillos, remaining jalape\xf1o, remaining garlic clove, remaining teaspoon salt, cilantro, and 1/4 cup water (add more if needed for desired consistency), then transfer to a bowl.', u'Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a small nonstick skillet over moderately low heat until hot. Gently break 2 eggs into a cup, keeping yolks intact, then pour into skillet and cook, covered, 5 minutes, or to desired doneness. Season with salt and pepper.', u'Fry tortillas while eggs cook. Make more eggs in same manner, adding oil as needed.', u'While each serving of eggs is cooking, heat 2 tablespoons oil in another small nonstick skillet over moderate heat until hot but not smoking. Stack 2 tortillas in skillet. Cook bottom tortilla 30 seconds on first side, then flip stack with tongs. While second tortilla cooks on bottom, turn top tortilla over with tongs, then flip stack again. Continue until both sides of both tortillas are cooked. Tortillas will soften and puff slightly, then deflate (do not let them become brown or crisp). Fry more tortillas in same manner, adding oil as needed.', u'Put tortillas on plate, overlapping slightly, and top with eggs. Spoon a different salsa over each egg.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/fried-eggs-on-corn-tortillas-with-two-salsas-huevos-divorciados-103387', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 4', 'recipe title': u'Fried Eggs on Corn Tortillas with Two Salsas (Huevos Divorciados)', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"When frozen, bananas become so creamy they can almost pass for sorbet or even ice cream. Coat them with chocolate and sprinkle them with homemade peanut brittle\u2014there will be plenty left over for snacking\u2014and you've got a refreshingly cold treat that feels almost as virtuous as a serving of fruit.", 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'8 medium bananas', u'1 cup salted dry-roasted peanuts', u'3/4 cup sugar', u'1/4 cup light corn syrup', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter plus more for baking sheet', u'1/8 teaspoon baking soda', u'12 ounces bittersweet (60% cacao) chocolate, chopped', u'Special equipment: 8 wooden popsicle sticks (4 1/2- by 1/2-inch); candy thermometer'], 'preperation steps': [u'Line a large baking sheet with wax paper.', u"Peel bananas and carefully insert a popsicle stick into bottom end of each banana, halfway up stick. Arrange bananas on the baking sheet and freeze until firm but not frozen hard, about 1 hour. (You don't want the bananas so cold that the chocolate solidifies before you have a chance to add the peanut brittle.)", u'Butter a rimmed baking sheet. Combine peanuts, sugar, corn syrup, and salt in a 2 1/2- to 3-quart heavy saucepan, and bring slowly to a boil over medium heat, stirring.', u'Position a candy thermometer so that it can rest on side of pan with bulb in mixture. Slowly boil, without stirring but tilting and swirling mixture in pan if it begins to color unevenly. Cook until deep golden and temperature reaches 295\xb0F on thermometer, about 5 minutes.', u'Remove pan from heat and stir in butter and baking soda (mixture will foam up). Immediately pour molten candy onto baking sheet. Let cool completely, 45 minutes to 1 hour, then pry from baking sheet, and finely chop.', u'Melt chocolate in a deep metal bowl set over a saucepan of barely simmering water, stirring occasionally, until smooth. Remove bowl of chocolate from pan. Working with 1 banana at a time, set banana in bowl and coat most of banana evenly in chocolate by spooning it on and smoothing it with the back of the spoon.', u'Immediately sprinkle peanut brittle over chocolate coating while chocolate is still wet, then return coated banana to wax paper-lined sheet, and let it set while coating remaining bananas. Refreeze bananas, if necessary, to firm up chocolate.'], 'chef': u'Gina Marie Miraglia Eriquez', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/frozen-chocolate-dipped-bananas-with-peanut-brittle-51107830', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Frozen Chocolate-Dipped Bananas with Peanut Brittle', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'3/4 cup water', u'1/2 cup lemon juice', u'1/4 cup agave or honey', u'8 kiwi slices', u'16 blueberries'], 'preperation steps': [u'In a bowl, mix together the water, lemon juice and agave.', u'Place 3-5 blueberries and 1 or 2 kiwi slices in each ice pop mold.', u"Gently pour the liquid mixture into each mold. You can reposition the fruit after you've poured in the liquid.", u'Freeze 6 hours or until frozen through.', u'Serve.'], 'chef': u'herine McCord', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/fruity-lemonade-ice-pops-51262480', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 ice pops', 'recipe title': u'Fruity Lemonade Ice Pops', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'EFFORT: A LOT PREP TIME: 25 MINUTES COOK TIME: 1 HOUR 20 MINUTES TO 2 HOURS KEEPS ON WARM: NO', 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'8 tablespoons (1 stick) unsalted butter, cut into small bits, plus more for greasing the canister', u'9 ounces dark chocolate, chopped', u'2 ounces unsweetened chocolate, chopped', u'1 cup sugar', u'2 large eggs, at room temperature', u'2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'2/3 cup all-purpose flour, plus more for coating the canister', u'1/2 teaspoon salt'], 'preperation steps': [u'1 Generously grease the inside of the slow cooker canister by holding a small slice of butter with a paper towel and rubbing the butter all over the surfaces. Add some flour, then turn the crock this way and that to coat both the bottom and the walls with a fine, even dusting. Tap out any excess flour.', u'2 Set up a double boiler with about 1 inch of water in the bottom pan, simmering over medium heat\u2014or place a large, heat-safe metal bowl over a medium saucepan with a similar amount of simmering water. Add the butter and both chocolates. Stir with a rubber spatula until about two-thirds of the chocolate has melted. Remove the top half of the double boiler or the bowl from the saucepan below, then continue stirring off the heat until all the chocolate has melted. Cool for 10 minutes.', u'3 Meanwhile, beat the sugar, eggs, and vanilla in a large bowl with an electric mixer at medium speed until quite thick and pale yellow, up to 10 minutes.', u'4 Beat in the cooled chocolate mixture until smooth, then scrape down and remove the beaters. Fold in the flour and salt with a rubber spatula, using wide, gentle arcs to make sure every speck of flour has been moistened. Pour and spread this mixture into the slow cooker.', u'5 Lay long strips of paper towels across the top of the slow cooker, overlapping each other and hanging down the sides for stability. Set the lid in place, then cook on high for about 1 hour 20 minutes in a small (2- to 3 1/2-quart) slow cooker, about 1 hour 40 minutes in a medium (4- to 5 1/2-quart) one, or about 2 hours in a large (6- to 8-quart) model, or until the cake is firm to the touch and the edges are dry while the middle is dark and moist. Unplug, uncover, and cool in the canister for 30 minutes before cutting out slices with a nonstick-safe knife or setting a cutting board over the cooker, inverting it, and turning the cake out.'], 'chef': u'Bruce Weinstein and Mark Scarbrough', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/fudgy-brownie-cake-51220650', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves: 6 to 12', 'recipe title': u'Fudgy Brownie Cake', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Usually considered a summer drink, this refreshing lime concoction is a tart surprise when the chill of winter weather settles in.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 ounces (6 tablespoons) gin', u'2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'6 to 8 oz chilled club soda or seltzer', u'Garnish: lime wedges'], 'preperation steps': [u'Fill a cocktail shaker halfway with cracked ice, then add gin and lime juice. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Bake this festive spice cake in your favorite Bundt pan or pudding bowl, or feel free to use an 8" springform pan. You can top the cake with Luscious Chocolate Icing or simply dust it with powdered sugar.', 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'75%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, room temperature, plus more for pan', u'2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour plus more for pan', u'1 cup dried tart cherries (about 6 ounces), finely chopped', u'1/2 cup finely chopped crystallized ginger', u'1 tablespoon finely grated peeled ginger', u'1 tablespoon Dijon mustard', u'1 cup hot espresso or very strong coffee', u'1 tablespoon ground ginger', u'2 teaspoons baking soda', u'1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon ground allspice', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup (packed) dark brown sugar', u'3 large eggs', u'1 cup mild-flavored (light) molasses', u'Luscious Chocolate Icing (optional)', u'Special equipment: A 6-8-cup Bundt pan'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F. Butter Bundt pan. Dust pan with flour, tapping out excess. Combine cherries, crystallized ginger, grated ginger, and Dijon mustard in a medium bowl. Pour espresso over cherry mixture and set aside. Whisk 2 1/2 cups flour, ground ginger, baking soda, salt, allspice, cinnamon, and pepper in a large bowl.', u'Using an electric mixer on medium speed, beat 1/2 cup butter in a large bowl until light and fluffy, about 2 minutes. Add brown sugar and beat for 2 minutes. Beat in eggs one at a time, then beat in molasses.', u'Strain cherry mixture into a small bowl, reserving soaking liquid. Add dry ingredients to butter mixture in 3 additions, alternately with soaking liquid in 2 additions, beating to blend between additions. Fold in drained cherry mixture. Scrape batter into prepared pan.', u'Bake until top of cake springs back when lightly pressed in the middle, about 1 hour. Let cool in pan on a wire rack. DO AHEAD: Can be made 2 days ahead. Store airtight at room temperature.', u'Remove cake from pan. Spoon Luscious Chocolate Icing over cake, if using, allowing it to drip down sides. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'You can make the souffl\xe9s 4 hours ahead (keep at room temperature). {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Anywhere you go in Laos, you will find women patiently preparing papaya for this salad. Using a small machete-like knife, they make repeated shallow parallel cuts, each about 1/8 inch deep, in a section of the papaya. Then they scrape the papaya from top to bottom so they end up with very nice julienne. A food processor fitted with the julienne disk or a manual slicer such as a mandoline works equally well.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'88%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 (1- to 1 1/4-pound) green papaya', u'1 large tomato, chopped', u'2 ounce Asian-style beef jerky (optional), cut into fine julienne', u'2 large garlic cloves, minced', u'1 to 3 small (1-inch) fresh Asian chiles such as bird or Thai, minced', u'1 tablespoon minced peeled galangal or fresh ginger', u'4 1/2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'1 1/2 tablespoons Asian fish sauce', u'1 1/2 tablespoons sugar', u'Accompaniment: soft-leaf lettuce'], 'preperation steps': [u'Peel and seed papaya. Cut into large pieces and then julienne. Combine with tomato, jerky, garlic, chiles, and galangal in a large bowl. Stir together lime juice, fish sauce, and sugar in a small bowl until sugar is dissolved and toss with papaya mixture.', u'Mound salad on a platter and serve with lettuce leaves for wrapping.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/green-papaya-salad-102259', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 4 as a side dish or 6 as a first course', 'recipe title': u'Green Papaya Salad', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This dip is also delicious with thin baguette slices, toast, crackers, or tortilla chips.', 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'8 whole artichokes', u'1 cup (packed) fresh mint leaves', u'6 ounces cream cheese', u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil'], 'preperation steps': [u'Prepare barbecue (medium heat). Using scissors, cut off spiky tips from artichokes. Using spoon, scrape out chokes from centers. Wrap each artichoke in foil. Using tines of fork, poke holes in foil. Grill until leaves pull away easily from heart, turning occasionally, about 40 minutes. Unwrap artichokes. Discard any outer leaves that may be charred and any tough inner leaves. Arrange 6 artichokes on platter. Remove leaves from remaining 2 artichokes and place on platter. Transfer artichoke hearts to processor. Add mint, cream cheese, and oil; blend until smooth. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Transfer dip to bowl and place on platter.'], 'chef': u'David Downie', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/grilled-artichokes-with-artichoke-mint-dip-234402', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Grilled Artichokes with Artichoke-Mint Dip', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Be sure to reserve two grilled chicken breasts and a cup of Mango-Sesame Dressing to use in the Asian Chicken-Noodle Salad .', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: 546 calories, 30 g fat, 2 g fiber\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Bon App\xe9tit', 'recommendation': u'88%', 'ingredient list': [u'8 1/3-inch-thick rounds red onion', u'8 large shiitake mushrooms, stemmed', u'8 red radishes, trimmed, halved', u'4 baby bok choy, halved lengthwise', u'1 large orange bell pepper, cut lengthwise into 8 strips', u'1 1/4 cups Mango-Sesame Dressing , divided', u'6 boneless chicken breast halves with skin', u'Nonstick vegetable oil spray'], 'preperation steps': [u'Arrange all vegetables on large rimmed baking sheet. Making the bruschetta on the grill will free up the oven.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'8 5 x 3 x 1/2-inch slices crusty country-style bread', u'Olive oil', u'1 8-ounce piece ripe Teleme cheese or Havarti cheese, cut into 8 slices', u'8 ripe fresh figs, stemmed, quartered lengthwise', u'Dark full-flavored honey (such as forest honey)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Prepare barbecue (medium-high heat). {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"If you're using whole-milk plain yogurt instead of lebneh, you'll have to allow extra time (at least 8 hours) for draining.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/2 cup lebneh* (thick Middle Eastern\u2013style yogurt) or 1 cup whole-milk plain yogurt', u'1 garlic clove', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'2 to 4 tablespoons water', u'2 lb eggplant (2 medium), cut crosswise into 3/4-inch-thick slices', u'1/2 cup olive oil', u'Garnish: fresh mint leaves'], 'preperation steps': [u'If using whole-milk plain yogurt, drain in a paper-towel-lined sieve set over a bowl, covered and chilled, 8 to 12 hours.', u'Mince garlic and mash to a paste with a pinch of salt, then transfer to a bowl. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Once you try this easy and delicious recipe, you'll never buy grocery-store ricotta again.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'57%', 'ingredient list': [u'8 cups whole milk', u'1 cup heavy cream', u'1 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'3 tablespoons lemon juice'], 'preperation steps': [u'Line a large colander with 2 layers of cheesecloth and place over a large bowl.', u"In a 5 to 6 quart pot over medium heat, heat milk, cream, and salt, stirring occasionally to avoid scorching, until mixture foams and comes to a boil. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"I CAN NEVER DECIDE WHAT I LIKE BETTER about this Alsatian and southern-German tart: the quetsches(similar to Italian blue plums, which are available for a short time in the fall) or the butter crust (called a sabl\xe9 in French and M\xfcrbeteig in German). On a recent trip to France, I learned a trick for making it: if you bake the tart with no sugar over the fruit, you won't get a soggy crust. Just sprinkle on a small amount of sugar after baking. Italian blue plums are only available in the early fall, so I tend to serve this tart at Rosh Hashanah.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'50%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 cup all-purpose flour', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1/8 teaspoon salt', u'1 stick (8 tablespoons) unsalted butter or pareve margarine, cut into 8 pieces', u'1 egg yolk', u'3 tablespoons plum or other fruit jam', u'1 tablespoon brandy', u'1 1/2 pounds Italian blue plums', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1 teaspoon grated lemon zest', u'1/4 cup sugar'], 'preperation steps': [u'To make the crust, pulse the flour, sugar, salt, and butter or margarine together in the bowl of a food processor fitted with a steel blade until crumbled. Then add the egg yolk, and pulse until the dough comes together.', u'Put the dough in the center of an ungreased 9-inch tart pan with a removable bottom. Dust your fingers with flour, and gently press out the dough to cover the bottom and sides of the pan. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.', u'Preheat the oven to 450 degrees, and bake the crust for 10 minutes. Reduce the oven to 375 degrees, and bake for another 5 minutes. Remove the crust from the oven, and let cool slightly. Reduce the oven temperature to 350 degrees.', u'Mix the jam with the brandy in a small bowl, and spread over the bottom of the crust. Pit the plums, and cut them into four pieces each. Starting at the outside, arrange the plums in a circle so that all the pieces overlap, creating concentric circles that wind into the center of the pan. Sprinkle with the cinnamon and lemon zest.', u'Return the tart to the oven, and bake for about 30 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the plums are juicy. Remove the tart from the oven, sprinkle on the sugar, and serve warm or at room temperature.'], 'chef': u'Joan Nathan', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/italian-plum-tart-em-tarte-aux-quetsches-em-360490', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Italian Plum Tart (Tarte aux Quetsches)', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'50%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 recipe Classic Sugar Cookies , baked using the slice-and-bake method', u'8 ounces dark or semi-sweet chocolate, chopped', u'8 ounces white chocolate, chopped', u"2 1/2 cups confectioner's sugar, sifted", u'3/4 cup (1 1/2 sticks) unsalted butter, at room temperature', u'8 ounces bar cream cheese, at room temperature', u'1 teaspoon vanilla\xa0extract', u'Green food coloring (preferably gel paste)', u'pastry bag with small tip or resealable plastic bag', u'wooden skewers or toothpicks'], 'preperation steps': [u'Fill a medium pot with 2 inches of water, place over medium heat, and bring to a simmer. Remove bowl from heat, and stir until smooth.', u'Using a small offset spatula or spoon, apply a thin layer of dark chocolate onto the rounded surface of the "tops" of half the cookies, reserving the remaining half of the cookies for the sandwich "bottoms." Fill a pastry bag fitted with a small tip with melted white chocolate. Drizzle thin horizontal stripes of white chocolate onto each chocolate-covered cookie, leaving a 1/4-inch gap in the center for the eyes. Add the whites of two eyes in the center of each cookie and allow to set, about 5 minutes. Using a toothpick, add two small dots of reserved melted dark chocolate to the eyes to make pupils. Repeat with remaining cookies.', u"Using an electric mixer, beat butter on medium-high until smooth and fluffy. Add the cream cheese and beat until well blended. Add the confectioner's sugar, vanilla extract, and a few drops food coloring. Let chicken stand 5 to 10 minutes (do not cover).'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/oven-fried-chicken-108494', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 1 serving', 'recipe title': u'Oven-Fried Chicken', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'The exotic flavors of passion fruit and guava are layered in these pretty ice pops. To create perfectly defined layers, chill the guava mixture while the passion fruit mixture is freezing.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/3 cup water', u'1/4 cup plus 3 tablespoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons fresh lime juice, divided', u'7 to 8 ripe passion fruits (about 11 ounces), halved', u'1 11.5-ounce can guava nectar (about 1 1/2 cups)', u'Special equipment: 8 3-ounce disposable paper cups; 8 ice pop sticks or lollipop sticks', u'Ingredient info: Choose passion fruit that is wrinkled on the outside, which indicates that the fruit is ripe.'], 'preperation steps': [u'Combine 1/3 cup water, 1/4 cup sugar, and 1 tablespoon lime juice in small bowl; stir until sugar dissolves. Using spoon, scoop flesh from passion fruits into sugar mixture. Strain mixture through fine-mesh strainer into small bowl; press on seeds with rubber spatula to extract as much liquid as possible (you will need 1 cup strained liquid); discard seeds in strainer.', u'Divide passion fruit mixture among eight 3-ounce paper cups (about 2 tablespoons for each). Stretch plastic wrap tightly over top of each cup, covering completely and securing each with rubber band. Insert ice pop stick or lollipop stick through plastic wrap and into mixture in each cup (taut plastic will hold stick in place). Place cups in muffin pan, tilting cups at angle. Freeze until passion fruit mixture is set, about 3 hours.', u'Meanwhile, stir guava nectar, remaining 3 tablespoons sugar, and 1 tablespoon lime juice in 2-cup measuring cup until sugar dissolves. Chill mixture until cold.', u'Remove cups with frozen passion fruit mixture from freezer; stand cups upright in muffin pan. Peel back some of plastic wrap on each. Pour guava mixture atop frozen passion fruit mixture in cups, dividing equally. Cover with plastic wrap, secure with rubber band, and freeze until firm, at least 4 hours. DO AHEAD: Can be made 3 days ahead. Keep frozen.', u'Using scissors, cut off paper cups from pops and serve immediately.'], 'chef': u'Rochelle Palermo', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/passion-fruit-and-guava-pops-359812', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 ', 'recipe title': u'Passion Fruit and Guava Pops', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Many people become extremely intimidated when it comes to making Persian rice. You have to trust me when I tell you it is really not a big deal\u2014just don\'t tell anyone Persian I said that! All you need to do is to imagine that instead of making rice, you are making pasta. Most of us know how to make pasta; it is probably what you ate every day when you went to college! You are going to cook this rice in boiling water with oil and salt, just like pasta. You are going to wait until the rice is "al dente" (when you bite a grain of rice it should still have a white dot in the middle), just like pasta. Do not overcook Persian rice or your reputation as a Persian cook will suffer! And last, you are going to drain it, just like pasta.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'5 cups basmati rice, checked and rinsed', u'12 cups water', u'1/2 cup canola oil', u'3 tablespoons salt', u'1/4-inch canola oil poured into the bottom of the saucepan', u'2 tablespoons water', u'1/4 teaspoon turmeric or powdered saffron (optional, for a more authentic flavor)'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Fill a large nonstick saucepan (at least 6 quarts) with 12 cups water; add oil and salt. Cover and bring to a brisk boil over high heat.', u'2. Add the rice and continue cooking over medium to high heat, stirring occasionally.', u'3. After 3-5 minutes, use a slotted spoon to scoop some grains from the water. Break one grain in half to make sure it is "al dente" (see above). Turn off the heat and pour rice into the colander to drain; set aside.', u'1. Place the empty 6-quart saucepan back onto the stovetop over medium heat. Add 1/4-inch canola oil and 2 tablespoons water. Add turmeric and/or saffron powder. Stir together.', u'2. Add the drained rice and shape it into a pyramid. Cover the pot and cook for 5-7 minutes until rice begins to steam.', u'3. Uncover and place 2 paper towels (one on top of the other) over the rice. The ends will extend outside the pot. Replace the lid tightly.', u'4. Reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, for 45 minutes. Turn off the heat and tilt the lid until ready to serve.', u'5. With a wide spatula, scoop the rice from the pot, making sure not to disturb the crust (tadig) that formed on the bottom of the pot. Serve the rice on a flat serving platter, mounding it into the shape of a pyramid. Turn the tadig out onto a flat serving platter by inverting the pot, as you would invert a cake pan, or cut it into pieces and serve around the rice.', u'1. To make saffron water, mix together 1 teaspoon crushed saffron threads and 1/4 cup hot water. Steep for a few minutes, until the water becomes yellow.', u'2. Mix saffron water with steamed white rice. Use this intensely yellow rice to make designs on the Chelo.', u'Pour 1/2 cup water mixed with 1/4 cup canola oil onto the pyramid in a large pot. You can also freeze this rice, as long as you do not stir it until it is completely defrosted. You can even cook it, freeze it, and later steam it as it defrosts. I know I will have to spend time in "rice hell" for admitting to freezing Persian rice, but it is worth it to make my life easier!'], 'chef': u'Reyna Simnegar', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/persian-steamed-white-rice-em-chelo-em-51109800', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Persian Steamed White Rice (Chelo)', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 20 min Start to finish: 8 1/2 hr (includes chilling)', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'33%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 teaspoons unflavored gelatin (from one 1/4-oz envelope)', u'1 tablespoon water', u'2 cups Hachiya persimmon pur\xe9e', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1 1/2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice', u'1/2 cup chilled heavy cream', u'6 oz firm-ripe Fuyu persimmons'], 'preperation steps': [u'Sprinkle gelatin over water in a small heatproof cup and let stand 1 minute to soften. Beat cream in another bowl with an electric mixer until it just holds stiff peaks, then gently fold into pur\xe9e. Divide fool among 4 stemmed glasses and chill, covered, at least 8 hours (it will set softly).', u'Just before serving, peel Fuyu persimmons, seeding if necessary, and chop. Top fool with chopped persimmons.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/persimmon-fool-108910', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 servings (about 2 1/4 cups)', 'recipe title': u'Persimmon Fool', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'86%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 cups distilled white vinegar', u'1 1/3 cups water', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1 1/2 teaspoons kosher or canning salt', u'1 1/2 pounds small hot chiles (6 cups), stems trimmed to 1/4 inch', u'7 or 8 garlic cloves', u'3 1/2 to 4 teaspoons pickling spices', u'Special equipment: 8 (1/2-pint) canning jars with lids and screw bands; a boiling-water canner or an 8- to 10-quart deep pot'], 'preperation steps': [u'Wash jars, lids, and screw bands in hot soapy water, then rinse well. Dry screw bands. Put jars and lids on a rack in canner or pot and add enough water to cover by 2 inches. Heat water until an instant-read thermometer registers 180\xb0F (do not let boil). Keep jars submerged in hot water, covered, until ready to use.', u'Bring vinegar, water, sugar, and salt to a boil in a 3-quart nonreactive saucepan, stirring until sugar is dissolved. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, 5 minutes.', u'Drain jars upside down on a clean kitchen towel 1 minute, then invert. Tightly pack jars with chiles and add 1 garlic clove and 1/2 teaspoon pickling spices to each jar. Fill jars with pickling liquid, leaving 1/4inch of space at top, then run a thin knife between chiles and jar to eliminate air bubbles.', u'Wipe off rims of filled jars with a damp clean kitchen towel, then firmly screw on lids with screw bands.', u'Put sealed jars on rack in canner or pot and add enough hot water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil, covered. Boil pickles, covered, 10 minutes, then transfer jars with tongs to a kitchen towel to cool. Jars will seal as they cool. (If you hear a ping, that signals that vacuum formed at top of jar has made lid concave.)', u"After jars have cooled 12 to 24 hours, press center of each lid to make sure that it's concave, then remove screw band and try to lift off lid with your fingertips. If you can't, lid has a good seal."], 'chef': u'ipe by Ian Knauer', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/pickled-hot-chiles-107029', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 7 or 8 (1/2-pint) jars', 'recipe title': u'Pickled Hot Chiles', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Babylonstoren's chef Maranda Engelbrecht uses exotic tamarillos. If you can get them, great. If not, tomatoes are your best swap.", 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 teaspoon distilled white vinegar', u'4 large eggs', u'6 tablespoons unsalted butter, divided', u'8 ounces shiitake mushrooms, stems removed, torn into pieces', u'8 ounces oyster mushrooms, trimmed, torn into pieces', u'Kosher salt, freshly ground pepper', u'2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, divided', u'1/4 cup sage leaves', u'8 tamarillos, peeled, thinly sliced, or 4 medium heirloom tomatoes, cored, thinly sliced (or a mix of both)', u'2 ounces Parmesan, shaved', u'Flaky sea salt'], 'preperation steps': [u'Bring 2" water to a boil in a large saucepan; reduce heat to a gentle simmer and add vinegar. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 45 min Start to finish: 1 1/4 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'8 large plum tomatoes (1 1/3 lb), halved lengthwise', u'3/4 lb mushrooms, trimmed and halved (quartered if large)', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'5 tablespoons olive oil', u'8 (1/2-inch-thick) slices Italian bread (3 to 4 inches wide)', u'1 garlic clove, halved crosswise', u'1 teaspoon distilled white vinegar', u'1/4 lb thinly sliced smoked ham (8 slices)', u'8 large eggs'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 400\xb0F.', u'Toss tomatoes and mushrooms with salt, pepper, and 2 tablespoons oil in a roasting pan. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Weighing down a chicken with bricks seems so ancient. Did the advisors to Roman emperors hatch the slogan, "A chicken under every brick," to go along with the bread and circus motif? Brick morphed so naturally from the good earth\u2014add water and high heat (ecco fatto, terracotta) and civilization started to build in a big way. Roman bricks were longer and narrower than present-day bricks, but any brick will do. If you have a few handy, you should wash them, let them air-dry, and wrap them in a few sheets of aluminum foil. Otherwise, you can use a heavy pan of some sort. I\'ve used an 8-quart Le Creuset, covering the bottom with aluminum foil.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: 390.0 calories, 370.0 calories from fat, 41.0g total fat, 6.0g saturated fat, 0.0mg cholesterol, 300.0mg sodium, 2.0g total carbs, 0.0g dietary fiber, 0.0g sugars, 0.0g protein\n\nNutritional analysis provided by TasteBook, using the USDA Nutrition Database', 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 garlic cloves', u'1 handful of parsley', u'Zest from 1 orange', u'4 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon pepper', u'1 chicken, 3 to 4 pounds', u'2 tablespoons red wine vinegar', u'1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1/2 cup white wine'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.', u'Mince the garlic and parsley and combine with the zest, 2 tablespoons of olive oil, and salt and pepper. Set aside.', u'Wash the chicken under cold running water and dry. With poultry shears, remove the wing tips, any excess fat, and cut out the backbone. Put them aside for stock. You may want to remove the ribs and breastbone, too. Mix together the marinade ingredients. Lay the chicken flat, skin side up. Stuff the garlic mixture under the skin, place in the marinade, then cover and marinate for a few hours or, even better, overnight. Turn two or three times.', u"Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a cast-iron pan large enough to hold the chicken (I use a 12-inch cast-iron skillet). Place the chicken skin side down and weigh it down with the two clean bricks wrapped in foil. Cook over medium heat for 5 minutes, then place the skillet and bricks in the oven for 15 to 20 minutes, after which you'll remove the weights and turn the chicken over, cooking another 10 minutes or so, until done. Cut into serving- sized pieces."], 'chef': u'Frances Mayes', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/pollo-al-mattone-chicken-under-a-brick-363384', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 4', 'recipe title': u'Pollo al Mattone: Chicken Under a Brick', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Home turf: New Mexico Local flavor: Southwestern-style chili is all about the chiles (with an "e"), as in this pillar of regional cooking, chile verde. The chiles are green and mild (New Mexico\'s famous hatch chiles are perfect), and the meat is pork. Tangy tomatillos balance the chiles and coat the slow-cooked pork. To up the regional cred, serve it "Christmas" style\u2014with a combo of green and red chiles. Make it a meal: Serve with warm corn tortillas, avocado and spinach salad with honey-lime vinaigrette, and a dark beer like Negra Modelo (Mexico, $8 per six-pack).', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'97%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 cups (or more) chicken broth, divided', u'1 pound tomatillos, husked, rinsed, cut into 1/2-inch wedges, divided', u'1 bunch green onions, coarsely chopped', u'1 1/2 cups (packed) fresh cilantro with tender stems', u'Olive oil', u'6 garlic cloves, peeled', u'1 4- to 4 1/2-pound pork shoulder (Boston butt), trimmed, cut into 1 1/2-inch cubes', u'1 large onion, chopped (about 2 cups)', u'1 tablespoon cumin seeds', u'3/4 cup diced roasted peeled seeded mild green chiles (such as Hatch or Anaheim)', u'2 teaspoons dried oregano (preferably Mexican)', u'1 pound yukon gold potatoes, peeled, cut into 3/4-inch cubes chopped', u'Fresh cilantro', u'Red chile salsa', u'Ingredient info: Look for tomatillos (green, tomato-like fruits with papery husks) at supermarkets and Latin markets.'], 'preperation steps': [u'Puree 2 cups chicken broth, 1/4 of tomatillos, green onions, cilantro with stems, and garlic in blender. Set salsa verde aside.', u'Brush heavy large pot with oil; heat over medium-high heat. Sprinkle pork with salt and pepper. Working in batches, add pork to pot; cook until browned, turning occasionally, about 4 minutes per batch. Using slotted spoon, transfer pork to bowl. Pour off all but 1 tablespoon fat from pot (add oil if needed). Add onion to pot; saut\xe9 until soft, about 5 minutes. Sprinkle cumin seeds over; cook until onion is golden and cumin is toasted, about 2 minutes. Add remaining tomatillos; cook until tender and browned in spots, stirring occasionally and reducing heat to medium if browning too quickly, about 8 minutes. Return pork and any juices to pot. Add 2 cups reserved salsa verde, 1 cup broth, chiles, and oregano. Cover; simmer over medium-low heat until pork is tender, about 2 hours. DO AHEAD: Can be made 3 days ahead. Cool slightly. Chill uncovered until cold, then cover and keep chilled. Bring to simmer before continuing.', u'Add potatoes to pork. Simmer until potatoes are tender, about 30 minutes. Stir in remaining salsa verde; bring to simmer. Thin with additional broth, if desired. Season with salt and pepper.', u'Divide chile verde among bowls. Top with cilantro and dollop of red chile salsa.'], 'chef': u'Jeanne Kelley', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/pork-chile-verde-with-red-chile-salsa-363730', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Pork Chile Verde with Red Chile Salsa', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'The delicate sweetness of Alaskan king crab is front and center in this easy-to-make appetizer. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Use good butter, fresh crabmeat, and Meyer lemons and this simple spread will really sing. Can't find Meyer lemons? {'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'64%', 'ingredient list': [u'8 small McIntosh apples, stemmed, washed well, and dried', u'1 1/2 cups red wine', u'2 cups sugar', u'1/2 cup water', u'6 tablespoons heavy cream', u'Equipment: 8 wooden ice-pop sticks; a candy thermometer'], 'preperation steps': [u'Insert a wooden stick halfway into each apple at stem end. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Although trends come and go, chocolate mousse never fails to impress. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 hr Start to finish: 4 hr', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'95%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 (12- to 14-lb) turkey (preferably kosher), any quills removed if necessary and neck and giblets (excluding liver) reserved for making stock', u'1 1/4 teaspoons salt', u'1/2 teaspoon black pepper', u'2 navel oranges, each cut into 8 wedges', u'3 small red onions, each cut into 8 wedges', u'5 bay leaves (not California)', u'3/4 stick (6 tablespoons) unsalted butter, melted', u'Pan juices from roast turkey', u'About 4 cups turkey stock (page 198)', u'1/3 cup all-purpose flour', u'Garnish: 4 roasted onions, each cut into 8 wedges (optional); fresh bay leaves (do not eat)', u'Special equipment: small metal skewers or wooden toothpicks; kitchen string'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 425\xb0F.', u'Rinse turkey inside and out and pat dry. Sprinkle turkey inside and out with salt and pepper, then fold neck skin under body and secure with small skewer. Stuff large cavity with oranges, 1 onion, and bay leaves. Tie drumsticks together with kitchen string and secure wings to body with small skewers.', u'Put turkey on a rack set in a large flameproof roasting pan and roast in middle of oven 30 minutes.', u'While turkey is roasting, toss remaining 2 onions with 2 tablespoons melted butter.', u'Reduce oven temperature to 350\xb0F. Brush remaining 1/4 cup butter over turkey and roast 30 minutes more. Baste turkey and scatter buttered onion wedges around it, then roast, basting turkey every 30 minutes (add a little water to pan if onions get too dark) until an instant-read thermometer inserted into fleshy part of a thigh (do not touch bone) registers 170\xb0F, 1 1/2 to 2 hours more (total roasting time: 2 1/2 to 3 hours). Transfer turkey to a platter (do not clean roasting pan) and let stand 25 minutes (temperature will rise to 180\xb0F).', u'Transfer pan juices with onions to a 2-quart glass measure, then skim off and reserve 1/4 cup fat. Add enough turkey stock to pan juices to make 4 1/2 cups total. Set roasting pan across 2 burners, then add 1 cup stock mixture and deglaze pan by boiling over moderately high heat, stirring and scraping up brown bits. Add remaining stock mixture and bring to a simmer. Pour stock through a fine sieve back into glass measure and discard onions.', u'Whisk together reserved fat and flour in a large heavy saucepan and cook roux over moderately low heat, whisking, 3 minutes. Add hot stock mixture in a fast stream, whisking constantly to prevent lumps, then simmer, whisking occasionally, until thickened, about 10 minutes. Stir in any additional turkey juices accumulated on platter and season gravy with salt and pepper.', u'Serve turkey with gravy on the side.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/roast-turkey-with-oranges-bay-leaves-red-onions-and-pan-gravy-105729', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 to 10 servings', 'recipe title': u'Roast Turkey with Oranges, Bay Leaves, Red Onions, and Pan Gravy', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'What to drink: Pour brut or ros\xe9 Champagne throughout the meal, or pair the soup with a light red wine (try an Oregon Pinot Noir) and the Oven Roasted Dungeness Crab with a fragrant dry white, such as Viognier or New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'86%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/2 pound red beets (about 3 medium)', u'1 1/2 teaspoons butter', u'1 1/2 teaspoons olive oil', u'1 leek (white and pale green parts only), chopped', u'1 small onion, thinly sliced', u'1 celery stalk, chopped', u'1/8 teaspoon ground ginger', u'1/8 teaspoon ground allspice', u'1/8 teaspoon ground white pepper', u'2 cups water', u'1 small bay leaf', u'1 fresh thyme sprig', u'1 fresh parsley sprig', u'1/4 cup whipping cream', u'2 tablespoons cr\xe8me fra\xeeche or sour cream'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F. Cut remaining beets into 1/2-inch pieces.', u'Melt butter with oil in heavy medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Add leek, onion, and celery and cook until beginning to brown, stirring frequently, about 13 minutes. Stir in ginger, allspice, white pepper, and 1/2-inch beet pieces. Cook until vegetables begin to stick to bottom of pot, stirring frequently, about 7 minutes. Add 2 cups water, bay leaf, thyme sprig, and parsley sprig. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until vegetables are very tender, about 25 minutes. Remove bay leaf, thyme sprig, and parsley sprig. Cool soup slightly. Working in batches, puree soup in blender with cream. Season to taste with salt and pepper. (Can be made 1 day ahead. Cool slightly, cover, and refrigerate.)', u'Gently rewarm soup (do not boil). Divide between 2 bowls. Garnish each with 1 tablespoon cr\xe8me fra\xeeche. Sprinkle with reserved beet cubes.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/roasted-beet-soup-with-creme-fraiche-231581', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 2 first-course servings', 'recipe title': u'Roasted Beet Soup with Cr\xe8me Fra\xeeche', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Throughout the Spanish-speaking world, thickened sweetened milk is a regular feature at dessert time (and, like all treats, whenever Mom isn\u2019t looking). {'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 cup whole milk', u'8 green cardamom pods', u'1/8 teaspoon crumbled saffron threads', u'2 envelopes active dry yeast', u'1 teaspoon plus 1/2 cup sugar', u'1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, room temperature', u'4 large eggs', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'4 1/2 cups all purpose flour', u'1 cup diced candied orange peel*', u'1 cup golden raisins', u'1 egg white, beaten to blend', u'8 sugar cubes, coarsely crushed'], 'preperation steps': [u'Combine milk, cardamom pods, and saffron in small saucepan; bring to simmer. Swirl pan to distribute saffron; remove from heat. Cover and let steep until instant-read thermometer inserted into milk mixture registers 110\xb0F, about 20 minutes.', u'Strain milk mixture into bowl of stand mixer fitted with paddle attachment; discard solids in strainer. Sprinkle yeast and 1 teaspoon sugar over milk mixture. Let stand until yeast is dissolved and mixture is foamy, about 10 minutes. Mix in remaining 1/2 cup sugar, butter, 4 eggs, and salt. Add 2 cups flour and beat on low speed until smooth. Increase speed to medium. Gradually add 2 1/2 cups flour; beat until smooth. Beat in candied orange peel and raisins. Continue beating until dough pulls away fromsides of bowl in long stretchy strands, about 3 minutes (dough will be sticky). Butter large bowl; scrape dough into bowl and cover with plastic wrap, then towel. Let rise in warm draft-free area until doubled, about 2 hours.', u'Butter 10x4-inch angel food cake pan. Using rubber spatula, press lightly on dough to release air. Turn out onto lightly floured surface; form into 18- to 20-inch rope. Transfer to prepared pan and wrap around center tube, pushing and pinching ends together and pressing top of dough slightly with rubber spatula to distribute evenly. Cover loosely with plastic wrap, then towel. Let dough rise in warm draft-free area until almost doubled, about 45 minutes.', u'Position rack in center of oven and preheat to 350\xb0F. Brush top of dough with beaten egg white. Sprinkle with crushed sugar cubes. Bake until golden brown and tester inserted near center comes out clean, about 45 minutes. Cool in pan on rack about 30 minutes. Turn out onto rack to cool completely. (Can be made 1 day ahead. Wrap in foil; store at room temperature.)', u'*Candied orange peel can be found at specialty foods stores or at chefshop.com.', u'Beating the dough until it forms stretchy strands traps air bubbles that expand with heatthus helping the dough rise.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/saffron-panettone-with-crushed-sugar-topping-233914', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 10 to 12 servings', 'recipe title': u'Saffron Panettone with Crushed Sugar Topping', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Table 8 uses a dry-aged porterhouse (sold at well-stocked butchers). If it's unavailable, substitute regular porterhouse or Kansas City steak.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'70%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 bay leaves, crushed', u'1 tablespoon whole black peppercorns', u'2 teaspoons whole coriander seeds', u'2 teaspoons fennel seeds', u'2 teaspoons mustard seeds', u'2 teaspoons dried rosemary', u'1/2 teaspoon dried crushed red pepper', u'1 teaspoon plus 1 1/2 cups coarse kosher salt', u'1 30-ounce porterhouse or T-bone steak (about 2 to 2 1/4 inches thick)', u'1/4 cup water'], 'preperation steps': [u'Mix first 7 ingredients in small bowl. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"I'll barbecue the hell out of a goat: get the whole animal on the grill or do up just the head or maybe the legs\u2014whatever strikes my fancy. But the shoulder is probably my favorite cut to treat to hours and hours of gentle smoky caressing. This is party cooking, because (a) everyone will want some of this tender, spicy action and (b) though it takes a while to cook, you're only not sitting on your ass and drinking for, like, 10 minutes. The goat shoulder smokes for approximately seven hours. The smoking should be done in an indirect smoker (Texas-style chamber smoker). A temperature of 225\xb0F to 250\xb0F (a big variation, as smokers can be hard to control) should be maintained for 7 to 8 hours. The time variation is big, too, as there are so many smokers, and often backyard versions don't hold heat all that well. At a constant 250\xb0F, it should not take longer than 7 hours, but an understanding of the variable types of equipment should be acknowledged.", 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 fresh long red chilies, such as Anaheim or Hungarian Wax, chopped', u'2 fresh Thai bird chilies, chopped', u'3 inches fresh ginger, peeled and chopped', u'8 garlic cloves, crushed and peeled', u'1 bunch of flat-leaf parsley, leaves only', u'2 tablespoons sea salt', u'1/4 cup olive oil (the best you can afford)', u'1 bone-in goat shoulder (about 5 pounds)'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Use a mortar and pestle to pound the chilies, ginger, garlic, and parsley with the salt to a coarse paste, pounding each ingredient thoroughly before adding the next. Add the olive oil, pounding again to form a pretty smooth paste.', u'2. Rub the goat shoulder with the chili paste and refrigerate, covered, for 24 hours.', u'1. Preheat a smoker (see Headnote above).', u"2. Place the goat shoulder in the smoker (reserving any leftover marinade) and let it ride for about 3 hours. Keep an eye on the temperature, stoke your fire, and drink a Scotch. Occasionally baste the goat with the leftover marinade. After 3 hours, periodically jiggle the leg. When it gives you the sense that if you pulled just a bit harder you could tear it from the joint, it's ready, but it'll probably take another 3 to 4 hours. Serve it straight away on a platter and tear into with your hands."], 'chef': u'Zakary Pelaccio with JJ Goode', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/smoked-chili-rubbed-goat-shoulder-395590', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 4', 'recipe title': u'Smoked-Chili-Rubbed Goat Shoulder', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Delicately flavored sole is a dieter's BFF, with only 73 calories per 3-ounce fillet.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: 396 calories, 16 g fat, 4 g saturated, 24 g carbohydrates, 1 g fiber, 36 g protein\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Self', 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'Parchment paper', u'4 sole fillets (6 ounces each)', u'1 tablespoon plus 4 teaspoons olive oil, divided', u'3 cloves garlic, 2 thinly sliced, 1 halved', u'1/8 teaspoon red pepper flakes', u'1 cup grape tomatoes, halved', u'2 tablespoons capers, drained', u'8 large, pitted kalamata olives, quartered', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'8 teaspoons dry white wine', u'4 teaspoons unsalted butter', u'8 fresh thyme sprigs', u'4 slices (1/2-inch thick) ciabatta bread'], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat oven to 450\xb0F. Fold four 15-inch-square pieces of parchment in half. Starting at fold of each piece, draw half a large heart shape. Cut along lines; open. Place 1 fish fillet next to crease on each piece of parchment. In a small skillet, warm 1 tbsp oil over medium heat. Saut\xe9 sliced garlic and pepper flakes until garlic turns golden, 1 minute. Remove skillet from heat; stir in tomatoes, capers and olives. Sprinkle fish with salt and pepper. Divide tomato mixture among fish. Top each fillet with 2 teaspoon wine, 1 teaspoon butter and 2 thyme sprigs. Fold other half of parchment over fish. Starting at top of each parchment half-heart, make small, tight, overlapping folds along outside edge to seal packet; twist tail ends tightly to seal completely. Place packets on a large rimmed baking sheet; roast 8 minutes. Broil or toast ciabatta until golden; rub with garlic clove halves and brush with remaining 4 teaspoon oil. Transfer packets to plates. Slit tops with a knife; gently open. Serve 1 slice ciabatta with each packet.'], 'chef': u'Larraine Perri', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/sole-em-en-papillote-em-with-tomatoes-and-olives-51101600', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 servings', 'recipe title': u'Sole en Papillote with Tomatoes and Olives', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'If pizza crust seems daunting and time-consuming to make, try this easy spelt dough, which is moistened with ricotta cheese and aromatic linseed oil. This rustic dinner is stunning to behold \u2014 thinly sliced apples and fennel sit on a tangy sour cream layer and are topped with lightly crisped prosciutto. The crust is inspired by classic German dough with Quark, a delicious fresh cheese, which keeps baked goods fresh. While your dough rests, preheat the oven and prepare the toppings \u2014 voil\xe0, dinner! Great also as a party appetizer in the early fall with a glass of ros\xe9 or dry white wine, or with a chilled lager in the summer.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'50%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 cups whole grain spelt flour (8 ounces)', u'2 teaspoons baking powder', u'3/4 teaspoon fine sea salt', u'1/2 teaspoon sugar', u'1 cup whole-milk ricotta cheese', u'1/4 cup whole milk', u'2 tablespoons linseed oil or extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 large egg', u'Coarse cornmeal, if using a pizza peel', u'4 or 5 green onions', u'1 cup sour cream', u'1/4 cup drained nonpareil capers', u'3/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1 Granny Smith apple, halved, cored, and sliced very thinly', u'1 fennel bulb, halved lengthwise, cored, and sliced very thinly', u'4 ounces thinly sliced prosciutto, cut crosswise into 1/2-inch-wide strips', u'Linseed or extra-virgin olive oil, for brushing'], 'preperation steps': [u'1 First, make the dough. To prepare the dough by hand: Whisk together the spelt flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar in a large bowl. Make a well in the center. In a small bowl, combine the ricotta, milk, linseed oil, and the egg and beat with a fork until smooth. Pour the ricotta mixture into the well. Combine with a dough whisk or a fork, stirring from the center and gradually incorporating the flour from the sides until a fairly moist dough comes together. To prepare the dough by food processor: Place the spelt flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar in the bowl and process for about 10 seconds. In a small bowl, combine the ricotta, milk, linseed oil, and the egg and beat with a fork until smooth. Pour the ricotta mixture across the top of the flour mixture and pulse, in 1-second intervals, just until a ball forms, 5 to 10 pulses. The dough will be fairly moist.', u'2 Transfer the dough to a well-floured work surface. Lightly flour your hands and briefly knead 5 to 7 turns to get a smooth yet slightly tacky dough. Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and let sit at room temperature for 30 to 45 minutes to allow the bran in the flour to soften.', u'3 Meanwhile, place a baking stone on a rack on the bottom shelf and preheat oven to 425\xb0F. Liberally sprinkle a pizza peel with coarse cornmeal. Finely chop the white and light green parts of the green onions until you have 1/2 cup. Combine them with the sour cream, capers, and 1/4 teaspoon of the pepper in a small bowl. Finely chop the dark green parts as well (about 1/4 cup) and set aside for garnish.', u'4 Unwrap the dough, transfer to a lightly floured work surface and cut into 2 pieces. Keep 1 piece covered with plastic wrap. Lightly flour your hands and briefly knead the other until smooth, 7 to 10 turns. Using a rolling pin, roll the dough into an elongated pizza, 11 by 8 inches and about 1/4 inch thick. Do this in stages, occasionally turning the dough over and rolling it out further, lightly flouring your work surface and the rolling pin each time. Place the dough on the pizza peel. Spread half of the sour cream topping across, leaving a 1/2-inch border. Cover with half of the apple slices, top with half of the fennel slices, and sprinkle with half of the prosciutto. Brush the border with oil.', u'5 Slide the dough onto the baking stone and bake until the fennel just starts to brown at the edges and the rim turns golden brown and starts to crisp \u2014 it should yield when pressed with a finger \u2014 about 15 minutes. Use a large spatula to lift the edges of the pizza so you can slide the peel underneath; carefully transfer the pizza to a wooden board. Sprinkle with half of the reserved green onions and 1/4 teaspoon of the pepper. Cut with a sharp knife and serve at once. Repeat with the second pizza.'], 'chef': u'Maria Speck', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/spelt-crust-pizza-with-fennel-prosciutto-and-apples-366669', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 2 pizzas, to serve 4 to 6 as a main course, or 8 as a starter', 'recipe title': u'Spelt Crust Pizza with Fennel, Prosciutto, and Apples', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'With apple cider, Aleppo pepper, and fresh thyme, this pretty dish offers a lighter take on your usual Thanksgiving sweet potato casserole.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 cups apple cider', u'1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter', u'2 tablespoons thyme leaves', u'1 tablespoon plus 2 teaspoons Aleppo pepper', u'4 teaspoons kosher salt, divided', u'6 1/2 pounds sweet potatoes (about 8 medium), peeled, sliced into 1/8"-thick rounds ', u'2 pounds parsnips (about 3 extra-large), peeled, sliced into 1/8"-thick rounds', u'A 4-quart casserole dish or braiser, preferably round '], 'preperation steps': [u'Position rack in middle of oven and preheat to 325\xb0F. Bring cider to a boil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low, add butter, thyme, Aleppo, and 2 tsp. salt, and cook, stirring, until butter is melted. Let cool slightly.', u'Place potatoes and parsnips in a large bowl. Pour cider mixture over and toss to coat. Stack a handful of slices about 3" high, then place vertically in casserole dish. Using a measuring cup or small bowl, keep slices standing up as you go, working around the perimeter and then into the center, forming concentric circles. Continue arranging slices in pan until tightly packed (you may have some leftover). Pour in cider mixture to come halfway up sides of dish; discard remaining cider mixture. Sprinkle with remaining 2 tsp. salt and cover tightly with foil.', u'Bake, covered, 1 hour. Remove foil and brush pan juices over tops of slices with a pastry brush. Increase oven temperature to 425\xb0F and bake, uncovered, until golden brown on top, 35\u201340 minutes more.', u'After first round of baking at 325\xb0F, let cool, then chill for up to 2 days. Bring to room temperature, then bake, uncovered, at 425\xb0F for 40\u201350 minutes.'], 'chef': u'a Stockwell', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/spiced-sweet-potato-and-parsnip-tian', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'8\u201310 servings', 'recipe title': u'Spiced Sweet Potato and Parsnip Tian', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Spicy adobo and cheese are cooled by tomato and cabbage on this eat-anytime breakfast. \u2014Goldman', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per sandwich: 525 calories, 24 g fat, 5 g saturated fat, 47 g carbohydrate, 6 g fiber, 35 g protein\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Self', 'recommendation': u'50%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 tablespoons olive oil, divided', u'4 eggs', u'8 teaspoons Tabasco, divided', u'4 slices reduced-fat pepper jack cheese with habaneros', u'8 slices turkey bacon', u'4 tablespoons lowfat mayonnaise', u'2 tablespoons adobo sauce', u'8 slices whole-grain toast', u'2 medium vine-ripened tomatoes, thinly sliced', u'2 cups shredded Napa cabbage, divided'], 'preperation steps': [u'In a medium pan over high heat, heat 1 tablespoon oil.
