{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'The lively dressing lends a little zip to this fresh-tasting, colorful salad.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: calories, 94; total fat, 7 g; saturated fat, 1 g; cholesterol, 0 mg\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Bon App\xe9tit', 'recommendation': u'79%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 medium beets, trimmed', u'3 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 teaspoons reduced-sodium soy sauce', u'2 teaspoons minced peeled fresh ginger', u'1/2 medium red onion, thinly sliced', u'8 cups fresh spinach leaves (about 8 ounces), trimmed'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 450\xb0F. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Steamed raisin pudding, or spotted dick, as it's also called, is a traditional English dessert cake that is steamed instead of baked. It can be portioned into 8 ramekins or steamed in a large bowl and turned out as a whole cake. If you're using the ramekins, rather than spooning in the batter, you may want to transfer it to a large pastry bag and pipe it in\u2014this will keep things neat and produce evenly proportioned cakes.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'9 tablespoons (1 stick plus 1 tablespoon) unsalted butter', u'1 1/4 cups plus 2 tablespoons sugar', u'4 large eggs', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'2 3/4 cups self-rising flour', u'2 cups plus 11 tablespoons whole milk', u'1 cup golden raisins', u"1/4 cup custard powder, such as Bird's brand*", u'Special equipment: large ceramic heatproof bowl or 8 (8-ounce) ramekins, parchment paper', u"*Available [online](http://www.google.com/products?source=ig=en==bird's+custard+powder=1=UTF-8=X=productresultgroup=1=title http://www.google.com/products?source=ig&hl=en&rlz=&q=bird's+custard+powder&um=1&ie=UTF-8&sa=X&oi=product_result_group&resnum=1&ct=title ) and from suppliers of British products."], 'preperation steps': [u'Butter bowl or ramekins, then dust with flour, knocking out excess. On parchment paper, trace circle slightly larger than diameter of bowl (or 8 circles slightly larger than ramekins). Cut out.', u'Fill large, shallow, wide saucepan with 1 inch water. Add flat steamer or equally sized cookie cutters to create steaming platform just above water level.', u'In bowl of stand mixer fitted with paddle attachment, beat together butter and 1 1/4 cups sugar until pale and fluffy, 4 to 5 minutes. Add eggs 1 at a time, beating well after each addition and scraping down sides of bowl periodically. Beat in vanilla.', u'Sift flour into medium bowl. Gradually beat flour into egg mixture just until combined. Add 3 tablespoons milk and beat until smooth, about 30 seconds. Add raisins and beat just until combined.', u'Transfer batter to prepared bowl or ramekins, smoothing top. Top bowl or ramekins with parchment paper circle(s), gently pressing on paper to make contact with batter.', u'Over moderately high heat, bring water in steamer to simmer. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'"These ribs just might be the best thing I\'ve ever come up with," said food editor Ian Knauer proudly. It\'s no idle boast. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Twelve years ago, I made a simple bowl of "strawberries pazzo"\u2014pazzo means "crazy" in Italian \u2014 for my friend Ann Spivack (this book\'s co-writer). The combination of strawberries, balsamic vinegar, and black pepper has been part of my repertoire for decades. Ann thanked me by baking me this pazzo cake.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 3/4 cups Cr\xe8me Fra\xeeche', u'1 tablespoon minced fresh rosemary leaves (or minced fresh basil leaves)', u'6 tablespoons unsalted butter, at room temperature, plus more to grease the pan', u'1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour', u'1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder', u'1/2 teaspoon coarse sea salt, preferably gray salt', u'1/2 cup granulated sugar', u'1/4 cup packed dark brown sugar', u'1 egg', u'1/2 cup whole milk', u'1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract', u'1 pound fresh strawberries, hulled and halved', u'4 tablespoons balsamic vinegar', u'1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon granulated sugar', u'A few grinds of fresh black pepper', u"Confectioners' sugar for dusting, optional", u'1 cup Roasted Strawberries with syrup , optional'], 'preperation steps': [u'For the Cr\xe8me Fra\xeeche: Stir together the cr\xe8me fra\xeeche and the herbs. Refrigerate and let sit for 30 minutes or overnight.', u"For the Cake: Butter a 9-inch cast-iron skillet or 8-by-8-inch enameled cast-iron baking pan (if cooking in the grill) or standard 8-by-8-inch baking pan (if baking in your oven). (Don't put a standard baking pan inside your grill or over a fire.) Ignite the coals, turn a gas grill to high, or preheat an oven to 350\xb0F.", u'Whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt. Set aside. In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment or with an electric mixer, cream the butter and sugars on medium speed until the mixture looks creamy, about 3 minutes. Slowly add the egg, milk, and vanilla and mix just until combined. Gradually add the flour mixture, mixing just until smooth with a creamy texture.', u"Pour the batter into the buttered pan. Arrange the strawberry halves, cut-side down, on top of the cake batter. Don't overlap the berries; use just enough strawberries for one layer and set aside the rest to use as garnish.", u"TO BAKE IN A GRILL: When the grill reaches 350\xb0F, slide in the cake, resting the pan on the grill rack, close the grill's lid and let it bake for at least 20 minutes with the grill lid closed. Test the cake: It's done when a skewer inserted into the center (but not in a strawberry) comes out clean and the cake is golden brown on top.", u'TO BAKE IN AN OVEN: Bake for 10 minutes and then decrease the heat to 325\xb0F and bake for an additional 45 to 50 minutes. The cake is done when a skewer inserted into the center (but not in a strawberry) comes out clean and the cake is golden brown on top.', u'For the Glaze: While the cake is baking, in a small pan combine the balsamic vinegar, sugar, and black pepper. Bring to a boil over high heat and remove from the heat right away. Set it aside until the cake has baked. It should be the consistency of maple syrup; if it thickens too much before the cake comes out of the oven, stir in a few more spoonfuls of vinegar. As soon as the cake comes off the heat, drizzle the top with about three-fourths of the balsamic glaze.', u"When the cake has cooled, cut it into wedges if baked in a skillet; if baked in a standard baking pan, cut it into squares. To garnish simply, top with a light dusting of confectioners' sugar. To dress up the cake, spoon several tablespoons of the Roasted Strawberries onto one side of each plate; on the other side of the plate drizzle a small pool of the balsamic glaze, and smear it lightly with the back of a spoon. Drizzle more balsamic glaze over the cake if you like. Set a cake slice on top the strawberry syrup, and top the cake with a spoonful of Herbed Cr\xe8me Fra\xeeche. Spoon any remaining cr\xe8me fra\xeeche into a bowl and set on a platter with leftover halved strawberries to pass so guests can add extra if they like."], 'chef': u'Michael Chiarello with Ann Krueger Spivack and Claudia Sansone', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/strawberry-pazzo-cake-with-herbed-creme-fraiche-51177400', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 8 ', 'recipe title': u'Strawberry Pazzo Cake with Herbed Cr\xe8me Fra\xeeche', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'The meat for these \u201cshepherd\u2019s\u201d tacos is commonly seen roasting on vertical spits displayed with pride on street stands throughout Mexico. The spits are usually topped with a pineapple, which is thinly sliced and served in the tacos. This method of cooking meat is identical to that used for the spit-roasted lamb (shawarma) brought to Puebla, Mexico, by Lebanese immigrants in the 1930s. The technique was copied by the Mexican taqueros (taco masters), who substituted pork for lamb. The original stand for tacos al pastor still exists in Puebla, with vertical spits of pork still revolving in front of its huge wood-burning hearth. This recipe makes two dozen tacos to serve 8 persons with big appetites, or more as part of a taco party platter. Note that the pork must marinate overnight before cooking.', 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: 500.0 calories, 170.0 calories from fat, 18.0g total fat, 7.0g saturated fat, 145.0mg cholesterol, 1710.0mg sodium, 28.0g total carbs, 3.0g dietary fiber, 19.0g sugars, 54.0g protein\n\nNutritional analysis provided by TasteBook, using the USDA Nutrition Database', 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'40 dried guajillo chiles', u'20 dried ancho chiles', u'20 dried pasilla negro chiles', u'2\xa01/2 cups fresh orange juice', u'Grated zest of 1 orange', u'1/3 cup firmly packed dark brown sugar', u'9 cloves garlic', u'1\xa01/2 tablespoons cumin seed, toasted and ground (page 164)', u'1\xa01/2 tablespoons dried Mexican oregano, toasted and ground (page 161)', u'1\xa01/2 tablespoons kosher salt', u'1 tablespoon black pepper', u'1\xa01/2 tablespoons distilled vinegar', u'1 tablespoon fresh lime juice', u'6 ounces cola', u'8 ounces Mexican beer', u'4 pounds pork shoulder, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'24 (5\xa01/2-inch) soft white corn tortillas (page 13), for serving', u'Garnish: Caramelized diced pineapple'], 'preperation steps': [u'Stem, seed, and rehydrate the dried chiles (page 153). Drain and set aside, reserving the soaking liquid.', u'In a small saucepan, simmer the orange juice over medium-low heat until reduced by half; set aside. In the jar of a blender, puree the rehydrated chiles until smooth, adding some of the soaking water, if needed, to achieve a smooth consistency.', u'In a large bowl, add the reduced orange juice, pureed chiles, orange zest, brown sugar, garlic, cumin, oregano, salt, black pepper, vinegar, lime juice, cola, and beer and stir to mix well. Add the pork, cover, and marinate in the refrigerator overnight.', u'When ready to cook, remove the pork from the marinade and drain well. In a large, heavy skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Saut\xe9 the pork pieces until the meat is cooked through, about 7 minutes. Remove from the heat and serve right away or keep warm in the pan until ready to serve.', u'To serve, lay the tortillas side by side, open face and overlapping on a platter. Divide the filling equally between the tortillas and top with pineapple and salsa. Grab, fold, and eat right away. Or build your own taco: lay a tortilla, open face, in one hand. Spoon on some filling, top with pineapple and salsa, fold, and eat right away.'], 'chef': u'Mark Miller with Benjamin Hargett and Jane Horn', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/tacos-al-pastor-363454', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'makes 24 tacos', 'recipe title': u'Tacos Al Pastor', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Serving Size: 8', 'rating': None, 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': None, 'ingredient list': [u'5 pounds Beef Belly , or prepared cured wagyu beef belly Foodshedexchange.com', u'1.5 oz Aleppo Chile salt, foodshedexchange.com, or kosher salt', u'2 cups Polenta , preferably, Grist and Toll', u'2 ears fresh Yellow corn', u'3 tablespoons Wagyu Golden Culinary Oil, foodshedexchange.com, or grass fed butter', u'85 grams fresh Italian parsley , picked and washed', u'25 grams fresh cilantro , picked and washed', u'25 grams fresh oregano , picked and washed', u'4 cloves garlic', u'1.5 teaspoons aleppo chili flakes, Or Aleppo chile salt', u'1.5 cups distilled vinegar', u'3/4 cup Walnut oil', u'100 grams walnuts, toasted and chopped', u'8 each Sweet water prawn , or Jumbo shrimp'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Three days before preparation of meal: Rise beef Belly throughly, and pat dry with paper towels. If you are using the cured and prepared Wagyu Beef Belly from Foodshedexchange.com omit this step and continue to step 2.', u'2. On third day preheat oven at 350 degrees fahrenheit. Plate up: a shallow bowl/plate is best for this dish. Place hot grits on the bottom of the bowl. Top with thin slices of the cured Wagyu beef Belly and grilled Prawns. Enjoy'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/tierra-y-mar-56389350', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': None, 'recipe title': u'Tierra y Mar', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

Finely grind cookies in processor. Press crumbs (about 1 1/2 cups) over bottom (not sides) of 9-inch-diameter springform pan with 2 1/2-inch-high sides (layer will be thin). Bake until crust is crisp, about 10 minutes. Cool on rack while preparing filling. Maintain oven temperature.', u'Using electric mixer, beat first 3 ingredients in large bowl until smooth. Scrape in seeds from vanilla bean. Beat in eggs, 1 at a time, just until blended. Pour filling over crust in pan (mixture will not fill pan). Bake cake until filling is just set and puffed around edges, about 45 minutes (cake may crack).', u'Whisk first 3 ingredients in small bowl to blend; spread over top of hot cake. Return cake to oven and bake 5 minutes. Run small knife between top edge of cake and pan. Chill cake uncovered overnight. (Can be made 2 days ahead. Cover; keep chilled.)', u'Release pan sides. Sprinkle toasted coconut chips around top edge of cake. Serve cake with tropical fruits.', u'*Fromage blanc is sold at cheese stores, specialty foods stores, and some supermarkets.', u'**Fresh ricotta cheese is sold at Italian markets and some supermarkets.', u'***Unsweetened coconut chips are available at natural foods stores and some supermarkets.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/tropical-cheesecake-with-coconut-shortbread-crust-109277', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 12 servings', 'recipe title': u'Tropical Cheesecake with Coconut Shortbread Crust', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"You'll need metal turkey-lacing pins (sold at supermarkets) to secure the roulade. Because they grow up to be portobellos, crimini are sometimes labled baby bellas. They are often sold in 6-to 8-ounce containers.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'90%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 cup water', u'3/4 ounce (about 3/4 cup) dried porcini mushrooms', u'4 ounces thinly sliced pancetta (Italian bacon), coarsely chopped', u'4 tablespoons vegetable oil, divided', u'6 ounces fresh crimini mushrooms, coarsely chopped', u'1/2 cup finely chopped onion', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh Italian parsley', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh rosemary', u'1/2 teaspoon fennel seeds, crushed', u'2 cups fresh breadcrumbs made from crustless French bread', u'1 2 3/4-pound turkey breast half with skin, boned but skin left intact, double butterflied', u'2 cups (about) low-salt chicken broth', u'4 tablespoons (about) unsalted butter, room temperature, divided', u'2 tablespoons all purpose flour', u'1/4 cup dry white wine'], 'preperation steps': [u'Bring 1 cup water and dried mushrooms to boil in heavy small saucepan. Remove from heat. Let stand until soft, about 30 minutes. Drain, reserving soaking liquid. Chop mushrooms.', u'Saut\xe9 pancetta in heavy large skillet over medium heat until crisp, about 10 minutes. Using slotted spoon, transfer pancetta to paper towel to drain. Add 2 tablespoons oil to drippings in skillet. Add crimini mushrooms and onion. Saut\xe9 until mushrooms begin to brown and no liquid remains, about 8 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in pancetta and chopped porcini, then parsley, rosemary, and fennel seeds. Mix in breadcrumbs; season stuffing to taste with salt and pepper. Mix in enough reserved mushroom-soaking liquid by tablespoonfuls to moisten (about 3). Cool stuffing completely.', u'Cover opened turkey breast with waxed paper. Using rolling pin, pound to 1/2-inch-thick rectangle (about 14x10 inches). Remove waxed paper. Sprinkle turkey with salt and pepper. Spread stuffing over, leaving 1-inch plain border. Sprinkle with additional mushroom-soaking liquid if dry. Starting at 1 long side, roll up turkey jelly-roll style. Secure with metal turkey-lacing pins. Tie roll crosswise with kitchen string every 1 1/2 to 2 inches to hold shape. Tie roll once lengthwise to secure ends. Remove metal pins. (Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and chill.)', u'Preheat oven to 375\xb0F. Heat remaining 2 tablespoons oil in heavy large ovenproof skillet or heavy roasting pan over medium-high heat. Brown turkey roll on all sides, turning often, about 12 minutes. Pour 1/3 cup broth over. Brush with 1 teaspoon butter. Cover skillet with foil. Roast turkey 30 minutes, basting 2 more times with 1/3 cup broth and brushing with 1 teaspoon butter. Remove foil. Roast until turkey is brown and thermometer inserted into center registers 170\xb0F, basting with broth and brushing with more butter occasionally, about 15 minutes longer. Transfer turkey to platter; tent loosely with foil. Reserve skillet or pan.', u'Strain pan juices into 2-cup glass measuring cup. Add more broth, if necessary, to measure 1 1/4 cups liquid. Blend 2 tablespoons butter and flour in small bowl. Place roasting skillet or pan over medium-high heat. Add 11/4 cups pan-juice mixture, wine, and remaining mushroom-soaking liquid, leaving any sediment in bowl. Simmer 5 minutes, scraping up any browned bits. Gradually whisk in flour paste. Simmer until gravy thickens, whisking constantly, about 3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.', u'Remove strings from turkey. Cut roast crosswise into 1/2-inch-thick slices and serve with gravy.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/turkey-breast-roulade-with-crimini-porcini-and-pancetta-231089', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': None, 'recipe title': u'Turkey Breast Roulade with Crimini, Porcini, and Pancetta', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Jazz up the vanilla ice cream in your freezer with this rich, delicious \u2014 and easy-to-make \u2014 sauce. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"When coming up with a vinegar sauce for Fette Sau, I didn't want something that was too obviously connected to any specific regional barbecue. (North Carolina 'cue employs a sauce that's either vinegar and spices, in the eastern part of the state, or the same with the addition of tomato, in the west; South Carolina adds mustard to its vinegar sauce.) And I wanted a vinegar sauce that would work equally well with all kinds of smoked meat\u2014not just the pork it's usually paired with. This sauce will add brightness to pulled pork, and it has enough depth to stand up to beef and lamb.", 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 cups cider vinegar', u'1/2 cup Worcestershire sauce', u'2 tablespoons dark brown sugar', u'1 tablespoon hard cider', u'1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt', u"1 1/2 teaspoons Colman's mustard powder", u'1/8 teaspoon cayenne pepper', u'1/8 teaspoon garlic powder', u'1/8 teaspoon granulated onion'], 'preperation steps': [u'In a large nonreactive saucepan, combine all the ingredients and bring to a boil, then turn off the heat and let cool to room temperature.', u'Transfer the sauce to a container, cover, and refrigerate until ready to use.', u'The sauce can be made and chilled for up to 1 week.'], 'chef': u' Carroll and Nick Fauchald', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/vinegar-sauce-56389837', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes about 2 1/2 cups', 'recipe title': u'Vinegar Sauce', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'The size of tapioca pearls varies widely. What one brand calls "small," another brand might term "large," so don\'t pay much attention to the label. Instead, look for pearls that are 1/8 to 3/16 inch in diameter for making this dessert.', 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Each serving contains about 248 calories and 2 grams fat.\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Gourmet', 'recommendation': u'40%', 'ingredient list': [u'8 1/3 cups water', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 cup plus 3 tablespoons sugar', u'2/3 cup pearl tapioca (about 1/8 inch; not quick-cooking)', u'1/2 pound rhubarb stalks, thinly sliced', u'1/8 teaspoon black pepper', u'1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice', u'1/4 cup half-and-half', u'1/8 teaspoon vanilla'], 'preperation steps': [u'Bring 8 cups water, salt, and 3 tablespoons sugar to a boil in a 3- to 4-quart heavy saucepan, then add tapioca in a stream, stirring constantly. Reduce heat and briskly simmer, uncovered, stirring occasionally, until tapioca is almost completely translucent, 35 to 50 minutes, depending on size of tapioca.', u'While tapioca is cooking, simmer 1 1/4 cups rhubarb, 1/3 cup sugar, pepper, a pinch of salt, and remaining 1/3 cup water in a 2-quart heavy saucepan, uncovered, stirring occasionally, until rhubarb is just tender, about 8 minutes. Pur\xe9e in a food processor until smooth (use caution when blending hot liquids), then reserve 1/4 cup (to add to tapioca) and return remainder to saucepan. Stir in raw rhubarb and simmer, stirring occasionally, until tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in lemon juice, then transfer to a shallow bowl.', u'Drain tapioca in a sieve and transfer to cleaned 2-quart heavy saucepan. Stir in half-and-half, remaining 2 tablespoons sugar, vanilla, and reserved rhubarb pur\xe9e and bring to a simmer, stirring occasionally until sugar is dissolved. Cool slightly, then divide among 4 dessert bowls and top with rhubarb.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/warm-tapioca-with-rhubarb-108132', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 servings', 'recipe title': u'Warm Tapioca with Rhubarb', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'To show off the layers, use a 12-cup trifle dish, a footed glass bowl measuring about 8 inches across and 5 inches deep.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'76%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 750-ml bottle dry white wine', u'2 cups pear juice or pear nectar', u'1 1/4 cups sugar', u'12 whole green cardamom pods, crushed in resealable plastic bag with mallet', u'4 1-inch-diameter rounds peeled fresh ginger (each about 1/8 inch thick)', u'2 cinnamon sticks, broken in half', u'5 large firm but ripe Anjou pears (3 to 31/4 pounds), peeled', u'7 ounces high-quality white chocolate (such as Lindt or Perugina), finely chopped', u'1/3 cup poire Williams (clear pear brandy)', u'1/4 cup water', u'1/2 vanilla bean, split lengthwise', u'1 8- to 8.8-ounce container mascarpone cheese*', u'1 cup chilled heavy whipping cream', u'3 3-ounce packages soft ladyfingers,** separated', u'2 cups chilled heavy whipping cream', u'1/4 cup minced crystallized ginger', u'White chocolate curls', u'1 tablespoon powdered sugar'], 'preperation steps': [u'Combine first 6 ingredients in large saucepan. Stir over medium-high heat until sugar dissolves. Add pears and bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium, cover, and simmer until pears are just tender when pierced with knife, about 35 minutes. Transfer liquid with pears to large bowl and refrigerate until cold, about 3 hours.', u'Using slotted spoon, transfer pears to plate. Boil poaching liquid in heavy large saucepan over medium-high heat until slightly thickened and reduced to generous 1 1/2 cups, about 15 minutes. Strain into 2-cup measuring cup; discard spices in strainer. Cool. Cover and chill pears and pear syrup until cold.', u'Combine white chocolate, pear brandy, and 1/4 cup water in top of double boiler set over simmering water. Stir until smooth (mixture will be very liquidy). Scrape in seeds from vanilla bean; discard bean. Transfer white chocolate mixture to large bowl; gradually add mascarpone, whisking until mixture is smooth. Cool mascarpone mixture until barely lukewarm.', u'Using electric mixer, beat 1 cup cream in medium bowl until peaks form. Fold whipped cream into mascarpone mixture in 4 additions. Cover and chill white chocolate mousse until set, about 3 hours. DO AHEAD: Pears and mousse can be made 1 day ahead. Keep chilled.', u'Cut pears lengthwise in half and remove cores and stems; cut halves lengthwise into 1/4-inch-thick slices.', u'Arrange ladyfingers, rounded sides down, in single layer in bottom of 12-cup trifle dish (about 8 inches in diameter and 5 inches deep), covering bottom completely (using about 15 ladyfingers). Drizzle 5 tablespoons pear syrup evenly over ladyfingers. Using small offset spatula, spread 1/3 of white chocolate mousse over ladyfingers, making layer slightly thicker around outer edges of dish to allow mousse to be more visible (center of mousse layer will be thin). Starting at outer edges of dish, place pear slices in single layer with curved edges against sides of dish atop mousse, covering completely. Repeat layering of ladyfingers, syrup, mousse, and pears 2 more times. Cover with fourth layer of ladyfingers (some ladyfingers and pear slices may be left over). Drizzle ladyfingers evenly with 5 tablespoons syrup. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and refrigerate trifle and remaining pear syrup separately.', u'Using electric mixer, beat 2 cups whipping cream in large bowl until soft peaks form. Add 1/4 cup pear syrup and beat until stiff peaks form. Working in batches, transfer cream to large pastry bag fitted with large star tip. Pipe rosettes all over top of trifle, mounding slightly in center. Sprinkle with crystallized ginger. Garnish with chocolate curls. DO AHEAD: Can be made 6 hours ahead. Keep refrigerated.', u'Sift powdered sugar over trifle just before serving.', u'* Mascarpone is an Italian cream cheese; sold at many supermarkets and at Italian markets.', u'** Available in the bakery or bread section of some supermarkets and at specialty foods stores.'], 'chef': u'e Wilson', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/white-chocolate-tiramisu-trifle-with-spiced-pears-240701', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 10 to 12 servings', 'recipe title': u'White Chocolate Tiramisu Trifle with Spiced Pears', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Though it may seem like a counterintuitive practice, extra flipping is the secret to the golden brown crust on these chops.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Calories 220 - Fat 16 g - Fiber 0 g\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Bon App\xe9tit', 'recommendation': u'70%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'2- 1 1/2"-thick bone-in pork rib chops (8\u201310 ounces each)', u'Kosher salt, freshly ground pepper', u'8 sprigs sage', u'2 garlic cloves, peeled, smashed', u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter'], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat oil in a large skillet over mediumhigh. Season pork chops all over (including the fat cap) with salt and pepper. Cook pork chops until bottom side is golden brown, about 1 minute. Turn and cook on other side about 1 minute before turning again. Repeat this process, turning about every minute, until chops are deep golden brown and an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part registers 135\xb0, 8\u201310 minutes (cooking time will depend on thickness of chops).', u'Remove pan from heat and add sage, garlic, and butter, smashing garlic into butter. Tilt skillet and spoon foaming butter and drippings over pork chops, making sure to baste the fat cap as well as the rib. Transfer pork chops to a cutting board and let rest at least 5 minutes (pork will come to 145\xb0 as it sits).', u'Cut away bone and slice pork about 1/4" thick. Serve with any juices from the cutting board spooned over top.'], 'chef': u'son Roman', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/your-new-favorite-pork-chops-51264230', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'4 Servings', 'recipe title': u'Your New Favorite Pork Chops', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'These wafer-thin cookies may have been created with Passover in mind, but their shattering crispness and perfume of almonds and lemon make them alluring at any time of year.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1 large egg white', u'6 tablespoons potato starch', u'1/4 cup mild olive oil', u'1/2 teaspoon grated lemon zest', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon pure almond extract', u'1/3 cup sliced almonds', u'Equipment: a 17-by 11-inch nonstick bakeware liner such as a Silpat'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 375\xb0F with rack in middle. Using a spatula, drape hot cookies over a rolling pin or empty wine bottle, pressing them gently to curl.', u'Make more cookies in same manner on cooled baking sheet.'], 'chef': u'Melissa Roberts', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/almond-olive-oil-tuiles-352327', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes about 18 cookies', 'recipe title': u'Almond Olive-Oil Tuiles', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"If you aren't making the schmaltz mani\xe9 ahead of time, there's no need to form the paste into balls. Simply add the paste by teaspoonfuls to the simmering stock until the gravy has reached the desired consistency.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'84%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 1/4 to 3 1/2 pounds chicken wings or turkey wings', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'11 cups water, divided', u'1 large onion, coarsely chopped', u'1 large celery stalk, coarsely chopped', u'1 large carrot, coarsely chopped', u'2 fresh parsley sprigs', u'2 fresh thyme sprigs', u'1 small bay leaf', u'5 tablespoons all purpose flour', u'Roasting pan with pan juices reserved from turkey', u'2 cups dry white wine', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley', u'1 teaspoon chopped fresh thyme', u'1 teaspoon chopped fresh sage'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 450\xb0F. Toss wings and oil in large bowl to coat; transfer to large roasting pan. Roast 45 minutes. Turn wings over; roast until deep golden brown, about 20 minutes. Add 1 cup water to pan and continue roasting wings 10 minutes longer.', u'Transfer wings with liquid to large pot, scraping in any browned bits from roasting pan. Add remaining 10 cups water, onion, celery, carrot, and herbs to pot. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer uncovered until reduced to 5 cups stock, about 3 1/2 hours. Strain through sieve set over large glass bowl. Press on solids in sieve to release as much stock as possible. Cool 30 minutes, then refrigerate overnight. (Stock can be made 3 days ahead. Cover and keep refrigerated.)', u'Transfer fat "cap" from surface of chilled stock to small bowl. Dry fat with paper towels. Using hands, break fat into pieces. Measure 5 tablespoons fat and transfer to another bowl; add flour and stir to form smooth paste. Refrigerate schmaltz mani\xe9 until cold. Roll into 1/2-inch balls. (Can be made 2 days ahead. Cover schmaltz mani\xe9 and stock separately and refrigerate.)', u'Pour pan juices from turkey roasting pan into fat separator or large measuring cup; spoon off fat if using measuring cup. Place roasting pan over 2 burners. Add wine and boil 1 minute, scraping up browned bits. Pour wine with bits into heavy large saucepan. Pourin pan juices from fat separator, leaving fat behind, or add degreased pan juices from measuring cup. Add herbs and stock to same saucepan. Bring to boil. Whisk in schmaltz mani\xe9 balls 1 at a time (or paste by teaspoonfuls), cooking gravy briefly after each few additions to judge consistency and boiling gravy until reduced to 4 cups and thick enough to coat spoon, whisking often, about 6 minutes. Season gravy to taste with salt and pepper.', u'Serve gravy with turkey.'], 'chef': u'Alton Brown', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/altons-t-day-gravy-233170', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 cups', 'recipe title': u"Alton's T-Day Gravy", 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Lamb with anchovy herb paste is a classic Italian preparation. The anchovy doesn't come across as fishy tasting \u2014 it simply lends a savory note that blends beautifully with the meat.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'96%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 garlic cloves', u'9 flat anchovy fillets, drained and patted dry', u'1/4 cup olive oil', u'2 1/2 tablespoons chopped fresh rosemary', u'1 (6- to 7-lb) semiboneless leg of lamb (aitchbone removed), all but a thin layer of fat discarded and lamb tied', u'2 teaspoons salt', u'3/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'Special equipment: a 17- by 11-inch roasting pan (or larger) with a rack; an instant-read thermometer'], 'preperation steps': [u'Mince garlic and anchovies and mash to a paste with a large heavy knife, then stir together with oil and rosemary in a small bowl. Marinate lamb, loosely covered, at room temperature 1 hour.', u'Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 400\xb0F.', u'Sprinkle lamb all over with salt and pepper, then roast until thermometer inserted into thickest part of lamb (almost to the bone but not touching it) registers 125\xb0F for medium-rare, 1 1/2 to 1 3/4 hours (temperatures in thinner parts of leg may register up to 160\xb0F). Let stand 30 minutes before slicing.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/anchovy-and-rosemary-roasted-lamb-231791', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Anchovy and Rosemary Roasted Lamb', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 25 min Start to finish: 3 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'86%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 cups egg whites (11 to 12 large eggs)', u'1 1/2 cups (150 g) sifted confectioners sugar (sift before measuring)', u'1 cup (100 g) sifted cake flour (not self-rising; sift before measuring)', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 1/2 teaspoons cream of tartar', u'1 cup (200 g) granulated sugar', u'1 teaspoon vanilla', u'Special equipment: a 10-inch tube pan (about 4 inches deep) with a removable bottom'], 'preperation steps': [u"Let egg whites stand in bowl of a standing electric mixer (see cooks' note) at room temperature about 1 hour before making cake. (They should be about 60\xb0F, slightly below room temperature.)", u'Set oven rack in lower third of oven and preheat oven to 350\xb0F.', u'Sift together confectioners sugar, flour, and salt onto a sheet of wax paper using a triple sifter or fine sieve.', u'Beat whites in mixer until frothy. Add cream of tartar and beat at medium speed until they form soft peaks. Add granulated sugar gradually, beating, and continue beating just until whites are thickened and form soft, droopy peaks. Beat in vanilla.', u'Sprinkle one fourth of sifted dry ingredients over whites and fold in with a rubber spatula gently but thoroughly. Fold in remaining dry ingredients, one third at a time.', u'Gently pour batter evenly into ungreased tube pan and bake until top is light golden, cake retracts a bit from pan and springs back when touched lightly, and a tester comes out clean, 40 to 45 minutes. Invert pan onto neck of an empty wine bottle or a large metal funnel and cool cake completely.', u'To remove cake from pan, run tip of a long, narrow knife between outer edge of cake and pan. Tilt cake pan on its side and gently tap bottom edge against counter. Rotate pan, tapping and turning a few more times, until cake appears free. Cover pan with a metal rack or cardboard round and invert, tapping pan firmly to loosen cake. Lift pan from cake. (It should come out beautifully, like a pillow taken out of a slipcover.)', u'Slice cake with a serrated knife, using a sawing motion.'], 'chef': u'pted (including comments) from "The Baker\'s Dozen Cookbook"', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/angel-food-cake-105741', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 to 10 servings', 'recipe title': u'Angel Food Cake', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'We like to bake with a combination of apples: some sweet and some tart, some that keep their shape and others that will break down and get saucy. Adding the pear lends a perfumey quality to the cake.', 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 cup oats', u'3/4 cup white rice flour', u'1 cup brown sugar, well packed', u'1 cup chopped nuts (optional)', u'1/2 cup melted unsalted butter', u'Pinch of ground cinnamon', u'1 pound (grapefruit-size portion) Apple Cider Brioche', u'Unsalted butter, for greasing the pan', u'2 small apples (1 tart and 1 sweet), thinly sliced', u'1 pear, thinly sliced', u'3 tablespoons brown sugar', u'Grated zest of half an orange', u'1 1/2 cups streusel topping (above)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Combine all streusel ingredients in a bowl and mix until the butter is incorporated. Do not overmix\u2013you want a crumbly texture. Set aside.', u'Grease an 8- inch round spring-form pan with butter. Set aside.', u'Toss the apples, pear, brown sugar, and zest together in a small bowl and set aside.', u'Dust the surface of the refrigerated dough with flour and cut off a 1-pound (grapefruit-size) piece. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Food editor Maggie Ruggiero learned this method of cooking artichokes from a close friend of hers, Betty Alfenito, "prop stylist and cook extraordinaire." We love the wonderful pan sauce it yields, as well as the way it infuses the artichokes with a subtle hint of garlic.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'78%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 medium artichokes (1/2 lb each)', u'18 fresh flat-leaf parsley sprigs', u'1/4 cup olive oil', u'8 fresh thyme sprigs', u'1 head of garlic, cloves separated and left unpeeled', u'1 cup water', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil', u'Special equipment: a 6- to 8-qt heavy pot wide enough to hold artichokes in a single layer (about 11 inches in diameter)', u'Accompaniment: crusty bread'], 'preperation steps': [u'Working with 1 artichoke at a time, cut off top inch of artichoke and gently pull open center. Put artichoke in a large bowl of cold water. Repeat with remaining artichokes.', u'Remove artichokes from water and push 3 parsley sprigs into center of each. Heat 1/4 cup olive oil in pot over moderate heat until hot but not smoking, then add artichokes, thyme sprigs, garlic, 1/4 cup water, pepper, and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Cover pot and braise artichokes, turning occasionally, until artichokes are browned in spots and bases are tender when pierced with a knife, about 35 minutes.', u'Transfer artichokes, thyme, and garlic to a platter. Add remaining 3/4 cup water to pot and deglaze by boiling over high heat, stirring and scraping up brown bits, 1 minute. Pour pan juices (they will be dark) into a small bowl and stir in extra-virgin olive oil and remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt. Garlic cloves can be peeled and spread on crusty bread.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/artichokes-braised-with-garlic-and-thyme-231804', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Artichokes Braised with Garlic and Thyme', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'To check if your meringue is stiff, lift the beaters out of the bowl and upend them: The peaks should stick straight up.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 large eggs', u'2/3 cup sugar', u'1/4 cup cornstarch', u'4 cups whole milk', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'Pinch of kosher salt', u'1 11-ounce box vanilla wafer cookies', u'3 ripe bananas, thinly sliced', u'4 large egg whites', u'1/2 cup sugar'], 'preperation steps': [u'Lightly whisk eggs in a large bowl just to blend. Whisk sugar and cornstarch in a medium saucepan. Gradually whisk milk into sugar mixture and heat over medium heat, whisking often, until very warm to the touch. Gradually whisk half of hot milk mixture into eggs, then whisk egg mixture back into milk mixture in saucepan.', u'Cook, whisking constantly, until thickened and whisk leaves a trail in pudding (it should be the consistency of mayonnaise), about 4 minutes. Remove from heat, add butter, vanilla, and salt and whisk until butter is melted and mixture is smooth.', u'Strain pudding through a fine-mesh sieve into another large bowl. Cover pudding with plastic wrap, pressing directly onto the surface. Chill until cool, about 2 hours.', u'Spread one-third of pudding evenly in a 2-qt. baking dish. Top with half of cookies and half of bananas. Repeat layers one more time and top with remaining third of pudding. Cover and chill at least 4 hours.', u'Just before serving, heat broiler. Using an electric mixer on medium speed, beat egg whites until foamy. With motor running, gradually add sugar. Increase speed to medium-high and beat until stiff peaks form.', u'Spoon meringue over pudding and swirl decoratively. Broil until meringue is dark brown in spots, about 1 minute.', u'Do ahead: Pudding (without meringue) can be assembled 2 days ahead. Keep chilled'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/banana-meringue-pudding-51235890', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Banana Meringue Pudding', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Pasties are savory turnovers. They originated in Cornwall, England, in the 1700s. During that era, tin miners took the portable pies into the mines for lunch.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'78%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 cups unbleached all purpose flour', u'1 cup white whole wheat flour or whole wheat flour', u'1 1/8 teaspoons salt', u'1/2 cup solid vegetable shortening (preferably nonhydrogenated), frozen', u'1/2 cup (1 stick) chilled unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u'7 tablespoons (or more) ice water', u'4 teaspoons olive oil', u'2 large onions, thinly sliced', u'1/2 cup dry white wine', u'1/2 teaspoon dried thyme', u'10 ounces skirt steak, cut crosswise on diagonal into 1/4-inch-wide strips', u'1 teaspoon coarse kosher salt, divided', u'6 ounces coarsely crumbled Stilton blue cheese (11/3 to 11/2 cups), divided', u'1 large egg white, beaten to blend'], 'preperation steps': [u'Blend both flours and salt in processor 5 seconds. Shape each into disk; wrap and chill at least 45 minutes and up to 1 day.', u'Heat oil in heavy large skillet over medium heat. Add onions. Saut\xe9 until deep brown, reducing heat if necessary to avoid burning, about 30 minutes. Add wine and thyme. Cover and chill.', u'Position 1 rack in top third and 1 rack in bottom third of oven and preheat to 400\xb0F. Roll out each dough disk between sheets of parchment paper to 9-inch round. Peel top parchment off each. Spread 1/4 of onion mixture on half of each round, leaving 1-inch plain border. Top onions with beef strips. Sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon coarse salt over beef on each, then top each with 1/4 of cheese. Sprinkle with pepper. Brush dough border with some egg white. Using bottom parchment as aid, fold plain dough half over filling. Seal edges. Fold sealed edge over again; press with fork to double-seal.', u'Brush each pasty with egg white. Cut 3 slits in each top crust. Divide pasties (still on parchment) between 2 large rimmed baking sheets.', u'Bake pasties until crust is golden brown and filling is cooked through, about 30 minutes. Cool 10 minutes; serve.'], 'chef': u'Jeanne Thiel Kelley', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/beef-pasties-with-caramelized-onions-and-stilton-cheese-351530', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 ', 'recipe title': u'Beef Pasties with Caramelized Onions and Stilton Cheese', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Colombia may be the best kept barbecue secret in South America. Sure, Argentina gets the attention for its cowboy-style asado. And Brazil has enjoyed spectacular success exporting its rodizio-style restaurants\u2014the kind where the waiters parade spits of grilled meats through the dining room. But Colombia? I doubt that most North Americans could name a single Colombian grilled dish. Well, it's time to shine the spotlight on the only country in South America to have coasts on both the Atlantic and the Pacific, whose cool-weather ranching district produces well-marbled, full-flavored beef, whose grill masters make extensive use of marinades (unlike the simplicity prized by their Argentine counterparts), and whose mastery of the art of grilling on charcoal extends to some unique techniques. Here's a not-so simple flank steak redolent of cumin, green onions, and beer.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'94%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 1 1/3-pound flank steaks', u'1 tablespoon dried oregano', u'2 teaspoons ground cumin', u'Coarse kosher salt', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'11/4 cups thinly sliced green onions (about 6)', u'1 12-ounce bottle dark beer', u'1/2 cup Worcestershire sauce', u'Aji Sauce', u'Colombian Guacamole'], 'preperation steps': [u'Using sharp knife, lightly score flank steaks about 1/8 inch deep on both sides in a crisscross pattern at 1/2-inch intervals. Place steaks in 13x9x2-inch glass baking dish. Sprinkle steaks on both sides with oregano and cumin and generous amount of coarse salt and freshly ground pepper. Drizzle olive oil over both sides of steaks, rubbing oil and spices into meat. Add green onions, beer, and Worcestershire sauce, turning steaks several times to coat both sides. Cover and chill at least 3 hours, turning occasionally. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Keep chilled.', u'Prepare barbecue (medium-high heat). Brush grill rack lightly with oil. Grill steaks to desired doneness, 3 to 4 minutes total per side for medium-rare, turning steaks 1/4 turn after 1 1/2 minutes to form crisscross grill marks, if desired. Transfer steaks to cutting board; let rest 5 minutes. Thinly slice steaks across grain. Transfer to platter and serve with Aji Sauce and Colombian Guacamole.'], 'chef': u'Steven Raichlen', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/beer-marinated-flank-steak-with-aji-and-guacamole-353782', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Beer-Marinated Flank Steak with Aji and Guacamole', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'The oat mixture makes a delicious crust for the bottom\u2014and a tasty crumble on top. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This version of the scone is based on the recipe from the Standard Baking Company. Molly tweaked the recipe slightly in her home kitchen. If using frozen blueberries, do not thaw them before folding into the batter.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'70%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 cups all purpose flour', u'1/3 cup (packed) golden brown sugar', u'1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon baking powder', u'1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda', u'3/4 teaspoon coarse kosher salt', u'11 tablespoons (1 stick plus 3 tablespoons) chilled unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u'1 cup plus 3 tablespoons old-fashioned oats', u'1 cup fresh or frozen blueberries (about 5 1/2 ounces)', u'1 3/4 cups chilled half and half', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'5 teaspoons raw sugar*'], 'preperation steps': [u'Position 1 rack in top third and 1 rack in bottom third of oven and preheat to 350\xb0F. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This dense quickbread is traditionally baked in empty coffee cans.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'75%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 tablespoon butter plus more for serving, room temperature', u'2 cups whole milk', u'1/2 cup mild-flavored (light) molasses', u'1/4 cup (packed) light brown sugar', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1 1/4 cups whole wheat flour', u'1 cup all-purpose flour', u'1 cup rye flour', u'1/3 cup cornmeal', u'1 tablespoons baking soda', u'1 teaspoon baking powder', u'1 cup raisins (optional)', u'Special equipment: Two empty, clean 11-13-ounce coffee cans', u'Ingredient info: Rye flour is available at natural foods stores and some supermarkets.'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"The inspiration for these handheld burritos came from those served at the Santa Fe Farmers Market, in New Mexico, where they are truly the early bird's reward\u2014feasting on a portable breakfast while scoring the pick of the produce is a magical start to the day. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'"I was 11 years old when I started receiving Gourmet magazine," says Kristi Tursi of Essex Junction, Vermont. "I am now 15, and I\u2019m happy to say that I\'ve tried at least one recipe from each issue. I love to experiment with new combinations of unusual foods. Maybe that is because I enjoy science and chemistry, or perhaps I just love eating delicious yummies! But this year, on my mom\'s birthday, I tried something cool: cherry chocolate chippers. These cookies are not as dramatic as my chicken mango tango, but they\'re quite a treat. Everyone at the party liked them so much that I spent part of the evening jotting down the recipe. So I decided to share it with everyone ... by way of Gourmet."', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'82%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u'1 teaspoon baking powder', u'1 teaspoon cinnamon', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 1/2 sticks unsalted butter, softened', u'1/2 cup granulated sugar', u'3/4 cup packed light brown sugar', u'2 large eggs', u'1 teaspoon vanilla', u'12 ounces semisweet chocolate chips', u'1 cup dried tart cherries'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 375\xb0F.', u'Whisk together flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt in a small bowl. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This is a mostly hands-off dinner that only needs a salad of assertive greens as accompaniment. The chicken gets a head start in the oven, but then finishes up by sharing its pan with the couscous. This way, the pasta laps up flavor from the meat, while getting crispy on top, and in turn, the steam coming up from the couscous keeps the chicken incredibly juicy. An intense slurry of anchovies, garlic, and lemon makes up most of the piquant dressing, with bursts of contrasting sweetness from the raisins.', 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 whole chicken, about 4 pounds', u'1 tablespoon butter, softened', u'Medium-grain kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'1 lemon', u'Approximately 2.5 cups chicken stock or water', u'4 cloves garlic, with loose paper removed but unpeeled', u'8 ounces large pearl couscous (see Note)', u"1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil (it needn't be an expensive one but should taste good)", u'2 to 4 anchovy fillets, rinsed if salt-packed', u'Generous pinch of crushed red pepper flakes', u'1 1/2 tablespoons capers, rinsed if packed in salt, drained if packed in brine', u'2 tablespoons golden raisins or dried currants', u'A couple of handfuls of flat-leaf parsley, chopped', u'Pickled caperberries, for garnish (optional)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat an oven to 400\xb0F with a baking pan on the lower middle rack.', u'Pat the chicken dry with paper towels. Rub the butter all over the chicken, making sure to give the back a good coating. Season generously with salt and pepper, inside and out. Position the wing tips behind the back and tie the legs together. Place the chicken, breast side up, on the preheated pan. Roast for 30 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, stir the juice from 1/2 lemon into the stock in a small saucepan. Heat over medium-low heat until steaming, then pop in the garlic. Pull from the heat and keep in a warm spot. (I leave it on top of the hot stove, but with the burner off.) After 30 minutes are up for the chicken, pour 1 cup of the liquid into the baking pan, holding back the garlic, and roast for 30 minutes more.', u'Cut the juiced lemon half into wedges; keep the other half for the relish.', u'Pull the baking pan from the oven. Sprinkle the couscous around the chicken. Pour the remaining liquid onto the couscous and tuck in the lemon wedges and soaked garlic. Return the baking pan to the oven and continue to roast until both the chicken and the couscous are cooked through, around 30 minutes. If the liquid is absorbed before the couscous is cooked, add more liquid, a half cup at a time, as needed.', u"Let the baking pan stand for 10 minutes while you make the relish. Squeeze the (now) roasted garlic into a small skillet. Add the oil and set the pan over medium heat. When the oil is hot, add the anchovies and red pepper flakes. Cook, stirring and breaking up the anchovies and garlic, until they've turned into a grungy paste, 2 to 3 minutes. Add the capers to the pan, and cook for 1 minute more. Stir in the juice from the second half of the lemon, along with the raisins and half of the parsley. Reduce the heat and simmer for 2 minutes, then check for seasoning. Remove the chicken to a board and carve as you'd like. Fluff the couscous with a fork, then arrange the cut chicken on top. Scatter the rest of the parsley over the whole baking pan of chicken and couscous, and serve with the relish."], 'chef': u"a O'Brady", 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/chicken-and-couscous-with-a-punchy-relish-56389470', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 4, generously ', 'recipe title': u'Chicken and Couscous with a Punchy Relish', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Serve this Basque-style dish with rice or bread to soak up all the juices.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Nutritional analysis per serving: 606 calories, 29.5 g fat (8.1 g saturated fat), 179.4 mg cholesterol, 20.0 g carbs, 5.2 g dietary fiber, 9.2 g total sugars, 15.4 g net carbs, 63.5 g protein\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Self', 'recommendation': u'95%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'3- to 3 1/2-pound chicken', u'2 large red bell peppers, cut into strips (about 4 cups)', u'2 medium onions, halved, cut lengthwise into strips (about 3 cups)', u"2 cups diced smoked ham steak (such as Nueske's; about 11 ounces)", u'1 teaspoon Piment\xf3n de La Vera (Spanish smoked paprika) or hot paprika, divided', u'1 1/2 cups low-salt chicken broth', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh Italian parsley'], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat oil in heavy wide pot over medium-high heat. Season with salt and pepper. {'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'11 ounces bittersweet chocolate, finely chopped', u'1 ounce (2 tablespoons) unsalted butter', u'6 tablespoons creamy peanut butter', u'4 large egg yolks', u'1/4 cup granulated sugar', u'1 3/4 cups heavy whipping cream', u'4 ounces bittersweet chocolate, finely chopped', u'2 1/2 ounces (5 tablespoons) unsalted butter', u'2 teaspoons light corn syrup', u'1 large egg white', u'6 tablespoons granulated sugar', u'1 1/2 cups (7 1/2 ounces) unsalted peanuts'], 'preperation steps': [u'Spray an 8 1/2-by-4 1/2-by-2 3/4-inch loaf pan with nonstick spray. Place the bowl over a pan of simmering water, making sure the bottom of the bowl does not touch the water. Heat, stirring occasionally, until the chocolate and butter melt. Remove from over the heat and whisk until smooth.', u'Combine the egg yolks and sugar in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whip attachment and whip on high speed until thick, about 1 minute. Remove the bowl from the mixer stand. Using a wooden spoon, stir in the chocolate mixture in 3 equal additions. Spread the batter in the prepared pan. Pull on a corner of the plastic wrap to release the terrine from the pan. Lift off the pan and carefully remove the plastic wrap. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and place the rack in it. Return the terrine to the refrigerator while you make the glaze.', u'In a stainless-steel bowl, combine the chocolate, butter, and corn syrup. Place the bowl over a pan of simmering water, making sure the bottom of the bowl does not touch the water, and heat, stirring occasionally, until the chocolate and butter melt. Remove from over the heat and whisk until smooth. The glaze should be pourable but not so thin that it will run off the terrine. In a bowl, whisk the egg white until frothy. Whisk in the sugar. Add the peanuts and mix until they are evenly coated with the egg white mixture.', u'Spread the peanuts in a single layer on a rimmed baking sheet and place in the oven. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Combining sweet, sour, salty, and bitter ingredients with a tangy vinaigrette,this salad almost explodes with flavor.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'92%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 tablespoons red-wine vinegar', u'1 teaspoon sugar, or to taste', u'1/2 teaspoon salt, or to taste', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 3/4 pounds clementines (7 to 11)', u'2 pounds Belgian endives (6 to 8)', u'4 pale inner ribs of celery, including leaves', u'1/2 cup Kalamata or other brine-cured black olives, pitted and cut lengthwise into slivers', u'1 cup drained cocktail (pickled) onions (5 ounces), quartered', u'3/4 cup loosely packed fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves'], 'preperation steps': [u'Whisk together vinegar, sugar, and salt in a small bowl until sugar and salt are dissolved, then add oil in a slow stream, whisking until emulsified. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'"I\'m on a mission to get people over their biscuit anxiety," says Chef Peacock. His advice? Wrap tips of rib bones with foil to prevent burning, then wrap meat below bones with overlapping bacon strips, securing them with wooden toothpicks.', u'Roast pork in middle of oven, covering stuffing loosely with foil after 30 minutes, until an instant-read thermometer registers 155\xb0F when inserted 2 inches into center of meat (do not touch bones), 2 1/4 to 2 3/4 hours total.', u'Transfer roast to a carving board and let stand, loosely covered with foil, 15 to 20 minutes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Be sure to buy the salmon with the skin on, which makes it much easier to handle as it grills. Keep in mind this is a special cut that your fish market or supermarket seafood counter may have to order. What to drink: Tom Douglas likes to pair this with a Washington State Chardonnay. Try: Columbia Crest 2002 Grand Estates Chardonnay ($11).', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'82%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 tablespoon fennel seeds', u'1/4 cup plus 2 teaspoons (packed) golden brown sugar', u'3 tablespoons Piment\xf3n de la Vera (Spanish smoked paprika)', u'1 tablespoon coarse kosher salt', u'2 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper', u'2 teaspoons dried dill weed', u'Nonstick vegetable oil spray', u'1 3 3/4- to 4-pound side of salmon with skin (preferably wild salmon)', u'Olive oil'], 'preperation steps': [u'Finely grind fennel seeds in spice mill or coffee grinder. Transfer to small bowl. Mix in next 5 ingredients.', u'Spray grill rack with nonstick spray. Prepare barbecue (medium-high heat). Brush salmon lightly on both sides with olive oil. Rub spice mixture generously over flesh side of salmon. Place salmon, skin side up, on grill rack; cover and cook until fish is slightly firmer, about 8 minutes. Slide rimless baking sheet under salmon to turn salmon over without breaking. Place another rimless baking sheet atop salmon. Using both hands, firmly hold baking sheets together and invert salmon; slide salmon, flesh side up, off baking sheet and onto grill rack. Cover and grill until just opaque in center, about 8 minutes longer. Using rimless baking sheet, remove salmon from grill. Gently slide salmon, flesh side up, onto platter and serve.'], 'chef': u'chef Tom Douglas', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/fennel-and-dill-rubbed-grilled-salmon-232377', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Fennel- and Dill-Rubbed Grilled Salmon', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Here, grapes top rounds of puff pastry (purchased, for ease), which form the crust of the two rustic tarts.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'80%', 'ingredient list': [u'11 cups red and green seedless grapes (about 4 1/2 pounds)', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'8 tablespoons all purpose flour', u'2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice', u'1 17.3-ounce package frozen puff pastry sheets (2 sheets), thawed', u'2 tablespoons (1/4 stick) unsalted butter'], 'preperation steps': [u'Puree 1 1/2 cups grapes in processor. Strain grape puree, pressing on solids to extract as much juice as possible. Pour 1/2 cup grape juice into large bowl; discard any remaining juice. Cut 4 3/4 cups grapes lengthwise in half; add all grapes to juice in bowl. Add sugar, 6 tablespoons flour, and lemon juice; toss to blend well. Let stand 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.', u'Preheat oven to 375\xb0F. Line 2 rimmed baking sheets with parchment paper. Roll out 1 pastry sheet on lightly floured surface to 11-inch square. Cut off just enough pastry from corners to form rough circle. Transfer pastry to 1 prepared baking sheet. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon flour over center of pastry, leaving 2 1/2-inch plain border. Spoon half of grape mixture, including juices, into center of pastry. Fold pastry edges up over grapes, forming 2- to 2 1/2-inch border. Dot grapes with 1 tablespoon butter. Repeat with remaining ingredients for second tart.', u'Bake tarts until crusts are golden brown and grape juices are bubbling, about 45 minutes (crust border will unfold slightly). Cool tarts to room temperature. (Can be prepared 6 hours ahead. Let stand at room temperature.)'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/fresh-grape-tarts-105706', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 12 servings', 'recipe title': u'Fresh Grape Tarts', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: 606.7 calories, 66.1 calories from fat, 7.3g total fat, 1.1g saturated fat, 0.0mg cholesterol, 502.4mg sodium, 124.4g total carbs, 2.6g dietary fiber, 32.4g sugars, 9.2g protein\n\nNutritional analysis provided by TasteBook, using the USDA Nutrition Database', 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'35 to 40 large mussels, cleaned under running water (about 3 pounds)', u'1 cup dry white wine (optional)', u'Sea salt', u'Good pinch of Aleppo or Maras pepper or hot red pepper flakes, to taste', u'1 cup plus 2 tablespoons cornstarch', u'Olive oil or olive and sunflower oil for frying', u'11/ 2 cups all-purpose flour', u'11/ 2 teaspoons baking powder', u'1 cup ouzo (see Note)', u'1/ 2 cup sparkling water, or more as needed', u'2 lemons, quartered', u"Vali's Skordalia or Roasted Garlic Skordalia"], 'preperation steps': [u'Place the mussels in a large pot over high heat and add the wine, if using. Cover and let the mussels steam for about 5 minutes, shaking the pot and stirring every now and then, until the shells open. Throw away the ones that stay closed. Shuck the mussels and discard the shells. Cover and refrigerate until needed, up to 3 hours.', u'Add salt and Aleppo pepper to the mussels, dust with about 2 tablespoons cornstarch,and toss to coat lightly. Heat about 2 inches of olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Mix the remaining 1 cup cornstarch, the flour, and the baking powder in a bowl. Add the ouzo and sparkling water, whisking to incorporate. It should be runny. If too thick, add a little more sparkling water.', u'When the oil is very hot (about 350\xb0F), dip a few mussels at a time in the batter,remove with tongs, and fry, turning them as they turn deep golden, about 1 minute total. Transfer to a plate lined with a double layer of paper towels to drain.', u'Serve with lemon quarters and skordalia.'], 'chef': u'Aglaia Kremezi', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/fried-mussels-in-ouzo-batter-355950', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'4 to 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Fried Mussels in Ouzo Batter', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: 278.9 calories, 271.5 calories from fat, 30.2 g total fat, 12.7 g saturated fat, 36.7 mg cholesterol, 51.8 mg sodium, 2.8 g total carbs, 0.0 g dietary fiber, 0.0 g sugars, 0.3 g protein\n\nNutritional analysis provided by TasteBook, using the USDA Nutrition Database', 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'8 tablespoons (120 g) unsalted butter, at room temperature, plus more for the baking dish', u'11 1/2 tablespoons (165 g) sugar, plus more for the baking dish', u'Freshly grated zest of 1 lemon', u'3 tablespoons (25 g) cornstarch', u'4 large egg yolks', u'2 cups (480 g) fromage blanc', u'6 large egg whites (at room temperature)', u'Pinch of salt'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Liberally butter a shallow 2-quart (2-L) baking dish, with sides that are at least 2 1/2 inches (8 cm) high. Sprinkle a few spoonfuls of sugar inside,tilt the dish to coat the bottom and sides, then tip out any excess.', u'2. Preheat the oven to 375\xb0F (190\xb0C).', u'3. Using a rubber spatula or an electric mixer with the paddle attachment, mash the very soft butter with the lemon zest and cornstarch until completely smooth. Beat in the egg yolks until smooth, then whisk in the fromage blanc.', u"4. With an electric mixer or by hand, whisk the egg whites with the salt in a clean, dry bowl (not plastic) until frothy. Increase the speed and beat until the whites begin to mound and hold their shape. While whipping, gradually add 10 tablespoons of the sugar, 1 tablespoon at a time. Once you've added all the sugar, beat until stiff.", u"5. Fold one-third of the beaten egg whites into the fromage blanc mixture, then fold in the remaining egg whites just until incorporated. It's okay to have some tiny bits of white; that's preferable to overfolding the batter.", u'6. Scrape the batter into the prepared baking dish, gently smooth the top, and sprinkle with the remaining 1 1/2 tablespoons of sugar.', u"7. Bake on a middle rack (or slightly higher, if possible) for 30 minutes, until the top is browned and the souffl\xe9 is just set but still very jiggly in the center if you nudge it. Depending on your oven, this may take slightly less or more time. Rather than going by strict baking times, touch the center to tell when it's done. If you like your souffl\xe9 creamy in the middle, the center should feel rather soft, like runny pudding.", u'If you like it more firm, you can bake it until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out pretty clean.'], 'chef': u'David Lebovitz', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/fromage-blanc-souffle-355924', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Fromage Blanc Souffle', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'There is no oil in this most original salad.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: calories, 132; total fat, 4 g; saturated fat, 1 g; cholesterol, 6 mg.\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Bon App\xe9tit', 'recommendation': u'94%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 11 1/2-ounce can apricot-pineapple nectar', u'1/4 cup rice vinegar', u'1/4 cup chopped dried apricots (about 1 ounce)', u'1 1/4 pounds slender green beans, trimmed', u'1 5-ounce package mixed baby greens', u'1 papaya, peeled, seeded, thinly sliced lengthwise', u'3 tablespoons chopped unsalted dry roasted pistachios', u'1 1/2 ounces ricotta salata* or feta cheese, crumbled', u'*Available at cheese shops, some Italian markets and some specialty foods stores.'], 'preperation steps': [u'Boil nectar in medium saucepan until reduced to scant * cup, about 5 minutes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This recipe yields two extra portions for second helpings. The hens are brined for at least six hours, so be sure to plan ahead. To make things easier, ask the butcher to halve the hens for you.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'86%', 'ingredient list': [u'9 cups water', u'1 cup fresh lemon juice, divided', u'1/2 cup coarse kosher salt', u'5 1 1/4- to 11/2-pound Cornish game hens, cut lengthwise in half, backbone removed', u'1/2 cup olive oil', u'2 tablespoons ground sumac*', u'4 garlic cloves, peeled', u'10 very thin lemon slices', u'Date Relish'], 'preperation steps': [u'Combine 9 cups water, 1/2 cup lemon juice, and coarse salt in large nonreactive pot. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"We've made one of America's most famous holiday desserts \u2014 pecan pie\u2014even more delicious by adding an unctuous layer of moist caramel, a touch of bittersweet chocolate (to cut the sweetness), and some finely shaved nuts on top.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'50%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 1/2 cups pecan halves (15 ounces)', u'1 cup sugar', u'1/3 cup mild honey', u'1 1/2 cups heavy cream', u'1/2 cup whole milk', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'Pastry dough', u'7 ounces fine-quality bittersweet chocolate (not unsweetened; preferably Lindt), finely chopped', u'3/4 cup heavy cream', u'Special equipment: an 11-inch fluted round tart pan (1 1/4 inches deep) with removable rim; an adjustable-blade slicer (optional)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Boil 4 cups pecans (reserve remaining 1/2 cup for garnish) with sugar, honey, cream, milk, and salt in a 4-quart heavy saucepan over moderately high heat, stirring occasionally, until liquid is golden, about 20 minutes (mixture will appear curdled at first, but then become thick and smooth). Remove from heat and transfer mixture to a shallow bowl, then cool completely, about 40 minutes.', u'Roll out larger disk of dough (keep remaining piece chilled) between 2 large sheets of parchment paper or plastic wrap (or 2 overlapping sheets for each side if necessary) into a 13-inch round (1/8 inch thick), then remove parchment from top and invert dough into tart pan set on a baking sheet, pressing onto bottom and side of pan and leaving overhang. Chill shell at least 30 minutes. Roll out remaining disk between 2 large sheets of parchment or plastic wrap into a 12-inch round (1/8 inch thick) and chill on a baking sheet at least 30 minutes.', u'Put oven rack in lower third of oven and preheat oven to 425\xb0F.', u'If nut filling is very firm, warm slightly in a saucepan over low heat until softened but not warm. Spread filling in tart shell, smoothing top. Brush overhang of bottom crust with water. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'A very pretty, fresh-tasting dessert that can be assembled a day ahead.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'96%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 cup plus 1 tablespoon sugar', u'3/4 cup fresh lemon juice', u'6 large egg yolks', u'2 large eggs', u'11/2 tablespoons grated lemon peel', u'1 12-ounce basket strawberries, hulled, halved (or quartered if large)', u'1 6-ounce basket fresh blueberries', u'1 6-ounce basket fresh raspberries', u'1 6-ounce basket fresh blackberries', u'2 cups chilled whipping cream', u'8 whole strawberries (for garnish)', u'Fresh mint sprigs'], 'preperation steps': [u'Combine 1 cup sugar, lemon juice, 6 egg yolks, 2 whole eggs and grated lemon peel in large metal bowl. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'A terrific side for roast pork loin or roast chicken. Smoky cheese and bacon are stirred into rich and creamy mashed potatoes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'We found the secret to the perfect key lime pie: a hint of fresh lemon juice.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'58%', 'ingredient list': [u'11 (2 1/4x4 3/4") graham crackers', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1 1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon', u'Pinch kosher salt', u'6 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted', u'1 (14-ounce) can sweetened condensed milk', u'4 large egg yolks', u'7 tablespoons fresh key lime juice', u'2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', u'1 cup chilled heavy cream', u'2 tablespoons powdered sugar', u'A 9" pie pan'], 'preperation steps': [u'Place rack in the center of oven and preheat to 350\xb0F.', u'Pulse graham crackers, sugar, cinnamon, and salt in a food processor until fine crumbs form. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"The original recipe for oysters Rockefeller, created at the New Orleans restaurant Antoine's in 1899, remains a secret to this day. The appetizer, oysters topped with a mixture of finely chopped greens and copious amounts of butter and then baked in their shells, was considered so rich that it had to be named after the richest man of the day, John D. Rockefeller. A few years later, no self-respecting restaurateur would be without his own version on the menu. This lighter take features spinach, watercress, green onions and grated Parmesan.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'92%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 garlic clove', u'2 cups loosely packed fresh spinach', u'1 bunch watercress, stems trimmed', u'1/2 cup chopped green onions', u'3/4 cup (11/2 sticks) unsalted butter, room temperature', u'1/2 cup dry breadcrumbs', u'2 tablespoons Pernod or other anise-flavored liqueur', u'1 teaspoon fennel seeds, ground', u'1 teaspoon hot pepper sauce', u'1 pound (about) rock salt', u'24 fresh oysters, shucked, shells reserved', u'1/4 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese'], 'preperation steps': [u'Position rack in top third of oven and preheat to 450\xb0F. Transfer mixture to medium bowl.', u'Combine butter, breadcrumbs, Pernod, fennel and hot sauce in processor. Process until well blended. Return spinach mixture to processor. Process, using on/off turns, just until mixtures are blended. Season with salt and pepper. (Can be made 8 hours ahead. {'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'73%', 'ingredient list': [u'1-pound block of extra-firm tofu', u'4 garlic cloves', u'1-inch chunk of fresh ginger', u'2 tablespoons Chinese fermented black beans', u'11/2 cups water', u'4 tablespoons soy sauce', u'3 tablespoons Sherry (dry or sweet)', u'1 tablespoon maple syrup', u'2 teaspoons cider vinegar', u'1 1/2 tablespoons cornstarch', u'vegetable oil'], 'preperation steps': [u'Rinse the tofu, then cut crosswise into 6 slices.
