Fry the slices on all sides (forgo the short ends), turning them only when the undersides are golden and crisp, 5 to 8 minutes total. (You may need to lower the heat as the frying progresses.) Give the tofu one last flip on a paper towel to sop up any stray oil and reheat the sauce.', u'Serve with rice and broccoli, pouring sauce over all.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/panfried-tofu-with-chinese-black-bean-sauce-103384', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 3 to 4', 'recipe title': u'Panfried Tofu with Chinese Black Bean Sauce', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Use a mandoline to cut the parsnips easily.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'57%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 ounces bacon slices, chopped', u'2 pounds parsnips (about 11 medium), peeled, trimmed, thinly sliced lengthwise', u'1/2 cup hazelnuts, chopped, toasted, divided', u'2 cups whipping cream', u'1 cup low-salt chicken broth', u'1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon ground black pepper', u'2 tablespoons minced fresh sage'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 400\xb0F. Saut\xe9 bacon in heavy medium skillet over medium-high heat until golden brown, about 6 minutes. Using slotted spoon, transfer bacon to large bowl. Stir in parsnips and 1/4 cup hazelnuts. Arrange mixture in even layer in 2-quart baking dish. Combine whipping cream, broth, salt, and pepper in medium bowl. Pour over parsnip mixture in dish.', u'Bake gratin 30 minutes. Press down on parsnips with spatula to moisten evenly. Continue baking until parsnips are tender and liquid bubbles thickly, about 35 minutes longer. Let stand 10 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining hazelnuts and sage.'], 'chef': u'Jill Silverman Hough', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/parsnip-and-hazelnut-gratin-with-bacon-234153', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 to 10 servings', 'recipe title': u'Parsnip and Hazelnut Gratin with Bacon', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'The exotic flavors of passion fruit and guava are layered in these pretty ice pops. To create perfectly defined layers, chill the guava mixture while the passion fruit mixture is freezing.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/3 cup water', u'1/4 cup plus 3 tablespoons sugar', u'2 tablespoons fresh lime juice, divided', u'7 to 8 ripe passion fruits (about 11 ounces), halved', u'1 11.5-ounce can guava nectar (about 1 1/2 cups)', u'Special equipment: 8 3-ounce disposable paper cups; 8 ice pop sticks or lollipop sticks', u'Ingredient info: Choose passion fruit that is wrinkled on the outside, which indicates that the fruit is ripe.'], 'preperation steps': [u'Combine 1/3 cup water, 1/4 cup sugar, and 1 tablespoon lime juice in small bowl; stir until sugar dissolves. Using spoon, scoop flesh from passion fruits into sugar mixture. Strain mixture through fine-mesh strainer into small bowl; press on seeds with rubber spatula to extract as much liquid as possible (you will need 1 cup strained liquid); discard seeds in strainer.', u'Divide passion fruit mixture among eight 3-ounce paper cups (about 2 tablespoons for each). Stretch plastic wrap tightly over top of each cup, covering completely and securing each with rubber band. Insert ice pop stick or lollipop stick through plastic wrap and into mixture in each cup (taut plastic will hold stick in place). Place cups in muffin pan, tilting cups at angle. Freeze until passion fruit mixture is set, about 3 hours.', u'Meanwhile, stir guava nectar, remaining 3 tablespoons sugar, and 1 tablespoon lime juice in 2-cup measuring cup until sugar dissolves. Chill mixture until cold.', u'Remove cups with frozen passion fruit mixture from freezer; stand cups upright in muffin pan. Peel back some of plastic wrap on each. Pour guava mixture atop frozen passion fruit mixture in cups, dividing equally. Cover with plastic wrap, secure with rubber band, and freeze until firm, at least 4 hours. DO AHEAD: Can be made 3 days ahead. Keep frozen.', u'Using scissors, cut off paper cups from pops and serve immediately.'], 'chef': u'Rochelle Palermo', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/passion-fruit-and-guava-pops-359812', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 ', 'recipe title': u'Passion Fruit and Guava Pops', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'89%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 1/2 cups finely ground or crushed pecan shortbread cookies (such as Pecan Sandies; about 11 ounces)', u'1/4 cup (1/2 stick) unsalted butter, melted', u'2 cups sugar', u'1/2 cup water', u'1 1/4 cups whipping cream', u'3/4 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'2 quarts (or 4 pints) peach ice cream, slightly softened', u'1 cup pecans, toasted, coarsely chopped (about 4 ounces)', u'1 cup (about) pecan halves, toasted'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 325\xb0F. Butter 9-inch-diameter springform pan with 2 3/4-inch-high sides. Mix cookie crumbs and melted butter in medium bowl until crumbs are evenly moistened. Press crumb mixture firmly onto bottom and 1 inch up sides of prepared pan. Bake until crust is set and pale golden, about 15 minutes. Cool completely.', u'Combine sugar and 1/2 cup water in heavy medium saucepan. Stir over medium-low heat until sugar dissolves. Increase heat to medium-high; boil without stirring until syrup is deep amber color, occasionally brushing down sides of pan with wet pastry brush and swirling pan, about 8 minutes. Remove from heat. Gradually add cream (mixture will bubble vigorously). Stir over low heat until any caramel bits dissolve and sauce is smooth, about 1 minute. Stir in vanilla. Let stand until cool but still pourable, about 1 hour.', u'Drizzle 1/4 cup cooled caramel sauce over bottom of crust. Freeze until caramel sets, about 10 minutes. Spread 1 quart ice cream over caramel in crust. Sprinkle chopped pecans over ice cream. Drizzle 1/2 cup caramel sauce over ice cream. Freeze until caramel sets, about 10 minutes. Spread remaining ice cream over. Freeze until top of pie is firm, about 1 hour.', u'Arrange pecan halves in 3 concentric circles around top of pie. Drizzle 1/4 cup caramel sauce over pie. Freeze pie until frozen solid, at least 4 hours. (Can be prepared 5 days ahead. Cover tightly with foil; keep frozen. Cover and chill remaining caramel sauce.)', u'Rewarm remaining caramel sauce over low heat, stirring often. Cut around pan sides to loosen pie. Let pie soften slightly at room temperature, about 10 minutes. Remove pan sides. Serve pie with warm caramel sauce.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/peach-pecan-ice-cream-pie-with-caramel-sauce-105386', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 12 servings', 'recipe title': u'Peach-Pecan Ice Cream Pie with Caramel Sauce', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Two holiday traditions\u2014the nut bowl and the cheese plate\u2014unite in these refined cheese balls. Lily-pad-like parsley leaves add a herbaceous note echoed in the surprising (and surprisingly good) combination of rosemary and coriander in the center of the cheese. These diminutive marbles coated with sweet buttered pecans are just the right size, making them neat to eat.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'82%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 cup pecans (1/4 pound)', u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter, melted', u'1/2 teaspoon sugar', u'1 (11-ounces) log soft goat cheese', u'1 teaspoon minced rosemary', u'1 teaspoon coriander seeds, crushed with side of a large knife, then chopped', u'About 50 to 60 large flat-leaf parsley leaves'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 400\xb0F with rack in upper third.', u'Toss pecans with butter, sugar, and 1/2 teaspoon salt, then toast in a 4-sided sheet pan until fragrant and a shade darker, 8 to 10 minutes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'When the weather warms up, these can be grilled, as they do at Spice Market. Look for the skewers in the kitchenware aisle.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'60%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/3 cup minced shallots', u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 tablespoons oyster sauce*', u'2 tablespoons sesame seeds, toasted', u'2 tablespoons minced lemongrass**', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce (such as nam pla or nuoc nam)*', u'1 garlic clove, minced', u'1 teaspoon soy sauce', u'1 1 1/2-pound pork tenderloin, cut crosswise into 3-inch-long pieces', u'6 11-inch-long metal skewers', u'Fresh Vegetable Pickles'], 'preperation steps': [u'Mix first 8 ingredients in medium bowl. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'You can make these custards and their grape garnish up to 2 days in advance.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 750 milliliter bottle off-dry Riesling', u'4 cups black seedless grapes or red seedless grapes', u'10 tablespoons sugar, divided', u'11 large egg yolks', u'Pinch of sea salt', u'2 1/4 cups heavy cream', u'3/4 cup whole milk', u'3/4 cup sour cream', u'Special equipment: Eight 3/4-cup ramekins'], 'preperation steps': [u'Bring wine, grapes, and 4 tablespoons sugar to a boil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Using an electric mixer, beat yolks, 6 tablespoons sugar, and salt in a large bowl until pale yellow, about 2 minutes.', u'Bring cream to a simmer in a medium saucepan over medium heat; gradually whisk into yolk mixture. Whisk in milk and sour cream. Pour through a fine-mesh sieve set over a medium pitcher. Divide among ramekins; cover each with foil and place in a large roasting pan. Add enough hot water to pan to come halfway up sides of ramekins.', u'Bake pots de cr\xe8me until just set in center, about 1 hour. Uncover and chill until cold, about 3 hours. Spoon grapes over.'], 'chef': u'Ashley Christensen', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/pots-de-creme-with-riesling-poached-grapes-367175', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Pots de Cr\xe8me with Riesling-Poached Grapes', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"A thin layer of plum jam beneath the custard is visually gorgeous\u2014it's a magenta pinstripe just under the pumpkin orange\u2014and provides a surprisingly delicious twist, since the tart plums bring out the best in all the other traditional flavors of pumpkin pie.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'78%', 'ingredient list': [u'Pastry dough', u'1 cup heavy cream', u'1 1/2 cups canned solid-pack pumpkin (not pie filling)', u'2/3 cup packed light brown sugar', u'2 large eggs', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/2 teaspoon ground ginger', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'3/4 cup damson plum preserves', u'Equipment: an 11-inch fluted tart pan (1 inch deep) with removable bottom; pie weights or dried beans'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F with rack in middle.', u'Roll out dough into a 15-inch round on a lightly floured surface with a lightly floured rolling pin, then fit into tart pan. Chill until firm, about 30 minutes.', u'Lightly prick bottom of shell all over with a fork, then line with foil and fill with pie weights. Bake tart shell until side is set and edge is pale golden, 25 to 30 minutes. 3Carefully remove weights and foil and bake shell until bottom and side are golden, about 15 minutes more. Cool completely in pan on a rack, about 30 minutes.', u'Whisk together cream, pumpkin pur\xe9e, brown sugar, eggs, cinnamon, ginger, and salt until smooth.', u'Put tart shell in pan on a baking sheet. Spread preserves evenly over bottom of tart shell, then pour pumpkin mixture over preserves.', u'Bake tart until filling is just set a few inches from edge but still slightly wobbly in center, 50 minutes to 1 hour. Cool in pan on a rack, about 1 hour. (Tart will continue to set as it cools.) Remove side of pan before serving.'], 'chef': u'issa Roberts', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/pumpkin-plum-tart-240578', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Pumpkin Plum Tart', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Terrine de Lapin aux Olives Vertes et Pistaches', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'77%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 (3-lb) rabbit, cut into 8 pieces', u'4 shallots, thinly sliced', u'2 carrots, thinly sliced', u'3 fresh parsley sprigs', u'2 fresh thyme sprigs', u'1 leek (green part only), rinsed', u'1 head garlic, left unpeeled and halved horizontally', u'1/2 teaspoon black peppercorns, cracked', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'6 1/4 cups cold water', u'2 large egg whites plus shells, crushed', u'4 teaspoons unflavored gelatin (from two 1/4-oz envelopes)', u'1 tablespoons Madeira', u'1/2 teaspoon fennel seeds, toasted*', u'1/2 cup picholine or other brine-cured green olives (3 oz), pitted and coarsely chopped', u'1/3 cup salted shelled pistachios, coarsely chopped', u'3 tablespoons thinly sliced fresh chives', u'1 teaspoon chopped fresh thyme', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'3/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'Accompaniment: 18 very thin slices firm white sandwich bread, each slice buttered and cut into 2 pieces the shape of terrine slices, then toasted.**', u'Special equipment: 2 (12- by 2-inch) tapered narrow rectangular terrines; kitchen string; 2 (11 1/2- by 1 1/2-inch) strips of corrugated cardboard wrapped well with foil; 2 (10- to 11-inch) rolling pins or high-shouldered wine bottles'], 'preperation steps': [u'Remove fat, kidneys, and liver from rabbit if necessary. Put rabbit, shallots, carrots, parsley, thyme, leek, garlic, peppercorns, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 6 cups water in a 4-quart heavy pot and bring to a boil, skimming froth. Reduce heat and gently simmer rabbit, partially covered, until tender, 1 hour.', u'Cool rabbit in broth, uncovered, 30 minutes, then remove, reserving rabbit pieces and broth separately. Pour broth through a fine sieve into a bowl, discarding solids. Whisk egg whites in another bowl until foamy and add egg shells. Whisk in warm broth in a stream and return mixture to cleaned pot.', u'Heat over moderate heat, stirring and scraping bottom constantly with a wooden spoon to prevent egg white from sticking, until stock comes to a simmer (this will take about 10 minutes). Reduce heat and gently simmer broth, without stirring, until all impurities rise to surface and form a crust, and broth underneath is clear, about 10 minutes.', u'While broth is simmering, coarsely shred rabbit meat, being careful to remove all small bones.', u"Pour broth through a sieve lined with a double thickness of dampened paper towels into a bowl and let all broth drain through. Discard solids. (If liquid doesn't drain completely, tap edge of sieve repeatedly with a metal spoon to help drain.) Broth should be completely clear; if not, repeat procedure with clean dampened paper towels.", u'If clarified broth measures more than 2 1/2 cups, boil to reduce. If it measures less, add water. Bring broth just to a simmer. Sprinkle gelatin over remaining 1/4 cup cold water and soften 1 minute, then whisk into hot broth until dissolved. Stir in Madeira and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt, or to taste.', u'Lightly oil terrines and line with a sheet of plastic wrap large enough to drape over edges. Place terrines on a tray. Cut 4 (18-inch) pieces of kitchen string and place 2 crosswise under each terrine about 2 inches from each end (they will be used to secure rolling pins or bottles to terrines).', u'Grind fennel seeds with a mortar and pestle or in an electric coffee/spice grinder and toss with rabbit, olives, pistachios, chives, thyme, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Divide mixture between terrines, then stir broth well and pour slowly into terrines, filling to 1/4 inch from top. Reserve any remaining broth, covered and chilled. Place a foil-wrapped cardboard strip on top of each terrine, then rest a rolling pin or bottle on top of cardboard and tie to terrine, creating just enough pressure to press cardboard about 1/2 inch into terrine (some broth will spill over onto tray).', u'Chill terrines on tray 3 hours, then remove string, weights, and cardboard. Heat any reserved jelled broth (including spillover on tray) just until it becomes liquid and add to terrines. Cover with overhanging plastic wrap and chill at least 6 hours more.', u'To unmold terrines, unwrap plastic wrap and invert molds onto a long narrow platter, pulling slightly on plastic to release terrines from molds, then removing it. Gently cut terrines with a serrated knife into 1/3-inch-thick slices and serve on toasts.', u'Toast spices in a dry heavy skillet over moderate heat, stirring, until fragrant and a shade or two darker.', u'** To toast, arrange bread slices on a baking sheet and spread with 2 tablespoons butter. Toast in middle of oven until golden, about 10 minutes.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/rabbit-terrine-with-green-olives-and-pistachios-105493', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u"Makes about 40 hors d'oeuvres", 'recipe title': u'Rabbit Terrine with Green Olives and Pistachios', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Top off this easy-to-make dessert with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'94%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 cups sliced natural almonds', u'2/3 cup sugar', u'1 1/4 sticks (1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons) cold unsalted butter, cut into pieces', u'11/4 cups all-purpose flour', u'1 rounded 1/4 teaspoon salt', u'2 tablespoons beaten egg', u'1 cup raspberry jam'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 400\xb0F.', u'Reserve 1/4 cup almonds in a bowl for topping. Add beaten egg to remaining flour mixture and pulse until mixture begins to clump together.', u'Transfer mixture from processor to a 9- by 1-inch round tart pan with a removable bottom. Press mixture with floured fingers onto bottom and up side of pan and bake in middle of oven 15 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, stir raspberry jam to loosen. Rub reserved almond mixture in bowl between your palms to form small clumps.', u'Remove tart shell from oven and spread jam over bottom. Sprinkle almond mixture over jam and bake tart 15 minutes. Cool tart in pan on a rack. Loosen side of pan with a knife, then remove it.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/raspberry-jam-tart-with-almond-crumble-104443', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Raspberry Jam Tart with Almond Crumble', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'The deep garnet glaze, made with pomegranate molasses, adds a richly piquant, sweet-tart depth of flavor to the turkey.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'86%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 cups water', u'1 celery stalk, cut into 2-inch pieces', u'1 carrot, peeled, cut into 2-inch pieces', u'1 onion, coarsely chopped', u'4 fresh parsley sprigs', u'1 11- to 12-pound turkey; neck, heart, and gizzard reserved', u'1 cup orange juice', u'1/2 cup pomegranate molasses*', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 tablespoon coarse kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon dried crushed red pepper', u'1 lemon, quartered', u'1 onion, quartered', u'10 fresh mint sprigs', u'3 tablespoons chilled unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch pieces'], 'preperation steps': [u'Combine first 5 ingredients and reserved neck, heart, and gizzard in saucepan. Simmer over medium heat. Simmer until giblet broth is reduced to 3 3/4 cups, about 1 hour. Strain; discard solids. Chill 3/4 cup broth for Bread Dressing with Dried Apricots, Pistachios, and Mint .', u'Position rack in bottom third of oven and preheat to 400\xb0F. Rinse turkey inside and out and pat dry. Whisk orange juice and next 4 ingredients in small bowl to blend for glaze. Place turkey on rack in heavy large roasting pan. Starting at neck end, carefully slide hand between skin and breast, thighs, and legs to loosen skin. Using pastry brush or hand, apply thin coat of pomegranate glaze over meat under skin. Stuff main cavity with lemon, quartered onion, and mint. Tuck wing tips under; tie legs together loosely. Brush turkey with some of remaining glaze.', u'Roast turkey 20 minutes. Pour 1 cup giblet broth into pan; brush turkey with glaze. Roast 20 minutes; brush with glaze. Roast 20 minutes. Add 1 cup broth to pan, brush with glaze, and cover turkey loosely with foil. Roast 20 minutes. Brush with glaze and reduce oven temperature to 325\xb0F. Continue to roast until thermometer inserted into thickest part of thigh registers 175\xb0F, brushing with glaze every 20 minutes, about 1 hour 10 minutes longer, about 2 1/2 hours total.', u'Transfer turkey to platter. Tent loosely with foil. Let stand 30 minutes (internal temperature will increase 5 to 10 degrees).', u'Meanwhile, tilt roasting pan and spoon fat from surface of juices. Add 1 cup giblet broth to pan. Place pan over 2 burners. Bring to simmer over medium-high heat, scraping up browned bits. Add chilled butter and simmer until gravy is smooth, whisking. Season with salt and pepper. Serve turkey with gravy.', u"*A thick pomegranate syrup available at Middle Eastern markets, some supermarkets, and by mail from Adriana's Caravan (adrianascaravan.com). Do not use cane sugar molasses."], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/roast-turkey-with-pomegranate-glaze-108821', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Roast Turkey with Pomegranate Glaze', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'The following is a slightly-NSFW recipe from the brilliant minds behind the popular cooking blog Thug Kitchen. To learn more about them, read our profile.\u2014Epicurious Editors', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'56%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/2 head of green cabbage (about 1/2 pound)', u'1 small carrot', u'2 tablespoons lime juice', u'2 tablespoons rice vinegar', u'1 teaspoon olive oil', u'1/8 teaspoon salt', u'1/3 cup chopped cilantro', u'1 head cauliflower (about 1 pound)', u'3/4 cup beer', u'1/4 cup vegetable broth', u'1 tablespoon lime juice', u'11/2 teaspoons tamari or soy sauce', u'11/2 tablespoons chipotle hot sauce', u'1 to 2 garlic cloves, sliced', u'11/2 teaspoons chili powder', u'1 teaspoon smoked paprika', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1/4 teaspoon garlic powder', u'Pinch of salt', u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'1/2 yellow onion, chopped', u'6 corn tortillas', u'1 avocado, sliced', u'Tomato salsa, for serving'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cut the cabbage into the thinnest strips you can and make sure those pieces are no longer than 2 inches. Got that st down now, right? In a small bowl, mix together the lime juice, vinegar, oil, and salt. Add the dressing right before you are going to eat and toss that s**t well. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 1 hr Start to finish: 2 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 large fennel bulbs (sometimes called anise; 21/2 lb total), stalks trimmed flush with bulbs and bulbs halved lengthwise', u'1/2 teaspoon olive oil', u'3/4 stick (6 tablespoons) unsalted butter', u'1 1/2 roasted, shelled, and skinned chestnuts (1 lb in shell or 11 oz bottled whole)', u'6 unsprayed fresh fig leaves (optional)', u'6 (1-inch-thick) monkfish steaks (6 oz each)', u'1 cup white bordelaise sauce'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 425\xb0F.', u'Cut 1 fennel bulb half lengthwise into paper-thin slices with a mandoline or other manual slicer and toss with oil and salt and pepper to taste. Cut remaining fennel lengthwise into 1/3-inch-thick sticks.', u'Heat 3 tablespoons butter in a well-seasoned 10-inch cast-iron or heavy nonstick skillet over moderately high heat until foam subsides, then cook fennel sticks in 2 batches with salt and pepper to taste over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until tender and edges are golden brown, about 7 minutes. Transfer to a bowl with a slotted spoon, reserving skillet, and keep warm, covered.', u'Halve chestnuts and add to skillet with 1 tablespoon butter and salt and pepper to taste. Cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until golden brown, about 3 minutes. Transfer to bowl with fennel using slotted spoon, reserving skillet, and keep warm, covered.', u'Blanch fig leaves in boiling salted water 2 minutes, then transfer to a bowl of ice and cold water to stop cooking and drain well. Trim stems from leaves.', u'Pat fish dry and season with salt and pepper. Add 1 tablespoon butter to skillet and heat over moderately high heat until foam subsides. Sear fish in 2 batches, turning once, until golden brown, about 2 minutes, transferring to a plate.', u'Melt remaining tablespoon butter in skillet, then remove skillet from heat. If not using fig leaves, drizzle pieces of fish with butter. If using fig leaves, arrange 1 leaf, smooth side down, on a work surface, then put a piece of fish in middle and drizzle with some of melted butter. Wrap fig leaf around fish to enclose it and secure with wooden toothpicks. Wrap remaining fish in same manner.', u'Boil 1/2 cup sauce in skillet until reduced to about 1/3 cup, about 2 minutes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'94%', 'ingredient list': [u'11 ounces Valrhona chocolate (56% cacao)', u'2/3 cup heavy cream', u'Valrhona cocoa powder for dusting'], 'preperation steps': [u'Finely chop 8 ounces of the chocolate and put in a bowl.', u"Bring heavy cream to a boil in a small heavy saucepan. If you do this, compensate for the extra evaporation by starting with a little more cream.", u'Pour the cream over the chocolate, mashing any big pieces with a wooden spoon.', u"Then stir with a whisk in concentric circles (don't beat or you'll incorporate air), starting in the center and working your way to the edge, until the ganache is smooth.", u'Let stand at room temperature until thick enough to hold a shape, about 1 hour, then, using a pastry bag with a 3/8-inch opening or tip, pipe into mounds (about 3/4 inch high and 1 inch wide) on parchment-lined baking sheets. Freeze until firm, about 15 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, melt 3 more ounces of the same Valrhona and smear some on a gloved hand. Gently rub each chilled truffle to coat lightly with chocolate. The secret to a delicate coating of chocolate is to roll each truffle in a smear of melted chocolate in your hand. Linxe always uses gloves.', u'Toss the truffles in unsweetened Valrhona cocoa powder so they look like their namesakes, freshly dug from the earth. A fork is the best tool for tossing truffles in cacao. Shake truffles in a sieve to eliminate excess cacao. Store truffles in the refrigerator.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/robert-linxes-chocolate-truffles-104655', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes about 60 truffles (do not double recipe)', 'recipe title': u"Robert Linxe's Chocolate Truffles", 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This risotto has the classic creamy yet al dente texture and features a combination of Parmesan cheese and seafood. Add 3/4 cup chicken broth. Simmer until almost all broth is absorbed, stirring often, about 2 minutes. Continue to add broth, 3/4 cup at a time, until rice is just tender and mixture is creamy, stirring often and allowing almost all broth to be absorbed after each addition, about 25 minutes total. During last 5 minutes, add spinach in 4 batches, stirring and allowing spinach to wilt after each addition. Mix in shrimp, 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese, and basil. Season risotto to taste with salt and pepper. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Spelt spaghetti has an incredible nutty taste and is a great alternative to regular spaghetti, as it's high in wheat bran fiber, or beta-glucans, which help keep our cholesterol levels in check.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'Olive oil', u'1/2 bunch of fresh thyme (1/2 ounces)', u'4 cloves of garlic', u'1/2-1 fresh red chile', u'1 lemon', u'1 pound mixed-color cherry tomatoes, on the vine', u'8 ounces best-quality ricotta salata cheese', u'11 ounces dried spelt spaghetti', u'4 handfuls of arugula', u'Optional: balsamic vinegar'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F. Pour 3 tablespoons of oil into a small bowl. Run the bunch of thyme under a hot tap for 3 seconds to reawaken it, then shake dry and strip the leaves into the oil. Peel the garlic, then finely slice it with the chile and add to the bowl. Finely grate in the lemon zest, add a pinch of sea salt and black pepper, and mix together. Lay the cherry tomatoes in a 12\u2013x 16-inch baking dish. Rub the flavored oil all over the ricotta and place in the center of the dish, then gently rub the remaining oil over the tomatoes. Add a splash of water to the dish, place in the oven, and roast for 45 minutes, then remove. With 10 minutes to go, cook the spaghetti in a pan of boiling salted water according to the package instructions.', u'Lift the ricotta out of the baking dish, then shake the tomatoes off the vines, discarding the stalks. Add half a cup of pasta water to the dish and gently shake to loosen all the sticky goodness from the base. Drain the spaghetti and toss straight into the dish with a squeeze of lemon juice, season to perfection, then break that beautiful ricotta over the top. Sprinkle over the arugula, toss together well, then serve. My missus likes this with a little drizzle of balsamic too.'], 'chef': u'Jamie Oliver', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/spelt-spaghetti-vine-tomatoes-and-baked-ricotta', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'4 servings', 'recipe title': u'Spelt Spaghetti, Vine Tomatoes & Baked Ricotta', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

Make more stencils with more plates if desired.', u'Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 350\xb0F. Line a large baking sheet with nonstick liner.', u'Beat together butter, confectioners sugar, honey, and tea leaves in a large bowl with an electric mixer at medium speed until combined well. Add egg whites 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Reduce speed to low, then mix in flour until just combined.', u'Place stencil on liner and spread batter with spatula over stencil to completely cover opening. Carefully lift stencil from liner and stencil more cookies in same manner about 1 inch apart. Bake until edges are deep golden brown, 6 to 9 minutes. Cool cookies 1 minute on sheet, then transfer with spatula to a rack to cool completely. (To curl cookies, drape while hot over handles of wooden spoons or rolling pins to cool.) Stencil and bake more cookies with remaining batter.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/tea-and-honey-crisps-236667', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes about 6 dozen (4-inch) cookies', 'recipe title': u'Tea-and-Honey Crisps', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Among the few recipes known to have been used by the Washington family is this one for cherry bounce, a brandy-based drink popular in the eighteenth century. It seems to have been such a favorite of General Washington\'s that he packed a "Canteen" of it, along with Madeira and port, for a trip west across the Allegheny Mountains in September 1784.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'10 to 11 pounds fresh sour cherries, preferably Morello, or 3 jars (1 pound, 9 ounce) preserved Morello cherries', u'4 cups brandy', u'3 cups sugar, plus more as needed', u'2 cinnamon sticks, broken into pieces', u'2 to 3 cloves', u'1 (1/4-inch) piece fresh whole nutmeg'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Pit the cherries, cut them in half, and put them in a large bowl. Using a potato masher, carefully mash the fruit to extract as much juice as possible. Strain the juice through a large fine-mesh strainer, pressing the fruit with a sturdy spoon. (You should have about 8 cups.) Reserve the mashed cherries in the freezer or refrigerator for later use. If using jarred cherries, drain the fruit and set the juice aside before halving and mashing the cherries. Add any pressed juice to the reserved jarred juice.', u'2. In a lidded 1-gallon glass jar, combine the juice with the brandy and sugar, stirring to dissolve the sugar. Cover with the lid, and set aside in the refrigerator for 24 hours, occasionally stirring or carefully shaking the jar.', u'3. Bring 2 cups of the juice to a simmer over medium heat. Taste the sweetened juice and add more sugar, if desired. Stir in the cinnamon sticks, cloves, and nutmeg. Then cover, and simmer for about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat, and set aside to cool to room temperature. Strain, and discard the spices.', u'4. Stir the spiced juice back into the 1-gallon glass jar with the reserved sweetened juice. Cover loosely with the lid, and set aside for at least 2 weeks before serving, occasionally shaking the jar with care.', u'5. Serve at room temperature in small cordial or wine glasses. Store the remaining cherry bounce in the refrigerator.'], 'chef': u'ted by Stephen A. McLeod', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/to-make-an-excellent-cherry-bounce-394679', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes about 3 quarts', 'recipe title': u'To Make an Excellent Cherry Bounce', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'A thin ganache topping puts these brownies over the top. The key to perfectly moist, fudgy brownies is not to overcook them. As soon as the tester comes out with moist crumbs attached, remove the pan from the oven.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'93%', 'ingredient list': [u'Nonstick vegetable oil spray', u'12 ounces bittersweet chocolate (do not exceed 61% cacao), chopped, divided', u'11 tablespoons (1 stick plus 3 tablespoons) unsalted butter, cut into 1-inch cubes', u'1 1/4 cups sugar', u'3 large eggs', u'1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 cup unbleached all purpose flour', u'1 cup walnuts, toasted, coarsely chopped', u'3/4 cup heavy whipping cream', u'Special equipment: 9 x 9 x 2-inch metal baking pan'], 'preperation steps': [u'Position rack in center of oven and preheat to 350\xb0F. Line 9 x 9 x 2-inch metal baking pan with foil, leaving overhang. Spray foil with nonstick vegetable oil spray. Combine 6 ounces bittersweet chocolate and butter in medium metal bowl. Set bowl over saucepan of simmering water and stir until chocolate and butter are melted and smooth. Remove bowl from over water and cool chocolate mixture until lukewarm, 5 to 10 minutes.', u'Whisk sugar, eggs, vanilla extract, and salt in large bowl to blend. Whisk in chocolate mixture. Stir in flour, then chopped toasted walnuts. Transfer batter to prepared baking pan. Bake brownies until tester inserted into center comes out with moist crumbs attached, 26 to 28 minutes. Transfer pan to cooling rack and let brownies cool completely.', u'Bring cream to simmer in small saucepan over medium heat. Remove from heat. Add remaining 6 ounces chocolate to hot cream and let stand 5 minutes to soften, then whisk until melted and smooth. Pour chocolate ganache over brownie sheet in pan and spread to cover completely. Let stand at cool room temperature until topping is set, about 4 hours. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and store at room temperature.', u'Using foil as aid, lift brownie sheet from pan. Fold down foil edges. Using large sharp knife, cut brownie sheet into 25 squares, wiping knife with hot moist cloth after each cut. Arrange brownies on platter and serve.'], 'chef': u'Rochelle Palermo', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/truffle-brownies-359811', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 25', 'recipe title': u'Truffle Brownies', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Start with chopped fresh tomatoes, basil and garlic spooned onto toasted baguette slices. Grill slices of potato to have with the tuna; follow with biscotti and fresh figs.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 tablespoons garlic-flavored olive oil', u'2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', u'4 teaspoons chopped fresh rosemary', u'1 11- to 12-ounce tuna steak, cut into 1-inch pieces', u'12 1x1x1/4-inch red onion pieces', u'8 lemon slices, halved', u'4 cups (about 2 ounces) mixed baby greens'], 'preperation steps': [u'Prepare barbecue (medium-high heat). Grill tuna and onion until tuna is just opaque in center and onion is slightly charred and tender, turning and brushing often with some remaining dressing, about 8 minutes.', u'Toss greens and all remaining dressing in medium bowl. Mound salad on plates; top with skewers.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/tuna-and-red-onion-spiedini-103620', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 2 servings; can be doubled', 'recipe title': u'Tuna and Red Onion Spiedini', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'As with biscotti there is an undeniable American-Italian influence at play here but, once again, I embrace this. Actually, though, American-Italian food has had its own influence on the cooking of the Old Country: these days, I am reliably informed by my Italian publisher and celebrated food writer, Csaba dalla Zorza, you can find dried cranberries with relative ease in Italy.', 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'2/3 cup dried cranberries', u'7 tablespoons Marsala', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'2 echalion or banana shallots, peeled and finely chopped', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cloves', u'1/2 teaspoon ground allspice', u'2 teaspoons chopped fresh sage', u'2 1/4 pounds Italian sausages', u'2 eggs, beaten', u'approx. 1/2 cup grated Parmesan', u'approx. 1 cup bread crumbs', u'1 X 11-pound boneless (double) turkey breast, butterflied, with skin left on', u'1/4 cup duck or goose fat'], 'preperation steps': [u'Put the cranberries and Marsala into a small saucepan and bring to a boil, then take off the heat and leave to one side.', u'Put the oil into a large frying pan or similar heavy pan, and fry the shallots for a minute or so, then add the spices and chopped sage, turning them in the soft shallots.', u'Squeeze the sausage meat out of its skins, add to the pan, and break it up\u2014using a wooden fork and spatula for ease\u2014turning it in the hot pan until it loses its pinkness. This will take about 5 minutes.', u'Take the frying pan off the heat and turn the contents into a large bowl, mixing in the steeped cranberries and any Marsala clinging to them, and leave to cool. You can cover with plastic wrap and put in the refrigerator for up to 2 days at this stage. When you are ready to stuff the turkey breast, take the bowl of sausage meat out of the refrigerator.', u'Preheat the oven to 400\xb0F.', u'Uncover the bowl of sausage meat, add the eggs, Parmesan, and bread crumbs and\u2014I use my hands for this\u2014mix well. Lay the butterflied turkey joint out in front of you. It really does look like a butterfly, though admittedly a fleshy one. Spread the stuffing out first in the slight cavity in the center of the butterfly and then outward onto the wings though not going right up to the edge (or it will squidge out when cooking) but as evenly as possible over the whole joint.', u'Carefully, in one swift but steady movement, fold one "wing" over the other to close the joint, and then sit the turkey in a large roasting pan, breast bone (or where the breast bone would be) on top as it would look were it the whole bird, with the pointier bit farthest away from you. Thread 2 skewers through the base\u2014i.e., the widest part that is nearer you\u2014to keep it closed, and smear it all over with the duck or goose fat.', u"Roast the turkey breast for 2\u20132 1/2 hours, then check it is cooked with a turkey or meat thermometer. When cooked, it should read 165\xb0F in the center. (If you're leaving it to rest, as you should, or to cool, you could take it out at 160\xb0F\u2014it will retain heat and continue to cook for a short while once out of the oven.)", u'Flex your muscles, then lift out onto a cutting board, and leave to rest for at least 20 minutes. Or leave to get cold if you are eating it as part of a cook-ahead buffet.', u'Cut through the whole joint in wide slices right across; they will need to be quite thick, at least 1/2 inch, maybe 1 inch, to keep the stuffing intact within the slice.', u'As you place it on table or sideboard, dot around it the condiments of your choice: I revert to Christmas in Italy here by putting a lusciously extravagant pot or two of Italian mostarda di Cremona on the table alongside: this is a hot and sweet preserve of mustardy candied fruits that gleam beautifully and taste both festive and fabulous.'], 'chef': u'Nigella Lawson', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/turkey-breast-stuffed-with-italian-sausage-and-marsala-steeped-cranberries-51204010', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 12, or many more as part of a buffet', 'recipe title': u'Turkey Breast Stuffed with Italian Sausage and Marsala-Steeped Cranberries', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'All the other kids at school will be jealous when they get a look at these delicious, colorful, healthful wraps.', 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Nutritional analysis per piece (1/2 of wrap): 350 calories, 15g fat (5g saturated), 36g carbohydrates, 4.5g fiber, 15.5g protein\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Nutrition Data', 'recommendation': u'50%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 large whole-wheat wrap (11 to 12 inches), or 2 smaller wraps (8 inches), or a 12-by 9-inch rectangular lavosh', u'1 tablespoon mayonnaise', u'1 lightly packed handful rinsed baby spinach leaves', u'1 tablespoon dried cranberries', u'2 medium carrots, ends cut off, peeled and coarsely shredded', u'2 slices Swiss cheese, such as Jarlsburg (2 ounces)', u'2 thin slices store-bought roasted turkey breast (2 ounces)'], 'preperation steps': [u'If necessary, warm the wrap in a 350\xb0F oven for 2 minutes to soften before filling.', u'Lay the wrap on a work surface and spread the mayonnaise all over. Sprinkle the spinach leaves, cranberries, and carrots evenly on top. Arrange the Swiss cheese and turkey in even layers over the vegetable layer. Fold in the side edges and then roll up snugly from the bottom.', u'Cut crosswise into 4 even pieces and wrap tightly in plastic.'], 'chef': u'Tracey Seaman and Tanya Wenman Steel', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/turkey-pinwheels-243128', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 2 servings', 'recipe title': u'Turkey Pinwheels', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"If venison isn't for you, beef tenderloin is a good alternative (see cooks' note, below). Because beef is not as dense and rich as venison, the portions are slightly larger (cooking times and temperatures will also be different).", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'93%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 (1/2-lb) piece venison tenderloin (1 1/2 inches in diameter), trimmed, at room temperature for 30 minutes', u'1/2 teaspoon coarsely ground black pepper', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'11/2 tablespoons vegetable or olive oil', u'1/4 cup finely chopped shallot', u'1/4 cup Madeira wine', u'1/3 cup beef or veal demi-glace', u'1 teaspoon drained green peppercorns in brine, coarsely chopped', u'1 teaspoon unsalted butter', u'Special equipment: an instant-read thermometer', u'Garnish: parsnip crisps'], 'preperation steps': [u'Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 425\xb0F.', u'Pat venison dry and sprinkle with black pepper and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Heat oil in an ovenproof 12-inch heavy skillet over moderately high heat until just smoking, then brown venison on all sides (except ends), about 3 minutes total.', u'Transfer skillet with venison to oven and roast until thermometer inserted diagonally 2 inches into center registers 115\xb0F, 4 to 5 minutes. Transfer venison with tongs to a plate and let stand, loosely covered with foil, 5 minutes (temperature will rise to 125\xb0F for medium-rare).', u'While meat stands, add shallot to skillet (handle will be hot) and cook over moderate heat, stirring, until golden, about 2 minutes. Add Madeira and deglaze skillet by boiling, stirring and scraping up brown bits, until liquid is reduced by half, about 1 minute. Add demi-glace and boil, stirring, until sauce is slightly thickened, about 1 minute. Stir in peppercorns, butter, remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt, and any meat juices that have accumulated on plate, then remove from heat.', u'Cut venison into 1/2-inch-thick slices and serve with sauce.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/venison-tenderloin-with-madeira-green-peppercorn-sauce-109028', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 2 servings', 'recipe title': u'Venison Tenderloin with Madeira Green Peppercorn Sauce', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'80%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 cups sugar', u'2/3 cup honey (preferably Greek)', u'2 cinnamon sticks', u'2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', u'3 cups walnuts (10 to 11 ounces)', u'3 cups natural raw unsalted pistachios (13 to 14 ounces)', u'3/4 cup sugar', u'2 teaspoons finely grated lemon peel', u'1 1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon', u'1/2 cup finely diced dried apple rings (1 1/2 ounces)', u'20 17 x 12-inch sheets fresh phyllo pastry or frozen, thawed', u'1 1/2 cups (3 sticks) unsalted butter, melted'], 'preperation steps': [u'Combine all ingredients and 1 cup water in heavy medium saucepan. Bring to boil over medium-high heat, stirring until sugar dissolves. Reduce heat to medium and boil until syrup is reduced to generous 2 cups, about 15 minutes. Transfer to bowl and cool completely. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and chill.', u'Position 1 rack in top third and 1 rack in bottom third of oven and preheat to 350\xb0F. Spread walnuts on large rimmed baking sheet. Spread pistachios on another large rimmed baking sheet. Place nuts in oven and toast 5 minutes. Cool nuts. Transfer nuts to processor. Add 3/4 cup sugar, lemon peel, and ground cinnamon. Using on/off turns, blend until nuts are ground to medium-fine texture. Transfer nut mixture to large bowl; mix in dried apples.', u'Place phyllo sheet stack on work surface; cover with sheet of plastic wrap, then damp kitchen towel. Brush 13 x 9 x 2-inch metal baking pan with some melted butter. Arrange 1 phyllo sheet in pan with half of phyllo sheet hanging over 1 long side. Brush phyllo in pan with some melted butter. Fold overhang over to make two 12 x 8 1/2-inch layers. Brush with some melted butter. Repeat stacking and buttering with 4 more phyllo sheets, making 10 layers total. Spread 1/3 of nut mixture (generous 2 cups) over phyllo in pan to within 1/2 inch of edge. Repeat layering 2 more times with 5 phyllo sheets and 1/3 of remaining nut mixture each time. Top with 5 more folded phyllo sheets. Using sharp knife, cut through top phyllo layers lengthwise (do not cut through to bottom of pan) to make 4 strips, then cut phyllo crosswise to make 16 rectangles. Bake until phyllo is golden, about 45 minutes.', u'Gradually spoon cold syrup over hot baklava. Cool to room temperature. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover; let stand at room temperature.', u'Cut each baklava rectangle crosswise in half for total of 32 pieces. Transfer baklava to platter and serve.'], 'chef': u'Michael Symon', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/walnut-and-pistachio-baklava-364612', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 32 pieces', 'recipe title': u'Walnut and Pistachio Baklava', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'To make curls, soften a chocolate bar briefly in the microwave and run a vegetable peeler along one long side.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': u'One serving contains the following: Calories (kcal) 396.66;% Calories from Fat 55.9; Fat (g) 24.62; Saturated Fat (g) 14.57; Cholesterol (mg) 50.75; Carbohydrates (g) 39.71; Dietary Fiber (g) 1.14\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Bon App\xe9tit', 'recommendation': u'81%', 'ingredient list': [u'7 ounces high-quality white chocolate (such as Lindt), chopped, plus white chocolate curls (optional garnish)', u'27 chocolate sandwich cookies (about 11 ounces)', u'1/2 cup chilled whipping cream', u'1 8-ounce package cream cheese, room temperature', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'3 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'1 tablespoon finely grated lime peel', u'Lime slices or lime twists (for garnish)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Line 8x8x2-inch square baking pan with foil, extending over all sides. Stir chopped white chocolate in small metal bowl set over saucepan of barely simmering water until melted and smooth. Remove bowl from over water. Finely grind cookies in processor. Add 2 tablespoons melted white chocolate and blend until mixture clumps together. Firmly press mixture onto bottom of prepared pan. Chill while making filling.', u'Beat whipping cream in medium bowl until peaks form. Beat cream cheese, sugar, lime juice, and lime peel in large bowl until smooth. Beat in remaining melted white chocolate. Fold in whipped cream in 2 additions; spread over prepared crust. Chill until filling is slightly firm, at least 2 hours. Using foil as aid, lift cheesecake out of pan. Cut into 9 bars. Garnish with chocolate curls, if desired, and lime slices or twists.'], 'chef': u'The Bon App\xe9tit Test Kitchen', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/white-chocolate-and-lime-cheesecake-bars-240131', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 9 servings', 'recipe title': u'White Chocolate and Lime Cheesecake Bars', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Designed for a four-tier cake, this recipe may be halved and simply made in a 9 1/2- by 11-inch pan and adorned with elephant cookies.', 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'50%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 1/2 cups flour', u'5 teaspoons baking powder', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'16 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened', u'2 cups sugar', u'4 eggs', u'1/3 cup canned coconut milk', u'2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'2 cups sugar', u'6 egg whites', u'1/4 teaspoon cream of tartar', u'A pinch of salt', u'1 1/4 pounds unsalted butter, at room temperature', u'1 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Preheat oven to 350\xb0F. Mix together the flour, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl; set aside. Using an electric mixer, cream the butter and sugar until the mixture is light yellow. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add the coconut milk and the flour mixture alternately, ending with the flour mixture, and continuing to beat well after each addition. Stir in the vanilla.', u'2. Divide the batter evenly among 3 lightly buttered and floured 8-inch square pans. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes, or until a cake tester comes out clean. Cool in the pan, then invert onto cooling racks.', u'3. To create a 4-tiered cake, cut a 2-inch, 4-inch, and 6-inch square out of 2 of the cakes. Using sturdy cardboard, cut precise squares of the same dimensions. Place the cut cakes on the corresponding cardboard squares (they will serve as bases).', u'4. Insert 4 heavy-duty plastic straws, cut to 6-inch lengths, into the center of the remaining 8-inch cake, forming a square (they will act as the support for the 6-inch cake). Place the 6-inch cake on top of the 8-inch cake. Repeat this process with four more straws on the 6-inch cake, then place the 4-inch cake on top. Repeat the procedure for the 2-inch cake.', u'1. Cream the butter in a bowl until light and fluffy; set aside.', u'2. Combine 2/3 cup water and the sugar in a heavy saucepan. Heat until the liquid reaches the soft-ball stage, 240\xb0F on a candy thermometer. Watch carefully; do not let the sugar syrup overheat.', u'3. In another bowl, beat the egg whites with the cream of tartar and salt until very stiff peaks form. Continue beating on high speed as you slowly pour in 1/4 cup of the sugar syrup. Gradually add the rest of the syrup using the same method.', u"4. Continue beating as you add the butter, several tablespoons at a time. (Make sure the mixture has no heat left in it or the butter will melt). The frosting should become thick and creamy. If it doesn't thicken, cool it over a bowl of ice, then try beating again. Stir in the vanilla. Frost the cake and adorn it with elephant cookies ($8 to $12 each, elenis.com)."], 'chef': u'ecca Miller Ffrench', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/white-elephant-cake-with-buttercream-frosting-240023', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 18-24 servings', 'recipe title': u'White Elephant Cake with Buttercream Frosting', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'92%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 cups wild rice (about 9 ounces)', u'2 teaspoons coarse kosher salt', u'3 cups 1/2-inch cubes peeled butternut squash (from 11/2-pound squash)', u'3 tablespoons olive oil', u'6 tablespoons (3/4 stick) butter, divided', u'1 1/2 cups finely chopped leeks (white part only)', u'1 1/2 cups frozen white corn kernels, thawed', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh Italian parsley'], 'preperation steps': [u'Rinse rice in strainer under cold water; drain. Bring 6 cups water and 2 teaspoons coarse salt to boil in large saucepan. Add rice; bring to boil. Reduce heat; simmer uncovered until rice grains begin to split and are tender but still slightly chewy, about 45 minutes. Drain. Spread on rimmed baking sheet to cool. Transfer to bowl. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and chill.', u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F. Oil rimmed baking sheet. Toss squash cubes and 3 tablespoons oil in medium bowl. Spread squash in single layer on prepared sheet; sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast just until tender but firm enough to hold shape, stirring occasionally, about 15 minutes. Transfer squash to bowl. Cool. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and chill.', u'Melt 4 tablespoons butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add leeks and 3/4 cup water; simmer until leeks are tender, about 7 minutes. Add corn; simmer 2 minutes longer. Add rice and butternut squash; simmer until heated through and liquid is absorbed, about 4 minutes. Stir in 2 tablespoons butter and parsley. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to bowl and serve.'], 'chef': u'Nancy Oakes and Pamela Mazzola', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/wild-rice-with-butternut-squash-leeks-and-corn-350425', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 10 servings', 'recipe title': u'Wild Rice with Butternut Squash, Leeks, and Corn', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"These intense, ultra-rich cookies are a dark chocolate lover's dream.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'79%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/4 cups all purpose flour', u'1/3 cup natural unsweetened cocoa powder', u'1/2 teaspoon baking soda', u'11 tablespoons (1 stick plus 3 tablespoons) unsalted butter, room temperature', u'2/3 cup (packed) golden brown sugar', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1/4 teaspoon fine sea salt', u'5 ounces extra-bittersweet chocolate (do not exceed 85% cacao), chopped (no pieces bigger than 1/3 inch)'], 'preperation steps': [u"Sift flour, cocoa, and baking soda into medium bowl. Keep chilled.", u'Preheat oven to 325\xb0F. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. Using thin sharp knife, cut logs crosswise into 1/2-inch-thick rounds. Space 1 inch apart on prepared sheets. Store airtight at room temperature.'], 'chef': u'Dorie Greenspan', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/world-peace-cookies-360733', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes about 36', 'recipe title': u'World Peace Cookies', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Soundtrack: "Mississippi Goddamn" by Nina Simone from Protest Anthology', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'12 cups cold water', u'2 2-inch cinnamon sticks', u'12 tea bags orange-flavored black tea', u'2 cups freshly squeezed orange juice', u'1/2 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice', u'1 1/2 cups agave nectar', u'Ice cubes', u'Thin orange wedges, for garnish'], 'preperation steps': [u'\u2022 In a stockpot, combine the water and cinnamon sticks and bring to a boil. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Chocolaty almonds are better than a gift certificate for a facial. Vitamin E in the nuts gives skin a healthy glow, and chocolate\u2014 well, do we really need to sell you on that?', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: 237 calories, 15 g fat, 7 g saturated fat, 21 g carbohydrates, 3 g fiber, 4 g protein per 2 pieces\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Self', 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'3/4 cup whole skin-on almonds', u'12 ounces dark chocolate (60 percent to 70 percent cocoa)', u'1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract', u'toasted almonds', u'1/3 cup dried tart cherries'], 'preperation steps': [u"Heat oven to 350\xb0F. Fill a medium saucepan with 1 inch water; bring to a simmer over medium-low heat. Set a large heatproof bowl atop saucepan, making sure water doesn't touch bottom of bowl. Place 10 ounces dark chocolate (60 percent to 70 percent cocoa) in bowl; cook, stirring, until smooth. Remove bowl from saucepan; add another 2 ounces dark chocolate and stir until smooth. Stir in 1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract, toasted almonds and 1/3 cup dried tart cherries, coarsely chopped. Pour onto baking sheet; spread into an even layer about 1/4 inch thick. Refrigerate until firm, 1 hour. Break into 24 pieces."], 'chef': u'Laraine Perri', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/almond-cherry-chocolate-bark-369109', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 24 pieces', 'recipe title': u'Almond-Cherry Chocolate Bark', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"In Asian cooking, angled loofah is typically braised or served in soups, but it's also perfectly suited to pickling. Try to buy young loofah (no longer than 12 inches).", 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'50%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 angled loofah (1/2 lb)', u'2 tablespoons kosher salt', u'2 cups ice cubes', u'1 cup cider vinegar', u'1/2 cup water', u'3/4 cup sugar', u'1 teaspoon mustard seeds', u'1/2 teaspoon celery seeds', u'1/4 teaspoon turmeric', u'1 medium sweet onion (1/2 lb), thinly sliced crosswise and separated into rings'], 'preperation steps': [u'Scrub loofah and peel only the ridges, then cut diagonally into 1/2-inch-thick slices. Toss loofah with kosher salt in a bowl, then cover with ice and let stand 2 hours. Drain and remove any unmelted ice.', u'Bring vinegar, water, sugar, mustard seeds, celery seeds, and turmeric to a boil in a 1-quart nonreactive saucepan, stirring until sugar is dissolved. Add loofah and onion, then reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, 5 minutes.', u'Transfer pickles with liquid to a 1-quart heatproof glass or ceramic bowl and cool to room temperature. Chill, covered, at least 2 days (for flavors to develop) and up to 1 month.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/angled-loofah-bread-and-butter-pickles-107780', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 cups', 'recipe title': u'Angled Loofah Bread-and-Butter Pickles', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Gravlaks \u2014 fish cured with salt, sugar, and dill \u2014 is usually made with salmon, but we like the milder flavor of arctic char for this particular dish.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 (1 1/4-lb) center-cut piece arctic char fillet with skin, pin bones removed', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1/4 cup kosher salt', u'1 tablespoon coarsely ground black pepper', u'3 cups coarsely chopped fresh dill (from 2 large bunches)', u'3 seedless cucumbers (usually plastic-wrapped; 3 lb total)', u'3/4 teaspoon table salt', u'2 teaspoons unflavored gelatin (from 1 envelope)', u'1 tablespoon distilled white vinegar', u'1 tablespoon tiny fresh dill fronds', u'Accompaniment: thin Scandinavian crispbread such as Kavli'], 'preperation steps': [u'Pat fish dry, then transfer, skin side up, to a large sheet of plastic wrap. Stir together sugar, salt, and pepper, then rub 3 tablespoons of mixture onto skin of fish. Turn fish over and thickly coat with remaining sugar mixture, then pack dill on top.', u'Wrap fish tightly in 2 or 3 layers of plastic wrap (to prevent leakage; salt mixture will liquefy as fish cures) and transfer to a large shallow baking pan. Put another baking pan or a cutting board on top of fish and weight down with 3 or 4 full cans (about 3 lb total). Let fish cure, chilled, turning wrapped fillet over roughly every 12 hours and then replacing weight, for 36 hours total.', u'Peel cucumbers, making sure to remove all green (for a clearer jelly), then halve lengthwise and core. Coarsely chop cucumbers and pur\xe9e in a food processor until smooth, then drain in a large fine-mesh sieve set over a bowl, pressing hard on solids to extract 2 cups liquid. Discard solids.', u'Stir together salt and 1/2 cup cucumber liquid in a small saucepan and sprinkle with gelatin. Let stand 1 minute to soften, then heat over moderate heat, stirring, just until gelatin is dissolved, about 2 minutes. Cool mixture to room temperature, then stir into remaining 1 1/2 cups cucumber liquid along with vinegar. Pour mixture into an 8-inch square glass baking dish and sprinkle with dill fronds, pressing gently to submerge. Chill, covered, until set, at least 8 hours.', u'Unwrap gravlaks, discarding liquid, and gently scrape off dill. Transfer gravlaks, skin side down, to a cutting board. Holding a very sharp long thin-bladed knife at a 30-degree angle, cut gravlaks across the grain into very thin slices, being careful not to cut through skin. Discard skin.', u'Cut jelly into 6 pieces and divide among 6 plates with a metal spatula. Serve with several slices of gravlaks.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/arctic-char-gravlaks-with-cucumber-jelly-232479', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 first-course servings', 'recipe title': u'Arctic Char Gravlaks with Cucumber Jelly', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This salad is served with crostini topped with artichoke pesto instead of croutons.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 12-ounce jar marinated artichoke hearts, drained', u'3 tablespoons (packed) finely grated Parmesan cheese', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1/4 cup chopped shallot (about 1 large)', u'1/4 cup red wine vinegar', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh Italian parsley plus additional for sprinkling', u'1 tablespoon whole grain Dijon mustard', u'1 garlic clove, minced', u'3/4 cup olive oil', u'12 1/2-inch-thick diagonal baguette slices, toasted', u'3 5-ounce packages mixed baby greens', u'2 12-ounce jars marinated artichoke hearts, drained', u'1 12-ounce container yellow and red cherry tomatoes, halved', u'1 cup crumbled feta cheese (about 4 ounces)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Place all ingredients in processor. Blend until finely chopped. Season to taste with salt and pepper. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and chill.', u'Whisk shallot, vinegar, 2 tablespoons chopped parsley, mustard, and garlic in medium bowl. Gradually whisk in oil. Season to taste with salt and pepper. DO AHEAD: vinaigrette can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and chill.', u'Spread 1 tablespoon pesto over each baguette slice. Sprinkle parsley over crostini. Mix baby greens, artichoke hearts, and cherry tomatoes in very large bowl. Toss with enough dressing to coat lightly. Sprinkle feta over.', u'Serve salad with crostini.'], 'chef': u'Diane Rossen Worthington', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/artichoke-cherry-tomato-and-feta-salad-with-artichoke-pesto-crostini-353393', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 12 servings', 'recipe title': u'Artichoke, Cherry Tomato, and Feta Salad with Artichoke-Pesto Crostini', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Why you'll make it: Because it's the classic side salad reconsidered, with lush peaches standing in for tomatoes.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'70%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 large ripe peaches', u'2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, divided', u'6 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 1/2 tablespoons whipping cream', u'1/3 cup finely chopped fresh chives', u'12 cups (loosely packed) arugula (about 6 ounces)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Wash peaches, rubbing to remove fuzz. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Chinese egg noodles are at Asian markets and in the Asian foods section of the supermarket.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'96%', 'ingredient list': [u'12 large dried shiitake mushrooms', u'1 tablespoon peanut oil', u'3 cups thinly sliced Napa cabbage', u'1 tablespoon minced peeled fresh ginger', u'1 tablespoon minced garlic', u'14 green onions; 12 halved lengthwise and cut on diagonal into 2-inch lengths, 2 chopped', u'3 tablespoons soy sauce', u'1 1-pound package fresh thin Chinese egg noodles or one 12-ounce package dried Chinese egg noodles', u'1/3 cup oriental sesame oil', u'2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', u'1 tablespoon unseasoned rice vinegar', u'2 teaspoons sugar', u'3 hard-boiled eggs; 2 thinly sliced, 1 chopped for garnish', u'1 cup chopped fresh cilantro'], 'preperation steps': [u'Place mushrooms in medium bowl; add enough boiling water to cover. Mix in 1 tablespoon soy sauce.', u'Cook noodles in large pot of boiling salted water until just tender but still firm to bite. Drain well; place in large bowl. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Egg whites are shaken into this gin-based sour, where they take on an airy, velvety texture.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'67%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 1/4 cups London dry gin', u'1 cup fresh lemon juice', u'3/4 cup Grand Marnier', u'4 large egg whites', u'12 teaspoons orange marmalade'], 'preperation steps': [u'Combine 2 1/4 cups London dry gin, 1 cup fresh lemon juice, and 3/4 cup Grand Marnier in a large pitcher; chill until very cold, at least 2 hours and up to 1 day. Mix 4 large egg whites* in a small jar; chill until cold. For each cocktail, shake 2 1/2 ounces gin mixture, 1/2 ounces egg white, and 1 teaspoon orange marmalade in a cocktail shaker until very frothy, about 1 minute. Fill with ice; shake until outside is frosty, about 30 seconds. Strain into coupe glass.'], 'chef': u'Rob Willey', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/autumn-gin-sour-51193080', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 12 servings', 'recipe title': u'Autumn Gin Sour', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'These dangerously addictive little bites fueled countless 1950s and \'60s bridge parties from Greenwood Mississippi, to Greenville, South Carolina, before being rescued from recipe-box oblivion by modern Southern cooks like Martha Hall Foose. And thank goodness. Magic happens when a cracker slowly sops up the fat from smoky, crisping bacon; it transforms into something more akin to piecrust. Unadorned, bacon crackers are pure pork perfection. The addition of a tine bundle of rosemary needles makes for a fancified version, while topping the "belt" of bacon with a bit of brown sugar adds a hint of sweet to the smoke.', 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'12 bacon slices (not thick-cut)', u'48 saltines or buttery crackers, such as Club brand', u'48 fresh rosemary tips (for Herbed Bacon Crackers)', u'6 teaspoons dark brown sugar (for Brown Sugar Bacon Crackers)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat the oven to 250\xb0F. Line the bottom of a broiler pan with foil for easy cleanup.', u'Cut the bacon slices in half lengthwise and then crosswire to create 4 long strips.', u'Arrange the crackers on a work surface and wrap a bacon strip around each cracker, overlapping the ends on top.', u'If making Herbed Bacon Crackers, tuck a base of rosemary tips under overlapping ends of bacon. If making Brown Sugar Bacon Crackers, carefully sprinkle 1/8 teaspoon brown sugar on the top side of each cracker, pressing to help it adhere (avoid getting sugar on the cracker or it will burn.)', u'Set a perforated rack on top of the foil-lined broiler pan and arrange the crackers seam-side down 1/2 apart in a single layer and bake for 1 to 1 1/2 hours, until the bacon is at your desired level of crispness. Transfer the crackers to a cooling rack and cool completely before serving.'], 'chef': u'tors of Garden & Gun', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/bacon-crackers-classic-herbed-and-brown-sugar', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 48 Crackers, Serves 12', 'recipe title': u'Bacon Crackers', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Skip the bacon if you like and substitute 2 tablespoons melted butter instead.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'86%', 'ingredient list': [u'12 large eggs', u'3 slices of bacon', u'Melted butter', u'1/3 cup mayonnaise', u'2 teaspoons Dijon mustard', u'1 heaping tablespoon chopped scallions', u'Kosher salt', u'Freshly ground black pepper', u'Thinly sliced scallions'], 'preperation steps': [u'Place 12 large eggs in a large saucepan; add water to cover by 1". Add melted butter if needed to measure 2 tablespoons.', u'Finely mash reserved yolks, bacon fat (and/or butter), 1/3 cup mayonnaise, 2 teaspoons Dijon mustard, and 1 heaping tablespoon chopped scallions in a medium bowl; season with kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper.', u'Transfer to a large resealable freezer bag, then cut 1/2" off 1 corner. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Who says pigs can't fly? Take a few boneless pork chops, add some bacon and a little creativity, and Pig Wings are on the menu! The bacon adds great flavor and keeps the loin meat from getting dry. These look delicious and are a little unusual, so they make a fabulous smoked appetizer with barbecue sauce for dipping. The kids will love them.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'Four 1-inch-thick boneless pork chops', u'12 slices bacon (do not use thick sliced)', u'Barbecue Rub #67', u'Barbecue sauce, for dipping'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cut each pork chop into three strips. {'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'12 fresh figs', u'1/3 cup plus 2 tablespoons sugar', u'1/2 cup water', u'1/4 cup plus 1 tablespoon Grand Marnier or other orange-flavored liqueur', u'1 cup chilled heavy cream'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 300\xb0F.', u'Prick bottom of each fig several times and stand figs in a buttered 9- to 10-inch flameproof gratin dish or ovenproof skillet. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Tortilla \xe0 la Basquaise au Thon et \xe0 la Tapenade', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'83%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 medium-size red bell peppers', u'2 medium-size green bell peppers', u'3 tablespoons olive oil', u'2 medium onions, chopped', u'1 pound tomatoes, chopped', u'4 ounces 1/4-inch-thick slices Black Forest ham, cut into matchstick-size strips', u'3 garlic cloves, chopped', u'3 large fresh thyme sprigs', u'1 bay leaf', u'8 large eggs', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper', u'1 6-ounce can water-packed albacore tuna, drained, flaked', u'1/2 cup tapenade (olive paste)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Char peppers over gas flame or in broiler until blackened on all sides. Add tomatoes and next 4 ingredients. Reduce heat to medium-low; cover and simmer 25 minutes to blend flavors. Stir in roasted peppers. Whisk eggs, salt and pepper in bowl to blend. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in large deep nonstick ovenproof skillet over medium-low heat. Serve warm or at room temperature.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/basque-style-tortilla-with-tuna-and-tapenade-105071', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Basque-Style Tortilla with Tuna and Tapenade', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Are you in love with a hard-core carnivore who simply won't touch the green stuff? Well, here's the perfect way to get your sweetie to eat less meaty. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Looking for an excuse to chase away the late-January blahs? Celebrate Burns Night on January 25. This drink\u2014perfect for Scotch lovers\u2014is named for the famed Scottish poet Robert Burns, who wrote "Auld Lang Syne." Since this drink is essentially all spirits (with no juice or mixers), traditionally it would be stirred rather than shaken. The method here, for making a bottled version, deviates from that rule, but it\'s effective for serving large group. It\'s also rather strong!', 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'12 ounces (1 1/2 cups) Scotch', u'12 ounces (1 1/2 cups) sweet vermouth (such as Carpano Antica)', u'5 ounces (1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons) water', u'2 ounces (1/4 cup) B\xe9n\xe9dictine', u'8 lemon twists for garnish'], 'preperation steps': [u'In a pitcher that holds at least 5 cups, combine the Scotch, vermouth, water, and B\xe9n\xe9dictine and stir well. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'We came up with this alternative to braised rabbit as a way to eat rabbit in the summer. If possible, ask the butcher to bone a rabbit for you. Be sure to distinguish between the legs and the loins (or saddle). In Canada, asking for the kidneys is no problem. In the United States, it is hit or miss.', 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 rabbit, divided into 2 legs, 2 loins, and 2 kidneys', u'4 slices bacon, cut into 3 pieces each', u'12 pitted prunes', u'1 red onion, cut into 12 pieces', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'2 large sprigs rosemary', u'1 tablespoon canola oil', u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Drizzle the olive oil evenly over the skewers, then sprinkle with the salt. Pluck the needles from the rosemary sprigs, and add a few pinches to each skewer.', u'4. Warm the canola oil and butter in a large frying pan over high heat. When the butter has melted and the fat is hot, add the skewers and cook, turning once, for 4 minutes on each side. Remove the pan from the heat and let the skewers rest for 3 minutes before serving.'], 'chef': u'Fred\xe9ric Morin, David McMillan & Meredith Erickson', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/brochette-de-lapin-aux-pruneaux-368960', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 skewers', 'recipe title': u'Brochette de Lapin \u2028aux Pruneaux', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Up until I was about 12 years old, my parents took my sister, Tracy, and me to Easter service at St. Louis Cathedral in Jackson Square. The only way they could keep us in check during mass was by bribing us to be good and quiet with promises of post-church beignets at Caf\xe9 de Monde across the street. We'd get so excited about the prospect of massive quantities of sugar that we probably would have done pretty much anything to ensure we got beignets before going home. Mom was a bit of a stickler when it came to sweets; I mean, at our house, Raisin Bran\xae was considered toeing the line of junk food! So you can only imagine how amped up we were at the mere prospect of real, honest-to-goodness fried dough piled sky-high with a mountain of powdered sugar.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'93%', 'ingredient list': [u'3/4 cup whole milk', u'1 1/2 cups buttermilk', u'4 teaspoons active dry yeast', u'2 1/2 tablespoons sugar', u'3 1/2 cups bread flour plus extra for flouring work surface', u'1/2 teaspoon baking soda', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'Peanut oil for frying', u"Confectioners' sugar for serving, as much as you think you'll need\u2014then double that!"], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat the milk in a small saucepan over medium-high heat until small bubbles form at the surface. Remove from the heat, add the buttermilk, and then pour into a stand mixer bowl. Whisk in the yeast and the sugar and set aside for 5 minutes. Add the flour, baking soda, and salt, and mix on low speed, using a dough hook, until the dry ingredients are moistened, 3 to 4 minutes. Increase the mixer speed to medium and continue mixing until the dough forms a loose ball and is still quite wet and tacky, 1 to 2 minutes longer. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and set the dough aside in a draft-free spot for 1 hour.', u'Pour enough peanut oil into a large pot to fill it to a depth of 3 inches and bring to a temperature of 375\xb0F over medium heat (this will take about 20 minutes). Line a plate with paper towels and set aside.', u"Lightly flour your work surface and turn the dough out on it. Sprinkle the top of the dough with flour, gently press to flatten, fold it in half, and gently tuck the ends under to create a rough-shaped round. Dust again and roll the dough out into a \xbd-inch- to \xb9/\xb3 -inch-thick circle. Let the dough rest for 1 minute before using a chef's knife, a bench knife, or a pizza wheel to cut the dough into 1 1/2-inch squares (you should get about 48).", u"Gently stretch a beignet lengthwise and carefully drop it into the oil. Add a few beignets (don't overcrowd them, otherwise the oil will cool down and the beignets will soak up oil and be greasy) and fry until puffed and golden brown, turning them often with a slotted spoon, for 2 to 3 minutes. Transfer to the prepared plate to drain while you cook the rest. Serve while still warm, buried under a mound of confectioners' sugar, with hot coffee on the side.", u'The beignet dough can be made up to 8 hours in advance of frying. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and spray it with nonstick cooking spray. The beignets can be fried straight from the refrigerator.'], 'chef': u'David Guas and Raquel Pelzel', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/buttermilk-beignets-356850', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes about 4 dozen beignets', 'recipe title': u'Buttermilk Beignets', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Who knew Cabernet and cranberries would make such a dynamic duo? Add dried figs (plumped in the Cabernet ahead of time), and you end up with a winey, fruity fig bar, minus the cookie. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Sold at Mexican street stands in large, clear barrels\u2014the better to show off their festive colors\u2014agua frescas, or "fresh waters," can be made with all kinds of fruits and herbs, the riper the better.
