{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Oyster-roast masters like Louis Osteen, who have been doing this for years, use huge pits or grills that are large enough to cook sausages, oysters, and clams all at the same time. We recommend using whatever type of oyster is locally available to you. Examine them carefully\u2014discard any that smell bad. If any are cracked or open, and don't close when tapped, discard those as well. When roasting oysters, it's important to keep them moist enough to create steam (hence the soaked burlap or water in the roasting pan). If roasted dry, they can explode.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'50%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/2 lb fresh bratwurst sausages', u'1/2 lb smoked bratwurst sausages', u'3/4 lb Mexican chorizo (spicy fresh pork sausages)', u'12 dozen oysters, well scrubbed', u'4 dozen small hard-shelled (littleneck) clams, well scrubbed', u'1 (12-oz) bottle of beer (not dark)', u'Accompaniments: Lowcountry a\xefoli , cocktail sauce, lemon wedges, and melted butter', u'Special equipment: about 2 yards burlap (for grill method) or heavy-duty foil, 12 oyster knives, and 12 oven mitts or thick kitchen towels'], 'preperation steps': [u'Prepare grill for cooking with about 7 pounds of briquets. (You\u2019ll need about 15 pounds of briquets total.)', u'Prick bratwursts and chorizo in several places with a fork, then grill, covered, turning occasionally, until browned and cooked through, about 10 minutes.', u'Scatter about 12 additional briquets over glowing coals and replace rack.', u'Fold burlap into a triple layer slightly smaller than grill surface and soak completely with water. Put 3 to 4 dozen oysters directly on grill rack, cover with wet burlap, and roast, without grill cover, until shells just begin to open (about 1/16 inch) or give slightly when squeezed with tongs, about 10 minutes. (If necessary, sprinkle more water over burlap to keep moist.) Serve oysters as they open, removing them with tongs, and roast any unopened oysters a few minutes longer, replacing burlap. Roast remaining oysters in 2 or 3 batches in same manner, adding about 12 more briquets between batches to keep fire hot and resoaking burlap thoroughly.', u'Follow the charcoal grill method for sausages and oysters, or use a roasting pan and foil for oysters and follow stovetop-oven method.', u'Preheat oven to 500\xb0F.', u'Heat 2 heavy ridged grill pans or skillets over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then cook sausages, turning occasionally, until browned and cooked through, 15 to 20 minutes.', u'Heat a 17- by 12-inch roasting pan (2 to 3 inches deep) on bottom shelf of oven until very hot. Remove from oven and quickly fill with 3 to 4 dozen oysters and 1 cup water, then cover pan tightly with heavy-duty foil. Roast oysters until shells just begin to open (about 1/16 inch) or give slightly when squeezed with tongs, about 10 minutes. Serve oysters as they open, removing them with tongs, and roast any unopened oysters a few minutes longer, covered with foil. Roast remaining oysters in 2 or 3 batches in same manner.', u'Steam clams in beer in a 6- to 8-quart pot over moderately high heat, covered, until clams open, about 10 minutes (discard any unopened clams after 15 minutes). Transfer clams as opened to a platter. Carefully pour clam broth into cups, avoiding any sediment, for dunking clams if still sandy.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/oyster-roast-104227', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 12 servings', 'recipe title': u'Oyster Roast', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'If you are using a single 12-inch nonstick skillet for this recipe, make the red cabbage and onions first. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'In North India these legume wafers are called papad and are dry-roasted over a flame, but in the South they are deep-fried until they form lots of air bubbles and become light and puffy. They are sold in many flavors, but plain is preferred in Kerala. Pappadams are always part of a Sadhya: You crush one up and mix it together with rice, dhal, and ghee. The pappadam helps to bind all the ingredients together so you can form balls when eating with your hand. Store-bought wafers are used almost exclusively by Indian cooks because the traditional recipes are labor-intensive and require days of drying in the hot sun. This recipe is part of our menu for Sadhya, a South Indian feast.', 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'About 5 cups vegetable oil', u'12 plain pappadams (about 4 inches in diameter)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat about 1 1/2 inches oil in a wok or 4- to 5-quart heavy pot over high heat until a tiny piece of pappadam dropped in oil quickly bobs to surface and expands (about 350\xb0F).', u"Reduce heat to medium-high. Slip 1 pappadam into oil and let it expand to its full size and turn light brown, 10 to 30 seconds. Using tongs, flip it over quickly and fry other side until light brown. Transfer to paper towels to drain. Repeat with remaining pappadams. (If pappadams don't expand immediately, oil is too cool; if they brown too quickly, oil is too hot.)"], 'chef': u'Maya Kaimal', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/pappadams-lentil-wafers-394658', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 12 pappadams', 'recipe title': u'Pappadams (Lentil Wafers)', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Lorraine Stevenski of Clearwater, Florida, writes: "I cook just about every weeknight for my family. To speed things up, I do my grocery shopping on weekends, along with making quick breads, cakes, and other baked goods. My 12-year-old son, Billy, is also a big help in the kitchen. He has practically become my personal sous chef with all the chopping and grilling he does."', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'78%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 cups all purpose flour', u'3/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'2 tablespoons baking powder', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper', u'1/2 cup (1 stick) chilled unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley or chives', u'1 cup (or more) chilled whole milk'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 400\xb0F. Lightly sprinkle heavy large baking sheet with flour. Combine 3 cups flour, 1/2 cup cheese, sugar, baking powder, salt, and pepper in large bowl; whisk until well blended. Add butter and rub in with fingertips until coarse meal forms. Mix in parsley. Gradually add 1 cup milk, tossing with fork until moist clumps form and adding more milk by tablespoonfuls if mixture is dry. Gather dough into ball. Press out on lightly floured work surface to 8-inch round, about 1 inch thick. Using 2-inch-diameter cutter, cut out biscuits. Repeat, gathering and pressing out dough and cutting biscuits until all dough is used. Arrange biscuits on prepared baking sheet. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup cheese.', u'Bake until biscuits are puffed and light golden and tester inserted into centers comes out clean, about 15 minutes. Transfer biscuits to towel-lined basket and serve warm.'], 'chef': u'Lorraine Stevenski, Clearwater, FL', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/parmesan-and-parsley-biscuits-108941', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes about 12', 'recipe title': u'Parmesan and Parsley Biscuits', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"If I were making dessert for one of my favorite movie stars, George Clooney or Meryl Streep, I'd bake this galette because it is simple, rustic, and honest. If you want to serve it to a large group for a special gathering, the recipe doubles easily to make a 12-inch galette. Accompany with a dollop of whipped cream or vanilla ice cream and you have a totally scrumptious home-style dessert. --Marcy", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'56%', 'ingredient list': [u'3/4 cup unbleached all-purpose flour, plus more for working with the dough', u'6 tablespoons whole wheat flour', u'1 tablespoon granulated sugar', u'Scant 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/2 cup plus 1 tablespoon cold unsalted butter, cut into small chunks', u'1 large egg', u'1 1/2 teaspoons milk', u'1 tablespoon beaten egg or heavy cream', u'Turbinado sugar, for sprinkling', u'1/2 cup granulated sugar', u'3 tablespoons unbleached all-purpose flour or tapioca flour', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'6 to 8 soft peaches or with give, peeled, halved, pitted, and cut into 1/4 to 1/2-inch-thick wedges'], 'preperation steps': [u'To make the pastry, combine the flours, granulated sugar, and salt in a food processor and pulse until blended. Scatter the butter over the flour mixture and pulse until it looks like coarse sand. (Alternatively, combine the flour, sugar, and salt in a bowl and work the mixture with a pastry blender until it has a sand-like texture.) In a small bowl or cup, whisk together the 1 egg and the milk until blended, pour into the food processor or bowl all at once, and pulse or gently mix by hand until the dough forms a rough clump. Do not overwork the dough to avoid toughness.', u"Lightly flour a work surface. Transfer the dough to the floured surface, form it into a ball, and then flatten into a disk 1 to 1 1/2 inches thick. Don't knead it! Wrap it in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 1/2 to 2 hours or for up to 1 day.", u'When the dough is well chilled, preheat the oven to 375\xb0F.', u'Remove the dough from the refrigerator and let it warm at room temperature for about 10 minutes. Meanwhile, make the filling. In a small bowl, stir together the granulated sugar, the flour, and the cinnamon, mixing well. Place the peaches in a bowl, sprinkle the sugar mixture over the top, and toss gently. (If the peaches are tart, you may want to add a little more sugar.)', u'Lay a large sheet of parchment paper on a work surface and dust the parchment with flour. Place the dough on the floured parchment and roll it out into a round about 11 inches in diameter and 1/8 inch thick. Transfer the pastry with the parchment to a rimmed or rimless baking sheet large enough to accommodate the pastry round comfortably. Starting 1 to 1 1/2 inches from the edge of the round, arrange the peach wedges in a single layer in concentric circles, continuing until you reach the center of the round. Fold the outer edges of the pastry over the peaches, creating overlapping folds as you work around the perimeter. If your peaches are extra juicy, leave the extra juice in the bowl so that the filling does not overflow in the oven. Brush the pastry border with 1 tablespoon beaten egg and then sprinkle lightly with the turbinado sugar.', u'Bake for 50 to 60 minutes, until the crust is golden and the filling is bubbling. If your galette has a lot of juice, you may want to place a second pan on the lowest rack in the oven under the baking sheet to catch any juices that overflow.', u'Let the galette cool on the baking sheet on a wire rack. Cut into wedges to serve.'], 'chef': u'Marcy, Nikiko & David Mas Masumoto', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/peach-galette-51185810', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes one 8 to 9-inch galette; serves 6 to 8', 'recipe title': u'Peach Galette', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'"Although desserts are not my forte, I wanted to send in this simple yet impressive dessert, which contains only five ingredients," says Debra Anderson of Destin, Florida. "It reminds me of the beautiful pastries displayed in bakery shop windows in France."', 'rating': u'1/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'9 (17- by 12-inch) phyllo sheets (1/2 lb)', u'1 stick (1/2 cup) unsalted butter, melted', u'4 tablespoons vanilla sugar', u'3 firm-ripe pears (1 1/3 lb), peeled, cored, and sliced into very thin wedges', u'12 raspberries'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 400\xb0F. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Makes 12 to 16 servings.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'83%', 'ingredient list': [u'Nonstick vegetable oil spray', u'3 1/4 cups cake flour', u'2 teaspoons baking powder', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'2 cups sugar', u'1 cup (2 sticks) unsalted butter, room temperature', u'4 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'4 large eggs', u'1 cup whole milk', u'1 cup pecans, toasted, finely chopped', u'1/4 cup dark corn syrup', u'1/4 cup mild-flavored (light) molasses', u'1/2 teaspoon baking soda', u'2 teaspoons water', u'1 teaspoon baking soda', u'2 cups sugar', u'1 cup buttermilk', u'1 cup (2 sticks) unsalted butter', u'2 teaspoons dark corn syrup', u'1/2 cup bourbon', u'2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'Vanilla ice cream'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This elegant, light salad is ideal to serve as a first course. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'The chive oil would also be delicious drizzled over salmon or chicken. For very hungry guests, poach 12 eggs and serve each person two instead of one. WHAT TO DRINK: Prosecco, an Italian sparkler, is festive, delicious, and a good value.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'85%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh chives', u'1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice', u'1/4 teaspoon finely grated lemon peel', u'6 tablespoons white wine vinegar or unseasoned rice vinegar', u'6 to 12 large eggs', u'2 pounds medium asparagus spears, trimmed', u'3 tablespoons olive oil', u'3 ounces thinly sliced prosciutto'], 'preperation steps': [u'Blend extra-virgin olive oil, chives, and lemon juice in blender or processor until smooth. Bring water to slow simmer over medium heat. Add 3 tablespoons vinegar to each skillet. Carefully crack each egg into individual ramekins. Gently slide 1 egg at a time into simmering water, working in batches of 3 eggs for each skillet. Cook until whites are just set, about 3 minutes. Using slotted spoon, very gently transfer eggs to bowls with ice water, being careful not to break eggs. DO AHEAD Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and refrigerate eggs in bowls of ice water.', u'Preheat broiler. Spread asparagus in single layer on rimmed baking sheet. Drizzle with 3 tablespoons olive oil; turn asparagus to coat. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Broil asparagus 6 minutes. Turn asparagus over and continue to broil until crisp-tender and beginning to brown, about 6 minutes longer. Divide asparagus among 6 plates and drape prosciutto slices over.', u'Pour enough water into each of 2 large skillets to reach depth of 1 inch; bring to simmer. Pass remaining chive oil separately.'], 'chef': u'Jessica Strand', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/poached-eggs-with-roasted-asparagus-prosciutto-and-chive-oil-237898', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Poached Eggs with Roasted Asparagus, Prosciutto, and Chive Oil', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"My editor, Maria Guarnaschelli, suggested this recipe, based on her memory of a savory pie served at a London pub. One half of the pie was filled with pork and the other with apples. As I later learned, that dish has its roots in an eighteenth-century workingman's lunch called the Bedfordshire Clanger\u2014a hand-held pie filled with meat on one end and jam on the other. It was a compact way to serve lunch and dessert in one package.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'91%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 1/2 cups (350 g) all-purpose flour', u'2 teaspoons dried sage, finely crumbled', u'1/2 teaspoon table salt', u'16 tablespoons (2 sticks; 255 g) chilled unsalted butter, cut into small cubes', u'3 ounces (85 g) sharp Cheddar cheese, finely grated', u'6 to 8 tablespoons (90 to 120 ml) ice water', u'1 egg blended with 1 tablespoon water', u'Fresh sage leaves for garnish (optional)', u'1 1/2 pounds (about 3 large) firm-sweet apples (see Apple Notes), unpeeled, cored, and cut into 1/4-inch-thick wedges', u'1 1/2 pounds (about 3 large) firm-tart apples, unpeeled, cored, and cut into 1/4-inch-thick wedges', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1 small onion, very finely chopped', u'2 pounds (900 g) ground pork (preferably 15 to 17% fat)', u'1 tablespoon firmly packed light brown sugar', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/2 teaspoon ground ginger', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cloves', u'1/4 teaspoon ground allspice', u'3 1/2 tablespoons plain breadcrumbs'], 'preperation steps': [u"1. First make the crust: In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, sage, and salt until well combined. Sprinkle the butter cubes over the flour mixture and use your fingers to work them in (you want to rub your thumb against your fingertips, smearing the butter as you do so). Do this until the mixture looks like cornmeal with some pea-sized bits of butter remaining. Stir in the cheese with a fork until evenly distributed. Sprinkle 6 tablespoons ice water over the mixture and stir with a fork until the dough begins to come together. If needed, add an additional tablespoon or two of ice water (you shouldn't need much more). Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead three times. Gather the dough into a ball, then divide into two portions, making one slightly bigger than the other. Press each portion down into a disk and wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.", u'2. Make the filling: In a skillet over medium-low heat, cook the apples without any oil, stirring gently, until they just begin to soften, 5 to 7 minutes. Transfer to a dish and set aside. Add oil to the pan and increase the heat to medium-high. Add the onion, pork, brown sugar, salt, and spices. Cook, using a wooden spoon to break up the meat, until it is lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Let the meat mixture cool for 10 minutes, then transfer to a food processor. Add the breadcrumbs and pulse five times until the mixture has the texture of coarse sand. Set aside.', u'3. Prepare the crust: Unwrap the larger disk of dough and put it in the center of a large sheet of parchment paper or wax paper. Cover the dough with a second piece of parchment. Roll out, working from the center, to a 13-inch circle. Peel off the top piece of parchment and transfer the dough to a pie plate, peeled side down. Peel off the remaining parchment and press the crust into the sides of the pie plate, draping any excess over the edge. Unwrap the smaller disk of dough and put it in the center of a large sheet of parchment paper. Cover the dough with a second piece of parchment. Roll out, working from the center, to an 11-inch circle. Set aside.', u'4. Preheat the oven to 425\xb0F and set a rack to the second-to-bottom position. Fill the pie: Pour the meat mixture into the bottom crust and gently smooth the top with a spatula. Arrange the cooked apple slices over the meat, pressing down to make the whole construction as smooth and neat as possible. Peel the top sheet of parchment off the top crust. Transfer, peeled side down, to the pie, then peel off the remaining parchment. Using a sharp knife, make two 3-inch slashes in the crust to allow steam to escape. Fold the edges of the bottom crust up over the top crust and crimp the edges to seal. Brush the crust with the egg wash and decorate with sage leaves, if desired. Bake at 425\xb0F for 10 minutes, then reduce the heat to 375\xb0F and bake until the crust is golden brown, 25 to 35 minutes more. Remove from oven and let cool 25 minutes before serving.'], 'chef': u'Amy Traverso', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/pork-and-apple-pie-with-cheddar-sage-crust-368089', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 to 10 servings', 'recipe title': u'Pork and Apple Pie with Cheddar-Sage Crust', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"This is an American-style Italian frittata or Spanish tortilla, an open-faced omelet that's a great last-minute brunch dish. The potato chips are layered throughout yet still retain their firm texture. (You don't even need to add salt to the eggs, because the potato chips provide the seasoning.) You can enjoy this warm or at room temperature, with sour cream on the side. Or if you're a ketchup-on-your-eggs person, use the San Marzano ketchup. (After I came up with this dish, I saw similar versions done by Jos\xe9 Andr\xe9s and Ferran Adri\xe0. A good idea is a good idea no matter how many people come up with it.)", 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'12 large eggs', u'3 tablespoons heavy cream', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground white pepper', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley', u'1 tablespoon minced fresh chives', u'6 cups plain kettle-cooked potato chips', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter or vegetable oil'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Preheat the oven to 375\xb0F. In a large bowl, whisk the eggs, cream, white pepper, parsley, and chives together until combined. Fold in the potato chips until they are completely covered in the egg mixture, but try not to crush the chips too much. Let stand for 10 minutes, until the chips soften slightly.', u'2. Heat the butter in an ovenproof 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, swirling the pan to coat the bottom completely, until very hot. Carefully pour in the egg mixture and spread it evenly in the pan, then immediately reduce the heat to low. Cook until the eggs are set and the bottom is light golden, about 15 minutes. If the bottom is golden but the eggs are still runny on the top, transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake until the eggs are completely set, 3 to 4 minutes.', u'3. To serve, invert a large flat plate over the pan and flip the pan and the plate to invert the omelet onto the plate. Let stand for at least 5 minutes before cutting into wedges and serving.'], 'chef': u'Richard Blais', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/potato-chip-omelet-51190640', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 4', 'recipe title': u'Potato Chip Omelet', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Get the irresistible flavor of samosas without all the frying. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Galette des Rois', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'95%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/4 cup pure almond paste (2 ounces)', u'1/4 cup granulated sugar', u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened', u'2 large eggs', u'1/4 teaspoon vanilla', u'1/4 teaspoon almond extract', u'2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'1 (17 1/4-oz) package frozen puff pastry sheets, thawed', u'1 dried bean such as a lima bean (optional)', u'1/2 tablespoon confectioners sugar'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 450\xb0F.', u'Pur\xe9e almond paste, granulated sugar, butter, and a pinch of salt in a food processor until smooth. Cut out an 11-inch round by tracing around an inverted plate with tip of a paring knife. Transfer round to a buttered large baking sheet (not dark metal, or pastry may brown too much), discarding trimmings, and chill. Repeat procedure with second pastry sheet, leaving round on floured surface.', u'Beat remaining egg with a fork and brush some over top of second round. Score round decoratively all over using tip of knife, then make several small slits all the way through pastry, at about 2-inch intervals, to create steam vents.', u'Brush some of egg in a 1-inch-wide border around edge of chilled pastry round (on baking sheet). Mound almond cream in center of chilled round, spreading slightly, and bury bean in cream. Immediately cover with decorated round and press edges together lightly. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"It seems na\xefve to talk about building a business on a single muffin, but in case of this pumpkin muffin, it's the truth. Instead of the heavy, dark-brown pumpkin muffins people expected, we offered them a light-textured, attractive, pastel orange mini-cake, sprinkled with sunflower seeds. Word about my baking spread, thanks to the success of those muffins. Thank you, Peggy Cullen, for sharing these beauties.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'67%', 'ingredient list': [u'Softened unsalted butter, for the pan', u'3 2/3 cups pastry flour, sifted', u'1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon baking powder', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/4 teaspoon ground ginger', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg', u'1/4 teaspoon fine sea salt', u'8 tablespoons (1 stick) unsalted butter, chilled and cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u'1 1/3 cups superfine sugar', u'4 large eggs, at room temperature, beaten', u'One 15-ounce can solid-pack pumpkin', u'1 cup seedless golden or dark raisins', u'1/4 cup hulled unsalted sunflower seeds'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Position a rack in the center of the oven and preheat to 400\u02daF. Brush the insides of 12 to 14 muffin cups with softened butter, then brush the top of the pan.', u'2. Sift the flour, baking powder, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, and salt together into a medium bowl. Beat the butter in the bowl of a heavy-duty stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment on high speed until creamy, about I minute. Gradually beat in the sugar and continue beating, scraping the sides of the bowl often with a silicone spatula, until the mixture is very light in color and texture, about 5 minutes. Gradually beat in the eggs. Reduce the mixture speed to low. Beat in the pumpkin; the mixture may look curdled. In thirds, beat in the flour mixture, scraping down the sides of the bowl often, and mix until smooth. Add the raisins. Increase the speed to high and beat until the batter has a slight sheen, about 15 seconds, no longer.', u'3. Using a 2 1/2 inch-diameter ice-cream scoop, portion the batter, rounded side up, into the prepared cups. Sprinkle the tops with the sunflower seeds.', u'4. Bake for 10 minutes. Reduce the oven temperature to 375\xb0F and continue baking until the tops of the muffins are golden brown and a wire cake tester inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean, about 15 minutes more.', u'5. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Remove the muffins from the pan and cool completely.'], 'chef': u'Sarabeth Levine', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/pumpkin-muffins-362109', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 12 to 14 muffins', 'recipe title': u'Pumpkin Muffins', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"The French custom of serving radishes with sweet butter and sea salt is a lesson in simplicity; there's something so satisfying about a lick of creamy butter against the snap of peppery radish. {'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'75%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 large egg yolks', u'1/4 cup powdered sugar', u'4 tablespoons saba*', u'2 tablespoons water', u'1/2 cup chilled whipping cream', u'12 ounces fresh raspberries'], 'preperation steps': [u'Whisk egg yolks, sugar, saba, and 2 tablespoons water to blend in top of double boiler over barely simmering water (do not allow upper pot to touch water); whisk constantly until mixture thickens and thermometer registers 160\xb0F, about 4 minutes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Raspberries are pureed and strained, then the mixture is partially frozen, and, finally, the slush is served in sugar-rimmed glasses. If you prepare the dessert ahead and freeze the mixture until hard, defrost it in the refrigerator for an hour or so before serving, to achieve the desired silky consistency.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 12-ounce package IQF frozen unsweetened raspberries, defrosted, or 12 ounces fresh raspberries', u'1/3 cup seedless black raspberry preserves', u'1/4 cup water', u'2 teaspoons fresh lime juice', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'4 fresh mint sprigs'], 'preperation steps': [u'Push the raspberries and preserves through a food mill, then strain through a fine-mesh strainer set over a stainless steel bowl to eliminate any remaining seeds. Dip the rims of four stemmed glasses (preferably tulip champagne glasses) into the lime juice and then into the sugar, to create a border. Serve immediately.'], 'chef': u'ques P\xe9pin', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/raspberry-velvet-366530', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'4', 'recipe title': u'Raspberry Velvet', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Aperol is similar to Campari but sweeter and less boozy. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Wassail is a deeply rooted tradition in the Midwest and a popular regional staple throughout the cold-weather season. Every winter as the holidays approach, many Wisconsinites still take part in the age-old "wassailing of apple trees," a ritual dating back to the fifteenth century that involves sprinkling wassail on apple trees to ensure a strong, healthy harvest and to keep the trees safe from evil spirits. Wassail always blends apples and winter holiday spices, but the sweeteners and spirits often change from recipe to recipe. This version comes from the Rittenhouse Inn in Bayfield, an area that leads apple production in Wisconsin. The cranberry juice is a perfectly tart counterpart to the sweetness of the apple cider and brown sugar, and the bourbon lends a full, rich quality, and the ginger, pepper, and spices offer a final kick of flavor.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'12 whole cloves', u'6 whole allspice', u'1/2 inch fresh ginger root, peeled and sliced', u'3 cinnamon sticks', u'12 whole white peppercorns', u'1 gallon fresh apple cider', u'6 ounces cranberry juice', u'3/4 cup light brown sugar, packed', u'10-12 ounces bourbon', u'cheesecloth, kitchen string, large pot', u'mugs', u'ground nutmeg and 1 cinnamon stick per drink'], 'preperation steps': [u'To make the wassail, wrap the cloves, allspice, ginger, cinnamon sticks, and peppercorns in cheesecloth and tie with kitchen string. Combine the cider, cranberry juice, brown sugar, and spice bag in a large pot over high heat. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer 30 minutes.', u'For each serving, put one ounce of the bourbon into a mug and fill it with hot Wassail. Garnish with a dusting of nutmeg and a cinnamon stick.'], 'chef': u'the Editors of Imbibe Magazine', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/rittenhouse-inn-wassail-punch-367909', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 10 to 12', 'recipe title': u'Rittenhouse Inn Wassail Punch', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'To save a step, rather than making the Balsamic Pan Sauce over the carved portions of the goose. This recipe must be started at least a day ahead.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 8- to 10-pound heirloom geese, rinsed, patted dry, excess fat pockets removed, wing tips and necks reserved', u'12 large fresh sage sprigs', u'1 bunch fresh thyme sprigs', u'4 lemons, pierced all over with fork', u'2 heads of garlic, unpeeled, cut in half horizontally to expose cloves', u'2 medium onions, unpeeled, quartered through root ends', u'Aged balsamic vinegar or Balsamic Pan Sauce'], 'preperation steps': [u'Using small sharp knife, make small slits in skin all over breasts, sides, legs, and thighs of each goose to allow fat to be released during roasting (do not pierce flesh). Refrigerate uncovered at least 1 day and up to 2 days for skin to dry.', u'Preheat oven to 325\xb0F. Sprinkle main cavity of each goose with salt and pepper. Place half of herb sprigs, lemons, garlic, and onions into each. Using small metal pins, skewer cavities closed. Place each goose, breast side down, on rack. Pierce skin on back all over with small sharp knife (do not pierce flesh).', u'Roast geese 1 1/2 hours. Using large spoon or bulb baster, transfer fat collected in bottom of roasting pan to bowl; leave juices in pan. Turn geese breast side up. Continue to roast geese until legs move easily, skin around thighs and breasts is puffed, and thermometer inserted into thickest part of thigh registers 175\xb0F to 180\xb0F, about 2 hours longer. Transfer to platter; tent loosely with foil. Let rest 30 to 45 minutes. If desired, reserve roasting pan with juices to make pan sauce.', u'Carve geese and serve with aged balsamic vinegar or Balsamic Pan Sauce.'], 'chef': u'Bruce Aidells and Nancy Oakes', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/roast-heirloom-goose-with-balsamic-vinegar-233402', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Roast Heirloom Goose with Balsamic Vinegar', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"The roast can be prepped one day ahead. What to drink: A robust, medium- to full-bodied red, such as an Italian Barbera. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"This is an easy way to enjoy figs that aren't dead ripe. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Malcolm Livingston II, the pastry chef at WD~50 in New York City, shared this recipe exclusively with Epicurious.', 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 cup root beer candies (about 14 candies total)*', u'2 tablespoons nonfat milk powder*', u'1 1/2 tablespoons cornstarch', u'1/8 teaspoon kosher salt', u'3/4 cup whole milk', u'2/3 cup root beer soda', u'1 1/2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'3 large egg yolks', u'Nonstick vegetable-oil spray', u'3/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons sugar', u'1/4 cup glucose syrup*', u'3 tablespoons water', u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter', u'7 ounces raw or roasted unsalted cashews', u'1/2 teaspoon smoked or kosher salt', u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'Equipment: Commercial blender, such as a Vitamix Vita-Prep; Robot Coupe or food processor; heatproof rubber spatula; large rimmed baking sheet; nonstick baking mat, such as a Silpat; stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment; 4 chilled glasses for serving'], 'preperation steps': [u'In a commercial blender, grind 1/2 cup root beer candies, the milk powder, cornstarch, and salt into a powder.', u'In a medium saucepan over moderate heat, bring the whole milk and root beer soda to a simmer. Carefully add the hot mixture to the powder in the blender, and with the blender on low, process for 1 minute. Add the butter and egg yolks, then gradually increase the blender speed to high and blend until smooth, about 1 minute.', u'Carefully pour the hot pudding back into the medium saucepan, place over moderate heat, and cook, whisking vigorously, until it comes to a simmer. Continue cooking, whisking constantly, until the pudding is very thick, about 2 more minutes. Remove from the heat and let cool to room temperature, about 30 minutes. Place plastic wrap directly on the surface of the pudding and refrigerate at least 1 hour. DO AHEAD: The pudding can be prepared ahead and kept, covered in the refrigerator, up to 2 days.', u'Spray a heatproof rubber spatula with nonstick vegetable oil spray and have ready. Line a large rimmed baking sheet with a nonstick baking mat or spray with nonstick vegetable oil spray.', u'In a medium saucepan over high heat, bring the sugar, glucose syrup, and water to a simmer. Cook, swirling the pan occasionally but not stirring, until the mixture turns a medium-dark caramel color, about 5 minutes. Add the butter, cashews, and salt and use the sprayed rubber spatula to stir the mixture until the cashews are completely covered in caramel.', u'Carefully pour the nougatine onto the prepared baking sheet, and use the rubber spatula to spread it into a thin, even layer. Set aside to cool and harden, about 30 minutes. Once the nougatine is completely cool, use your hands to break it into small pieces then transfer to a Robot Coupe or food processor, and grind into a coarse powder. DO AHEAD: Nougatine can be made ahead and kept, in an airtight container at room temperature, for 1 week.', u'In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment, beat the cream and sugar until medium peaks form.', u'Place the remaining 1/2 cup root beer candies in a resealable plastic bag and use a meat mallet or rolling pin to crush them into small pieces.', u'Divide the chilled pudding among 4 chilled glasses. Dollop each pudding with whipped cream and garnish with the crushed cashew nougatine and root beer candy pieces.'], 'chef': u'Malcolm Livingston II', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/root-beer-pudding-51222410', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 servings', 'recipe title': u'Root Beer Pudding', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This fluffy flat bread has large, irregular holes thanks to a wet, sticky dough and gentle handling during mixing.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'95%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 1/2 cups (13.25 ounces/371 grams) Gold Medal "Better for Bread" flour*', u'1/4 cup (1.25 ounces/35 grams) whole-wheat flour', u'1 1/4 teaspoons instant yeast (also known as rapid-rise or bread machine yeast)', u'1 1/2 teaspoons fine sea salt', u'1 1/2 cups (12 ounces/336 grams) water, room temperature (70 to 90\xb0F)', u'1 teaspoon honey', u'1/4 cup plus 4 teaspoons (2 ounces/56 grams) extra-virgin olive oil', u'Vegetable oil or nonstick vegetable-oil spray', u'2 tablespoons fresh whole rosemary needles', u'2 teaspoons coarse sea salt such as fleur de sel', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'*If unavailable, substitute 1 1/4 cups bread flour and 1 1/4 cups unbleached all-purpose flour', u'Special equipment: stand mixer fitted with whisk attachment and dough hook, 3-quart or larger bowl or dough-rising container, masking tape, heavy baking sheet, baking stone or second heavy baking sheet, large aluminum-foil-lined cast-iron pan or heavy, rimmed baking pan'], 'preperation steps': [u'In bowl of stand mixer fitted with whisk attachment, whisk together bread flour, whole-wheat flour, and yeast, then whisk in sea salt. Whisk in water, honey, and 1/4 cup olive oil.', u'Attach dough hook to stand mixer and mix on low (#2 on Kitchen Aid) until dough begins to pull away from sides of bowl, about 3 minutes. (Dough should be very sticky to touch and should not pull away from bowl completely. However, if dough does not pull away at all, gradually beat in up to 1/4 cup additional flour.)', u"Using vegetable oil or nonstick vegetable-oil spray, lightly oil 3-quart or larger bowl (or dough-rising container). Transfer dough to bowl and lightly oil or spray top of dough. Using tape, mark outside of bowl to approximately double current height of dough. Cover bowl tightly with plastic wrap and let dough rise in warm place (75\xb0F to 80\xb0F, see Chef's Notes) 30 minutes. Using oiled hands, transfer dough to lightly oiled work surface. Gently stretch bottom of dough and fold up to center, then repeat with left side, right side, and top. Round dough package then transfer to bowl, smooth side up, and lightly oil or spray top of dough. Cover bowl tightly with plastic wrap. Let dough rise until doubled in size and depression holds when pressed gently with fingertip, about 30 minutes to 1 hour.", u'Brush heavy baking sheet with 2 teaspoons olive oil. Transfer dough to sheet and, using fingertips, very gently press into 12-by 5-by 1/2-inch rectangle. Brush top of dough with remaining 2 teaspoons olive oil.', u'Lightly coat sheet of plastic wrap with vegetable oil or nonstick vegetable-oil spray. Cover dough with oiled plastic wrap and let rise in warm place until doubled in size and depression very slowly fills in when pressed gently with fingertip, about 1 hour.', u'While dough is rising, position rack near bottom of oven and top with baking stone or heavy baking sheet. Set aluminum-foil-lined cast-iron pan or heavy rimmed baking pan on floor of oven and preheat oven to 475\xb0F for 1 hour.', u"Using fingertips, deeply dimple dough all over. Sprinkle with rosemary, coarse salt, and pepper. Quickly transfer baking sheet to hot baking stone (see Chef's Notes) and add 1/2 cup ice cubes to pan beneath.", u'Bake bread, rotating pan 180 degrees halfway through, until top is golden brown and skewer inserted into center comes out clean (instant-read thermometer inserted into center will register about 210\xb0F), 12 to 15 minutes. Transfer bread from baking sheet to rack to cool completely. Serve warm or at room temperature.', u"\u2022Dough rises best around 75\xb0F to 80\xb0F. If your house is on the cold side, you can set a container of very hot tap water near the rising dough and cover the dough and the hot water with a large plastic container or bowl-you will need to reheat the water every 30 to 40 minutes. Alternatively you can place the dough (and the small container of very hot water) in a microwave oven (not turned on) or a standard oven without a pilot light, but with the oven light turned on to provide gentle heat. \u2022If you want to make this bread over a 2-day period, you can refrigerate it overnight after the first rise. Once it has doubled in size (first rise), gently press the dough down in the bowl, then transfer to a large, re-sealable freezer bag that's been coated with vegetable oil or nonstick vegetable-oil spray. Leave a small end of the bag unsealed to allow for gas to escape during fermentation and refrigerate the dough overnight. The next day, bring the dough to room temperature at least 1 hour before shaping and baking the loaf. \u2022For proper texture, it's important for the bread to get a blast of heat as soon as it goes into the oven. For this reason, the oven needs to be preheated for a full hour, and it's important not to let too much heat escape when you put the bread in. When transferring the dough to the oven to bake, be sure to shut the door quickly.", u'Flour: 100% Water: 70.6% Yeast: 0.81% Salt: 1.8% Oil: 1.1%'], 'chef': u'Rose Levy Beranbaum', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/rosemary-flat-bread-351249', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 1 (12- by 5- by 1/2-inch) flat bread', 'recipe title': u'Rosemary Flat Bread', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Over the past few years, the popular Italian flatbread has made its way into bread baskets at home and in restaurants. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Salumi refers to all dry-cured Italian-style meats and sausages. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Shaving asparagus with a vegetable peeler transforms the texture of a raw stalk into silky strips. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Two rimmed baking sheets and a hot oven mimic a giant panini press, making grilled cheese for a crowd a super quick and easy prospect.', 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 tablespoons mayonnaise', u'12 slices soft white sandwich bread', u'3 cups coarsely grated cheese (such as Monterey Jack, cheddar, mozzarella, or a mix; about 12 ounces)', u'Kosher salt, freshly ground black pepper', u'2 (13x18") rimmed baking sheets'], 'preperation steps': [u'Position rimmed baking sheet on a rack in middle of oven and preheat to 450\xb0F. Mound 1/2 cup cheese in the center of each slice, season with salt and pepper, and top each with remaining bread slices, mayo side up.', u'Using oven mitts, carefully remove preheated baking sheet from oven and place, rimmed side up, on top of sandwiches, then, holding both rimmed baking sheets together, return to oven. Cut into pieces and serve.'], 'chef': u'a Stockwell', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/sheet-pan-grilled-cheese-56390006', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'6 Servings', 'recipe title': u'Sheet-Pan Grilled Cheese', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"In Thailand, pad thai is hugely popular, but it's not a dish that's cooked at home. Instead, it is commonly purchased from street vendors, who cook it to order in individual portions. For home cooks on this side of the Pacific, cookbook author Nancie McDermott figured out a way to successfully make a big portion of pad thai, enough to serve four people at once, but it does require a wok (they are inexpensive and last forever; look for a 14-inch flat-bottom carbon-steel wok). If you don't have one, consider making her Pad Thai for Two , which works in a 12-inch heavy, deep skillet.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'64%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/3 cup water', u"4 teaspoons prepared tamarind paste, preferably unsweetened, such as Neera's or Rani brands*", u'1/3 cup palm sugar or packed dark brown sugar', u'1/3 cup Asian fish sauce (also called nam pla or nuoc mam)', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'4 1/2 ounces (about 1 1/2 cups) fresh mung bean sprouts', u'2 limes, each cut into 6 wedges', u'1/4 cup salted dry-roasted peanuts, coarsely chopped', u'1/3 cup Asian fish sauce (also called nam pla or nuoc mam)', u'1/3 cup granulated sugar', u'1/3 cup crushed red pepper', u'Boiling water for soaking noodles', u'12 ounces dried flat rice noodles (slender linguine-width; sometimes called pad thai noodles or stir-fry noodles)', u'2 tablespoons chopped garlic (about 4 large cloves)', u'2 tablespoons chopped shallots or onion', u'12 ounces peeled and deveined small or medium shrimp, patted dry', u'3 large eggs, beaten well', u'4 1/2 ounces (about 1 1/2 cups) fresh mung bean sprouts', u'2 bunches scallions, greens only, cut into 1-inch pieces (about 1 cup)', u'1/2 cup salted dry-roasted peanuts, coarsely chopped', u'5 tablespoons vegetable oil', u"*Tamarind paste tends to be a South Asian product; it usually comes in a jar and is available in many supermarkets. Its smooth texture makes it easier and faster to use than the traditional Thai blocks of tamarind pulp that include the fruit's seeds and fibers. Read the label carefully to see if the tamarind paste is sweetened or not; if the jar you purchase contains a sweetener, just use less sugar in your seasoning sauce.", u'Equipment: Large wok (preferably a 14-inch flat-bottom carbon-steel wok); large metal spatula or slotted spoon; tongs; small bowls or ramekins for assembling ingredients; colander for draining rice noodles'], 'preperation steps': [u'In a medium bowl, combine the water, tamarind paste, palm or dark brown sugar, fish sauce, and salt and stir until the sugar is dissolved.', u'Place the bean sprouts, limes, and peanuts each in their own small bowl and arrange near the stove. Place the fish sauce, granulated sugar, and crushed red pepper each in their own small bowl and arrange on the dining table.', u'Bring a 5-quart saucepan of water to a full, rolling boil. Remove it from the heat and immediately add the rice noodles, making sure they are fully submerged in the water. Let the noodles soak for exactly 3 minutes (use a timer), occasionally lifting them up and pulling them apart as necessary with tongs or a long fork to keep the noodles separate and help them soften evenly. Drain the noodles in a large colander and rinse them under cold running water. (If the noodles become sticky and clumped together while standing, rinse them briefly under cold water just before cooking, so that they return to their slippery, firm, toss-able state.)', u'In a small bowl combine the garlic and shallots. Place the shrimp, beaten eggs, bean sprouts, scallion greens, and peanuts each in their own bowl and arrange near the stove. Have ready 1 clean medium bowl for the cooked shrimp and eggs, and arrange a platter for serving near the stove.', u'Heat a large wok over high heat until hot but not smoking. Add 2 tablespoons of the vegetable oil and swirl to coat the pan. (If at any point during cooking the oil starts smoking, lower the heat.) When the oil is hot, scatter in the shrimp. Cook undisturbed until the shrimp begin to change color and firm up, about 30 seconds. Toss well then continue to cook, stirring frequently, until the shrimp are pink, firm and just cooked through, about 30 seconds longer. Using a slotted spoon, transfer the shrimp to the clean bowl.', u'Add the eggs and swirl the pan to spread them into a thin layer. Cook the eggs, lifting the sides and tilting the pan to allow the uncooked eggs to pour underneath as you do when making an omelet, until the eggs are mostly set, 1 to 1 1/2 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and use the slotted spoon to quickly cut the eggs into bite-size pieces then add them to the bowl of shrimp.', u'Place the wok over high heat and add the remaining 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil, and swirl to coat the pan. Add the garlic and shallots and stir-fry until fragrant, about 5 seconds. Scatter in the softened rice noodles, and using tongs, evenly spread the noodles out across the pan, like a net. Let them cook undisturbed for 15 seconds then scoop them in toward the center. Toss the noodles gently then spread them out again. Pour about 1/3 of the seasoning sauce around the edges of the pan, and continue stir-frying the noodles in the same manner, spreading them out and letting them cook undisturbed occasionally, until most of the sauce is absorbed, about 30 seconds more.', u'Add another third of the sauce and continue to stir-fry in the same manner until most of the sauce is absorbed and the noodles are just tender but not mushy, about 30 seconds. Test a noodle or two: If they are too firm, add 2 to 4 tablespoons of water around the edge of the pan, and continue stir-frying until they are just tender and evenly coated with the sauce.', u'Return the shrimp and eggs to the pan, along with any juices collected in the bottom of the bowl, and toss to incorporate them into the noodles. Add the remaining third of the seasoning sauce, along with the bean sprouts, scallion greens, and chopped peanuts, and cook, tossing, until they are mixed in and barely heated, about 30 seconds.', u'Quickly transfer the noodles onto the platter, mounding them at one end. Mound the reserved bean sprouts next to the noodles, and arrange the reserved lime wedges next to the bean sprouts. Sprinkle the peanuts on the noodles in a stripe next to the bean sprouts. Serve hot with the small bowls of fish sauce, sugar, and crushed red pepper so that guests can flavor their portions to taste.'], 'chef': u'Nancie McDermott', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/shrimp-pad-thai-for-four-51206860', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 servings', 'recipe title': u'Shrimp Pad Thai For Four', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"This version of pad thai, developed by cookbook author and teacher Nancie McDermott, is for those who may not have a wok at home. McDermott's pad thai recipe to serve four , which does require a wok, is reason enough to invest in one (they are inexpensive and last forever; look for a 14-inch flat-bottom carbon-steel wok). In either case you will be rewarded with the most authentic pad thai possible with ingredients from the supermarket. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Alain Ducasse\u2014 If you have cooking juices left over in the lamb casserole dish and it seems too much, put it back on the heat and reduce. Paule Neyrat\u2014 In pearl barley all the husks have been removed. As a result it keeps its richness in carbohydrates but loses most of its vitamins and minerals. Fortunately, the vegetables make up for this.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'80%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 shoulder of young lamb', u'4 carrots', u'2 stalks of celery', u'4 red onions', u'4 splashes olive oil', u'3 squashed garlic cloves', u'12 sage leaves', u'8 peppercorns', u'1 1/4 cups red wine', u'1 1/4 cups chicken stock', u'3/4 cup of pearl barley', u'salt', u'12 fresh almonds', u'freshly ground black pepper'], 'preperation steps': [u'Trim the fat from 1 shoulder of young lamb. Then add 1 1/4 cups of chicken stock, cover the casserole dish with a lid, and put in the oven for 2 1/2 hours, basting the shoulder from time to time.', u'Take out the casserole dish. Let it swell with the liquid and cook for 15 to 18 minutes, adding more of the liquid as and when it is absorbed.', u'Peel 12 fresh almonds and add them at the end of cooking with a splash of olive oil. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Spinach and Feta Phyllo Triangles', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'92%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 stick (1/2 cup) plus 1 tablespoon unsalted butter', u'1 lb baby spinach', u'1/2 lb feta, crumbled (scant 2 cups)', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg', u'10 (17- by 12-inch) phyllo sheets, thawed if frozen'], 'preperation steps': [u'Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderate heat, then cook spinach, stirring, until wilted and tender, about 4 minutes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Spaghetti stands in for rice in this version of the Spanish favorite.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'83%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 cups (about) water, divided', u'1/4 teaspoon saffron threads, crumbled', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 medium onion, finely chopped', u'1 red bell pepper, finely chopped', u'4 tablespoons chopped fresh Italian parsley, divided', u'2 large garlic cloves, chopped', u'1 pound tomatoes, seeded, chopped', u'1 tablespoon tomato paste', u'1 teaspoon Hungarian sweet paprika', u'3 8-ounce bottles clam juice', u'1 1 1/4-pound live lobster', u'10 ounces spaghetti, broken into 1-inch pieces (about 2 1/3 cups)', u'12 mussels, scrubbed, debearded', u'12 uncooked large shrimp, peeled, deveined', u'12 sea scallops, side muscle trimmed'], 'preperation steps': [u'Place 1 tablespoon water in cup; mix in saffron. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Use seasonal strawberries if you can get them, but even less than stellar ones will shine with the help of a jar of preserves. The combination creates beautiful ruby red candy-like edges, with a bit of ooze in the center, especially if you bake them and eat them in the same day. Just make sure they are completely cool before cutting them. Preserves usually come in either 12- or 13-ounce jars; either one will work\u2014just use the whole jar.', 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 cup (2 sticks) cold unsalted butter, cut into pieces, plus more for pan', u'2 1/4 cups all-purpose flour', u'3/4 cup buckwheat flour', u'1/2 cup granulated sugar', u'1/2 cup light brown sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon baking powder', u'1 large egg, beaten to blend', u'3 cups hulled, quartered strawberries (about 1 pound)', u'1 (12\u201313-ounce) jar strawberry preserves', u'1 tablespoon cornstarch', u'2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice', u'Powdered sugar (for dusting; optional)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 375\xb0F. Add 1 cup butter and pulse until mixture resembles coarse meal. Add egg and pulse until well distributed. Transfer mixture to a large bowl and mix with your fingers until clumps form; it should look like crumb topping at this point. Chill dough while you make the filling.', u'Combine strawberries, preserves, cornstarch, and lemon juice in a small saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until preserves are melted and cornstarch is dissolved, 2\u20133 minutes.', u'Press half of dough into prepared pan, patting with your knuckles to an even thickness. Pour strawberry mixture evenly over dough. Sprinkle remaining dough evenly over top. Bake bar until fruit is bubbling and top is golden brown, 40\u201345 minutes.', u'Let cool on a wire rack. Lift bar out of pan using parchment overhang and cut into 24 squares. Dust with powdered sugar, if desired.', u'Bars can be stored in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days.'], 'chef': u'an Spungen', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/strawberry-buckwheat-bars-56389816', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 24 bars', 'recipe title': u'Strawberry Buckwheat Bars', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"A simple, traditional British dessert that combines fresh berries, buttered bread, and a little sugar \u2014 and it couldn't be more delicious. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Here's a mellow way to flavor this creamy and comforting Spanish custard dessert.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'82%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 large red-skinned sweet potato (yam; about 12 ounces)', u'1 cup sugar, divided', u'2 tablespoons water', u'1 cup half and half', u'4 large eggs', u'1/2 cup whipping cream', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'2 tablespoons tawny Port'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F. Pierce sweet potato with fork; roast until tender, 1 to 1 1/2 hours, depending on width of potato. Cool. Cut potato in half and scoop flesh into mini processor; puree until smooth. Measure 1 cup puree (reserve any remaining puree for another use). Maintain oven temperature.', u'Stir 1/2 cup sugar and 2 tablespoons water in medium saucepan over medium-low heat until sugar dissolves. Increase heat to high and boil without stirring until syrup turns deep amber, occasionally swirling pan and brushing down sides with wet pastry brush, about 5 minutes. Immediately pour caramel into 8-inch-diameter metal cake pan, leaving about 2 tablespoons caramel in saucepan. Using pot holders, swirl cake pan, allowing caramel to coat bottom and about 1/2 inch up sides.', u'Add half and half to remaining caramel in saucepan. Stir over medium-low heat until caramel dissolves. Whisk eggs in medium bowl until frothy. Whisk in cream, salt, 1 cup sweet potato puree, and remaining 1/2 cup sugar. Gradually whisk in hot half and half mixture. Strain into same saucepan. Stir over medium heat 1 minute. Remove from heat; whisk in Port. Pour custard into prepared cake pan.', u'Place cake pan in large roasting pan. Add enough hot water to roasting pan to come halfway up sides of cake pan. Bake until just set in center, about 1 hour. Remove flan from water. Chill until cold, about 5 hours. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover; keep chilled.', u'Dip bottom and 1 inch up sides of cake pan into pan of hot water 15 seconds. Wipe dry. Invert onto rimmed plate, scraping caramel in pan over flan.'], 'chef': u'n Anderson', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/sweet-potato-flan-240091', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 to 10 servings', 'recipe title': u'Sweet Potato Flan', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This traditional sweet is believed to have originated in Sichuan, where walnut trees from Persia were first planted in China. As with many Chinese foods, the walnut is imbued with symbolic meaning: it is believed to benefit the mind because the shelled nut looks like a brain lobe. Brain food or not, the walnut was a deliciously significant sweet long ago in Sichuan and western China. Reminiscent of halvah, mashed walnuts encased in a thin, flaky dough and covered with sugar syrup is a famed tea-time dish and just one of many Sichuan creations based on walnuts.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'10 cups water; plus 6 tablespoons for glaze', u'12 ounces (about 4 cups) walnut halves', u'6 tablespoons sugar', u'5 cups peanut oil'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Place 5 cups of the water in a pot and bring to a boil over high heat. Add the walnuts and stir. Allow the water to return to a boil and boil for 3 minutes. Turn off the heat and run cold water into the pot. Drain the nuts thoroughly in a strainer. Return the nuts to the pot, add 5 cups of the water, and bring to a boil over high heat. Allow the nuts to boil for 5 minutes, then drain again and set the walnuts aside to dry.', u'2. This next step requires a wok that is completely free of oil. Place the 6 tablespoons water in the wok and bring to a boil over high heat. Add the sugar and stir to dissolve with a spatula. Bring to boil and stir constantly for 2 minutes. Add the walnuts and continue to stir for about 8 minutes, or until the nuts are coated completely with the sugar syrup and the liquid in the wok has evaporated. As the walnuts become glazed with the syrup, take care to regulate the heat so neither the nuts nor the glaze burns.', u'3. Turn off the heat. Using a Chinese strainer, remove the walnuts and set aside on a plate. Wash the wok and the spatula with extremely hot water to remove the sugar residue and dry thoroughly.', u'4. Place the peanut oil in the wok, and heat it to 375\xbaF on a deep-frying thermometer. Place the walnuts on the strainer and lower them into the hot oil. Fry the walnuts, stirring with the spatula, for about 5 minutes, or until they turn a golden amber brown. Turn off the heat. Scoop the nuts from the oil with the strainer and allow to drain briefly.', u'5. Spread the nuts on a baking sheet and let cool completely. After 2 minutes, loosen the walnuts so they do not stick to one another. Serve the cooled nuts or transfer them to an airtight container and store as directed in the introduction.'], 'chef': u'Eileen Yin-Fei Lo', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/sweet-walnuts-357569', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes about 4 cups', 'recipe title': u'Sweet Walnuts', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Life without pasta? Perish the thought. It's not a French thing per se, potatoes being the more ubiquitous starch of choice. But in Alsace, noodles are served with lots of dishes, from fish to game, mostly with heavy sauces somewhat like those from the Piedmont region of Italy. We had pasta a few times a month when I was a kid, but we tended to favor the lighter, more intensely flavored preparations, like this cream-and-lemon combination Tante Caroline developed. She considered it a perfect lunch staple accompanied by a salad and piece of fruit. Her daughter, Louise, tells me it's still very popular with all the kids. Pay attention to the portions!", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: 142.2 calories, 96.4 calories from fat, 10.7g total fat, 5.1g saturated fat, 19.3mg cholesterol, 454.3mg sodium, 1.2g total carbs, 0.2g dietary fiber, 0.3g sugars, 10.2g protein\n\nNutritional analysis provided by TasteBook, using the USDA Nutrition Database', 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'12 ounces tagliatelle', u'4 lemons', u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'6 ounces cr\xe8me fra\xeeche', u'4 ounces Parmesan cheese', u'Salt and freshly ground pepper'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Cook the tagliatelle in boiling salted water until al dente. Drain.', u'2. While the pasta is cooking, grate the zest of lemons and squeeze and reserve the juice of 1 lemon.', u'3. In a saucepan, warm up the olive oil, add the zest, and cook over low flame for 2 minutes. Add the cr\xe8me fra\xeeche and bring to a boil; pour in the reserved lemon juice and bring to a boil again.', u'4. When the cream starts to thicken, add the Parmesan, season to taste, mix well, and cook for another minute. Add the drained pasta and toss to mix. Serve immediately.'], 'chef': u'Madeleine Kamman', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/tagliatelle-with-lemon-355906', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 4', 'recipe title': u'Tagliatelle with Lemon', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'For the kids, simply serve the cocktail base over ice\u2014hold the vodka, naturally.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'8 cups water', u'3/4 cup sugar', u'1/2 cup plus 8 teaspoons tamarind concentrate,* divided', u'2 tablespoons plus 4 teaspoons fresh lime juice, divided', u'12 tablespoons vodka, divided', u'4 cups ice cubes, divided', u'Lime slices'], 'preperation steps': [u'Stir 8 cups water, sugar, 1/2 cup tamarind concentrate, and 2 tablespoons lime juice in large pitcher until sugar dissolves.
