Serve at room temperature.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/tart-cranberry-onion-relish-236418', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes about 3 1/2 cups', 'recipe title': u'Tart Cranberry-Onion Relish', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"I've worked on my fried chicken for many years, researching every recipe that I could lay my hands on, from early antebellum instructions to the Kentucky Colonel's secret technique. This recipe uses five fats, and each one contributes to the flavor of the result.", 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 gallon water', u'38 regular black tea bags or 4 ounces loose black tea', u'1 cup kosher salt', u'1 cup sugar', u'1 chicken (about 3 pounds), cut into 8 pieces (2 legs, 2 thighs, 2 wings, and 2 breasts)', u'2 quarts buttermilk, preferably whole-milk', u'3 tablespoons hot sauce', u'1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'1 1/2 pounds chicken skin, cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'6 cups flour, preferably Anson Mills White May Flour', u'1 cup fine cornmeal, preferably Anson Mills Antebellum Fine White Cornmeal', u'2 tablespoons cornstarch', u'1 1/2 teaspoons garlic powder', u'1 1/2 teaspoons onion powder', u'1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper', u'1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika', u'1 cup rendered fresh lard', u'1 cup canola oil', u"2 ounces Benton's slab bacon, diced", u"2 ounces Benton's smoked ham, diced", u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'Sea salt', u'Gravy'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Put the water in a pot and bring to a boil over high heat. Remove from the stove, add the tea bags, and let them steep for 8 minutes.', u'2. Remove the tea bags, or strain the liquid if you used loose tea. Add the salt and sugar to the hot water and stir to dissolve them. Pour the brine into a heatproof container and cool it to room temperature, then refrigerate until completely cold.', u'3. Rinse the chicken with cold water. Place in the brine, cover, and refrigerate for 12 hours. After the chicken has spent 12 hours in the brine, make an ice bath in a large bowl with equal amounts of ice and water. Place the chicken in the ice bath for 5 minutes. (The ice will rinse away any impurities.) Remove the chicken and pat it dry.', u'4. Combine the buttermilk, hot sauce, and 1 tablespoon of the black pepper in a large container. Add the chicken pieces to the buttermilk mixture, cover, and let marinate for 1 hour at room temperature.', u"5. While the chicken is marinating, put the chicken skins in a small saucepan over very low heat, adding a small amount of water to prevent the skins from sticking and burning. Cook the skins, stirring frequently so that they don't burn, until their fat is rendered. Strain the fat; you need 1 cup.", u'6. Drain the chicken, quickly rinse under cold water, and pat dry.', u'7. Combine the flour, cornmeal, cornstarch, garlic powder, onion powder, the remaining 1 teaspoon black pepper, the cayenne pepper, and smoked paprika in a large bowl and mix well. Add the chicken and toss to coat thoroughly. Allow it to sit for 15 minutes, then shake off any excess, transfer the chicken to a wire rack, and let sit for 15 minutes.', u'8. Meanwhile, put the chicken fat, lard, and canola oil in a large, deep cast-iron skillet. Add the bacon and ham and heat the fats over medium-high heat until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the fat reads 275\xb0F. Turn the heat off and allow the bacon and ham to infuse the fats and oil for 10 minutes.', u'9. With a skimmer or slotted spoon, remove the bacon and ham from the skillet (discard them or eat as a snack). Set up a rimmed baking sheet lined with paper towels, or place a wire rack over the sheet and place alongside the stove. Heat the oil to 300\xb0F. Add the breasts and thighs and cook for 3 minutes. Add the legs and wings and cook for 5 minutes more. (Remove the fat needed for the gravy at this point and start the gravy.)', u'10. Turn the chicken over, cover the skillet, and cook until the pieces of chicken are the color of hay, about another 5 minutes. Remove the lid, turn the pieces again, cover, and cook the chicken until golden brown, another 3 minutes. Add the butter and continue cooking, turning the pieces once, for another 2 minutes or so on each side. The chicken should be crispy and golden brown. Let the chicken rest and drain on wire racks or on a plate covered with paper towels for about 8 minutes, but no longer.', u'11. Sprinkle with sea salt and serve with the gravy.'], 'chef': u'n Brock', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/tea-brined-buttermilk-fried-chicken-and-gravy-51257610', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 4', 'recipe title': u'Tea-Brined Buttermilk Fried Chicken and Gravy', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Tea-marbled eggs are a time-honored part of Chinese cuisine. The outer shell of a hard-boiled egg is cracked (but not removed), and the egg is then soaked in tea, which gives it a lovely marbled appearance and subtle smoky flavor. We found traditionally cooked tea-marbled eggs \u2014 usually simmered for an hour \u2014 were too tough for our taste; this method yields more tender whites.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'12 large eggs', u'3/4 cup soy sauce', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'3 cups water', u'4 Lapsang souchong tea bags*', u'1 teaspoon balsamic vinegar, or to taste', u'1/2 cup mayonnaise', u'Garnish: watercress sprigs'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cover eggs with cold water by 1 inch in a 2- to 3-quart saucepan and bring to a rolling boil, partially covered. Remove from heat and let eggs stand, covered, 10 minutes. Transfer eggs with a slotted spoon to a bowl of ice and cold water and let stand 5 minutes (to cool). Gently tap shell all over with back of a spoon to lightly crack (do not peel). Do not tap too hard or tea liquid will seep into shell instead of just staining cracks.', u'Bring soy sauce, sugar, and water to a boil in saucepan, stirring until sugar is dissolved, then add tea bags. Reduce heat and simmer, covered, 10 minutes. Add eggs (and more water if eggs are not completely covered by liquid) and simmer, covered, 10 minutes. Remove pan from heat and let eggs stand in liquid, uncovered, until cool, then chill at least 2 hours. Lift eggs from liquid and peel. Reserve 2 tablespoons cooking liquid and discard remainder.', u'Whisk vinegar and reserved cooking liquid into mayonnaise and serve with eggs. Present eggs whole, then quarter for dipping. (Yolks may have a dark ring.)'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/tea-marbled-eggs-with-soy-balsamic-mayonnaise-107961', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u"Makes 12 hors d'oeuvres", 'recipe title': u'Tea-Marbled Eggs with Soy Balsamic Mayonnaise', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'In Texas, barbecue is about beef: specifically brisket, the cut by which any joint is judged. Brisket has become a favorite of restaurant chefs, too, hence the smoke ribbons and Hank Williams songs drifting out of restaurants as far away as Brooklyn. But can great brisket be made at home? I devoted a weekend to the task and learned that with a few key ingredients\u2014 salt, pepper, patience, and advice from Aaron Franklin, my neighbor and the pitmaster at Franklin Barbecue in Austin\u2014swoonworthy results are doable. You just have to take the time\u201412 smoky hours.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'40%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 10-12-pound whole beef brisket, fat trimmed to 1/4" thickness', u'1/3 cup kosher salt', u'1/3 cup freshly ground black pepper)', u'A gas grill with a full tank of propane and a drip tray', u'8 cups all-natural hardwood chips, preferably hickory, for smoking', u'A smoker box', u'A grill or analog thermometer (we recommend it even if your grill has one)'], 'preperation steps': [u'1 Order the brisket You\'ll have to special-order your brisket ahead of time (the brisket already sold at the meat counter is typically not whole). You should be able to do this at almost any butcher shop or at a grocery store meat counter. Ask for a brisket that is as evenly thick as possible, with the surrounding fat trimmed to 1/4" thick (this protects the meat from drying out while cooking).', u'2 Season the meat An hour before preparing the grill, place brisket on a rimmed baking sheet. Mix salt and pepper in a small bowl and season the meat all over (it should look like sand stuck to wet skin but without being cakey). Let meat sit at room temperature for 1 hour.', u"3 Prepare your grill Meanwhile, soak 6 cups wood chips in a bowl of water for at least 30 minutes or overnight. Leave in water throughout the cooking process. Keep remaining 2 cups chips dry. Light only 1 grill burner to medium (if using a 3-burner grill, light burner on either end). Make sure drip tray is empty, as a lot of fat will render. Place smoker box over the lit burner, add 1/2 cup soaked wood chips to box, and close grill. Adjust heat as needed to keep temperature at 225-250\xb0F. We recommend using a stand-alone thermometer, even if your grill has one, to ensure an accurate reading. Stick it through the gap between the lid and base of the grill (or set it on the grill's upper shelf, though this is not ideal, as it requires opening the lid more frequently). The wood chips should begin to smolder and release a steady stream of smoke. How long this takes depends on how wet your chips are and the heat of your grill. To get more smoke without increasing grill heat, add a few dry chips to the soaked ones.", u'4 Maintain the heat Place brisket, fatty side up, on grill grate as far away from lit burner as possible. Cover grill and smoke meat, resisting the urge to open grill often, as this will cause the temperature to fluctuate. Adjust heat as needed to keep temperature steady at 225-250\xb0F. Check wood chips every 45 minutes or so, and add soaked chips by 1/2-cupfuls as needed to keep smoke level constant.', u"5 Know when it's done Keep smoking the brisket, rotating every 3 hours and flipping as needed if top or bottom is coloring faster than the other, until meat is very tender but not falling apart and an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of meat registers 195-205\xb0F, 10-12 hours total.*", u"*Need a cheat? If you just don't want to spend your whole day at the grill, here's a fail-safe, Aaron Franklin- endorsed alternate method that will deliver similarly glorious results: Smoke brisket on grill until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of meat registers 150-170\xb0F, 5-6 hours. Wrap brisket in foil, place on a baking sheet, and cook in a 250\xb0F oven until meat reaches the same 195-205\xb0F internal temperature, 4-6 hours longer. What's important is getting that smoky flavor into the meat, and 5-6 hours on the grill should do it. After that point, you're simply getting the meat cooked through.", u'DO AHEAD: Brisket is best shortly off the grill, but you can still get good results smoking it up to 3 days ahead. Let cool for an hour before wrapping in foil and chilling. To serve, reheat meat, still wrapped, in a 325\xb0F oven until warmed through.', u'6 Dig in Transfer brisket to a carving board and let rest at least 30 minutes. Slice brisket against the grain 1/4" thick.', u'Serve it with: Coleslaw, potato salad, and pinto beans.'], 'chef': u'Paula Disbrowe', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/texas-style-smoked-brisket-51175220', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 12 to 16 servings', 'recipe title': u'Texas-Style Smoked Brisket', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This recipe can be prepared in 45 minutes or less.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 1/2 cups (lightly packed) fresh basil leaves', u'1 cup mayonnaise', u'1/4 cup butter, room temperature', u'12 thick-sliced bacon strips (about 1 pound)', u'12 1/2-inch-thick slices fresh country-style white bread', u'3 large tomatoes, cut into 1/4-inch-thick rounds', u'2 ripe avocados, pitted, peeled, sliced', u'1 red onion, thinly sliced', u'6 lettuce leaves'], 'preperation steps': [u'Mix basil, mayonnaise and butter in processor until basil is finely chopped and mixture is well blended. Season to taste with salt and pepper. (Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and refrigerate.)', u'Cook bacon in heavy large skillet over medium-high heat until crisp, about 8 minutes. Transfer to paper towels; drain.', u'Spread half of mayonnaise mixture over 1 side of 6 bread slices. Top each with 2 tomato slices. Sprinkle tomatoes with salt and pepper. Top tomato slices with avocado, then with bacon strips, onion and lettuce. Spread remaining mayonnaise mixture over remaining 6 bread slices. Place bread slices atop lettuce. Cut sandwiches in half and serve.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/the-best-blts-101977', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 6', 'recipe title': u'The Best Blts', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Keep your rolling pin in the cupboard\u2014you won't need it for this simple press-in pie dough, which does double duty for both the crust and crumb topping. The gorgeous peach-raspberry filling can also be baked in a muffin tin to make 12 adorable mini pies.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'75%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for surface', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 cup sugar, divided', u'3/4 cup (1 1/2 sticks) unsalted butter, melted', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar', u'1 1/2 pounds ripe yellow peaches (about 3\u20134 medium)', u'2 pints raspberries (about 4 cups)', u'1 cup sugar', u'6 tablespoons cornstarch', u'1 tablespoon vanilla extract', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'9" pie pan (not deep dish)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Whisk 2 1/2 cups flour, salt, and 1 Tbsp. sugar in a large bowl. Drizzle in butter. Stir just to combine but do not fully incorporate. Texture should be crumbly with some large clumps.', u'Transfer 1 1/4 cups (loosely packed) crust mixture to a medium bowl; add cinnamon and remaining 3 Tbsp. sugar. Knead with fingertips until well-combined but still crumbly with a few pea-sized pieces remaining. Freeze until ready to use.', u'Add vinegar and 2 Tbsp. cold water to remaining crust mixture. Stir to form a dough, then transfer to a lightly floured surface and knead a few times until the texture is smooth. Transfer to pie pan and press into bottom and up sides with a flat-bottomed measuring cup. Crimp edge with a floured fork, if desired, and freeze while you prepare the filling.', u'Position 1 rack in bottom third and 1 rack in center of oven; preheat to 425\xb0F. Place a foil-lined rimmed baking sheet on bottom rack to preheat.', u'Slice peaches into 1/4-inch-thick wedges, then transfer to a large bowl. Add raspberries, sugar, cornstarch, vanilla, and salt and toss well to combine. Fill pie crust with fruit mixture, then sprinkle with crumb topping.', u'Place pie on preheated sheet and bake until crust begins to turn golden, 20\u201325 minutes. Rotate sheet, move to center rack, and reduce oven temperature to 350\xb0F. Continue to bake pie until crust is golden brown and thickened juices are bubbling, 35-45 minutes more; cover crust with foil or a pie shield if it begins to darken too much before juices are bubbling. Cool on a wire rack at least 2 hours to allow juices to set before slicing.', u'Pie dough and crumb topping can be made and frozen for up to 3 months; thaw before using.'], 'chef': u'da Boone', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/the-easiest-peach-raspberry-pie-with-press-in-crust-56389627', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 1 (9") pie', 'recipe title': u'The Easiest Peach-Raspberry Pie with Press-In Crust', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Yanni Kehagiaras of San Francisco\'s Nopa restaurant created this dessert drink for a beer-cocktail competition. So I chose Diplomatico, which adds a subtle sweetness and caramel flavor without clashing." That approach\u2014and this drink\u2014is likely to wins fans on both sides of the beer/cocktail divide.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 tablespoons (1 ounce) mild dark rum, such as Diplomatico, chilled', u'1 tablespoon (1/2 ounce) Pedro Xim\xe9nez sherry, chilled', u'12 tablespoons (6 ounces) chocolate or regular stout, chilled'], 'preperation steps': [u'In a small, 5-ounce Delmonico glass (the one that holds orange juice at diners), combine rum, sherry, and stout. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Make this impressive but easy bark for a holiday gathering, gift-giving, or festive snacking.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'12 ounces high-quality dark chocolate, coarsely chopped', u'1/2 teaspoon peppermint extract', u'5 candy canes, coarsely crushed'], 'preperation steps': [u'Line a baking sheet with parchment. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Hams with a thick honey glaze can sometimes be too cloying. This recipe takes a more balanced approach that results in a light sweetness and a beautiful shine.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'96%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'2 tablespoons chopped thyme', u'1 (12-to 14-pounds) boneless or semiboneless fully cooked ham at room temperature 1 hour', u'1/4 cup cider vinegar', u'1/2 cup mild honey', u'1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce'], 'preperation steps': [u'Melt butter with thyme and let stand until ready to use.', u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F with rack in lower third.', u'Peel off and discard any rind or skin from ham, leaving 1/4 inch of fat on ham. Let honey glaze stand until ham has baked 1 3/4 hours.', u'Discard foil and parchment from ham. If there is no liquid in roasting pan, add 1 cup water (liquid will prevent glaze from burning in pan). Brush ham with half of honey glaze, then bake, uncovered, 30 minutes.', u'Brush with remaining glaze and bake until glaze is deep golden-brown and ham is heated through, about 30 minutes more.'], 'chef': u'Maggie Ruggiero', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/thyme-honey-glazed-ham-352289', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 12 to 16 servings', 'recipe title': u'Thyme Honey Glazed Ham', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This recipe could easily become a year-round favorite\u2014simply substitute supermarket rotisserie chicken for the turkey. And as a special treat for the kids (or the kid in you), make individual-size pies, using eight 10- to 12-ounce gratin dishes.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'90%', 'ingredient list': [u'Carcass and skin from a 12- to 14-pound roast turkey', u'10 cups water', u'1 medium onion, coarsely chopped', u'2 large carrots, cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'2 celery ribs, cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'1 large parsnip (peeled), cored and cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'1 teaspoon chopped thyme', u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1/2 pound mushrooms, trimmed and quartered', u'1/4 cup all-purpose flour', u'4 cups roast turkey meat, cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'1 (10-ounce) package frozen baby peas, thawed', u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u'2 teaspoons baking powder', u'1 teaspoon baking soda', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon black pepper', u'1 cup coarsely grated extra-sharp Cheddar', u'1/4 cup grated Parmigiano-Reggiano', u'3/4 stick cold unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'1 1/4 cups well-shaken buttermilk'], 'preperation steps': [u'Separate parts of carcass and put, along with skin, in an 8-quart pot. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Kutia', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 cups pearl barley', u'3/4 cup poppy seeds', u'1/2 cup sliced almonds', u'1/2 cup honey', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'7 dried apricots, thinly sliced', u'1/2 cup raisins', u'1/4 cup sugar, optional', u'1/2 teaspoon cinnamon, optional'], 'preperation steps': [u'In medium saucepan over high heat, combine barley and 5 cups water. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Even though purists protested, a variety of ingredients were used to flavor the classic French custard. Reserve remaining raspberries for garnish.', u'Whisk yolks and 6 tablespoons sugar in medium bowl to blend. Scrape in seeds from vanilla bean. Gradually whisk in cream. Divide mixture among dishes. Arrange dishes in 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Pour enough hot water into pan to come halfway up sides of dishes.', u'Bake custards until set in center, about 40 minutes. Place pan on work surface. Cool custards in water 30 minutes. Remove from water; chill overnight.', u'Preheat broiler. Sieve 2 teaspoons brown sugar atop each custard. Place dishes on small baking sheet. Broil until sugar just starts to caramelize, rotating sheet for even browning, about 2 minutes. Chill until topping hardens, about 2 hours. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Baked Alaska is called an "omelette norv\xe9gienne" in French when made in the oval shape of an omelete. However, this dessert is done in a conical shape to emulate a volcano; hence its name. The top of a "volcano" is adorned with a hollowed-out lemon half that is filled (as soon as it comes out of the oven) with warm brandy, which is ignited, and the dessert is brought flaming to the table. The lemon mousseline cake, used here to hold the ice cream in the center, can be made a day or two ahead and stored in a plastic bag to keep it moist. If you prefer, a standard genoise or a sponge cake or pound cake can be substituted for the mousseline cake, as can ladyfingers.', 'rating': u'1/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 large eggs, separated', u'1/2 cup granulated sugar', u'2 teaspoons grated lemon rind', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1/2 cup potato starch (3 to 3 1/2 ounces)', u'1/4 cup all-purpose flour', u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter (for buttering pan and platter)', u'1 quart vanilla ice cream', u'3 tablespoons cognac', u'8 egg whites from large eggs', u'4 egg yolks, beaten with a fork', u'1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1 cup granulated sugar', u'Hollowed-out shell of 1/2 lemon', u"1 tablespoon confectioners' sugar, for dusting the cake", u'1/3 cup warm cognac'], 'preperation steps': [u'Put the egg yolks, sugar, grated lemon rind, and vanilla in a bowl, and mix well with a whisk until smooth and thick. Add the potato starch and flour, and mix with a whisk.', u'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. In another bowl, beat the egg whites until firm. Add about one-third of the egg whites to the egg-yolk mixture, and mix with a whisk to lighten the batter. Fold the remainder of the egg whites into the batter. Pour the batter into a buttered 9-inch springform pan.', u'Bake on a cookie sheet in the 350-degree oven for approximately 35 minutes. The cake should be nice and puffy as it comes out of the oven. Let cool in the pan in a warm place. The cake will shrink slightly but remain moist and spongy inside.', u'Butter the center of a round ovenproof platter and slice the cake horizontally into four layers. Place one of the cake slices on the buttered platter. Spoon the ice cream onto the cake slice, mounding it in the center, and smooth with a spatula.', u'Cover the top of the ice-cream mound completely with cake, breaking the remaining slices of cake into large pieces, as needed, to make them fit snugly and over the filling entirely. (Any leftover cake can be frozen for future use.) Sprinkle the cognac over the cake. At this point, the dessert can be placed in the freezer while you prepare the rest of it.', u'In the bowl of a mixer fitted with a whisk attachment, beat the egg whites until firm. Meanwhile, mix the egg yolks and the vanilla in a separate bowl with a fork just until blended. When the egg whites are firm, add the sugar fairly quickly, and continue beating with the whisk for another 15 to 20 seconds to incorporate it. Gently fold the egg yolks into th egg whites with a spatula. Spoon some of the souff\xe9 mixture on top of the ice-cream cake, and smooth and round it into a conical shape.', u'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. You should have approximately a 1-inch thickness of the souffl\xe9 mixture on the cake, with the souffl\xe9 higher in the center. Spoon the rest of the souffl\xe9 mixture into a pastry bag fitted with a fluted tip, and make a spiral decoration all around the bottom of the volcano. Continue decorating the cake as you like with the remainder of the souffl\xe9 mixture.', u'Embed the hollowed-out half-lemon shell in the center of the top of the volcano. Work quickly, so the ice cream and the souffl\xe9 coating remain firm. Bake in the 400-degree oven for 12 to 15 minutes. The outside of the cake should be nicely browned, and it should be just set inside.'], 'chef': u'Jacques P\xe9pin', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/volcano-surprise-with-lemon-mousseline-cake-359009', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'10 to 12 servings', 'recipe title': u'Volcano Surprise with Lemon Mousseline Cake', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Drink up and get a healthy dose of cancer-fighting lycopene.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Nutritional analysis per serving: 169 calories, 0.3 g fat (0 g saturated), 15.8 g carbs, 0.8 g fiber, 1.3 g protein\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Self', 'recommendation': u'67%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 fresh shiso (or mint) leaves, plus 8 additional sprigs for garnish', u'12 3/4 cups (2 3/4 quarts) cubed seedless watermelon, pureed and strained (makes 1 1/2 quarts juice)', u'1 2/3 cups white rum (or to taste)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Crush shiso in the bottom of a large pitcher, using a long wooden spoon. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'To show off the layers, use a 12-cup trifle dish, a footed glass bowl measuring about 8 inches across and 5 inches deep.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'76%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 750-ml bottle dry white wine', u'2 cups pear juice or pear nectar', u'1 1/4 cups sugar', u'12 whole green cardamom pods, crushed in resealable plastic bag with mallet', u'4 1-inch-diameter rounds peeled fresh ginger (each about 1/8 inch thick)', u'2 cinnamon sticks, broken in half', u'5 large firm but ripe Anjou pears (3 to 31/4 pounds), peeled', u'7 ounces high-quality white chocolate (such as Lindt or Perugina), finely chopped', u'1/3 cup poire Williams (clear pear brandy)', u'1/4 cup water', u'1/2 vanilla bean, split lengthwise', u'1 8- to 8.8-ounce container mascarpone cheese*', u'1 cup chilled heavy whipping cream', u'3 3-ounce packages soft ladyfingers,** separated', u'2 cups chilled heavy whipping cream', u'1/4 cup minced crystallized ginger', u'White chocolate curls', u'1 tablespoon powdered sugar'], 'preperation steps': [u'Combine first 6 ingredients in large saucepan. Stir over medium-high heat until sugar dissolves. Add pears and bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium, cover, and simmer until pears are just tender when pierced with knife, about 35 minutes. Transfer liquid with pears to large bowl and refrigerate until cold, about 3 hours.', u'Using slotted spoon, transfer pears to plate. Boil poaching liquid in heavy large saucepan over medium-high heat until slightly thickened and reduced to generous 1 1/2 cups, about 15 minutes. Strain into 2-cup measuring cup; discard spices in strainer. Cool. Cover and chill pears and pear syrup until cold.', u'Combine white chocolate, pear brandy, and 1/4 cup water in top of double boiler set over simmering water. Stir until smooth (mixture will be very liquidy). Scrape in seeds from vanilla bean; discard bean. Transfer white chocolate mixture to large bowl; gradually add mascarpone, whisking until mixture is smooth. Cool mascarpone mixture until barely lukewarm.', u'Using electric mixer, beat 1 cup cream in medium bowl until peaks form. Fold whipped cream into mascarpone mixture in 4 additions. Cover and chill white chocolate mousse until set, about 3 hours. DO AHEAD: Pears and mousse can be made 1 day ahead. Keep chilled.', u'Cut pears lengthwise in half and remove cores and stems; cut halves lengthwise into 1/4-inch-thick slices.', u'Arrange ladyfingers, rounded sides down, in single layer in bottom of 12-cup trifle dish (about 8 inches in diameter and 5 inches deep), covering bottom completely (using about 15 ladyfingers). Drizzle 5 tablespoons pear syrup evenly over ladyfingers. Using small offset spatula, spread 1/3 of white chocolate mousse over ladyfingers, making layer slightly thicker around outer edges of dish to allow mousse to be more visible (center of mousse layer will be thin). Starting at outer edges of dish, place pear slices in single layer with curved edges against sides of dish atop mousse, covering completely. Repeat layering of ladyfingers, syrup, mousse, and pears 2 more times. Cover with fourth layer of ladyfingers (some ladyfingers and pear slices may be left over). Drizzle ladyfingers evenly with 5 tablespoons syrup. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and refrigerate trifle and remaining pear syrup separately.', u'Using electric mixer, beat 2 cups whipping cream in large bowl until soft peaks form. Add 1/4 cup pear syrup and beat until stiff peaks form. Working in batches, transfer cream to large pastry bag fitted with large star tip. Pipe rosettes all over top of trifle, mounding slightly in center. Sprinkle with crystallized ginger. Garnish with chocolate curls. DO AHEAD: Can be made 6 hours ahead. Keep refrigerated.', u'Sift powdered sugar over trifle just before serving.', u'* Mascarpone is an Italian cream cheese; sold at many supermarkets and at Italian markets.', u'** Available in the bakery or bread section of some supermarkets and at specialty foods stores.'], 'chef': u'e Wilson', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/white-chocolate-tiramisu-trifle-with-spiced-pears-240701', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 10 to 12 servings', 'recipe title': u'White Chocolate Tiramisu Trifle with Spiced Pears', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This is a lightning-fast way to make scrumptious little cookie bites. You simply dab marmalade onto a tray full of vanilla wafers and then cloak each cookie in melted white chocolate. For a fittingly elegant garnish, you can top each one with a tiny piece of candied orange peel (available in specialty food stores and by mail).', 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'48 vanilla wafer cookies, such as Nilla Wafers', u'1/2 cup orange marmalade', u'1 bag (12 ounces) white chocolate chips', u'Candied orange peel, for garnish (optional)'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Place the vanilla wafer cookies, rounded sides down, on wire racks set on top of baking sheets. Place 1/2 teaspoon of marmalade on the flat side of each cookie.', u'2. Place the white chocolate chips in a microwave-safe bowl and microwave on high, stirring once or twice, until just melted, 1 to 2 minutes depending on the strength of your microwave. Stir until smooth. (Alternatively, place water to a depth of 1 inch in the bottom of a double boiler or a large saucepan and bring to a bare simmer. Place the white chocolate chips in the top of the double boiler or in a stainless steel bowl big enough to rest on top of the saucepan without touching the water. Heat, whisking occasionally, until the chocolate is just melted. Remove from the heat and whisk until smooth.)', u'3. Use a small offset spatula to spread white chocolate over each cookie, covering the marmalade and coming to the edges. Place the baking sheets in the refrigerator for 5 minutes to allow the chocolate to set.', u'White Chocolate and Marmalade Vanilla Wafers will keep, layered between parchment paper, at room temperature in an airtight container for up to 3 days.'], 'chef': u'Lauren Chattman', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/white-chocolate-and-marmalade-vanilla-wafers-361430', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 48 cookies', 'recipe title': u'White Chocolate and Marmalade Vanilla Wafers', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: 289.1 kcal calories, 27.5 % calories from fat, 8.8 g fat, 3.0 g saturated fat, 10.4 mg cholesterol, 10.4 g carbohydrates, 4.5 g dietary fiber, 4.1 g total sugars, 41.6 g net carbohydrates, 9.4 g protein\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Bon App\xe9tit', 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 cups wild rice (about 12 ounces)', u'4 tablespoons (1/2 stick) butter, divided', u'4 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided', u'12 ounces fresh shiitake mushrooms, stemmed, sliced', u'12 ounces oyster mushrooms, sliced', u'2 large onions, chopped (about 4 cups)', u'1 large dried ancho chile,* stemmed, seeded, finely chopped', u'2 cups brown basmati rice', u'5 cups low-salt chicken broth', u'3 bay leaves (preferably fresh)', u'1 teaspoon (or more) coarse kosher salt', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh Italian parsley'], 'preperation steps': [u'Place wild rice in heavy medium saucepan. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"In this Spanish-style frittata, the potatoes and zucchini are characteristically creamy and filling. The dish is also a host's friend, since it tastes just right at room temperature.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'83%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 pounds zucchini (preferably small; 6 to 8)', u'2 pounds boiling potatoes', u'1 1/2 cups olive oil', u'2 1/2 cups chopped Spanish onion (1 pound)', u'10 large eggs', u'a 12-inch nonstick skillet'], 'preperation steps': [u'Coarsely grate zucchini, then toss with 2 teaspoons salt and let stand 30 minutes.', u'While zucchini stands, peel potatoes and cut into 1/3-inch dice.', u'Heat oil in skillet over medium-high heat until hot, then add potatoes, onion, and 3/4 teaspoon salt. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Can be prepared in 45 minutes or less but requires additional unattended time.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'82%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 small thin baguettes (each about 16 by 2 by 1 inch)', u'about 1/4 cup bottled olive paste or tapenade*', u'4 ounces mild goat cheese', u'1/4 pound thinly sliced Genoa salami or smoked turkey', u'2 cups packed arugula leaves, washed well and spun dry', u'a 7-ounce jar roasted red peppers, drained, rinsed, and patted dry', u'a 13- to 14-ounce can whole artichoke hearts, drained, rinsed, patted\xa0dry, and chopped', u'*available at specialty foods shops and some supermarkets'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cut top third off each baguette horizontally with a serrated knife and remove soft crumb from tops and bottoms, leaving shells about 1/2 inch thick.', u'Spread about 1 tablespoon olive paste or tapenade on inside of each bottom shell and top with goat cheese, spreading it evenly. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Inspired by the many delicious recipes I found for apple challah, I set out to create the most intensely appley version possible. I started with a sweet challah dough and crammed in as many apples as possible. To minimize surface area and hence excess apple juice, I cut the apples into very large chunks \u2014 I also like the distinctive and succulent way these show up in the baked bread. If the dough is too firm to knead easily, add a tablespoon or two of water to it; if it seems to wet, add a few tablespoons of flour.', u'The dough should feel smooth, soft, and only slightly sticky.', u'Place the dough in the warmed clean bowl and cover it with plastic wrap. Scatter 1 heaping cup of the apples over the center third of the dough, then fold up the bottom third to cover them. Press the dough into the apples to try to seal it around them. Scatter another heaping cup over the folded-over apple-filled portion of the dough and fold the top of the dough over it to create a very stuffed letter fold. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"If you don't have individual souffl\xe9 dishes, this can be prepared in a 13 x 9-inch glass baking dish, in which case the crisp will need to bake for about 55 minutes.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'92%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/4 cups old-fashioned or quick oats', u'1 cup plus 2 tablespoons (packed) dark brown sugar', u'3/4 cup all purpose flour', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'3/4 cup (1 1/2 sticks) unsalted butter, room temperature', u'3/4 cup almonds, lightly toasted, chopped', u'1/2 cup chopped crystallized ginger', u'4 pounds Granny Smith or Pippin apples, peeled, cored, sliced', u'1 1/2 cups dried tart cherries', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice', u'1 tablespoon all purpose flour', u'3/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'Vanilla ice cream'], 'preperation steps': [u'Mix oats, brown sugar, flour, cinnamon and salt in large bowl. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Tarte aux Pommes et au Fenouil Caramelise', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 sheet frozen puff pastry (half of 17 1/4-ounce package), thawed', u'4 Golden Delicious apples, peeled, cored, chopped', u'1/4 cup water', u'2 tablespoons plus 3/4 cup sugar', u'3 medium fennel bulbs (about 13 ounces each), halved lengthwise, stalks separated', u'4 tablespoons (1/2 stick) unsalted butter', u'2 teaspoons aniseed', u'Vanilla ice cream'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 425\xb0F. Roll out puff pastry sheet on lightly floured surface to 12-inch square. Transfer to 9-inch-diameter tart pan with removable bottom. Trim overhang to 1 inch. Fold in overhang to form double-thick high-standing sides. Pierce pastry all over with fork. Freeze pastry shell 15 minutes. Line shell with foil and beans or pie weights. Bake until sides are set, about 20 minutes. Remove foil and beans. Bake until bottom is golden, about 8 minutes longer. Cool pastry shell.', u'Place apples, 1/4 cup water and 2 tablespoons sugar in heavy medium saucepan. Simmer over medium heat until mixture is reduced to 1 1/4 cups, stirring and breaking up apples with back of spoon, about 5 minutes. Set aside.', u'Cook fennel in large saucepan of boiling, lightly salted water until tender, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat; drain fennel well.', u'Melt butter in heavy large skillet over medium heat. Stir in 3/4 cup sugar. Cook until sugar dissolves and mixture is dark amber, stirring frequently, about 14 minutes. Stir in drained fennel (caramel mixture will harden). Cover; cook until caramel melts, stirring occasionally, about 15 minutes. Uncover and simmer until caramel thickens, about 5 minutes longer (fennel will be very tender). (Pastry shell, apple compote and caramelized fennel can be made 1 day ahead. Cover separately. Refrigerate apple and fennel mixtures; store pastry shell airtight at room temperature.)', u'Preheat oven to 425\xb0F. Spread apple compote evenly over bottom of pastry shell. Arrange caramelized fennel evenly over compote. Sprinkle tart with aniseed. Bake until warmed through, about 15 minutes. Serve with vanilla ice cream.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/apple-tart-with-caramelized-fennel-101641', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 6', 'recipe title': u'Apple Tart with Caramelized Fennel', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Loaded with fruit, this dessert is cut and served as you would a cake, but the texture is that of a pudding. To keep the meal kosher when your menu includes meat, omit the whipped cream frosting and serve this with nondairy topping and the berry sauce. Begin the cake a day ahead.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'67%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 cups water', u'2 cups frozen unsweetened boysenberries or blackberries (about 8 ounces)', u'1 cup sugar', u'1/4 cup Passover brandy', u'1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice', u'4 1/2 pounds Golden Delicious apples (about 9 medium-large), peeled,\xa0cored, each cut into 12 wedges', u'1 13-ounce Passover sponge cake', u'2 cups sliced almonds, toasted', u'12 soft almond macaroons, finely crumbled (about 1 1/2 cups)', u'6 tablespoons (3/4 stick) unsalted margarine, melted, cooled', u'1/2 cup apricot preserves', u'2 tablespoons Passover brandy', u'1 1/2 cups chilled whipping cream', u'sugar', u'Additional toasted sliced almonds'], 'preperation steps': [u'Combine first 5 ingredients in heavy large saucepan. Add half of apple slices to simmering syrup and cook until tender and just translucent, stirring occasionally, about 12 minutes. Using slotted spoon, transfer apples to sieve set over large bowl. Press apples to extract excess syrup. Reserve syrup. Transfer apples to another bowl. Repeat cooking and draining with remaining apples.', u'Return berries and drained syrup to same saucepan. Boil syrup until thickened and reduced to 1 2/3 cups, about 5 minutes. Transfer boysenberry sauce to small bowl. Cover and refrigerate.', u'Position rack in center of oven and preheat to 350\xb0F. Coat 9-inch-diameter springform pan with 2 3/4-inch-high sides with margarine. Crumble cake onto large baking sheet. Bake until crumbs are dry and just beginning to color, about 15 minutes. Cool. Maintain oven temperature. Finely grind crumbled cake in processor.', u'Sprinkle 1/3 of cake crumbs in bottom of prepared pan. Sprinkle 2/3 cup almonds over. Sprinkle 1/3 of macaroons over. Top with half of apple slices. Mix apricot preserves and brandy in small bowl. Spread half of apricot mixture over apples. Repeat layering with half of remaining crumbs, almonds, macaroons and margarine. Press top firmly to compact cake.', u'Place cake on baking sheet. Bake until top is golden and cake just begins to shrink from sides of pan, covering loosely with foil for last 15 minutes if browning too quickly, about 45 minutes. Transfer cake to rack. Press top firmly to compact cake. Cool cake in pan on rack. Cover and chill overnight. (Can be prepared 2 days ahead.)', u'Run small sharp knife around sides of pan to loosen cake. Release pan sides. Whip cream and 3 tablespoons sugar to firm peaks. Spread cream over top and sides of cake. Press additional almond slices onto sides of cake. Refrigerate at least 1 hour and up to 4 hours.', u'Cut cake into wedges. Spoon reserved boysenberry sauce over.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/apple-boysenberry-cake-1631', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 10 to 12', 'recipe title': u'Apple-Boysenberry Cake', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This stuffing pairs perfectly with roast turkey.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'88%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/4 pounds lean pork tenderloin', u'10 ounces fresh pork fat', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 teaspoon dried thyme, crumbled', u'1 teaspoon dried sage, crumbled', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground pepper', u'1/4 teaspoon ground allspice', u'1/4 cup Cognac', u'13 to 14 cups 1/4-inch day-old French bread pieces (crusts trimmed)', u'10 tablespoons (1 1/4 sticks) unsalted butter', u'2 cups finely chopped peeled tart green apple (about 1 1/4 pounds)', u'1 1/2 cups minced onion', u'1 cup minced celery', u'3/4 cup minced fresh parsley', u'1 tablespoon ground sage', u'1 1/2 teaspoons dried thyme, crumbled', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'Freshly ground pepper'], 'preperation steps': [u'Place pork tenderloin and pork fat on baking sheet. Spread French bread on 2 large baking sheets. Bake until brown and dry, stirring frequently, 20 to 30 minutes. Let cool. Transfer to large mixing bowl.', u'Melt 2 tablespoons butter in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add sausage and cook until no longer pink, 5 to 7 minutes, stirring and pressing with fork occasionally to break up lumps. Add sausage to bread using slotted spoon. {'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'89%', 'ingredient list': [u'Black Pepper and Sour Cream Pastry Dough', u'3 pounds thick white or green asparagus, trimmed to 6 inches and peeled', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt plus additional for sprinkling', u'1 cup heavy cream', u'2 large eggs', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg', u'1 cup finely grated Gruy\xe8re', u'Special equipment: a round pizza pan (13 inches in diameter, not including rim) and pie weights or raw rice'], 'preperation steps': [u'Roll out pastry dough on a floured surface into a 15 1/2-inch round. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Pack this stunning beef roast with a savory stuffing. It helps keep the meat juicy and makes a fine accompaniment on the plate.', 'rating': None, 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': None, 'ingredient list': [u'1 pound sliced applewood-smoked bacon, cut crosswise into 1/2" pieces', u'1/2 cup finely chopped celery', u'1/2 cup finely chopped shallots', u'3 garlic cloves, chopped', u'2 1/2 cups cooked (or three 10-ounce bags frozen, thawed) spinach, squeezed dry, finely chopped', u'1/4 cup cr\xe8me fra\xeeche or sour cream', u'2 cups coarse fresh breadcrumbs made from day-old white bread', u'1/2 cup finely chopped scallions', u'1 teaspoon chopped fresh sage', u'1 teaspoon chopped fresh thyme', u'1/4 teaspoon nutmeg, preferably freshly grated', u'Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 large eggs, whisked to blend', u'1 5-bone standing beef rib-eye roast (10\xbf13 pounds), chine bone removed, fat trimmed to 1/4" thickness', u'Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1/4 cup finely chopped fresh thyme'], 'preperation steps': [u'Pulse bacon several times in a food processor to coarsely chop. Scrape into a large skillet; cook over medium heat, stirring often, until bacon is browned but not crisp, about 10 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel\xbflined plate to drain. Pour off and reserve 2 tablespoons bacon drippings for another use. Return pan to medium heat. Add celery, shallots, and garlic; cover and cook, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are soft, about 5 minutes. Stir in spinach and cr\xe8me fra\xeeche; cook, stirring occasionally, 2\xbf3 minutes longer. Scrape mixture into a medium bowl.', u'Stir breadcrumbs, scallions, sage, thyme, and nutmeg into stuffing mixture. Season to taste with salt and pepper. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate. Stir in eggs. Spread stuffing out on a rimmed baking sheet; cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until stuffing is firm, about 1 hour.', u'Let meat stand at room temperature for 4 hours.', u'Arrange a rack in lower third of oven and preheat to 450\xb0F. Set a V-shaped rack inside a large roasting pan. Place roast on a work surface with bones standing straight up. Using a knife, cut along bones so only 1" of meat is attached at base of bones.', u'Pull bones away from meat to create a 3"\xbf4"-wide pocket at the top. Lightly pack stuffing into pocket. Starting at one end, tie kitchen twine horizontally around the bones to keep them in place and secure the stuffing. Tie the roast vertically between each bone.', u'Season the roast (including the bones) generously with salt and pepper, rub with oil, and sprinkle with thyme. Place roast, bones facing up, in prepared pan; wrap bone tips in foil to prevent burning.', u'Roast beef for 20 minutes. Reduce heat to 350\xb0F and continue roasting for about 3 hours\u2014beginning to probe center of roast at the 2-hour mark\u2014until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of roast registers 110\xb0F\xbf115\xb0F for rare and 120\xb0F\xbf125\xb0F for medium-rare.', u'Transfer the roast to a carving board; tent loosely with foil. Let rest for at least 20 minutes and up to 1 hour. Remove the twine.', u'Carving option 1: Cut between the ribs to make 5 large bone-in steaks to be shared.', u'Carving option 2: Spoon stuffing into a serving bowl. Slice off rib rack by cutting through strip of meat at base of bones. Slice between bones and transfer ribs to a platter. Place meat on a work surface; cut into 1/4"\xbf1/2"-thick slices. Transfer slices to platter with ribs and serve with small spoonfuls of stuffing on the side.'], 'chef': u'Bruce Aidells', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/bacon-and-spinach-stuffed-rib-eye-roast-368971', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8\x9610 servings', 'recipe title': u'Bacon and Spinach-Stuffed Rib-Eye Roast', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Accompany this salad version of a BLT sandwich with grilled bread.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: 118 calories, 9 g fat, 3 g fiber\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Bon App\xe9tit', 'recommendation': u'79%', 'ingredient list': [u'5 ounces applewood-smoked bacon (about 6 slices)', u'12 cups torn romaine lettuce (from 1 large head; about 13 ounces)', u'8 ounces cherry tomatoes, grape tomatoes, and/or pear tomatoes, halved', u'1 garlic clove, pressed', u'3 tablespoons mayonnaise', u'1 1/2 tablespoons white-wine vinegar'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cook bacon in large skillet over medium heat until crisp; transfer to paper towels. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Batter-fried fish tacos as we know them in the United States originated in the 1930s in Ensenada, Mexico, home to a large Japanese immigrant population who worked in the fishing industry there. Along with their skills as fishermen, the Japanese also brought with them the technique for tempura\u2014deep-frying fish in batter. The Mexicans adapted this technique to make tacos, using young shark, a very inexpensive local catch that held up beautifully when fried. These tacos are best served immediately as fried foods get soggy if left to sit. If you can\u2019t find shark, substitute a firm, moist white fish like opah, tilapia, or mahi mahi.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: 500.0 calories, 180.0 calories from fat, 21.0g total fat, 7.0g saturated fat, 135.0mg cholesterol, 1430.0mg sodium, 27.0g total carbs, 1.0g dietary fiber, 5.0g sugars, 50.0g protein\n\nNutritional analysis provided by TasteBook, using the USDA Nutrition Database', 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1\xa01/2 cups water', u'1/2 cup fresh lime juice', u'10 cloves garlic, sliced', u'2 serrano chiles, stemmed and sliced', u'2 teaspoons dried Mexican oregano, ground (page 161)', u'1 tablespoon fine sea salt', u'2 pounds young shark fillet, cut into 4 by 3/4-inch strips (see headnote)', u'3/4 cup plus 1 tablespoon ice water', u'2\xa01/2 teaspoons yellow mustard (optional)', u'1 cup bleached all-purpose flour', u'Vegetable oil, for deep-frying', u'10 (5\xa01/2-inch) soft white corn tortillas (page 13), for serving', u'Garnish: Baja Cabbage Slaw (page 145), lime wedges, and pickled jalape\xf1o rings'], 'preperation steps': [u'To make the marinade, in a large bowl, combine the 1\xa01/2 cups water, lime juice, garlic, chiles, oregano, and salt. Add the fish strips and let marinate for at least 20 minutes.', u'To make the tempura batter, in a separate bowl, whisk together the ice water and mustard. Gently stir in the flour, but don\u2019t overmix; a few small lumps are okay. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes.', u'Drain the shark pieces and pat them dry with a paper towel.', u'Have a plate lined with paper towels ready. In a large, heavy-bottomed pot, heat at least 2 to 3 inches of oil over medium heat until it reaches 360\xb0F on a deep-fat thermometer. Remove the batter from the refrigerator and stir once more. Dredge the fish pieces in the batter, a few at a time, to evenly coat. Drop them in the hot fat, 2 pieces at a time, adding 2 more pieces every 30 seconds (fry no more than 4 pieces at a time). Monitor the temperature of the hot oil throughout frying, letting the oil return to proper temperature, if necessary, between batches; to ensure crispness, it must remain a constant 360\xb0F to 380\xb0F. If too low, the fish will be oily; if too hot, the pieces will burn.', u'Fry them until crisp, light golden brown, and floating in the oil, about 2\xa01/2 minutes per batch. With a fine-mesh skimmer, transfer the fish tempura to the paper-towel-lined plate to absorb the excess oil. Repeat with the remaining pieces of fish. During frying, be sure to remove any pieces of floating batter, or they will burn and darken the oil, which will transfer a burned flavor to the tempura. Serve immediately.', u'To serve, lay the tortillas side by side, open face and overlapping on a platter. Divide the slaw and filling equally between the tortillas and top with salsa and garnish. Grab, fold, and eat right away. Or build your own taco: lay a tortilla, open face, in one hand. Spoon on some slaw, then filling, top with salsa, fold, and eat right away.'], 'chef': u'Mark Miller with Benjamin Hargett and Jane Horn', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/baja-style-tempura-fish-363453', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'makes 10 tacos', 'recipe title': u'Baja-Style Tempura Fish', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Brie is even more indulgent when warm and covered with mushrooms. Serve this appetizer on a cold evening with a big red wine.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'95%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/2 ounce dried porcini mushrooms*', u'2/3 cup dry red wine', u'2 tablespoons (1/4 stick) butter', u'6 ounces crimini (baby bella) mushrooms, halved or quartered if large', u'6 ounces shiitake mushrooms, stemmed, sliced', u'2 tablespoons minced shallot (about 1 large)', u'2 teaspoons chopped fresh thyme', u'1 13- to 14-ounce Brie (about 5 inches in diameter; preferably in wooden box)', u'1 baguette, cut into 1/4-inch-thick slices'], 'preperation steps': [u'Rinse dried porcini to remove any grit. Place porcini and wine in small saucepan. Bring to simmer over low heat; remove from heat. Let soak until soft, about 20 minutes. Using slotted spoon, transfer porcini to work surface and coarsely chop. Line strainer with damp paper towel; strain wine into small bowl and reserve.', u'Melt butter in heavy large skillet over medium-high heat. Add crimini and shiitakes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and cook until brown, stirring occasionally, about 8 minutes. Add shallot and stir until soft, about 1 minute. Add chopped porcini and strained wine. Boil until almost dry, about 1 minute. Stir in thyme. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Cool.', u'Remove Brie from box, discarding lid and paper. Using sharp knife, cut top rind from Brie; discard. Return Brie to box. (Alternatively, stack two 12-inch rounds of foil and fold up around bottom and sides of Brie, crimping foil at edges, leaving top exposed.) Mound mushroom mixture atop Brie. DO AHEAD: Can be made 8 hours ahead. Cover and chill. Bring to room temperature before continuing.', u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F. Place Brie with mushrooms on rimmed baking sheet. Bake until cheese begins to melt and mushrooms are warmed through, about 15 minutes. Transfer Brie in box to plate. Serve hot with baguette slices.', u'*Available in the produce section of many supermarkets and at specialty foods stores and Italian markets.'], 'chef': u'Rick Rodgers', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/baked-brie-with-mushrooms-and-thyme-351537', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 to 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Baked Brie with Mushrooms and Thyme', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Made with airy whipped egg whites and strategically placed yolks, this dish has the soft, yolky flavor of eggs Benedict but without all the hassle. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'It\u2019s what the french call pain perdu, or "lost bread"\u2014a dish that was created to revive day-old or stale baguettes. Here, hot and sweet, baked to a golden crisp, and dripping with syrup, you\u2019ll find not a single thing is missing.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'87%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 (13- to 14-inch-long) loaf of soft-crust supermarket Italian bread', u'1/2 stick (1/4 cup) unsalted butter, softened', u'2 large eggs', u'1 2/3 cups whole milk', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'Accompaniment: pure maple syrup'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cut 12 (1-inch-thick) diagonal slices from bread, reserving ends for another use.', u'Generously butter 1 side of each slice and arrange slices, buttered sides up, in 1 layer in a buttered 13- by 9- by 2-inch glass baking dish, squeezing them slightly to fit if necessary.', u'Whisk together eggs, milk, and 1/4 teaspoon salt until combined well, then pour evenly over bread. Serve immediately.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/baked-french-toast-104357', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Baked French Toast', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This recipe is an accompaniment for <epi:recipelink id="107772">Candied Kumquat and Ricotta Tart</epi:recipelink> . Active time: 30 min Start to finish: 1 1/4 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 1/3 cups all-purpose flour', u'1/3 cup sugar', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 3/4 sticks (3/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons) cold unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u'3 large egg yolks', u'1 teaspoon vanilla', u'Special equipment: a pastry or bench scraper; 1 (12- to 13-inch) round fluted tart pan (1 inch deep) with removable bottom; pie weights or raw rice'], 'preperation steps': [u'Pulse together flour, sugar, salt, and butter in a food processor until most of mixture resembles coarse meal with small (roughly pea-size) butter lumps. With heel of your hand, smear each portion once or twice in a forward motion. Gather dough together into a ball with scraper and transfer to tart pan. Pat out ball with floured fingertips onto bottom and up side of tart pan in an even 1/4-inch layer. (If mixture sticks to your fingers, spread a sheet of plastic wrap over it and pat through plastic wrap.)
