{'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'90%', 'ingredient list': [u'13/4 cups unsweetened cocoa powder (not Dutch-process)', u'13/4 cups boiling water', u'4 ounces fine-quality bittersweet chocolate (not unsweetened), chopped', u'one 8-ounce container sour cream', u'1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'3 cups all-purpose flour', u'2 1/2 teaspoons baking soda', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'3 3/4 sticks (1 3/4 cups plus 2 tablespoons) unsalted butter, softened', u'1 3/4 cups granulated sugar', u'3/4 cup firmly packed light brown sugar', u'5 large eggs', u'1 cup heavy cream', u'8 ounces fine-quality bittersweet chocolate (not unsweetened), chopped', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened', u'2 teaspoons freshly grated orange zest', u'1 tablespoon Cointreau or other orange-flavored liqueur', u'one 8-inch cardboard round*', u'one 6-inch cardboard round*', u'three 8-inch plastic straws', u'5 large egg yolks', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1/2 cup fresh orange juice', u'1/2 stick (1/4 cup) unsalted butter, softened', u'1 1/2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice', u'1 1/4 cups sugar', u'1/2 cup water', u'5 large egg whites', u'1/2 teaspoon cream of tartar', u'6 1/2 sticks (3 1/4 cups) unsalted butter, cut into pieces and softened to cool room temperature', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'2 tablespoons freshly grated orange zest', u'Note: A cake-decorating turntable* is extremely helpful for assembling and decorating a wedding cake.', u'Decoration: fraises des bois (wild strawberries)** and small roses with some leaves attached (both fruit and flowers must be nontoxic and pesticide-free)', u'*available at specialty cookware shops'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0 F. and line 2 buttered 7- by 2-inch round cake pans and 2 buttered 9- by 2-inch round cake pans with rounds of wax paper. Butter paper and dust pans with flour, knocking out excess.', u'Put cocoa powder in a bowl and whisk in boiling water in a stream until smooth. Stir in chopped chocolate and let stand 5 minutes. Stir mixture until smooth and chocolate is melted and cool mixture. Whisk in sour cream and vanilla.', u'Into a bowl sift together flour, baking soda, and salt. In large bowl of a standing electric mixer beat together butter and sugars until light and fluffy and add eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition and scraping down side of bowl. Reduce speed to low and add flour mixture and cocoa mixture alternately in batches, beginning and ending with flour mixture and beating until batter is combined well.', u'Pour 2 cups batter into each 7-inch pan and smooth tops. Divide remaining batter between 9-inch pans (about 33/4 cups each) and smooth tops. In middle and lower thirds of oven arrange one 9-inch layer and one 7-inch layer on each rack, putting 7-inch layers in front part of oven. Bake 7-inch layers 25 to 30 minutes and 9-inch layers 35 to 40 minutes, or until a tester comes out with crumbs adhering. Run a thin knife around edges of pans and invert cakes onto racks. Peel off paper and cool cakes completely. Cake layers may be made 2 days ahead and kept at cool room temperature, wrapped well in plastic wrap, or 2 weeks ahead and frozen, wrapped well in plastic wrap and foil. Defrost cake layers (without unwrapping) at room temperature.', u'In a small saucepan bring cream just to a boil. Remove pan from heat and add chocolate, butter, zest, and liqueur. Let ganache stand 3 minutes and whisk until chocolate is melted. Chill ganache just until cool, about 40 minutes.', u'In a bowl with an electric mixer beat ganache just until light and fluffy before using (do not overbeat or it will become grainy).', u'Put one 9-inch layer on 8-inch cardboard round and spread evenly with 2 cups ganache. Top with remaining 9-inch layer and gently press layers together to form an even tier. Put one 7-inch layer on 6-inch cardboard round and top with remaining ganache and remaining 7-inch layer in same manner.', u'Frost top and sides of 9-inch tier with some buttercream and chill while frosting 7-inch tier. Chill both tiers until buttercream is firm.', u'Cut straws in half and insert 1 straw piece all the way into center of 9-inch tier. Trim straw flush with top of tier and insert remaining 5 straw pieces in same manner in a circle about 1 1/2 inches from center straw. Center 7-inch tier (still on cardboard) on top of 9-inch tier. Fill in any gaps between tiers with buttercream and transfer cake to a cake stand or platter. Chill cake at least 6 hours and up to 1 day.', u'Arrange fraises des bois and roses decoratively on top and around sides of cake. Let cake stand at cool room temperature (buttercream is sensitive to warm temperatures) 2 to 4 hours before serving. Serves about 30 (including top tier).', u'In a small heavy saucepan whisk together yolks and sugar and whisk in orange juice, butter, and a pinch salt. Cook mixture over moderately low heat, whisking, until it just reaches boiling point, 5 to 7 minutes (do not let boil), and strain through a fine sieve into a bowl. Whisk in lemon juice and cool curd, its surface covered with plastic wrap. Chill orange curd, covered, until cold, at least 4 hours, and up to 2 days.', u'In a heavy saucepan bring sugar and water to a boil, stirring until sugar is dissolved. Boil syrup, undisturbed, until it registers 248\xb0 F. on a candy thermometer. While syrup is boiling, in large bowl of a standing electric mixer beat whites with a pinch salt until foamy and beat in cream of tartar. Beat whites until they just hold stiff peaks and beat in hot syrup in a stream (try to avoid beaters and side of bowl). Beat mixture at medium speed until completely cool, 15 to 20 minutes. Beat in butter, 1 piece at a time, and beat until thickened and smooth. (Buttercream will at first appear very thin and at some point look like it is breaking but, as more butter is beaten in, it will thicken and become glossy and smooth.) Beat in orange curd, salt, and zest until smooth. Buttercream may be made 4 days ahead and chilled in an airtight container or 2 weeks ahead and frozen in an airtight container. Bring buttercream completely to room temperature (this may take several hours if frozen) and beat before using. (If buttercream is too cold when beaten it will not be glossy and smooth.) Makes about 8 cups.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/dark-chocolate-wedding-cake-with-chocolate-orange-ganache-and-orange-buttercream-13244', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves about 30 (including top tier)', 'recipe title': u'Dark Chocolate Wedding Cake with Chocolate Orange Ganache and Orange Buttercream', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Don't let the humble name fool you. These little cookies are bursting with flavor. They're reminiscent of those fig cookies you had as a kid-raised to the third power. The cream pastry is tender and flaky, and the honey-kissed filling, just sweet enough, is deepened by plump Medjool dates. They're also bite-size and adorable.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 cups (13 1/2 ounces) all-purpose flour, plus more for the work surface ', u"3/4 cup confectioners' sugar ", u'3/4 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1 cup plus 2 tablespoons (2 1/4 sticks) chilled unsalted butter, cut into cubes', u'3 large egg yolks ', u'4 to 6 tablespoons heavy cream, plus more for brushing ', u'Sanding sugar, for sprinkling (optional) ', u'3 1/4 ounces (3/4 cup) chopped pitted Medjool dates', u'3/4 cup water', u'1 ounce (1/4 cup) pecans', u'1 ounce (1/4 cup) walnuts ', u'2 tablespoons honey or sugar', u'1 tablespoon finely grated orange zest (from 1 orange) ', u'1 teaspoon freshly ground cardamom ', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cloves ', u'1/4 teaspoon kosher salt'], 'preperation steps': [u"To prepare the pastry, combine the flour, confectioners' sugar, and salt in the bowl of a food processor fitted with the metal blade. Add the butter and pulse until the mixture resembles coarse meal. Add the egg yolks and 3 tablespoons of the cream and pulse just until the dough starts to come together. Add more cream if necessary but stop before the dough is too wet. Tip half of the dough out onto a piece of plastic wrap and form it into a disk. Repeat with the remaining dough. Chill the disks for at least 2 hours.", u'To prepare the filling, bring the dates and the water to a simmer over medium heat in a small saucepan. Cook until the dates are very soft, about 5 minutes. Transfer the dates and the water to the bowl of a food processor fitted with the metal blade and add the pecans, walnuts, honey, orange zest, cardamom, cloves, and salt and pulse until you have a chunky paste. Let cool completely.', u'Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.', u'Working with one disk at a time, roll the dough out to a thickness of 1/8 inch on a very lightly floured surface. (Less flour means a more tender cookie.) Using a 2-inch cookie cutter, cut out circles of dough and set them about 1 inch apart on the prepared baking sheets. Repeat with the remaining disk. You can reroll the dough once if you like.', u"Scoop about a rounded 1/2 teaspoon of filling onto half of the dough circles. Brush the edges of the filling-topped circles with a bit of cream and top with another dough circle, gently pressing the edges to seal. Once you've sandwiched all of the cookies, use a fork to crimp all of the edges.", u'Chill the cookies until firm, about 30 minutes. Preheat the oven to 350\xb0F.', u'Brush the top of each cookie with cream and sprinkle with a bit of sanding sugar. Bake until the cookies are golden and crisp, 25 to 30 minutes, rotating the sheets halfway through. Let the cookies cool completely on a rack.', u'Store the cookies in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 5 days.'], 'chef': u'antha Seneviratne', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/date-nut-cookie-pies-recipe', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': None, 'recipe title': u'Date Nut Cookie Pies', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'14 ounces Medjool dates (about 1 1/2 cups), pitted', u'1/2 cup walnuts, toasted', u'3 tablespoons plus 1/4 cup Greek honey or other honey', u'1 teaspoon finely grated orange peel', u'1/2 teaspoon cardamom seeds (from about 10 pods), finely ground in spice mill or in mortar with pestle', u'8 17 1/2x12 1/2-inch or sixteen 13 1/2x8 1/2-inch sheets fresh phyllo pastry or frozen, thawed', u'1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, melted', u'1 cup Greek whole-milk yogurt'], 'preperation steps': [u'Combine dates, walnuts, 3 tablespoons honey, orange peel, and cardamom in processor. Blend until paste forms.', u'Preheat oven to 375\xb0F. Line rimmed baking sheet with parchment. If using 17 1/2x12 1/2-inch phyllo sheets, place stack of 8 phyllo sheets on work surface. Halve stack crosswise, forming 16 sheets, each 12 1/2x8 3/4 inches; arrange in 1 stack. Or if using 13 1/2x8 1/2-inch phyllo sheets, stack 16 sheets on work surface. Cover phyllo stack with plastic wrap, then damp kitchen towel. Remove 1 phyllo sheet from stack and place on work surface; brush with melted butter. Top with second sheet; brush with butter. Starting 1 inch from edge at short end of phyllo, spoon 3 tablespoons date mixture in dollops in row parallel to edge. Mold date mixture into log, leaving 1/2-inch border at edges of phyllo. Roll up date log in phyllo, enclosing filling and forming roll (filling will be exposed at ends). Transfer to baking sheet; brush with butter. Repeat with remaining phyllo, butter, and date mixture. Bake until golden, about 23 minutes. Cool on baking sheet.', u'Spoon yogurt into small bowl (or 8 individual bowls); drizzle remaining 1/4 cup honey over yogurt. Place 1 phyllo roll on each of 8 plates. Serve with honey-yogurt for dipping.'], 'chef': u'Elizabeth Falkner', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/date-and-walnut-phyllo-rolls-with-greek-yogurt-and-honey-233722', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Date and Walnut Phyllo Rolls with Greek Yogurt and Honey', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"My most coveted pie is of the apple variety. To me, nothing says an afternoon out by the grill than having an apple pie to finish off the experience. What sets this pie apart from your normal apple pie is that I use a whopping thirteen apples that I slowly cook down with Vietnamese cinnamon and brown sugar, creating a collection of flavors so distinctively comforting, you'll never search for another apple pie recipe. Use Maker's Mark bourbon as it is currently the only gluten-free bourbon available.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'13 mixed baking apples: Golden Delicious, Braeburn, or Red Delicious and either Gala or Fuji', u'Juice of 1 large lemon', u'1 cup granulated sugar', u'1/3 cup packed light brown sugar', u'1/3 cup dark brown sugar', u'4 tablespoons cornstarch', u'2 teaspoons ground cinnamon', u'1/4 teaspoon grated nutmeg', u'1/4 teaspoon kosher salt', u'3 tablespoons cold unsalted butter, diced', u'1 scant cup of water', u"2 tablespoons Maker's Mark bourbon", u'2 disks Sweet P\xe2te Bris\xe9e (Short Crust Dough)', u'Glutinous rice flour for dusting', u'Milk for brushing', u'Sanding sugar for sprinkling', u'Vanilla ice cream for serving'], 'preperation steps': [u'Peel, core, and thinly slice all the apples and put in a very large bowl. Pour the lemon juice over the apples and toss. In a small bowl, combine the granulated sugar, light brown sugar, dark brown sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt and toss with a fork until there are no longer any lumps. Pour the dry ingredients over the apples, toss, and let stand for 5 minutes.', u'In a large Dutch oven, melt the butter and then add the apple mixture. Stir to coat the apples in the butter and cook down for 10 minutes. Add the bourbon and 1/2 cup of the water and cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, for 20 minutes, or until the apples are tender and the sugar has caramelized. If the mixture begins to thicken too much, add the remaining 1/2 cup water, reduce the heat to low, and continue to cook, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking, about 15 minutes longer.', u'Remove both disks of the dough from the refrigerator and let stand for 15 minutes. Position an oven rack in the center of the oven and preheat the oven to 400\xb0F.', u'Dust the work surface with glutinous rice flour and roll one of the dough disks out to a 14-inch round.', u'Gingerly transfer the rolled dough to a 12-inch deep-dish pie pan, fitting the dough into the pan and being cautious not to tear the dough, as it is delicate. (If you do tear the dough, just join the tear together and brush the tear with water; smooth with your finger until the damage is no longer visible.) Using scissors, trim the overhanging dough to an even 1 inch.', u'Roll out the second disk of dough to a 14-inch round, adding additional rice flour, if needed. Trim the edges. Using decorative cookie cutters, press into the center of the disk to form a vent. Set aside.', u'Pour the filling into the pie shell. Brush the overhang of the bottom crust with water. Fold the pit top in half, center the vent hole, and unfold. Pinch the top layer of dough to the bottom and then flute the edges with your fingers.', u'Brush the dough with milk and sprinkle with sanding sugar. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes, or until golden brown.', u'Remove from the oven and let cool on a wire rack for at least 2 hours before slicing. Serve cut into wedges and topped with vanilla ice cream.', u'Cover and store for up to 2 days at room temperature or refrigerate for up to 1 week.'], 'chef': u'Karen Morgan', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/deep-dish-apple-pie-362669', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes one 12-inch deep-dish pie; serves 8 to 10', 'recipe title': u'Deep-Dish Apple Pie', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Until recently, we had always thought of duck \xe0 l'orange as a tired clich\xe9 of the 1960s, so it was a surprise to find out how delightful this old recipe actually is. We have reduced the original quantity of sugar and caramelized it (along with the aromatic vegetables which balance out the sweetness) for a rich sauce with layers of flavor. One thing that hasn't changed: Cooking a whole duck still feels wonderfully extravagant.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'91%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 tablespoon kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon ground coriander', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1 teaspoon black pepper', u'1 (5- to 6-lb) Long Island duck (also called Pekin)', u'1 juice orange, halved', u'4 fresh thyme sprigs', u'4 fresh marjoram sprigs', u'2 fresh flat-leaf parsley sprigs', u'1 small onion, cut into 8 wedges', u'1/2 cup dry white wine', u'1/2 cup duck stock, duck and veal stock*, chicken stock, or reduced-sodium chicken broth', u'1/2 carrot', u'1/2 celery rib', u'1/3 cup sugar', u'1/3 cup fresh orange juice (from 1 to 2 oranges)', u'2 tablespoons white-wine vinegar', u'1/8 teaspoon salt', u'2 to 4 tablespoons duck or chicken stock or reduced-sodium chicken broth', u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter, softened', u'1 tablespoon all-purpose flour', u'1 tablespoon fine julienne of fresh orange zest, removed with a vegetable peeler', u'Special equipment: an instant-read thermometer; a 13- by 9-inch flameproof roasting pan'], 'preperation steps': [u'Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 475\xb0F.', u'Stir together salt, coriander, cumin, and pepper. Pat duck dry and sprinkle inside and out with spice mixture. Cut 1 half of orange into quarters and put in duck cavity with thyme, marjoram, parsley, and 4 onion wedges.', u'Squeeze juice from remaining half of orange and stir together with wine and stock. Set aside.', u'Spread remaining 4 onion wedges in roasting pan with carrot and celery, then place duck on top of vegetables and roast 30 minutes.', u'Pour wine mixture into roasting pan and reduce oven temperature to 350\xb0F. Continue to roast duck until thermometer inserted into a thigh (close to but not touching bone) registers 170\xb0F, 1 to 1 1/4 hours more. Turn on broiler and broil duck 3 to 4 inches from heat until top is golden brown, about 3 minutes.', u'Tilt duck to drain juices from cavity into pan and transfer duck to a cutting board, reserving juices in pan. Let duck stand 15 minutes.', u'While duck roasts, cook sugar in a dry 1-quart heavy saucepan over moderate heat, undisturbed, until it begins to melt. Continue to cook, stirring occasionally with a fork, until sugar melts into a deep golden caramel. Add orange juice, vinegar, and salt (use caution; mixture will bubble and steam vigorously) and simmer over low heat, stirring occasionally, until caramel is dissolved. Remove syrup from heat.', u'Discard vegetables from roasting pan and pour pan juices through a fine-mesh sieve into a 1-quart glass measure or bowl, then skim off and discard fat. Add enough stock to pan juices to total 1 cup liquid.', u'Stir together butter and flour to form a beurre mani\xe9. Bring pan juices to a simmer in a 1- to 2-quart heavy saucepan, then add beurre mani\xe9, whisking constantly to prevent lumps. Add orange syrup and zest and simmer, whisking occasionally, until sauce is thickened slightly and zest is tender, about 5 minutes. Serve with duck.', u"Available at D'Artagnan (800-327-8246)."], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/duck-a-lorange-233535', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 servings', 'recipe title': u"Duck a l'Orange", 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 (1 1/4-lb) eggplant, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'6 cups chopped braised veal shanks with sauce, reheated to warm', u'3 cups short tubular pasta (about 10 oz) such as cellentani', u'3 cups whole milk', u'1 large garlic clove, smashed', u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'3 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'7 oz crumbled feta (1 1/2 cups)', u'3 large eggs, lightly beaten', u'Special equipment: a 3- to 3 1/2-qt (13- by 9-inch) shallow baking dish or casserole'], 'preperation steps': [u'Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 425\xb0F.', u'Toss eggplant with salt in a colander set over a bowl and let drain 30 minutes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"If you can't find burrata, substitute fresh whole-milk mozzarella.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 medium head of escarole (about 13 ounces), halved lengthwise', u'6 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided, plus additional for brushing', u'1 1/2 teaspoons coarse kosher salt, divided', u'Freshly ground black pepper', u'1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon red wine vinegar', u'1 large garlic clove, minced, plus 1 garlic clove, halved', u'8 b\xe2tarde slices or large baguette slices or four 5x3-inch country-style bread slices, cut in half crosswise', u'8 thick slices applewood-smoked bacon, halved crosswise', u'2 8-ounce balls burrata cheese, each cut into 4 slices', u'8 teaspoons mostarda'], 'preperation steps': [u'Place escarole in bowl. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'The secret to this succulent bird is an inexpensive metal pan. We used the kind of old-fashioned oval roaster found in most supermarkets, not fancy cookware stores. These lightweight enameled pans with lids simultaneously roast and braise the turkey, so it stays moist even as it cooks quickly. Simply uncover it at the end to crisp the skin. Ample pan juices add a fragrant richness to our easy gravy.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'67%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 (11-to 12-pounds) turkey at room temperature 1 hour, reserving neck, giblets (excluding liver), and wing tips for stock', u'1/2 medium onion', u'1 bunch thyme', u'5 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted, divided', u'1 cup water', u'2 cups hot turkey stock', u'1/3 cup all-purpose flour', u'Melted unsalted butter if necessary', u'Reserved chopped giblets from stock (optional)', u'Equipment: a small metal skewer; a 24-inch piece of kitchen string; a covered turkey roaster, or a 13- by 9-inch roasting pan and heavy-duty foil; a 2-quart measuring cup or a fat separator', u'1 a 24-inch piece of kitchen string', u'1 a covered turkey roaster, or a 13- by 9-inch roasting pan and heavy-duty foil', u'1 a 2-quart measuring cup or a fat separator', u'Garnish: thyme sprigs'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 400\xb0F with rack in lower third.', u'Rinse turkey inside and out, then pat dry. Mix together 2 teaspoons salt and 1 teaspoon pepper and rub all over turkey inside and out. Put onion and thyme in large cavity. Pin neck skin to body with skewer. Center kitchen string under back of breast and bring ends over to pin wings, then crisscross string and tie ends of drumsticks together. Put turkey on a metal rack in roaster and brush with 4 tablespoon melted butter. Cover pan (if using a roasting pan, cover turkey with parchment paper, then foil) and roast 1 hour.', u'Baste with pan juices and add water to pan. Continue to roast, covered, until an instant-read thermometer inserted into fleshy part of each thigh (test both; close to but not touching bone) registers 170\xb0F, 30 minutes to 1 hour.', u'Baste with remaining tablespoon melted butter and roast, uncovered, until skin is browned, about 15 minutes more (total roasting time: 1 3/4 to 2 1/4 hours). Carefully tilt turkey so juices from inside large cavity run into pan. Transfer turkey to a platter and let stand, loosely covered with foil, 30 minutes (temperature of thigh meat will rise to 175 to 180\xb0F).', u'Strain pan juices through a fine- mesh sieve into 2-quart measure and skim off fat (or use a fat separator), reserving fat. Pour pan juices into a bowl and add stock.', u'Whisk together flour and 1/3 cup reserved fat (if there is less, add melted butter) in a heavy medium saucepan, then cook over medium heat, whisking constantly, 2 minutes (mixture will be thick). Add pan juices and stock in a fast stream, whisking constantly to prevent lumps, then bring to a boil, whisking. Stir in any turkey juices from platter. Chop and add giblets (if using). Simmer gravy, whisking occasionally, 3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.'], 'chef': u'Ruth Cousineau', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/extra-moist-turkey-with-pan-gravy-350601', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Extra-Moist Turkey with Pan Gravy', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'These hearty falafel are equally delicious eaten alone or piled into pita bread with lettuce, tomato, onion, and tahini sauce.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'82%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/4 cups dried chickpeas (7 oz)', u'2 garlic cloves, finely chopped', u'3/4 cup finely chopped onion (1 medium)', u'1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley', u'1 teaspoon fine sea salt', u'3/4 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1/2 teaspoon ground coriander', u'1/2 teaspoon black pepper', u'1/2 teaspoon baking soda', u'1/4 teaspoon cayenne', u'About 6 cups vegetable oil (48 fl oz)', u'Special equipment: a deep-fat thermometer', u'Accompaniment: tahini sauce'], 'preperation steps': [u'Soak chickpeas in cold water to cover by 2 inches in a bowl at room temperature at least 12 hours. Drain well in a colander.', u'Pur\xe9e chickpeas with all remaining ingredients except oil in a food processor until as smooth as possible, about 2 minutes. Spread pur\xe9e in a 15- by 10- by 1-inch baking pan and let dry, uncovered, 1 hour.', u'Scoop 2 tablespoons of pur\xe9e onto a long sheet of wax paper, then press and pat with your fingers into a 2-inch-wide patty. (Pressing the pur\xe9e will help the patty hold together when frying.) Make a small hole in center of patty with tip of your pinkie finger (to help cook evenly). Make more patties in same manner, arranging them in 1 layer on wax paper.', u'Heat about 1 inch oil in a 4- to 5-quart heavy pot (preferably cast-iron) until thermometer registers 340\xb0F. Working in batches of 4, gently drop patties into hot oil, then fry, turning occasionally, until golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes, and transfer to paper towels to drain. Return oil to 340\xb0F between batches. Serve falafel warm or at room temperature.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/falafel-109010', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 main-course servings', 'recipe title': u'Falafel', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"The technique: Any dish that's topped with breadcrumbs or cheese and then browned is considered a gratin. The payoff: Layers of flavor and texture and a way to transform almost any vegetable into something special.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'89%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 tablespoons butter', u'3/4 cup panko (Japanese breadcrumbs)', u'1 cup Pecorino Romano cheese', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh Italian parsley', u'1 1/2 teaspoons finely grated lemon peel', u'5 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 12- to 13-ounce onion, halved, cut into 1/4-inch-thick slices', u'3 large garlic cloves, minced', u'5 large fresh fennel bulbs, trimmed, cored, cut into 1/4-inch-thick slices', u'1/2 cup low-salt chicken broth', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh Italian parsley', u'1 tablespoon chopped fresh thyme', u'1 1/2 teaspoons coarse kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon black pepper', u'Ingredient Info: Panko can be found in the Asian foods section of most supermarkets.'], 'preperation steps': [u'Lightly oil shallow 2-quart glass or ceramic baking dish. Heat 5 tablespoons oil in large wide pot over medium heat. Add onion and garlic; saut\xe9 until soft but not brown, about 5 minutes. Add fennel; increase heat to medium-high and saut\xe9until fennel is slightly softened and beginning to brown, stirring frequently, about 18 minutes. Stir in broth and next 4 ingredients. Reduce heat to medium-low; simmer until most of broth is absorbed, about 5 minutes. Transfer to dish.DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Cool slightly; cover and chill. Let stand at room temperature 1 hour before baking.', u'Melt butter in large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add panko; saut\xe9 until golden, about 3 minutes. Remove from heat; cool to room temperature. Stir Pecorino, parsley, and peel into panko. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Store airtight in refrigerator.', u'Preheat oven to 425\xb0F. Sprinkle panko mixture over fennel. Bake until gratin is heated through and topping is deep golden, about 20 minutes. Serve warm.'], 'chef': u'Diane Morgan', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/fennel-gratin-with-pecorino-and-lemon-361834', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 10 servings', 'recipe title': u'Fennel Gratin with Pecorino and Lemon', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This unorthodox panino\u2014you work in reverse, griddling the bread first, then layering it with prosciutto, Fontina, and arugula before baking\u2014results in a warm, gooey flatbread with a crunchy crust.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'86%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/4 ounce fresh (cake) yeast or 13/4 teaspoons active dry yeast', u'2/3 cup warm water (105-115\xb0F), divided', u'9 ounce unbleached bread flour (about 1 3/4 cups plus 2 tablespoons)', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 tablespoon olive oil', u'1/4 pound thinly sliced Italian Fontina, Gruy\xe8re, or Emmental cheese', u'2 cups baby arugula', u'6 thin prosciutto slices'], 'preperation steps': [u"Stir together yeast and 1/3 cup warm water in a small bowl and let stand until foamy, about 5 minutes. (If mixture doesn't foam, start over with new yeast.)", u'Stir together flour and salt with a fork in a large bowl. Make a well in center and add yeast mixture and oil. Stir in flour, then stir in as much of remaining 1/3 cup water as needed to form a firm, moist dough.', u'Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth, shiny, and elastic, about 10 minutes.', u'Put dough in cleaned large bowl and cover bowl. Let rise in a draft-free place at warm room temperature until doubled, about 1 hour.', u'Punch down dough and divide into 2 pieces. Form each piece into a ball and let stand, covered, 10 minutes.', u'Roll out each ball on a lightly floured surface with a rolling pin into an 8-inch round (about 1/4 inch thick; if dough resists rolling out, let stand 1 to 2 minutes, then continue).', u'Preheat oven to 400F with rack in middle.', u'Heat a heavy medium skillet or griddle over medium-low heat until very hot, about 10 minutes. Cook rounds 1 at a time, flipping frequently to avoid scorching and to aid even cooking, until golden, about 6 minutes per round. Stack rounds and wrap in a kitchen towel (not terry cloth) to keep soft while cooling.', u'When rounds are cool, separate into halves by cutting into bread all around edge and gently pulling rounds apart. Sandwich cheese, arugula, prosciutto, and salt and pepper to taste between halves.', u'Put stuffed breads on a baking sheet and bake until crisp and cheese has melted, about 8 minutes. Cut into wedges and serve warm.'], 'chef': u'Ursula Ferrigno', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/flatbread-stuffed-with-cheese-and-prosciutto-em-torta-al-testo-em-242030', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 (first course) servings', 'recipe title': u'Flatbread Stuffed with Cheese and Prosciutto (Torta al Testo )', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'If you want dramatic impact on your holiday table, look no further. These leaf-shaped breads (traditionally one of the 13 desserts of a Proven\xe7al Christmas Eve) are large and sculptural, with a heady fragrance of orange and anise.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1/2 cup warm water (105\u2013115\xb0F)', u'2 teaspoons active dry yeast (from a 1/4-oz package)', u'1/2 cup all-purpose flour', u'2 tablespoons sugar', u'1 1/4 teaspoons table salt', u'1 teaspoon anise seeds, lightly crushed', u'2/3 cup water', u'2 teaspoons orange-flower water (preferably French)', u'1 teaspoon finely grated fresh orange zest', u'1/3 cup mild extra-virgin olive oil (preferably French) plus 1 tablespoon for brushing', u'3 1/4 cups unbleached all-purpose flour plus additional for kneading', u'1 1/2 teaspoons flaky or coarse sea salt', u'Special equipment: a stand mixer fitted with paddle attachment'], 'preperation steps': [u"Stir together sugar and warm water in bowl of mixer. Sprinkle yeast over mixture and let stand until foamy, about 5 minutes. (If yeast doesn't foam, discard and start over with new yeast.)", u'Whisk flour into yeast mixture until combined well. Let starter rise, loosely covered with plastic wrap, 30 minutes.', u'Add sugar, salt, crushed anise seeds, water, orange-flower water, zest, 1/3 cup oil, and 11/4 cups flour to starter and beat at medium speed until smooth. Mix in remaining 2 cups flour, 1/2 cup at a time, at low speed until a soft dough forms.', u'Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead, sprinkling surface lightly with flour if dough is very sticky, until smooth and elastic (dough will remain slightly sticky), 8 to 10 minutes. Form dough into a ball and transfer to a lightly oiled large bowl, turning dough to coat with oil. Cover bowl with plastic wrap and let dough rise in a draft-free place at warm room temperature until doubled in bulk, 1 to 1 1/2 hours.', u'Punch down dough (do not knead), then halve. Pat out each half into an oval (about 12 inches long and 1/4 inch thick), then transfer to 2 lightly oiled large baking sheets.', u'Using a very sharp knife or a pastry scraper, make a cut down center of each oval "leaf," cutting all the way through to baking sheet and leaving a 1-inch border on each end of cut. Make 3 shorter diagonal cuts on each side of original cut, leaving a 1-inch border on each end of cuts, to create the look of leaf veins (do not connect cuts). Gently pull apart cuts about 1 1/2 inches with your fingers. Let dough stand, uncovered, until slightly puffed, about 30 minutes.', u'Put oven racks in upper and lower thirds of oven and preheat oven to 375\xb0F.', u'Brush loaves with remaining tablespoon oil and sprinkle with sea salt. Bake, switching position of baking sheets halfway through baking, until loaves are golden brown and sound hollow when tapped on bottom, 35 to 40 minutes total. Transfer loaves to a rack and cool to warm or room temperature.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/fougasse-236703', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 2 loaves', 'recipe title': u'Fougasse', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'The rich and tender biscuits would also be great with plums or blackberries. Rinse and wipe off any fuzz from peaches before using.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Nutritional analysis per serving: Calories (kcal) 646.21; %Calories from Fat 50.2; Fat (g) 36.01; Saturated Fat (g) 22.49; Cholesterol (mg) 118.12; Carbohydrates (g) 77.78; Dietary Fiber (g) 2.63; Total Sugars (g) 42.06; Net Carbs (g) 75.15; Protein (g) 6.08\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Bon App\xe9tit', 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 cups all purpose flour', u'13 tablespoons sugar, divided', u'1 tablespoon baking powder', u'1/2 cup (1 stick) chilled salted butter, diced', u'1/2 cup finely chopped crystallized ginger, divided', u'1/2 cup ginger ale', u'3 tablespoons plus 1 1/4 cups chilled heavy whipping cream, divided', u'4 large peaches, halved, thinly sliced'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 400\xb0F. Line baking sheet with parchment paper. Whisk flour, 6 tablespoons sugar, and baking powder in large bowl. Add butter; rub in with fingertips until very coarse meal forms (oatmeal-size flakes). Mix in 1/4 cup chopped ginger. Add ginger ale and 2 tablespoons cream. Toss until moist clumps form. Gather dough into 7-inch log. Cut crosswise into 6 equal rounds. Place on sheet, spaced apart. Shape each into 2 1/2-inch diameter round. Mix 1 tablespoon cream and 1 tablespoon sugar in small bowl; brush over top and sides of shortcakes.', u'Bake shortcakes until golden and tester inserted into center comes out clean, 20 to 22 minutes. Cool on sheet.', u'Meanwhile, toss peaches in large bowl with 4 tablespoons sugar and remaining 1/4 cup chopped ginger. Whisk remaining 1 1/4 cups cream and 2 tablespoons sugar in medium bowl to peaks.', u'Halve shortcakes horizontally. Place bottoms on plates. Top each with peaches, whipped cream, and shortcake top.'], 'chef': u'The Bon App\xe9tit Test Kitchen', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/fresh-peach-and-gingercream-shortcakes-242968', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Fresh Peach and Gingercream Shortcakes', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Frigitterie, found all over Palermo, means things fried, and the selections are endless. Breaded eggplant, broccoli, artichokes\u2014all of the vegetables in season are coated with a flour paste (pastella) and find their way into a fryer. In Palermo, one of the undisputed specialties is panella, made of chickpea flour and cooked like polenta, chilled, and then cut into thick slices that are fried in olive oil. Fried panelle are eaten as is, or multiple slices are piled in a sesame bun and enjoyed as a big sandwich.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'64%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 cups water', u'1 teaspoon coarse sea salt or kosher salt', u'1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for the baking sheet and for frying', u'1/2 pound chickpea (garbanzo) flour', u'A heavy-bottomed 3-quart saucepan or deep saut\xe9 pan, about 10-inch diameter; a stiff wire whisk; a rimmed baking sheet, 9 by 13 inches (a quarter-sheet), or a shallow baking pan of the same size, bottom and sides lightly brushed with olive oil; a stiff metal spatula'], 'preperation steps': [u'Pour 4 cups water, the salt, and the olive oil into the saucepan, and gradually whisk in the chickpea flour until smooth. Set over medium heat, and whisk constantly as the batter slowly heats. It will thicken and eventually steam but does not need to boil. Cook and keep whisking, scraping the bottom and sides of the pan frequently, until the mixture is quite stiff and starts to pull away from the sides as you stir it, 15 to 20 minutes.', u'Turn the batter into the oiled pan, and spread it quickly with the spatula, before it cools and sets, so it fills the pan in an even layer. Wet the spatula with water, and smooth the top of the batter. Let cool for an hour or longer, until completely firm.', u'Cut pieces with a sharp knife, in whatever size or shape you like and in the amount you need. I cut 1 1/2-inch squares for appetizers and Sicilian-style sandwiches; 2-by-3-inch bars\u2014at least two per person\u2014to accompany a main course. Lift the cut pieces from the pan with a spatula (seal the remainder with plastic wrap and refrigerate for longer keeping).', u'To fry the panelle, pour enough extra-virgin olive oil into the heavy skillet to cover the bottom with 1/8 inch of oil, and set over medium heat. When the oil is hot, lay in the panelle, leaving plenty of space between them. Fry about 3 minutes, until the underside is crisp and golden, then flip them over and brown the second side, about 2 minutes more. Set the panelle on paper towels to drain and cool for a minute, but serve while they are still warm (though they taste good at room temperature too!).'], 'chef': u'ia Bastianich', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/fried-chickpea-polenta-em-panelle-em-241707', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings or more', 'recipe title': u'Fried Chickpea Polenta (Panelle)', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Nougat is an egg white, honey and nut confection traditional in the city of Mont\xe9limar, in the Rh\xf4ne Valley. It is one of the 13 sweets offered to churchgoers on Christmas Eve. Start making this impressive dessert at least one day before you plan to serve it, although it can be prepared up to one week ahead.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'86%', 'ingredient list': [u'5 tablespoons cold water', u'1 teaspoon unflavored gelatin', u"6 ounces good-quality white chocolate (such as Baker's or Lindt),\xa0 chopped", u'5 large eggs, separated', u'6 tablespoons honey', u'1 tablespoon Grand Marnier or other orange liqueur', u'3/4 cup chilled whipping cream', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'3 tablespoons almonds, toasted, finely chopped', u'3 tablespoons walnuts, toasted, finely chopped', u'">Bittersweet Chocolate Sauce', u'Raspberry-Fig Sauce'], 'preperation steps': [u'Line 9 x 5 x 2 3/4-inch metal loaf pan with plastic wrap, leaving overhang. Pour 1 tablespoon cold water into small bowl. Sprinkle gelatin over. Let stand until gelatin softens, about 10 minutes. Stir white chocolate in top of double boiler set over simmering water (do not allow bottom of pan to touch water) until melted. Remove chocolate from over water.', u'Whisk egg yolks, 2 tablespoons honey, Grand Marnier and 3 tablespoons water in large metal bowl to blend. Set over saucepan of gently boiling water (do not allow bottom of bowl to touch water) and whisk until mixture thickens and thermometer registers 160\xb0F, about 3 minutes. Remove bowl from over water; add gelatin mixture and whisk until dissolved.', u'Stir remaining 1 tablespoon water and 4 tablespoons honey in small pan over low heat until honey dissolves. Increase heat and boil until candy thermometer reaches 220\xb0F, tilting pan to submerge thermometer bulb, about 2 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, using electric mixer, beat egg whites in large bowl until soft peaks form. Gradually beat hot honey syrup into whites. Continue beating until whites are cool and very stiff, about 4 minutes. Fold white chocolate into yolk mixture; then fold whites into yolk mixture in 3 additions. Beat cream and vanilla in medium bowl until medium-firm peaks form. Fold cream and nuts into mousse. Transfer mixture to prepared pan; smooth top. Cover with plastic; freeze overnight. (Can be made 1 week ahead. Keep frozen.)', u'Freeze oval platter 15 minutes. Uncover terrine. Place platter on pan. Invert terrine onto platter; peel off plastic. Spoon chocolate sauce onto center of plates. Slice terrine; place atop sauce. Spoon Raspberry-Fig Sauce over center of terrine slices and serve immediately.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/frozen-nougat-terrine-with-bittersweet-chocolate-sauce-and-raspberry-fig-sauce-3001', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 8', 'recipe title': u'Frozen Nougat Terrine with Bittersweet Chocolate Sauce and Raspberry-Fig Sauce', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Why Fujis? This not-too-sugary cake (inspired by carrot cake) is best when made with fairly sweet apples. Plus, it's important to choose an apple variety with a sturdy structure so that it won't break down during baking. Fuji apples fill the bill on both counts.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: 762.5 kcal calories, 47.4% calories from fat, 40.1 g fat, 19.0 g saturated fat, 133.8 mg cholesterol, 96.2 g carbohydrates, 3.0 g dietary fiber, 71.3 g total sugars, 93.3 g net carbs, 7.1 g protein\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Bon App\xe9tit', 'recommendation': u'87%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 cups all purpose flour', u'1 3/4 teaspoons ground cinnamon', u'1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon ground allspice', u'1/4 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg or ground nutmeg', u'1/4 teaspoon baking soda', u'1 cup (2 sticks) unsalted butter, room temperature', u'1 1/4 cups sugar', u'3/4 cup (packed) golden brown sugar', u'3 large eggs', u'2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'2 tablespoons bourbon, apple brandy, or rum (optional)', u'1 1/2 cups unsweetened applesauce', u'2 medium Fuji or Gala apples (13 to 14 ounces total), peeled, halved, cored, cut into 1/3-inch cubes', u'1 1/2 cups finely chopped pecans (about 6 ounces)', u'1 8-ounce package cream cheese, room temperature', u'1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, room temperature', u'1 tablespoon vanilla extract', u'Pinch of salt', u'3 cups powdered sugar (measured, then sifted)', u'Coarsely chopped toasted pecans (for garnish)', u'Special equipment: 2 9-inch-diameter cake pans with 2-inch-high sides'], 'preperation steps': [u'Position rack in center of oven and preheat to 350\xb0F. Butter and flour two 9-inch-diameter cake pans with 2-inch high sides. Line bottom of each pan with parchment paper round. Whisk first 7 ingredients in medium bowl. Using electric mixer, beat 1 cup butter in large bowl until fluffy. Add both sugars and beat until smooth. Add eggs 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in vanilla, then bourbon, if desired (mixture may look curdled). Add flour mixture to egg mixture in 3 additions alternately with applesauce in 2 additions, beating until blended after each addition. Stir in apples and pecans. Divide batter between cake pans; smooth tops.', u'Bake cakes until tester inserted into center of each comes out clean, about 50 minutes. Transfer cakes to racks and cool in pans 15 minutes. Cut around pan sides to loosen cakes. Invert cakes onto racks; peel off parchment paper. Place another rack atop 1 cake and invert again so that cake is rounded side up. Repeat with second cake. Cool completely. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Wrap each cake in plastic and stoer at room temperature.', u'Using electric mixer, beat cream cheese and butter in large bowl until smooth. Beat in vanilla extract and pinch of salt. Gradually add powdered sugar, beating until frosting is smooth and creamy, about 2 minutes.', u'Using long serrated knife, trim off rounded tops of cakes to make level; brush off any loose crumbs. Transfer 1 cake to platter, trimmed side up. Drop half of frosting (about 11/2 cups) by spoonfuls atop cake. Spread frosting evenly to edges of cake. Top with second cake, trimmed side down. Drop remaining frosting by spoonfuls onto top of cake, leaving sides of cake plain. Spread frosting to top edges of cake, swirling and creating peaks, if desired. Sprinkle with pecans. Let cake stand at room temperature 1 hour to allow frosting to set slightly. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover with cake dome and refrigerate. Let cake stand at room temperature at least 2 hours before serving.'], 'chef': u'Dorie Greenspan', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/fuji-apple-spice-cake-with-cream-cheese-frosting-355219', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 12 servings', 'recipe title': u'Fuji Apple Spice Cake with Cream Cheese Frosting', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This recipe can be prepared in 45 minutes or less but requires additional sitting time.', 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'46%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 English cucumber (about 13 inches long)', u'a 1/4-pound piece j\xedcama', u'1 small red bell pepper', u'1 celery rib', u'1 small garlic clove', u'2 cups V8 or tomato juice', u'2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice, or to taste', u'1 1/2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce, or to taste', u'Garnish: chopped fresh chives'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cut cucumber in half lengthwise and cut each half lengthwise into 3 spears. Cut bell pepper and celery into 1/4-inch dice and add with diced j\u202dcama to cucumber. Mince garlic and toss with cucumber mixture. Stir in remaining ingredients and season soup with salt and pepper.', u'In a blender pur\xe9e half of soup until smooth and return to bowl, stirring to combine. Chill soup, covered, until cold, at least 1 hour, and up to 2 days. Season soup and serve garnished with chives.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/gazpacho-101907', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': None, 'recipe title': u'Gazpacho', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'We tested this recipe with Lindt, Valrhona, Ghirardelli, and Callebaut bittersweet chocolates, all of which worked equally well. Our favorite, however, was Valrhona, which made for an especially rich-flavored gianduia.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'93%', 'ingredient list': [u'9 ounces fine-quality bittersweet chocolate (not unsweetened)', u'7 ounces fine-quality milk chocolate', u'1 cup Nutella * (chocolate-hazelnut spread; from a 13-ounce jar)', u'3/4 cupunsweetened hazelnut butter **', u'6 large eggs', u'1/2 cup superfine granulated sugar', u'1 cup well-chilled heavy cream', u'Accompaniment: whipped cream'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0 F and butter a 10-inch springform pan. Wrap bottom and side of pan with a large piece of heavy-duty foil to waterproof.', u'Chop chocolates into small pieces and melt in a double boiler or a metal bowl set over a saucepan of barely simmering water, stirring until smooth. Remove top of double boiler or bowl from heat and stir in Nutella and hazelnut butter until combined well.', u'In a large bowl of a standing electric mixer or in a large bowl with a handheld mixer beat eggs until frothy, about 1 minute. Gradually add sugar, beating mixture at high speed until thick and pale and it holds a slowly dissolving ribbon when beaters are lifted, about 4 minutes if using a standing mixer and about 8 minutes if using a hand-held mixer. Pour chocolate mixture into egg mixture and stir until combined well. In a chilled bowl beat cream until it holds soft peaks and fold into batter gently but thoroughly.', u'Pour batter into springform pan and put springform pan in a roasting pan. Add enough hot water to roasting pan to reach halfway up side of springform pan. Bake cake in middle of oven 1 hour and 10 minutes. Turn off oven and let cake stand in oven 40 minutes. Remove springform pan from water and cool cake in pan on a rack 30 minutes. Remove side of pan from cake. Let cake cool completely before serving.', u'Serve cake with whipped cream. Cake keeps, covered and chilled, 3 days. Cake served at room temperature will have a texture reminiscent of mousse; chilled cake will be more fudgelike.', u'Available at specialty foods shops and many supermarkets.', u'** Available for purchase from Dundee Orchards, P.O. Box 327, Dundee, OR 97115, (503) 538-8105.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/gianduia-mousse-cake-105215', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 12 to 14 servings', 'recipe title': u'Gianduia Mousse Cake', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"A pork tenderloin is too much meat for one person, but you'll be happy to have leftovers for the fried rice with pork and kale .", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'90%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 2/3 cups chicken broth (13 1/2 ounces)', u'1/4 cup soy sauce', u'1/4 cup packed brown sugar', u'3 tablespoons ketchup or 2 tablespoons tomato paste', u'3 tablespoons finely grated peeled fresh ginger', u'3 garlic cloves, minced', u'1 tablespoon cider vinegar or balsamic vinegar', u'1 (3/4 pound) pork tenderloin', u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'Special equipment: an instant-read thermometer'], 'preperation steps': [u'Whisk together 2/3 cup broth, soy sauce, brown sugar, ketchup, ginger, garlic, and vinegar and pour into a large sealable plastic bag. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'(Les Gnocchi au Gorgonzola)', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'87%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 1/4 pounds russet potatoes', u'1 large egg', u'2 cups all purpose flour', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper', u'1/8 teaspoon ground nutmeg', u'1 cup whipping cream', u'3 cups crumbled Gorgonzola cheese (about 13 ounces)', u'Chopped fresh chives', u'Grated Parmesan cheese (optional)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Pierce potatoes several times with fork. Cut dough into 1-inch lengths and make grooves in each piece with fork.', u'Cook gnocchi in large pot of boiling salted water until gnocchi are tender and rise to surface, about 5 minutes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Dripping with honey and sprinkled with fresh thyme, cracked pepper, and sea salt, these warm, crunchy toasts make a delicious breakfast, after-school treat, or lunch when matched with a handful of salad greens. I'm always amazed how something so simple, and a tad messy, can be so unbelievably good.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'whole-grain bread, 4 slices, each about 2 1/2 by 5 inches (6 by 13 cm), lightly toasted', u'fresh goat cheese, 3 oz (90 g), at room temperature', u'walnuts, 1/4 cup (1 oz/30 g) coarsely chopped', u'roasted walnut oil, 1 tsp', u'sea salt and freshly cracked black pepper', u'honey, for drizzling', u'fresh thyme leaves, 1/2 tsp'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat the oven or toaster oven to 375\xb0F (190\xb0C). Drizzle 1/4 tsp of the walnut oil over each toast. Bake until the walnuts are toasted and the cheese is warm, about 5 minutes.', u'Transfer the toasts to plates and season with salt and pepper. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'To make these tarts two 13 1/2 x 4 x 1-inch tart pans with removable rims are ideal; however, you could also use one 11 x 1-inch round tart pan with a removable rim.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/4 sticks (10 tablespoons) cold unsalted butter', u'2 cups all-purpose flour', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'2 to 4 tablespoons ice water', u'3 onions (about 1 1/2 pounds total)', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'pie weights or raw rice for weighting shells', u'10 ounces soft mild goat cheese (about 1 heaping cup), softened', u'1 stick (1/2 cup) unsalted butter, softened', u'3/4 cup sour cream', u'3 large eggs', u'1 teaspoon fresh thyme leaves'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cut butter into bits and in a bowl with a pastry blender or in a food processor blend or pulse together with flour and salt until mixture resembles coarse meal. Add 2 tablespoons ice water and toss with a fork or pulse until incorporated. Add enough remaining ice water, 1 tablespoon at a time, tossing with fork or pulsing to incorporate, to form a dough. On a work surface smear dough with heel of hand in 3 or 4 forward motions to make dough easier to work with. Divide dough in half and pat each half into a rectangle, about 6 by 3 inches. Chill rectangles, wrapped separately in plastic wrap, at least 1 hour and up to 1 week.', u'Thinly slice onions and in a large skillet cook with salt to taste in oil, covered, over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, 10 minutes, or until softened. Cook onions, uncovered, stirring, until golden and any liquid in skillet is evaporated.', u'Preheat oven to 375\xb0F.', u'On a lightly floured surface roll out 1 dough rectangle into a 16 x 6-inch rectangle and fit it into a 13 1/2 x 4 x 1-inch tart pan with a removable fluted rim. Roll a rolling pin over pastry to trim it flush with top of rim and prick bottom of shell in several places with a fork. Make 1 more tart shell in another tart pan in same manner.', u'Line shells with foil and fill with pie weights or raw rice. Bake shells in middle of oven 10 minutes. Carefully remove foil and weights or rice and bake shells until pale golden, about 5 minutes more.', u'While shells are baking, whisk together goat cheese, butter, and sour cream until smooth and whisk in eggs until combined well. Season custard with salt and pepper.', u'Spread onions evenly in shells and pour custard over onions. Sprinkle thyme over custard and bake tarts in middle of oven 20 minutes, or until puffed and golden. Cool tarts in pans on racks (filling will deflate). Tarts may be made 2 days ahead, cooled completely in pans, and chilled, covered, in pans. Reheat tarts in pans, uncovered, in a 350\xb0F. oven about 15 minutes to crisp crusts. Remove rims from pans.', u"Cut tarts crosswise into 3/4-inch-wide slices to make about 32 hors d'oeuvres and, if desired, halve slices crosswise to make about 64 hors d'oeuvres. Serve tarts warm or at room temperature."], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/goat-cheese-and-onion-tarts-100707', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u"Makes about 32 large or 64 small hors d'oeuvres", 'recipe title': u'Goat Cheese and Onion Tarts', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'My family has made these schnecken for most every holiday for as long as I can remember. schnecken, which means "snails" in German, are basically pecan-cinnamon buns. Once the schnecken were turned out hot from the pan and the top of the buns covered with gooey pecan caramel, the real struggle began\u2014fighting my seven siblings for first crack at our favorite piece. it might have been the first time I realized that my rotundness and arm length gave me a distinct advantage over my sisters as I groped for the warm center of this classic cinnamon pull-apart. After the center pieces were gone, I went for the ultra-caramelized golden brown corners.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'9 \xd7 13-inch Baking Pan', u'1/2 cup (1 stick/4 ounces/113 grams) unsalted butter, plus more for the bowl and pan', u'1 cup (8 1/2 ounces/242 grams) milk', u'5 tablespoons (2 1/4 ounces/63 grams) granulated sugar', u'1 tablespoon active dry yeast', u'1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt', u'1 large egg plus 1 large egg yolk', u'3 to 3 1/2 cups (13 1/2 to 15 1/2 ounces/383 to 439 grams) all- purpose flour as needed', u'3/4 cup (1 1/2 sticks/6 ounces/170 grams) unsalted butter', u'3/4 cup (4 1/2 ounces/128 grams) packed brown sugar', u'1/4 cup (3 ounces/85 grams) light corn syrup', u'3/4 cup (3 ounces/85 grams) chopped pecans', u'4 tablespoons (1/2 stick/2 ounces/57 grams) unsalted butter', u'1 cup (7 ounces/200 grams) granulated sugar', u'1 tablespoon ground cinnamon'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. To make the dough, melt the 1/2 cup butter in a small saucepan over medium-low heat. Add the milk and sugar and heat just to lukewarm (about 110\xb0F), stirring to dissolve the sugar. Pour the warm milk mixture into a bowl. Stir in the yeast. Allow the mixture to sit for 10 minutes, then stir in the salt.', u'2. Beat the whole egg and egg yolk together and add to the yeast mixture. Stir in the flour 1 cup at a time until you have a sticky dough. Scrape the dough out onto a floured work surface and knead for about 5 minutes, until you have a nice smooth dough. Butter a large bowl. Place the dough in the prepared bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Put the bowl in a warm place and allow the dough to rise for 2 hours, until tripled in volume.', u'3. Meanwhile, brush a 9 \xd7 13-inch baking pan with some melted butter (or spray it with vegetable oil spray). To prepare the sugar-pecan topping, melt the butter with the brown sugar and corn syrup in a small saucepan over medium-low heat, stirring to combine. Remove from the heat and spread the mixture in the bottom of the pan. Sprinkle with the chopped pecans.', u'4. Punch down the dough and turn it out of the bowl onto a lightly floured work surface. Knead for a minute, then use a lightly floured rolling pin to roll the dough into a rectangle about 15 \xd7 12 inches and 1/8 inch thick. To make the cinnamon-sugar filling, melt the butter in a small saucepan over medium-low heat and allow it to cool. Brush the butter thoroughly over the surface of the dough. In a bowl, mix together the sugar and cinnamon. Sprinkle the cinnamon sugar evenly over the melted butter. Roll the rectangle up, like a jelly roll, along one long edge.', u"5. Slice the log of rolled dough into 1-inch-thick slices and arrange the slices, cut sides up, in the prepared pan. Cover the pan with a piece of plastic wrap (you can spray the plastic wrap first with vegetable oil spray to be sure it doesn't stick to the dough) and allow it to rise in a warm place for about 40 minutes.", u'6. Preheat the oven to 350\xb0F. Bake the schnecken until golden brown, 35 to 40 minutes, rotating the pan halfway through the baking time. Check them occasionally during the baking time, and if they seem to be browning too quickly, loosely cover them with a sheet of aluminum foil.', u'7. Remove the pan from the oven and cool on a wire rack for 5 to 10 minutes. Turn the schnecken out of the pan while still warm by inverting the pan over a large platter or baking sheet. Serve the schnecken warm.'], 'chef': u'Tom Douglas and Shelley Lance', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/grandma-douglass-schnecken-51128800', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 12 to 14 schnecken', 'recipe title': u"Grandma Douglas's Schnecken", 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"There's not much cheese in this gratin \u2014 the better to let the perfectly ripe summer peppers and tomatoes, cooked just enough to intensify their flavors, sing.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'79%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 lb red bell peppers (3 large), halved lengthwise', u'1 1/2 lb yellow bell peppers (3 large), halved lengthwise', u'5 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil plus additional for oiling pan', u'1/2 cup finely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh thyme', u'1/2 teaspoon finely chopped fresh rosemary', u'1 teaspoon finely grated fresh lemon zest', u'1 1/2 teaspoons salt', u'3/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'3 1/2 cups cubed (1/2-inch) baguette (preferably sourdough; from 1 loaf)', u'1 oz finely grated Parmigiano-Reggiano (1/2 cup)', u'4 large yellow tomatoes (2 lb total), cored and each cut crosswise into 5 slices', u'4 large red tomatoes (2 lb total), cored and each cut crosswise into 5 slices', u"Special equipment: a 13- by 9-inch (3- to 31/2-qt) gratin or nonreactive shallow baking dish (see cooks' note, below)"], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat broiler.', u'Arrange bell peppers, cut sides down, in a shallow baking pan.', u'Broil 4 to 5 inches from heat until blackened and beginning to soften, about 15 minutes.', u'Cover pan tightly with foil and let stand, covered, until cool enough to handle, 10 to 15 minutes. 3Peel peppers and cut lengthwise into 1/2-inch-wide strips.', u'Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 400\xb0F. {'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'Reserved neck, gizzard and heart from 13- to 14-pound turkey', u'2 cups chopped onions', u'1 1/2 cups chopped carrots', u'1/2 cup chopped celery', u'1 teaspoon dried marjoram', u'1/2 teaspoon dried thyme', u'1 bay leaf', u'Stems from 1 bunch fresh parsley', u'4 cups canned low-salt chicken broth', u'1 1/2 cups reserved soaking liquid from Three-Mushroom', u'2/3 cup tawny Port'], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat oil in heavy large pot over medium heat. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Feta, Kalamata olives, oregano, and a squeeze of fresh lemon juice give this grilled-squash pizza its unmistakably Greek flavor. I use a panini press to grill the slices of yellow squash and zucchini because I love the look and slightly charred flavor this method produces.', 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 (13-ounce/370-gram) ball Master Dough , preferably with starter, made with Poolish', u'1 part flour mixed with 1 part semolina, for dusting', u'1 to 2 medium (about 6 ounces/170 grams each) zucchini', u'1 to 2 medium (about 6 ounces/ 170 grams each) straight-neck yellow squash', u'Olive oil, for brushing', u'Fine sea salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'7 ounces (200 grams) part-skim mozzarella cheese, shredded (1-3/4 cups)', u'1-ounce (30-gram) piece Feta cheese, preferably water-packed Greek', u'6 pitted Kalamata olives, quartered lengthwise', u'1 large (18 grams) Peppadew pepper, cut into strips', u'Grated Pecorino Romano cheese, for dusting', u'Dried oregano, for dusting', u'Garlic Oil , for drizzling', u'1/2 lemon, grilled (see headnote)', u'2 pizza baking stones or steels, pizza peel'], 'preperation steps': [u'Remove the dough ball from the refrigerator and leave wrapped at room temperature until the dough warms to 60\xb0F to 65\xb0F. Transfer the slices to a flat plate and season with additional salt and pepper.', u'Dust the work surface with the dusting mixture, then move the dough to the surface and dust the top.', u"Sprinkle a wooden peel with the dusting mixture. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Jews from Persia (present-day Iran) are especially proud of Queen Esther's role in the holiday of Purim. A favorite dish of Iranian children is halvah, which they eat after they break the fast of Esther, observed on Adar 13. At nursery school, Merissa learned this recipe for halvah from an Iranian teacher. In between tastes, the children played with Esther and Ahasuerus marionettes they had made with the help of their teacher.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'50%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 cups flour', u'1 1/2 cups sugar', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1 cup vegetable oil', u'2 cups water', u'1 cup chopped walnuts', u'Measuring cups', u'Measuring spoon', u'Large frying pan with cover', u'Wooden spoon', u'Spatula'], 'preperation steps': [u'Adult with Child: In a frying pan, brown the flour over low heat, watching constantly, for about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat.', u'Child: To the flour, add the sugar, cinnamon, and oil. With the pan off the heat, stir for about 5 minutes, keeping the mixture a light brown color.', u'Adult: Add the water and reheat, stirring for about 5 minutes, until the halvah thickens. Then cover and simmer slowly for 5 minutes more. Fold in the walnuts.', u'Child: Let cool, then cut into squares.'], 'chef': u'Joan Nathan', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/halvah-40004', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes about 20 squares', 'recipe title': u'Halvah', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"According to lore, the original mole was served with turkey that had been fattened with hazelnuts. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'When shopping for ham, be aware that smoked pork shoulder is available partially or fully cooked. This will affect the braising time (partially cooked takes about 1 hour longer). We found that blanching the ham before braising helps eliminate excessive saltiness in both the ham and the broth. Leaving the skin on the ham adds body to the resulting sauce.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'57%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 (11- to 13-pound) bone-in smoked pork shoulder (sometimes called picnic ham)', u'2 medium leeks (white and pale green parts only), chopped', u'1 large onion, chopped', u'3 medium carrots, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u'2 celery ribs, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u'2 garlic cloves, finely chopped', u'6 (5-inch) fresh thyme sprigs plus 2 tablespoons finely chopped leaves', u'6 fresh flat-leaf parsley stems plus 1/4 cup finely chopped leaves', u'1/4 whole nutmeg, smashed with side of a large heavy knife', u'1 teaspoon whole black peppercorns', u'4 whole cloves', u'5 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened', u'2 cups dry white wine', u'4 cups water', u'1/3 cup all-purpose flour', u'Special equipment: a deep 10- to 20-quart pot (such as a stockpot, lobster pot, or canning pot); a wide 7-quart heavy ovenproof pot (if you have an 11-pound ham) or a wide 9- to 10-quart heavy ovenproof pot (if you have a 13-pound ham); an instant-read thermometer (preferably remote digital with probe)'], 'preperation steps': [u"Put ham in deep 10- to 20-quart pot and cover with cold water (don't worry if bone sticks out). Bring to a boil, then drain ham.", u'Put oven rack in lower third of oven (remove any other racks) and preheat oven to 350\xb0F.', u'Wash leeks in a bowl of cold water, then lift out and drain well. Cook leeks, onion, carrots, celery, garlic, thyme sprigs, parsley stems, nutmeg, peppercorns, and cloves in 2 tablespoons butter in wide 7- to 10-quart heavy pot (see "special equipment," above) over moderately high heat, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are softened and beginning to brown, about 10 minutes. Add wine and bring to a boil, then add ham, skin side down, and water (liquid will not cover ham) and return to a boil.', u'Cover pot tightly with lid or, if ham sticks up over top of pot, with heavy-duty foil. Braise ham in oven 1 hour.', u'Turn ham skin side up and continue to braise in oven, covered, until thermometer inserted into center of ham (do not touch bone) registers 120\xb0F, about 1 hour more (if ham was labeled "fully cooked"), or 160\xb0F, about 2 hours more (if ham was labeled "partially cooked").', u'While ham braises, mash together flour and remaining 3 tablespoons butter with a fork to make a beurre mani\xe9.', u'Transfer ham to a platter and let stand, loosely covered with foil, 45 minutes.', u'While ham stands, pour braising liquid through a fine-mesh sieve into a 3-quart saucepan, pressing on and discarding solids, and skim off any fat. Bring braising liquid to a simmer and whisk in beurre mani\xe9 1/2 tablespoon at a time (sauce will become lumpy). Continue to simmer, whisking, until sauce is smooth and slightly thickened, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in chopped thyme and parsley.', u'Remove skin from ham, then slice meat and serve with sauce.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/herb-braised-ham-108884', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Herb-Braised Ham', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'73%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 gallons water', u'1 3-pound box coarse kosher salt', u'1/2 cup whole black peppercorns', u'1/3 cup fresh thyme sprigs', u'1/3 cup fresh marjoram sprigs', u'1/3 cup fresh sage sprigs', u'12 Turkish bay leaves', u'1 13-pound turkey', u'1/2 cup butter, room temperature pear gravy', u'1/4 cup (1/2 stick) butter', u'1/2 cup all purpose flour', u'2 cups low-salt chicken broth', u'1 cup pear juice', u'2 tablespoons dark rum', u'3 tablespoons chopped fresh marjoram'], 'preperation steps': [u'Stir 3 gallons water and salt in large pot until salt dissolves. Stir in peppercorns and next 4 ingredients. Add turkey to brine. Place large plate atop turkey to submerge. Place in refrigerator. Soak turkey 8 to 10 hours. Remove turkey from brine; rinse and pat dry. (Can be prepared 1 day ahead. Store uncovered in refrigerator.)', u'Preheat oven to 450\xb0F. Place turkey on rack in large roasting pan. Rub butter over turkey. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place turkey in oven. Reduce temperature to 325\xb0F. Roast turkey until thermometer inserted into thickest part of thigh registers 175\xb0F, about 2 1/2 hours. Transfer turkey to platter; tent with foil. Let stand at room temperature 30 minutes before carving (internal temperature will rise 5 to 10 degrees).', u'Spoon off fat from drippings in pan, reserving 1/4 cup fat. Measure 2/3 cup pan juices. Melt butter and reserved 1/4 cup fat in heavy large saucepan over medium heat. Mix in flour. Stir until light brown, about 2 minutes. Gradually add chicken broth, pear juice, and 2/3 cup pan juices. Simmer until thickened, stirring frequently, about 10 minutes. Stir in rum. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle turkey with marjoram; serve with gravy.', u'No room in the fridge to brine a turkey? No problem. Put a turkey-sized oven bag in a large cooler, then place the turkey in the bag. Pour in the brine and seal tightly. Place ice over and around turkey, close the lid tightly, and let it brine 8 to 10 hours, adding ice periodically to keep temperature at 40\xb0 or below.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/herb-brined-turkey-with-pear-gravy-231060', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Herb-Brined Turkey with Pear Gravy', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Nothing says Christmas quite like a standing beef rib roast. For starters, it's got good bones. And those bones give it stature\u2014there's nothing petite about this hunk of beef\u2014so it is a commanding presence on your holiday table. That other holiday favorite, beef tenderloin, can't begin to compare in brawn or beefiness.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'83%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 (4-rib) standing beef rib roast (bone-in prime rib; 9 to 10 pounds)', u'1/4 cup mixed peppercorns (pink, white, and green)', u'3 tablespoons plus 2 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt, divided', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh thyme', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh rosemary', u'1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil', u'3 pounds medium Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled and each cut into 6 wedges (keep in a bowl of cold water to prevent discoloration)', u'3 pounds carrots, peeled and cut diagonally into 2-inch pieces', u'1 (750 milliliter) bottle Pinot Noir', u'1/2 cup chopped shallots', u'4 tablespoons unsalted butter, divided', u'2 1/4 cups reduced-salt beef or chicken broth', u'Special equipment: Heavy flameproof roasting pan (not glass) fitted with a flat rack; instant-read thermometer; 2 (18- by 13-inch) heavy rimmed sheet pans (aka half-sheet pans); parchment paper'], 'preperation steps': [u'Pat roast dry and put, fat side up, on rack in roasting pan.', u'Coarsely crush peppercorns in a mortar and pestle or folded kitchen towel (not terry cloth) with a meat pounder or bottom of a heavy skillet. Stir together peppercorns, 3 tablespoons kosher salt, thyme, and rosemary in a small bowl.', u'Rub roast all over with oil, then coat it all over with peppercorn mixture, pressing to help it adhere. Let coated roast stand at room temperature 1 hour.', u'Preheat oven to 450\xb0F with rack in lower third. Roast beef roast 20 minutes.', u'Reduce oven temperature to 350\xb0F and roast until an instant-read thermometer inserted into center of meat (do not touch bone) registers 110\xb0F, 1 1/2 to 2 hours more. Transfer to a platter (keep fat and pan juices in roasting pan) and let stand, uncovered, 40 minutes (temperature of meat will rise to about 130\xb0F for medium-rare).', u'While roast stands, put second oven rack in upper-third position and increase oven temperature to 450\xb0F. Line 1 sheet pan with parchment paper.', u'Strain pan juices from roasting pan through a sieve into a glass measuring cup (reserve roasting pan). Toss carrots in same bowl with another 3 tablespoons beef fat from pan and 1 teaspoon kosher salt, then spread out on other rimmed sheet pan. Roast vegetables in upper and lower thirds of oven, stirring occasionally and switching position of pans halfway through roasting, until golden, 25 to 30 minutes for carrots and 30 to 35 minutes for potatoes.', u'Skim off and discard any remaining fat from pan juices. Set pan over 2 burners. Add 1 cup of wine and deglaze pan by boiling it over high heat, scraping up brown bits, 1 minute. Pour into pan juices in cup.', u'Cook shallot in 1 tablespoon butter with remaining 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt in a 3- to 4-quart heavy saucepan over medium heat, stirring, until golden, 4 to 5 minutes. Add wine mixture in cup, along with remaining wine in bottle, and boil over high heat until mixture is reduced to 3/4 cup, about 10 minutes.', u'Add broth and continue to boil over high heat until mixture is reduced to 1 1/2 cups. Strain mixture through a sieve into another saucepan and whisk in remaining 3 tablespoons butter (cut into pieces) until incorporated. Season sauce with salt and pepper.', u'To carve roast, slide a carving knife along inside of ribs to separate meat from bones, then cut ribs into individual bones. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'These are outstanding buns, substantial yet tender. Before using buns, pull apart and cut lengthwise down center of each (but not all the way through).'], 'chef': u'Ian Knauer', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/homemade-burger-dog-buns-353657', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes about 18 Hamburger buns or 16 hot dog buns', 'recipe title': u'Homemade Burger/Dog Buns', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Ice wine, or eiswein, is traditionally made from grapes that are handpicked after being allowed to freeze. Less costly bottlings of the concentrated sweet wine are made from grapes frozen in freezers.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 (375-ml) bottle ice wine (13 fl oz)', u'3/4 cup water', u'6 tablespoons sugar', u'4 firm-ripe white peaches, cut into 1/2-inch-thick wedges', u'Special equipment: an ice cream maker'], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat wine, water, and sugar in a 3-quart saucepan over moderate heat, stirring, until sugar is dissolved, then gently simmer 2 minutes.
