{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Pillsbury test kitchen home economists have heard it all. When they told me some people were adding melted ice cream to a cake mix, I couldn't believe it. Well, that's precisely what I did with this fun recipe. Choose your flavor and let the ice cream melt. The only trick is that you must have 2 cups of melted ice cream. For super-premium ice creams with little overrun, that's 1 pint frozen. But for less expensive brands with a lot of air piped in, you'll need to begin with more than a pint.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'62%', 'ingredient list': [u'vegetable oil spray for misting the pan', u'flour for dusting the pan', u'1 package (18.25 ounces) plain white cake mix', u'2 cups melted ice cream, your choice of flavor', u'3 large eggs', u'Chocolate Marshmallow Frosting'], 'preperation steps': [u'Place a rack in the center of the oven and preheat the oven to 350\xb0F. Lightly mist a 12-cup Bundt pan with vegetable oil spray, then dust with flour. Shake out the excess flour. Set the pan aside.', u'Place the cake mix, melted ice cream, and eggs in a large mixing bowl. Blend with an electric mixer on low speed for 1 minute. Stop the machine and scrape down the sides of the bowl with the rubber spatula. Increase the mixer speed to medium and beat 2 minutes more, scraping the sides down again if needed. The batter should look thick and well blended. Pour the batter into the prepared pan, smoothing the top with the rubber spatula. Place the pan in the oven.', u'Bake the cake until it springs back when lightly pressed with your finger and just starts to pull away from the sides of the pan, 38 to 42 minutes. Remove the pan from the oven and place it on a wire rack to cool for 20 minutes. Run a long, sharp knife around the edge of the cake and invert it onto a small rack, then invert it again onto a second rack so that the cake is right side up to complete cooling, 30 minutes more.', u'Meanwhile prepare the Chocolate Marshmallow Frosting , or another frosting that would go well with the flavor of the ice cream in the cake. Place the cake on a serving platter and frost the top of the cake with clean, smooth strokes.'], 'chef': u'Anne Byrn', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/incredible-melted-ice-cream-cake-102834', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 16', 'recipe title': u'Incredible Melted Ice-Cream Cake', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'At the restaurant, this dish is served as a starter. It would also make a great main course for four.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'94%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 pound Italian sweet sausage, casings removed, crumbled into 1/2-inch pieces', u'8 ounces portobello mushrooms, stemmed, dark gills scraped out, caps diced', u'10 ounces fresh shiitake mushrooms, stemmed, diced', u'1 teaspoon chopped fresh thyme', u'1 teaspoon chopped fresh oregano', u'1 1/2 cups Madeira', u'6 cups chicken stock or canned low-salt chicken broth', u'1/2 cup (1 stick) butter', u'1 large onion, chopped', u'4 garlic cloves, minced', u'2 cups arborio rice or other medium-grain rice (about 13 ounces)', u'1 cup freshly grated Asiago cheese*'], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add sausage and saut\xe9 until beginning to brown, about 3 minutes. Add all mushrooms, thyme, and oregano and saut\xe9 until mushrooms are tender, about 10 minutes. Add 1/2 cup Madeira; boil until almost absorbed, about 1 minute. Set aside.', u'Bring stock to simmer in large saucepan; remove from heat and cover to keep hot. Melt butter in heavy large pot over medium-high heat. Add onion and garlic and saut\xe9 until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes. Add rice; stir 2 minutes. Add remaining 1 cup Madeira; simmer until absorbed, about 2 minutes. Add 1 cup hot stock; simmer until almost absorbed, stirring often, about 3 minutes. Continue to cook until rice is just tender and mixture is creamy, adding more stock by cupfuls, stirring often and allowing most stock to be absorbed before adding more, about 25 minutes. Stir in sausage mixture. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Transfer to serving bowl. Pass cheese separately.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/italian-sausage-and-wild-mushroom-risotto-105531', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 first-course servings', 'recipe title': u'Italian Sausage and Wild Mushroom Risotto', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Filled with spices, buttermilk, and jam, this moist cake has been in the baking repertoire of my husband's family for over a century. Although this particular recipe hails from Bowling Green, Kentucky, I found many other recipes for jam cake that originated further south. At first glance, I mistakenly thought the jam was merely a filling between the cake layers but to my happy surprise, the jam is actually an ingredient in the batter, creating a lovely berry hue to the cake and an even better berry taste. This down-home cake traditionally calls for a sweet caramel frosting, but I opted for a decadent caramel chocolate ganache. Make the ganache before you make the cake as it needs about 3 hours to firm up at room temperature (and is so much better when not refrigerated).", 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'Three 8-inch round cake pans, greased and bottoms lined with parchment paper circles', u'2 3/4 cups (13 3/4 ounces) all-purpose flour', u'1 teaspoon baking soda', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cloves', u'1 teaspoon fine sea salt', u'1 1/2 cups (17 1/4 ounces) jam, preferably blackberry, raspberry, or apricot', u'3/4 cup buttermilk, at room temperature', u'3/4 cup (6 ounces) unsalted butter, at room temperature', u'1 1/2 cups (10 1/2 ounces) sugar', u'4 eggs, at room temperature', u'1 cup (4 ounces) sliced natural almonds, toasted', u'Caramel Chocolate Ganache'], 'preperation steps': [u'Center an oven rack and preheat the oven to 325\xb0F.', u'In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and salt, then whisk the mixture to ensure that the ingredients are well distributed.', u'In a small bowl, stir together the jam and the buttermilk.', u'In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, cream the butter and sugar together on medium-high speed until fluffy, about \u20285 minutes. As you make the batter, stop the mixer frequently and scrape the paddle and the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula. Blend in the eggs one at a time, adding the next one as soon as the previous one has disappeared into the batter. With the mixer on low speed, add the flour mixture in three parts, alternating with the buttermilk mixture in two parts, beginning and ending with the flour. After each addition, mix until just barely blended and stop and scrape the bowl. Stop the mixer before the last of the flour has been incorporated and complete the blending by hand with a rubber spatula to ensure you do not overbeat the batter.', u'Divide the batter evenly into the prepared pans (there will be approximately 1 pound 4 ounces per pan) and smooth the tops. Bake in the middle of the oven until the centers are just barely firm when lightly touched, 32 to 34 minutes. Cool the cakes on a wire rack for 30 minutes before removing them from their pans. Once removed, continue to cool the cakes on the rack, top side up, until they reach room temperature. Leave the parchment paper on until you assemble the cake.', u'To assemble the cake, place one of the layers, top side up, on a flat plate or a cake board. Using a thin metal spatula, spread a thin layer of caramel ganache (a bit more than 1/2 cup) on top of the cake and out to the edges of the cake. Sprinkle 2 tablespoons of almonds evenly over the ganache. Align the next cake layer, top side up, on top of the first one, and repeat with another thin layer of ganache and almonds. Place the final layer of cake on top of the cake. Frost the top heavily and the sides lightly with the remainder of the ganache. Lightly press the remaining toasted almonds on the sides of cake.', u'This cake is best stored and served at room temperature. In an airtight container, it keeps for up to 5 days.'], 'chef': u'Julie Richardson', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/jam-cake-with-caramel-chocolate-ganache-51111800', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'12 to 16 servings', 'recipe title': u'Jam Cake with Caramel Chocolate Ganache', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 cups jasmine rice (13 oz)', u'2 cups water', u'1 cup reduced-sodium chicken broth', u'1/2 cup salted roasted peanuts (2 1/2 oz), finely chopped', u'2/3 cup thinly sliced scallion greens'], 'preperation steps': [u'Wash rice in several changes of cold water in a bowl until water is almost clear, then drain rice well in a sieve. Bring rice, water, and broth to a boil in a 3- to 4-quart heavy saucepan, then reduce heat to low and cook, covered, until rice is tender and water is absorbed, 12 to 15 minutes. Remove from heat and let stand, covered, 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork, then stir in peanuts and scallion greens.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/jasmine-rice-with-peanuts-and-scallions-232172', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Jasmine Rice with Peanuts and Scallions', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"No Fourth of July celebration is complete without a traditional flag cake studded with sweet summer berries. But slice into our Stars and Stripes creation and you'll quickly discover this isn't your everyday vanilla sheet cake with buttercream frosting. For a fresh new take on everyone's favorite red, white, and blue finale, we paired moist chocolate cake with tangy cream cheese frosting, and finished with juicy raspberries and blueberries. Have no fear if cake decorating isn't your strong suit. You'll be able to master this patriotic design using our step-by-step photos and tips for frosting and adorning the ultimate Independence Day dessert.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'71%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 cup boiling water', u'3/4 cup natural unsweetened cocoa powder', u'1 tablespoon instant coffee granules', u'1/2 cup whole milk', u'1 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract', u'2 cups all-purpose flour, plus additional flour for dusting pan', u'1 1/4 teaspoons baking soda', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'2 sticks (1/2 pound) unsalted butter, softened, plus additional butter for greasing pan', u'1 cup packed light brown sugar', u'1 cup sugar', u'4 large eggs', u'2 (8-ounce) packages cream cheese, at room temperature', u'2 sticks (1/2 pound) unsalted butter, at room temperature', u'1 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract', u"1 1/2 cups confectioners' sugar, sifted", u'1 1/2 pints raspberries (about 3 cups total)', u'1/2 pint blueberries (about 1 cup total)', u'Equipment: 13- by 9-inch metal baking pan, stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, pastry bag, star-shaped pastry tip (such as Wilton #2110)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Position a rack in the middle of the oven and preheat to 350\xb0F.', u'Butter the bottom and sides of a 13- by 9-inch metal baking pan and line the bottom with wax or parchment paper. Butter the paper and dust the pan with flour, knocking out any excess.', u'In a medium bowl, whisk together the boiling water, cocoa powder, and instant coffee granules until smooth. Whisk in the milk and vanilla.', u'In a second medium bowl, sift together the flour, baking soda, and salt.', u'In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, combine the butter with both sugars and beat on medium until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes. Add the eggs, one at a time, and beat on medium until fully incorporated. Reduce the speed to low and add the flour and cocoa powder mixtures in batches, beginning and ending with the flour mixture. (The batter may look curdled.) Pour the batter into the prepared pan, smoothing the top, and bake the cake until a wooden toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean and the cake begins to pull away from the sides of the pan, 35 to 40 minutes. Let the cake cool in the pan on a rack for 10 minutes, then invert the cake onto the rack, remove the wax or parchment paper, and let it cool completely. DO AHEAD: The unfrosted cake, can be cooled, wrapped securely in plastic wrap, and stored at room temperature up to 24 hours, before assembling and serving.', u"In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, combine the cream cheese and butter and beat until creamy and smooth, 3 to 5 minutes. Beat in the vanilla extract. With the mixer on low, add the sifted confectioners' sugar in three batches, mixing until fully incorporated. Increase the speed to medium-high and beat until the frosting is smooth. Chill the frosting in the refrigerator for 30 minutes before assembling the cake.", u'Frost the top and sides of the cake with 2 1/2 cups of the frosting. Transfer the remaining frosting to a pastry bag fitted with the star tip.', u'Using a toothpick or small knife, outline a 4 1/2-inch-long by 3 1/2-inch-wide rectangle in the top left corner of the cake. This area will be reserved for blueberries.', u'Starting with the longer side of the cake that is closest to you, pipe a line of frosting along the top edge of the cake then arrange two horizontal rows of raspberries directly above the line of frosting. Pipe a second line of frosting above the raspberries and arrange two more horizontal rows of raspberries directly above the frosting. Repeat this process two more times, making sure to exclude the top left corner that is reserved for the blueberries. Arrange the blueberries in horizontal rows in the top left corner of the cake.', u'Slice and serve the cake immediately or store it, covered securely in plastic wrap, in the refrigerator until ready to serve.'], 'chef': u'Kelly Senyei', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/july-4th-flag-cake-51170010', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 1 (13- by 9-inch) cake', 'recipe title': u'July 4th Flag Cake', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Pudding cakes are little culinary marvels. Take what is basically a thin cake batter, fold in whipped egg whites, put the batter into a baking dish (or several ramekins as I do here), and voil\xe0! As it bakes, the batter separates and forms a sponge cake on the top with a thick, kind of custardy pudding on the bottom. Lemon pudding cakes are common in the South, but I've swapped lemon for Key lime juice.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'50%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 (6-ounce) ramekins or custard cups', u'Electric stand mixer or a handheld mixer and medium bowl', u'Rubber spatula', u'9- by 13-inch baking pan that will hold the ramekins', u'2 tablespoons plus 1/2 cup granulated sugar', u'2 large eggs', u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter, at room temperature', u'1/4 cup unbleached all-purpose flour', u'1/8 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1 cup whole milk', u'1/4 cup Key lime juice', u'1/4 cup sliced almonds'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Preheat the oven to 350\xb0F and put the oven rack in the middle of the oven.', u'2. Grease the insides of the ramekins with nonstick cooking spray or butter and evenly coat with the 2 tablespoons sugar (see headnote). Separate the eggs into 2 bowls.', u'3. Using the stand mixer, or a handheld mixer and medium bowl, first on low speed and then gradually increasing the speed to medium, beat the butter and the 1/2 cup sugar together until smooth. Scrape down the side of the bowl with the rubber spatula. Beat in the egg yolks one at a time, mixing well after each addition, stopping once or twice to scrape down the side of the bowl. Reduce the speed to medium-low, add the flour and salt, and mix until everything is evenly combined. Mix in the milk, 1/3 cup at a time. Then, by hand, stir in the Key lime juice. The batter will be thin. Set aside while you whip the egg whites.', u'4. With a handheld or stand mixer, whisk the egg whites in a clean dry bowl on medium speed until frothy. Increase the speed to medium-high and whip until the whites hold a peak on the whisk or beaters (stop the mixer and lift to check).', u'5. Using the rubber spatula, gently fold the egg whites into the Key lime mixture. Using a measuring cup to scoop up the batter evenly, divide it among the ramekins so it comes to within 1/4 inch of the rims.', u"6. It's best to find a space near your oven to fill the baking pan with water so you don't have to walk too far. Place the ramekins in the baking pan and, using a container with a spout, slowly pour very hot tap water into the pan so that the water comes about half the way up the sides of the ramekins. Carefully transfer the baking pan to the oven. Bake the puddings until some begin to turn golden brown and have cracked slightly on the surface, about 40 minutes.", u'7. Remove the baking pan from the oven. Let cool until you can pick up the ramekins (15 minutes or so), then remove them from the water.', u"8. Spread the almonds in one layer in a small baking pan and put it in the still-warm oven. Set a timer for 10 minutes and check the nuts to see if they're a light golden brown. If not, toast 2 minutes longer. Set aside to cool.", u'9. Serve the cakes warm or at room temperature, the almonds scattered on top just before serving.'], 'chef': u'Emily Luchetti and Lisa Weiss', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/key-lime-pudding-cakes-366009', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Key Lime Pudding Cakes', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Abigail Gullo, the head bar chef at SoBou in New Orleans, shared this recipe exclusively with Epicurious. In keeping with Mardi Gras tradition, Gullo occasionally sneaks a plastic baby (like those found in actual King Cakes) into the glass when she makes this drink at Sobou. "I tell people if you get the baby, you have to buy the next round." At home, another option is to freeze the baby into the large ice cube that chills the cocktail.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 cups sugar', u'1 cup water', u'6 to 8 (3-inch) cinnamon sticks', u'1 (2 1/2-inch) ice cube or ice ball', u'2 ounces Rougaroux 13 Pennies Praline Rum*', u'2 dashes of El Guapo Chicory-Pecan Bitters**', u'1 (1/2- by 3-inch) piece orange peel and 2 to 3 golden raisins for garnish', u"*Rougaroux 13 Pennies Praline Rum is available throughout Louisiana, and has limited availability in Kentucky and Montana. It can be ordered and shipped to most states by calling or emailing Donner-Peltier Distillers (985-446-0002; info@dpdspirits.com). To make your own praline-infused rum, see the Cook's Notes below.", u"**El Guapo Chicory-Pecan bitters can be ordered from Amazon.com. Alternatively, Dale Degroff's Pimento Aromatic Bitters make a good substitute.", u'1 (2 1/2-inch) ice cube mold; 1 cocktail pick'], 'preperation steps': [u'In a small saucepan, bring the sugar, water, and cinnamon sticks to a boil, stirring occasionally, and continue boiling until the sugar is completely dissolved, 10 to 15 minutes. Cool the syrup then remove and discard the cinnamon sticks. DO AHEAD: Cinnamon syrup can be made ahead and refrigerated, in an airtight container, for up to 1 week.', u'Place 1 (2 1/2-inch) ice cube in a rocks glass. Add the rum, the bitters, and 1/2 teaspoon (1/4 ounce) cinnamon syrup, and stir until well chilled. Squeeze the orange peel over the drink, making sure the oils fall into the glass, then thread the peel, along with the raisins, onto a cocktail pick. Place the pick in the drink and serve.'], 'chef': u'Abigail Gullo', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/king-cake-old-fashioned-51225610', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 1 drink', 'recipe title': u'King Cake Old Fashioned', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'While flipping through an Australian food magazine, my eyes were drawn to the appetizing green sauce in a photo of Indian-style meatballs. I am one of those people who do not rate cilantro as my favorite herb, but when I developed this dish to replicate the recipe at home, the sauce proved as delicious as it was attractive. Cook some basmati rice to serve with the meatballs.', 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'33%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1 medium yellow onion, chopped', u'4 cloves garlic, minced', u'2 tablespoons peeled and minced fresh ginger', u'1 jalape\xf1o or serrano chile, seeded and minced', u'1 (13 1/2-ounce) can coconut milk (do not shake)', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1/2 teaspoon garam masala', u'1 cup packed chopped cilantro leaves', u'1 teaspoon tamarind concentrate (sold at Indian grocers) or fresh lemon juice', u'Kosher salt', u'1 pound ground lamb', u'1/2 cup fresh bread crumbs', u'1 large egg, beaten', u'1 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1/2 teaspoon garam masala', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. To make the meatballs, mix the ground lamb, bread crumbs, egg, cumin, garam masala, and salt together in a large bowl. Cover and refrigerate for at least 15 minutes or up to 4 hours.', u'2. To make the sauce, heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion, garlic, ginger, and chile and stir well. Open the can of coconut milk. Spoon out and measure 1/2 cup of the thick coconut milk that has risen to the top. Add to the saucepan with the cumin and garam masala. Cook until the onion mixture is softened and the coconut milk is reduced and looks oily, about 5 minutes. Add 1 cup water, the cilantro, tamarind concentrate, and remaining coconut milk (about 1 1/4 cups). Whisk well and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to medium-low and cook, whisking occasionally, until slightly reduced, about 10 minutes.', u'3. Using your hands rinsed under cold water, shape the meat mixture into 24 equal small meatballs. Transfer to a plate. Carefully add the meatballs to the simmering sauce and cover with the lid ajar. Simmer until the sauce is thickened and the meatballs are cooked through with no sign of pink, about 20 minutes. Season with salt. Serve hot.'], 'chef': u'Rick Rodgers', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/lamb-meatballs-in-green-curry-sauce-369529', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 to 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Lamb Meatballs in Green Curry Sauce', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'In the Emilia-Romagna region of Italy, lasagne bolognese is usually made with a besciamella sauce. Italian-American cooks often replace that time-consuming step with ricotta. In this wickedly good interpretation, food editor Melissa Roberts combines the two traditions by whisking milk into some of the ricotta, creating a billowy pseudo-besciamella (the remaining ricotta mixture is stirred together with spinach). We rarely call for specific brands, but we did find that widely available Barilla no-boil dried noodles produced an exemplary lasagne. An egg pasta, this one comes very close to the flavor and delicacy of homemade.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'78%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/4 cup olive oil', u'3 ounces sliced pancetta, finely chopped', u'1 medium onion, finely chopped', u'1 large carrot, finely chopped', u'1 celery rib, finely chopped', u'2 garlic cloves, chopped', u'2 pounds ground beef chuck (not lean)', u'1 1/2 cups dry white wine', u'1 1/2 cups whole milk', u'1/4 cup tomato paste', u'1 1/2 teaspoon thyme leaves', u'2 (10-ounce) packages frozen chopped spinach,thawed', u'2 (15-ounce) containers whole-milk ricotta', u'4 large eggs, lightly beaten', u'1/2 cup grated Parmigiano-Reggiano', u'1/2 teaspoon grated nutmeg', u'3/4 cup whole milk, divided', u'12 Barilla no-boil dried lasagne noodles (from 1 box)', u'1/2 cup grated Parmigiano-Reggiano', u'Equipment: a 13- by 9-inch baking pan (3 inches deep)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat oil in a 12-to 14-inch heavy skillet over medium heat until it shimmers. Cook pancetta, onion, carrot, celery, and garlic, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are golden and softened, 12 to 15 minutes. Add beef and cook, stirring occasionally and breaking up any lumps, until meat is no longer pink, 6 to 10 minutes. Stir in wine, milk, tomato paste, thyme, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 3/4 teaspoon pepper. Simmer, uncovered, stirring occasionally, until most of liquid has evaporated but sauce is still moist, about 1 hour.', u'Put spinach in a kitchen towel (not terry cloth) and twist to squeeze out as much moisture as possible.', u'Whisk together ricotta, eggs, parmesan, nutmeg, 1 1/4 teaspoons salt, and 1 teaspoon pepper. Transfer 1 1/2 cups ricotta mixture to another bowl and whisk in 1/4 cup milk; set aside. Whisk spinach into remaining filling with remaining 1/2 cup milk.', u'Preheat oven to 375\xb0F with rack in middle.', u"Soak noodles in a bowl of very warm water until pliable but not softened, 3 to 5 minutes. Place on a kitchen towel (it's not necessary to pat noodles dry).", u'Spread 1 1/2 cups bolognese sauce in baking pan and sprinkle with 1 tablespoon parmesan. Cover with 3 noodles, leaving space in between. Spread half of spinach filling on top, then 1 cup bolognese sauce, and top with 1 tablespoon parmesan and 3 noodles; repeat. Top with remaining bolognese sauce, 1 tablespoon parmesan, and remaining 3 noodles. Pour reserved ricotta mixture over top and sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup parmesan.', u'Cover pan tightly with parchment paper and foil (or just buttered foil) and bake 50 minutes. Remove foil and bake until top is browned in spots, about 15 minutes more. Let stand 15 to 30 minutes before cutting.'], 'chef': u'Melissa Roberts', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/lasagne-bolognese-with-spinach-351166', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Lasagne Bolognese with Spinach', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This is perhaps my favorite way to eat pound cake! The fresh light flavor of lemon blends beautifully with the buttery flavor of pound cake. The lemon syrup tenderizes, adds tartness, and helps to keep the cake fresh for a few days longer than usual. Poppy seeds add a delightful crunch. Lemon blossoms and lemon leaves make a lovely and appropriate garnish.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'84%', 'ingredient list': [u'All ingredients should be at room temperature.', u'3 tablespoons milk (1.5 ounces = 45 grams)', u'3 large eggs (scant 5 fluid ounces = 5.25 ounces = 150 grams, weighed without shells)', u'1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla (6 grams)', u'1 1/2 cups sifted cake flour (5.25 ounces = 150 grams)', u'3/4 cup sugar (5.25 ounces = 150 grams)', u'3/4 teaspoon baking powder (3.7 grams)', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 tablespoon loosely packed grated lemon zest (6 grams)', u'3 tablespoons poppy seeds (1 ounce = 28 grams)', u'13 tablespoons unsalted butter, must be softened (6.5 ounces = 184 grams)', u'1/4 + 2 tablespoons sugar (2.75 ounces = 75 grams)', u'1/4 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice (2 ounces = 63 grams)', u'One 8-inch by 4-inch by 2 1/2-inch loaf pan (4 cups) \u2014 most attractive size \u2014 or any 6-cup loaf or fluted tube pan, greased and floured. If using a loaf pan, grease it, line the bottom with parchment or wax paper, and then grease again and flour.'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F.', u'In a medium bowl lightly combine the milk, eggs, and vanilla.', u"In a large mixing bowl combine the dry ingredients, including the lemon zest and poppy seeds, and mix on low speed for 30 seconds to blend. Add the butter and half the egg mixture. Mix on low speed until the dry ingredients are moistened. Increase to medium speed (high speed if using a hand mixer) and beat for 1 minute to aerate and develop the cake's structure.", u'Scrape down the sides. Gradually add the remaining egg mixture in 2 batches, beating for 20 seconds after each addition to incorporate the ingredients and strengthen the structure. Scrape down the sides.', u'Scrape the batter into the prepared pan and smooth the surface with a spatula. The batter will be almost 1/2 inch from the top of a 4-cup loaf pan. (If your pan is slightly smaller, use any excess batter for cupcakes.) Bakes 55 to 65 minutes (35 to 45 minutes in a fluted tube pan) or until a wooden toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cover loosely with buttered foil after 30 minutes to prevent overbrowning. The cake should start to shrink from the sides of the pan only after removal from the oven.', u'To get an attractive split down the middle of the crust, wait until the natural split is about to develop (about 20 minutes) and then with a lightly greased sharp knife or a single-edged razor blade make a shallow mark about 6 inches long down the middle of the cake. This must be done quickly so that the oven door does not remain open very long or the cake will fall. When cake splits, it will open along the mark.', u'In a small pan over medium heat, stir the sugar and lemon juice until dissolved. As soon as the cake comes out of the oven, place the pan on a rack, poke the cake all over with a wire tester, and brush it with 1/2 the syrup. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Loosen the sides with a spatula and invert it onto a greased wire rack. Poke the bottom of the cake with the wire tester, brush it with some syrup, and reinvert onto a greased wire rack. Brush the sides with the remaining syrup and allow to cool before wrapping airtight. Store 24 hours before eating to give the syrup a chance to distribute evenly. The syrup will keep the cake fresh a few days longer than a cake without syrup.', u'Note:This cake is very attractive made in individual portions. A 6-cake Bundt-lette pan is the perfect size. This recipe will make 6 individual cakelettes, which require about 20 minutes to bake.', u'Finished Height: In a 4-cup loaf: 2 1/4 inches at the sides and 3 1/2 inches in the middle. In a 6-cup loaf: 1 3/4 inches at the sides and 2 1/2 inches in the middle. In a 6-cup fluted tube: 2 1/4 inches in the middle.', u'Store: Airtight: 3 days room temperature, 1 week refrigerated, 2 months frozen.', u'Complementary Adornment: A simple dusting of powdered sugar.', u'Serve: Room temperature.', u'\u2022 Use cake flour that does not already contain leavening. Do not use self-rising cake flour.', u'\u2022 Use superfine sugar for finest texture.', u'\u2022 Use fresh baking powder.', u'\u2022 Measure or weigh ingredients carefully.', u'\u2022 If using a hand-held mixer, beat at high speed.', u'\u2022 Use the correct pan size.', u'\u2022 For very even layers and maximum height use Magi-Cake Strips.', u'\u2022 Check for accurate oven temperature.', u'\u2022 Use correct baking time; do not overbake.', u'\u2022 Be sure to use a wooden toothpick to test for doneness. The cake will spring back when pressed lightly in the center even before it is done. If the cake is underbaked, it will have tough, gummy spots instead of a fine, tender crumb.'], 'chef': u'Rose Levy Beranbaum', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/lemon-poppy-seed-pound-cake-105981', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Lemon Poppy Seed Pound Cake', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Many of the cake's components can be made a head, and once the tiers are filled and decorated, they can be refrigerated up to two days or frozen up to two weeks before the wedding.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'94%', 'ingredient list': [u'13 large eggs', u'5 1/2 cups sugar', u'2 2/3 cups vegetable oil', u'2 2/3 cups part-skim ricotta cheese (about 21 ounces)', u'1/4 cup orange juice', u'1/4 cup grated lemon peel (from about 8 lemons)', u'3 tablespoons orange liqueur', u'2 1/2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', u'1 tablespoon vanilla extract', u'8 3/4 cups all purpose flour', u'2 tablespoons baking powder', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'5 large eggs', u'1 1/4 cups unsalted butter, room temperature', u'1 1/4 cups sugar', u'3/4 cup fresh lemon juice (from about 5 lemons)', u'1 tablespoon grated lemon peel', u'3 cups chilled whipping cream', u'6 tablespoons sugar', u'1 1/2 cups water', u'3/4 cup fresh lemon juice', u'3/4 cup sugar', u'1 8-inch-diameter cardboard cake round', u'3 1/2 cups fresh raspberries, about three 6-ounce baskets', u'3 1/2 cups fresh small blackberries or boysenberries, about three 6-ounce baskets', u'1 12-inch-diameter cardboard cake round', u'11 large egg yolks', u'3 1/4 cups plus 7 tablespoons sugar', u'1 cup plus 2 tablespoons milk (do not use low-fat or nonfat)', u'1 1/2 tablespoons grated lemon peel', u'1 tablespoon vanilla extract', u'3 pounds unsalted butter, cut into large pieces, room temperature', u'3/4 cup water', u'7 large egg whites', u'3 12-inch-long, 1/4-inch-diameter wooden dowels', u'1 3-foot long peach and/or cream colored ribbons', u'2 4-foot-long peach and/or cream-colored ribbons', u'Assorted nonpoisonous flowers (such as roses, freesias, and tulips)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Position rack in center of oven and preheat to 350\xb0F. Butter bottom of 12-inch-diameter cheesecake pan(not springform) with 3-inch-high sides and removable bottom. Line bottom of pans with parchment paper.', u'Beat eggs, sugar, and oil in large bowl of heavy-duty mixer and medium-low speed 5 minutes. Increase speed to medium and beat until mixture is very thick and falls in heavy ribbon when beater is lifted, about 5 minutes. Whisk cheese, orange juice, lemon peel, liqueur, lemon juice, and vanilla in medium bowl until well blended. Add cheese mixture to egg mixture; beat at low speed until just blended. Transfer to extra-large bowl (at least 6-quart capacity). Sift flour, baking powder, and salt into large bowl. Sift dry ingredients over batter in 5 additions, whisking to blend after each addition. Transfer about 11 cups batter to 12-inch prepared pan and about 5 cups batter to 8-inch prepared pan (batter should be of equal depth in both pans).', u'Bake cakes until golden brown in firm (tops may crack) and tester inserted into center comes out clean, rotating pans occasionally for even baking and covering loosely with foil if browning too quickly; about 1 hour 30 minutes. Transfer to racks; cool completely.', u'Whisk eggs to blend in medium bowl. Combine butter, 1 1/4 cups sugar, lemon juice, and peel in heavy medium saucepan. Stir over medium heat until butter melts, sugar dissolves and mixture comes to a boil. Gradually whisk lemon mixture into eggs. Return to same pan. Stir over medium heat until curd thickens and just begins to bubble, about 3 minutes. Strain curd into large bowl. Chill until cold and thick, stirring occasionally, about 4 hours.', u'Beat cream and 6 tablespoons sugar in medium bowl until firm peaks form. Fold into curd in 4 additions. Chill filling until very cold, about 2 hours.', u'Stir all ingredients in heavy medium saucepan over medium heat until sugar dissolves. Increase heat; bring to boil. Chill syrup until cold, about 1 hour. (Cakes, filling, and syrup can be made 1 day ahead. Cover cakes; store at room temperature. Cover filling and syrup; keep refrigerated.', u'Cut around sides of cakes to loosen. Push up pan bottoms, releasing cakes from pan. If necessary, cut between parchment and pan bottoms to loosen cakes. Invert cakes onto surface. Peel off parchment. Wash and dry pans and reassemble.', u'Using long serrated knife, cut off doomed top of 8-inch cake to level. Cut cake horizontally into 3 equal layers. Place bottom cake layer, cut side up, on 8-inch cardboard. Place cake on cardboard back into pan. Brush bottom layer with 1/4 cup lemon syrup. Spread with 1 1/2 cups lemon filling. Sprinkle with 1 1/2 cups raspberries. Place top cake layer atop raspberries; press cake lightly to compact. Brush with 1/4 cup syrup. (Assembled cake may be higher than pan sides.) Cover tightly with plastic wrap.', u'Using long serrated knife, cut off doomed top of 12-inch cake to level. Cut cake horizontally into 3 equal layers. Place bottom layer, cut side up, on 12-inch cardboard. Place cake on cardboard back into pan. Brush with 1/2 cup lemon syrup. Spread with 3 cups lemon filling. Sprinkle with 2 cups raspberries. Using 10- or 11-inch diameter tart pan as aid, slide top layer onto raspberries. Press cake lightly to compact. Brush with 1/2 cup syrup. (Assembled cake may be higher than pan sides.) Cover tightly with plastic wrap. Refrigerate both cakes overnight.', u'Whisk yolks and 1 cup plus 2 tablespoons sugar in large bowl to blend. Bring milk and lemon peel just to boil in heavy large saucepan. Gradually whisk hot milk into yolk mixture. Return to same saucepan. Stir custard over medium heat until thick, about 3 minutes ( do not allow custard to boil). Strain custard into extra-large (6-quart) metal bowl; add vanilla extract. Using handheld electric mixer, beat custard until custard lightens and custard cools to room temperature, about 15 minutes. Gradually add butter; beat until well blended, scraping down sides of bowl often. (If buttercream appears curdled at any time, place bowl directly over heat for several seconds. Remove from heat and beat well; repeat warming and beating as necessary to achieve smooth texture). Set buttercream aside at room temperature.', u'Stir 2 1/4 cups sugar and 3/4 cup water in heavy medium saucepan over medium heat until sugar dissolves. Attach clip-on candy thermometer to side of pan. Increase heat and boil syrup without stirring until thermometer registers 240\xb0F, occasionally brushing down sugar crystals from sides of pan with wet pastry brush, about 7 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, beat egg whites in large bowl of heavy-duty mixer until stiff but not dry. Gradually add 5 tablespoons sugar and beat until firm glossy peaks form. Gradually beat hot sugar syrup into egg whites. Continue to beat 2 minutes longer. Place bowl of meringue into larger bowl filled with ice and water. Using handheld electric mixer with clean beaters, continue to beat until meringue cools to room temperature, about 10 minutes. Gradually add meringue to buttercream, beating until well blended.', u'Cut around all sides of 8-inch cake. Push up pan bottom, releasing cake from pan. Remove pan bottom, leaving cake on cardboard base. If desired, place cake on revolving cake stand. Using offset spatula, spread thin layer of frosting (about 2 1/3 cups) over top and sides of cake to anchor crumbs. Refrigerate cakes on their cardboard bases until frosting is firm, about 1 hour.', u'Spread enough frosting (about 1 1/2 cups) over top and sides of 8-inch cake to coat. Spread enough frosting (about 3 cups) over tops and sides of 12-inch cake to coat. Dip large offset spatula into very hot water to warm blade; wipe dry. Run spatula over sides and tops of cakes, warming spatula repeatedly as necessary, until frosting is smooth. Using pastry bag fitted with small plain round tip, pipe border of small frosting dots around top edge of each cake. Refrigerate both cakes uncovered on their cardboard bases until frosting hardens, about 4 hours. (Once frosting is hardened, cakes can be wrapped in plastic and refrigerated up to two days or double-wrapped with plastic and frozen up to two weeks. Before continuing with recipe, thaw wrapped frozen cakes overnight in refrigerator.)', u'Insert 1 dowel straight down into center of 12-inch cake to cardboard base. Mark dowel about 1/4 inch above top of frosting. Remove dowel and cut with serrated knife at marked point. Cut 2 more dowels to same length. Press 3 cut dowels into cake, positioning about 3 1/2 inches inward from cake on platter. Using large metal spatula as aid, place 8-inch cake on its cardboard atop dowels in 12-inch cake, centering carefully.', u'Wrap 3-foot long ribbons around base of 8-inch cake; cut to fit with slight overlap. Press ribbons gently into frosting to adhere. Wrap 4-foot long ribbons around base of 12 inch cake; cut to fit with slight overlap. Press ribbons gently into frosting to adhere.', u'Transfer 8-inch cake to work surface; cut cake into 16 slices. Remove dowels from 12-inch cake. Staring 2 inches inward from edge and inserting knife straight down, cut 8-inch-diameter circle in center of cake. Cut outer portion of cake into 16 slices. Cut middle portion of cake into 8 slices. Cut inner 4-inch portion of cake into 4 wedges. Serve cake.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/lemon-berry-wedding-cake-101874', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 44', 'recipe title': u'Lemon-Berry Wedding Cake', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Though Treviso is recognized as the birthplace of tiramis\xf9, the precise origins of this phenomenally popular dessert are shrouded in mystery. Imagine my excitement, then, when my friend Celeste Tonon, proprietor of Ristorante da Celeste, passed on to me the original procedures for making this luscious assemblage of ladyfingers (savoiardi) and Mascarpone cream, which Celeste learned from his mentor Speranza Garatti, the true mother of tiramis\xf9, he claims. Her creation was made and served in individual portions, in a goblet or coppa, which I suspect gave rise to its name, which means "pick me up" in the Venetian dialect.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'97%', 'ingredient list': [u'5 large eggs', u'5 or 6 lemons', u'1 cup sugar', u'1 1/2 cups limoncello liqueur', u'1 cup water', u'1 pound (2 cups) Mascarpone, at room temperature', u'40 ladyfingers (preferably imported Italian savoiardi), or more as needed', u'A double boiler, with a large stainless-steel bowl and a wide saucepan to hold it; a large flexible wire whisk; a shallow-rimmed pan for moistening the savoiardi with syrup', u'For assembling the tiramis\xf9: a shallow casserole or baking dish with 3-quart capacity, such as a 9-by-13-inch Pyrex pan'], 'preperation steps': [u'Pour just enough water in the double-boiler pan so the water level is right below the bottom of the mixing bowl when it is sitting in the pan. Separate the eggs, putting yolks into the large bowl of the double boiler and the whites into another stainless-steel bowl for whipping by hand or with an electric mixer.', u'Remove the zest of two or more of the lemons, using a fine grater, to get 2 tablespoons of zest. Squeeze out and strain the juice of these and the other lemons to get 3/4 cup of fresh lemon juice.', u'To make the base for the tiramis\xf9, heat the water in the double boiler to a steady simmer. Off the heat, beat the egg yolks with 1/4 cup of the sugar and 1/2 cup of the limoncello until well blended. Set the bowl over the simmering water, and whisk constantly, frequently scraping the whisk around the sides and bottom of the bowl, as the egg mixture expands and heats into a frothy sponge, 5 minutes or longer. When the sponge has thickened enough to form a ribbon when it drops on the surface, take the bowl off the double-boiler pan and let it cool.', u'Meanwhile, pour the remaining cup of limoncello, all of the lemon juice, 1 cup water, and 1/2 cup of the sugar in a saucepan. Bring to a boil, stirring to dissolve the sugar, and cook for 5 minutes, evaporating the alcohol. Let the syrup cool completely.', u'In another large bowl, stir the mascarpone with a wooden spoon to soften it, then drop in the grated lemon zest and beat until light and creamy. Whip the egg whites with the remaining 1/4 cup sugar, by hand or by machine, until it holds moderately firm peaks.', u'When the cooked limoncello sponge (or zabaglione) is cooled, scrape about a third of it over the mascarpone, and fold it in with a large rubber spatula. Fold in the rest of the zabaglione in two or three additions. Now fold in the whipped egg whites in several additions, until the limoncello-mascarpone cream is light and evenly blended.', u'Pour some of the cooled syrup, no deeper than 1/4 inch, into the shallow-rimmed pan to moisten the ladyfingers (savoiardi). One at a time, roll a ladyfinger in the syrup and place it in the casserole or baking dish. Wet each cookie briefly\u2014if it soaks up too much syrup, it will fall apart. Arrange the moistened ladyfingers in neat, tight rows, filling the bottom of the pan completely. You should be able to fit about twenty ladyfingers in a single layer.', u'Scoop half of the limoncello-mascarpone cream onto the ladyfingers, and smooth it to fill the pan and cover them. Dip and arrange a second layer of ladyfingers in the pan, and cover it completely with the remainder of the cream.', u'Smooth the cream with the spatula, and seal the tiramis\xf9 airtight in plastic wrap. Before serving, refrigerate for 6 hours (or up to 2 days), or put it in the freezer for 2 hours. To serve, cut portions of tiramis\xf9 in any size you like, and life each out of the pan and onto dessert plates.'], 'chef': u'ia Bastianich', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/limoncello-tiramisu-em-tiramisu-al-limoncello-em-241708', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 12 servings or more', 'recipe title': u'Limoncello Tiramisu (Tiramisu al Limoncello)', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Clams are excellent on the grill. The tinge of smokiness perfectly complements their briny flavor, and, conveniently enough, they pop open when they are done cooking. Combined with crisp bacon, they\x92re the foundation of a very easy yet very flavorful pasta sauce.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'83%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/2 pound sliced bacon, chopped', u'6 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'2 teaspoons hot red-pepper flakes', u'1/4 cup fresh lemon juice', u'32 small (less than 2 inches wide) hard-shelled clams, scrubbed', u'3/4 pound linguine', u'1/2 cup chopped flat-leaf parsley', u'Equipment: a 13-by 9- by 2-inch disposable foil pan'], 'preperation steps': [u'Prepare grill for direct-heat cooking over hot charcoal (high heat for gas), leaving about one third of grill free of coals (or, for a gas grill, shutting off one or two burners); see Grilling Procedure .', u'Cook bacon in a 12-inch heavy skillet over medium heat until crisp. Transfer with a slotted spoon to paper towels to drain.', u'Stir together oil, garlic, red-pepper flakes, and lemon juice in foil pan and put on grill over area with no coals.', u'Grill clams on grill rack over coals, turning with tongs, until they open, 3 to 7 minutes, transferring as opened to foil pan and being careful not to spill their juices. (Discard any clams that remain unopened after 7 minutes.)', u'Cook linguine in a pasta pot of well-salted boiling water until al dente, then drain.', u'Toss pasta with bacon, parsley, contents of foil pan, and salt and pepper to taste.'], 'chef': u'Chris Schlesinger and John Willoughby', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/linguine-with-grilled-clams-and-bacon-353661', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 (main course) servings', 'recipe title': u'Linguine with Grilled Clams and Bacon', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Owner Dick Varano knows a thing or two about traditional New England lobster rolls: He sells about 20,000 of them a year. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'We recommend using a sturdy food mill (available at cookware stores) to help produce a thick stew base from simmered vegetables and fish. Alternatively, you can use a large heavy-duty mesh sieve to strain the seafood broth. Then push through enough fish and vegetables to make 13 cups of stew base. Serve cioppino with sourdough toasts.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'83%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 1 1/3- to 1 1/2-pound live lobsters', u'2 pounds uncooked large shrimp with shells', u'1 1/4 cups olive oil', u'2 medium onions, chopped', u'1 cup chopped celery', u'1 cup chopped fresh fennel bulb', u'12 garlic cloves, peeled, flattened', u'1/4 cup tomato paste', u'1 28-ounce can plus 2 cups diced tomatoes in juice', u'1 bunch fresh basil', u'4 large fresh thyme sprigs', u'4 large fresh parsley sprigs', u'2 large fresh oregano sprigs', u'2 bay leaves', u'1 teaspoon dried crushed red pepper', u'4 8-ounce bottles clam juice', u'2 cups dry white wine', u'3 pounds red snapper fillets', u'16 large sea scallops', u'1 pound large lump crabmeat (optional)', u'1/2 cup all purpose flour', u'6 tablespoons olive oil', u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'6 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley', u'2 large garlic cloves, minced', u'1 large shallot, minced', u'1/2 cup dry white wine'], 'preperation steps': [u'Bring large pot of water to boil. Add 1 lobster headfirst. Cover pot; cook lobster 5 minutes. Transfer lobster to large bowl of ice. Cook remaining lobster; cool. Working over rimmed baking sheet, twist tail and large claws off lobsters. Using lobster cracker or nutcracker, crack claws; gently remove meat in 1 piece. Remove tail meat from shell; slice each tail crosswise into 6 medallions. Place lobster meat in small bowl; cover and chill. Place lobster shells and juices in heavy resealable plastic bag; smash shells with kitchen mallet into smaller pieces; reserve.', u'Peel and devein shrimp, leaving tails intact; reserve shells. Place shrimp in medium bowl; cover and chill.', u'Heat oil in large pot (at least 8-quart capacity) over medium-high heat. Add onions, celery, fennel and garlic; saut\xe9 5 minutes. Mix in tomato paste; saut\xe9 5 minutes. Add tomatoes with juices, herbs and crushed pepper; cook 5 minutes. Add clam juice, wine, snapper, lobster shells, and juices and shrimp shells; bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered 1 hour.', u'Working in batches, strain stew through large sieve into second large pot, reserving solids. Set food mill over second pot. Working with 2 cups reserved stew-base solids at a time, press through food mill to extract remaining broth and some fish and vegetables to make 13 cups stew base. Discard remaining solids.', u'Boil stew base until reduced to 10 cups, stirring occasionally, about 15 minutes. (Can be made 1 day ahead. Chill stew base uncovered until cold, then cover and keep chilled. Keep lobster and shrimp chilled.)', u'Bring stew base to simmer; keep warm. Combine scallops, crabmeat (if desired), shrimp, and lobster meat in large bowl. Add flour; toss gently to coat. Place seafood in sieve; shake off excess flour. Heat 3 tablespoons oil in heavy large skillet over medium-high heat. Add half of seafood. Saut\xe9 1 minute. Add half of butter, then 2 tablespoons parsley, half of garlic, and half of shallot. Saut\xe9 until scallops and shrimp are just opaque in center and all seafood is beginning to brown, about 4 minutes. Transfer to large bowl. Repeat with remaining oil, butter, seafood, 2 tablespoons parsley, garlic, and shallot; transfer to same bowl. Add wine to skillet and boil until reduced to glaze, scraping up browned bits, about 3 minutes. Mix glaze into seafood.', u'Ladle stew base into shallow bowls. Arrange seafood in center. Sprinkle with 2 tablespoons parsley.'], 'chef': u'Nancy Oakes', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/lobster-and-shrimp-cioppino-105674', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Lobster and Shrimp Cioppino', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"When my wife, Julie, and I got married, we knew there was only one place to go for our honeymoon: Italy. I was excited to take her to Gombitelli, the tiny town in the mountains near Lucca where my dad's side of the family came from. My great-grandparents, Angelo and Olimpia Gemignani, had left Gombitelli for America at the turn of the last century, and my Grandpa Frank was born right after they got off the boat.", 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 (13-ounce/370-gram) ball Master Dough , preferably with starter, made with Poolish', u'2 parts flour mixed with 1 part semolina, for dusting', u'Scant 1/2 cup (100 grams) handcrushed tomatoes', u'10 oil-cured black olives, pitted and halved', u'1 teaspoon (8 grams) minced drained oil-packed anchovies', u'1/4 teaspoon (0.7 grams) minced garlic', u'Extra virgin olive oil, for brushing and drizzling', u'6 ounces (170 grams) whole-milk mozzarella cheese, shredded (1 1/2 cups)', u'1 fresh basil leaf, rolled up lengthwise and cut crosswise into fine julienne', u'Dried oregano, for sprinkling', u'2 pizza baking stones or steels, pizza peel'], 'preperation steps': [u'Remove the dough ball from the refrigerator and leave wrapped at room temperature until the dough warms to 60\xb0F to 65\xb0F. Meanwhile, set up the oven with two pizza stones or baking steels and preheat to 500\xb0F for 1 hour.', u'In a bowl, mix together the tomatoes, olives, anchovies, and garlic and set aside.', u'Dust the work surface with the dusting mixture, then move the dough to the surface and dust the top.', u'Sprinkle a wooden peel with the dusting mixture.', u'Roll out the dough into a round 14 to 15 inches in diameter. Using a pizza wheel, trim the dough to a 13-inch round. Brush the surface of the dough with oil, flatten the edge, then dock the surface.', u"Move the dough to the peel. As you work, shake the peel forward and backward to ensure the dough isn't sticking.", u'Mound the mozzarella in the center of the dough and use your fingertips to spread it out evenly over the surface, leaving a 3/4-inch border. Drizzle more oil over the top.', u'Slide the pizza onto the top stone. Bake for 4 minutes. Lift the pizza onto the peel, remove it from the oven, and scatter the tomato mixture over the top. Rotate the pizza 180 degrees and transfer it to the bottom stone. Bake for 5 minutes, until the bottom is browned and crisp and the top is golden brown.', u'If you would like the top of the pizza darker, transfer it to the top stone for 30 seconds.', u'Transfer the pizza to a cutting board and cut into 6 wedges. Scatter the basil over the top and finish with a dusting of oregano and a drizzle of oil.'], 'chef': u'Tony Gemignani', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/lucca-51255660', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes one 13-inch pizza; 6 slices ', 'recipe title': u'Lucca', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Garrett McCord, coauthor with Stephanie Stiavetti of Melt: The Art of Macaroni and Cheese, created this recipe exclusively for Epicurious. A completely traditional take on the ultimate comfort food casserole, we think this is a guaranteed crowd-pleaser. Plus, it's a flexible recipe that can easily be tinkered with to suit your family's mac 'n' cheese preferences.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'79%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 tablespoons unsalted butter, plus more to grease the baking dish', u'1 cup panko bread crumbs', u'24 ounces sharp or extra-sharp Cheddar, grated (about 9 cups total)', u'1 pound elbow macaroni', u'3 1/4 cups whole milk', u'3 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'1 1/2 teaspoons dry mustard', u'1 teaspoon fine sea salt', u'1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'Equipment: 9- by 13-inch baking dish, flat-edged wooden spoon or heat-safe rubber spatula'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat the oven to 350\xb0F. Lightly butter a 9- by 13-inch baking dish.', u'In a small saucepan over moderate heat, melt 3 tablespoons of the butter. Place the panko bread crumbs in a small bowl, drizzle with the melted butter, and toss to combine. Add a handful of the grated cheese to the bowl, toss to combine, and set aside.', u'In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook the elbow macaroni until al dente. Drain the noodles, without rinsing, then return them to the pot they were cooked in.', u'In a small saucepan over moderate heat, warm the milk just until it starts to steam and form tiny bubbles around its edges\u2014be careful not to let the milk come to a boil. Remove from the heat.', u"In a medium saucepan over moderate heat, melt the remaining 3 tablespoons of butter. Add the flour and use a flat-edged wooden spoon or heat-safe rubber spatula to stir the mixture together, scraping the bottom of the pan to prevent burning, just until it starts to turn a light brown color, about 3 minutes. Slowly add the warm milk and stir constantly until the sauce thickens, about 3 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the dry mustard, salt, and pepper. Add the remaining grated cheese and stir until it's completely melted. Adjust the seasoning to taste. Pour the cheese sauce over the cooked elbow macaroni and gently stir to coat the noodles in the sauce.", u'Pour the macaroni and cheese into the prepared baking dish and top with the panko-cheese mixture. Bake until light golden brown and bubbling, about 30 minutes. Serve hot. DO AHEAD: Macaroni and cheese can be made ahead, put into the baking dish, cooled completely, and kept, covered in the refrigerator, for 2 days. Do not add the bread crumbs until ready to bake. (Chilled Macaroni and Cheese may take longer than 30 minutes to be fully cooked.)'], 'chef': u'Garrett McCord', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/macaroni-and-cheese-51218810', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Macaroni and Cheese', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'The technique: Brining\u2014soaking the bird in salt water\u2014creates juicy turkey. Here, stout beer and barley malt syrup add a richness to the brine, which infuses the meat with flavor. The payoff: Moist meat that tastes great. The malt glaze gives the bird a crisp, burnished skin.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'80%', 'ingredient list': [u'2/3 cup barley malt syrup', u'1/4 cup malt vinegar or apple cider vinegar', u'6 fresh sage sprigs', u'4 fresh thyme sprigs', u'1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper', u'2 tablespoons (1/4 stick) unsalted butter', u'4 quarts water', u'2 cups Diamond Crystal coarse kosher salt or 1 1/2 cups Morton coarse kosher salt', u'3 12-ounce bottles stout beer (such as Guinness)', u'1 1/2 cups barley malt syrup', u'1 14- to 16-pound turkey', u'2 teaspoons ground black pepper', u'2 peeled onions, quartered', u'2 celery stalks, cut into chunks', u'1 bunch fresh sage', u'1 bunch fresh thyme', u'1 unpeeled head of garlic, cut crosswise in half', u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 cups (or more) water', u'Mixed-Mushroom and Tarragon Gravy', u'Special equipment: 2 turkey-size oven bags', u'Turkey lacing pins', u'Charcoal chimney (if grilling)', u'13 x 9 x 2-inch disposable aluminum baking pan (to catch drips; if grilling)', u'Ingredient info: Barley malt syrup has a flavor similar to molasses. Look for it at natural foods stores or buy it from edenfoods.com.'], 'preperation steps': [u'Bring malt syrup, vinegar, herbs, and pepper to boil in small saucepan, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat to low and simmer until glaze coats spoon, 4 to 5 minutes. Mix in butter. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover; chill. Rewarm before using.', u'Pour 4 quarts water into 16-quart nonreactive bowl or pot. Add salt; stir to dissolve. Mix in beer and malt syrup. Insert 1 oven bag into second bag; place in large bowl. Rinse turkey inside and out. Slide turkey, breast side down, into doubled bag. Pour brine into bag. Press out any air; seal bags. Chill turkey in brine (still in bowl) 16 to 18 hours.', u'Remove turkey from brine. Pat very dry, inside and out, with paper towels. Sprinkle main cavity with 2 teaspoons pepper; fill with onions, celery, sage, thyme, and garlic. Close cavity with turkey lacing pins. Tuck wing tips under; brush all over with oil.', u'Set oven rack at lowest position; preheat to 350\xb0F. Place turkey on rack in roasting pan; add 2 cups water.', u'Roast turkey 2 hours. Brush with glaze; add water if pan is dry. Roast 30 minutes. Brush with glaze. Tent with foil if browning too quickly. Roast until thermometer inserted into thickest part of thigh registers 165\xb0F, 30 to 45 minutes. Brush with more glaze. Transfer to platter; let rest 30 minutes (temperature will rise 5 to 10 degrees).', u'Prepare barbecue (medium heat). Remove top grill rack. If using charcoal, light briquettes in chimney. When briquettes are covered with white ash, push to opposite sides of bottom grill rack, leaving center empty. Place disposable aluminum pan in center of rack (you will need to light additional briquettes, checking every 30 minutes during grilling time). Replace top grill rack. If using 3-burner gas grill, light burners on left and right sides, leaving center burner off. If using 2-burner gas grill, light burner on 1 side; place disposable pan over unlit side.', u'Place turkey, breast side up, on grill rack over disposable pan. Cover barbecue. Insert instant-read thermometer into hole in hood. Maintain temperature as close as possible to 350\xb0F on charcoal grill by opening vents to increase temperature and closing vents to reduce temperature or adjusting temperature on gas grill with controls. Cook turkey 2 hours, tenting loosely with foil if browning too quickly. Brush turkey with glaze. Cover grill; cook 30 minutes longer. Brush again with glaze. Cook until thermometer inserted into thickest part of thigh registers 165\xb0F, about 30 minutes longer. Transfer turkey to platter. Brush with glaze. Let rest 30 minutes (temperature will rise 5 to 10 degrees).'], 'chef': u'Bruce Aidells', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/malt-beer-brined-turkey-with-malt-glaze-361750', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 to 10 servings', 'recipe title': u'Malt-Beer-Brined Turkey with Malt Glaze', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This lightly sweet gelatin separates into two distinctly textured layers when it cools, adding a lovely depth to a unique dessert.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 (1/4-oz) envelopes unflavored gelatin', u'1/2 cup cold water', u'2 cups whole milk', u'1 1/2 cups sugar, divided', u'1 (13- to 14-oz) can unsweetened coconut milk', u'4 large egg whites, at room temperature 30 minutes, or 1/2 cup yolk-free liquid egg whites such as Eggology', u'yolk-free liquid egg whites such as Eggology', u'Equipment: a 9- to 12-cup nonstick bundt or tube pan', u'Accompaniment: fresh mango slices and berries'], 'preperation steps': [u'Sprinkle gelatin over cold water and let stand 2 minutes to soften.', u'Bring milk, 1 cup sugar, and 1/8 teaspoon salt to a boil in a small saucepan over medium-high heat, stirring until sugar has dissolved. Remove from heat and stir in gelatin mixture until dissolved. Stir in coconut milk until smooth and cool to room temperature, stirring occasionally, about 45 minutes.', u'Beat egg whites with an electric mixer at medium-high speed until they just hold soft peaks. Beat in remaining 1/2 cup sugar, 1 tablespoon at a time, beating until whites hold stiff glossy peaks. Gently stir one third of egg-white mixture into coconut mixture with a whisk, then add remaining egg-white mixture, stirring to break up any lumps.', u'Pour into bundt pan and chill, uncovered, until set, at least 4 hours.', u'To unmold, gently separate gelatin from pan using a rubber spatula. Fill a large bowl with very warm water, then dip pan (do not submerge) in water 15 seconds. Invert a large plate over pan, then invert gelatin onto plate, gently lifting off pan.'], 'chef': u'Maria Pereira, New York City', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/mangar-de-coco-242404', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 (dessert) servings', 'recipe title': u'Mangar de C\xf4co', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Pureed fresh mango gives this cheesecake a light and soft texture and subtle tropical fruit flavor.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'85%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 cups graham cracker crumbs', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'6 tablespoons (3/4 stick) unsalted butter, melted', u'3 large very ripe mangoes (each about 13 ounces), peeled, pitted, coarsely chopped', u'3 8-ounce packages cream cheese, room temperature', u'1 1/4 cups sugar', u'2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'4 large eggs', u'Sliced peeled pitted mangoes'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 325\xb0F. Lightly butter 9-inch-diameter springform pan with 2 3/4-inch-high sides. Stir cracker crumbs and sugar in medium bowl to blend. Add melted butter and stir until evenly moistened. Press crumb mixture firmly onto bottom (not sides) of prepared pan. Bake until crust is set, about 12 minutes. Cool completely. Maintain oven temperature.', u'Puree mangoes in processor until smooth. Set aside 2 cups mango puree (reserve any remaining puree for another use). Beat cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla in large bowl until smooth. Add eggs 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Add 2 cups mango puree and beat until well blended. Pour filling over crust in pan.', u'Bake cake until set and puffed and golden around edges (center may move very slightly when pan is gently shaken), about 1 hour 25 minutes. Cool cake 1 hour. Refrigerate uncovered overnight. Run small knife between cake and sides of pan to loosen. Remove pan sides. Transfer cake to platter. Cut into wedges and serve with sliced mangoes.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/mango-cheesecake-105565', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 12 servings', 'recipe title': u'Mango Cheesecake', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"It just wouldn't be a holiday without my mom preparing a pasta course, whether it precedes the turkey at Thanksgiving or follows antipasti at Easter. My mom's manicotti recipe (which comes from her Italian mother), feeds our immediate family of 40, but I've scaled it down to feed a smaller group of 6. The tender manicotti wrappers are made by quickly cooking a batter to form a pastalike cr\xeape.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'80%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 medium onion, chopped', u'3 garlic cloves, minced', u'2 (28- to 32-oz) cans Italian tomatoes in juice, drained, reserving juice, and finely chopped', u'1/2 cup water', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh basil', u'3 large eggs', u'1 1/2 cups water', u'1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter, melted', u'2 lb fresh ricotta (3 cups)', u'2 large eggs', u'1 oz finely grated Parmigiano-Reggiano (1/2 cup)', u'1/3 cup chopped fresh parsley', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon black pepper', u'1/2 lb fresh mozzarella', u'Special equipment: 2 glass or ceramic baking dishes, one 13 by 9 inches and one 8 inches square'], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat oil in a 5- to 6-quart heavy pot over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then saut\xe9 onion, stirring occasionally, until golden, about 6 minutes. Add garlic and saut\xe9, stirring, until golden, about 1 minute. Add tomatoes with juice, water, sugar, and salt and simmer, uncovered, stirring occasionally, until thickened, about 30 minutes. Stir in basil and remove from heat.', u"Break up eggs with a wooden spoon in a medium bowl and stir in water until combined (don't beat). Sift in flour and salt, then stir batter until just combined. Force through a medium-mesh sieve into another bowl.", u'Lightly brush an 8-inch nonstick skillet with melted butter and heat over moderate heat until hot. Ladle about 1/4 cup batter into skillet, tilting and rotating skillet to coat bottom, then pour excess batter back into bowl. (If batter sets before skillet is coated, reduce heat slightly for next cr\xeape.) Cook until underside is just set and lightly browned, about 30 seconds, then invert cr\xeape onto a clean kitchen towel to cool completely. Make at least 11 more cr\xeapes in same manner, brushing skillet with butter as needed and stacking cr\xeapes in 3 piles.', u'Stir together ricotta, eggs, Parmigiano-Reggiano, parsley, salt, and pepper.', u'Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 425\xb0F.', u'Cut mozzarella lengthwise into 1/4-inch-thick sticks.', u'Spread 2 cups sauce in larger baking dish and 1 cup in smaller one. Arrange 1 cr\xeape, browned side up, on a work surface, then spread about 1/4 cup filling in a line across center and top with a mozzarella strip. Fold in sides to enclose filling, leaving ends open, and transfer, seam side down, to either baking dish. Fill 11 more cr\xeapes in same manner, arranging snugly in 1 layer in both dishes (8 in larger dish and 4 in smaller). Spread 1 cup sauce over manicotti in larger dish and 1/2 cup in smaller dish. Tightly cover dishes with foil and bake until sauce is bubbling and filling is hot, 15 to 20 minutes. Serve remaining sauce on the side.'], 'chef': u'd editor: Gina Marie Miraglia Eriquez Mother: Marie Miraglia, Howard Beach, NY', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/manicotti-109442', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 main-course servings', 'recipe title': u'Manicotti', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Maple syrup and maple sugar infuse a simple vanilla custard with a rich caramelized flavor.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'86%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 whole large eggs', u'2 large egg yolks', u'1 1/2 cups whole milk', u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u'1/4 cup dark amber or Grade B maple syrup', u"2 tablespoons granulated maple sugar (see cooks' note, below)", u'1/2 teaspoon vanilla', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'Special equipment: a 13- by 9-inch baking pan; 6 (6-oz) custard cups or ramekins'], 'preperation steps': [u'Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 350\xb0F.', u'Whisk together all ingredients in a large bowl until sugar is dissolved, then pour through a fine-mesh sieve into a 1-quart glass measure. Divide custard evenly among cups, then transfer cups to baking pan. Bake in a hot water bath , pan covered loosely with foil, until custards are just set and a knife inserted in center of one comes out clean, 35 to 40 minutes.', u'Carefully transfer cups to a rack and cool to warm, about 30 minutes.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/maple-custard-cups-234000', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Maple Custard Cups', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This gorgeous dessert has just 5 ingredients and is super simple to make. Use a fine-mesh sieve to lightly dust the top with confectioners\x92 sugar for an elegant finish.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 large egg', u'1 14- to 17-ounce box of puff pastry (preferably all-butter puff), defrosted according to package directions', u'2 large Anjou pears (about 1 1/4 pounds), skin on', u'1/4 cup granulated sugar', u'2 tablespoons maple syrup', u'13"x18" baking sheet'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat the oven to 375\xb0F. Line a 13x18-inch baking sheet with parchment paper. In a small bowl, beat the egg with 1 tablespoon water.', u'If using a 14-ounce puff pastry package, roll the sheet to a 13-x18-inch rectangle on a floured surface. If using a 17-ounce puff pastry package, roll each sheet to a 9 1/2-x13-inch rectangle. Line up the two longer sides and overlap by 1 inch to form a 13-x18-inch rectangle. Brush egg wash in between to form a seam. Use a rolling pin to seal the seam.', u'Transfer the pastry to the parchment. Fold sides of pastry towards center to form a 1/2-inch border on all four sides. Lightly score the border by using a paring knife to make small shallow diagonal cuts. Prick the surface of the pastry inside the border with a fork. Refrigerate until ready to use.', u'Slice the pears in half lengthwise, and then cut lengthwise into 1/4-inch thick slices. Trim the seeds and core and toss the slices in the sugar. Arrange on the pastry and brush all exposed pastry (including the borders) with the egg wash.', u'Bake until the crust is puffed and golden brown, 45 to 50 minutes. Brush the fruit and pastry with the maple syrup. Let cool completely, and then slice into squares to serve.'], 'chef': u'da Boone', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/maple-pear-sheet-tart-51253810', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes one 13-x18-inch tart (12 servings)', 'recipe title': u'Maple-Pear Sheet Tart', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'The technique: Cornbread made with masa (the corn flour in corn tortillas) is the foundation for this Latin-flavored stuffing. < The payoff: Masa adds a natural sweetness to the cornbread. Timing note: The cornbread needs to be baked at least one day ahead.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'75%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 cup (2 sticks) unsalted butter', u'3 cups chopped white onions', u'5 garlic cloves, minced', u'18 ounces fresh Anaheim chiles (about 6 large), seeded, chopped (scant 4 cups)', u'18 ounces fresh poblano chiles, seeded, chopped (about 3 cups)', u'4 large fresh jalape\xf1o chiles, seeded (if desired), chopped (about 1 cup)', u'1 1/2 tablespoons ground New Mexico chiles', u'1 tablespoon coarse kosher salt', u'3/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'3/4 teaspoon dried oregano', u'3/4 teaspoon ground cumin', u'1 cup chopped fresh cilantro', u'1 13 x 9-inch loaf Masa Cornbread , cut into 1-inch cubes (12 to 13 cups)', u'6 ounces Monterey Jack cheese, cut into 1/3-inch cubes (optional)', u'4 large eggs', u'1 cup low-salt chicken broth', u'Ingredient info: Look for Anaheim chiles (California chiles), poblano chiles (a.k.a. pasillas), and ground New Mexico chiles at some supermarkets and at Latin markets.'], 'preperation steps': [u'Melt butter in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onions and garlic; saut\xe9 until tender, about 5 minutes. Add all chiles; saut\xe9 until beginning to soften, 12 to 14 minutes. Stir in ground chiles and next 4 ingredients. Transfer vegetable mixture to bowl. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Cool, then cover and chill.', u'Preheat oven to 375\xb0F. Butter 15 x 10 x 2- inch glass baking dish. Stir cilantro into vegetable mixture. Place cornbread cubes in very large bowl; add vegetable mixture and toss gently. Toss in cheese, if using. Whisk eggs and broth in medium bowl, then pour over stuffing and toss gently to moisten. Transfer stuffing to prepared dish. Cover dish with buttered foil, buttered side down.', u'Bake stuffing until heated through, about 30 minutes. Remove foil; bake until top is golden, about 30 minutes longer.'], 'chef': u'Rochelle Palermo', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/masa-cornbread-stuffing-with-chiles-361732', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 12 servings', 'recipe title': u'Masa Cornbread Stuffing with Chiles', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'50%', 'ingredient list': [u'Vegetable oil (for frying)', u'1 large bunch fresh sage leaves with short stems (about 30)', u'6 pounds Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled, cut into 1-inch cubes', u'14 tablespoons (13/4 sticks) butter, room temperature', u'1 1/3 cups (or more) whole milk', u'1 1/2 tablespoons dried sage leaves, crumbled'], 'preperation steps': [u'Pour enough oil into large saucepan to reach depth of 1 inch; heat to 350\xb0F.
