{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Baked in individual ring molds, these little desserts feature caramelized pears, streusel topping and sweetened cream.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'6 pounds under-ripe Anjou pears (about 13), peeled, cored, cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'1 1/3 cups dried currants', u'1 1/3 cups sugar', u'1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice', u'1 1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon', u'1 vanilla bean, halved lengthwise', u'3/4 cup slivered almonds (about 3 ounces)', u'3/4 cup all purpose flour', u'6 tablespoons sugar', u'6 tablespoons chilled unsalted butter, cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'8 3-inch-diameter ring molds with 1 1/2-inch-high sides*', u'Sweetened whipping cream (unwhipped)'], 'preperation steps': [u': Heat 2 heavy large skillets over medium heat. Melt 1 tablespoon butter in each skillet. Divide pears, currants, sugar, lemon juice and cinnamon between skillets. Scrape in seeds from vanilla bean; add bean halves to skillets. Cook until juices evaporate and pears caramelize, stirring often, about 35 minutes. Let fruit cool in skillets. Remove vanilla bean halves.', u': Preheat oven to 400\xb0F. Blend almonds, flour and sugar in processor until almonds are finely chopped. Add butter. Using on/off turns, process until large moist clumps form. Sprinkle mixture onto heavy baking sheet. Bake until streusel is pale golden, stirring often and leaving mixture in clumps, about 10 minutes. Cool completely. (Can be prepared 1 day ahead. Store streusel airtight at room temperature. Cover and refrigerate fruit mixture.)', u'Reduce oven temperature to 350\xb0F. Arrange ring molds on large baking sheet. Divide fruit mixture evenly among molds, pressing to compact. Sprinkle streusel evenly over fruit.', u'Bake until fruit is heated through, about 5 minutes for room-temperature fruit and 10 minutes for refrigerated fruit. Let cool 5 minutes. Slide metal spatula under ring molds and transfer to plates. Remove molds. Drizzle sweetened cream around fruit and serve.', u'*Sold at most specialty cookware stores. If unavailable, substitute clean 8-ounce cans with bottoms and tops removed.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/pear-and-currant-streusel-rounds-102387', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Pear and Currant Streusel Rounds', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This gorgeous dessert features crisp peppermint meringues layered with tender chocolate cake and rich chocolate frosting.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving (analysis does not include thin chocolate-covered mint wafers garnish): 722.1 kcal calories 67.1 % calories from fat 53.8 g fat, 30.2 g saturated fat, 158.2 mg cholesterol, 69.0 g carbohydrates, 4.7 g dietary fiber, 52.2 g total sugars, 64.2 g net carbohydrates, 8.0 g protein\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Bon App\xe9tit', 'recommendation': u'67%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 cup powdered sugar', u'1/3 cup superfine sugar', u'Pinch of salt', u'3 large egg whites, room temperature', u'1/2 teaspoon cream of tartar', u'1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1/4 teaspoon peppermint extract', u'1/2 cup water', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1 tablespoon peppermint schnapps', u'1/2 cup all purpose flour', u'1/4 cup natural unsweetened cocoa powder', u'1/2 teaspoon baking powder', u'Pinch of salt', u'2 large eggs', u'2 large egg yolks', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon vanilla extracts', u'1 3/4 cups heavy whipping cream', u'1 cup (2 sticks) unsalted butter, cut into 8 pieces', u'3 tablespoons light corn syrup', u'1 1/2 pounds bittersweet chocolate (do not exceed 61% cacao), chopped', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'Pinch of salt', u'Thin chocolate-covered mint wafers, cut into small triangles (for garnish)', u'Fresh raspberries (for garnish)', u'Fresh mint leaves (for garnish)', u'Heavy-duty stand mixer', u'13 x 9 x 1-inch baking sheet', u'Small offset spatula', u'Pastry bag', u'Medium star tip (for decorating)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Position rack in center of oven and preheat to 175\xb0F. Using pencil, trace two 12 x 4-inch rectangles on sheet of parchment paper; turn parchment over (rectangles will show through) and place on large rimmed baking sheet. Trace one 12 x 4-inch rectangle on second sheet of parchment paper; turn parchment over and place on second rimmed baking sheet.', u'Sift powdered sugar, superfine sugar, and salt into medium bowl. Combine egg whites and cream of tartar in large bowl of heavy-duty stand mixer fitted with wire whisk; beat on medium-low speed until frothy. Increase speed to medium-high and beat until soft peaks form. Increase speed to high; gradually add sugar mixture and beat until stiff and glossy peaks form, about 3 minutes. Beat in vanilla and peppermint extracts. Divide meringue equally among prepared rectangles on parchment (about 1 1/3 cups for each); spread meringue evenly within traced lines.', u'Bake meringues until dry and crisp but not browned, about 3 hours. Turn off oven and let meringues cool completely in oven.', u'Carefully remove meringue rectangles from parchment. DO AHEAD: Meringues can be made 1 week ahead. Store in single layer in airtight container at room temperature.', u'Combine 1/2 cup water and sugar in small saucepan. Stir over medium heat until sugar dissolves and mixture comes to boil. Remove from heat; stir in peppermint schnapps. Transfer to bowl; cover and chill until cold. DO AHEAD: Can be made 3 days ahead. Keep chilled.', u'Position rack in center of oven and preheat to 350\xb0F. Lightly butter bottom and sides of 13 x 9 x 1-inch baking sheet. Line bottom of baking sheet with parchment paper. Lightly dust sheet sides with flour. Sift 1/2 cup flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt into medium bowl. Using electric mixer, beat eggs and egg yolks in another medium bowl until pale and foamy, about 2 minutes. Add sugar and vanilla; beat until mixture is thick and ribbon forms when beaters are lifted, about 3 minutes. Sift flour mixture over egg mixture and gently fold in with rubber spatula just until incorporated.', u'Transfer batter to baking sheet; spread evenly to edges. Bake until top springs back when gently touched and tester inserted into center comes out clean, about 15 minutes. Transfer baking sheet to rack and cool cake 20 minutes. Run small knife around sides of cake to loosen. Invert cake onto parchment-lined work surface; gently peel off parchment. Cool completely. Using serrated knife, cut cake in half lengthwise, then trim each half to 12 x 4-inch rectangle.', u'Simmer cream, butter, and corn syrup in medium saucepan.Remove from heat. Add chocolate; whisk until smooth. Whisk in vanilla and salt. Let stand at room temperature until thick enough to spread, 1 hour to 1 1/2 hours. DO AHEAD: Can be made 4 hours ahead. Let stand at room temperature.', u'Transfer 1/2 cup buttercream to pastry bag fitted with medium star tip; reserve for piping rosettes. Brush off any crumbs from meringue layers and cake layers. Place several small dabs of buttercream down center of 15-inch-long rectangular serving platter. Place 1 meringue layer, top side up, atop buttercream on platter, anchoring to platter. Place strips of foil around meringue layer to protect platter when spreading meringue with buttercream. Using small offset spatula, spread 2/3 cup buttercream over meringue. Top with 1 cake layer, top side down, pressing gently to adhere. Brush cake layer with 1/3 cup peppermint syrup (cake layer will be very moist). Spread 2/3 cup buttercream over, then top with second meringue layer, top side up. Spread 2/3 cup buttercream over. Cover with second cake layer, top side down. Brush with 1/3 cup peppermint syrup (cake layer will be very moist). Spread with 2/3 cup buttercream. Top with third meringue layer, top side up. Spread thin layer of buttercream over top and sides of cake. Chill 15 minutes.', u'Spread remaining buttercream over top and sides of cake. Pipe small rosettes of buttercream in 2 rows atop center of cake. Stand 1 or 2 mint wafer triangles in each rosette. Chill cake at least 6 hours. DO AHEAD: Can be made 2 days ahead. Cover loosely; chill. Let cake stand at room temperature 1 1/2 hours before serving.', u'Garnish top of cake with fresh raspberries and mint leaves and serve.'], 'chef': u'Abigail Johnson Dodge', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/peppermint-meringue-cake-with-chocolate-buttercream-356317', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 10 to 12 servings', 'recipe title': u'Peppermint Meringue Cake with Chocolate Buttercream', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Fluffy texture (thanks to less-starchy converted rice) and the right balance of flavors (bay, thyme, and white pepper) earn this foolproof rice its name.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'77%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 tablespoon butter', u'1/2 cup finely chopped onion', u'1 small bay leaf', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon dried thyme', u'1 small pinch of white pepper', u'2 cups converted white rice (about 13 ounces)', u'3 cups low-salt chicken broth'], 'preperation steps': [u'Melt butter in heavy large saucepan over medium heat. {'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: 313 calories, 21 g fat, 2 g fiber\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Bon App\xe9tit', 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'12 to 13 ounces cherry tomatoes and/or pear tomatoes', u'1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil', u'3/4 teaspoon coarse kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon dried oregano', u'12 12x9-inch sheets fresh phyllo pastry or frozen, thawed', u'6 tablespoons (3/4 stick) unsalted butter, melted', u'4 tablespoons finely grated Parmesan cheese, divided', u'3/4 cup (packed) coarsely grated smoked mozzarella cheese* (about 3 ounces)', u'1/2 yellow bell pepper, cut into thin strips', u'1/4 cup quartered pitted Kalamata olives', u'2 teaspoons coarsely chopped fresh oregano'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 400\xb0F. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"This is a family favorite, created by Gianni's aunt Angela. It's a great cake to make when summer fruit is abundant. It is delicious when made with the plums called for in this recipe, but you may also want to consider using figs\x97one of my favorite fruits\x97or pitted sweet cherries. You can substitute about 6 quartered figs or 1/2 cup of cherries in place of the plums.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'88%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons finely ground cornmeal or semolina flour', u'1 cup all-purpose flour', u'1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder', u'Pinch of kosher salt', u'13 tablespoons butter, softened', u'3/4 cup granulated sugar', u'4 large egg yolks', u'2 large eggs', u'1 teaspoon grated lemon zest', u'1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract', u'4 plums, cut in half and pitted', u'2 tablespoons packed light brown sugar'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Preheat the oven to 350 \xb0F. Grease and lightly flour an 8 x 2-inch round cake pan or an 8-inch springform pan, tapping out any excess flour. Set aside.', u'2. In a small bowl, toss the cornmeal, all-purpose flour, baking powder, and salt. Set aside.', u'3. In a large bowl, beat the butter and granulated sugar together with an electric mixer, until pale yellow and creamy, about 5 minutes. Scrape down the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula and add the egg yolks, one at a time, beating after each addition. Scrape down the sides of the bowl and add the whole eggs, one at a time, beating after each addition. Mix in the lemon zest and vanilla. Add the dry ingredients and blend until just combined.', u'4. Spread the batter in the prepared pan. Place the plum halves, skin side down, at even intervals on top of the batter. Sprinkle the brown sugar on top of the fruit and batter. Bake until the cake is golden brown on top and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 45 minutes.'], 'chef': u'Stanley Tucci with Joan and Stan Tucci, and Gianni Scappin and Mimi Shanley Taft', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/plum-and-polenta-cake-51119620', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 6', 'recipe title': u'Plum and Polenta Cake', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/4 cups all purpose flour', u'1/4 cup whole wheat flour', u'2 1/2 teaspoons sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, chilled, cut into 1/2-inch pieces', u'1/4 cup (or more) ice water', u'1 large egg white, room temperature', u'1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons sugar', u'1/4 cup almond flour or almond meal*', u'13/4 pounds Pluots (about 5 large or 12 small)', u'1 tablespoon butter, melted'], 'preperation steps': [u'Whisk flours, sugar, and salt in large bowl. Add butter. Using fingertips, rub in butter until coarse meal forms. Add 1/4 cup ice water, stirring until clumps form, adding more water by teaspoonfuls if dough is dry. Gather into ball; flatten into disk. Wrap in plastic; chill 1 hour. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Keep chilled. Let rest 15 minutes at room temperature before rolling out.', u'Preheat oven to 425\xb0F. Place sheet of parchment on work surface; sprinkle with flour. Roll out crust on parchment to 13-inch round. Using pot lid as guide, trim dough to 12-inch round. Slide crust on parchment onto rimless baking sheet. Chill dough.', u'Using electric mixer, beat egg white in medium bowl until foamy. With machine running, gradually add 1/4 cup sugar, beating until firm peaks form. Fold in almond meal. Set 1 Pluot, stem side up, on work surface. Working parallel to pit, cut 1/8-inch-thick rounds off both sides of Pluot. Repeat with remaining Pluots.', u'Spread meringue over crust. Arrange Pluot slices, slightly overlapping, in spiral pattern atop meringue, beginning at outer edge and working toward center, turning any end pieces cut side up. Finish with 1 Pluot slice in center. Brush melted butter over Pluots; sprinkle tart with 2 tablespoons sugar. Bake tart 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 400\xb0F and bake tart until edges are brown, about 20 minutes. Cool tart slightly on pan. Loosen with spatula. Serve warm or at room temperature.'], 'chef': u'Amelia Saltsman', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/pluot-pinwheel-tart-353776', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 to 10 servings', 'recipe title': u'Pluot Pinwheel Tart', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Editor's note: The recipe and introductory text below are from Simple Chinese Cooking by Kylie Kwong.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'98%', 'ingredient list': [u'400 g (13 oz) pork fillets', u'1/3 cup vegetable oil', u'4 free-range eggs, lightly beaten', u'1 small red onion, finely diced', u'1 tablespoon finely diced ginger', u'2 teaspoons white sugar', u'2 tablespoons hoisin sauce', u'2 tablespoons light soy sauce', u'1 tablespoon malt vinegar', u'1/4 teaspoon sesame oil', u'4 cups steamed rice', u'2/3 cup finely sliced spring onions (scallions)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Using a sharp knife, cut pork fillets into 5 mm (1/4 inch) slices, then cut into 5 mm (1/4 inch) strips and set aside.', u'Heat half the oil in a hot wok until surface seems to shimmer slightly. Pour beaten eggs into wok and leave to cook on the base of the wok for 10 seconds before folding egg mixture over onto itself with a spatula and lightly scrambling for about 1 minute or until almost cooked through. Carefully remove omelette from wok with a spatula and drain on kitchen paper. Set aside.', u'Heat remaining oil in hot wok and stir-fry onion and ginger for 30 seconds. Add sugar and stir-fry for 30 seconds. Add pork and stir-fry for a further 30 seconds. Stir in hoisin sauce, soy sauce, vinegar, and sesame oil and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Toss in rice and reserved omelette and stir-fry, using a spatula to break up the egg into smaller pieces, for 1 minute. Lastly, add spring onions and stir-fry for a further 30 seconds or until well combined and rice is heated through.', u'Transfer rice to a platter and serve.'], 'chef': u'Kylie Kwong', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/pork-fried-rice-237524', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serve as a meal for 4 or as part of a banquet for 4-6', 'recipe title': u'Pork Fried Rice', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This turkey is basted with Port, a wine exported to the colonies by English merchants in Portugal; for a time it was boycotted by the revolutionaries. Roast 30 minutes.', u'Meanwhile, bring 1 1/2 cups broth, Port and 4 tablespoons butter to simmer in heavy medium saucepan, stirring until butter melts. Baste turkey with 3/4 cup Port mixture. Baste turkey with pan juices. Roast 20 minutes. Remove cheesecloth. Transfer turkey to platter; tent with foil.', u'Place roasting pan over medium-high heat. Bring pan juices and vegetables to boil, scraping up any browned bits. Add enough additional broth to cup to measure 3 cups liquid if necessary, or transfer pan juices to saucepan and boil until reduced to 3 cups if necessary. Bring pan juices to simmer in heavy medium saucepan. Mix 3 tablespoons butter and flour in small bowl to form paste. Add paste to pan juices; bring to boil, whisking constantly. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Finnan Haddie Gratin', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 medium onions, halved lengthwise, thenthinly sliced lengthwise', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1/2 lb smoked haddock fillet (finnan haddie), thawed if frozen, shredded with your fingers into 1/2-inch pieces, discarding any tough parts', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley', u'1 1/2 lb celery root (sometimes called celeriac), peeled with a knife', u'2 lb large potatoes (preferably russet or Yukon Gold), peeled', u'2 cups heavy cream', u'1/2 cup whole milk', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'Special equipment: a Japanese Benriner* or other adjustable-blade slicer; a 13- by 9- by 2-inch or other shallow (2 1/2- to 3-quart) glass or ceramic baking dish'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 375\xb0F.', u'Cook onions in butter in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until softened and just beginning to brown, 7 to 8 minutes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 25 min Start to finish: 1 1/4 hr', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'74%', 'ingredient list': [u'10 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'2 lb medium tomatoes (about 6), cut crosswise into 1/2-inch-thick slices', u'About 13/4 teaspoons salt', u'1 teaspoon black pepper', u'2 lb medium red potatoes, scrubbed well', u'1 garlic clove', u'1/2 cup plain fine dry bread crumbs', u'1/4 cup finely chopped fresh basil', u'1 1/2 teaspoons chopped fresh thyme', u'Special equipment: a 3-qt shallow flameproof gratin or casserole dish (about 2 inches deep; not glass)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 425\xb0F.', u'Brush a shallow baking pan (1/2 to 1 inch deep) with 2 tablespoons oil. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Mole Poblano', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'86%', 'ingredient list': [u'13 cups water', u'1 4-pound whole boneless turkey breast with skin, halved lengthwise', u'1 large white onion, peeled, quartered', u'1 head of garlic, outer skin removed, cut crosswise in half', u'1 1/2 teaspoons fine sea salt', u'1 cup lard or canola oil', u'8 dried mulato chiles, stemmed, seeds and membranes removed', u'6 dried pasilla chiles, stemmed, seeds and membranes removed', u'5 dried ancho chile, stemmed, seeds and membranes removed', u'1 tablespoon canola oil', u'1/2 cup whole almonds', u'1/4 cup pecans', u'1 tablespoon unsalted roasted peanuts', u'1/4 cup shelled pepitas', u'3 tablespoons sesame seeds', u'1/4 cup canola oil', u'1 large ripe dark-skinned plantain, peeled, thickly sliced', u'1 pound tomatillos, husked, rinsed, coarsely chopped', u'1 pound plum tomatoes, coarsely chopped', u'2/3 cup raisins flavorings', u'1 large white onion, peeled, cut into 8 wedges', u'12 large garlic cloves, unpeeled', u'5 whole cloves', u'1 teaspoon whole black peppercorns', u'5 whole allspice berries', u'1 teaspoon cumin seeds', u'1/2 teaspoon aniseed', u'1 1-inch piece canela* or cinnamon stick', u'1 teaspoon dried Mexican oregano', u'1/2 teaspoon dried thyme', u'1 teaspoon fine sea salt', u'3 tablespoons canola oil', u'1 3x2x1-inch bread slice from firm French roll', u'3 5- to 6-inch-diameter corn tortillas, coarsely chopped', u'6 ounces Mexican chocolate, chopped', u'1/2 cup chopped piloncillo** or (packed) dark brown sugar', u'2 cups (about) low-salt chicken broth (if necessary)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Combine all ingredients in large pot. Bring to boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer until turkey is just cooked through, skimming foam, about 35 minutes. Transfer turkey to bowl; cover and chill. Strain and reserve broth in pot.', u'Heat 1/2 cup lard in large skillet over medium-high heat. Working in batches, fry all chiles until beginning to blister and change color, about 15 seconds per side (do not burn). Using tongs and shaking off excess lard, transfer chiles to another large pot. Add 4 cups reserved turkey broth; bring to boil. Reduce heat; simmer uncovered until chiles are very soft, about 35 minutes. Strain liquid into 4-cup measuring cup; add enough reserved turkey broth to measure 4 cups. Chop chiles. Working in batches, puree chiles and 4 cups chile broth in blender until smooth.', u'Heat remaining 1/2 cup lard in same pot over medium heat until almost smoking. Press chile puree through large mesh strainer into pot (mixture will sputter and bubble vigorously). Stir until puree thickens enough to form path on bottom of pot when wooden spoon is drawn across, about 15 minutes. Remove chile puree from heat.', u'Heat 1 tablespoon oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add almonds and stir until color deepens, about 1 minute. Add pecans and peanuts; stir 1 minute. Add pepitas; stir 30 seconds. Transfer to blender. Add sesame seeds to skillet; stir 1 minute. Transfer 2 tablespoons sesame seeds to small bowl and reserve for garnish. Place remaining 1 tablespoon sesame seeds in blender with nuts. Add 1/2 cup reserved turkey broth and blend until thick puree forms. Add nut-and-seed puree to pot with chile puree. Cook over very low heat, stirring often, while preparing fruits.', u'Heat 1/4 cup oil in same skillet over high heat. Add plantain and saut\xe9 until golden, about 3 minutes. Using slotted spoon, transfer to paper towels. Add tomatillos and tomatoes to skillet; saut\xe9 until slightly softened, mashing with fork. Reduce heat to medium-low; simmer until thickened, stirring often, about 25 minutes. Add raisins and plantain; simmer 10 minutes, stirring often. Cool slightly.', u'Working in batches, puree tomatillo mixture in blender with 2 cups reserved turkey broth. Strain mixture through sieve into chile-nut puree, pressing on solids to extract as much mixture as possible; discard solids in sieve. Continue cooking puree over very low heat while preparing flavorings, stirring often.', u'Cook onion and garlic cloves in dry heavy medium skillet over medium heat until beginning to brown and soften, turning often, about 15 minutes. Cool slightly. Coarsely chop onion; peel garlic. Place in blender.', u'Stir cloves in same skillet over medium-high heat until fragrant, about 20 seconds. Transfer cloves to spice mill or coffee grinder; add peppercorns and next 7 ingredients. Grind finely. Add to blender. Add 1 cup reserved turkey broth; blend until smooth. Stir spice mixture into chile-nut puree. Simmer mole over very low heat 30 minutes to blend flavors while preparing thickeners, stirring often (mole will bubble thickly).', u'Heat 1 1/2 tablespoons oil in medium skillet over medium-high heat. Add bread slice; fry until golden, about 1 1/2 minutes per side. Transfer to blender. Add 1 1/2 tablespoons oil and tortillas to skillet; saut\xe9 2 minutes. Transfer to blender with bread. Add 2 cups reserved turkey broth; blend until smooth. Add to mole; simmer 10 minutes.', u'Add chocolate and piloncillo to mole; simmer over low heat 20 minutes, stirring often, scraping bottom of pot and adding more turkey broth (or chicken broth if necessary) by 1/2 cupfuls if mole is too thick (up to 2 cups more broth may be needed). Season with salt. Continue simmering over low heat until streaks of oil form on mole surface, about 10 minutes longer. (Can be made 3 days ahead. Cool slightly. Chill uncovered until cold, then cover and keep refrigerated. Rewarm over low heat, stirring and adding more broth if desired, before continuing.)', u'Cut turkey into 1/3-inch-thick slices. Add to hot mole; simmer until turkey is heated through, about 10 minutes. Arrange turkey slices on platter. Spoon mole over; sprinkle with sesame seeds.', u'*Mexican cinnamon sticks with a delicate, floral flavor.', u'**Mexican raw sugar shaped into hard cones. Smaller chunks are sometimes labeled panocha. If neither is available, substitute an equal weight of packed dark brown sugar.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/puebla-style-fiesta-turkey-in-mole-sauce-108056', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': None, 'recipe title': u'Puebla-Style Fiesta Turkey in Mole Sauce', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Editor's note: Use this puff pastry to make Francois Payard's Souffl\xe9 of Puff Pastry with Orange-Scented Pastry Cream, Candied Pecans, and Caramel Butter Sauce .", 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 1/3 cups (750 g/1 lb 10.4 oz) unsalted butter', u'2 2/3 cups (300 g/10.5 oz) all-purpose flour', u'1/2 cup plus 2 Tbsp (150 g/5.3 oz) water', u'1 Tbsp plus 1 1/2 tsp (30 g/1.05 oz) salt', u'13/4 cups (200 g/7 oz) all-purpose flour', u'3 3/4 cups plus 1 1/2 Tbsp (500 g/17.6 oz) bread flour', u'10 1/2 Tbsp (150 g/5.3 oz) unsalted butter, melted'], 'preperation steps': [u'Place the butter in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment and beat on low speed until it is pliable. Add the flour and mix until combined. Scrape the mixture out onto a work surface and shape it into a 6-inch square about 1/2 inch high. Wrap the butter in plastic wrap and place it in a cool place (not the refrigerator) until ready to use.', u'Put the water in the bowl of a stand mixer and stir the salt into it. Place the bowl on the mixer stand fitted with the dough hook. Begin mixing on low speed, gradually adding the all-purpose and bread flours. Add the melted butter and mix until a dough begins to form and just comes together; do not overmix. Shape the dough into a tight ball and, using a serrated knife, cut a cross halfway into the ball and wrap it in plastic wrap. Let the dough rest in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.', u'1. Pull out the corners of the cut edges in the dough ball to make it square shaped. On a lightly floured work surface, using a rolling pin, roll out the opened dough to an 8-inch square. Place the butter square diagonally in the center of the dough and fold over the dough points so that they meet in the center. Pinch the edges of the dough to seal the butter in the dough. Roll the dough out into a 10 by 20-inch rectangle, dusting very lightly with flour, as necessary, to prevent the dough from sticking. Make an impression with the rolling pin in the center of the rectangle. Brush off any excess flour from the dough and, with a short end facing you, fold the two short ends of the dough so that they meet in the center, leaving a slight gap. Fold the dough together as if you were closing a book-this is a double turn. Place the dough on a half-sheet pan, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate for 30 minutes.', u'2. For the next turn, place the unwrapped dough rectangle on the work surface so that the folded edges are facing you; the open ends will be on the left and right. Roll out the dough to a 10 by 20-inch rectangle and repeat the folding, rolling, and resting as directed in step 1.', u'3. Remove the dough from the refrigerator and place the unwrapped dough rectangle on the work surface so that the folded edges are facing you; the open ends will be on the left and right. Roll it out again to a 10 by 20-inch rectangle, dusting it lightly with flour as necessary. Brush off the excess flour and fold the bottom third of the dough up over the center, then fold the top third over, as if you were folding a business letter\u2014this is a single turn. The dough is now ready to use.'], 'chef': u'Francois Payard with Tish Boyle', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/puff-pastry-51202630', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 5 pounds (2.25 kg) dough', 'recipe title': u'Puff Pastry', 'image_source': None}

Whisk constantly until parfait base thickens and thermometer inserted into base registers 160\xb0F, about 8 minutes.', u'Remove bowl from over water. Using electric mixer, beat parfait base until billowy and completely cool, about 8 minutes. Divide between 2 medium bowls (about 1 cup parfait base in each bowl). Beat remaining 2 1/4 cups cream in large bowl until medium peaks form. Fold cool peach puree and schnapps into 1 parfait base, then fold in half of whipped cream. Spread peach parfait in prepared pan. Sprinkle remaining macaroon mixture over. Place in freezer.', u'Fold 1 cup of raspberry puree (reserve remaining puree for another use) into parfait base in second bowl. Fold in remaining whipped cream. Spread parfait over macaroon mixture in pan. Cover; freeze at least 8 hours and up to 2 days.', u'Fold 30x7-inch strip aluminum foil lengthwise in half to form 30x3 1/2-inch strip.', u'Microwave white chocolate in glass bowl for 10-second intervals until chocolate just begins to melt; stir until smooth. Pour into small resealable plastic bag. Cut tip off 1 corner of bag. Pipe white chocolate over foil strip in lacy design. Let stand until chocolate sets, about 10 minutes.', u'Using heated knife, cut around parfait cake to loosen; remove pan sides. Holding foil strip upright and parallel to bottom of cake, place 1 end against cake, white chocolate side in. Gently press strip completely around cake like a fence, leaving overhang. Freeze 10 minutes. Starting at overhang, carefully peel off foil. Trim off chocolate overhang. Cover; return cake to freezer for up to 12 hours.', u'Combine all ingredients except raspberries in large bowl; let compote stand at least 15 minutes and up to 1 hour, stirring occasionally. Arrange raspberries atop cake. Cut cake into wedges. Serve with compote.', u'Lindt and Perugina white chocolate gave the best results in our test kitchen.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/raspberry-and-peach-parfait-cake-108469', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 12 servings', 'recipe title': u'Raspberry and Peach Parfait Cake', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Ribollita is a classic Tuscan soup that's made up of vegetable soup mixed with pieces of rustic bread. This version is packed with veggies\u2014white beans, kale, chard, potatoes, tomatoes\u2014and served with a drizzle of extra-virgin olive oil.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: 343.7 kcal calories, 32.6 % calories from fat, 12.4 g fat, 2.0 g saturated fat, 2.5 mg cholesterol, 45.8 g carbohydrates, 9.5 g dietary fiber, 6.2 g total sugars, 36.3 g net carbohydrates, 13.3 g protein\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Bon App\xe9tit', 'recommendation': u'80%', 'ingredient list': [u'13 cups (or more) water, divided', u'1 1/4 cups dried cannellini (white kidney beans; about 8 ounces)', u'12 large fresh sage leaves', u'8 garlic cloves; 5 sliced, 3 chopped', u'2 teaspoons (or more) fine sea salt, divided', u'6 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided, plus additional for drizzling', u'1 large onion, chopped', u'2 large celery stalks, diced', u'1 medium carrot, chopped', u'1 large unpeeled Yukon Gold potato, scrubbed, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u'1 small fennel bulb, trimmed, quartered through core, sliced crosswise', u'1 large pinch of dried thyme', u'1 small bunch black kale,* cut crosswise into 1-inch ribbons (about 6 cups)', u'1 small bunch green chard (about 4 large leaves), center stem removed, cut crosswise into 1-inch-wide ribbons (about 6 cups)', u'4 cups thinly sliced savoy cabbage', u'5 large plum tomatoes, chopped', u'1 2-inch square Parmesan cheese rind', u'Pinch of dried crushed red pepper', u'2 cups (or more) Light Vegetable Broth or good-quality canned vegetable broth (such as Swanson)', u'6 1/2-inch-thick slices country white bread, coarsely torn with crusts'], 'preperation steps': [u'Combine 8 cups water, beans, sage, and sliced garlic in large saucepan. Bring to boil; reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until beans are tender, stirring occasionally and adding more water by 1/4 cupfuls to keep beans submerged, 2 to 2 1/2 hours, depending on age of beans. Add 1 teaspoon sea salt; simmer 10 minutes. Uncover and cool beans in liquid. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and chill in cooking liquid.', u'Heat 3 tablespoons oil in large pot over medium heat. Add onion; sprinkle with sea salt. Cook until onion is translucent, stirring often, about 5 minutes. Add chopped garlic; stir 2 minutes. Add celery, carrot, potato, fennel, and thyme; cook until vegetables are tender and begin to turn brown in spots, stirring often, 15 to 18 minutes. Add kale, chard, cabbage, tomatoes, Parmesan rind, 5 cups water, and 1 teaspoon sea salt. Bring to boil; reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until vegetables are very tender, about 1 1/2 hours. Add beans with cooking liquid and crushed red pepper. Add 2 cups broth. Season with salt and generous amount of pepper. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Cool, cover, and chill. Rewarm before continuing.', u'Add bread to soup and simmer, stirring often to break up bread into smaller pieces and adding more broth by 1/2 cupfuls to thin, if desired. Season with sea salt and pepper.', u'Divide ribollita among bowls, drizzle with oil, and serve.', u"Also called Tuscan kale, dinosaur kale, lacinato kale, or cavolo nero, black kale has long, narrow dark green leaves; available at some supermarkets and farmers' markets."], 'chef': u'Anna Thomas', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/ribollita-357309', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Ribollita', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'The slight spiciness of Gala apples and the decadence of homemade caramel sauce pair nicely with a creamy and not too- sweet vanilla rice pudding. Fuji apples would be another good choice for this dessert.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: 367.5 kcal calories, 36.1% calories from fat, 14.8 g fat, 8.9 g saturated fat, 48.7 mg cholesterol, 52.3 g carbohydrates, 1.4 g dietary fiber, 35.8 g total sugars, 50.9 g net carbs, 7.1 g protein (Analysis does not include whipped cream.)\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Bon App\xe9tit', 'recommendation': u'94%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 cups water', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 cup arborio rice or medium-grain white rice', u'4 cups whole milk', u'1/3 cup sugar', u'2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'2 medium Gala or Fuji apples (13 to 14 ounces total)', u'1/4 cup sugar', u'1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice', u'1 tablespoon unsalted butter, room temperature', u'1/2 cup apple cider', u'Pinch of salt', u'1/2 cup heavy whipping cream', u'Whipped cream (for topping; optional)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Bring 3 cups water and 1/4 teaspoon salt to boil in heavy large saucepan. Add rice and boil 10 minutes. Drain rice; discard cooking water. Rinse saucepan. Combine milk and sugar in same saucepan; bring to boil over medium-high heat, stirring until sugar dissolves. Add rice; reduce heat to medium and simmer until rice is very tender, most of milk is absorbed, and pudding is thickened but still creamy and reduced to scant 3 cups, stirring occasionally, about 35 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla extract. Transfer rice pudding to medium bowl. Press plastic wrap onto surface of pudding; let pudding cool to room temperature. Refrigerate until cold. DO AHEAD: Can be made 2 days ahead. Keep refrigerated.', u'Peel apples; quarter through stem end and remove core. Cut each apple quarter into 4 slices, then cut slices crosswise into thirds. Combine sugar and lemon juice in medium nonstick skillet. Stir over medium-high heat until sugar dissolves and syrup is medium amber color, occasionally swirling skillet, 3 to 4 minutes. Remove from heat; add butter to skillet and swirl until melted (mixture may bubble vigorously). Return skillet to medium heat; add cider and pinch of salt and bring to boil. Add apples and simmer until tender, stirring often, about 6 minutes. Add 1/2 cup whipping cream and boil until sauce thickens slightly, about 2 minutes. Transfer apples with caramel sauce to heatproof bowl. Cool caramel apples until lukewarm or room temperature. DO AHEAD: Caramel apples can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and refrigerate. Stir over medium heat until just warm before using.', u'Divide half of caramel apples among 6 Martini glasses or lowball glasses. Top each with rice pudding, dividing equally. Top with remaining caramel apples, dividing equally. Garnish each with dollop of whipped cream, if desired, and serve.'], 'chef': u'Dorie Greenspan', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/rice-puddings-with-caramel-gala-apples-355205', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Rice Puddings with Caramel Gala Apples', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Can be prepared in 45 minutes or less.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'50%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 cup unconverted long-grain rice', u'1 onion, chopped fine', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'a 13-ounce can plum tomatoes, drained, reserving 1/4 cup juice, and chopped'], 'preperation steps': [u'In a large saucepan bring 4 quarts water to a boil with the salt. Sprinkle in the rice, stirring until the water returns to a boil, and boil it for 10 minutes. Drain the rice in a colander and rinse it. Set the colander over a large saucepan of boiling water and steam the rice, covered with a kitchen towel and the lid, for 15 minutes, or until it is fluffy and dry. The rice may be made 1 day in advance and kept covered and chilled. Reheat the rice in a steamer over boiling water. In a saucepan cook the onion in the oil over moderately low heat, stirring occasionally, until it is softened, add the tomatoes with the reserved juice, and cook the mixture, stirring occasionally, for 3 minutes. In a bowl combine well the rice, the tomato mixture, and salt and pepper to taste.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/rice-and-tomatoes-10308', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 4', 'recipe title': u'Rice and Tomatoes', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"A simplified risotto technique saves much time and effort. Seek out radicchio di Treviso, a slender, elongated variety that is available at some farmers' markets.", 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'4 tablespoons (1/2 stick) butter, divided', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 cup minced onion', u'2 large heads of radicchio, halved, cored, cut into 1/3-inch strips', u'2 cups arborio rice or medium-grain white rice (about 13 ounces)', u'1 cup amarone or other dry red wine', u'6 cups (about) low-salt chicken broth', u'1 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese'], 'preperation steps': [u'Melt 1 tablespoon butter with olive oil in heavy large deep skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and radicchio; saut\xe9 until beginning to brown, about 18 minutes. Add rice. Sprinkle with salt and pepper; stir until rice is translucent at edges but still opaque in center, about 3 minutes. Add wine; simmer until wine is absorbed, stirring occasionally, about 3 minutes. Add 5 1/2 cups broth; increase heat and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer until rice is tender and risotto is creamy, stirring occasionally and adding more broth as needed, about 18 minutes. Remove risotto from heat; stir in remaining 3 tablespoons butter and Parmesan cheese. Season risotto to taste with salt and pepper and serve.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/risotto-with-amarone-and-caramelized-radicchio-232082', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 to 8 first-course servings', 'recipe title': u'Risotto with Amarone and Caramelized Radicchio', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This dish has a livelier, fresher taste than traditional risotto because the vegetables are cooked separately from the rice and then spooned over it in a rich ragout.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'89%', 'ingredient list': [u'3/4 oz dried morel mushrooms (1 cup) or 1/4 lb fresh', u'6 1/2 cups reduced-sodium chicken broth (52 fl oz)', u'2 cups water', u'1 lb medium asparagus, trimmed and cut diagonally into 1-inch-long pieces (about 3 cups)', u'1/2 small onion, finely chopped (1/3 cup)', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'2 cups Arborio rice (about 13 oz)', u'1/2 cup dry white wine', u'2/3 cup finely grated Parmigiano-Reggiano (1 1/4 oz) plus additional for serving', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon black pepper', u'1/2 stick (1/4 cup) unsalted butter, cut into tablespoon pieces', u'1 teaspoon finely chopped garlic', u'1/2 cup frozen baby peas', u'1 teaspoon finely grated fresh lemon zest', u'2 teaspoons chopped fresh chives'], 'preperation steps': [u'If using dried morels, soak in warm water to cover 30 minutes. Agitate dried morels in soaking water or fresh morels in cold water to dislodge grit, then lift from water, squeezing out excess. Pat dry with paper towels. Cut morels (fresh or dried) crosswise into 1/4-inch-thick slices.', u'Bring broth and water to a boil in a 4-quart pot. Add asparagus and cook, uncovered, stirring occasionally, until crisp-tender, 3 to 4 minutes. Transfer asparagus with a slotted spoon to a large bowl of ice and cold water to stop cooking, then drain and pat dry. Reserve 1 cup broth mixture for ragout and keep remaining broth at a bare simmer.', u'Cook onion in oil in a 5- to 6-quart heavy pot over moderate heat, stirring, until softened, about 3 minutes. Add rice and cook, stirring constantly, 1 minute. Add wine and simmer briskly, stirring constantly, until absorbed, about 1 minute. Add 1/2 cup hot broth mixture and simmer briskly, stirring constantly, until broth is absorbed. Continue simmering and adding hot broth mixture, about 1/2 cup at a time, stirring constantly and letting each addition be absorbed before adding the next, until rice is just tender and creamy-looking, 18 to 22 minutes. (There will be leftover broth mixture. Reserve for thinning risotto.)', u'Stir cheese, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper into risotto, then remove from heat and let stand, covered, while making ragout.', u'Heat 2 tablespoons butter in a 10-inch heavy skillet over moderately high heat until foam subsides, then saut\xe9 morels and garlic, stirring occasionally, until garlic is pale golden, about 4 minutes. Pour in 1 cup reserved broth and bring to a boil. Stir in peas, asparagus, zest, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper and simmer, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are heated through, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat and add remaining 2 tablespoons butter, swirling skillet until butter is incorporated, then season ragout with salt and pepper.', u'Thin risotto to desired consistency with some of leftover broth and season with salt and pepper. Divide risotto among 4 shallow bowls. Spoon asparagus and morel ragout (with liquid) on top and sprinkle with chives.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/risotto-with-asparagus-and-morel-ragout-234260', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 main-course servings', 'recipe title': u'Risotto with Asparagus and Morel Rago\xfbt', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Inspired by all that's great about Sephardic cooking, this roast chicken feels both homey and exotic. What to drink: A light- to medium-bodied red wine with dark fruit flavors is just the thing. Try the Giacosa 2005 Dolcetto d'Alba (Italy, $20) or the Campo Viejo 2000 Reserva (Spain, $13).", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'78%', 'ingredient list': [u'7 tablespoons olive oil, divided', u'3 pounds onions, thinly sliced', u'1 pound pitted prunes, halved', u'12 ounces pitted dates, halved', u'10 ounces dried apricot halves (about 2 cups)', u'3 tablespoons sugar', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'2 (4- to 4 1/2-pound) chickens, rinsed, patted dry', u'1 teaspoon turmeric, divided', u'1 1/2 cups (or more) water', u'1/2 cup blanched slivered almonds, toasted'], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat 6 tablespoons olive oil in heavy large skillet over medium-high heat. Do ahead Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and chill.', u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F. Spread fruit mixture over bottom of large roasting pan. Tuck chicken wing tips under. Pour 11/2 cups water around chickens. Roast chickens 1 hour. Turn pan around; add more water to fruit mixture by 1/4 cupfuls if beginning to dry. {'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'78%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'a 3 1/2-pound fillet of beef at room temperature', u'chipotle red pepper sauce and mustard chive sauce as\xa0accompaniments', u'3 cups thinly sliced red bell pepper (about 13 large peppers)', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 canned chipotle chili in adobo (available at Mexican markets, some specialty foods shops, and some\xa0supermarkets), unseeded', u'2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce', u'1/2 cup dry mustard', u'3 tablespoons distilled white vinegar', u'1 1/2 teaspoon sugar', u'1 1/2 teaspoons salt', u'3/4 stick (6 tablespoons) unsalted butter, cut into bits and softened', u'3 tablespoons minced fresh chives'], 'preperation steps': [u'In a heavy flameproof roasting pan heat the oil over moderate high heat until it is hot but not smoking, add the beef, patted dry and seasoned with salt and pepper, and brown it, turning it every 2 minutes, for 10 minutes. Serve the beef with the sauces.', u'In a heavy skillet cook the bell peppers in the oil, covered, over moderately low heat, stirring occasionally, for 25 to 30 minutes, or until they are soft. In a blender pur\xe9e the mixture with the chipotle, the Worcestershire sauce, and salt to taste. The sauce may be made 2 days in advance and kept covered and chilled. Transfer the sauce to a sauceboat and serve it warm or at room temperature.', u'Makes about 1 cup.', u'In a small bowl stir together the mustard, the vinegar, the sugar, the salt, and 3 tablespoons water, making a smooth paste, and let the mixture stand, covered, for 10 minutes. Transfer the mixture to the top of a double boiler set over barely simmering water and whisk in the butter until it is just melted and incorporated thoroughly. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the chives. Transfer the sauce to a sauceboat and serve it warm or at room temperature.', u'Makes about 1 cup.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/roast-fillet-of-beef-with-chipotle-red-pepper-sauce-and-mustard-chive-sauce-10415', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 8', 'recipe title': u'Roast Fillet of Beef with Chipotle Red Pepper Sauce and Mustard Chive Sauce', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Roast goose with apples, a specialty of Alsace, has become a classic Hanukkah dish in Paris. This recipe comes from Didier Lewkowicz, a butcher in the old Jewish quarter of Paris. Serve a French red Bordeaux with the goose.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'90%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 13-pound goose, giblets and neck discarded', u'3 garlic cloves, thinly sliced', u'8 Gala or Golden Delicious apples, peeled, each cut into 6 wedges', u'1/4 cup fresh lemon juice', u'6 tablespoons sugar', u'1/4 cup Calvados', u'1 1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon'], 'preperation steps': [u'Position rack in bottom third of oven and preheat to 350\xb0F. Rinse goose inside and out; pat dry with paper towels. Sprinkle inside and out with salt and pepper. Using knife, cut small slits all over goose; place garlic slices into slits. Place goose on rack, breast side down, in large roasting pan.', u'Roast goose 2 hours 45 minutes, basting occasionally with drippings and removing excess fat; reserve 6 tablespoons fat. Turn goose over. Roast until brown and thermometer inserted into thickest part of thigh registers 175\xb0F, basting occasionally with drippings, about 45 minutes longer.', u'Meanwhile, toss apples and lemon juice in large bowl. Pour 6 tablespoons goose fat into 15 x 10 x 2-inch glass baking dish. Using slotted spoon, transfer apples to baking dish; toss apples in goose fat. Add sugar, Calvados and cinnamon to apples; toss. Bake apples alongside goose until very tender and golden, about 1 hour.', u'Serve goose with caramelized apples.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/roast-goose-with-caramelized-apples-4509', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 8', 'recipe title': u'Roast Goose with Caramelized Apples', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'In most of France, turkey with chestnuts has become a standard Christmas dish, but in the southwest, goose is preferred.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'91%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 16-ounce package pitted prunes', u'3 cups beef stock or canned beef broth', u'1 3/4 cups dry red wine', u'1 1/4 cups prune juice', u'1 12- to 13-pound goose', u'1 orange, quartered', u'1 tablespoon salt', u'1 tablespoon ground pepper', u'1 large onion, cut into 8 pieces', u'4 bay leaves', u'6 tablespoons Armagnac, Cognac or other brandy', u'1 tablespoon butter, room temperature', u'1 tablespoon all purpose flour', u'1 7 2/5-ounce jar steamed or roasted chestnuts', u'Chopped fresh parsley'], 'preperation steps': [u'Combine prunes, stock, 1 1/2 cups wine and 1 cup prune juice in heavy medium saucepan. Rub inside and out with cut side of orange. Combine salt and pepper and rub inside and outside goose. Place orange, onion, bay leaves and 12 drained prunes in goose cavity. Tie legs together. Place goose on rack in roasting pan. Pierce all over with small metal skewer or toothpick.', u'Roast goose 15 minutes. Reduce temperature to 350\xb0F and roast 30 minutes longer. Remove fat from roasting pan. Combine remaining 1/4 cup wine and 1/4 cup prune juice and brush some over goose. Let stand 20 minutes.', u'Strain prune poaching liquid, reserving prunes. Degrease roasting juices. Add 1/2 cup poaching liquid to roasting pan and bring to boil, scraping up any browned bits. Transfer to heavy medium saucepan. Add Armagnac, remaining poaching liquid and degreased roasting juices. Boil until flavors are intense, about 15 minutes. Knead butter and flour together. Whisk into sauce in small bits and simmer until thick, about 8 minutes. Add poached prunes and chestnuts and heat through. Sprinkle with parsley.', u'Carve goose into thin slices. Spoon sauce, chestnuts and prunes over.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/roast-goose-with-chestnuts-prunes-and-armagnac-1086', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 8', 'recipe title': u'Roast Goose with Chestnuts, Prunes and Armagnac', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'88%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/4 cup (1/2 stick) unsalted butter', u'2 small onions, finely chopped', u'2 celery stalks, diced', u'5 garlic cloves, chopped', u'1 14-ounce bag cubed herbed stuffing mix', u'1 1/2 tablespoons rubbed or ground dried sage', u'3/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 teaspoon dried oregano, crumbled', u'1/2 teaspoon dried thyme, crumbled', u'1/2 teaspoon pepper', u'1/2 teaspoon Italian Seasoning', u'2 eggs, beaten to blend', u'1 cup chicken stock or canned broth', u'1 11- to 13-pound goose, fat removed from cavity', u'1 lemon, halved', u'3 bacon slices'], 'preperation steps': [u'Melt butter in heavy large skillet over medium heat. {'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'92%', 'ingredient list': [u'8 whole baby bok choy', u'2 teaspoons plus 2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1/2 teaspoon Thai red curry paste*', u'1 13 1/2- to 14-ounce can unsweetened coconut milk*', u'1/4 cup finely chopped fresh lemongrass or 1 tablespoon grated lemon peel', u'1 tablespoon brown sugar', u'2 1/2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'2 tablespoons fish sauce (nam pla*)', u'4 6-ounce salmon fillets', u'*Thai red curry paste and fish sauce (nam pla) are both available at Asian markets and in the Asian foods section of some supermarkets nationwide.', u'**Canned unsweetened coconut milk is available at Indian markets, Southeast Asian markets, Latin American markets and many supermarkets.'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cook bok choy in pot of boiling salted water until crisp-tender, about 2 minutes. Add bok choy and saut\xe9 until beginning to brown in spots, about 4 minutes. Drizzle bok choy with remaining 1 tablespoon fish sauce. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Easy and elegant: a beautifully simple bird and a rich wine gravy.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'Neck, heart, and gizzard reserved from one 13- to 14-pound turkey', u'2 large celery stalks, coarsely chopped', u'1 large onion, chopped', u'6 cups water', u'1 13- to 14-pound turkey, rinsed, patted dry', u'1 medium onion, chopped', u'1 medium McIntosh apple or Golden Delicious apple, quartered, cored, coarsely chopped', u'3 1/2 teaspoons coarse kosher salt, divided', u'1 1/2 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper, divided', u'1/2 teaspoon dried thyme', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'1/4 cup (1/2 stick) butter, room temperature', u'1/4 cup unbleached flour', u'1/2 cup tawny Port', u'Low-salt chicken broth (if needed)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat oil in heavy large saucepan over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer 1 1/2 hours. Strain stock into large measuring cup and reserve; discard solids. DO AHEAD Can be made 1 day ahead. Cool slightly, cover, and chill.', u'Place turkey on rack in large roasting pan. Mix onion, apple, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon pepper, and thyme in bowl. Spoon mixture into main turkey cavity. Cover with plastic; chill.', u'Position rack in bottom third of oven and preheat to 400\xb0F. Roast turkey uncovered 45 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 375\xb0F. Roast turkey 1 hour. Turn pan around; pour 1 cup turkey stock over. Roast until thermometer inserted into thickest part of thigh registers 175\xb0F, about 1 hour longer. Transfer turkey to platter; tent loosely with foil and let stand 30 minutes (internal temperature will rise 5 to 10 degrees). Reserve pan juices for gravy.', u'Blend butter and flour in small bowl to smooth paste. Tilt roasting pan; spoon off fat from pan juices. Place pan over 2 burners on medium-high heat. Add Port and 1 cup turkey stock; bring to boil, scraping up browned bits. Transfer to large saucepan. Measure 3 cups turkey stock, adding chicken broth if needed. Add to saucepan and bring to boil. Whisk in flour paste. Boil until gravy is thick enough to coat spoon, whisking occasionally, about 15 minutes. Season gravy with salt and pepper.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/roast-turkey-with-port-gravy-236500', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Roast Turkey with Port Gravy', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Cornish hens have a distinctive, delicate flavor that can be easily overpowered. Perhaps surprisingly, the extroverted combination of olives and capers doesn't drown out the meat, but gives it an unexpectedly earthy and savory quality.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'67%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 garlic cloves', u'2 tablespoons coarsely chopped shallot', u'1 stick (1/2 cup) unsalted butter, softened', u'1/2 teaspoon black pepper', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1 tablespoon coarsely chopped pitted Kalamata or other brine-cured black olives', u'1 tablespoon drained capers (in brine)', u'1 tablespoon olive oil', u'4 (1 1/4- to 1 1/2-lb) Cornish hens (not frozen), halved lengthwise', u'1/4 cup dry white wine', u'Special equipment: a 17- by 13-inch heavy shallow metal baking pan'], 'preperation steps': [u'Put oven rack in upper third of oven and preheat oven to 500\xb0F.', u'With motor of a food processor running, drop garlic cloves into processor to finely chop. Add shallot and pulse until finely chopped. Heat 1 tablespoon butter in a small skillet over moderate heat until foam subsides, then add garlic mixture (do not wash bowl of food processor), pepper, and 1/4 teaspoon salt and cook, stirring occasionally, until garlic begins to turn golden, 3 to minutes. Return garlic mixture to food processor and add olives and capers. Pulse until olives and capers are finely chopped. Add 5 tablespoons butter and pulse until smooth.', u'Brush baking pan with oil (1 tablespoon).', u'Working with 1 hen half at a time, slide your index finger under skin on each breast and around legs, including drumsticks, being careful not to tear skin. Place 1 tablespoon olive butter under skin on each half hen, then massage skin over thigh, drumstick, and breast to distribute butter.', u'Arrange hen halves, skin sides up, in baking pan. Melt remaining 2 tablespoons butter in small skillet, then brush evenly over skin of hens. Sprinkle hens evenly with remaining 3/4 teaspoon salt.', u'Roast hens until golden and just cooked through, about 30 minutes.', u'Transfer hens to a platter, then straddle baking pan over 2 burners and add wine. Deglaze pan by simmering over low heat, stirring and scraping up brown bits with a wooden spoon, 2 minutes. Transfer pan sauce to a small serving bowl and skim fat with a spoon. Serve hens with sauce.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/roasted-cornish-hens-with-black-olive-butter-237195', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 (main course) servings', 'recipe title': u'Roasted Cornish Hens with Black-Olive Butter', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Present the shrimp atop the green beans.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'86%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 cups brut Champagne', u'1/2 cup minced shallots', u'3 1/2 tablespoons olive oil plus additional for brushing', u'2 3/4 pounds uncooked large shrimp (13 to 15 per pound), peeled, deveined, tails left intact', u'3 1/2 teaspoons chopped fresh thyme, divided', u'2 1/4 teaspoons finely grated lemon peel, divided', u'1/2 cup (1 stick) butter, room temperature, diced', u'Blue Lake Green Beans with Lemon and Thyme<epi:recipelink></epi:recipelink>', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh Italian parsley'], 'preperation steps': [u'Simmer Champagne and shallots until reduced to 1/2 cup, about 25 minutes. do ahead Sauce base can be made 2 days ahead. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"A beef tenderloin roast is a boon for the host and a treat for family or guests during the holidays. Many big-box stores sell them at a reasonable price, and when trimmed, there's no waste\u2014just solid meat. Cooking the roast doesn't tie up your oven for long, and once it's done, it couldn't be easier to carve. Between the green of the rosemary and the red of the grape tomatoes, the sauce is festive with color and loaded with bright flavor.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'50%', 'ingredient list': [u"1 (6- to 6 1/2-pound) whole beef tenderloin, trimmed of fat, silverskin, and the chain (see Cooks' Notes); or a 5- to 5 1/2-pound well-trimmed tenderloin roast", u'4 ounces diced pancetta', u'2 pounds grape tomatoes', u'Salt', u'Freshly ground black pepper', u'6 large garlic cloves, finely chopped', u'2/3 cup pitted kalamata olives, quartered lengthwise (3 ounces)', u'1 1/2 cups water, divided', u'1 1/4 cups panko (Japanese bread crumbs)', u'5 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided', u'5 tablespoons Dijon mustard', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh rosemary', u'1/4 cup finely chopped flat-leaf parsley', u'Special equpment: Kitchen string; large (18- by 13-inch) rimmed baking sheet; large heavy roasting pan; instant-read thermometer'], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat oven to 500\xb0F with rack in middle.', u'Make a deep cut into the top side of tenderloin, about 4 inches from tail end, to facilitate folding the tail end under the roast to give the meat a more uniform thickness. Tie roast at 1-inch intervals with kitchen string.', u'Cook pancetta in a large rimmed baking sheet in oven, stirring once, until fat is rendered and pancetta is crisp, 4 to 8 minutes. Transfer pancetta with a slotted spoon to a bowl.', u'Add tomatoes and 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper to fat in rimmed baking sheet and stir, then roast in oven 15 minutes.', u'Stir in garlic and olives and roast until tomatoes are falling apart and browned in patches, 2 to 4 minutes.', u'Remove sheet from oven, then add pancetta and 1/2 cup water, scraping up brown bits.', u'Lower oven temperature to 350\xb0F.', u'Toss together bread crumbs, 2 tablespoons oil, and 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper in a bowl.', u'Stir together mustard and rosemary in a small bowl.', u'Pat tenderloin dry and sprinkle all over with 1 1/4 teaspoons each salt and pepper, rubbing into meat.', u'Set roasting pan over 2 burners, then add remaining 3 tablespoons oil and heat over medium-high heat until shimmering. Brown tenderloin on all sides, about 10 minutes.', u'Spread top and upper part of sides with mustard mixture, then sprinkle evenly with bread crumbs. Pat lightly to adhere.', u'Roast tenderloin until thermometer inserted diagonally 2 inches into center of thickest part of meat registers 120\xb0F, 30 to 40 minutes. Transfer beef to a cutting board and let stand 15 minutes (internal temperature will rise to about 130\xb0F for medium-rare).', u'Set roasting pan over 2 burners and add remaining 1 cup water. Bring to a boil, scraping up brown bits, then stir in tomato mixture and parsley.', u'Cut tenderloin into 1/2-inch-thick slices, discarding string, and serve with tomato mixture.'], 'chef': u'Alexis Touchet', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/rosemary-crumb-beef-tenderloin-with-pancetta-roasted-tomatoes-387491', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 10 to 12 servings', 'recipe title': u'Rosemary-Crumb Beef Tenderloin with Pancetta-Roasted Tomatoes', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Angel food cake gets its ethereal fluffiness from whipped egg whites, which also keep it friendly to the waistline and healthy for the heart. The unused egg yolks may be saved for making such real indulgences as Cr\xe8me Anglaise, custards, or lemon curd.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'93%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 cup cake flour (not self-rising)', u'1 2/3 cups sugar', u'1 3/4 cups egg whites (about 13 large egg whites)', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'1 teaspoon cream of tartar', u'1 teaspoon rosewater (available at specialty foods shops) if desired', u'1/2 teaspoon vanilla', u"1 cup confectioner's sugar", u'2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', u'1/8 teaspoon grenadine syrup', u'fresh raspberries for garnish', u'mint sprigs for garnish'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat the oven to 300\xb0F. Sift the flour 3 times onto a sheet of wax paper. Sift together the sifted flour and 2/3 cup of the sugar onto another sheet of wax paper. In a large bowl with an electric mixer beat the egg whites until they are frothy, add the salt and the cream of tartar, and beat the mixture until it barely forms soft peaks. Beat in the remaining 1 cup of sugar, a little at a time, the rosewater, and the vanilla and beat the mixture until it holds soft peaks. Sift one fourth of the flour mixture over the whites, fold it gently but thoroughly, and sift and fold in the remaining flour mixture in the same manner. Spoon the batter into a very clean, ungreased tube pan, 10 by 8 1/4 by 4 1/4 inches, preferably with a removable bottom, smoothing the top, and rap the pan on a hard surface twice to remove any air bubbles. Bake the cake in the middle of the oven for 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until it is springy to the touch and a tester comes out clean. If the pan has feet invert it over a work surface; otherwise invert it over the neck of a bottle. Let the cake cool for at least 2 hours or overnight. Run a thin knife in a sawing motion around the edge of the pan and the tube to loosen the cake from the pan and invert the cake onto a cake plate.', u"In a small bowl stir together with a fork the confectioner's sugar, the lemon juice, and the grenadine syrup until the mixture is smooth.", u'Pour the glaze over the cake, let the cake stand for 10 minutes, or until the glaze is set, and garnish it with the raspberries and the mint.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/rosewater-angel-food-cake-11887', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'about 8 people', 'recipe title': u'Rosewater Angel Food Cake', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"This update on a classic terrine is made with an aromatic broth and olive oil instead of cream. If you're short on time, don't bother with the leek lining\u2014though it is pretty, the terrine works fine without it.", 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'50%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 long medium-thick leeks', u'1/2 cup dry white wine', u'1 1/2 cups water', u'1/4 cup chopped onion (1/2 small)', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped carrot', u'4 long fresh cilantro sprigs plus 2 tablespoons chopped leaves', u'2 tablespoons minced peeled fresh ginger', u'1 teaspoon coriander seeds, toasted and crushed', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'3/8 teaspoon white pepper', u'1/3 pound salmon fillet, skin, pin bones, and any dark flesh discarded', u'2/3 pound medium sea scallops (about 13), tough muscle removed from side of each if necessary', u'1 large egg white, lightly beaten (2 tablespoons)', u'6 tablespoons mild olive oil', u'2 tablespoons white-wine vinegar', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/8 teaspoon white pepper', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1/4 pound fris\xe9e (French curly endive), torn into bite-size pieces (4 cups)', u'2 Belgian endives, halved lengthwise, cored, and sliced crosswise', u'1 cup thinly sliced radicchio leaves (from 1 head)', u'1 teaspoon fleur de sel or kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon coriander seeds, toasted and crushed', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh cilantro', u'Special equipment: a 1-quart loaf pan (preferably 8 by 4 inches; about 2 1/4 inches deep); a kitchen scale (optional)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Discard any discolored leaves from leeks, then cut off root end (to expose layers) and discard. Thinly slice enough of dark green ends to measure 1/4 cup. Wash sliced leeks well and reserve for broth. Keep remainder of leeks (for lining) separately.', u'Bring wine and water to a boil in a 2-quart saucepan with sliced leeks, onion, carrot, cilantro sprigs, 1 tablespoon ginger, 1/2 teaspoon crushed coriander seeds, 1/8 teaspoon salt, and 1/8 teaspoon white pepper, then simmer, partially covered, 20 minutes. Pour broth through a fine-mesh sieve into a bowl, pressing hard on and then discarding solids. (You will have 1 to 1 1/2 cups broth.) Set bowl in a larger bowl of ice and cold water and chill broth until cold, 5 to 10 minutes.', u'While broth is simmering, slit 1 side of each leek lengthwise, cutting only to center, and peel off layers. Rinse layers in warm water to remove any grit, then cook in a 6- to 8-quart pot of boiling salted water until tender, about 10 minutes. Transfer with tongs to a bowl of ice and cold water to stop cooking, then spread layers flat on paper towels and pat dry.', u'Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 325\xb0F.', u'Lightly oil loaf pan, then line bottom and long sides of pan by draping some of leeks crosswise over bottom and up long sides of pan, allowing at least 1 inch of leeks to hang over each side.', u'Cut salmon into 1-inch cubes, then weigh on scale (if using) with enough scallops (about 3) to total 1/2 lb and set aside together.', u'Pur\xe9e remaining 1/2 lb scallops (about 10) with 1 tablespoon egg white, 1/8 teaspoon salt, and 1/8 teaspoon white pepper in a food processor until smooth. Add 1/2 cup cooled broth and blend well. With motor running, add 3 tablespoons oil in a slow stream until incorporated. Transfer scallop pur\xe9e to lined terrine with a rubber spatula and smooth top evenly.', u'Stir together chopped cilantro leaves, 1/8 teaspoon salt, and remaining tablespoon ginger and 1/2 teaspoon crushed coriander seeds in a small bowl, then sprinkle evenly over scallop pur\xe9e.', u'Pur\xe9e salmon and scallop mixture with remaining tablespoon egg white, 1/8 teaspoon salt, and 1/8 teaspoon white pepper in processor until smooth. Add 1/2 cup cooled broth and blend well. With motor running, add remaining 3 tablespoons oil in a slow stream until incorporated. Spoon salmon pur\xe9e evenly over herb mixture to fill terrine, then smooth top. Fold leeks over pur\xe9e to cover, filling in any bare spots with additional pieces of remaining leeks. Cover surface of terrine with an oiled piece of wax paper or parchment (oiled side down).', u'Put loaf pan in a larger baking pan and bake in a hot water bath until terrine is just cooked through (terrine will be firm to the touch and will separate easily from sides of pan), about 30 minutes. Let terrine stand in loaf pan on a rack at least 15 minutes before unmolding.', u'Whisk together vinegar, salt, and white pepper, then add oil in a slow stream, whisking until combined well. Toss fris\xe9e, endive, and radicchio in a large bowl with just enough vinaigrette to coat.', u'Divide salad among 8 plates, then unmold terrine (warm or at room temperature) and cut into 8 slices. Divide among plates, then drizzle with remaining vinaigrette and sprinkle with fleur de sel, crushed coriander seeds, and cilantro.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/salmon-and-scallop-terrine-with-frisee-salad-231480', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Salmon and Scallop Terrine with Fris\xe9e Salad', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Moderate', 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'Large (13" x 18") rimmed baking sheet', u'Candy thermometer', u'Heatproof spatula', u'Cutting board, lined with parchment or wax paper', u'Wax twisting papers', u'3 1/2 tablespoons (50 g) unsalted butter, plus about 1 teaspoon for greasing thebaking sheet', u'1 3/4 cups (350 g) granulated sugar', u'3 1/2 ounces (100 g) unsweetened dark chocolate, chopped into small pieces (about 1/2 cup)', u'1 1/2 cups (12 ounces/375 g) evaporated milk', u'2/3 cup (160 g) heavy (whipping) cream', u'3/4 cup plus 1 tablespoon (300 g) light corn syrup', u'1 tablespoon (20 g) coarse sea salt', u'Cooking spray or vegetable oil'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Grease the baking sheet with the 1 teaspoon butter, and set it aside on a heatproof surface.', u'2. Combine the sugar, chocolate, evaporated milk, and heavy cream, in a large (6- to 8-quart) saucepan or stockpot. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, uncovered and without stirring.', u'3. Once the mixture has come to a boil, insert the candy thermometer. Add the corn syrup, and stir gently with the heatproof spatula until everything is mixed well. Reduce the heat to medium-low and cook, stirring often and making sure to scrape the bottom of the pot to keep the mixture from burning, until the mixture reaches 230\xb0F/110\xb0C (thread stage), about 30 minutes.', u'4. Add the 3 1/2 tablespoons butter and, stirring continuously, cook the caramel until it reaches 238\xb0F/115\xb0C (soft ball stage), 15 to 20 minutes. Remove the caramel from the heat.', u"5. Stir in the salt, making sure to mix well so that it's distributed evenly. Wearing oven mitts, carefully pour the caramel onto the prepared baking sheet. Allow it to cool completely until it's firm to the touch, at least 3 hours, preferably overnight. (If it's humid, cover the caramel with plastic wrap until you can cut it and wrap it in wax paper.)", u"6. Lightly coat a sharp chef's knife with cooking spray, and run the tip around the edge of the baking sheet to release the caramel. Gently turn the caramel out onto the lined cutting board, and cut it into 1-inch squares. Wrap the pieces in wax twisting paper (to turn the squares into little logs, fold each piece over on itself, wrap the twisting paper around it and roll the wrapped caramel against the cutting board, then twist the ends of the paper shut).", u"Store the caramels in an airtight container at cool room temperature for up to 4 weeks; they'll last for up to 3 months in the refrigerator."], 'chef': u'Liz Gutman & Jen King', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/salted-chocolate-caramels-51139620', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes about 120 one-inch pieces', 'recipe title': u'Salted Chocolate Caramels', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This risotto is mellow yet full-flavored.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'71%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 bunch dandelion greens, Swiss chard, or mustard greens (12 ounces), tough bottom stems removed, leaves cut into 3/4-inch pieces', u'4 tablespoons (1/2 stick) butter, divided', u'1 small onion, chopped', u'1 large garlic clove, finely chopped', u'6 ounces mild Italian sausage (about 1 1/2 links), casings removed', u'2 cups arborio rice (13 to 14 ounces)', u'1 cup dry white wine', u'5 cups low-salt chicken broth', u'3/4 cup (packed) freshly grated Parmesan cheese plus additional for serving'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cook greens in boiling salted water just until wilted, about 1 minute. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'The richness of the sausage is a great match for bright, fresh fennel and sweet squash.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'Nonstick vegetable oil spray', u'4 cups 1/2- to 3/4-inch cubes peeled seeded butternut squash (from one 13/4-pound squash)', u'1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter', u'3 cups chopped onions (about 1 pound)', u'2 cups chopped celery (4 to 5 stalks)', u'1 1/2 cups coarsely chopped fresh fennel bulb (about 1 medium)', u'1 1-pound pork sausage log', u'1/4 cup chopped fresh Italian parsley', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh sage', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh marjoram', u'12 cups (generous) 1-inch cubes day-old pain rustique or ciabatta bread with crust (about 1 1/4 pounds)', u'2 large eggs', u'1 1/2 teaspoons fine sea salt', u'1 teaspoon coarsely ground black pepper', u'1 cup (or more) low-salt chicken broth'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F.
