{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'A crisp white wine, such as Sauvignon Blanc, would be nice with this dish.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'89%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1 medium onion, thinly sliced', u'4 garlic cloves, minced', u'4 teaspoons curry powder', u'2 13 1/2- to 14-ounce cans unsweetened coconut milk', u'1 cup chicken stock or canned low-salt chicken broth', u'2 medium carrots, peeled, cut into matchstick-size pieces', u'4 5- to 6-ounce sea bass fillets', u'4 green onions, thinly sliced'], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat oil in heavy medium saucepan over medium heat. Add onion, garlic and curry powder. Saut\xe9 mixture until onions are translucent, about 4 minutes. Mix in coconut milk and stock; bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-high and boil until liquid is reduced to thin sauce consistency, about 50 minutes. Add carrots; simmer until crisp-tender, about 3 minutes. Remove from heat; keep warm.', u'Preheat broiler. Place fish on baking sheet; sprinkle with salt and pepper. Broil fish until just opaque in center, about 8 minutes. Using metal spatula, transfer fish to plates. Spoon sauce over fish. Sprinkle with green onions.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/sea-bass-with-coconut-curry-sauce-101689', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 4', 'recipe title': u'Sea Bass with Coconut-Curry Sauce', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'We have given no-boil lasagne noodles as an alternative to fresh because regular dried lasagne noodles often have curly edges and are too thick.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'89%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/3 cup finely chopped shallot', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped carrot', u'2 tablespoons finely chopped celery', u'1 lb medium shrimp in shells (31 to 35 per lb), peeled, reserving shells, and deveined', u'1 lb sea scallops, tough muscle removed from side of each and reserved', u'5 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened', u'1 teaspoon tomato paste', u'1 cup dry white wine', u'3 cups water', u'1 tablespoon seafood glaze* (optional)', u'2 fresh flat-leaf parsley sprigs', u'3 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'1 cup heavy cream', u'1/2 teaspoon fresh lemon juice, or to taste', u'1 1/2 teaspoons salt', u'1/2 teaspoon black pepper', u'2 tablespoons Cognac', u'1/2 cup finely chopped fresh chives', u'14 (6- by 3-inch) flat fresh or no-boil lasagne noodles (without curly edges)', u'Special equipment: a 3-quart flameproof rectangular casserole dish (about 13 by 9 inches; not glass)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Cook shallot, carrot, celery, reserved shrimp shells, and reserved scallop muscles in 3 tablespoons butter in a 2- to 3-quart heavy saucepan over moderately low heat, uncovered, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are softened and pale golden, about 5 minutes. Add tomato paste and cook, stirring, 1 minute. Add wine and boil over high heat, stirring occasionally, until reduced to about 1/4 cup, 6 to 8 minutes. Add water, seafood glaze (if using), and parsley sprigs and simmer, covered, 30 minutes.', u'Discard parsley and pur\xe9e stock, including shrimp shells, in 2 batches in a blender (use caution when blending hot liquids). Pour through a fine-mesh sieve into a bowl, pressing on and discarding solids.', u'Melt remaining 2 tablespoons butter in cleaned saucepan over moderately low heat, then add flour and cook roux over low heat, stirring, 3 minutes. Add warm seafood stock all at once, whisking, and bring to a boil, whisking. Add 1/2 cup cream and gently simmer sauce, whisking occasionally, 10 minutes. Stir in lemon juice, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.', u'Transfer 1/2 cup sauce to a bowl set in a larger bowl of ice and cold water to cool for filling.', u'Cut one third of shrimp and one third of scallops into 1/4-inch pieces and toss with 1/4 teaspoon salt. Pur\xe9e remaining shrimp and scallops in a food processor with Cognac, cooled 1/2 cup sauce, remaining 3/4 teaspoon salt, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Add remaining 1/2 cup cream and pulse just until combined. Transfer mousse to a large bowl and stir in shrimp and scallop pieces and chives.', u'Preheat oven to 375\xb0F.', u'Boil lasagne noodles a few at a time in a large pot of boiling salted water , stirring to separate, until al dente, about 2 minutes for fresh noodles or about 6 minutes for no-boil. Gently transfer noodles with tongs and a slotted spatula to a large bowl of cold water to stop cooking, then lift out, shaking off water, and lay flat on dry kitchen towels (not terry cloth). Spread 1/3 cup mousse over each noodle, leaving a 1/2-inch border on both short ends. Starting with a short end, loosely roll up each noodle.', u'Spread about 1/2 cup sauce on bottom of casserole dish and arrange cannelloni, seam sides down, snugly in 1 layer over sauce. Pour remaining sauce over cannelloni and bake, covered with foil, in middle of oven until sauce is bubbling and filling is just cooked through, 25 to 30 minutes. (To test filling for doneness, insert a metal skewer into a cannelloni and hold it there 5 seconds. Remove skewer and press it against your bottom lip: If metal is warm, casserole is hot all the way through and filling is cooked.)', u'Preheat broiler.', u'Remove foil and broil cannelloni about 3 inches from heat until brown spots appear, 3 to 5 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.', u'Available at some supermarkets, specialty foods shops, and More Than Gourmet (800-860-9395).'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/seafood-cannelloni-107417', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Seafood Cannelloni', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Adorable Seckel pears are on display in this showpiece, but the essence of pear permeates the entire tart. Musky, honeyed Bartletts are juiced into white wine, creating a poaching liquid for the Seckels. Doubly infused with pear, that syrup becomes the base for the poire William-spiked pastry cream and glaze.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'85%', 'ingredient list': [u'Sweet pastry dough', u'1 cup dry white wine', u'2 ripe Bartlett pears', u'3/4 cup sugar', u'2 pounds Seckel pears (24 very small or 16 small)', u'3 large egg yolks', u'1 1/2 tablespoons cornstarch', u'1/2 vanilla bean, split lengthwise', u'2 tablespoons poire William (pear eau-de-vie)', u'1/2 tablespoon unsalted butter', u'1 tablespoon poire William', u'3/4 teaspoon unflavored gelatin (from a 1/4-ounce envelope)', u'Equipment: a 13-by 4-inch rectangular fluted tart pan with removable side; pie weights or dried beans; a flour sack or linen cloth'], 'preperation steps': [u'Roll out dough on a floured surface with a floured rolling pin into a 20-by 8-inch rectangle, reflouring surface as necessary. Transfer to tart pan, gently fitting dough into pan without stretching. Trim overhang to 3/4 inch, cutting off corners. Fold overhang inward to reinforce side, then trim flush with edge of pan. Reserve excess pastry for another use if desired. Prick bottom of tart shell all over with a fork and chill until firm, about 30 minutes.', u'Preheat oven to 375\xb0F with rack in middle.', u'Line shell with foil and fill with pie weights, then bake until sides are set, about 20 minutes. Remove foil and weights and bake shell until golden brown all over, 15 to 20 minutes more. Cool completely in pan.', u'Put wine in a wide 4-quart pot and set a sieve lined with dampened flour sack cloth over it. Grate Bartlett pears (including skin) on large holes of a box grater into cloth, then bunch up cloth around mixture and squeeze as much clear juice as possible through cloth into pan with wine. Discard solids remaining in cloth. Transfer wine mixture to a 2-cup measure and add enough water, if necessary, to bring total to 2 cups liquid, then return to pan and stir in sugar.', u'Carefully peel Seckel pears, leaving stems intact, then core through bottom with tip of vegetable peeler or a small knife to remove seeds.', u'Bring wine mixture to a boil, stirring until sugar has dissolved, then add pears, in 1 layer if possible. Simmer, tightly covered, turning occasionally, until tender, about 20 minutes. Carefully transfer pears with a slotted spoon to a rack set over a 4-sided sheet pan to drain and cool, standing them upright. Transfer pear syrup to cleaned 2-cup measure, adding any juices from sheet pan under pears (you will have 1 1/4 to 1 1/2 cups syrup), and reserve for pastry cream and glaze.', u'Whisk together egg yolks and cornstarch in a small bowl, then whisk in 1 cup pear syrup. Transfer to a small heavy saucepan and scrape in seeds from vanilla bean, reserving pod for another use. Bring to a boil over medium heat, whisking, then cook, whisking, 2 minutes. Remove from heat and whisk in poire William and butter. Transfer to a bowl and cool completely, its surface covered.', u'Stir together poire William and gelatin in a very small bowl and let stand 1 minute.', u'Bring remaining pear syrup to a boil in a very small heavy saucepan, then boil, if necessary, until reduced to about 1/3 cup. Stir in gelatin mixture until dissolved. Remove from heat.', u'Remove side of tart pan. Whisk cooled pastry cream to loosen, then spread in shell. Stand pears upright on pastry cream, arranging them in 8 rows of 2 or 3.', u'When glaze has cooled and thickened slightly (to speed cooling, set pan in an ice bath), brush it on pears. If glaze gels in pan, reheat very briefly.'], 'chef': u'Shelley Wiseman', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/seckel-pear-tart-with-em-poire-william-em-cream-350575', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Seckel Pear Tart with Poire William Cream', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Called thiebou djenne, this national dish of Senegal is traditionally eaten from a communal platter. The hostess divides the fish and vegetables onto a portion of rice for each person.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 1/8 cups chopped onion (from 3 medium)', u'1 1/4 cups peanut oil', u'5 large garlic cloves (2 cloves finely chopped and 3 cloves chopped)', u'1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons tomato paste', u'3 1/2 cups reduced-sodium chicken broth (28 fl oz)', u'1 1/2 lb fresh cassava (also called yuca)', u'1/8 lb eggplant', u'3 medium carrots, cut crosswise into 1/2-inch pieces (1 1/4 cups)', u'2 medium turnips, cut into 1-inch pieces (2 1/2 cups)', u'1/8 lb cabbage, cored and cut into 1-inch pieces (4 cups)', u'8 small fresh or frozen okra (2 oz)', u'1 (2-oz) piece dried fish such as stockfish (optional), broken into 2 or 3 pieces', u'4 cups water', u'2 1/4 teaspoons salt', u'1 1/2 teaspoons cayenne', u'1/8 cup loosely packed fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves', u'3 (1-lb) whole white-fleshed fish (each about 12 inches long) such as red snapper, cleaned, leaving head and tail intact', u'2 cups long-grain white rice (1/8 lb)', u"Special equipment: a large nonreactive roasting pan (16 by 13 by 3 inches; see cooks' note, below)"], 'preperation steps': [u'Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 450\xb0F.', u'Cook 2 cups onion in 1/4 cup oil in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderately low heat, stirring occasionally, until softened, 4 to 5 minutes. Add finely chopped garlic (from 2 cloves) and cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add tomato paste and cook, stirring constantly, until caramelized, about 1 minute. Add broth and bring to a boil, stirring until tomato paste is incorporated, then remove from heat.', u'Trim ends of cassava, then halve crosswise and peel, removing all waxy brown skin and pinkish layer underneath. Quarter each half lengthwise, then cut away and discard thin, woody core. Cut cassava crosswise into 1-inch pieces. Cut eggplant into 1-inch pieces.', u'Put cassava, eggplant, carrots, turnips, cabbage, okra, and dried fish (if using) in roasting pan, then straddle pan over 2 burners and add broth mixture (reserve skillet), water, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1 1/4 teaspoons cayenne. Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally, then transfer to oven and braise, uncovered, stirring twice, until vegetables are just tender, 20 to 25 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.', u'While vegetables are braising, pulse together parsley, chopped garlic (from remaining 3 cloves), 1/8 teaspoon salt, remaining 1/8 cup onion, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon cayenne in a food processor until finely chopped.', u"Lay 1 fish on its side with gutted side facing you. Holding a sharp paring knife at a 30-degree angle from fish, cut 3 evenly spaced (2 1/2-inch-long) slits across center of fish's side to make shallow pockets. (Start at side farthest away from you; be careful not to cut through bone.) Turn fish over and cut 3 slits across center of other side in same manner, then repeat with remaining 2 fish. Pat fish dry, then stuff slits with parsley mixture (some mixture will come out of slits).", u'Clean skillet and wipe dry, then heat remaining cup oil in skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking. Brown fish, 1 at a time (fish will not lie flat in skillet), turning over once carefully using tongs and a metal spatula, until golden, about 2 minutes per fish. Transfer as browned with tongs and spatula to a shallow baking pan.', u'Arrange fish over vegetables and braise in oven, without stirring, until fish is just cooked through, 5 to 10 minutes (test for doneness in thickest part of fish). Transfer fish using tongs and spatula to a platter, then transfer vegetables with slotted spoon to a large bowl and keep warm, covered with foil.', u'Pour cooking liquid from roasting pan into a 1-quart liquid measure and add enough water to total 4 cups liquid.', u'Bring liquid (4 cups), rice, and remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt to a full rolling boil in a 4-quart heavy pot, then cover and reduce heat to low. Cook, undisturbed, until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat and let stand, undisturbed, 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork.', u'Spoon vegetable mixture into center of a very large platter, then spoon rice around vegetables. Arrange fish on vegetables.'], 'chef': u'ipe by Alexis Touchet', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/senegalese-rice-with-fish-232831', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Senegalese Rice with Fish', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Wrapper's delight: two paper pouches, eight shrimp, 10 minutes \u2014 dinner!", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Nutritional analysis per serving: 352 calories, 8 g fat (3 g saturated fat), 33 g carbohydrates, 37 g protein, 5.5 g fiber\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Self', 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 firm apples (such as Granny Smith or Gala)', u'1 tsp butter', u'2 sheets parchment paper, 13" x 18" (found in the paper-goods aisle), or aluminum foil cut to size', u'8 jumbo shrimp, peeled (leave tail) and deveined', u'1 egg white', u'4 extra-thin slices (1/2 oz) Gruy\xe8re'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F. Peel and core 2 apples. Wrap each in a sheet of aluminum foil and bake 35 minutes on a cookie sheet. Core third apple and cut into 8 slices. In a nonstick pan, saut\xe9 slices in butter, 3 minutes per side. Remove pan from heat. Cut each parchment sheet into a heart, keeping shapes as large as possible (18-inch width). Brush one side of each heart with egg white. Unwrap baked apples, place in bowl and mash with a fork. Heat oven to 400\xb0F. Spoon 1/2 cup mashed apples into a rectangle in the center of one half of each heart. Position 4 apple slices alternating with 4 shrimp atop mashed apples. Season with salt and pepper. Layer 2 Gruy\xe8re slices on each arrangement. Fold heart, crimp edges to seal and bake 6 to 8 minutes on a cookie sheet. Transfer to plates and open right before serving.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/shrimp-cooked-in-paper-230195', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 2 servings', 'recipe title': u'Shrimp Cooked in Paper', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'The mildly bitter flavor of yu choy plays nicely against the sweet curry sauce and kabocha squash. Chinese broccoli or broccoli rabe (rapini) can be used instead. Serve with white rice.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'70%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 pound yu choy, bottom 2 inches trimmed, stalks and leaves cut into 1 1/2-inch-wide strips', u'4 cups 3/4-inch cubes peeled seeded kabocha squash (from about one 2 3/4-pound squash)', u'2 13- to 14-ounce cans unsweetened coconut milk, divided', u'2/3 cup (packed) Thai basil leaves, divided', u'6 large fresh cilantro sprigs', u'3 double-leaf kaffir lime leaves,* chopped', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1 large shallot, finely chopped', u'2 teaspoons Thai green curry paste*', u'1 1/2 tablespoons minced lemongrass*', u'2 1/2 tablespoons fish sauce*', u'1 tablespoon golden brown sugar', u'3/4 pound uncooked medium-size shrimp, peeled, deveined'], 'preperation steps': [u'Bring large saucepan of water to boil. Boil until almost tender, about 4 minutes. Drain, rinse with cold water, and set aside.', u'Blend 1/2 cup coconut milk, 1/3 cup basil, cilantro, and lime leaves in mini processor or blender until herbs are finely chopped and loose paste forms. Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add shallot and curry paste; stir 30 seconds. Add herb paste and lemongrass; stir 1 minute. Add remaining milk, fish sauce, sugar, and squash. Boil until squash is tender, about 4 minutes. Add shrimp and yu choy. Simmer until shrimp are opaque in center, about 2 minutes. Mix in 1/3 cup basil leaves. Season with salt and pepper.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/shrimp-curry-with-yu-choy-and-kabocha-squash-232265', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 servings', 'recipe title': u'Shrimp Curry with Yu Choy and Kabocha Squash', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Serve over steamed basmati rice. Garam masala, a spice mixture, is available at Indian markets and some supermarkets.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'94%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 cups chopped onions', u'4 large garlic cloves, minced', u'1 1/2 teaspoons garam masala', u'1 1/2 teaspoons curry powder', u'1 1/2 teaspoons ground coriander', u'1 teaspoon turmeric', u'1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper', u'1 28-ounce can diced tomatoes in juice', u'1 cup plain whole-milk yogurt', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'2 pounds uncooked large shrimp, peeled, deveined', u'1 13 1/2-ounce can unsweetened coconut milk', u'1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro', u'1/4 cup chopped green onion tops', u'1 1/2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice'], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over medium heat. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Tacos de Pescado', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'89%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/4 cup mayonnaise', u'1/4 cup ketchup', u'1/4 cup crema mexicana*', u'1 cup all purpose flour', u'1 teaspoon fine sea salt', u'1/2 teaspoon ground pepper', u'1 cup dark beer, room temperature', u'13/4 pounds halibut, cut into 5x3/4-inch strips', u'1 lime, halved crosswise', u'12 white corn tortillas', u'Vegetable oil (for deep-frying)', u'1 1/2 cups shredded red cabbage', u'2 large tomatoes, chopped', u'Lime wedges', u'Bottled hot pepper sauce'], 'preperation steps': [u'Mix all ingredients in bowl; season with salt and pepper.', u'Whisk flour, salt, and pepper in bowl; pour in beer, whisking until batter is smooth. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Sephardic Jews from Turkey, Greece, Morocco, and other countries of the Mediterranean region say seven special blessings over seven different symbolic foods at their Rosh Hashanah dinner. Five of these blessings are over vegetables \u2014 apples (candied or dipped in sugar or honey), leeks, beet greens or spinach, dates, and zucchini or squash. These blessings symbolize their hopes for the New Year. Many of these Jews trace their ancestors back to Spain, which is called Sepharad in the Bible. Over the centuries, the Sephardic Jews took advantage of the abundance of vegetables available in the Mediterranean countries, often throughout the year. Among these vegetables are sweet potatoes and squash, great favorites of my family. The special blessing you can say over your sweet potatoes and squash at the beginning of your Rosh Hashanah dinner goes like this:', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'83%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 pound acorn or butternut squash', u'1 pound sweet potatoes or yams', u'2 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'1/4 cup dried cranberries or cherries', u'2 tablespoons brown sugar', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'Vegetable peeler', u'Sharp paring knife', u'Wooden spoon', u'Frying pan', u'Mixing bowl', u'Aluminum foil', u'Oblong casserole dish (about 9 by 13 inches)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Adult: Preheat oven to 375\xb0. Peel the squash.', u'Child: Peel the sweet potatoes or yams. Then carefully cut both the sweet potatoes and squash into 1-inch cubes. Place most of the oil in the casserole. Add the sweet potatoes and bake, covered with aluminum foil, about 20 minutes.', u'Adult: Take out the hot dish from the oven and carefully remove the foil.', u'Child: Add the squash and the cranberries or cherries. Sprinkle the sugar and cinnamon on top and dribble with the remaining oil.', u'Adult: Bake uncovered at 375\xb0 for 30-35 minutes, or until well browned. Serve over roast chicken or pot roast.'], 'chef': u'Joan Nathan', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/sort-of-sephardic-sweet-potatoes-and-squash-40001', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 6', 'recipe title': u'Sort of Sephardic Sweet Potatoes and Squash', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"This beautiful tart features a pastry the Italians call pasta frolla \u2014 the texture of the dough is more like cookie dough than traditional French-style pastry. The lattice crust is surprisingly easy to make because it doesn't require weaving the strips.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'92%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 sticks (3/4 cup) unsalted butter, softened', u'1/3 cup plus 1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 large egg, lightly beaten', u'1 teaspoon vanilla', u'2 1/4 cups all-purpose flour', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'2 teaspoons finely grated fresh lemon zest', u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter, cut into pieces', u'5 1/4 cups fresh or frozen (not thawed) sour cherries (13/4 lb), pitted', u'3/4 cup plus 1 tablespoon sugar', u'2 tablespoons cold water', u'3 tablespoons cornstarch', u'Special equipment: a 9- by 1-inch fluted round tart pan with removable rim'], 'preperation steps': [u'Beat together butter and 1/3 cup sugar with an electric mixer at medium speed until pale and fluffy, about 3 minutes. Reserve 1 tablespoon beaten egg, chilled, for egg wash and beat remaining egg into butter mixture, then add vanilla, beating well. Reduce speed to low and mix in flour, salt, and zest until mixture just forms a dough.', u'Halve dough and form each half into a 5- to 6-inch disk. Wrap disks in plastic wrap and chill until firm, at least 30 minutes.', u'Heat butter in a 12-inch nonstick skillet over moderate heat until foam subsides, then add fresh or frozen cherries with any juices and sugar and simmer, stirring, until sugar is dissolved. (Cherries will exude juices.) Continue to simmer until cherries are tender but not falling apart, about 8 minutes. Stir together water and cornstarch to form a thick paste, then stir into simmering filling and boil, stirring frequently, 2 minutes. Cool filling quickly by spreading it in a shallow baking pan and chilling until lukewarm, about 15 minutes.', u'Roll out 1 piece of dough (keep remaining piece chilled) between 2 sheets of wax paper into a 12-inch round. Remove top sheet of paper and invert dough into tart pan. Trim overhang to 1/2 inch and fold inward, then press against side of pan to reinforce edge. Chill tart shell. Roll out remaining dough in same manner and remove top sheet of paper, then cut dough into 10 (1-inch-wide) strips and slide dough, still on wax paper, onto a baking sheet. Chill strips until firm, about 5 minutes.', u'Put a foil-lined large baking sheet in middle of oven and preheat oven to 375\xb0F.', u'Spread filling in chilled tart shell and arrange 5 strips 1 inch apart across filling, pressing ends onto edge of tart shell. Arrange remaining 5 strips 1 inch apart diagonally across first strips to form a lattice with diamond-shaped spaces. Trim edges of all strips flush with edge of pan. Brush lattice top with reserved beaten egg and sprinkle crostata with remaining tablespoon sugar.', u'Bake crostata in pan on baking sheet in oven until pastry is golden and filling is bubbling, about 1 hour. (If lattice and edges look too brown after 30 minutes, loosely cover with foil.) Cool crostata completely in pan on a rack, 1 1/2 to 2 hours, to allow juices to thicken.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/sour-cherry-crostata-108374', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Sour Cherry Crostata', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"A wonderfully homey cake that's equally good with afternoon tea, after a meal, or for breakfast with a cup of Italian roast coffee. Maple sugar is available at some supermarkets and at many natural foods stores.", 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'86%', 'ingredient list': [u'Nonstick vegetable oil spray', u'2 cups all purpose flour', u'2 teaspoons baking powder', u'1/2 teaspoon baking soda', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 1/3 cups sour cream', u'1/4 cup pure maple syrup', u'1/2 cup walnuts, toasted, chopped', u'1/4 cup plus 1 1/3 cups maple sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'13 tablespoons butter, cut into pieces, room temperature', u'2 large eggs', u'2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'1 1/3 cups powdered sugar', u'3 tablespoons sour cream', u'1 tablespoon pure maple syrup', u'1 1/2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'1/2 teaspoon grated lemon peel', u'Whipped cream'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F. Mix walnuts, 1/4 cup maple sugar, and cinnamon in small bowl.', u'Using electric mixer, beat butter and remaining 1 1/3 cups maple sugar in large bowl until fluffy. Gradually beat in eggs and vanilla, occasionally stopping to scrape down sides of bowl. Add flour mixture in 3 additions, alternating with sour cream mixture in 2 additions. Transfer 2/3 of batter to prepared Bundt pan. Sprinkle with walnut mixture. Pour remaining batter into pan.', u'Bake cake until tester inserted near center comes out clean, about 55 minutes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'For best results, be sure to use artisanal sourdough bread.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: 289.1 kcal calories, 27.5 % calories from fat, 8.8 g fat, 3.0 g saturated fat, 10.4 mg cholesterol, 46.0 g carbohydrates, 4.5 g dietary fiber, 4.1 g total sugars, 41.6 g net carbohydrates, 9.4 g protein\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Bon App\xe9tit', 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1 1/2-pound loaf sourdough bread, crusts removed, bread cut into 1/2-inch cubes (about 13 cups)', u'2 pounds bulk pork breakfast sausage', u'2 large onions, chopped (about 4 generous cups)', u'2 cups chopped celery (about 5 stalks)', u'4 tablespoons (1/2 stick) butter, divided', u'6 cups 1/2-inch cubes peeled Granny Smith apples (about 28 ounces)', u'3/4 cup golden raisins (about 4 ounces)', u'2 tablespoons chopped fresh sage', u'2 1/2 cups low-salt chicken broth', u'3 large eggs'], 'preperation steps': [u'Position rack in center of oven and preheat to 350\xb0F. {'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'97%', 'ingredient list': [u'5 pounds mussels (preferably cultivated)', u'3 limes', u'a 13 1/2-ounce can unsweetened coconut milk', u'1/3 cup dry white wine', u'1 1/2 tablespoons Thai red curry paste', u'1 1/2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'1 tablespoon Asian fish sauce', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'2 cups fresh cilantro sprigs', u'Accompaniment: lime wedges'], 'preperation steps': [u'Scrub mussels well and remove beards. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Coconut milk ties this dish together, adding a tropical note and balancing the heat of Sriracha sauce (a Thai bottled sauce of pur\xe9ed red chiles).', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'85%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 cups long-grain white rice', u'1 1/2 cups water', u'1 teaspoon sugar', u'1 1/2 cups well-stirred unsweetened coconut milk (not low-fat; from a 13 1/2- to 14-oz can)', u'1 1/2 teaspoons salt', u'1 lb Broccolini', u'2 lb peeled and deveined large shrimp (raw; 20 to 25 per lb)', u'2 1/2 tablespoons Sriracha sauce', u'2 teaspoons cornstarch', u'1/2 cup reduced-sodium chicken broth', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'Accompaniment: lime wedges'], 'preperation steps': [u'Rinse rice in a sieve under cold water, then shake well to drain and transfer to a 1 1/2-to 2-quart heavy saucepan. Add water (1 1/2 cups), sugar, 1 cup coconut milk, and 3/4 teaspoon salt. Bring to a boil, partially covered, then reduce heat to low and cover completely. Cook 20 minutes, then remove from heat and let stand, covered, 5 minutes.', u'While rice cooks, trim Broccolini, discarding 1/4 inch from bottom, then cut diagonally into 1-inch lengths. Toss shrimp with Sriracha sauce and remaining 3/4 teaspoon salt in a bowl.', u'Stir together cornstarch, 1/4 cup chicken broth, and remaining 1/2 cup coconut milk in another bowl until cornstarch is completely dissolved.', u'Heat a 12- to 14-inch well-seasoned flat-bottomed wok or a 12-inch heavy skillet over high heat until it just begins to smoke, then add oil, swirling to coat. Add Broccolini and stir-fry until bright green, then add remaining 1/4 cup chicken broth and stir-fry until liquid is evaporated, about 3 minutes. Add shrimp mixture and cook, stirring frequently, 2 minutes. Stir cornstarch mixture, then pour it down side of wok and boil, stirring, until sauce is slightly thickened and shrimp are just cooked through, about 3 minutes more. Fluff rice with a fork and serve with shrimp immediately.'], 'chef': u'issa Roberts-Matar', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/spicy-wok-shrimp-with-coconut-rice-1222183', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Spicy Wok Shrimp with Coconut Rice', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Active time: 2 hr Start to finish: 4 hr (includes making fresh pasta)', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'81%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1 1/2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'2 cups whole milk', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'Pinch of freshly grated nutmeg', u'3/4 oz finely grated Pecorino Romano or Parmigiano-Reggiano (about 1/3 cup)', u'3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 small onion, chopped', u'2 garlic cloves, finely chopped', u'10 oz baby spinach', u'1 3/4 cups ricotta (12 oz fresh or 15 oz supermarket-style)', u'1 large egg, lightly beaten', u'1/2 cup chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley', u'3 oz thinly sliced prosciutto (optional), chopped', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'1 oz finely grated Pecorino Romano or Parmigiano-Reggiano ( 1/2 cup)', u'8 (6- by 4-inch) fresh pasta rectangles lasagne noodles', u'Special equipment: a 13- by 9- by 2-inch ceramic baking dish or other shallow 3-qt flameproof baking dish (not glass)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Melt butter in a 1 1/2- to 2-quart heavy saucepan over moderately low heat. {'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'90%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1/4 cup finely chopped shallots (2 to 3)', u'1 cup long-grain white rice', u'1 2/3 cups low-sodium chicken broth (13 fl oz)', u'2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 tablespoon chopped garlic (2 cloves)', u'3 (10-oz) bags spinach, tough stems discarded', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'2 to 3 teaspoons fresh lemon juice'], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat butter in a 1- to 2-quart heavy saucepan over moderately low heat until foam subsides, then cook shallots, stirring occasionally, until beginning to turn golden, about 2 minutes. {'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'89%', 'ingredient list': [u'Pastry dough', u'1 cup heavy cream', u'1 whole large egg', u'2 large egg yolks', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1/4 teaspoon black pepper', u'5 oz chilled Stilton, rind removed and cheese crumbled (1 1/2 cups)', u'Accompaniment: cranberry chutney', u'Special equipment: a 13 1/2- by 4- by 1-inch rectangular fluted tart pan with a removable bottom', u'pie weights or raw rice'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F.', u'Roll out dough on a lightly floured surface with a floured rolling pin into a 17- by 8-inch rectangle and fit into tart pan. Slowly pour custard into shell and bake in middle of oven until golden around edge and custard is just set, 30 to 35 minutes. Cool tart completely in pan on a rack.', u'Cut tart into 32 rectangles and serve at room temperature, topped with chutney.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/stilton-tart-with-cranberry-chutney-105906', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u"Makes 32 hors d'oeuvres", 'recipe title': u'Stilton Tart with Cranberry Chutney', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Tumis Sayur', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 medium-size bunch (about 13 ounces) tender Asian greens, such as bok choi, baby bok choi, baby Shanghai choi, choi sum, baby kai lan, or water spinach', u'3 tablespoons peanut oil', u'4 cloves garlic, peeled, bruised until juicy with a flat side of knife, and coarsely chopped into 3 or 4 chunks', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u"1 to 2 fresh red Holland chiles or other hot fresh red long chiles, such as Fresno or cayenne, stemmed and sliced on the diagonal into thin pieces (optional, but the chiles add appealing color and gentle heat; see Cook's Note, below)"], 'preperation steps': [u"1. Carefully inspect the greens, discarding or trimming off any spoiled stems or leaves. Trim the bottom ends off and discard. Wash the greens in several changes of the coldest possible water; tepid water might cause them to wilt, and you want them to stay as alert and perky as possible before being cooked. (Note: Because bok choi and baby bok choi tend to have pockets full of sand in the nooks where the leaves meet the center stem, be certain to pull the leaves back slightly away from the stem when you're cleaning them. There are few things worse than a mouthful of sand when you want a mouthful of greens.)", u"2. Cut the cleaned greens into pieces 2-1/2 to 3 inches long. If any of the stems are particularly wide \u2014 say, more than 1 inch \u2014 or are tough or sinewy-looking, cut them in half lengthwise. If you're using baby bok choi or baby Shanghai choi, you can either leave the heads whole or cut them in half lengthwise \u2014 it's up to you. Spin the greens dry in a salad dryer or set them aside to air-dry on a kitchen towel or paper towels; they needn't be bone dry \u2014 a little dampness won't matter.", u"3. In a wok, 12-inch skillet, Dutch oven, or soup pot (any pot large and wide enough to comfortably hold the greens will do), heat the oil over medium-high heat. When it's hot but not smoking \u2014 it should appear shimmery \u2014 add the garlic, the salt, and, if using, the chiles. Saut\xe9, stirring until the garlic just begins to lose its rawness, about 1 minute. (Try not to let the garlic turn golden or golden brown, which would give this dish an inappropriate roasted taste.)", u'4. Add the greens. Raise the heat slightly and immediately begin to vigorously stir-fry the greens around the pot. Continue to vigorously stir-fry the greens until they just begin to go limp but the leaves remain a spring-green color and the stems are still crunchy-crisp, 3 to 4 minutes, depending on the type of greens. Taste for salt, adding only a pinch more if necessary (a little salt goes a long way with greens).', u"5. Transfer the cooked greens to a large serving platter and serve promptly. Be careful not to pile the greens in a small bowl; since the greens will continue to cook for a minute or two after they're removed from the heat, a serving bowl that crowds them may cause them to overcook and become mushy."], 'chef': u'James Oseland', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/stir-fried-asian-greens-with-chiles-and-garlic-237115', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 servings', 'recipe title': u'Stir-Fried Asian Greens with Chiles and Garlic', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Use seasonal strawberries if you can get them, but even less than stellar ones will shine with the help of a jar of preserves. The combination creates beautiful ruby red candy-like edges, with a bit of ooze in the center, especially if you bake them and eat them in the same day. Just make sure they are completely cool before cutting them. Preserves usually come in either 12- or 13-ounce jars; either one will work\u2014just use the whole jar.', 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 cup (2 sticks) cold unsalted butter, cut into pieces, plus more for pan', u'2 1/4 cups all-purpose flour', u'3/4 cup buckwheat flour', u'1/2 cup granulated sugar', u'1/2 cup light brown sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1 teaspoon baking powder', u'1 large egg, beaten to blend', u'3 cups hulled, quartered strawberries (about 1 pound)', u'1 (12\u201313-ounce) jar strawberry preserves', u'1 tablespoon cornstarch', u'2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice', u'Powdered sugar (for dusting; optional)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 375\xb0F. Butter a 9x13" baking pan and line with parchment paper, leaving a 1" overhang on both long sides.', u'Pulse all-purpose flour, buckwheat flour, granulated sugar, brown sugar, salt, and baking powder in a food processor until well combined. Add 1 cup butter and pulse until mixture resembles coarse meal. Add egg and pulse until well distributed. Transfer mixture to a large bowl and mix with your fingers until clumps form; it should look like crumb topping at this point. Chill dough while you make the filling.', u'Combine strawberries, preserves, cornstarch, and lemon juice in a small saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until preserves are melted and cornstarch is dissolved, 2\u20133 minutes.', u'Press half of dough into prepared pan, patting with your knuckles to an even thickness. Pour strawberry mixture evenly over dough. Sprinkle remaining dough evenly over top. Bake bar until fruit is bubbling and top is golden brown, 40\u201345 minutes.', u'Let cool on a wire rack. Lift bar out of pan using parchment overhang and cut into 24 squares. Dust with powdered sugar, if desired.', u'Bars can be stored in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days.'], 'chef': u'an Spungen', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/strawberry-buckwheat-bars-56389816', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 24 bars', 'recipe title': u'Strawberry Buckwheat Bars', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 medium red bell peppers', u'3 tablespoons olive oil', u'1 tablespoon finely chopped fresh basil', u'2 lb red or green Swiss chard, center ribs and stems discarded', u'1/4 cup finely chopped shallot', u'13 large eggs', u'3/8 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 cup plus 3 tablespoons cr\xe8me fra\xeeche or heavy cream', u'6 oz coarsely grated white sharp Cheddar (1 1/2 cups)', u'Special equipment: a nonstick 12- by 4- by 2 1/2-inch loaf pan (8-cup capacity) or 9- by 2-inch round cake pan'], 'preperation steps': [u'Roast bell peppers on racks of gas burners over high heat, turning with tongs, until skins are charred, 6 to 8 minutes. Stir in salt and pepper to taste and cool.', u'Preheat oven to 450\xb0F.', u'Break 4 eggs into each of 2 bowls, then add 1/8 teaspoon salt and pepper to taste to each and whisk to combine eggs in each bowl. Whisk 1/4 cup cr\xe8me fra\xeeche into other bowl of eggs until smooth, then stir in chard mixture.', u'Pour bell pepper eggs into oiled loaf pan and bake in a hot water bath in middle of oven until firm to the touch, 18 to 20 minutes (about 13 minutes if using round cake pan).', u'Pour chard eggs into loaf pan and continue to bake until layer is firm, 18 to 20 minutes more (about 13 minutes if using round cake pan).', u'While chard layer bakes, break remaining 5 eggs into a bowl, then add remaining 1/8 teaspoon salt and pepper to taste and whisk to combine. Whisk in Cheddar and remaining 1/4 cup cr\xe8me fra\xeeche, then pour cheese eggs into loaf pan and bake until layer is lightly browned and slightly puffed, about 20 minutes (about 16 minutes if using round cake pan). Transfer loaf pan to a rack and cool omelet 5 minutes.', u'Invert a long platter over loaf pan and invert omelet onto platter. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Have your butcher order the veal breast, then ask him to bone, butterfly, and pound it, forming a rectangle that has the dimensions described in the recipe.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'88%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 pound ground veal', u'2 cups fresh breadcrumbs made from crustless French bread', u'1 10-ounce package frozen chopped spinach, thawed, squeezed dry', u'1 cup drained oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes, chopped', u'2 large eggs', u'3 tablespoons chopped fresh marjoram', u'2 1/2 tablespoons minced garlic', u'1 1/2 teaspoons salt', u'1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper', u'1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg', u'1 3 1/2- to 3 3/4-pound piece boneless veal breast, butterflied, pounded to 15 x 13-inch rectangle', u'2 tablespoons olive oil', u'6 cups coarsely chopped onions', u'3 cups coarsely chopped carrots', u'2 cups coarsely chopped celery', u'1 750-ml bottle dry red wine', u'3 1/2 cups (about) chicken stock or canned low-salt chicken broth', u'1 14 1/2- to 16-ounce can diced tomatoes in juice'], 'preperation steps': [u'Mix first 5 ingredients, 1 tablespoon marjoram, 1 tablespoon garlic, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, 1/2 teaspoon pepper and nutmeg in large bowl to blend.', u'Preheat oven to 400\xb0F. Place veal breast, pounded side up, on work surface. Sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper. Form ground veal mixture into 8-inch-long, 3 1/2-inch-wide loaf. Place loaf atop breast about 3 inches from 1 long side. Fold short sides of breast over stuffing. Fold long side nearest stuffing over. Roll up, enclosing stuffing. Tie in several places with twine. Fasten each short end with toothpicks. (Can be made 8 hours ahead. Wrap in plastic; chill.)', u'Sprinkle veal with salt and pepper. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in heavy large skillet over high heat. Add veal; saut\xe9 until brown on all sides, about 10 minutes. Transfer to large roasting pan. Add 1 tablespoon oil, onions, carrots and celery to skillet; saut\xe9 until golden, about 15 minutes. Transfer vegetables to pan with veal. Add wine, 2 cups stock, tomatoes with juices, 2 tablespoons marjoram and 1 1/2 tablespoons garlic to roasting pan.', u'Roast veal until very tender, turning and basting with pan juices every 30 minutes and adding stock as needed to keep juices halfway up sides of veal, about 2 hours 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Transfer to platter; let stand 30 minutes. Remove twine. Slice veal. Transfer pan juices and vegetables to saucepan; rewarm. Season with salt and pepper. Spoon juices and vegetables around veal.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/stuffed-veal-breast-with-spinach-and-sun-dried-tomatoes-5692', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 6', 'recipe title': u'Stuffed Veal Breast with Spinach and Sun-Dried Tomatoes', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Legend has it that on December 13, 1764, a gentleman in Sweden was roused in the middle of the night by a beautiful voice. He saw a young woman in white moving through his room singing. She had wings and was carrying a candle. That was Lucia the Saint. She brought light, food, and wine as comfort on what was, in the Gregorian calendar, the longest night of the year. We celebrate Saint Lucia on December 13. Children will walk with lit candles singing the beautiful Lucia carol and bringing the Lucia bread.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'40%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 ounces yeast', u'2 cups lukewarm water', u'1/8 ounce saffron', u'Scant 1 cup butter, melted', u'2 pounds all-purpose flour', u'1 teaspoon salt', u'1/2 cup superfine sugar', u'1/3 cup raisins', u'44 raisins', u'1 egg, beaten'], 'preperation steps': [u'Dissolve the yeast in the warm milk in a mixing bowl, then add the saffron and keep stirring until the mixture turns yellow. Add the melted butter. In a separate mixing bowl, sift together the flour and salt, then stir in the sugar and raisins.', u'Pour the yeast mixture into the dry ingredients and stir until the dough comes cleanly from the edge of the bowl. Knead the dough on a floured counter for 10 minutes, until it is shiny but not sticky. Put the dough back in the bowl and let rise for 1 1/2 hours at room temperature.', u'Lightly knead the dough again on a floured counter. Divide into 22 equal pieces. Roll them into sausages then curl the ends so that each piece is shaped like the number eight. Put one raisin in the middle of each circle. Place the breads on baking sheets lined with parchment paper, cover with dish towels, and let rise again for 30 minutes.', u'Preheat the oven to 350\xb0F. Brush the risen breads with beaten egg. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, or until golden brown all over. Let cool on a wire rack. Eat them as they are, or spread with cold butter.'], 'chef': u'Trina Hahnemann', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/swedish-lucia-breads-354550', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 22', 'recipe title': u'Swedish Lucia Breads', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Similar to pumpkin pie, but not quite as sweet. Serve with whipped cream, if you like.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'98%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/3 cups all purpose flour', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'6 tablespoons chilled unsalted butter, cut into small pieces', u'2 tablespoons chilled solid vegetable shortening, cut into small pieces', u'3 tablespoons (or more) ice water', u'2 large red-skinned sweet potatoes (yams; 13/4 pounds)', u'1 cup (packed) golden brown sugar', u'1 cup whipping cream', u'3 large eggs', u'1 teaspoon vanilla extract', u'3/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/4 teaspoon ground mace', u'1/4 teaspoon salt', u'1 large egg white, beaten to blend'], 'preperation steps': [u'Mix flour, sugar, and salt in processor. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'The meat for these \u201cshepherd\u2019s\u201d tacos is commonly seen roasting on vertical spits displayed with pride on street stands throughout Mexico. The spits are usually topped with a pineapple, which is thinly sliced and served in the tacos. This method of cooking meat is identical to that used for the spit-roasted lamb (shawarma) brought to Puebla, Mexico, by Lebanese immigrants in the 1930s. The technique was copied by the Mexican taqueros (taco masters), who substituted pork for lamb. The original stand for tacos al pastor still exists in Puebla, with vertical spits of pork still revolving in front of its huge wood-burning hearth. This recipe makes two dozen tacos to serve 8 persons with big appetites, or more as part of a taco party platter. Note that the pork must marinate overnight before cooking.', 'rating': u'2/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: 500.0 calories, 170.0 calories from fat, 18.0g total fat, 7.0g saturated fat, 145.0mg cholesterol, 1710.0mg sodium, 28.0g total carbs, 3.0g dietary fiber, 19.0g sugars, 54.0g protein\n\nNutritional analysis provided by TasteBook, using the USDA Nutrition Database', 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'40 dried guajillo chiles', u'20 dried ancho chiles', u'20 dried pasilla negro chiles', u'2\xa01/2 cups fresh orange juice', u'Grated zest of 1 orange', u'1/3 cup firmly packed dark brown sugar', u'9 cloves garlic', u'1\xa01/2 tablespoons cumin seed, toasted and ground (page 164)', u'1\xa01/2 tablespoons dried Mexican oregano, toasted and ground (page 161)', u'1\xa01/2 tablespoons kosher salt', u'1 tablespoon black pepper', u'1\xa01/2 tablespoons distilled vinegar', u'1 tablespoon fresh lime juice', u'6 ounces cola', u'8 ounces Mexican beer', u'4 pounds pork shoulder, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', u'3 tablespoons vegetable oil', u'24 (5\xa01/2-inch) soft white corn tortillas (page 13), for serving', u'Garnish: Caramelized diced pineapple'], 'preperation steps': [u'Stem, seed, and rehydrate the dried chiles (page 153). Drain and set aside, reserving the soaking liquid.', u'In a small saucepan, simmer the orange juice over medium-low heat until reduced by half; set aside. In the jar of a blender, puree the rehydrated chiles until smooth, adding some of the soaking water, if needed, to achieve a smooth consistency.', u'In a large bowl, add the reduced orange juice, pureed chiles, orange zest, brown sugar, garlic, cumin, oregano, salt, black pepper, vinegar, lime juice, cola, and beer and stir to mix well. Add the pork, cover, and marinate in the refrigerator overnight.', u'When ready to cook, remove the pork from the marinade and drain well. In a large, heavy skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Saut\xe9 the pork pieces until the meat is cooked through, about 7 minutes. Remove from the heat and serve right away or keep warm in the pan until ready to serve.', u'To serve, lay the tortillas side by side, open face and overlapping on a platter. Divide the filling equally between the tortillas and top with pineapple and salsa. Grab, fold, and eat right away. Or build your own taco: lay a tortilla, open face, in one hand. Spoon on some filling, top with pineapple and salsa, fold, and eat right away.'], 'chef': u'Mark Miller with Benjamin Hargett and Jane Horn', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/tacos-al-pastor-363454', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'makes 24 tacos', 'recipe title': u'Tacos Al Pastor', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'The recipe below is part of a healthy and delicious spa menu developed exclusively for Epicurious by Ananda spa in India. Darjeeling tea and herbs, including star anise, cinnamon, and ginger, flavor the smoked duck breast, which is served with nutrient-packed pears, sweet potatoes, vegetables, and blueberries. If you are watching calories and cholesterol, take a small portion of duck and fill the rest of your plate with the veggies and fruit. If you are following an Ayurvedic diet, the experts at Ananda recommend this for vata and pitta doshas.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'63%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 (3/4-pound) boneless Moulard* duck breast halves with skin', u'1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u'3/8 teaspoon fine sea salt', u'4 scallions, white and light green parts only, finely chopped', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/8 teaspoon ground ginger', u'1 whole star anise', u'2 large sweet potatoes (about 1 pound total)', u'12 ears fresh baby corn,** husked', u'12 asparagus spears, trimmed and cut crosswise into thirds', u'12 baby carrots', u'1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice', u'1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1 teaspoon fine sea salt', u'2 firm Bosc pears, peeled', u'1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 red onion, cut into large dice (about 1 1/2 cups)', u'1 medium carrot, peeled and cut into large dice (about 1/2 cup)', u'1 leek, white part only, cut into large dice (about 3/4 cup)', u'1/2 cup fortified red wine, such as port, Marsala, or Madeira', u'2 1/2 cups chicken stock or low-sodium chicken broth', u'1 whole cinnamon stick', u'1 green cardamom pod, lightly crushed', u'2 tablespoons whole fresh blueberries', u'1 teaspoon Darjeeling tea leaves', u'1 tablespoon fresh cilantro leaves, coarsely chopped', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter', u'1 tablespoon superfine sugar', u'2 tablespoons fresh blueberries', u'teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', u"*Moulard duck breasts, also called magrets, are available from D'Artagnan.", u"*Fresh baby corn\u2014actually just tiny, immature ears of sweet corn\u2014is available at Asian markets and farmers' markets. Alternatively, substitute thawed frozen baby corn or canned, rinsed twice to remove excess salt, and skip blanching step.", u'Special equipment: wok with lid, heavy-duty foil, 12-inch round wire rack, 3-quart (9- by 13-inch) baking dish; instant-read thermometer'], 'preperation steps': [u'Rinse breasts and pat dry. Using sharp knife, score skin in 1/2-inch crosshatch pattern, taking care not to cut through fat into meat below. Sprinkle breasts with pepper and teaspoon salt.', u'In large bowl, stir together scallions, cinnamon, ginger, remaining 1/8 teaspoon salt, and star anise. Add duck breasts and toss to combine, making sure both breasts are completely covered with mixture. Cover and chill in refrigerator for at least 8 hours or overnight.', u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F.', u'Prick potatoes all over with fork, wrap each in aluminum foil, and place on rimmed baking sheet. Roast, turning over once, until tender, 35 to 45 minutes.', u'Unwrap potatoes and let cool to room temperature. Slice lengthwise into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Refrigerate until ready to use. (Potatoes can be roasted up to 4 hours in advance and refrigerated, covered.)', u'Have ready large bowl of ice water.', u'In medium saucepan over high heat, bring salted water to boil. Transfer corn to medium sieve and plunge sieve into boiling water. Cook corn in sieve, uncovered, until crisp-tender, 2 to 3 minutes, then lift sieve from boiling water and immediately plunge into ice water to stop cooking. Drain corn, pat dry, and transfer to large bowl. Repeat process with asparagus then carrots, allowing water to return to boil between each batch. Refrigerate vegetables until ready to use. (Vegetables can be cooked up to 4 hours in advance and refrigerated, covered.)', u'Line large rimmed baking sheet with paper towels and top with wire cooling rack. In 3-quart saucepan over high heat, stir together 4 cups water, lemon juice, cinnamon, and salt. Bring to boil, then reduce heat to moderately low, add pears standing upright, and partially cover with lid. Simmer pears until just tender, about 15 minutes, then, using slotted spoon, transfer to rack. Allow to drain and cool to room temperature, then refrigerate until ready to use. (Pears can be poached up to 24 hours in advance and refrigerated, covered).', u'In heavy, 1 1/2-quart saucepan over moderate heat, heat oil until hot but not smoking. Add onion, carrot, and leek, and saut until softened and light golden, about 10 minutes. Add wine, raise heat to high, and bring to boil. Lower heat to moderately high and simmer vigorously, uncovered, until the liquid has reduced by 2/3, 4 to 5 minutes. Add stock, cinnamon stick, and cardamom pod, raise heat to high and bring to boil. Reduce heat to moderate and simmer until mixture is thick enough to lightly coat back of spoon, 30 to 45 minutes. Pour through fine-mesh strainer into small, clean saucepan. Cover and keep warm.', u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F.', u'Line bottom of wok and inside of lid with double layer of heavy-duty foil, leaving 3-inch overhang along edges. In small bowl, stir together tea leaves and cilantro. Sprinkle mixture in even layer on bottom of wok and set rack in wok (it should rest about 2 inches from bottom).', u'Heat heavy, 12-inch skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking. Remove duck breasts from marinade and transfer, skin-side down, to skillet. Sear without moving until skin is deep golden brown, about 5 minutes.', u'Using tongs, transfer breasts, skin side up, to rack in wok, arranging about 1 inch apart. Heat wok over high heat, uncovered, until steady wisps of smoke begin to appear, 5 to 10 minutes. Reduce heat to moderate, then cover wok and, using oven mitts, fold foil overhang from wok and lid together, crimping to seal tightly (foil will be very hot). Smoke duck breasts 10 minutes.', u'Slice each pear in half lengthwise and, using small spoon or melon baller, remove seeds.', u'In heavy, 12-inch skillet over moderately high heat, melt butter. Stir in sugar, then add pears and gently toss to coat. Cook, uncovered, turning over once, until pears are caramelized, about 5 to 6 minutes per side. Remove from pan and keep warm, covered.', u'When breasts have smoked 10 minutes, carefully unwrap foil (smoke and steam will billow out). Using tongs, transfer breasts to baking dish and place in oven. Transfer potatoes to rimmed baking sheet and place alongside duck in oven. Roast duck to desired doneness, 7 to 8 minutes for medium-rare (instant-read thermometer inserted into breasts will read 135\xb0F). Transfer breasts to carving board, tent with foil, and let rest 5 minutes before slicing. When potatoes are warm, remove from oven, cover and keep warm.', u'In heavy, 12-inch skillet over moderately high heat, heat oil until hot but not smoking. Add asparagus, carrots, and baby corn and saut\xe9 until lightly browned and heated through, about 7 minutes. Keep warm.', u'If necessary, rewarm sauce over low heat. Stir in blueberries.', u'Divide potato slices among 4 large plates. Sprinkle duck breasts with pepper. Holding sharp knife at 45\xb0F angle, cut each duck breast into thin slices. Arrange slices on top of potatoes. Place 1 pear half on side of each plate and arrange vegetables on other side. Spoon blueberry jus over plates and serve immediately.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/tea-smoked-duck-breast-with-pears-and-blueberry-jus-240799', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 servings', 'recipe title': u'Tea-Smoked Duck Breast with Pears and Blueberry Jus', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"When the topic of chowder comes up, debates rage about the merits of the creamy New England style versus the red, tomato-packed Manhattan version. We'd be hard-pressed to choose a favorite, but one thing is for sure: We love chowder. It's comforting, hearty, and full of seafood. The same can be said of Thai-style seafood curry. Coconut milk stands in for cream, and curry paste packs a warming punch. It\x92s global chowder\u2014 and it's delicious. That's something we can all agree on.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'93%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 tablespoons unrefined peanut oil', u'5 green onions, finely chopped, dark green parts separated from white and pale green parts', u'3 tablespoons minced fresh cilantro, divided', u'3 garlic cloves, minced', u'6 tablespoons Thai green curry paste', u'1 1/4 cups water', u'1 13-to 14-ounce can unsweetened coconut milk', u'2 small fresh red Thai chiles or 1 red jalape\xf1o chile', u'2 kaffir lime leaves', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce (such as nam pla or nuoc nam)', u'1 large carrot, peeled, thinly sliced on diagonal (about 1 cup)', u'4 cups thinly sliced bok choy', u'8 ounces uncooked medium shrimp, peeled, deveined', u'8 ounces bay scallops', u'1 pound green or black mussels, scrubbed, debearded', u'2 tablespoons minced fresh basil', u'2 cups (about) steamed rice'], 'preperation steps': [u'Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Add white and pale green parts of green onions, 1 tablespoon cilantro, and garlic; saut\xe9 until tender, about 2 minutes. Add curry paste; cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add 1 1/4 cups water, coconut milk, chiles, lime leaves, and fish sauce. Bring to simmer. Add carrot; cover and cook until carrot is just tender, about 5 minutes. Layer bok choy, shrimp, scallops, and mussels in pan. Cover and simmer until mussels open and seafood and bok choy are cooked (discard mussels that do not open), about 5 minutes. Stir in dark green parts of green onions, 2 tablespoons cilantro, and basil.', u'Divide rice among 4 shallow bowls. Ladle curry over rice and serve.'], 'chef': u'Jeanne Thiel Kelley', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/thai-green-curry-with-seafood-352634', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 servings', 'recipe title': u'Thai Green Curry with Seafood', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'For a light lunch, top the salad with grilled shrimp or tofu.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'5 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'3 tablespoons (packed) palm sugar or golden brown sugar', u'2 tablespoons plus 2 teaspoons fish sauce', u'2 tablespoons dried shrimp, chopped', u'4 garlic cloves, minced', u'3 Chinese long beans, halved crosswise or 15 green beans', u'1 1 1/2- to 13/4-pound green papaya, peeled, halved, seeded', u'10 large cherry tomatoes, halved', u'1 cup chopped fresh cilantro', u'2 green onions, very thinly sliced', u'1 fresh red Thai chile with seeds, thinly sliced', u'2 tablespoons coarsely chopped salted peanuts', u'Special equipment: Julienne peeler or box grater'], 'preperation steps': [u'Whisk first 5 ingredients in medium bowl. Sprinkle peanuts over and serve.', u'Palm sugar, fish sauce (nam pla or nuoc nam), dried shrimp, Chinese long beans, green papaya, and Thai chiles can all be found at Asian markets.'], 'chef': u'Molly Wizenberg', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/thai-green-papaya-salad-358495', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 servings', 'recipe title': u'Thai Green Papaya Salad', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Thai red curry paste typically has more than eight different ingredients, including hot red pepper and lemongrass, so buying it ready- made is certainly easier than making your own. Look for it in the ethnic foods section of your supermarket or at Asian grocers. You can add 1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined, to the curry during the last few minutes of cooking, if you wish.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'81%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 small butternut squash (about 2 pounds)', u'2 tablespoons canola oil', u'1/3 cup Thai red curry paste', u'One 15-ounce can chickpeas (garbanzo beans), drained and rinsed', u'Kosher salt', u'One 13-ounce can unsweetened coconut milk', u'1/3 cup fresh cilantro, plus more for garnish'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Peel the squash, cut it lengthwise in half, and scoop out the seeds. Cut off the top where it meets the bulbous bottom. Cut the bulb end into 3/4- inch-wide wedges. Cut the neck end into 1/2- inch-thick half-moons.', u'2. Heat a large heavy pot over medium-high heat. Add the canola oil, then add the curry paste and stir for about 1 minute, or until fragrant. Add the squash and stir to coat with the curry paste. Stir in the chickpeas and season with salt. Add the coconut milk and 3/4 cup water and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer gently for about 10 minutes, or until the squash just begins to soften.', u'3. Stir in the cilantro and simmer, uncovered, stirring occasionally, for about 20 minutes, or until the squash is tender but not falling apart and the sauce has reduced slightly. Season to taste with salt.', u'4. Divide the curry among four soup bowls, top with cilantro, and serve.'], 'chef': u'Curtis Stone', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/thai-red-curry-with-butternut-squash-and-chickpeas-51163610', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Serves 4', 'recipe title': u'Thai Red Curry with Butternut Squash and Chickpeas', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Thai red curry paste, unsweetened coconut milk, and fish sauce are available in the Asian foods section of most supermarkets. Serve this curry over steamed jasmine rice.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': u'296 calories, 9 g fat, 1 g fiber\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Bon App\xe9tit', 'recommendation': u'91%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 large limes', u'1 tablespoon vegetable oil', u'1 cup chopped shallots', u'1 large red bell pepper, cut into 1/2-to 3/4-inch dice', u'1 1/2 tablespoons minced peeled fresh ginger', u'2 1/2 teaspoons Thai red curry paste (such as Thai Kitchen brand)', u'1 13 1/2- to 14-ounce can unsweetened coconut milk', u'1 tablespoon fish sauce (such as nam pla or nuoc nam)', u'16 to 18 ounces halibut fillets, cut into 1 1/2-inch chunks', u'8 peeled deveined uncooked large shrimp (8 to 10 ounces)', u'1/3 cup chopped fresh cilantro', u'1/3 cup chopped fresh basil'], 'preperation steps': [u'Finely grate enough peel from 2 limes to measure 1 1/2 teaspoons. Add chopped shallots, diced red bell pepper, and minced ginger; saut\xe8 until shallots are tender and peppers soften, about 5 minutes. Stir in curry paste, coconut milk, fish sauce, 1 1/2 teaspoons lime peel, and 2 tablespoons lime juice. Simmer gently, stirring often, about 5 minutes. Sprinkle fish and shrimp with salt and pepper. Gently stir in cilantro and basil; serve with lime wedges.'], 'chef': u'The Bon App\xe9tit Test Kitchen', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/thai-shrimp-halibut-curry-364570', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 servings ', 'recipe title': u'Thai Shrimp Halibut Curry', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Using shrimp instead of chicken in this recipe makes for an equally delicious soup.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'90%', 'ingredient list': [u'8 cups chicken stock or low-sodium chicken broth (64 fl oz)', u'4 cups water', u'1 tablespoon Thai green curry paste*', u'4 garlic cloves, coarsely chopped', u'1 (2-inch) piece peeled fresh ginger, coarsely chopped', u'1 teaspoon coriander seeds, crushed', u'2 cups loosely packed whole fresh cilantro leaves plus 1/2 cup chopped (from 2 large bunches)', u'1 cup jasmine rice', u'3/4 lb boneless skinless chicken breast, thinly sliced crosswise, then slices cut lengthwise into thin strips, or 3/4 lb medium shrimp in shell (31 to 35 per lb), peeled and deveined', u'1 (13- to 14-oz) can unsweetened coconut milk, stirred well', u'1/4 lb snow peas, trimmed and cut diagonally into 1/4-inch strips', u'2 tablespoons Asian fish sauce', u'2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', u'1 1/2 teaspoons salt, or to taste', u'Accompaniment: lime wedges'], 'preperation steps': [u'Combine stock, water, curry paste, garlic, ginger, coriander seeds, and whole cilantro leaves in a 3- to 4-quart saucepan, then simmer, uncovered, until ginger is softened, about 15 minutes. Stir in coconut milk, snow peas, and fish sauce and simmer, uncovered, until peas are crisp-tender, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in lime juice, salt, and chopped cilantro.', u'*Available at Asian markets, some specialty foods shops, and some supermarkets.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/thai-style-chicken-and-rice-soup-109019', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 main-course servings', 'recipe title': u'Thai-Style Chicken and Rice Soup', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Coconut milk, coconut extract, and rum give the souffl\xe9s a slightly tropical note. The vivid crimson sauce looks beautiful with the white souffl\xe9s.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': u'Per serving: 231.9 kcal calories, 49.5 % calories from fat, 12.7 g fat, 10.6 g saturated fat, 7.5 mg cholesterol, 27.1 g carbohydrates, 1.0 g dietary fiber,, 23.6 g total sugars, 26.1 g net carbohydrates, 3.4 g protein\n\nNutritional analysis provided by Bon App\xe9tit', 'recommendation': u'67%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 cup fresh or frozen cranberries (about 4 ounces)', u'3/4 cup cranberry juice cocktail', u'1/2 cup sugar', u'2 tablespoons (1/4 stick) unsalted butter', u'2 tablespoons all purpose flour', u'1 1/4 cups canned unsweetened coconut milk* (from one 13-to 14-ounce can)', u'5 tablespoons sugar, divided, plus additional for sprinkling', u'1 1/2 teaspoons white rum', u'3/4 teaspoon coconut extract', u'Pinch of salt', u'5 large egg whites, room temperature', u'1/3 cup sweetened flaked coconut, lightly toasted, cooled, crushed into small flakes plus additional toasted sweetened flaked coconut for garnish', u'Special equipment: 8 3/4-cup custard cups or ramekins'], 'preperation steps': [u'Bring all ingredients to boil in small saucepan, stirring until sugar dissolves. Reduce heat; simmer until berries are soft, about 6 minutes. Pour mixture through strainer set over bowl, pressing on solids to extract liquid. Discard solids in strainer. DO AHEAD: Can be made 3 days ahead. Cover and chill. Rewarm sauce before using.', u'Melt butter in medium saucepan over medium heat. Add flour; whisk until bubbling but not brown, about 2 minutes. Gradually add coconut milk; whisk until mixture boils and thickens, about 1 minute. Remove from heat; whisk in 2 1/2 tablespoons sugar, rum, extract, and salt. Transfer to large bowl. Place plastic wrap directly onto surface of souffl\xe9 base. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Cover; chill. Bring to room temperature; whisk until smooth before continuing.', u'Butter eight 3/4-cup custard cups or ramekins; sprinkle with sugar, tilting cups to coat completely and tapping out any excess. Place cups on rimmed baking sheet. Using electric mixer, beat egg whites in large bowl until soft peaks form. Gradually add 21/2 tablespoons sugar and beat until medium-stiff peaks form. Add 1/4 of whites to coconut base and whisk until lightened. Add remaining whites in 2 additions and fold in with rubber spatula. Fold in crushed toasted coconut. Divide souffl\xe9 mixture among prepared cups; smooth tops. DO AHEAD: Can be made 6 hours ahead. Cover and chill.', u'Position rack in center of oven and preheat to 375\xb0F. Bake souffl\xe9s until puffed and beginning to brown, about 18 minutes. Transfer 1 souffl\xe9 to each of 8 plates. Top with warm cranberry sauce and garnish with toasted coconut; serve immediately.', u'Available at many supermarkets and at Indian, Southeast Asian, and Latin markets.'], 'chef': u'Abigail Johnson Dodge', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/toasted-coconut-souffles-with-ruby-red-cranberry-sauce-356336', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': None, 'recipe title': u'Toasted-Coconut Souffl\xe9s with Ruby-Red Cranberry Sauce', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"Escoffier codified the mother sauces of French cooking. In the Italian-American tradition, there is only one: tomato sauce. Call it marinara (we do), call it gravy (we don't), call it whatever your grandma called it. It's tomato sauce. There's almost nothing we won't cook in it or put it on.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'86%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 cup olive oil', u'13 cloves garlic', u'One 96-ounce can (or, if you can find it, 1-kg) or four 28-ounce cans Italian tomatoes', u'Large pinch of red pepper flakes', u'2 teaspoons fine sea salt'], 'preperation steps': [u'1. Combine the olive oil and garlic in a large deep saucepan and cook over medium-low heat for about 10 minutes, stirring or swirling occasionally, until the garlic is deeply colored\u2014striations of deep brown running through golden cloves\u2014and fragrant. If the garlic starts to smell acrid or sharp or is taking on color quickly, pull the pan off the stove and reduce the heat.', u'2. While the garlic is getting golden, deal with the tomatoes: Pour them into a bowl and crush them with your hands. We like to pull out the firmer stem end from each of the tomatoes as we crush them and discard those along with the basil leaves that are packed into a can.', u'3. When the garlic is just about done, add the red pepper flakes to the oil and cook them for 30 seconds or a minute, to infuse their flavor and spice into the oil. Dump in the tomatoes, add the salt, and stir well. Turn the heat up to medium, get the sauce simmering at a gentle pace, not aggressively, and simmer for 4 hours. Stir it from time to time. Mother it a little bit.', u'4. Check the sauce for salt at the end. The sauce can be cooked with meat at this point, or stored, covered, in the fridge for at least 4 days or frozen for up to a few months.'], 'chef': u'Frank Falcinelli, Frank Castronovo, Peter Meehan', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/tomato-sauce-360149', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes about 3 quarts', 'recipe title': u'Tomato Sauce', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'This impressive frozen dessert has a crisp gingersnap crust, cool mango and lime sorbet filling, and refreshing fruit topping.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 cups finely ground gingersnap cookies (about 13 1/2 ounces)', u'1/2 cup (packed) golden brown sugar', u'2 teaspoons ground ginger', u'3/4 cup (1 1/2 sticks) unsalted butter, melted', u'2 pints mango sorbet, slightly softened', u'1 pint lime sorbet, slightly softened', u'1/2 small pineapple, peeled, cored, chopped', u'1 small papaya, peeled, seeded, chopped', u'1 small mango, peeled, pitted, chopped', u'2 1/2-pint baskets blueberries', u'Shredded sweetened coconut, toasted'], 'preperation steps': [u'Combine gingersnap cookie crumbs, brown sugar, and ginger in large bowl. Spoon fruit atop lime sorbet. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Dressing up jarred eggplant and canned tuna results in an incredibly lusty lunch.
