{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Jason Vincent, executive chef of Chicago\'s Nightwood, shared this recipe exclusively with Epicurious. His creative take on Thanksgiving leftovers does require some extra prep on Turkey Day\u2014you need to add the enchilada sauce ingredients to the bottom of the turkey\'s roasting pan\u2014but it\'s a technique Vincent has perfected over the years and will save you tons of time and effort in the end. "The sauce kind of makes itself," says Vincent.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'46%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 (28-ounce) cans whole, peeled San Marzano tomatoes, drained and seeded', u'2 large onions, roughly chopped', u'8 dried ancho chiles,* seeds removed', u'20 dried arbol chiles, seeds removed', u'4 heads garlic, cloves separated and peeled', u'2 stalks celery, roughly chopped', u'2 large carrots, roughly chopped', u'4 tablespoons whole coriander seeds', u'2 tablespoons whole cumin seeds', u'2 tablespoons whole dill seeds', u'Fine sea salt and freshly ground black pepper', u'Your favorite roast turkey or 2 roast chickens', u'3 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened, for greasing the baking dish', u'About 4 cups pulled cooked turkey (from roast turkey) or chicken (from 2 roast chickens)', u'8 (12-inch) flour tortillas', u'3 cups grated queso fresco**', u'3 cups shredded queso Chihuahua***', u'Sour cream', u'Limes, cut into wedges', u'*Dried chiles are often quite spicy and can leave their heat on your hands so some cooks like to wear rubber gloves when working with them. Be careful not to touch your eyes.', u'**Queso fresco is a mild, grainy Mexican cheese available at many supermarkets. Cotija and feta are good substitutes.', u'***Queso Chihuahua is a stringy, melting Mexican cheese. If unavailable, use mozzarella.', u'Equipment: 1 large roasting pan; food processor or blender; 2 (9- by 13-inch) baking dishes'], 'preperation steps': [u'In a large bowl, combine the tomatoes, onions, ancho and arbol chiles, garlic, celery, carrots, coriander, cumin, and dill and stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper then transfer to the roasting pan you will roast the turkey in.', u"Roast the turkey according to your recipe. As the turkey roasts, its juices and fat will drip down and cook the enchilada sauce ingredients. (Keep in mind that if you baste the turkey with the turkey juices, they'll be flavored with your enchilada sauce ingredients. To avoid flavoring your turkey this way, baste with melted butter, turkey or chicken stock, or low-sodium chicken broth\u2014or a combination of these.)", u'When you remove the turkey from the oven to rest, check to see that the vegetables are tender and if necessary return them to the oven to finish cooking.', u'Working in batches, transfer the enchilada mixture to a food processor or blender and process until smooth\u2014if necessary, use a few splashes of water to loosen or thin the mixture and create a smooth paste. Season with salt and pepper. DO AHEAD: The enchilada sauce can be prepared ahead and refrigerated, in an airtight container, up to 3 days, or frozen, up to 3 months.', u'Preheat the oven to 350\xb0F and butter 2 (9- by 13-inch) baking dishes. Spread about 1 cup of the enchilada sauce in the bottom of each dish.', u"Pick the meat off the leftover turkey carcass and transfer to a large bowl\u2014you'll need about 4 cups of meat. Add half the remaining enchilada sauce, along with half the queso fresco and half the queso Chihuahua, and stir to combine.", u'On a work surface, spread about 1 cup of the turkey filling on the bottom half of 1 tortilla and roll it up burrito-style, folding in the sides to seal them closed. Repeat with the remaining tortillas and filling. Arrange the enchiladas tightly in the 2 prepared baking dishes then cover with the remaining sauce, followed by the remaining queso fresco and queso Chihuahua. DO AHEAD: The turkey enchiladas can be assembled up to this point, covered, and refrigerated, up to 24 hours, or frozen up to 3 months.', u'Cover the enchiladas with foil and bake until the cheese has melted and the sauce is thickened and dark, about 1 hour. Serve immediately with sour cream and limes.'], 'chef': u'Jason Vincent', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/turkey-enchiladas-51197020', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6 to 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Turkey Enchiladas', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'You can decorate all the cones the same way or do each one differently. If time is short, simply use purchased ice cream.', 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 cup whipping cream', u'1/2 cup half and half', u'5 large egg yolks', u'13 tablespoons sugar', u'4 ounces imported white chocolate (such as Lindt), chopped', u'1 1/2 cups quartered stemmed strawberries', u'1 pound mangoes, peeled, pulp cut away from pit', u'6 sugar cones', u'1 1/2 pounds imported white chocolate (such as Lindt), chopped', u'1/2 cup plus 2 teaspoons vegetable oil', u'Rainbow mix sprinkles (nonpareil), chocolate sprinkles and/or dark chocolate shavings', u'Red, green and yellow food coloring (optional)', u'3 ounces imported bittersweet (not unsweetened) chocolate, chopped'], 'preperation steps': [u'Bring cream and half and half to simmer in heavy medium saucepan. Whisk yolks and 6 tablespoons sugar in medium bowl. Gradually whisk in hot cream mixture. Return mixture to saucepan; stir over medium heat until custard thickens and leaves path on back of spoon when finger is drawn across, about 4 minutes; do not boil. Strain custard into another bowl. Add white chocolate; whisk until melted and smooth. Chill until cold.', u"Toss berries, mangoes and remaining 7 tablespoons sugar in bowl; let stand 10 minutes. Puree mixture in blender. Mix puree into cold custard. Transfer custard to manufacturer's instructions. Transfer to container; freeze overnight.", u'Spoon small amount of ice cream into 1 cone, packing gently. Dip large ice cream scoop into hot water. Scoop large ball of ice cream onto cone, pressing gently. Stand cone in small glass; place in freezer. Repeat with remaining cones and ice cream. Freeze 2 hours.', u'Place white chocolate and 1/2 cup oil in medium metal bowl. Set bowl over saucepan of simmering water; stir until chocolate is melted and smooth. Remove bowl from over water; cool until barely lukewarm, about 5 minutes.', u'Working quickly and tilting bowl, dip ice cream end of cone into chocolate, turning to coat. Shake cone, allowing excess chocolate to drip into bowl.', u'To decorate with sprinkles or chocolate shavings, immediately sprinkle dipped cone with topping of choice. Stand cone in small glass; freeze. Repeat with remaining cones.', u'To decorate with tinted white chocolate dots, freeze dipped cones. Cut out three 10-inch parchment squares. Fold 1 parchment square diagonally in half, forming triangle. Twist corners of long side of triangle toward each other and roll to form tight cone. Seal outside seam with tape to secure. Repeat with remaining parchment squares.', u'Rewarm remaining white chocolate in bowl over simmering water, stirring occasionally. Place 1/4 cup melted white chocolate in each of 3 small bowls. Mix 3 drops red coloring into first bowl, 3 drops green coloring into second bowl and 2 drops each of red and yellow coloring into third bowl; stir to blend. Spoon each tinted chocolate into separate parchment cone; fold wide ends over to seal. Cut off tip to form 1/4-inch-wide opening. Pipe tinted dots all over white chocolate-coated cone. Stand cone in small glass; freeze.', u'To decorate with bittersweet chocolate, freeze dipped cones. Form parchment cone as described above. Combine bittersweet chocolate and remaining 2 teaspoons vegetable oil in small metal bowl. Set bowl over sauce pan of simmering water, stir until chocolate is melted and smooth. Remove from over water, cool slightly. Spoon some of chocolate mixture into parchment cone and fold wide end to seal. Cut off tip of parchment cone to form 1/8-inch-wide opening. Tilt bowl slightly and dip 1 side of white chocolate-coated cone into melted dark chocolate, allowing excess to drip back into bowl. Pipe chocolate across top of cone in zigzag lines.', u'Stand cone in glass; freeze until chocolate sets. (Can be made 1 week ahead. Wrap each cone in plastic and freeze.)'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/tutti-frutti-ice-cream-cones-2327', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 6', 'recipe title': u'Tutti-Frutti Ice Cream Cones', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"WHAT TO DRINK: A medium-bodied red with floral aromas and plummy flavors. Try L'Ostal Cazes Circus Shiraz from France's Pays d'Oc ($13).", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'90%', 'ingredient list': [u'6 large meaty lamb shanks (about 7 1/2 pounds)', u'2/3 cup sugar', u'6 tablespoons plus 6 cups water, divided', u'1 cup soy sauce', u'1/2 cup black vinegar', u'1 (4-ounce) piece fresh ginger, peeled, sliced (about 2/3 cup)', u'12 whole star anise', u'8 large garlic cloves, peeled, crushed', u'4 2-inch-long small dried red chiles', u'2 teaspoons Chinese five-spice powder', u'2 green onions, thinly sliced on diagonal'], 'preperation steps': [u'Bring large pot of water to boil. Remove from heat; add 3 cups water, soy sauce, and black vinegar to caramel; stir over medium heat to dissolve any caramel bits. Transfer caramel mixture to very large wide pot. Add remaining 3 cups water, ginger, star anise, garlic, chiles, and five-spice powder, then lamb shanks. Bring to boil (liquid will not cover shanks completely). Reduce heat to medium-low, cover tightly, and simmer until lamb is very tender, turning occasionally, about 3 hours.', u'Transfer lamb to work surface. Skim any fat from sauce and discard; season sauce with salt and pepper. Remove meat from bones in bite-size pieces; discard bones. Return meat to sauce in pot. DO AHEAD Can be made 1 day ahead. Sprinkle green onions over and serve.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/twice-cooked-five-spice-lamb-with-red-chiles-237099', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 8 servings', 'recipe title': u'Twice-Cooked Five-Spice Lamb with Red Chiles', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Inspired by my mom Julie Boone, the family\'s "Nacho Queen," these nachos start with three essential ingredients: a dollop of homemade pinto bean dip, sliced jalape\xf1os, and plenty of grated cheddar. Grill the chicken turning once until cooked through, about 4 to 5 minutes per side. Allow to cool, then cut chicken in 1/2-inch cubes.', u'In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the olive oil. Add the onion and cook until softened, 4 to 5 minutes. Add the garlic and bell pepper and cook, stirring, until softened, 4 to 5 minutes more. Remove from heat.', u'To the bowl of a food processor, add the beans, vinegar, oregano, salt, pepper, and 1/4 cup water and pulse to combine. Add the onion mixture and pulse to combine. Add a small dollop of bean dip to the center of each chip (about 1/4 teaspoon per chip) and divide chips among 2 rimmed baking sheets. Sprinkle evenly with jalape\xf1o slices and cheeses. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'The secret to these moist cupcakes? Reduced coconut milk.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'86%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 13-to 14-ounce cans unsweetened coconut milk* (preferably organic)', u'2 cups all purpose flour', u'2 1/4 teaspoons baking powder', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'3/4 cup (1 1/2 sticks) unsalted butter, room temperature', u'1 1/3 cups sugar', u'3 large eggs', u'Seeds scraped from 1 split vanilla bean or 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'1 cup reduced coconut milk (see above), room temperature', u'1 cup (2 sticks) unsalted butter, room temperature', u'2 1/2 cups powdered sugar', u'1/3 cup reduced coconut milk (see above), room temperature', u'Seeds scraped from 1 split vanilla bean or 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'1/8 teaspoon salt', u'1 1/2 cups sweetened flaked coconut, lightly toasted (for garnish)'], 'preperation steps': [u'Bring coconut milk to boil in large deep saucepan over medium-high heat (coconut milk will boil up high in pan). Reduce heat to mediumlow; boil until reduced to 1 1/2 cups, stirring occasionally, 25 to 30 minutes. Remove from heat; cool completely. Transfer to small bowl. Cover; chill (coconut milk will settle slightly as it cools). DO AHEAD: Can be made 2 days ahead. Keep chilled.', u'Position rack in center of oven; preheat to 350\xb0F. Line eighteen 1/3-cup muffin cups with paper liners. Whisk flour, baking powder, and salt in medium bowl. Using electric mixer, beat butter in large bowl until smooth. Add sugar; beat on medium-high speed until well blended, about 2 minutes. Add 2 eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition and occasionally scraping down sides of bowl. Beat in seeds from vanilla bean and remaining egg. Add half of flour mixture; mix on low speed just until blended. Add 1 cup reduced coconut milk; mix just until blended. Add remaining flour mixture; mix on low speed just until blended. Divide batter among muffin cups. Bake cupcakes until tops spring back when gently touched and tester inserted into center comes out clean, about 20 minutes. Transfer cupcakes in pans to rack; cool 10 minutes. Carefully remove cupcakes from pans and cool completely on rack.', u'Using electric mixer, beat butter in large bowl until smooth. Add sugar, 1/3 cup reduced coconut milk, seeds from vanilla bean, and salt. Beat on medium-low speed until blended, scraping down sides of bowl. Increase to mediumhigh and beat until light and fluffy.', u'Using pastry bag fitted with large star tip, pipe frosting onto cooled cupcakes. (Alternatively, top each cupcake with 2 tablespoons frosting. Using small offset spatula, swirl frosting over top of cupcakes, leaving 1/2-inch plain border.) Sprinkle with coconut. DO AHEAD: Can be made 1 day ahead. Store in airtight containers; chill. Bring to room temperature before serving.', u'Available at many supermarkets and at Indian, Southeast Asian, and Latin markets.'], 'chef': u'Abigail Johnson Dodge', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/vanilla-bean-coconut-cupcakes-with-coconut-frosting-352095', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 18', 'recipe title': u'Vanilla Bean-Coconut Cupcakes with Coconut Frosting', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Though you may associate bocconcini with the tiny mozzarella balls sold at Italian markets and cheese shops, the word simply means "little bites" (the veal in this stew is cut into bite-size pieces). When purchasing dried porcini, look for packages containing large, flat, recognizable slices of the mushroom.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'92%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/4 oz (30 g) dried porcini (1 1/2 cups), rinsed', u'1 1/2 cups warm water', u'13/4 lb boneless veal shoulder, cut into 1-inch cubes', u'3 tablespoons all-purpose flour', u'1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil', u'1 cup dry white wine', u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u'1/2 cup whole milk', u'8 soft dried tomatoes (not packed in oil), cut crosswise into 1/8-inch-thick slices', u'1 (1 1/2-inch) fresh red or green Thai or serrano chile, halved crosswise', u'2 (4-inch-long) fresh rosemary sprigs', u'3/4 teaspoon salt'], 'preperation steps': [u'Soak porcini in warm water in a small bowl until softened, about 20 minutes. Lift porcini out, squeezing liquid back into bowl, then rinse porcini (to remove any grit) and cut into 1/2-inch pieces. Pour soaking liquid through a sieve lined with a coffee filter or a dampened paper towel into another small bowl.', u'Pat veal dry. Toss one fourth of veal in flour. Heat oil in a 4- to 5-quart heavy pot over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then shake off excess flour and brown veal, turning, until golden brown, about 3 minutes. Transfer with a slotted spoon to a bowl. Coat and brown remaining veal in 3 batches in same manner.', u'Add wine to pot and deglaze by boiling, stirring and scraping up brown bits, 1 minute. Stir in veal with any juices accumulated in bowl, porcini and soaking liquid, cream, milk, tomatoes, chile, and rosemary sprigs and simmer, partially covered, stirring occasionally, until veal is very tender, about 1 1/4 hours. Discard rosemary sprigs and chile, then stir in salt.'], 'chef': None, 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/veal-bocconcini-with-porcini-and-rosemary-107812', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 4 servings', 'recipe title': u'Veal Bocconcini with Porcini and Rosemary', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u"You don't have to use a vegan chocolate to make this decadent tart\u2014any bittersweet baking bar will be great. But if you want to go dairy-free, reading the label isn't all there is to it.", 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'100%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/4 cups old-fashioned oats', u'3/4 cup whole wheat flour', u'1/3 cup virgin coconut oil, melted, slightly cooled', u'1/4 cup light agave syrup (nectar)', u'2 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder', u'3/4 teaspoon kosher salt', u'1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', u'1/2 teaspoon instant espresso powder', u'1 cup unsweetened cocoa powder', u'7 ounces vegan dark chocolate, melted, slightly cooled', u'2/3 cup light agave syrup (nectar)', u'2 teaspoons vanilla extract', u'2/3 cup plus 1 teaspoon virgin coconut oil, melted, slightly cooled', u'1/4 teaspoon kosher salt, plus more', u'2 tablespoons old-fashioned oats', u'1 tablespoon demerara sugar, divided', u'Flaky sea salt', u'A 9"-diameter or a 13 3/4x4 1/2" tart pan with removable bottom'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F. Pulse oats, whole wheat flour, coconut oil, agave, cocoa, salt, and cinnamon in a food processor until oats are coarsely ground and mixture looks like wet sand.', u'Firmly press into bottom and up the sides of tart pan. Bake until crust is golden brown and smells toasty, 20\u201325 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack; let cool.', u'Dissolve espresso powder in 3/4 cup very hot water in a food processor. Gradually add half of demerara sugar, stirring constantly, until sugar is melted, then remove from heat and stir in remaining demerara sugar just to coat. Season with kosher salt; let oat mixture cool.', u'Scatter oat mixture over tart, sprinkle with sea salt, and chill until filling is set, at least 1 hour.', u'Cut chilled tart into slices with a dry, hot knife; let sit at room temperature 15\u201320 minutes before serving.', u'Tart can be made 2 days ahead. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'"Rundown" (also called "oiled down" or "oil dong") is a classic stew served throughout the islands, often using saltfish or mackerel. {'cook_time': None, 'description': None, 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'80%', 'ingredient list': [u'2 cups sugar', u'2/3 cup honey (preferably Greek)', u'2 cinnamon sticks', u'2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', u'3 cups walnuts (10 to 11 ounces)', u'3 cups natural raw unsalted pistachios (13 to 14 ounces)', u'3/4 cup sugar', u'2 teaspoons finely grated lemon peel', u'1 1/2 teaspoons ground cinnamon', u'1/2 cup finely diced dried apple rings (1 1/2 ounces)', u'20 17 x 12-inch sheets fresh phyllo pastry or frozen, thawed', u'1 1/2 cups (3 sticks) unsalted butter, melted'], 'preperation steps': [u'Combine all ingredients and 1 cup water in heavy medium saucepan. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'A unique no-knead loaf developed for baking in coffee cans to create that special mushroom shape, this white bread is a savory loaf that fills the kitchen with an incredible aroma while it bakes. Since it takes only one rise in the molds, you can plan on 2 hours from mixing to table. In my travels around the United States, home bakers most often surprise me when they tell me this is their favorite bread recipe. It utilizes creamy evaporated milk, which has 60 percent of its water removed and gives the bread an especially delicate, moist texture. I think you will find it exceptionally easy to prepare, and each variation is as good as the master recipe. I use two glass baking canisters in lieu of coffee cans, which are not so often readily available.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'57%', 'ingredient list': [u'Two 13-ounce coffee cans or two 4 1/2-inch diameter ovenproof glass baking canisters', u'1 tablespoon (1 package) active dry yeast', u'3 tablespoons firmly packed light brown sugar', u'1/4 teaspoon ground ginger', u'1/2 cup warm water (105 to 115\xb0)', u"1 can (12 ounces) evaporated milk, regular, fat-free, or goat's milk, undiluted, at room temperature", u'2 teaspoons salt', u'2 tablespoons walnut oil or unsalted butter, melted', u'4 1/2 cups (exact measure) unbleached all-purpose flour'], 'preperation steps': [u'In a small bowl, sprinkle the yeast, a pinch of the brown sugar, and the ginger over the warm water. Stir to dissolve and let stand until foamy, about 10 minutes.', u'Combine the milk, the remaining sugar, salt, oil or butter, and 1 1/2 cups of the flour in a large bowl. Beat vigorously with a balloon whisk or dough whisk, at least 40 strokes by hand, until thick and sticky. Add the yeast mixture and beat vigorously for 1 minute more. Continue to add the remaining flour gradually, 1/2 cup at a time, then beat vigorously another 100 strokes, about 2 minutes. The batter will stay sticky. Scrape down the sides of the bowl with a spatula.', u'Combine the milk, the remaining sugar, salt, oil or butter, and 1 1/2 cups of the flour in the bowl of a heavy-duty electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. Beat for 1 minute on medium speed, or until thick and sticky. Add the yeast mixture and beat for 1 minute more. Continue to add the remaining flour on low speed, 1/2 cup at a time, then beat vigorously about 2 minutes on medium speed. The batter will stay sticky. Scrape down the sides with a spatula.', u'Generously grease the bottom and sides of the coffee cans or glass baking canisters. Divide the batter evenly between the 2 molds, filling one-half to two-thirds full. Use a spatula to push the batter into the corners and smooth the top with flour-dusted fingers. Cover loosely with plastic wrap lightly greased with vegetable oil cooking spray and let rise at room temperature until double in bulk, about 45 minutes to 1 hour; the batter should be even with the rim of the pan and slightly lift up the plastic wrap. Do not let the dough rise more than double (overrisen loaves collapse during baking). If the batter overrises, scrape it into a bowl, beat vigorously about 20 strokes, then return it to the pan and begin the rising again.', u'About 20 minutes before baking, place the oven rack in the lower part of the oven and preheat the oven to 350\xb0 (325\xb0 if using glass molds).', u'Bake until the top is crusty and dark brown, the bread sounds hollow when tapped, and a cake tester inserted into the center comes out clean, 40 to 45 minutes. An instant-read thermometer should read 200 degrees. The crown will dome about 3 to 4 inches above the rim of the mold. Cool in the molds for 5 minutes. Turn the mold on its side and slide the loaves out onto a rack to cool on their sides for at least 2 hours. Serve slightly warm, sliced into thick rounds or cut into long wedges, with lots of butter.', u'Store wrapped in a plastic food storage bag at room temperature for up to 3 days or in the freezer for up to 2 months.'], 'chef': u'Beth Hensperger', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/white-velvet-batter-bread-103217', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes 2 loaves', 'recipe title': u'White Velvet Batter Bread', 'image_source': None}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Mary Risley, the director of Tante Marie\'s Cooking School, says, "I come from a family of Connecticut Yankees, and when I was growing up, I spent every Thanksgiving at my grandparents\' eighteenth-century home, which was right across from a turkey farm. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u"When SFMOMA presented the first Francesca Woodman retrospective in the United States in over two decades, I was excited to immerse myself in the work of another influential female photographer whom I studied in college. I love Woodman's juxtaposition of textures, her way of placing soft and vulnerable human forms in withered, deteriorating environments. My plan was to base a dessert on a photograph with this type of contrast. Of all of the images in the show, the one of the artist wearing a Victorian-style floral coat and flowing dress while posing in a crumbling room was my favorite.", 'rating': u'0/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'0%', 'ingredient list': [u'1 1/2 cups (13 oz / 363 g) whole milk', u'1/2 cup (4.1 oz / 116 g) heavy cream', u'1/2 teaspoon Maldon sea salt', u'1 1/2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', u'1/2 cup (2.5 oz / 70 g) whole wheat pastry flour', u'1/2 cup (2.1 oz / 60 g) rye flour', u'1 tablespoon sugar', u'1 teaspoon Maldon sea salt', u'1 teaspoon baking powder', u'1 teaspoon caraway seeds', u'4 tablespoons (2 oz / 56 g) cold unsalted butter, cut into small chunks', u'1/4 cup (2.1 oz / 60 g) whole-milk plain yogurt', u'Colorful edible flower petals, for garnish', u'Maldon sea salt, for garnish'], 'preperation steps': [u'To make the ricotta cheese, line a colander with a double layer of cheesecloth and set the colander over a bowl.', u'Combine the milk, cream, and salt in a small saucepan and cook over medium-low heat, stirring often to prevent scorching, until the mixture registers 190\xb0F on a digital thermometer.', u'Remove the pan from the heat and gently stir in the lemon juice. Let stand for 5 minutes, and then pour the curds and whey through the cheesecloth-lined colander. Let drain at room temperature until the cheese is thick and spreadable, about 1 hour.', u'Transfer the cheese to a container, cover tightly, and refrigerate.', u'Combine the whole wheat flour, rye flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, and caraway seeds in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. Mix briefly on low speed to blend. Add the butter and mix on low speed until the mixture resembles coarse meal, 1 to 2 minutes. Add the yogurt and continue mixing just until the dough comes together into a ball, 10 to 20 seconds.', u"Turn out the dough onto a large sheet of parchment paper and press it into a flat, even rectangle measuring about 5 by 6 inches. Lay a second sheet of parchment paper on top and roll out the dough to an even 1/8-inch thickness. Remove the top sheet of parchment and, using a chef's knife, cut the dough into rough 2 by 4-inch rectangles. The dough will be sticky, so don't try to remove the rectangles until after chilling. Slide the parchment with the dough onto a baking sheet and refrigerate until the dough is firm, at least 30 minutes or up to 1 week.", u'To make the crackers, position racks in upper and lower thirds of the oven. Preheat the oven to 400\xb0F and line two baking sheets with parchment paper.', u'Using a small spatula, carefully remove the crackers and place them on the prepared baking sheets, spacing them 1 inch apart.', u'Bake, rotating the baking sheets midway through baking, until the crackers are golden brown and crisp, 10 to 12 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes on the baking sheets, and then use a spatula to transfer the crackers to a wire rack to finish cooling.', u'To serve, spread a layer of ricotta cheese about 1/8 inch thick onto each cracker. Scatter a few edible flowers over the ricotta and sprinkle with sea salt.'], 'chef': u'Caitlin Freeman', 'r_link': '/recipes/food/views/woodman-cheese-and-crackers-51159410', 'prep_time': None, 'servings': u'Makes about 28 crackers with cheese', 'recipe title': u'Woodman Cheese and Crackers', 'image_source': '/static/img/px/background.png'}

{'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Chef Kris Wessel of Florida Cookery in Miami Beach, Florida, shared this recipe as part of a Palm Tree Christmas menu he created exclusively for Epicurious.', 'rating': u'4/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'83%', 'ingredient list': [u'1/4 cup canola oil', u"2 cups converted long-grain rice such as Uncle Ben's", u'1 cup vermicelli noodles, broken into roughly 1-inch pieces', u'1 small yellow onion, peeled and diced', u'1 small celery rib, diced', u'1/2 yellow bell pepper, diced', u'4 scallions, white and light green parts only, cut on a diagonal, into 1/2-inch pieces', u'2 cloves garlic, peeled and minced', u'2 teaspoons ground turmeric', u'2 teaspoons ground cumin', u'1/2 to 1 teaspoon cayenne pepper', u'4 cups chicken stock or low-sodium chicken broth', u'1 teaspoon kosher salt', u'2 tablespoons unsalted butter, cut into small pieces', u'1/4 cup coarsely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley', u'Special equipment: 1 (9- by 13-inch) baking dish'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 400\xb0F.', u'In a medium saucepan over moderately high heat, warm the canola oil. Transfer to the baking dish. DO AHEAD: The rice can be prepared up to this point, covered, and refrigerated up to 8 hours. {'cook_time': None, 'description': u'Dripping with snowy-white icing and paired with fresh berries and a ruby-red currant and raspberry sauce, this sheet cake is a charming way to end a dinner party.', 'rating': u'3/4', 'nutritional_info': None, 'recommendation': u'86%', 'ingredient list': [u'3 cups sifted cake flour (not self-rising; sift before measuring)', u'2 teaspoons baking powder', u'1 teaspoons baking soda', u'1/2 teaspoon salt', u'2 sticks unsalted butter, softened', u'2 cups granulated sugar', u'2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract', u'3 large eggs, warmed in shell in warm water 10 minutes', u'2 cups well-stirred plain whole-milk yogurt (not Greek-style) atroom temperature 30 minutes', u'2 cups fresh red currants (1/2 pound), stemmed', u'4 cups fresh raspberries (16 ounces), divided', u'2/3 cup granulated sugar room temperature 30 minutes', u'3 cups confectioners sugar', u'3 tablespoons light corn syrup', u'1/2 cup heavy cream', u'Scant 1/2 teaspoon pure vanilla extract', u'Equipment: a 13- by 9-inch cake pan'], 'preperation steps': [u'Preheat oven to 350\xb0F with rack in middle.
